http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.label: Abnormality of body height
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.definition: Deviation from the norm of height with respect to that which is expected according to age and gender norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.label: Multicystic kidney dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.definition: Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvicaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.label: Mode of inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.definition: The pattern in which a particular genetic trait or disorder is passed from one generation to the next.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.label: Autosomal dominant inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.label: Autosomal recessive inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in individuals with two pathogenic alleles, either homozygotes (two copies of the same mutant allele) or compound heterozygotes (whereby each copy of a gene has a distinct mutant allele).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.label: Abnormal morphology of female internal genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000000.definition: An abnormality of the female internal genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.label: Recurrent urinary tract infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.definition: Repeated infections of the urinary tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.label: Neurogenic bladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.definition: A type of bladder dysfunction caused by neurologic damage. Neurogenic bladder can be flaccid or spastic. Common manifestatios of neurogenic bladder are overflow incontinence, frequency, urgency, urge incontinence, and retention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.label: Urinary urgency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.definition: Urge incontinence is the strong, sudden need to urinate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.label: Abnormality of the bladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.definition: An abnormality of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.label: Bladder diverticulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.definition: Diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.label: Urinary retention
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.definition: Inability to completely empty the urinary bladder during the process of urination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.label: Nocturia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.definition: Abnormally increased production of urine during the night leading to an unusually frequent need to urinate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.label: Urinary hesitancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000001.definition: Difficulty in beginning the process of urination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.label: Urinary incontinence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.definition: Loss of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.label: Abnormal male internal genitalia morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.definition: An abnormality of the male internal genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.label: Inguinal hernia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.definition: Protrusion of the contents of the abdominal cavity through the inguinal canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.label: Prostatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.definition: The presence of inflammation of the prostate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.label: Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia
Male hypogonadism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.definition: Decreased functionality of the male gonad, i.e., of the testis, with reduced spermatogenesis or testosterone synthesis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.label: Azoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm,whereby spermatozoa cannot be observed even after centrifugation of the semen pellet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.label: Cryptorchidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.definition: Testis in inguinal canal. That is, absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.label: Testicular atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000002.definition: Wasting (atrophy) of the testicle (the male gonad) manifested by a decrease in size and potentially by a loss of fertility.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.label: Testicular gonadoblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.definition: The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the testis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.label: Epididymitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.definition: The presence of inflammation of the epididymis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.label: Abnormality of male external genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.definition: An abnormality of male external genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.label: Ambiguous genitalia, male
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.definition: Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XY genetic gender.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.label: Hydrocele testis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.definition: Accumulation of clear fluid in the between the layers of membrane (tunica vaginalis) surrounding the testis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.label: Abnormal testis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.definition: An anomaly of the testicle (the male gonad).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.label: Abnormal penis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.definition: Abnormality of the male external sex organ.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.label: Male pseudohermaphroditism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.definition: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.label: Epispadias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000003.definition: Epispadias is a urogenital malformation characterized by the failure of the urethral tube to tubularize on the dorsal aspect. Unlike in hypospadias, where the meatus is on the ventral aspect, children with epispadias have a wide-open urethral plate on the dorsum. It is commonly seen as a component in the spectrum of bladder exstrophy-epispadias-complex. Isolated epispadias constitutes less than 10 percent of the total cases of epispadias.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.label: Long penis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.definition: Penile length more than 2 SD above the mean for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.label: Chordee
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.definition: Ventral, lateral, or ventrolateral bowing of the shaft and glans penis of more than 30 degrees.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.label: Absent external genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.definition: Lack of external genitalia in a male or female individual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.label: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.definition: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.label: Hypospadias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.definition: Abnormal position of urethral meatus on the ventral penile shaft (underside) characterized by displacement of the urethral meatus from the tip of the glans penis to the ventral surface of the penis, scrotum, or perineum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.label: Bifid scrotum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.definition: Midline indentation or cleft of the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.label: Shawl scrotum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000004.definition: Superior margin of the scrotum superior to the base of the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.label: Hypoplastic male external genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.definition: Underdevelopment of part or all of the male external reproductive organs (which include the penis, the scrotum and the urethra).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.label: Perineal hypospadias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.definition: Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the perineal region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.label: Urethral atresia, male
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.definition: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in males.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.label: Macroorchidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.definition: The presence of abnormally large testes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.label: Micropenis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.definition: Abnormally small penis. At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.label: Abnormality of female external genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.definition: An abnormality of the female external genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.label: Abnormal labia morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000005.definition: An anomaly of the labia, the externally visible portions of the vulva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.label: Ambiguous genitalia, female
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.definition: Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XX genetic gender.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.label: Ambiguous genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.definition: A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.label: Fused labia minora
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.definition: Fusion of the labia minora as a result of labial adhesions resulting in vaginal obstruction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.label: Urethral atresia, female
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.definition: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in females.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.label: Urethral atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.definition: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.label: Abnormality of the ureter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000006.definition: An abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.label: Ureterocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.definition: A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.label: Ureteral stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.definition: The presence of a stenotic, i.e., constricted ureter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.label: Hydroureter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.definition: The distention of the ureter with urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.label: Ureteral duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two, instead of one, ureter connecting a kidney to the bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.label: Ureteropelvic junction obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.definition: Blockage of urine flow from the renal pelvis to the proximal ureter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.label: Renal duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.definition: A congenital anomaly of the urinary tract, in which the kidney is duplicated and is drained via two separate renal pelves and ureters.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.label: Vesicoureteral reflux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.definition: Abnormal (retrograde) movement of urine from the bladder into ureters or kidneys related to inadequacy of the valvular mechanism at the ureterovesicular junction or other causes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.label: Abnormality of the genital system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.definition: An abnormality of the genital system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.label: Abnormality of the urinary system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000007.definition: An abnormality of the urinary system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.label: Abnormality of reproductive system physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.definition: An abnormal functionality of the genital system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.label: Duplicated collecting system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.definition: A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney, defined as a kidney with two (instead of, normally, one) pyelocaliceal systems. The pyelocaliceal system is comprised of the renal pelvis and calices. The duplicated renal collecting system can be associated with a single ureter or with double ureters. In the latter case, the two ureters empty separately into the bladder or fuse to form a single ureteral orifice.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.label: Renal insufficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.definition: A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.label: Horseshoe kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.definition: A connection of the right and left kidney by an isthmus of functioning renal parenchyma or fibrous tissue that crosses the midline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.label: Ectopic kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000008.definition: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.label: Nephronophthisis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.definition: Presence of cysts at the corticomedullary junction of the kidney in combination with tubulointerstitial fibrosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.label: Abnormal renal tubule morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.definition: An abnormality of the renal tubules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.label: Renal tubular atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.definition: The presence of renal tubules with thick redundant basement membranes, or a reduction of greater than 50% in tubular diameter compared to surrounding non-atrophic tubules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.label: Proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.definition: Increased levels of protein in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.label: Abnormal renal glomerulus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.definition: A structural anomaly of the glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.label: Glomerular sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.definition: Accumulation of scar tissue within the glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.label: Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.definition: Segmental accumulation of scar tissue in individual (but not all) glomeruli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.label: Tall stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000009.definition: A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.label: Nephrotic syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.definition: Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.label: Polyuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.definition: An increased rate of urine production.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.label: Renal agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.definition: Agenesis, that is, failure of the kidney to develop during embryogenesis and development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.label: Enlarged kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.definition: An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.label: Renal cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.definition: A fluid filled sac in the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.label: Renal corticomedullary cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000010.definition: The presence of multiple cysts at the border between the renal cortex and medulla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.label: Renal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.label: Renal juxtaglomerular cell hypertrophy/hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.definition: Increased number and size of the juxtaglomerular cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.label: Nephropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.definition: A nonspecific term referring to disease or damage of the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.label: Polycystic kidney dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.definition: The presence of multiple cysts in both kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.label: Proximal tubulopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.definition: Dysfunction of the proximal tubule, which is the portion of the duct system of the nephron of the kidney which leads from Bowman's capsule to the loop of Henle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.label: Renal phosphate wasting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.definition: High urine phosphate in the presence of hypophosphatemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.label: Abnormality of the genitourinary system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000011.definition: The presence of any abnormality of the genitourinary system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.label: Nephrocalcinosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.definition: Nephrocalcinosis is the deposition of calcium salts in renal parenchyma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.label: Unilateral renal agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.definition: A unilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.label: Nephritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.definition: The presence of inflammation affecting the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.label: Renal tubular dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.definition: Abnormal function of the renal tubule. The basic functional unit of the kidney, the nephron, consists of a renal corpuscle attached to a renal tubule, with roughly 0.8 to 1.5 nephrons per adult kidney. The functions of the renal tubule include reabsorption of water, electrolytes, glucose, and amino acids and secretion of substances such as uric acid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.label: Pelvic kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.definition: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position within the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.label: Hydronephrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.definition: Severe distention of the kidney with dilation of the renal pelvis and calices.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.label: Renal salt wasting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.definition: A high concentration of one or more electrolytes in the urine in the presence of low serum concentrations of the electrolyte(s).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.label: Renal potassium wasting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000012.definition: High urine potassium in the presence of hypokalemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.label: Uterine leiomyoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.definition: The presence of a leiomyoma of the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.label: Menorrhagia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.definition: Prolonged and excessive menses at regular intervals in excess of 80 mL or lasting longer than 7 days.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.label: Female hypogonadism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.definition: Decreased functionality of the female gonads, i.e., of the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.label: Hypogonadism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.definition: A decreased functionality of the gonad.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.label: Bifid uterus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.definition: The presence of a bifid uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.label: Ovarian cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.definition: The presence of one or more cysts of the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.label: Uterine prolapse
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000013.definition: The presence of prolapse of the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.label: Abnormality of the menstrual cycle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.definition: An abnormality of the ovulation cycle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.label: Amenorrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.definition: Absence of menses for an interval of time equivalent to a total of more than (or equal to) 3 previous cycles or 6 months.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.label: Abnormal vagina morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.definition: Any structural abnormality of the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.label: Rectovaginal fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.definition: The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.label: Vaginal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.definition: Congenital occlusion of the vagina or adhesion of the walls of the vagina causing occlusion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.label: Ovarian gonadoblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000014.definition: The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.label: Gonadoblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.definition: The presence of a gonadoblastoma, a neoplasm of a gonad that consists of aggregates of germ cells and sex cord elements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.label: Abnormality of head or neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.definition: An abnormality of head and neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.label: Wide mouth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.definition: Distance between the oral commissures more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased width of the oral aperture (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.label: Oral ulcer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.definition: Erosion of the mucous mebrane of the mouth with local excavation of the surface, resulting from the sloughing of inflammatory necrotic tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.label: Macroglossia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000015.definition: Increased length and width of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.label: Narrow mouth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.definition: Distance between the commissures of the mouth more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the oral aperture (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.label: Median cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.definition: A type of cleft lip presenting as a midline (median) gap in the upper lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.label: Glossoptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.definition: Posterior displacement of the tongue into the pharynx, i.e., a tongue that is mislocalised posteriorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.label: Abnormal oral cavity morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.definition: Abnormality of the oral cavity, i.e., the opening or hollow part of the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.label: Abnormality of the gingiva
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.definition: Any abnormality of the gingiva (also known as gums).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.label: Gingival fibromatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000016.definition: The presence of fibrosis of the gingiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.label: Microglossia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.definition: Decreased length and width of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.label: Abnormal uvula morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.definition: Abnormality of the uvula, the conic projection from the posterior edge of the middle of the soft palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.label: Abnormal palate morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.definition: Any abnormality of the palate, i.e., of roof of the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.label: Cleft palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.definition: Cleft palate is a developmental defect of the palate resulting from a failure of fusion of the palatine processes and manifesting as a separation of the roof of the mouth (soft and hard palate).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.label: Submucous cleft hard palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.definition: Hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the bony palate that are covered by the mucous membrane of the roof of the mouth. It may be possible to detect a submucous cleft hard palate upon palpation as a notch in the bony palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.label: Abnormal upper lip morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.definition: An abnormality of the upper lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.label: Abnormal lower lip morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.definition: An abnormality of the lower lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.label: Thick lower lip vermilion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000017.definition: Increased thickness of the lower lip, leading to a prominent appearance of the lower lip. The height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the midline is more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000018.label: Lobulated tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000018.definition: Multiple indentations and/or elevations on the edge and/or surface of the tongue producing an irregular surface contour.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000018.label: Cleft soft palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000018.definition: Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000018.label: Short upper lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000018.definition: Decreased width of the upper lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000018.label: Narrow palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000018.definition: Width of the palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased palatal width (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.label: Abnormal oral frenulum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.definition: An abnormality of the lingual frenulum, that is of the small fold of mucous membrane that attaches the tongue to the floor of the mouth, or the presence of accessory frenula in the oral cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.label: Accessory oral frenulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.definition: Extra fold of tissue extending from the alveolar ridge to the inner surface of the upper or lower lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.label: Bifid uvula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.definition: Uvula separated into two parts most easily seen at the tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.label: Open mouth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.definition: A facial appearance characterized by a permanently or nearly permanently opened mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.label: Lower lip pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.definition: Depression located on the vermilion of the lower lip, usually paramedian.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.label: Abnormal parotid gland morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000019.definition: Any abnormality of the parotid glands, which are the salivary glands that are located in the subcutaneous tissues of the face overlying the mandibular ramus and anterior and inferior to the external ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.label: Short lingual frenulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.definition: The presence of an abnormally short lingual frenulum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.label: Pierre-Robin sequence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.definition: Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia), glossoptosis and cleft palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.label: Orofacial cleft
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.definition: The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.label: Cleft upper lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.definition: A gap in the upper lip. This is a congenital defect resulting from nonfusion of tissues of the lip during embryonal development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.label: Pursed lips
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.definition: An abnormality of the appearance of the face caused by constant contraction of the lips leading to a puckered or pursed appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.label: Triangular mouth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000020.definition: The presence of a triangular form of the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.label: Trismus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.definition: Limitation in the ability to open the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.label: Gingival overgrowth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.definition: Hyperplasia of the gingiva (that is, a thickening of the soft tissue overlying the alveolar ridge. The degree of thickening ranges from involvement of the interdental papillae alone to gingival overgrowth covering the entire tooth crown.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.label: Lip telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.definition: Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the lips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.label: Thick upper lip vermilion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.definition: Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.label: Xerostomia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.definition: Dryness of the mouth due to salivary gland dysfunction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.label: High palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.definition: Height of the palate more than 2 SD above the mean (objective) or palatal height at the level of the first permanent molar more than twice the height of the teeth (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.label: Thin upper lip vermilion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000021.definition: Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.label: Velopharyngeal insufficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.definition: Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.label: Furrowed tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.definition: Accentuation of the grooves on the dorsal surface of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.label: Hypogeusia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.definition: A decreased ability to perceive flavor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.label: Tongue telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.definition: Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.label: Oral cavity telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000022.definition: Presence of telangiectases in the oral cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.label: Everted lower lip vermilion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.definition: An abnormal configuration of the lower lip such that it is turned outward i.e., everted, with the Inner aspect of the lower lip vermilion (normally opposing the teeth) being visible in a frontal view.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.label: Thin vermilion border
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.definition: Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lip more than 2 SD below the mean, or apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lip in the frontal view. The vermilion is the red part of the lips (and confusingly, the vermilion itself is also often referred to as being equivalent the lips).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.label: Abnormality of the fontanelles or cranial sutures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.definition: Any abnormality of the fontanelles (the regions covered by a thick membrane that normally ossify in the first two years of life) or the cranial sutures (the fibrous joints in which the articulating bones or cartilages of the skull are connected by sutural ligaments).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.label: Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.definition: An abnormality of the anterior fontanelle, i.e., the cranial fontanelle that is located at the intersection of the coronal and sagittal sutures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.label: Small anterior fontanelle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.definition: Abnormally decreased size of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.label: Hydrocephalus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.definition: Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.label: Large fontanelles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000023.definition: In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.label: Abnormality of skull size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.definition: Any abnormality of the size of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.label: Parietal bossing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.definition: Parietal bossing is a marked prominence in the parietal region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.label: Trigonocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.definition: Wedge-shaped, or triangular head, with the apex of the triangle at the midline of the forehead and the base of the triangle at the occiput.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.label: Brachyturricephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.definition: Abnormal vertical height of the skull and a shortening of its anterior-posterior length, frequently combined with malformations of the occipital region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.label: Abnormal paranasal sinus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.definition: Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.label: Sinusitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.definition: Inflammation of the paranasal sinuses owing to a viral, bacterial, or fungal infection, allergy, or an autoimmune reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.label: Brachycephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000024.definition: An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a decreased anterior-posterior diameter. That is, a cephalic index greater than 81%. Alternatively, an apparently shortened anteroposterior dimension (length) of the head compared to width.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000025.label: Dense calvaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000025.definition: An abnormal increase of density of the bones making up the calvaria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000025.label: Microcephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000025.definition: Head circumference below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000025.label: Progressive microcephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000025.definition: Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000025.label: Macrocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000025.definition: Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the cranium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.label: Wide anterior fontanel
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.definition: Enlargement of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.label: Turricephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.definition: Tall head relative to width and length.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.label: Oxycephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.definition: Oxycephaly (from Greek oxus, sharp, and kephalos, head) refers to a conical or pointed shape of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.label: Abnormal mastoid morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.definition: An abnormality of the mastoid process, which is the conical prominence projecting from the undersurface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.label: Cranial asymmetry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.definition: Asymmetry of the bones of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.label: Dolichocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.definition: An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a increased anterior-posterior diameter, i.e., an increased antero-posterior dimension of the skull. Cephalic index less than 76%. Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.label: Prominent occiput
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000026.definition: Increased convexity of the occiput (posterior part of the skull).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.label: Delayed cranial suture closure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.definition: Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.label: Malar flattening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.definition: Underdevelopment of the malar prominence of the jugal bone (zygomatic bone in mammals), appreciated in profile, frontal view, and/or by palpation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.label: Small face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.definition: A face that is short and narrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.label: Narrow face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.definition: Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width are both more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or, an apparent reduction in the width of the upper and lower face (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.label: Long face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.definition: Facial height (length) is more than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, an apparent increase in the height (length) of the face (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.label: Abnormal mandible morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.definition: Any abnormality of the mandible, the bone of the lower jaw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.label: Retrognathia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000027.definition: An abnormality in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.label: Coarse facial features
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.definition: Absence of fine and sharp appearance of brows, nose, lips, mouth, and chin, usually because of rounded and heavy features or thickened skin with or without thickening of subcutaneous and bony tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.label: Broad face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.definition: Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width greater than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or an apparent increase in the width of the face (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.label: obsolete Abnormality of the ocular region
Epicanthus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.definition: A fold of skin starting above the medial aspect of the upper eyelid and arching downward to cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.label: Increased facial adipose tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.definition: An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.label: Broad philtrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000028.definition: Distance between the philtral ridges, measured just above the vermilion border, more than 2 standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the ridges of the philtrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.label: Loss of facial adipose tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.definition: Loss of normal subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.label: Full cheeks
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.definition: Increased prominence or roundness of soft tissues between zygomata and mandible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.label: Low anterior hairline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.definition: Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between the hairline and the glabella.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.label: Doll-like facies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.definition: A characteristic facial appearance with a round facial form, full cheeks, a short nose, and a relatively small chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.label: Facial hypotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.definition: Reduced muscle tone of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.label: Mask-like facies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000029.definition: A lack of facial expression often with staring eyes and a slightly open mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.label: Oval face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.definition: A face with a rounded and slightly elongated outline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.label: Abnormality of facial musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.definition: An anomaly of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.label: Mandibular prognathia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.definition: Abnormal prominence of the chin related to increased length of the mandible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.label: Abnormality of the chin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.definition: An abnormality of the chin, i.e., of the inferior portion of the face lying inferior to the lower lip and including the central prominence of the lower jaw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.label: Pointed chin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.definition: A marked tapering of the lower face to the chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.label: Microretrognathia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.definition: A form of developmental hypoplasia of the mandible in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.label: Abnormal midface morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000030.definition: An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma and cheeks and malar region. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000031.label: Round face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000031.definition: The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000031.label: Hypertelorism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000031.definition: Interpupillary distance more than 2 SD above the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an increased interpupillary distance or widely spaced eyes).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000031.label: Facial myokymia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000031.definition: Facial myokymia is a fine fibrillary activity of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000031.label: Smooth philtrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000031.definition: Flat skin surface, with no ridge formation in the central region of the upper lip between the nasal base and upper vermilion border.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.label: Square face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.definition: Facial contours, as viewed from the front, show a broad upper face/cranium and lower face/mandible, creating a square appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.label: Short philtrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.definition: Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.label: Facial asymmetry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.definition: An abnormal difference between the left and right sides of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.label: Triangular face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.definition: Facial contour, as viewed from the front, triangular in shape, with breadth at the temples and tapering to a narrow chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.label: Abnormal maxilla morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.definition: An abnormality of the Maxilla (upper jaw bone).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.label: Hypoplasia of the maxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.definition: Abnormally small dimension of the Maxilla. Usually creating a malocclusion or malalignment between the upper and lower teeth or resulting in a deficient amount of projection of the base of the nose and lower midface region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.label: Facial hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000032.definition: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.label: Short chin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.definition: Decreased vertical distance from the vermilion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.label: Prominent supraorbital ridges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.definition: Greater than average forward and/or lateral protrusion of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.label: Broad forehead
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.definition: Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently increased distance between the two sides of the forehead.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.label: Hypomimic face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.definition: A reduced degree of motion of the muscles beneath the skin of the face, often associated with reduced facial crease formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.label: Pugilistic facies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000033.definition: Coarse facial features reminiscent of those of a boxer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.label: Sloping forehead
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.definition: Inclination of the anterior surface of the forehead from the vertical more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently excessive posterior sloping of the forehead in a lateral view.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.label: Narrow forehead
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.definition: Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or apparently narrow intertemporal region (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.label: Long philtrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.definition: Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.label: Whistling appearance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.definition: An abnormality of facial morphology characterized by a small mouth opening and constant contraction of the lips as if the patient were whistling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.label: High forehead
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.definition: An abnormally increased height of the forehead.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.label: Widow's peak
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000034.definition: Frontal hairline with bilateral arcs to a low point in the midline of the forehead.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000035.label: Small forehead
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000035.definition: The presence of a forehead that is abnormally small.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000035.label: Abnormality of the outer ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000035.definition: An abnormality of the external ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000035.label: Posteriorly rotated ears
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000035.definition: A type of abnormal location of the ears in which the position of the ears is characterized by posterior rotation (the superior part of the ears is rotated towards the back of the head, and the inferior part of the ears towards the front).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000035.label: Abnormality of the inner ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000035.definition: An abnormality of the inner ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.label: Tinnitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.definition: Tinnitus is an auditory perception that can be described as the experience of sound, in the ear or in the head, in the absence of external acoustic stimulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.label: Otosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.definition: In otosclerosis, a callus of bone accumulates on the stapes creating a partial fixation. This limits the movement of the stapes bone, which results in hearing loss.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.label: Abnormal earlobe morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.definition: An abnormality of the lobule of pinna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.label: Hearing abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.definition: An abnormality of the sensory perception of sound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.label: Hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.definition: A decreased magnitude of the sensory perception of sound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.label: Low-set, posteriorly rotated ears
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.definition: Ears that are low-set and posteriorly rotated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.label: Low-set ears
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000036.definition: Upper insertion of the ear to the scalp below an imaginary horizontal line drawn between the inner canthi of the eye and extending posteriorly to the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.label: Abnormality of the middle ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.definition: An abnormality of the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.label: Acute otitis media
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.definition: Acute otitis media is a short and generally painful infection of the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.label: Abnormality of the auditory canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.definition: An abnormality of the External acoustic tube (also known as the auditory canal).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.label: Incomplete partition of the cochlea type II
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.definition: With incomplete partition II, the cochlea consists of 1.5 turns; the apical and middle cochlea turns are undifferentiated and form a cystic apex. The vestibule is normal while the vestibular aqueduct is always enlarged. Developmental arrest occurs at the seventh week of gestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.label: Abnormal pinna morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.definition: An abnormality of the pinna, which is also referred to as the auricle or external ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.label: Cupped ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000037.definition: Laterally protruding ear that lacks antihelical folding (including absence of inferior and superior crura).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.label: Stapes ankylosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.definition: Stapes ankylosis refers to congenital or acquired fixation of the stapes (the stirrup-shaped small bone or ossicle in the middle ear), which is associated with conductive hearing resulting from impairment of the sound-conduction mechanism (the external auditory canal, tympanic membrane, and/or middle-ear ossicles).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.label: Preauricular skin tag
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.definition: A rudimentary tag of skin often containing ear tissue including a core of cartilage and located just anterior to the auricle (outer part of the ear).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.label: Absent earlobe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.definition: Absence of fleshy non-cartilaginous tissue inferior to the tragus and incisura.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.label: Otitis media
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.definition: Inflammation or infection of the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.label: Chronic otitis media
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000038.definition: Chronic otitis media refers to fluid, swelling, or infection of the middle ear that does not heal and may cause permanent damage to the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.label: Thickened helices
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.definition: Increased thickness of the helix of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.label: Lop ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.definition: Anterior and inferior folding of the upper portion of the ear that obliterates triangular fossa and scapha.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.label: Prominent antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.definition: The presence of an abnormally prominent antihelix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.label: Overfolded helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.definition: A condition in which the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal. That is, excessive curling of the helix edge, whereby the free edge is parallel to the plane of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.label: Prelingual sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000039.definition: A form of sensorineural deafness with either congenital onset or infantile onset, i.e., before the acquisition of speech.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.label: Macrotia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.definition: Median longitudinal ear length greater than two standard deviations above the mean and median ear width greater than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparent increase in length and width of the pinna (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.label: Stenosis of the external auditory canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the external auditory canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.label: Recurrent otitis media
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.definition: Increased susceptibility to otitis media, as manifested by recurrent episodes of otitis media.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.label: Conductive hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.definition: An abnormality of vibrational conductance of sound to the inner ear leading to impairment of sensory perception of sound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.label: Sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.definition: A type of hearing impairment in one or both ears related to an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.label: Progressive sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000040.definition: A progressive form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.label: Mixed hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.definition: A type of hearing loss resulting from a combination of conductive hearing impairment and sensorineural hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.label: Protruding ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.definition: Angle formed by the plane of the ear and the mastoid bone greater than the 97th centile for age (objective); or, outer edge of the helix more than 2 cm from the mastoid at the point of maximum distance (objective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.label: Atresia of the external auditory canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.definition: Absence or failure to form of the external auditory canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.label: Bulbous nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.definition: Increased volume and globular shape of the anteroinferior aspect of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.label: Abnormality of the choanae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.definition: Abnormality of the choanae (the posterior nasal apertures).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.label: Narrow nasal ridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.definition: Decreased width of the nasal ridge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.label: Abnormal nasal septum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000041.definition: An abnormality of the nasal septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.label: Short nasal septum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.definition: Reduced superior to inferior length of the nasal septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.label: Epistaxis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.definition: Epistaxis, or nosebleed, refers to a hemorrhage localized in the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.label: Abnormal nasal bridge morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.definition: Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. It lies between the glabella and the inferior boundary of the nasal bone, and extends laterally to the inner canthi.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.label: Prominent nasal bridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.definition: Anterior positioning of the nasal root in comparison to the usual positioning for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.label: Abnormal morphology of the nasal alae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000042.definition: An abnormality of the Ala of nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000043.label: Underdeveloped nasal alae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000043.definition: Thinned, deficient, or excessively arched ala nasi.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000043.label: Wide nasal bridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000043.definition: Increased breadth of the nasal bridge (and with it, the nasal root).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000043.label: Abnormal nasal tip morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000043.definition: An abnormality of the nasal tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000043.label: Depressed nasal tip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000043.definition: Decreased distance from the nasal tip to the nasal base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000044.label: Convex nasal ridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000044.definition: Nasal ridge curving anteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip. The nose appears often also prominent, and the columella low.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000044.label: Wide nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000044.definition: Interalar distance more than two standard deviations above the mean for age, i.e., an apparently increased width of the nasal base and alae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000044.label: Narrow nasal bridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000044.definition: Decreased width of the bony bridge of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000044.label: Prominent nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000044.definition: Distance between subnasale and pronasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased anterior protrusion of the nasal tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.label: Choanal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.definition: Abnormal narrowing of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.label: Choanal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.definition: Absence or abnormal closure of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture). Most embryologists believe that posterior choanal atresia results from a failure of rupture between the 35th and 38th day of fetal life of the partition which separates the bucconasal or buccopharyngeal membranes. The resultant choanal atresia may be unilateral or bilateral, bony or membranous, complete or incomplete. In over 90 per cent of cases the obstruction is bony, while in the remainder it is membranous. The bony type of atresia is commonly located 1-2 mm. anterior to the posterior edge of the hard palate, and the osseous septum varies in thickness from 1 to 10 mm. In the membranous form of choanal atresia the obstruction usually occurs further posteriorly. In approximately one third of cases the atresia is bilateral.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.label: Broad nasal tip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.definition: Increase in width of the nasal tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.label: Bifid nasal tip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.definition: A splitting of the nasal tip. Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.label: Depressed nasal ridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.definition: Lack of prominence of the nose resulting from a posteriorly-placed nasal ridge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.label: Anosmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000045.definition: An inability to perceive odors. This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.label: Narrow nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.definition: Interalar distance more than 2 SD below the mean for age, or alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the nasal base and alae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.label: Anteverted nares
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.definition: Anteriorly-facing nostrils viewed with the head in the Frankfurt horizontal and the eyes of the observer level with the eyes of the subject. This gives the appearance of an upturned nose (upturned nasal tip).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.label: Webbed neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.definition: Pterygium colli is a congenital skin fold that runs along the sides of the neck down to the shoulders. It involves an ectopic fibrotic facial band superficial to the trapezius muscle. Excess hair-bearing skin is also present and extends down the cervical region well beyond the normal hairline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.label: Neck muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.definition: Decreased strength of the neck musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.label: Increased adipose tissue around the neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000046.definition: An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue around the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.label: Gastrointestinal angiodysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.definition: Dysplasia affecting the vasculature of the gastrointestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.label: Long neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.definition: Increased inferior-superior length of the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.label: Torticollis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.definition: Involuntary contractions of the neck musculature resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.label: Thickened nuchal skin fold
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.definition: A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold (NF) measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. An NF measurement greater than 5 mm at 14 to 17+6 weeks of gestation, or 6 mm at 18 to 28 weeks has been associated with a markedly increased risk for Down syndrome.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.label: Broad neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.definition: Increased side-to-side width of the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.label: Cystic hygroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.definition: A cystic lymphatic lesion of the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.label: Abnormality of the eye
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.definition: Any abnormality of the eye, including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.label: Abnormal retinal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000047.definition: A structural abnormality of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.label: Retinal coloboma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.definition: A notch or cleft of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.label: Abnormal cornea morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.definition: Any abnormality of the cornea, which is the transparent tissue at the front of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.label: Microcornea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.definition: A congenital abnormality of the cornea in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.label: Astigmatism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.definition: A type of astigmatism associated with abnormal curvatures on the anterior and/or posterior surface of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.label: Hyperopic astigmatism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.definition: A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.label: Megalocornea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.definition: An enlargement of the cornea with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.label: Strabismus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.definition: A misalignment of the eyes so that the visual axes deviate from bifoveal fixation. The classification of strabismus may be based on a number of features including the relative position of the eyes, whether the deviation is latent or manifest, intermittent or constant, concomitant or otherwise and according to the age of onset and the relevance of any associated refractive error.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.label: Retinopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.definition: Any noninflammatory disease of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000048.label: obsolete Abnormality of globe location or size

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.label: Deeply set eye
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.definition: An eye that is more deeply recessed into the plane of the face than is typical.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.label: Abnormal foveal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.definition: An abnormality of the fovea centralis, the central area of the macula that mediates central, high resolution vision and contains the largest concentration of cone cells in the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.label: Downslanted palpebral fissures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.definition: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.label: Recurrent corneal erosions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.definition: The presence of recurrent corneal epithelial erosions. Although most corneal epithelial defects heal quickly, some may show recurrent ulcerations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.label: Abnormality of eye movement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.definition: An abnormality in voluntary or involuntary eye movements or their control.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000049.label: Globe retraction and deviation on abduction

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.label: Glaucoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.definition: Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.label: Tortuosity of conjunctival vessels
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the conjunctival blood vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.label: Visual impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.definition: Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.label: Telecanthus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.definition: Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.label: Ptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000050.definition: The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.label: Rod-cone dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.definition: An inherited retinal disease subtype in which the rod photoreceptors appear to be more severely affected than the cone photoreceptors. Typical presentation is with nyctalopia (due to rod dysfunction) followed by loss of mid-peripheral field of vision, which gradually extends and leaves many patients with a small central island of vision due to the preservation of macular cones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.label: Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.definition: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.label: Abnormal electroretinogram
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.definition: Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.label: Slow saccadic eye movements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.definition: An abnormally slow velocity of the saccadic eye movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.label: Cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.definition: A cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the crystalline lens of the eye or in its capsule.
