http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.label: Developmental cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000051.definition: A cataract that occurs congenitally as the result of a developmental defect, in contrast to the majority of cataracts that occur in adulthood as the result of degenerative changes of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.label: Proptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.definition: An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.label: Subcapsular cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.definition: A cataract that affects the region of the lens directly beneath the capsule of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.label: Conjunctival telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.definition: The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the conjunctiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.label: Abnormality iris morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.definition: An abnormality of the iris, which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.label: Aniridia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.definition: Abnormality of the iris characterized by, typically bilateral, complete or partial iris hypoplasia. The phenotype ranges from mild defects of anterior iris stroma only to almost complete absence of the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.label: Long eyelashes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.definition: Mid upper eyelash length >10 mm or increased length of the eyelashes (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.label: Anophthalmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.definition: Absence of the globe or eyeball.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.label: Progressive visual loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000052.definition: A reduction of previously attained ability to see.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.label: Abnormal chorioretinal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.definition: An abnormality of the choroid and retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.label: Chorioretinal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.definition: Atrophy of the choroid and retinal layers of the fundus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.label: Epicanthus inversus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.definition: A fold of skin starting at or just below the medial aspect of the lower lid and arching upward to cover, extend in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.label: Pseudopapilledema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.definition: Apparent optic disc swelling in the absence of increased intracranial pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.label: Abnormality of refraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000053.definition: An abnormality in the process of focusing of light by the eye in order to produce a sharp image on the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.label: Hypermetropia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.definition: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects in the distance clearly, while objects nearby appear blurry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.label: Retinal detachment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.definition: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.label: Impaired ocular adduction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.definition: Reduced ability to move the eye in the direction of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.label: Optic disc pallor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.definition: A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disk (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.label: External ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.definition: Paralysis of the external ocular muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.label: Myopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.definition: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.label: Retinal degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.definition: A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.label: Abnormal conjugate eye movement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000054.definition: Any deviation from the normal motor coordination of the eyes that allows for bilateral fixation on a single object.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.label: Undetectable electroretinogram
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.definition: Lack of any response to stimulation upon electroretinography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.label: Color vision defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.definition: An anomaly in the ability to discriminate between or recognize colors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.label: Tritanomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.definition: Difficulty distinguishing between yellow and blue, possible related to dysfunction of the S photopigment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.label: Abnormal uvea morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.definition: An abnormality of the uvea, the vascular layer of the eyeball.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.label: Uveitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.definition: Inflammation of one or all portions of the uveal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.label: Leukocoria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.definition: An abnormal white reflection from the pupil rather than the usual black reflection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.label: Retinal dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.definition: Retinal dystrophy is an abnormality of the retina associated with a hereditary process. Retinal dystrophies are defined by their predominantly monogenic inheritance and they are frequently associated with loss or dysfunction of photoreceptor cells as a primary or secondary event.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.label: Buphthalmos
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.definition: Diffusely large eye (with megalocornea) associated with glaucoma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.label: Rieger anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000055.definition: A congenital malformation of the anterior segment characterized by iridicorneal malformation, glaucoma, iris stroma hypoplasia, posterior embryotoxon, and corneal opacities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.label: Keratoconus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.definition: A cone-shaped deformity of the cornea characterized by the presence of corneal distortion secondary to thinning of the apex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.label: Lacrimal duct atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.definition: A developmental disorder of the lacrimal drainage system that most often affects the lacrimal ostium and resulting in non-opening of the nasolacrimal duct. It usually results from a non-canalization of the nasolacrimal duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.label: Esotropia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.definition: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes turned inward ('crossed') to a relatively severe degree, usually defined as 10 diopters or more.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.label: Chorioretinal coloboma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.definition: Absence of a region of the retina, retinal pigment epithelium, and choroid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.label: Microphthalmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000056.definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one or both eyes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.label: Abnormal saccadic eye movements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.definition: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impairment of fast (saccadic) eye movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.label: Hypometric saccades
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.definition: Saccadic undershoot, i.e., a saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.label: Visual loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.definition: Loss of visual acuity (implying that vision was better at a certain time point in life). Otherwise the term reduced visual acuity should be used (or a subclass of that).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.label: Thick eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.definition: Increased density/number and/or increased diameter of eyebrow hairs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.label: Scotoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.definition: A regional and pathological increase of the light detection threshold in any region of the visual field surrounded by a field of normal or relatively well-preserved vision.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.label: Centrocecal scotoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.definition: A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) located between the central point of fixation and the blind spot with a roughly horizontal oval shape.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.label: Exotropia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000057.definition: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes deviated outward.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.label: Pigmentary retinopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.definition: An abnormality of the retina characterized by pigment deposition. It is typically associated with migration and proliferation of macrophages or retinal pigment epithelial cells into the retina; melanin from these cells causes the pigmentary changes. Pigmentary retinopathy is a common final pathway of many retinal conditions and is often associated with visual loss.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.label: Blepharophimosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.definition: A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.label: Upslanted palpebral fissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.definition: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, the inclination of the palpebral fissure is greater than typical for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.label: Band keratopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.definition: An abnormality of the cornea characterized by the deposition of calcium in a band across the central cornea, leading to decreased vision, foreign body sensation, and ocular irritation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.label: Shallow orbits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.definition: Reduced depth of the orbits associated with prominent-appearing ocular globes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.label: Optic disc coloboma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.definition: A cleft of the optic nerve that extends inferiorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.label: Coloboma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000058.definition: A developmental defect characterized by a cleft of some portion of the eye or ocular adnexa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.label: Progressive external ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.definition: Initial bilateral ptosis followed by limitation of eye movements in all directions and slowing of saccades.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.label: Blue sclerae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.definition: An abnormal bluish coloration of the sclera.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.label: Abnormal anterior chamber morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.definition: Abnormality of the anterior chamber, which is the space in the eye that is behind the cornea and in front of the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.label: Shallow anterior chamber
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.definition: Reduced depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is decreased.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.label: Ophthalmoparesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.definition: Ophthalmoplegia is a paralysis or weakness of one or more of the muscles that control eye movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.label: Abnormality of the frontal hairline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000059.definition: An anomaly in the placement or shape of the hairline (trichion) on the forehead, that is, the border between skin on the forehead that has head hair and that does not.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.label: Abnormality of the pharynx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.definition: An anomaly of the pharynx, i.e., of the tubular structure extending from the base of the skull superiorly to the esophageal inlet inferiorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.label: Hypotelorism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.definition: Interpupillary distance less than 2 SD below the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an decreased interpupillary distance or closely spaced eyes).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.label: Ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.definition: Paralysis of one or more extraocular muscles that are responsible for eye movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.label: Central scotoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.definition: An area of depressed vision located at the point of fixation and that interferes with central vision.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.label: Supranuclear gaze palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.definition: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a particular direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.label: Abnormality of the periorbital region
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.definition: An abnormality of the region situated around the orbit of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.label: Macular degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000060.definition: A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells of the macula lutea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.label: Abnormal choroid morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.definition: Any structural abnormality of the choroid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.label: Photophobia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.definition: Excessive sensitivity to light with the sensation of discomfort or pain in the eyes due to exposure to bright light.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.label: Abnormal nasolacrimal system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.definition: An abnormality of the nasolacrimal drainage system, which serves as a conduit for tear flow from the external eye to the nasal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.label: Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.definition: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impaired smooth-pursuit eye movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.label: Blindness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.definition: Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception defined as visual perception below 3/60 and/or a visual field of no greater than 10 degrees in radius around central fixation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.label: Impaired convergence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000061.definition: Reduced ability to turn the eyes inward in order to focus on a nearby object.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.label: Entropion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.definition: An abnormal inversion (turning inward) of the eyelid (usually the lower) towards the globe. Entropion is usually acquired as a result of involutional or cicatricial processes but may occasionally be congenital.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.label: Blurred vision
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.definition: Lack of sharpness of vision resulting in the inability to see fine detail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.label: Supranuclear ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.definition: A vertical gaze palsy with inability to direct the gaze of the eyes downwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.label: Eyelid coloboma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.definition: A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower or upper eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.label: Posterior embryotoxon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000062.definition: A posterior embryotoxon is the presence of a prominent and anteriorly displaced line of Schwalbe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.label: Retinal arterial tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.label: Decreased lacrimation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.definition: Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced ability to produce tears.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.label: Impaired ocular abduction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.definition: An impaired ability of the eye to move in the outward direction (towards the side of the head).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.label: Blue irides
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.definition: A markedly blue coloration of the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.label: Upper eyelid coloboma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.definition: A short discontinuity of the margin of the upper eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.label: Long palpebral fissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.definition: Distance between medial and lateral canthi is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, apparently increased length of the palpebral fissures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.label: Nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000063.definition: Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.label: Gaze-evoked nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.definition: Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.label: Dysmetric saccades
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.definition: The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.label: Red-green dyschromatopsia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.definition: Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.label: Blepharospasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.definition: A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.label: Amblyopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.definition: Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.label: Sclerocornea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.definition: A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.label: Optic atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.definition: Atrophy of the optic nerve. Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.label: Abnormality of visual evoked potentials
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000064.definition: An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.label: Abnormal amplitude of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials
Diplopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.definition: Diplopia is a condition in which a single object is perceived as two images, it is also known as double vision.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.label: Lower eyelid coloboma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.definition: A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.label: Decreased light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram amplitude
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.definition: Descreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.label: Ectropion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.definition: An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.label: Oculomotor apraxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.definition: Ocular motor apraxia is a deficiency in voluntary, horizontal, lateral, fast eye movements (saccades) with retention of slow pursuit movements. The inability to follow objects visually is often compensated by head movements. There may be decreased smooth pursuit, and cancellation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.label: Peters anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000065.definition: A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.label: Lipemia retinalis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.definition: A creamy appearance of the retinal blood vessels that occurs when the concentration of lipids in the blood are extremely increased, with pale pink to milky white retinal vessels and altered pale reflexes from choroidal vasculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.label: Nyctalopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.definition: Inability to see well at night or in poor light.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.label: Synophrys
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.definition: Meeting of the medial eyebrows in the midline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.label: Horizontal nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.definition: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.label: Phthisis bulbi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.definition: Atrophy of the eyeball with blindness and decreased intraocular pressure due to end-stage intraocular disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.label: Hypodontia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000066.definition: The absence of five or less teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.label: Carious teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.definition: Caries is a multifactorial bacterial infection affecting the structure of the tooth. This term has been used to describe the presence of more than expected dental caries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.label: Anodontia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.definition: The absence of all teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.label: Macrodontia of permanent maxillary central incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.definition: Increased size of the maxillary central secondary incisor tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.label: Abnormality of the incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.definition: An abnormality of the Incisor tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.label: Oligodontia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.definition: The absence of six or more teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.label: Dental crowding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.definition: Changes in alignment of teeth in the dental arch

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.label: Taurodontia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000067.definition: Increased volume of dental pulp of permanent molar characterized by a crown body-root ratio equal or larger than 1:1 or an elongated pulp chambers and apical displacement of the bifurcation or trifurcation of the roots.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.label: Delayed eruption of primary teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.definition: Delayed tooth eruption affecting the primary dentition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.label: Abnormal dental enamel morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.definition: An abnormality of the dental enamel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.label: Grayish enamel
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.definition: A grey discoloration of the dental enamel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.label: Delayed eruption of teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.definition: Delayed tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD beyond the mean eruption age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.label: Widely spaced teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.definition: Increased spaces (diastemata) between most of the teeth in the same dental arch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.label: Dental malocclusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000068.definition: Dental malocclusion refers to an abnormality of the occlusion, or alignment, of the teeth and the way the upper and lower teeth fit together, resulting in overcrowding of teeth or in abnormal bite patterns.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.label: Agenesis of maxillary lateral incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.definition: Agenesis of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the maxillary lateral primary incisor and maxillary lateral secondary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.label: Microdontia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.definition: Decreased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.label: Tooth malposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.definition: Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., misaligned teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.label: Odontodysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.definition: The diagnosis odontodysplasia requires clinical and radiological exams, in which unusually large pulp chambers and large pulp room chambers with thin enamel and dentin are visible. It may affect either a single tooth or several teeth. The term regional odontodysplasia is used if several teeth are affected. It affects the deciduous and permanent dentitions in the maxilla, the mandible or both, although the maxilla is more frequently involved. A type of dental dysplasia occurring in dentinogenesis imperfecta in which the pulp chambers are enlarged and there is a reduced amount of coronal dentin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.label: Natal tooth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.definition: A tooth present at birth or erupting within the first month of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.label: Delayed eruption of permanent teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.definition: Delayed tooth eruption affecting the secondary dentition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.label: Conical tooth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.definition: An abnormal conical form of the teeth, that is, a tooth whose sides converge or taper together incisally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.label: Diastema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000069.definition: Increased space between two adjacent teeth in the same dental arch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.label: Periapical bone loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.definition: Radiolucency (reflecting a reduction in the bony substance) around the apex (the tip of the dental root).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.label: Amelogenesis imperfecta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.definition: A developmental dysplasia of the dental enamel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.label: Eruption failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.definition: A tooth which does not erupt within the teeth eruption timeline and after the loss of eruption potential.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.label: Abnormality of the nervous system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.definition: An abnormality of the nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.label: Atypical behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.definition: Atypical behavior is an abnormality in a person's actions, which can be controlled or modulated by the will of the individual. While abnormal behaviors can be difficult to control, they are distinct from other abnormal actions that cannot be affected by the individual's will.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.label: Psychosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000070.definition: A condition characterized by changes in personality and thought patterns, often accompanied by hallucinations and delusional beliefs, is known as psychosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.label: Hyperorality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.definition: Hyperorality is a condition characterized by an excessive preoccupation with oral sensations and behaviors, such as chewing, sucking, biting, swallowing, and excessive mouthing of objects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.label: Restlessness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.definition: A state of unease is characterized by diffuse motor activity or motion, which is subject to limited control, nonproductive, or disorganized behavior.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.label: Emotional lability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.definition: Unstable emotional experiences and frequent mood changes; emotions that are easily aroused, intense, and/or disproportionate to events and circumstances.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.label: Agitation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.definition: A state of extreme restlessness and excessive motor activity is associated with mental distress or a feeling of inner tension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.label: Depression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.definition: Frequently experiencing feelings of being down, miserable, and/or hopeless; struggling to recover from these moods; having a pessimistic outlook on the future; feeling a pervasive sense of shame; having a low self-worth; experiencing thoughts of suicide and engaging in suicidal behavior.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.label: Autism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.definition: Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impaired social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior. Autism begins in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.label: Aggressive behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.definition: Behavior or an act aimed at harming a person, animal, or physical property (e.g., acts of physical violence; shouting, swearing, and using harsh language; slashing someone's tires).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.label: Inappropriate behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000071.definition: An explicit or perceived action, demonstration, conduct, or language (verbal and written) that is contrary to generally accepted norms, rules, procedures, or unacceptable within the context in which it is carried out. Inappropriate behaviors could take place in a sexual or social context and could be aggressive, violent, impulsive, intimidating, or threatening in nature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.label: Compulsive behaviors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.definition: Behavior that consists of repetitive acts, characterized by the feeling that one "has to" perform them, while being aware that these acts are not in line with one's overall goal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.label: Restrictive behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.definition: Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to a few interests and activities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.label: Psychotic episodes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.definition: Periods of time during which an individual experiences significant disturbances in their thoughts, perceptions, emotions, and behavior, resulting in a loss of touch with reality. These episodes are hallmark features of psychotic disorders such as schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, and certain forms of bipolar disorder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.label: Dementia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.definition: A loss of global cognitive ability of sufficient amount to interfere with normal social or occupational function. Dementia represents a loss of previously present cognitive abilities, generally in adults, and can affect memory, thinking, language, judgment, and behavior.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.label: Impaired ability to form peer relationships
Autistic behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000072.definition: Persistent deficits in social interaction and communication and interaction as well as a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest as well as repetitive patterns of behavior.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.label: Inflexible adherence to routines
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.definition: A need to strictly adhere to repetitive routines or patterns of behavior which are created by the environment. One becomes upset or distressed when their routines are disrupted or altered.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.label: Abnormal repetitive mannerisms
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.definition: Use of the same abnormal action in response to certain triggers or at random. They may be used as a way to regulate one's internal state but must otherwise have no apparent functional purpose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.label: Disinhibition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.definition: Reduced ability to control, or a failure to resist a temptation, urge, or impulse. Examples include disregard for social conventions, general impulsivity, and poor risk assessment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.label: Impaired social interactions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.definition: Difficulty interacting with others through emotional, physical, or verbal communication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.label: Short attention span
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.definition: Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.label: Irritability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.definition: A proneness to anger, i.e., a tendency to become easily bothered or annoyed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.label: Hallucinations
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.definition: Perceptions in a conscious and awake state that, in the absence of external stimuli, have qualities of real perception. These perceptions are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.label: Anxiety
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000073.definition: Intense feelings of nervousness, tension, or panic often arise in response to interpersonal stresses. There is worry about the negative effects of past unpleasant experiences and future negative possibilities. Individuals may feel fearful, apprehensive, or threatened by uncertainty, and they may also have fears of falling apart or losing control.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.label: Episodic paroxysmal anxiety
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.definition: Recurrent attacks of severe anxiety, which occur without restriction to any particular situation or set of circumstances, are therefore unpredictable.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.label: Apathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.definition: Apathy is a quantitative reduction of motivation and the initiation and persistence of goal-directed behavior, where the accompanying emotions, thoughts, and social interactions are also suppressed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.label: Self-mutilation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.definition: Deliberate harm to one's body resulting in tissue damage, without a conscious intent to die.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.label: Frontal release signs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.definition: Primitive reflexes traditionally held to be a sign of disorders that affect the frontal lobes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.label: Low frustration tolerance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.definition: The feeling of frustration can be defined as an emotional reaction that occurs when a desired goal is not achieved. Frustration intolerance is defined as an age-inappropriate response to frustration, characterized by crying or temper tantrums in children, or aggressive or other undesirable behaviors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.label: Diminished motivation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.definition: A reduction in goal-directed behavior, that is, motivation, is the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.label: Delusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.definition: A delusion is a fixed false belief held despite evidence to the contrary. The term delusion broadly encompasses all false judgments that possess the following external characteristics to a significant, albeit unspecified, extent: (1) they are held with an exceptional level of conviction, accompanied by an unparalleled subjective certainty; (2) there is an inability to consider alternative experiences or compelling counter-arguments; (3) the content of the belief is impossible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.label: Inappropriate laughter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000074.definition: Laughing that may be excessive and/or inappropriate in context (e.g., laughing at a funeral while others are crying).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.label: Delayed speech and language development
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.definition: A degree of language development that is significantly below the norm for a child of a specified age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.label: Personality changes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.definition: An abnormal shift in patterns of thinking, acting, or feeling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.label: Hyperactivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.definition: Hyperactivity is a condition characterized by constant and unusually high levels of activity, even in situations where it is deemed inappropriate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.label: Agoraphobia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.definition: A type of anxiety disorder characterized by the avoidance of public places, especially where crowds gather.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.label: Lack of insight
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.definition: Lack of insight (Anosognosia) is a neurological condition in which an individual is unaware of his or her own neurological deficit or psychiatric condition. Anosognosia can be associated with mental illness, dementia, and structural brain lesions and can affect an indviduals's conscious awareness of deficits involving judgment, emotions, memory, executive function, language skills, and motor ability.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.label: Abnormal nonverbal communicative behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.definition: Abnormalities in eye contact, communicative facial expressions, gesture use, or the use of others' bodies to communicate convey shared meanings within a culture that replace or supplement verbal communication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.label: Abnormal peripheral nervous system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000075.definition: A structural abnormality of the peripheral nervous system, which is composed of the nerves that lead to or branch off from the central nervous system. This includes the cranial nerves (olfactory and optic nerves are technically part of the central nervous system).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.label: Decreased nerve conduction velocity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.definition: A reduction in the speed at which electrical signals propagate along the axon of a neuron.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.label: Sensory neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.definition: Peripheral neuropathy affecting the sensory nerves.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.label: Abnormal thorax morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.definition: Any abnormality of the thorax (the region of the body formed by the sternum, the thoracic vertebrae and the ribs).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.label: Abnormal sternum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.definition: An anomaly of the sternum, also known as the breastbone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.label: Pectus excavatum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.definition: A defect of the chest wall characterized by a depression of the sternum, giving the chest ("pectus") a caved-in ("excavatum") appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.label: Pectus carinatum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000076.definition: A deformity of the chest caused by overgrowth of the ribs and characterized by protrusion of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.label: Gynecomastia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.definition: Abnormal development of large mammary glands in males resulting in breast enlargement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.label: Narrow chest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.definition: Reduced width of the chest from side to side, associated with a reduced distance from the sternal notch to the tip of the shoulder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.label: Abnormality of the diaphragm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.definition: Any abnormality of the diaphragm, the sheet of skeletal muscle that separates the thoracic cavity from the abdominal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.label: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.definition: The presence of a hernia of the diaphragm present at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.label: Abnormal thymus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000077.definition: Abnormality of the thymus, an organ located in the upper anterior portion of the chest cavity just behind the sternum and whose main function is to provide an environment for T lymphocyte maturation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000078.label: Abnormal scapula morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000078.definition: Any abnormality of the scapula, also known as the shoulder blade.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000078.label: Nephrolithiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000078.definition: The presence of calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.label: Hematuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.definition: The presence of blood in the urine. Hematuria may be gross hematuria (visible to the naked eye) or microscopic hematuria (detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.label: Uric acid nephrolithiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.definition: The presence of uric acid-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.label: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.definition: A type of glomerulonephritis characterized by diffuse mesangial cell proliferation and the thickening of capillary walls due to subendothelial extension of the mesangium. The term membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis is often employed to denote a general pattern of glomerular injury seen in a variety of disease processes that share a common pathogenetic mechanism, rather than to describe a single disease entity

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.label: IgA deposition in the glomerulus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.definition: The presence of immunoglobulin A deposits in the glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.label: Abnormality of the urethra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.definition: An abnormality of the urethra, i.e., of the tube which connects the urinary bladder to the outside of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.label: Urethral obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.definition: Obstruction of the flow of urine through the urethra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.label: Oligozoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.definition: Reduced count of spermatozoa in the semen, defined as a sperm count below 20 million per milliliter semen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.label: Renal steatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000079.definition: Abnormal fat accumulation in the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.label: Impotence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.definition: Inability to develop or maintain an erection of the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.label: Renal cortical cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.definition: Cysts of the cortex of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.label: Xanthine nephrolithiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.definition: The presence of xanthine-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.label: Enuresis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.definition: Lack of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination at an age where control of the bladder should already be possible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.label: Penoscrotal hypospadias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.definition: A severe form of hypospadias in which the urethral opening is located at the junction of the penis and scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.label: Urinary tract atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000080.definition: Congenital absence of the normal opening of a structure of the urinary tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.label: Abnormal internal genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.definition: An anomaly of the adnexa, uterus, and vagina (in female) or seminal tract and prostate (in male).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.label: Bicornuate uterus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.definition: The presence of a bicornuate uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.label: Hypergonadotropic hypogonadism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.definition: Reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) associated with excess pituitary gonadotropin secretion and resulting in delayed sexual development and growth delay.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.label: Abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.definition: An abnormality of the tricarboxylic acid cycle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.label: Reduced eye contact
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.definition: A reduced frequency or duration of eye contact.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.label: Abnormality of the endocrine system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.definition: An abnormality of the endocrine system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.label: Diabetes mellitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000081.definition: A group of abnormalities characterized by hyperglycemia and glucose intolerance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.label: Abnormality of the thyroid gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.definition: An abnormality of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.label: Hypertension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.definition: The presence of chronic increased pressure in the systemic arterial system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.label: Delayed puberty
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.definition: Passing the age when puberty normally occurs with no physical or hormonal signs of the onset of puberty.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.label: Decreased response to growth hormone stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.definition: Insufficient responses to growth hormone (GH) provocation tests. GH deficiency is defined as a serum peak GH concentration less than 10 ng/mL on provocation with a combination of at least two separate stimulation tests.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.label: Hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.definition: An increased concentration of insulin combined with a decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.label: Precocious puberty
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.definition: The onset of secondary sexual characteristics before a normal age. Although it is difficult to define normal age ranges because of the marked variation with which puberty begins in normal children, precocious puberty can be defined as the onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls or 9 years in boys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.label: Abnormality of the parathyroid gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.definition: An abnormality of the parathyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.label: Hypoparathyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000082.definition: A condition caused by a deficiency of parathyroid hormone characterized by hypocalcemia and hyperphosphatemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.label: Anterior hypopituitarism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.definition: A condition of reduced function of the anterior pituitary gland characterized by decreased secretion of one or more of the pituitary hormones growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, prolactin, luteinizing hormone, and follicle-stimulating hormone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.label: Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.definition: A type of diabetes mellitus related not to lack of insulin but rather to lack of response to insulin on the part of the target tissues of insulin such as muscle, fat, and liver cells. This type of diabetes is typically associated with increases both in blood glucose concentrations as well as in fasting and postprandial serum insulin levels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.label: Primary hypothyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.definition: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.label: Abnormality of the adrenal glands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.definition: Abnormality of the adrenal glands, i.e., of the endocrine glands located at the top of the kindneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.label: Adrenal hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the adrenal glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.label: Hyperthyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.definition: An abnormality of thyroid physiology characterized by excessive secretion of the thyroid hormones thyroxine (i.e., T4) and/or 3,3',5-triiodo-L-thyronine zwitterion (i.e., triiodothyronine or T3).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.label: Increased circulating gonadotropin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.definition: Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.label: Pituitary dwarfism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000083.definition: A type of reduced stature with normal proportions related to dysfunction of the pituitary gland related to either an isolated defect in the secretion of growth hormone or to panhypopituitarism, i.e., a deficit of all the anterior pituitary hormones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.label: Adrenogenital syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.definition: Adrenogenital syndrome is also known as congenital adrenal hyperplasia, which results from disorders of steroid hormone production in the adrenal glands leading to a deficiency of cortisol. The pituitary gland reacts by increased secretion of corticotropin, which in turn causes the adrenal glands to overproduce certain intermediary hormones which have testosterone-like effects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.label: Hyperactive renin-angiotensin system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.definition: An abnormally increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system, causing hypertension by a combination of volume excess and vasoconstrictor mechanisms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.label: Hyperinsulinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.definition: An increased concentration of insulin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.label: Hyperparathyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.definition: Excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH) by the parathyroid glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.label: Elevated circulating growth hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.definition: Acromegaly is a condition resulting from overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland in persons with closed epiphyses, and consists chiefly in the enlargement of the distal parts of the body. The circumference of the skull increases, the nose becomes broad, the tongue becomes enlarged, the facial features become coarsened, the mandible grows excessively, and the teeth become separated. The fingers and toes grow chiefly in thickness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.label: Adrenal insufficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.definition: Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.label: Abnormality of renin-angiotensin system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.definition: An abnormality of the renin-angiotensin system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.label: Increased circulating renin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000084.definition: An increased level of renin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.label: Congenital hypothyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.definition: A type of hypothyroidism with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.label: Pseudohypoparathyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.definition: A condition characterized by resistance to the action of parathyroid hormone, in which there is hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, and (appropriately) high levels of parathyroid hormone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.label: Goiter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.definition: An enlargement of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.label: Thyroid adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.definition: The presence of a adenoma of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.label: Insulin resistance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.definition: Increased resistance towards insulin, that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.label: Irregular menstruation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.definition: Abnormally high variation in the amount of time between periods.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.label: Hyperaldosteronism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000085.definition: Overproduction of the mineralocorticoid aldosterone by the adrenal cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000086.label: Parathyroid hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000086.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the parathyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000086.label: Central diabetes insipidus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000086.definition: A form of diabetes insipidus related to a failure of vasopressin (AVP) release from the hypothalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000086.label: Abnormality of the hypothalamus-pituitary axis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000086.definition: Abnormality of the pituitary gland (also known as hypophysis), which is an endocrine gland that protrudes from the bottom of the hypothalamus at the base of the brain. The pituitary gland secretes the hormones ACTH, TSH, PRL, GH, endorphins, FSH, LH, oxytocin, and antidiuretic hormone. The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000086.label: Secondary hyperparathyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000086.definition: Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.label: Increased circulating prolactin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.definition: The presence of abnormally increased levels of prolactin in the blood. Prolactin is a peptide hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland that plays a role in breast development and lactation during pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.label: Panhypopituitarism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.definition: A pituitary functional deficit affecting all the anterior pituitary hormones (growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone, luteinizing hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, and prolactin).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.label: Hashimoto thyroiditis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.definition: A chronic, autoimmune type of thyroiditis associated with hypothyroidism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.label: Diabetes insipidus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.definition: A state of excessive water intake and hypotonic (dilute) polyuria. Diabetes insipidus may be due to failure of vasopressin (AVP) release (central or neurogenic diabetes insipidus) or to a failure of the kidney to respond to AVP (nephrogenic diabetes insipidus).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.label: Oligomenorrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.definition: Infrequent menses (less than 6 per year or more than 35 days between cycles).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.label: 11 pairs of ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.definition: Presence of only 11 pairs of ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.label: Short sternum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000087.definition: Decreased inferosuperior length of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000088.label: Horizontal ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000088.definition: A horizontal (flat) conformation of the ribs, the long curved bones that form the rib cage and normally progressively oblique (slanted) from ribs 1 through 9, then less slanted through rib 12.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000088.label: Abnormal clavicle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000088.definition: Any abnormality of the clavicles (collar bones).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.label: Bifid ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.definition: A bifid rib refers to cleavage of the sternal end of a rib, usually unilateral. Bifid ribs are usually asymptomatic, and are often discovered incidentally by chest x-ray.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.label: Bulging of the costochondral junction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.definition: Abnormal outward curving (protuberance) of the junction of ribs and costal cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.label: Lateral clavicle hook
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.definition: An excessive upward convexity of the lateral clavicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.label: Rib exostoses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.definition: Multiple circumscribed bony excrescences located in the ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.label: Rachitic rosary
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000089.definition: A row of beadlike prominences at the junction of a rib and its cartilage (i.e., enlarged costochondral joints), resembling a rosary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000090.label: Rib fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000090.definition: Complete or partial merging of adjacent ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000090.label: Flaring of rib cage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000090.definition: The presence of wide, concave anterior rib ends.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000090.label: Progressive clavicular acroosteolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000090.definition: Progressive bone resorption in the distal part of the clavicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.label: Flat glenoid fossa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.definition: Abnormally flat configuration of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.label: Sprengel anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.definition: A congenital skeletal deformity characterized by the elevation of one scapula (thus, one scapula is located superior to the other).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.label: Posterior rib fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.definition: Complete or partial merging of the posterior part of adjacent ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.label: Pectus excavatum of inferior sternum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.definition: Pectus excavatum (defect of the chest wall characterized by depression of the sternum) affecting primarily the inferior region of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.label: Broad clavicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.definition: Increased width (cross-sectional diameter) of the clavicles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.label: Superior pectus carinatum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.definition: Pectus carinatum affecting primarily the superior part of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.label: Scapular exostoses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.definition: The presence of multiple exostoses on the scapula. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.label: Abnormality of the costochondral junction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000091.definition: Any anomaly of the costochondral junction. The costochondral junctions are located between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.label: Enlargement of the costochondral junction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.definition: Abnormally increased size of the costochondral junctions, which are located between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.label: Missing ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.definition: A developmental anomaly with absence of one or more ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.label: Beaded ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.definition: The presence of a row of multiple rounded expansions (beadlike prominences) at the junction of a rib and its cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.label: Abnormality of the skeletal system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.definition: An abnormality of the skeletal system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.label: Abnormality of the vertebral column
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.definition: Any abnormality of the vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.label: Platyspondyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.label: Abnormality of skeletal maturation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.definition: The bones of the skeleton undergo a series of characteristic changes in size, shape, and calcification from fetal life until puberty. An abnormality of this process can include delayed or accelerated skeletal maturation, or deviation of some, but not all bones from the expected patterns of maturation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.label: Abnormal skull morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000092.definition: An abnormality of the skull, the bony framework of the head which is comprised of the neurocranium (with eight cranial bones) and the viscerocranium (facial skeleton) that comprises fourteen facial bones with the mandible as its largest bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.label: Elevated imprint of the transverse sinuses
Thinning and bulging of the posterior fossa bones
Abnormal posterior cranial fossa morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.definition: An abnormality of the fossa cranii posterior (the posterior fossa), which is made up primarily of the occipital bone and which surrounds to the foramen magnum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.label: Posterior fossa cyst at the fourth ventricle
Chondrocalcinosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.definition: Radiographic evidence of articular calcification that represent calcium pyrophosphate depositions in soft tissue surrounding joints and at the insertions of tendons near joints (Entheses/Sharpey fibers) .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.label: Thickened cortex of long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.definition: Abnormal thickening of the cortex of long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.label: Osteopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.definition: Osteopenia is a term to define bone density that is not normal but also not as low as osteoporosis. By definition from the World Health Organization osteopenia is defined by bone densitometry as a T score -1 to -2.5.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.label: Osteoporosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000093.definition: Osteoporosis is a systemic skeletal disease characterized by low bone density and microarchitectural deterioration of bone tissue with a consequent increase in bone fragility. According to the WHO criteria, osteoporosis is defined as a BMD that lies 2.5 standard deviations or more below the average value for young healthy adults (a T-score below -2.5 SD).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000094.label: Abnormal diaphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000094.definition: An abnormality of the structure or form of the diaphysis, i.e., of the main or mid-section (shaft) of a long bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000094.label: Abnormal metaphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000094.definition: An abnormality of one or more metaphysis, i.e., of the somewhat wider portion of a long bone that is adjacent to the epiphyseal growth plate and grows during childhood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000094.label: Dumbbell-shaped long bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000094.definition: An abnormal appearance of the long bones with resemblance to a dumbbell, a short bar with a weight at each end. That is, the long bone is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.label: Jaundice
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.definition: Yellow pigmentation of the skin due to bilirubin, which in turn is the result of increased bilirubin concentration in the bloodstream.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.label: Hyperpigmentation of the skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.definition: A darkening of the skin related to an increase in melanin production and deposition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.label: Single transverse palmar crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.definition: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.label: Acanthosis nigricans
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.definition: A dermatosis characterized by thickened, hyperpigmented plaques, typically on the intertriginous surfaces and neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.label: Cafe-au-lait spot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.definition: Cafe-au-lait spots are hyperpigmented lesions that can vary in color from light brown to dark brown with smooth borders and having a size of 1.5 cm or more in adults and 0.5 cm or more in children.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.label: Dry skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000095.definition: Skin characterized by the lack of natural or normal moisture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.label: Sacral dimple
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.definition: A cutaneous indentation resulting from tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) of the intergluteal cleft.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.label: Cyanosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.definition: Bluish discoloration of the skin and mucosa due to poor circulation or inadequate oxygenation of arterial or capillary blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.label: Hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.definition: Hyperkeratosis is thickening of the outer layer of the skin, the stratum corneum, which is composed of large, polyhedral, plate-like envelopes filled with keratin which are the dead cells that have migrated up from the stratum granulosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.label: Thin skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.definition: Reduction in thickness of the skin, generally associated with a loss of suppleness and elasticity of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.label: Eczema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.definition: Eczema is a form of dermatitis. The term eczema is broadly applied to a range of persistent skin conditions and can be related to a number of underlying conditions. Manifestations of eczema can include dryness and recurring skin rashes with redness, skin edema, itching and dryness, crusting, flaking, blistering, cracking, oozing, or bleeding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.label: Cutis marmorata
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.definition: A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.label: Petechiae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.definition: Petechiae are pinpoint-sized reddish/purple spots, resembling a rash, that appear just under the skin or a mucous membrane when capillaries have ruptured and some superficial bleeding into the skin has happened. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing petechiae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.label: Ectodermal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.definition: Ectodermal dysplasia is a group of conditions in which there is abnormal development of the skin, hair, nails, teeth, or sweat glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.label: Edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000096.definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.label: Abnormal sweat gland morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.definition: Any structural abnormality of the sweat gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.label: Palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.definition: Abnormal thickening of the skin localized to the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.label: Cutis laxa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.definition: Wrinkled, redundant, inelastic and sagging skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.label: Hyperextensible skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.definition: A condition in which the skin can be stretched beyond normal, and then returns to its initial position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.label: Hyperhidrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.definition: Abnormal excessive perspiration (sweating) despite the lack of appropriate stimuli like hot and humid weather.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.label: Soft skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.definition: Subjective impression of increased softness upon palpation of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.label: Bruising susceptibility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.definition: An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.label: Purpura
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000097.definition: Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning "purple") is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000098.label: Palmoplantar keratoderma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000098.definition: Abnormal thickening of the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000098.label: Skin rash
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000098.definition: A red eruption of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000098.label: Pruritus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000098.definition: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased disposition to experience pruritus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.label: Xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.definition: The presence of multiple xanthomas (xanthomata) in the skin. Xanthomas are yellowish, firm, lipid-laden nodules in the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.label: Cutaneous photosensitivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.definition: An increased sensitivity of the skin to light. Photosensitivity may result in a rash upon exposure to the sun (which is known as photodermatosis). Photosensitivity can be diagnosed by phototests in which light is shone on small areas of skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.label: Molluscoid pseudotumors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.definition: Bluish-grey, spongy nodules associated with scars over pressure points and easily traumatized areas like the elbows and knees.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.label: Melanocytic nevus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.definition: A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.label: Facial capillary hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.definition: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells with small endothelial spaces, occurring in the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.label: Axillary freckling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.definition: The presence in the axillary region (armpit) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.label: Hypertrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.definition: Hypertrichosis is increased hair growth that is abnormal in quantity or location.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.label: Pyoderma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000099.definition: Any manifestation of a skin disease associated with the production of pus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000100.label: Abnormality of skin pigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000100.definition: An abnormality of the pigmentation of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000100.label: Multiple lentigines
