http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000160.definition: Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000160.label: Laryngeal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000160.definition: Stricture or narrowing of the larynx that may be associated with symptoms of respiratory difficulty depending on the degree of laryngeal narrowing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000160.label: Vocal cord paresis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000160.definition: Decreased strength of the vocal folds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000160.label: Vocal cord paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000160.definition: A loss of the ability to move the vocal folds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000160.label: obsolete Vocal cord paralysis (caused by tumor impingement)
Hoarse voice
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000160.definition: Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000161.label: Hypernasal speech
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000161.definition: A type of speech characterized by the presence of an abnormally increased nasal airflow during speech associated with structural abnormality of the nasal passages.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000161.label: obsolete Hoarse voice (caused by tumor impingement)
Dysphonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000161.definition: Difficulty in speaking due to a physical disorder of the mouth, tongue, throat, or vocal cords. Associated with a known physical or neurological cause.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.label: High pitched voice
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.definition: An abnormal increase in the pitch (frequency) of the voice.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.label: Premature birth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.definition: The birth of a baby of less than 37 weeks of gestational age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.label: Breech presentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.definition: A position of the fetus at delivery in which the fetus enters the birth canal with the buttocks or feet first.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.label: Abnormality of the cardiovascular system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.definition: Any abnormality of the cardiovascular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.label: Abnormal heart morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.definition: Any structural anomaly of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.label: Ventricular septal defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000162.definition: A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.label: Atrial septal defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.definition: Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the interatrial septum that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.label: Abnormal mitral valve morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.definition: Any structural anomaly of the mitral valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.label: Mitral valve prolapse
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.definition: One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.label: Congestive heart failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.definition: The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.label: Tetralogy of Fallot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.definition: A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.label: Abnormal myocardium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.definition: A structural anomaly of the muscle layer of the heart wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.label: Cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.definition: A myocardial disorder in which the heart muscle is structurally and functionally abnormal, in the absence of coronary artery disease, hypertension, valvular disease and congenital heart disease sufficient to cause the observed myocardial abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.label: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000163.definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is defined by the presence of increased ventricular wall thickness or mass in the absence of loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) sufficient to cause the observed abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Cardiomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: Increased size of the heart, clinically defined as an increased transverse diameter of the cardiac silhouette that is greater than or equal to 50% of the transverse diameter of the chest (increased cardiothoracic ratio) on a posterior-anterior projection of a chest radiograph or a computed tomography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Abnormal pulmonary valve morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: Any structural abnormality of the pulmonary valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Pulmonic stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis), below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis), or above the pulmonary valve (supravalvar stenosis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Patent ductus arteriosus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Dilated cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) is defined by the presence of left ventricular dilatation and left ventricular systolic dysfunction in the absence of abnormal loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. Right ventricular dilation and dysfunction may be present but are not necessary for the diagnosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Sudden cardiac death
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: The heart suddenly and unexpectedly stops beating resulting in death within a short time period (generally within 1 h of symptom onset).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Abnormal aortic valve morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: Any abnormality of the aortic valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Bicuspid aortic valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: The presence of an aortic valve with two instead of the normal three cusps (flaps). Bicuspid aortic valvue is a malformation of a commissure (small space between the attachment of each cusp to the aortic wall) and the adjacent parts of the two corresponding cusps forming a raphe (the fused area of the two underdeveloped cusps turning into a malformed commissure between both cusps; the raphe is a fibrous ridge that extends from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Cor pulmonale
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: Right-sided heart failure resulting from chronic hypertension in the pulmonary arteries and right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.label: Tachycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000164.definition: A rapid heartrate that exceeds the range of the normal resting heartrate for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.label: Aortic valve stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.definition: The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.label: Dextrocardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.definition: The heart is located in the right hand sided hemithorax. That is, there is a left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the heart in which the heart is locate on the right side instead of the left.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.label: Mitral regurgitation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.definition: An abnormality of the mitral valve characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.label: Abnormal heart valve morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.definition: Any structural abnormality of a cardiac valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.label: Patent foramen ovale
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.definition: Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.label: Prolonged QT interval
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.definition: Increased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.label: Myocardial infarction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.definition: Necrosis of the myocardium caused by an obstruction of the blood supply to the heart and often associated with chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations, and anxiety as well as characteristic EKG findings and elevation of serum markers including creatine kinase-MB fraction and troponin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.label: Aortic regurgitation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000165.definition: An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.label: Truncus arteriosus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.definition: A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.label: Bradycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.definition: A slower than normal heart rate (in adults, slower than 60 beats per minute).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.label: Ventricular fibrillation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.definition: Uncontrolled contractions of muscles fibers in the left ventricle not producing contraction of the left ventricle. Ventricular fibrillation usually begins with a ventricular premature contraction and a short run of rapid ventricular tachycardia degenerating into uncoordinating ventricular fibrillations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.label: Torsade de pointes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.definition: A type of ventricular tachycardia characterized by polymorphioc QRS complexes that change in amplitue and cycle length, and thus have the appearance of oscillating around the baseline in the EKG.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.label: Right ventricular hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.definition: In this case the right ventricle is more muscular than normal, causing a characteristic boot-shaped (coeur-en-sabot) appearance as seen on anterior- posterior chest x-rays. Right ventricular hypertrophy is commonly associated with any form of right ventricular outflow obstruction or pulmonary hypertension, which may in turn owe its origin to left-sided disease. The echocardiographic signs are thickening of the anterior right ventricular wall and the septum. Cavity size is usually normal, or slightly enlarged. In many cases there is associated volume overload present due to tricuspid regurgitation, in the absence of this, septal motion is normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.label: Transposition of the great arteries
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000166.definition: A complex congenital heart defect in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.label: Asymmetric septal hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.label: Abnormal cardiac septum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.definition: An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.label: Complete atrioventricular canal defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.definition: A congenital heart defect characterized by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.label: obsolete Rhythm disturbances associated with pheochromocytoma
Coronary artery atherosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.definition: Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries, which increases the risk of myocardial ischemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.label: Atrioventricular block
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000167.definition: Delayed or lack of conduction of atrial depolarizations through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.label: Coarctation of aorta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.definition: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.label: Angina pectoris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.definition: Paroxysmal chest pain that occurs with exertion or stress and is related to myocardial ischemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.label: Subvalvular aortic stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.definition: A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the left-ventricular outflow tract related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.label: Ectopia cordis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.definition: Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and through the defect in the ventral wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.label: Secundum atrial septal defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.definition: A kind of atrial septum defect arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.label: Myocardial fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.definition: Myocardial fibrosis is characterized by dysregulated collagen turnover (increased synthesis predominates over unchanged or decreased degradation) and excessive diffuse collagen accumulation in the interstitial and perivascular spaces as well as by phenotypically transformed fibroblasts, termed myofibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.label: Sinus bradycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000168.definition: Bradycardia related to a mean resting sinus rate of less than 50 beats per minute.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.label: Muscular subvalvular aortic stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.definition: A type of subvalvular aortic stenosis resulting from thickening of the musculature of the interventricular septum, which results in obstruction to blood flow through the left-ventricular outflow tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.label: Atrial arrhythmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.definition: A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.label: Cardiac shunt
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.definition: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.label: Right-to-left shunt
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.definition: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the right side of the heart to the left.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.label: Cardiac arrest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.definition: An abrupt loss of heart function.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.label: Situs inversus totalis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.definition: A left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.label: Abnormal pericardium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.definition: An abnormality of the pericardium, i.e., of the fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.label: Pericardial effusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000169.definition: Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.label: Myocardial necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.definition: Irreversible damage to heart tissue (myocardium) due to lack of oxygen after a heart attack (myocardial infarction).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.label: Pericarditis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.definition: Inflammation of the sac-like covering around the heart (pericardium).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.label: Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.definition: Any structural anomaly of the tricuspid valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.label: Tricuspid valve prolapse
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.definition: One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.label: Right ventricular outlet tract obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.definition: An obstruction to the forward flow of blood in the outflow tract of the right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.label: Endocardial fibroelastosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.definition: Diffuse thickening of the ventricular endocardium and by associated myocardial dysfunction

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.label: Abnormal right ventricle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.definition: An abnormality of the right ventricle of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.label: Right ventricular failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.definition: Reduced ability of the right ventricle to perform its function (to receive blood from the right atrium and to eject blood into the pulmonary artery), often leading to pitting peripheral edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.label: Third degree atrioventricular block
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000170.definition: Third-degree atrioventricular (AV) block (also referred to as complete heart block) is the complete dissociation of the atria and the ventricles. Third-degree AV block exists when more P waves than QRS complexes exist and no relationship (no conduction) exists between them.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.label: Conotruncal defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.definition: A congenital malformation of the outflow tract of the heart. Conotruncal defects are thought to result from a disturbance of the outflow tract of the embryonic heart, and comprise truncus arteriosus, tetralogy of Fallot, interrupted aortic arch, transposition of the great arteries, and double outlet right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.label: Abnormal left ventricle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.definition: Any structural abnormality of the left ventricle of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.label: Left ventricular hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.definition: Enlargement or increased size of the heart left ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.label: Abnormal cardiac ventricle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.definition: An abnormality of a cardiac ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.label: Ventricular hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.definition: Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.label: Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.definition: A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.label: Coronary artery calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a coronary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.label: Mitral stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the orifice of the mitral valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.label: Double outlet right ventricle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000171.definition: Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000172.label: High-output congestive heart failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000172.definition: A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000172.label: Restrictive cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000172.definition: Restrictive left ventricular physiology is characterized by a pattern of ventricular filling in which increased stiffness of the myocardium causes ventricular pressure to rise precipitously with only small increases in volume, defined as restrictive ventricular physiology in the presence of normal or reduced diastolic volumes (of one or both ventricles), normal or reduced systolic volumes, and normal ventricular wall thickness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000172.label: obsolete Increased prevalence of valvular disease
Thromboembolic stroke
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000172.definition: A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.label: Progressive hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.definition: A progressive form of hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.label: Pancreatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.definition: The presence of inflammation in the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.label: Annular pancreas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.definition: A congenital anomaly in which the pancreas completely (or sometimes incompletely) encircles the second portion of duodenum and occasionally obstructs the more proximal duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.label: Pancreatic cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.definition: A cyst of the pancreas that possess a lining of mucous epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.label: Exocrine pancreatic insufficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.definition: Impaired function of the exocrine pancreas associated with a reduced ability to digest foods because of lack of digestive enzymes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.label: Abnormal nasopharynx morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000173.definition: A structural anomaly of the nasopharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.label: Phimosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.definition: The male foreskin cannot be fully retracted from the head of the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.label: Nasal congestion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.definition: Reduced ability to pass air through the nasal cavity often leading to mouth breathing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.label: Splenomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.definition: Abnormal increased size of the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.label: Accessory spleen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.definition: An accessory spleen is a round, iso-echogenic, homogenic and smooth structure and is seen as a normal variant mostly on the medial contour of the spleen, near the hilus or around the lower pole. This has no pathogenic relevance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.label: Polysplenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000174.definition: Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000175.label: Single ventricle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000175.definition: The presence of only one working lower chamber in the heart, usually with a virtual absence of the ventricular septum and usually present in conjunction with double inlet left or right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000175.label: Abnormal vestibular function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000175.definition: An abnormality of the functioning of the vestibular apparatus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000175.label: Vestibular hypofunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000175.definition: A general descriptive term that describes impaired functioning of the vestibular apparatus that leads to manifestations such as dizziness or postural imbalance

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000175.label: High-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000175.definition: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment that affects primarily the higher frequencies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.label: Abnormal foot morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.definition: An abnormality of the skeleton of foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.label: Pes cavus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.definition: An increase in height of the medial longitudinal arch of the foot that does not flatten on weight bearing (i.e., a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.label: Talipes equinovarus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.definition: Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.label: Pes planus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.definition: A foot where the longitudinal arch of the foot is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.label: Hammertoe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.definition: Hyperextension of the metatarsal-phalangeal joint with hyperflexion of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.label: Broad foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000176.definition: A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000177.label: Toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000177.definition: Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000177.label: Achilles tendon contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000177.definition: A contracture of the Achilles tendon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000177.label: Talipes equinovalgus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000177.definition: A deformity of foot and ankle in which the foot is bent down and outwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000177.label: Short foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000177.definition: A measured foot length that is more than 2 SD below the mean for a newborn of 27 - 41 weeks gestation, or foot that is less than the 3rd centile for individuals from birth to 16 years of age (objective). Alternatively, a foot that appears disproportionately short (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.label: Bulbous tips of toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.definition: An abnormality of the morphology of the toes, such that the tips of the toes are prominent and bulbous.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.label: Broad metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.definition: Increased side-to-side width of a metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.label: Narrow foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.definition: A foot for which the measured width is below the 5th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately narrow for its length.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.label: Abnormal delivery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.definition: An abnormality of the birth process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.label: Premature rupture of membranes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.definition: Premature rupture of membranes (PROM) is a condition which occurs in pregnancy when the amniotic sac ruptures more than an hour before the onset of labor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.label: Hydrops fetalis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000178.definition: The abnormal accumulation of fluid in two or more fetal compartments, including ascites, pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, and skin edema.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000179.label: Nonimmune hydrops fetalis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000179.definition: A type of hydrops fetalis in which there is no identifiable circulating antibody to red blood cell antigens .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000179.label: Fetal ascites
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000179.definition: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity during the fetal period.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000179.label: Small nail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000179.definition: A nail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped nail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000179.label: Hyperconvex nail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000179.definition: When viewed on end (with the digit tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the nail forms a tighter curve of convexity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.label: Nail pits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.definition: Small (typically about 1 mm or less in size) depressions on the dorsal nail surface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.label: Onychogryposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.definition: Nail that appears thick when viewed on end.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.label: Onycholysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.definition: Detachment of the nail from the nail bed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.label: Ridged nail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.definition: Longitudinal, linear prominences in the nail plate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.label: Split nail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000180.definition: A nail plate that has a longitudinal separation and the two sections of the nail share the same lateral radius of curvature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000181.label: Dystrophic toenail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000181.definition: Toenail changes apart from changes of the color of the toenail (nail dyschromia) that involve partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000181.label: Hyperconvex fingernails
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000181.definition: When viewed on end (with the finger tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the fingernail forms a tighter curve of convexity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000181.label: Thin nail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000181.definition: Nail that appears thin when viewed on end.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000181.label: Paronychia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000181.definition: The nail disease paronychia is an often-tender bacterial or fungal hand infection or foot infection where the nail and skin meet at the side or the base of a finger or toenail. The infection can start suddenly (acute paronychia) or gradually (chronic paronychia).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000182.label: Hallux valgus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000182.definition: Lateral deviation of the great toe (i.e., in the direction of the little toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000182.label: Genital tract atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000182.definition: Congenital occlusion of a tube in the genital tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000182.label: Foot polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000182.definition: A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary toe or toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.label: Postaxial foot polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.definition: Polydactyly of the foot most commonly refers to the presence of six toes on one foot. Postaxial polydactyly affects the lateral ray and the duplication may range from a well-formed articulated digit to a rudimentary digit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.label: Short toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.definition: A toe that appears disproportionately short compared to the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.label: Abnormal metatarsal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.definition: Abnormalities of the metatarsal bones (i.e. of five tubular bones located between the tarsal bones of the hind- and mid-foot and the phalanges of the toes).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.label: Long foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.definition: Increased back to front length of the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.label: Camptodactyly of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.definition: Camptodactyly is a painless flexion contracture of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint that is usually gradually progressive. This term refers to camptodactyly of one or more toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.label: Broad toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.definition: Visible increase in width of the non-hallux digit without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.label: Rocker bottom foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.definition: The presence of both a prominent heel and a convex contour of the sole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.label: Split foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000183.definition: A condition in which middle parts of the foot (toes and metatarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe over absent 2nd or 3rd toes as far as oligo- or monodactyl feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.label: Metatarsus adductus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.definition: The metatarsals are deviated medially (tibially), that is, the bones in the front half of the foot bend or turn in toward the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.label: Preaxial foot polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.definition: Duplication of all or part of the first ray.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.label: Abnormal hallux morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.definition: This term applies for all abnormalities of the big toe, also called hallux.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.label: Overlapping toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.definition: Describes a foot digit resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the foot is at rest. Initially clawing may be dynamic and only noticeable on walking. Over time the plantar plate tears, subluxation occurs at the metatarsophalangeal joint (MTPJ), and the deformity becomes permanent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.label: Long hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.definition: Increased length of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.label: Calcaneovalgus deformity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.definition: This is a postural deformity in which the foot is positioned up against the tibia. The heel (calcaneus) is positioned downward (that is, the ankle is flexed upward), and the heel is turned outward (valgus).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.label: Foot oligodactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000184.definition: A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000185.label: Abnormality of the tarsal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000185.definition: An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000185.label: Sandal gap
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000185.definition: A widely spaced gap between the first toe (the great toe) and the second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000185.label: Podagra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000185.definition: Gout affecting the Metatarsophalangeal joint of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000185.label: Short distal phalanx of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000185.definition: Short distance from the end of the toe to the most distal interphalangeal crease or distal interphalangeal joint flexion point, i.e., abnormally short distal phalanx of toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000186.label: obsolete Acral ulceration and osteomyelitis leading to autoamputation of the digits (feet)
Toe clinodactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000186.definition: Bending or curvature of a toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000186.label: Clinodactyly of the 5th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000186.definition: Bending or curvature of a fifth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000186.label: Autoamputation of foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000186.definition: The spontaneous detachment of a foot from the body due to long standing pathology.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000186.label: Deep plantar creases
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000186.definition: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.label: Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.definition: An abnormality of the hematopoietic system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.label: Thrombocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.definition: A reduction in the number of circulating thrombocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.label: Neutropenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.definition: An abnormally low number of neutrophils in the peripheral blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.label: Pancytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.definition: An abnormal reduction in numbers of all blood cell types (red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.label: Abnormal erythrocyte morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.definition: Any structural abnormality of erythrocytes (red-blood cells).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.label: Hemolytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.definition: A type of anemia caused by premature destruction of red blood cells (hemolysis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.label: Abnormal eosinophil morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000187.definition: An abnormal count or structure of eosinophils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.label: Eosinophilia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.definition: Increased count of eosinophils in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.label: Leukopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.definition: An abnormal decreased number of leukocytes in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.label: Talipes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.definition: A deformity of foot and ankle that has different subtypes that are talipes equinovarus, talipes equinovalgus, talipes calcaneovarus and talipes calcaneovalgus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.label: Talipes calcaneovalgus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.definition: Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an "up and out" appearance, with the dorsal forefoot practically touching the anterior aspect of the ankle and lower leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.label: Foot osteomyelitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.definition: An infection of bone of the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.label: Lymphopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.definition: A reduced number of lymphocytes in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.label: Megaloblastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000188.definition: Anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal (megaloblasts).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.label: Autoimmune hemolytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.definition: An autoimmune form of hemolytic anemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.label: Abnormal bleeding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.definition: An abnormal susceptibility to bleeding, often referred to as a bleeding diathesis. A bleeding diathesis may be related to vascular, platelet and coagulation defects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.label: Thrombocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.definition: Increased numbers of platelets in the peripheral blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.label: Reticulocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.definition: A reduced number of reticulocytes in the peripheral blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.label: Normocytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.definition: A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.label: Increased red blood cell mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.definition: The presence of an increased mass of red blood cells in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.label: Increased hematocrit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000189.definition: An elevation above the normal ratio of the volume of red blood cells to the total volume of blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.label: Polycythemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.definition: Polycythemia is diagnosed if the red blood cell count, the hemoglobin level, and the red blood cell volume all exceed the upper limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.label: Giant platelets
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.definition: Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. The term giant platelet is used when the platelet is larger than the size of the average red cell in the field. (Description adapted from College of American Pathologists, Hematology Manual, 1998).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.label: Anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.definition: A reduction in erythrocytes volume or hemoglobin concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.label: Neutropenia in presence of anti-neutropil antibodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.definition: A type of neutropenia that is observed in the presence of granulocyte-specific antibodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.label: Thromboembolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.definition: The formation of a blood clot inside a blood vessel that subsequently travels through the blood stream from the site where it formed to another location in the body, generally leading to vascular occlusion at the distant site.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.label: Hypoplastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.definition: Anemia with varying degrees of erythrocytic hypoplasia without leukopenia or thrombocytopenia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.label: Leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000190.definition: A cancer of the blood and bone marrow characterized by an abnormal proliferation of leukocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.label: Abnormal granulocyte morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.definition: Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of granulocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.label: Abnormal basophil morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.definition: Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of basophils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.label: Granulocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.definition: An abnormally reduced number of granulocytes in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.label: Aplastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.definition: Aplastic anemia is defined as pancytopenia with a hypocellular marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.label: Renal amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.definition: A form of amyloidosis that affects the kidney. On hematoxylin and eosin stain, amyloid is identified as extracellular amorphous material that is lightly eosinophilic. These deposits often stain weakly for periodic acid Schiff (PAS), demonstrate a blue-to-gray hue on the trichrome stain and are typically negative on the Jones methenamine silver (JMS) stain. These tinctorial properties contrast with the histologic appearance of collagen, a major component of basement membranes, mesangial matrix and areas of sclerosis, which demonstrates strong positivity for PAS and JMS (See Figure 1 of PMID:25852856).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.label: Acute kidney injury
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000191.definition: Sudden loss of renal function, as manifested by decreased urine production, and a rise in serum creatinine or blood urea nitrogen concentration (azotemia).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.label: Renal artery stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.definition: The presence of stenosis of the renal artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.label: Vacuolated lymphocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.definition: The presence of clear, sharply defined vacuoles in the lymphocyte cytoplasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.label: Reticulocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.definition: An elevation in the number of reticulocytes (immature erythrocytes) in the peripheral blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.label: Sideroblastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.definition: Sideroblastic anemia results from a defect in the incorporation of iron into the heme molecule. A sideroblast is an erythroblast that has stainable deposits of iron in cytoplasm (this can be demonstrated by Prussian blue staining).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.label: Acanthocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.definition: Acanthocytosis is a type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence of spikes on the cell surface. The cells have an irregular shape resembling many-pointed stars.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.label: Abnormality of coagulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.definition: An abnormality of the process of blood coagulation. That is, altered ability or inability of the blood to clot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.label: Reduced factor XI activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000192.definition: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XI. Factor XI, also known as plasma thromboplastin antecedent, is a serine proteinase that activates factor IX.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000193.label: Hypochromic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000193.definition: A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000193.label: Subcutaneous hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000193.definition: This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising (purpura, petechiae, or ecchymoses).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000193.label: Microcytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000193.definition: A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is reduced.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.label: Acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.definition: Abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.label: Metabolic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.definition: Metabolic acidosis (MA) is characterized by a fall in blood pH due to a reduction of serum bicarbonate concentration. This can occur as a result of either the accumulation of acids (high anion gap MA) or the loss of bicarbonate from the gastrointestinal tract or the kidney (hyperchloremic MA). By definition, MA is not due to a respirary cause.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.label: Hypoglycemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.definition: A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.label: Fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.definition: Body temperature elevated above the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.label: Ketosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.definition: Presence of elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.label: Renal tubular acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.definition: Acidosis owing to malfunction of the kidney tubules with accumulation of metabolic acids and hyperchloremia, potentially leading to complications including hypokalemia, hypercalcinuria, nephrolithiasis and nephrocalcinosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.label: Alkalosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000194.definition: Depletion of acid or accumulation base in the body fluids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.label: Respiratory alkalosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.definition: Alkalosis due to excess loss of carbon dioxide from the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.label: Glucose intolerance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.definition: Glucose intolerance (GI) can be defined as dysglycemia that comprises both prediabetes and diabetes. It includes the conditions of impaired fasting glucose (IFG) and impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) and diabetes mellitus (DM).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.label: Diabetic ketoacidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.definition: A type of diabetic metabolic abnormality with an accumulation of ketone bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.label: Recurrent fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.definition: Periodic (episodic or recurrent) bouts of fever.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.label: Unexplained fevers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.definition: Episodes of fever for which no infectious cause can be identified.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.label: Truncal obesity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.definition: Obesity located preferentially in the trunk of the body as opposed to the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.label: Polydipsia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000195.definition: Excessive thirst manifested by excessive fluid intake.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.label: Palpitations
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.definition: A sensation that the heart is pounding or racing, which is a non-specific sign but may be a manifestation of arrhythmia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.label: Abnormal speech discrimination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.definition: A type of hearing impairment prominently characterized by a difficulty in understanding speech, rather than an inability to hear speech. Poor speech discrimination is a very common symptom of high frequency hearing loss.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of metatarsal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the metatarsal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.label: Abnormal scalp morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.definition: Any anomaly of the scalp, the skin an subcutaneous tissue of the head on which head hair grows.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.label: Abnormal glomerular mesangium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.definition: An abnormality of the mesangium, i.e., of the central part of the renal glomerulus between capillaries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.label: Diffuse mesangial sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.definition: Diffuse sclerosis of the mesangium, as manifestated by diffuse mesangial matrix expansion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.label: Abnormal tubulointerstitial morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000196.definition: An abnormality that involves the tubules and interstitial tissue of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.label: Tubulointerstitial nephritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.definition: A form of inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.label: Hypersplenism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.definition: A malfunctioning of the spleen in which it prematurely destroys red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.label: Macrocytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.definition: A type of anemia characterized by increased size of erythrocytes with increased mean corpuscular volume (MCV) and increased mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.label: Autoimmune thrombocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.definition: The presence of thrombocytopenia in combination with detection of antiplatelet antibodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.label: Leukocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.definition: An abnormal increase in the number of leukocytes in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.label: Decreased platelet glycoprotein IIb-IIIa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein IIb-IIIa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.label: Reduced antithrombin III activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.definition: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of antithrombin-III.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.label: Abnormal thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.definition: Venous or arterial thrombosis (formation of blood clots) of spontaneous nature and which cannot be fully explained by acquired risk (e.g. atherosclerosis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.label: Extramedullary hematopoiesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000197.definition: The process of hematopoiesis occurring outside of the bone marrow (in the liver, thymus, and spleen) in the postnatal organisms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.label: Megaloblastic bone marrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.definition: Abnormal increased number of megaloblasts in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.label: Schistocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.definition: The presence of an abnormal number of fragmented red blood cells (schistocytes) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.label: Sea-blue histiocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.definition: An abnormality of histiocytes, in which the cells take on a sea blue appearance due to abnormally increased lipid content. Histiocytes are a type of macrophage. Sea-blue histiocytes are typically large macrophages from 20 to 60 micrometers in diameter with a single eccentric nucleus whose cytoplasm if packed with sea-blue or blue-green granules when stained with Wright-Giemsa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.label: Reduced lymphocyte surface expression of CD43
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.definition: A reduction in the expression of CD43 on the cell surface of lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.label: Hypoketotic hypoglycemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.definition: A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood associated with a reduced concentration of ketone bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.label: Hyperammonemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.definition: An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.label: Recurrent hypoglycemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.definition: Recurrent episodes of decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.label: Fetal akinesia sequence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000198.definition: Decreased fetal activity associated with multiple joint contractures, facial anomalies and pulmonary hypoplasia. Ultrasound examination may reveal polyhydramnios, ankylosis, scalp edema, and decreased chest movements (reflecting pulmonary hypoplasia).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.label: Organic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.definition: Excretion of non-amino organic acids in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.label: Ketoacidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.definition: Acidosis resulting from accumulation of ketone bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.label: Renal Fanconi syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.definition: An inability of the tubules in the kidney to reabsorb small molecules, causing increased urinary loss of electrolytes (sodium, potassium, bicarbonate), minerals, glucose, amino acids, and water.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.label: Hyperchloremic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.definition: Acidosis (pH less than 7.35) that develops with an increase in ionic chloride.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.label: Gout
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.definition: Recurrent attacks of acute inflammatory arthritis of a joint or set of joints caused by elevated levels of uric acid in the blood which crystallize and are deposited in joints, tendons, and surrounding tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.label: Abnormal facial shape
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000199.definition: An abnormal morphology (form) of the face or its components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.label: Short columella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.definition: Reduced distance from the anterior border of the naris to the subnasale.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.label: Deep philtrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.definition: Accentuated, prominent philtral ridges giving rise to an exaggerated groove in the midline between the nasal base and upper vermillion border.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.label: Facial cleft
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.definition: A congenital malformation with a cleft (gap or opening) in the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.label: Frontal bossing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.definition: Bilateral bulging of the lateral frontal bone prominences with relative sparing of the midline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.label: Potter facies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000200.definition: A facial appearance characteristic of a fetus or neonate due to oligohydramnios experienced in the womb, comprising ocular hypertelorism, low-set ears, receding chin, and flattening of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.label: Morphological central nervous system abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.definition: A structural abnormality of the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.label: Abnormality of the abdominal organs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.definition: An abnormality of the viscera of the abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.label: Vomiting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.definition: Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth by means of a series of involuntary spasmic contractions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.label: Diarrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.definition: Abnormally increased frequency (usually defined as three or more) loose or watery bowel movements a day.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.label: Nausea and vomiting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.definition: Nausea is a commonly encountered symptom that has been defined as an unpleasant painless subjective feeling that one will imminently vomit. Vomiting has been defined as the forceful expulsion of the contents of the stomach, duodenum, or jejunum through the oral cavity. While nausea and vomiting are often thought to exist on a temporal continuum, this is not always the case. There are situations when severe nausea may be present without emesis and less frequently, when emesis may be present without preceding nausea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.label: Nausea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.definition: A sensation of unease in the stomach together with an urge to vomit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.label: Constipation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000201.definition: Infrequent or difficult evacuation of feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.label: Gastroesophageal reflux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.definition: A condition in which the stomach contents leak backwards from the stomach into the esophagus through the lower esophageal sphincter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.label: Pyloric stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.definition: Pyloric stenosis, also known as infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis, is an uncommon condition in infants characterized by abnormal thickening of the pylorus muscles in the stomach leading to gastric outlet obstruction. Clinically infants are well at birth. Then, at 3 to 6 weeks of age, the infants present with projectile vomiting, potentially leading to dehydration and weight loss.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.label: Anal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.definition: Congenital absence of the anus, i.e., the opening at the bottom end of the intestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.label: Malabsorption
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.definition: Impaired ability to absorb one or more nutrients from the intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.label: Anal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.definition: Abnormal narrowing of the anal opening.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.label: Abdominal pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.label: Chronic diarrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000202.definition: The presence of chronic diarrhea, which is usually taken to mean diarrhea that has persisted for over 4 weeks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.label: Abnormal esophagus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.definition: A structural abnormality of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.label: Esophageal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.definition: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the esophagus such that the esophagus ends in a blind pouch rather than connecting to the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.label: Poor suck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.definition: An inadequate sucking reflex, resulting in the difficult of newborns to be breast-fed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.label: Abnormal rectum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.definition: An abnormaltiy of the rectum, the final segment of the large intestine that stores solid waste until it passes through the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.label: Rectal prolapse
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.definition: Protrusion of the rectal mucous membrane through the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.label: Hiatus hernia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.definition: The presence of a hernia in which the upper part of the stomach, i.e., mainly the gastric cardia protrudes through the diaphragmatic esophageal hiatus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.label: Inflammation of the large intestine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.definition: Inflammation, or an inflammatory state in the large intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.label: Anorexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000203.definition: Anorexia, or the loss of appetite for food, is a medical condition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.label: Esophageal varix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.definition: Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the lower portion of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.label: Esophageal stricture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.definition: A pathological narrowing of the esophagus that is caused by the development of a ring of scar tissue that constricts the esophageal lumen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.label: Zollinger-Ellison syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.definition: A condition in which there is increased production of gastrin by a gastrin-secreting tumor (usually located in the pancreas, duodenum, or abdominal lymph nodes) that stimulates the gastric mucosa to maximal activity, with consequent gastrointestinal mucosal ulceration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.label: Hypothermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.definition: Reduced body temperature due to failed thermoregulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.label: Heat intolerance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.definition: The inability to maintain a comfortable body temperature in warm or hot weather.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.label: Malignant hyperthermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.definition: Malignant hyperthermia is characterized by a rapid increase in temperature to 39-42 degrees C. Malignant hyperthermia may occur in response to either inhalational anesthetics such as halothane, to muscle relaxants such as succinylcholine, or to exercise.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.label: Renal cortical atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.definition: Atrophy of the cortex of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.label: Proximal renal tubular acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000204.definition: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of the proximal tubular cells to reabsorb bicarbonate, leading to urinary bicarbonate wasting and subsequent acidemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000205.label: Curved linear dimple below the lower lip
Myopathic facies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000205.definition: A facial appearance characteristic of myopathic conditions. The face appears expressionless with sunken cheeks, bilateral ptosis, and inability to elevate the corners of the mouth, due to muscle weakness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000205.label: Cerebral atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000205.definition: Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the cerebrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.label: Abnormal cerebral morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.definition: Any structural abnormality of the telencephalon, which is also known as the cerebrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.label: Lower limb spasticity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.definition: Spasticity (velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone and hyperexcitable tendon reflexes) in the muscles of the lower limbs, hips, and pelvis

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.label: Abnormal pyramidal tract morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.definition: Any structural abnormality of the pyramidal tract, whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.label: Rigidity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.definition: Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.label: Spastic gait
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.definition: Spasticity is manifested by increased stretch reflex which is intensified with movement velocity. This results in excessive and inappropriate muscle activation which can contribute to muscle hypertonia. Spastic gait is characterized by manifestations such as muscle hypertonia, stiff knee, and circumduction of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.label: Gait ataxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.definition: A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to coordinate the movements required for normal walking. Gait ataxia is characteirzed by a wide-based staggering gait with a tendency to fall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.label: Bradykinesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.definition: Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.label: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000206.definition: A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure is a seizure defined by a tonic (bilateral increased tone, lasting seconds to minutes) and then a clonic (bilateral sustained rhythmic jerking) phase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.label: Limb ataxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.definition: A kind of ataxia that affects movements of the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.label: Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.definition: A neurological condition related to lesions of the basal ganglia leading to typical abnormalities including akinesia (inability to initiate changes in activity and perform volitional movements rapidly and easily), muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement), chorea (widespread arrhythmic movements of a forcible, rapid, jerky, and restless nature), athetosis (inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, or other group of muscles in a fixed position), and akathisia (inability to remain motionless).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.label: Chorea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.definition: Chorea (Greek for 'dance') refers to widespread arrhythmic involuntary movements of a forcible, jerky and restless fashion. It is a random-appearing sequence of one or more discrete involuntary movements or movement fragments. Movements appear random because of variability in timing, duration or location. Each movement may have a distinct start and end. However, movements may be strung together and thus may appear to flow randomly from one muscle group to another. Chorea can involve the trunk, neck, face, tongue, and extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.label: Increased neuronal autofluorescent lipopigment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.definition: Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the neuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.label: Dysdiadochokinesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.definition: A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to perform rapidly alternating movements, such as pronating and supinating his or her hand on the dorsum of the other hand as rapidly as possible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.label: Migraine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.definition: Migraine is a chronic neurological disorder characterized by episodic attacks of headache and associated symptoms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.label: Migraine with aura
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.definition: A type of migraine in which there is an aura characterized by focal neurological phenomena that usually proceed, but may accompany or occur in the absence of, the headache. The symptoms of an aura may include fully reversible visual, sensory, and speech symptoms but not motor weakness. Visual symptoms may include flickering lights, spots and lines and/or loss of vision and/or unilateral sensory symptoms such as paresthesias or numbness. At least one of the symptoms of an aura develops gradually over 5 or more minutes and/or different symptoms occur in succession.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.label: Truncal ataxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000207.definition: Truncal ataxia is a sign of ataxia characterized by instability of the trunk. It usually occurs during sitting.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000208.label: Intention tremor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000208.definition: A type of kinetic tremor that occurs during target directed movement is called intention tremor. That is, an oscillatory cerebellar ataxia that tends to be absent when the limbs are inactive and during the first part of voluntary movement but worsening as the movement continues and greater precision is required (e.g., in touching a target such as the patient's nose or a physician's finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000208.label: Migraine without aura
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000208.definition: Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000208.label: Encephalocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000208.definition: A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000208.label: Occipital encephalocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000208.definition: A type of encephalocele (that is, a a protrusion of part of the cranial contents including brain tissue through a congenital opening in the cranium, typically covered with skin or mucous membrane) in the occipital region of the skull. Occipital encephalocele presents as a midline swelling over the occipital bone. It is usually covered with normal full-thickness scalp.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000208.label: Abnormality of the respiratory system
