Obstruction of hepatic venous outflow is mainly caused by primary intravascular thrombosis, which can occur suddenly or be repeated over time, accompanied by some revascularization, accounting for the variable parenchymal hepatic damage and histologic presentation. Budd-Chiari syndrome is thus a disease, but since it occurs as a manifestation of several other diseases, this term is kept for the present for convenience.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000264.label: Hypertension associated with pheochromocytoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000264.definition: A type of hypertension associated with pheochromocytoma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000264.label: Arteriovenous fistulas of celiac and mesenteric vessels
Abnormal pelvic girdle bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000264.definition: An abnormality of the bony pelvic girdle, which is a ring of bones connecting the vertebral column to the femurs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000264.label: Wormian bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000264.definition: The presence of extra bones within a cranial suture. Wormian bones are irregular isolated bones which appear in addition to the usual centers of ossification of the cranium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000264.label: Aortic dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000264.definition: Aortic dissection refers to a tear in the intimal layer of the aorta causing a separation between the intima and the medial layers of the aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.label: Scoliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.definition: The presence of an abnormal lateral curvature of the spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.label: Skeletal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.definition: A general term describing features characterized by abnormal development of bones and connective tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.label: Bone pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.label: Spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.definition: A disorder of bone growth affecting the vertebrae and the ends of the long bones (epiphyses).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.label: Increased susceptibility to fractures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000265.definition: An abnormally increased tendency to fractures of bones caused by an abnormal reduction in bone strength that is generally associated with an increased risk of fracture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.label: Painless fractures due to injury
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.definition: An increased tendency to fractures following trauma, with fractures occurring without pain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.label: Neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.definition: An organ or organ-system abnormality that consists of uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation which can occur in any part of the body as a benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.label: Lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.definition: A cancer originating in lymphocytes and presenting as a solid tumor of lymhpoid cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.label: Pheochromocytoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.definition: Pheochromocytomas (also known as chromaffin tumors) produce, store, and secrete catecholamines. Pheochromocytomas usually originate from the adrenal medulla but may also develop from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia. A common symptom of pheochromocytoma is hypertension owing to release of catecholamines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.label: Nephroblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.definition: The presence of a nephroblastoma, which is a neoplasm of the kidney that primarily affects children.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.label: Paraganglioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.definition: A carotid body tumor (also called paraganglionoma or chemodectoma) is a tumor found in the upper neck at the branching of the carotid artery. They arise from the chemoreceptor organ (paraganglion) located in the adventitia of the carotid artery bifurcation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.label: Osteosarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000266.definition: A malignant bone tumor that usually develops during adolescence and usually affects the long bones including the tibia, femur, and humerus. The typical symptoms of osteosarcoma comprise bone pain, fracture, limitation of motion, and tenderness or swelling at the site of the tumor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.label: Basal cell carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.definition: The presence of a basal cell carcinoma of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.label: Coxa valga
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.definition: Coxa valga is a deformity of the hip in which the angle between the femoral shaft and the femoral neck is increased compared to age-adjusted values (about 150 degrees in newborns gradually reducing to 120-130 degrees in adults).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.label: Cloverleaf skull
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.definition: Trilobar skull configuration when viewed from the front or behind.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.label: Small foramen magnum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the foramen magnum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.label: Abnormal sella turcica morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000267.definition: Abnormality of the sella turcica, a saddle-shaped depression in the sphenoid bone at the base of the human skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.label: J-shaped sella turcica
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.definition: A deformity of the sella turcica whereby the sella extends further anterior than normal such that the anterior clinoid process appears to overhang it, giving the appearance of the letter J on imaging of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.label: Abnormal calvaria morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.definition: Abnormality of the morphology (structure) of the calvaria (skullcap), that is, of that part of the skull that is made up of the superior portions of the frontal bone, occipital bone, and parietal bones and covers the cranial cavity that contains the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.label: Thickened calvaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.definition: The presence of an abnormally thick calvaria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.label: Pregnancy history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.definition: Medical history of maternal diseases, exposures, or other relevant findings during the pregnancy of which the index person was the product.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.label: Abnormality of frontal sinus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000268.definition: An abnormality of the frontal sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The frontal sinus is located within the frontal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.label: Large sella turcica
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.definition: An abnormal enlargement of the sella turcica.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.label: Platybasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.definition: A developmental malformation of the occipital bone and upper end of the cervical spine, in which the latter appears to have pushed the floor of the occipital bone upward such that there is an abnormal flattening of the skull base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.label: Abnormal skull base morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.definition: An abnormality of the base of the skull, which forms the floor of the cranial cavity and separates the brain from other facial structures. The skull base is made up of five bones: the ethmoid, sphenoid, occipital, paired frontal, and paired parietal bones, and is subdivided into 3 regions: the anterior, middle, and posterior cranial fossae. The petro-occipital fissure subdivides the middle cranial fossa into 1 central component and 2 lateral components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.label: Sclerosis of skull base
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.definition: Increased bone density of the skull base without significant changes in bony contour.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.label: obsolete Symmetrical, oval parietal bone defects
Abnormal parietal bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.definition: Any abnormality of the parietal bone of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.label: Parietal foramina
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.definition: The presence of symmetrical and circular openings (foramina) in the parietal bone ranging in size from a few millimeters to several centimeters wide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.label: Abnormal foramen magnum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000269.definition: Any abnormality of the foramen magnum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.label: Large foramen magnum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.definition: An abnormal increase in the size of the foramen magnum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.label: Abnormality of skull ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.definition: An abnormality of the process of ossification of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.label: High, narrow palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.definition: The presence of a high and narrow palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.label: Palate telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.definition: The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.label: Prominent median palatal raphe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000270.definition: Unusual prominence of the median palatal raphe, which is the ridge formed by the fusion of the two plates of the skull that form the hard palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.label: Commissural lip pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.definition: A depression located at an oral commissure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.label: Exaggerated median tongue furrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.definition: Increased depth of the median tongue furrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.label: Downturned corners of mouth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.definition: A morphological abnormality of the mouth in which the angle of the mouth is downturned. The oral commissures are positioned inferior to the midline labial fissure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.label: Abnormality of the immune system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.definition: An abnormality of the immune system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.label: Recurrent bacterial infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000271.definition: Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of bacterial infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.label: Immunodeficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.definition: Failure of the immune system to protect the body adequately from infection, due to the absence or insufficiency of some component process or substance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.label: Recurrent abscess formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.definition: An increased susceptibility to abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent abscesses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.label: Absence of bactericidal oxidative respiratory burst in phagocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.definition: An absence of the phase of elevated metabolic activity, during which oxygen consumption increases, that occurs in neutrophils, monocytes, and macrophages shortly after phagocytosing material. An enhanced uptake of oxygen leads to the production, by an NADH dependent system, of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2), superoxide anions and hydroxyl radicals, which play a part in microbiocidal activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.label: Recurrent Aspergillus infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.definition: An increased susceptibility to Aspergillus infections, as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of Aspergillus infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.label: Systemic lupus erythematosus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.definition: A chronic, relapsing, inflammatory, and often febrile multisystemic disorder of connective tissue, characterized principally by involvement of the skin, joints, kidneys, and serosal membranes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.label: Recurrent Staphylococcus aureus infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.definition: Increased susceptibility to Staphylococcus aureus infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Staphylococcus aureus infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.label: Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.definition: Recurrent or persistent superficial Candida infections of the skin, mucous membranes, and nails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.label: Follicular hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000272.definition: Lymphadenopathy (enlargement of lymph nodes) owing to hyperplasia of follicular (germinal) centers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000273.label: Chronic noninfectious lymphadenopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000273.definition: A chronic form of lymphadenopathy that is not related to infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000273.label: Decreased lymphocyte apoptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000273.definition: A reduction in the rate of apoptosis in lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.label: Recurrent E. coli infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.definition: Increased susceptibility to infections with Escherichia coli, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection with this agent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.label: Recurrent Serratia marcescens infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.definition: Increased susceptibility to Serratia marcescens infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Serratia marcescens infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.label: Recurrent Klebsiella infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.definition: Increased susceptibility to Klebsiella infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Klebsiella infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.label: Recurrent enteroviral infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.definition: Increased susceptibility to enteroviral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of enteroviral infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.label: Bilateral cleft lip and palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.definition: Cleft lip and cleft palate affecting both sides of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.label: Oral leukoplakia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.definition: A thickened white patch on the oral mucosa that cannot be rubbed off.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.label: Respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness
Rickets
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.definition: Rickets is divided into two major categories including calcipenic and phosphopenic. Hypophosphatemia is described as a common manifestation of both categories. Hypophosphatemic rickets is the most common type of rickets that is characterized by low levels of serum phosphate, resistance to ultraviolet radiation or vitamin D intake. There are several issues involved in hypophosphatemic rickets such as calcium, vitamin D, phosphorus deficiencies. Moreover, other disorder can be associated with its occurrence such as absorption defects due to pancreatic, intestinal, gastric, and renal disorders and hepatobiliary disease. Symptoms are usually seen in childhood and can be varied in severity. Severe forms may be linked to bowing of the legs, poor bone growth, and short stature as well as joint and bone pain. Hypophosphatemic rickets are associated with renal excretion of phosphate, hypophosphatemia, and mineral defects in bones. The familial type of the disease is the most common type of rickets.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.label: Osteomalacia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000274.definition: Osteomalacia is a general term for bone weakness owing to a defect in mineralization of the protein framework known as osteoid. This defective mineralization is mainly caused by lack in vitamin D. Osteomalacia in children is known as rickets.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.label: Delayed skeletal maturation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.definition: A decreased rate of skeletal maturation. Delayed skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.label: Kyphoscoliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.definition: An abnormal curvature of the spine in both a coronal (lateral) and sagittal (back-to-front) plane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.label: Thin bony cortex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.definition: Abnormal thinning of the cortical region of bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.label: Osteomyelitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.definition: Osteomyelitis is an inflammatory process accompanied by bone destruction and caused by an infecting microorganism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.label: Pathologic fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.definition: A pathologic fracture occurs when a bone breaks in an area that is weakened secondarily to another disease process such as tumor, infection, and certain inherited bone disorders. A pathologic fracture can occur without a degree of trauma required to cause fracture in healthy bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.label: Recurrent fractures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.definition: The repeated occurrence of bone fractures (implying an abnormally increased tendency for fracture).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.label: Osteoarthritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000275.definition: Degeneration (wear and tear) of articular cartilage, i.e., of the joint surface. Joint degeneration may be accompanied by osteophytes (bone overgrowth), narrowing of the joint space, regions of sclerosis at the joint surface, or joint deformity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000276.label: Generalized joint laxity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000276.definition: Joint hypermobility (ability of a joint to move beyond its normal range of motion) affecting many or all joints of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000276.label: Multiple exostoses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000276.definition: Presence of more than one exostosis. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000276.label: Stippled chondral calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000276.definition: Punctate (speckled, dot-like) deposition of calcium of calcium salts in the articular cartilage (cartilage located in joints).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000277.label: Abnormal tracheal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000277.definition: A structural anomaly of the trachea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.label: Bronchomalacia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.definition: Weakness or softness of the cartilage in the walls of the bronchial tubes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.label: Upper airway obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.definition: Increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.label: Recurrent lower respiratory tract infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.definition: An increased susceptibility to lower respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent lower respiratory tract infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.label: Tracheobronchomalacia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.definition: Weakness of the cartilage in the trachea and the bronchi, resulting in a floppy (non-rigid) airway. Affected persons may have difficulties to maintain patency of the airways.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.label: Tracheal calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.definition: Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the tracheal tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.label: Recurrent upper respiratory tract infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000278.definition: An increased susceptibility to upper respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent upper respiratory tract infections (running ears - otitis, sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000279.label: Hypoventilation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000279.definition: A reduction in the amount of air transported into the pulmonary alveoli by breathing, leading to hypercapnia (increase in the partial pressure of carbon dioxide).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000279.label: Reduced vital capacity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000279.definition: An abnormal reduction on the vital capacity, which is defined as the total lung capacity (volume of air in the lungs at maximal inflation) less the residual volume (i.e., volume of air in the lungs following maximal exhalation) of the lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000279.label: Abnormal pattern of respiration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000279.definition: An anomaly of the rhythm or depth of breathing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000279.label: Osteolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000279.definition: Osteolysis refers to the destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000280.label: Congenital contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000280.definition: One or more flexion contractures (a bent joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively) that are present at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000280.label: Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000280.definition: Multiple congenital contractures in different body areas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000280.label: Kyphosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000280.definition: Exaggerated anterior convexity of the thoracic vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000281.label: Coxa vara
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000281.definition: Coxa vara includes all forms of decrease of the femoral neck shaft angle (the angle between the neck and the shaft of the femur) to less than 120 degrees.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000281.label: Abnormal limb bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000281.definition: Any abnormality of bones of the arms or legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000281.label: Abnormality of the knee
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000281.definition: An abnormality of the knee joint or surrounding structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000281.label: Genu recurvatum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000281.definition: An abnormally increased extension of the knee joint, so that the knee can bend backwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000282.label: Abnormal femur morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000282.definition: Any anomaly of the structure of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000282.label: Caudal appendage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000282.definition: The presence of a tail-like skin appendage located adjacent to the sacrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000282.label: Halberd-shaped pelvis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000282.definition: An anomalous radiographic appearance of the developing pelvis, in which the greater ischiadic noth (incisura ischiadica major) is shallow and the pelvis takes on the appearance said to resemble a halberd (a weapon especially of the 15th and 16th centuries consisting typically of a battle-ax and pike mounted on a handle).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000282.label: Hip dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000282.definition: Displacement of the femur from its normal location in the hip joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.label: Calcific stippling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.definition: An abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) pattern of calcifications in soft tissues within or surrounding bones (as observed on radiographs).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.label: Cystic angiomatosis of bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.definition: Disseminated multifocal hemangiomatous or lymphangiomatous lesions of the skeleton. The lesions are lytic, well-defined, round or oval lesions within the medullary cavity, and they have an intact cortex, and manifest variable peripheral sclerosis and may exhibit endosteal scalloping.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.label: Aspiration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.definition: Inspiration of a foreign object into the airway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.label: Bladder exstrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.definition: Eversion of the posterior bladder wall through the congenitally absent lower anterior abdominal wall and anterior bladder wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.label: Recurrent bronchitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.definition: An increased susceptibility to bronchitis as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.label: Urinary bladder sphincter dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000283.definition: Abnormal function of a sphincter of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.label: Recurrent fungal infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.definition: Increased susceptibility to fungal infections, as manifested by multiple episodes of fungal infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.label: Recurrent Burkholderia cepacia infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.definition: Increased susceptibility to infections with Burkholderia cepacia, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection with this agent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.label: obsolete Increased proportion of peripheral CD3+ T cells
Abnormal B cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.definition: A structural abnormality of B cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.label: Impaired memory B cell generation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.definition: Impaired production of memory cells, the B cells that persist for years or an entire lifetime and which confer rapid and enhanced response to secondary challenge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.label: Decreased specific anti-polysaccharide antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.definition: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against bacterial polysaccharides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.label: Absence of lymph node germinal center
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000284.definition: Absence of germinal centers in lymph nodes. Germinal centers are the parts of lymph nodes in which B lymphocytes proliferate, differentiate, mutate through somatic hypermutation and class switch during antibody responses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.label: Decreased circulating total IgM
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin M (IgM) in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.label: Elevated proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative, alpha-beta regulatory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.definition: An abnormally increased proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative (double negative or DN) alpha-beta regulatory T cells (Tregs) as compared to total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.label: Increased proportion of HLA DR+ T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.definition: An elevated proportion of T cells that express human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-DR. HLA-DR is an MHC class II cell surface receptor that presents antigens (peptides of at least 9 amino acids), thereby constituting a ligand for the T-cell receptor. HLA-DR can be upregulated in response to immune stimulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.label: Genu valgum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.definition: The legs angle inward, such that the knees are close together and the ankles far apart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.label: Meningioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000285.definition: The presence of a meningioma, i.e., a benign tumor originating from the dura mater or arachnoid mater.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.label: Squamous cell carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.definition: The presence of squamous cell carcinoma of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.label: Melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.definition: The presence of a melanoma, a malignant cancer originating from pigment producing melanocytes. Melanoma can originate from the skin or the pigmented layers of the eye (the uvea).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.label: Bladder carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.definition: The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.label: Myelodysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.definition: Clonal hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by dysplasia (ineffective production) in one or more hematopoietic cell lineages, leading to anemia and cytopenia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.label: Medullary thyroid carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.definition: The presence of a medullary carcinoma of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.label: Abnormal ilium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.definition: An abnormality of the ilium, the largest and uppermost bone of the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.label: Narrow iliac wing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.definition: Decreased width of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.label: Flared iliac wing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000286.definition: Widening of the ilium ala, that is of the wing of the ilium, combined with external rotation, leading to a flared appearance of the iliac wing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.label: Obstructive sleep apnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.definition: Obstructive Sleep Apnea is a condition characterized by the obstruction of the airway and pauses in breathing during sleep, which occur multiple times throughout the night. It is related to the relaxation of muscle tone that typically happens during sleep, leading to a partial collapse of the soft tissues in the airway and causing airflow obstruction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.label: Central apnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.definition: Apnea resulting from depression of the respiratory centers in the medulla oblongata. There is a lack of respiratory effort rather than obstruction of airflow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.label: Apneic episodes precipitated by illness, fatigue, stress
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.definition: Recurrent episodes of apnea that are precipitated by factors such as illness, fatigue, or stress.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.label: Exertional dyspnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.definition: Perceived difficulty to breathe that occurs with exercise or exertion and improves with rest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.label: Nocturnal hypoventilation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.definition: An abnormal reduction in alveolar ventilation occuring during sleep. This is characterized by a rise in arterial carbon dioxide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.label: Respiratory failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.definition: A severe form of respiratory insufficiency characterized by inadequate gas exchange such that the levels of oxygen or carbon dioxide cannot be maintained within normal limits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.label: Anisospondyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000287.definition: Abnormally increased variability of the size of the vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.label: Sudden episodic apnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.definition: Recurrent bouts of sudden, severe apnea that may be life-threatening.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.label: Hyperventilation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.definition: Hyperventilation refers to an increased pulmonary ventilation rate that is faster than necessary for the exchange of gases. Hyperventilation can result from increased frequency of breathing, an increased tidal volume, or both, and leads to an excess intake of oxygen and the blowing off of carbon dioxide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.label: Hepatoblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.definition: A kind of neoplasm of the liver that originates from immature liver precursor cells and macroscopically is composed of tissue resembling fetal or mature liver cells or bile ducts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.label: Medulloblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.definition: A rapidly growing embryonic tumor arising in the posterior part of the cerebellar vermis and neuroepithelial roof of the fourth ventricle in children. More rarely, medulloblastoma arises in the cerebellum in adults.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.label: Vagal paraganglioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.definition: A tumor that develops in the retrostyloid compartment of the parapharyngeal space, arising from an island of paraganglion tissue derived from the neural crest that is located on the vagus nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.label: Ependymoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000288.definition: The presence of an ependymoma of the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.label: Thyroid carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.definition: The presence of a carcinoma of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.label: Uterine leiomyosarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.definition: The presence of a leiomyosarcoma of the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.label: Pituitary adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.definition: A benign epithelial tumor derived from intrinsic cells of the adenohypophysis (anterior pituitary).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.label: Neoplasm of the pancreas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.label: Papillary thyroid carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.definition: The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.label: Neoplasm of the liver
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.label: Parathyroid adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000289.definition: A benign tumor of the parathyroid gland that can cause hyperparathyroidism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.label: Hypokalemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.definition: An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.label: Hypocalcemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.definition: An abnormally decreased calcium concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.label: Hyponatremia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.definition: An abnormally decreased sodium concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.label: Hyperbilirubinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.definition: An increased amount of bilirubin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.label: Hyperphosphatemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.definition: An abnormally increased phosphate concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.label: Microscopic hematuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.definition: Microscopic hematuria detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.label: Generalized aminoaciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000290.definition: An increased concentration of all types of amino acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.label: Elevated hepatic transaminase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.definition: Elevations of the levels of SGOT and SGPT in the serum. SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) are transaminases primarily found in the liver and heart and are released into the bloodstream as the result of liver or heart damage. SGOT and SGPT are used clinically mainly as markers of liver damage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.label: Methylmalonic acidemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.definition: Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.label: Myoglobinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.definition: Presence of myoglobin in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.label: Hyperchloriduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.definition: An increased concentration of chloride in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.label: Hypomagnesemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.definition: An abnormally decreased magnesium concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.label: Hypermagnesemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.definition: An abnormally increased magnesium concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.label: Ketonuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000291.definition: High levels of ketone bodies (acetoacetic acid, beta-hydroxybutyric acid, and acetone) in the urine. Ketone bodies are insignificant in the blood and urine of normal individuals in the postprandial or overnight-fasted state.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.label: Decreased circulating ACTH concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.definition: The concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), is below the lower limit of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.label: Abnormal cerebrospinal fluid morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.definition: An abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.label: Increased CSF protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.definition: Increased concentration of protein in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.label: Rheumatoid factor positive
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.definition: The presence in the serum of an autoantibody directed against the Fc portion of IgG.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.label: Elevated circulating thyroid-stimulating hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.definition: Increased concentration of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.label: Abnormality of thyroid physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.definition: An abnormal functionality of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.label: Histidinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.definition: An increased concentration of histidine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000292.label: Decreased activity of the pyruvate dehydrogenase complex

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.label: Impaired sensitivity to thyroid hormone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.definition: Reduced sensitivity of end organs to thyroid hormone characterized by elevated serum levels of free thyroid hormone with nonsuppressed thyroid stimulating hormone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.label: Aldehyde oxidase deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.definition: A reduction in aldehyde oxidase level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.label: Ventral hernia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.definition: Ventral hernia refers to a condition in which abdominal contents protrude through a weakened portion of the abdominal wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.label: Distal sensory impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.definition: An abnormal reduction in sensation in the distal portions of the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.label: Hemivertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.definition: Absence of one half of the vertebral body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.label: Lumbar hyperlordosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000293.definition: An abnormal accentuation of the inward curvature of the spine in the lumbar region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.label: Thoracic kyphosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.definition: Over curvature of the thoracic region, leading to a round back or if sever to a hump.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.label: Intervertebral space narrowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.definition: Decreased height of the intervertebral disk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.label: Cervical kyphosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.definition: Exaggerated convexity of the cervical vertebral column, causing the cervical spine to bow outwards and take on a rounded appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.label: Vertebral fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.definition: A developmental defect leading to the union of two adjacent vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.label: Fused cervical vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000294.definition: A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more cervical vertebral bodies with one another.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000295.label: Partial absence of cerebellar vermis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000295.definition: Congenital absence of a part of the vermis of cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000295.label: Granulomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000295.definition: A granulomatous inflammation leading to multiple granuloma formation, which is a specific type of inflammation. A granuloma is a focal compact collection of inflammatory cells, mononuclear cells predominating, usually as a result of the persistence of a non-degradable product and of active cell mediated hypersensitivity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000295.label: Immune dysregulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000295.definition: Altered immune function characterized by lymphoid proliferation, immune activation, and excessive autoreactivity often leading to autoimmune/inflammatory complications.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000295.label: Impaired Ig class switch recombination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000295.definition: An impairment of the class-switch recombination process that normally leads B lymphocytes to produce IgG, IgA, or IgE.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.label: Autoimmunity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.definition: The occurrence of an immune reaction against the organism's own cells or tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.label: Dysgammaglobulinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.definition: Selective deficiency of one or more, but not all, classes of immunoglobulins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.label: Abnormal delayed hypersensitivity skin test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.definition: Delay in cutaneous immune reaction to specific antigens mediated not by antibodies but by cells. The delayed hypersensitivity test is an immune function test measuring the presence of activated T cells that recognize a specific antigen and is performed by injecting a small amount of the antigen into the skin. The area of the injection is examined 48-72 hours thereafter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.label: Cutaneous anergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.definition: Inability to react to a delayed hypersensitivity skin test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.label: Cubitus valgus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000296.definition: Abnormal positioning in which the elbows are turned out.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.label: Genu varum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.definition: A positional abnormality marked by outward bowing of the legs in which the knees stay wide apart when a person stands with the feet and ankles together.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.label: Absent microvilli on the surface of peripheral blood lymphocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.definition: Absence of the fingerlike protrusive, actin-dependent structures found on the surface of peripheral blood lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.label: Reduced delayed hypersensitivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.definition: Decreased ability to react to a delayed hypersensitivity skin test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.label: Abnormal forearm morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.definition: An abnormality of the lower arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.label: Radioulnar synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.definition: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the central nervous system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of tissue in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.label: Bowing of the legs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000297.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting a long bone of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.label: Abnormality of the calf
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.definition: An abnormality of the calf, i.e. of the posterior part of the lower leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.label: Tibial bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.label: Micromelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.definition: The presence of abnormally small extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.label: Radial bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.label: Elbow flexion contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000298.definition: An elbow contracture that limits the ability of the elbow joint to be extended (straightened), meaning that the elbow is fixed in an flexed (bent) position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000299.label: Abnormal fibula morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000299.definition: An anomaly of the calf bone (fibula), one of the two bones of the calf.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000299.label: Patellar dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000299.definition: The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar dislocation occurs if the patella fully dislocates out of the groove.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000300.label: Breast carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000300.definition: The presence of a carcinoma of the breast.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000300.label: Ganglioneuroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000300.definition: A benign neoplasm that usually arises from the sympathetic trunk in the mediastinum, representing a tumor of the sympathetic nerve fibers arising from neural crest cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000300.label: Neuroblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000300.definition: Neuroblastoma is a solid tumor that originate in neural crest cells of the sympathetic nervous system. Most neuroblastomas originate in the abdomen, and most abdominal neuroblastomas originate in the adrenal gland. Neuroblastomas can also originate in the thorax, usually in the posterior mediastinum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.label: Prolonged bleeding time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.definition: Prolongation of the time taken for a standardized skin cut of fixed depth and length to stop bleeding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.label: Abnormality of the musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.definition: Abnormality originating in one or more muscles, i.e., of the set of muscles of body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.label: Bulging epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.definition: A morphological abnormality of epiphyses whereby they are abnormally outwardly curving (protuberant).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.label: Flared metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.definition: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.label: Metaphyseal widening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.definition: Abnormal widening of the metaphyseal regions of long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.label: Abnormality of the wrist
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000301.definition: Abnormality of the wrist, the structure connecting the hand and the forearm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.label: Metaphyseal cupping
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.definition: Metaphyseal cupping refers to an inward bulging of the metaphyseal profile giving the metaphysis a cup-like appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.label: Bowing of limbs due to multiple fractures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.definition: Curvature of the shafts of the long bones due to multiple fractures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.label: Metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphyses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.label: Short long bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.definition: One or more abnormally short long bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.label: Mesomelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.definition: Shortening of the middle parts of the limbs (forearm and lower leg) in relation to the upper and terminal segments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.label: Abnormality of the ankle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000302.definition: An anomaly of the joint that connects the foot with the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000303.label: Ulnar bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000303.definition: Bending of the diaphysis (shaft) of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000303.label: Diaphyseal sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000303.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000303.label: Enlarged joints
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000303.definition: Increase in size of one or more joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.label: Humeroradial synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.definition: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.label: Elbow dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.definition: Dislocation of the distal humerus out of the elbow joint, where the radius, ulna, and humerus meet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.label: Abnormal shoulder morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.definition: An abnormality of the shoulder, which is defined as the structures surrounding the shoulder joint where the humerus attaches to the scapula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.label: Shoulder flexion contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.definition: Chronic reduction in active and passive mobility of the shoulder joint due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.label: Radial head subluxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000304.definition: Partial dislocation of the head of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000305.label: Enlarged metaphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000305.definition: Abnormal increase in size of one or more metaphyses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000306.label: Abnormality of the humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000306.definition: An abnormality of the humerus (i.e., upper arm bone).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000306.label: Limited knee extension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000306.definition: Reduced ability to extend (straighten) the knee joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000306.label: Madelung deformity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000306.definition: An anomaly related to partial closure, or failure of development of the ulnar side of the distal radial growth plate, which results in an arrest of epiphyseal growth of the medial and volar portions of the distal radius. This leads to shortening of the radius and relative overgrowth of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.label: Hypercalcemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.definition: An abnormally increased calcium concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.label: Hypoalbuminemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.definition: Reduction in the concentration of albumin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.label: Hyperglycemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.definition: An increased concentration of glucose in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.label: Hypoproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.definition: A decreased concentration of protein in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.label: Glycosuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.definition: An increased concentration of glucose in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.label: Hyperlipidemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.definition: An elevated lipid concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000307.label: Defective DNA repair after ultraviolet radiation damage

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000308.label: Hydroxyprolinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000308.definition: An increased concentration of 4-hydroxy-L-proline in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000308.label: Increased urinary potassium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000308.definition: An increased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000308.label: Dislocated radial head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000308.definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000308.label: Fractures of the long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000308.definition: An increased tendency to fractures of the long bones (Mainly, the femur, tibia, fibula, humerus, radius, and ulna).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.label: Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.definition: Underdevelopment of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.label: Trophic limb changes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.definition: Trophic changes occurring in a limb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.label: Limited hip extension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.definition: Limitation of the extension of the hip, i.e., decreased ability to straighten the hip joint and thereby increase the angle between torso and thigh; moving the thigh or top of the pelvis backward.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.label: Short femur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.definition: An abnormal shortening of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.label: Fibular overgrowth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000309.definition: Relatively increased growth of the fibula compared to that of the tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.label: Slender long bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.definition: Reduced diameter of a long bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.label: Increased carrying angle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.definition: An abnormal increase in the carrying angle, which is the angle he long axis of the extended forearm as it lies lateral to the long axis of the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.label: Abnormal cortical bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.definition: An abnormality of compact bone (also known as cortical bone), which forms the dense surface of bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.label: Protuberances at ends of long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.definition: The presence of multiple protuberances (bulges, or knobs) at the ends of the long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.label: Subperiosteal bone resorption
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.definition: Loss of bone mass occurring beneath the periosteum (the periosteum is the connective-tissue membrane that surrounds all bones except at the articular surfaces). This process may create a serrated and lace-like appearance in periosteal cortical bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.label: Abnormal circulating cholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of cholesterol in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.label: Hyperglycinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.definition: An increased concentration of glycine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.label: Hyperphosphaturia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000310.definition: An increased excretion of phosphates in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.label: Abnormality of urine homeostasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.definition: An abnormality of the composition of urine or the levels of its components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.label: Abnormal blood ion concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.definition: Abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of a monoatomic ion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.label: Abnormal circulating amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.definition: The presence of an abnormal decrease or increase of one or more amino acids in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.label: Hypochloremia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.definition: An abnormally decreased chloride concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.label: Abnormal circulating hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.definition: Concentration of a hormone in the blood circulation outside of normal limits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.label: Increased circulating cortisol level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.definition: Overproduction of the hormone of cortisol by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.label: Abnormal circulating lipid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000311.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a lipid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.label: Limb joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.definition: A contracture (chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin) that prevent normal movement of one or more joints of the limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.label: Hypercholesterolemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.definition: An increased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.label: Reduced factor VIII activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.definition: Reduced activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.label: Low-molecular-weight proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.definition: Excretion in urine of proteins of a size smaller than albumin (molecular weight 69 kD).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.label: Hypocalciuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.definition: An abnormally decreased calcium concentration in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.label: Lactic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000312.definition: An abnormal buildup of lactic acid in the body, leading to acidification of the blood and other bodily fluids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.label: Abnormal peripheral myelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.definition: An abnormality of the myelination of motor and sensory peripheral nerves. These are axons for motor nerves and dendrites for sensory nerves in the strict anatomic sense.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.label: Cystinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.definition: An increased concentration of cystine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.label: Abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.definition: An abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts, a set of axonal fibers originating in the spinal cord and terminating in the ipsilateral cerebellum. The spinocerebellar tract convey information to the cerebellum about limb and joint position (proprioception). They comprise the ventral spinocerebellar tract, the anterior spinocerebellar tract, and the posterior spinocerebellar tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.label: Abnormality of peripheral nerve conduction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.definition: An abnormality of the conduction of electrical impulses by peripheral (motor or sensory) nerves. This finding is elicited by a nerve conduction study (NCS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.label: Prolinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.definition: Level of proline in the urine anove the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.label: Increased blood urea nitrogen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.definition: An increased amount of nitrogen in the form of urea in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.label: Panhypogammaglobulinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000313.definition: A reduction in the circulating levels of all the major classes of immunoglobulin. is characterized by profound decreases in all classes of immunoglobulin with an absence of circulating B lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.label: T-wave inversion in the right precordial leads
Increased LDL cholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.definition: An elevated concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.label: Increased serum serotonin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.definition: A increased concentration of serotonin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.label: Decreased adenosylcobalamin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.definition: Decreased concentration of adenosylcobalamin. Adenosylcobalamin is one of the active forms of vitamin B12.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.label: Hypocholesterolemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.definition: An decreased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.label: Hyperuricosuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000314.definition: An abnormally high level of uric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.label: Glutaric aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.definition: The concentration of glutaric acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.label: Cystathioninuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.definition: An elevated urinary concentration of cystathionine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.label: Increased circulating ACTH level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.definition: An abnormal increased in the concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.label: Elevated circulating alkaline phosphatase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.definition: Abnormally increased serum levels of alkaline phosphatase activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.label: Hyposthenuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.definition: An abnormally low urinary specific gravity, i.e., reduced concentration of solutes in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.label: Hyperoxaluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000315.definition: Increased excretion of oxalates in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.label: Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.definition: Glycosylated transferrin concentrations can be measured in serum as a marker of N-linked glycosylation fidelity. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II. These terms are retained for historical reasons but for new annotations the precise glycosylation defect should be recorded.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.label: 4-Hydroxyphenylpyruvic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.definition: Increased relative concentration of 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.label: Elevated urinary delta-aminolevulinic acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.definition: An increased concentration of 5-aminolevulinic acid (CHEBI:17549) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.label: Elevated circulating parathyroid hormone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.definition: An abnormal increased concentration of parathyroid hormone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.label: Increased urinary taurine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.definition: Increased concentration of taurine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.label: Carnosinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.definition: An increased concentration of carnosine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.label: Dibasicaminoaciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000316.definition: An increased level of a dibasic amino acid in the urine. Dibasic amino acids are usually refered to simply as basic aminoacids because they contain basic side chains at neutral pH. These are arginine (Arg), lysine (Lys), and histidine (His).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.label: Abnormal acetabulum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.definition: An abnormality of the acetabulum, i.e., the Acetabular part of hip bone, which together with the head of the femur forms the hip joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.label: Abnormal pubic bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.definition: An anomaly of the the pubic bone, i.e., of the ventral and anterior of the three principal components (pubis, ilium, ischium) of the hip bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.label: Hypoplastic pubic bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.definition: Underdevelopment of the pubis, which together with the ilium and the ischium, is one of the three bones that make up the hip bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.label: Abnormal ischium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.definition: An anomaly of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.label: Hypoplastic ischia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.definition: Underdevelopment of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.label: Squared iliac bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.definition: A shift from the normally round (convex) appearance of the iliac wing towards a square-like appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.label: Protrusio acetabuli
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000317.definition: Intrapelvic bulging of the medial acetabular wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.label: Flat acetabular roof
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.definition: Flattening of the superior part of the acetabulum, which is a cup-shaped cavity at the base of the hipbone into which the ball-shaped head of the femur fits. The acetabular roof thereby appears horizontal rather than arched, as it normally does.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.label: Wide pubic symphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.definition: Abnormally increased width of the pubic symphysis is the midline cartilaginous joint uniting the superior rami of the left and right pubic bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.label: Decreased hip abduction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.definition: Reduced ability to move the femur outward to the side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.label: Short greater sciatic notch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.definition: The sacroiliac joint in the bony pelvis connects the sacrum and the ilium of the pelvis, which are joined by strong ligaments. The notch is located directly superior to the joint. This term refers to a reduction in the height of the notch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.label: Inverted nipples
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.definition: The presence of nipples that instead of pointing outward are retracted inwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.label: Long nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000318.definition: Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased length from the nasal root to the nasal base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.label: Cleft ala nasi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.definition: The presence of a notch in the margin of the ala nasi.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.label: Allergic rhinitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.definition: It is characterized by one or more symptoms including sneezing, itching, nasal congestion, and rhinorrhea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.label: Short nasal bridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.definition: Decreased superior-inferior length of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.label: Short nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.definition: Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations below the mean, or alternatively, an apparently decreased length from the nasal root to the nasal tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.label: Myopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000319.definition: A disorder of muscle unrelated to impairment of innervation or neuromuscular junction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.label: Ragged-red muscle fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.definition: An abnormal appearance of muscle fibers observed on muscle biopsy. Ragged red fibers can be visualized with Gomori trichrome staining as irregular and intensely red subsarcolemmal zones, whereas the normal myofibrils are green. The margins of affect fibers appear red and ragged. The ragged-red is due to the accumulation of abnormal mitochondria below the plasma membrane of the muscle fiber, leading to the appearance of a red rim and speckled sarcoplasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.label: Rhabdomyolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.definition: Breakdown of muscle fibers that leads to the release of muscle fiber contents (myoglobin) into the bloodstream.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.label: Skeletal muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.definition: The presence of skeletal muscular atrophy (which is also known as amyotrophy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.label: Impaired oxidative burst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.definition: In the NBT test, neutrophils change the colorless compound NBT into a compound with a deep blue color. If this test is negative (i.e., no blue color is produced), then this indicates a defect in superoxide-generating NADPH oxidase activity with inability to efficiently kill phagocytized bacteria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.label: Intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.definition: The intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent storage material.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.label: Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.definition: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a curved pattern.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.label: Arterial calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.definition: Pathological deposition of calcium salts in one or more arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.label: Fingerprint intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.definition: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a trabecular or fingerprint-like pattern.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.label: Decreased pyruvate carboxylase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000320.definition: A decreased rate of pyruvate carboxylase activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.label: Decreased methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.definition: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.label: Increased circulating IgE level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.definition: An abnormally increased overall level of immunoglobulin E in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.label: Deficient excision of UV-induced pyrimidine dimers in DNA
Prolonged G2 phase of cell cycle
Dicarboxylic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.definition: An increased concentration of dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.label: Hyperglutaminemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.definition: An increased concentration of glutamine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.label: Oroticaciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.definition: An increased concentration of orotic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.label: Ethylmalonic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000321.definition: The concentration of ethylmalonic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.label: Abnormality of chromosome stability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.definition: A type of chromosomal aberration characterised by reduced resistance of chromosomes to change or deterioration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.label: Chromosomal breakage induced by crosslinking agents
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.definition: Increased amount of chromosomal breaks in cultured blood lymphocytes or other cells induced by treatment with DNA cross-linking agents such as diepoxybutane and mitomycin C.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.label: Decreased methylcobalamin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.definition: Decreased concentration of methylcobalamin. Methylcobalamin is a form of vitamin B12.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.label: Increased cellular sensitivity to UV light
Reduced coagulation factor V activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.definition: Decreased activity of coagulation factor V.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.label: Rectilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.definition: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a straight or rectilinear pattern.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.label: Hypernatremia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000322.definition: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.label: Hypertyrosinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.definition: An increased concentration of tyrosine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.label: Decreased HDL cholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.definition: An decreased concentration of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.label: Decreased circulating carnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.definition: Concentration of carnitine in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.label: Hypermethioninemia
