http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.definition: An increased concentration of methionine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.label: Elevated circulating creatine kinase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.definition: An elevation of the level of the enzyme creatine kinase (also known as creatine phosphokinase (CK; EC 2.7.3.2) in the blood. CK levels can be elevated in a number of clinical disorders such as myocardial infarction, rhabdomyolysis, and muscular dystrophy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.label: Increased circulating IgG level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin G in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.label: Phosphoethanolaminuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000323.definition: An increased level of phosphoethanolamine (synonym: O-phosphoethanolamine) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000324.label: Increased phosphoribosylpyrophosphate synthetase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000324.definition: Abnormally elevated level of the enzyme phosphoribosyl pyrophosphatesynthetase, which catalyzes the synthesis of PP-ribose-P from ATP and ribose-5-phosphate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000324.label: External genital hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000324.definition: Underdevelopment of part or all of the external reproductive organs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000324.label: Penile hypospadias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000324.definition: Location of the urethral opening on the inferior aspect of the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000324.label: Prominent scrotal raphe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000324.definition: Increased size of the ridge of tissue that extends along the midline of the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000324.label: Gonadal tissue inappropriate for external genitalia or chromosomal sex

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000325.label: Abnormality of DNA repair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000325.definition: An abnormality of the process of DNA repair, that is, of the process of restoring DNA after damage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000325.label: Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000325.definition: An abnormality of the coagulation cascade, which is comprised of the contact activation pathway (also known as the intrinsic pathway) and the tissue factor pathway (also known as the extrinsic pathway) as well as cofactors and regulators.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000325.label: Elevated circulating creatinine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000325.definition: An increased amount of creatinine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.label: Hydroxyprolinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.definition: An increased concentration of hydroxyproline in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.label: Increased circulating IgA level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin A in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.label: Smooth muscle antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.definition: The presence in serum of antibodies against smooth muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.label: Neonatal hyperbilirubinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.definition: A type of hyperbilirubinemia with neonatal onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.label: Reduced orotidine 5-prime phosphate decarboxylase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.definition: An abnormal decrease in orotidine 5'-phosphate decarboxylase level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.label: Argininuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000326.definition: A increased concentration of arginine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.label: Visceromegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.definition: Abnormal increased size of the viscera of the abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.label: Abnormal hip bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.definition: An abnormality of the hip bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.label: Hip contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.definition: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the hip joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.label: Narrow pelvis bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.definition: Reduced side to side width of the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.label: Pelvic bone exostoses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.definition: A benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface of the pelvis. Exostoses are capped by cartilage, and arise from a bone that develops from cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.label: Square pelvis bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.definition: An abnormally squared appearance of the bony pelvis, a normally rounded or basin-shaped structure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.label: Coxa magna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000327.definition: Widening of the femoral head and neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000328.label: Increased circulating ferritin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000328.definition: Increased concentration of ferritin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000328.label: Low alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000328.definition: Abnormally reduced serum levels of alkaline phosphatase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000328.label: Cystathioninemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000328.definition: An increased concentration of cystathionine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000329.label: Decreased serum leptin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000329.definition: A decreased concentration of leptin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000329.label: obsolete Impaired FSH and LH secretion
Hyperthreoninuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000329.definition: An increased concentration of threonine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000329.label: Hyperlysinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000329.definition: An increased concentration of lysine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000329.label: Spina bifida occulta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000329.definition: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of a vertebral body with intact overlying skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.label: Ovoid vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.definition: When viewed in lateral radiographs, vertebral bodies have a roughly rectangular configuration. This term applies if the vertebral body appears rounded or oval.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.label: Irregular vertebral endplates
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.definition: An irregular surface of the vertebral end plates, which are normally relatively smooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.label: Spondylolisthesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.definition: Complete bilateral fractures of the pars interarticularis resulting in the anterior slippage of the vertebra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.label: Spondylolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.definition: Spondylolysis is an osseous defect of the pars interarticularis, thought to be a developmental or acquired stress fracture secondary to chronic low-grade trauma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.label: Block vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.definition: Congenital synostosis between two or more adjacent vertebrae (partial or complete fusion of adjacent vertabral bodies).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.label: Spinal rigidity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.definition: Reduced ability to move the vertebral column with a resulting limitation of neck and trunk flexion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.label: Hyperlordosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.definition: Abnormally increased curvature (anterior concavity) of the lumbar or cervical spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.label: Cervical subluxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000330.definition: A partial dislocation of one or more intervertebral joints in the cervical vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000331.label: Abnormal odontoid process morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000331.definition: Abnormal structure of the odontoid process, which is a part of the C2 or axis vertebra and forms pivot of the structures forming the craniovertebral junction. The odontoid process is also known as the dens of the axis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000331.label: Hypoplasia of the odontoid process
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000331.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the dens of the axis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000331.label: Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies
Butterfly vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000331.definition: A butterfly vertebra (sagittal cleft vertebra or anterior rachischisis) is a sagittal defect in the vertebral body caused by failure of fusion of the two lateral chondrification centers during embryogenesis. The name is based on the appearance of the two hemivertebrae emerging as butterfly wings from the central cleft on x-ray.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000331.label: Abnormality of the cervical spine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000331.definition: Any abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.label: C1-C2 subluxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.definition: A partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.label: Generalized muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.definition: Generalized weakness or decreased strength of the muscles, affecting both distal and proximal musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.label: Limb-girdle muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.definition: Weakness of the limb-girdle muscles (also known as the pelvic and shoulder girdles), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders and the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.label: Axial muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.definition: Reduced strength of the axial musculature (i.e., of the muscles of the head and neck, spine, and ribs).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.label: Abnormal hairshaft morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.definition: An abnormal structure of the hairshaft, i.e., of the nongrowing portion of a hair that protrudes from the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000332.label: Hair shafts flattened at irregular intervals and twisted through 180 degrees about their axes

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.label: Abnormal bone structure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.definition: Any anomaly in the composite material or the layered arrangement of the bony skeleton.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.label: Elevated circulating catecholamine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.definition: An abnormal increase in catecholamine concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.label: Abnormal enchondral ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.definition: An abnormality of the process of endochondral ossification, which is a type of replacement ossification in which bone tissue replaces cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.label: Reduced prothrombin consumption
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.definition: The prothrombin consumption test measures the formation of intrinsic thromboplastin by determining the residual serum prothrombin after blood clotting is complete. If there is a defect in the process, less prothrombin will be converted to thrombin than normal (less prothrombin is consumed). This test may be abnormal with conditions including deficiency of factors VIII or IX, with circulating anticoagulants, thrombocytopenia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.label: Focal necrosis of right ventricular muscle cells
Pyrimidine-responsive megaloblastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000333.definition: A type of megaloblastic anemia that improves upon administration of pyrimidine supplements such as uridylic acid and cytidylic acid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.label: Lamina lucida cleavage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.definition: The formation of bullae (blisters) with cleavage in the lamina lucida layer of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.label: Reduced glutathione synthetase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.definition: Reduced level of the enzyme glutathione synthetase, which catalyzes the last step in the synthesis of glutathione and a deficiency results in low levels of glutathione. Acidosis is due to reduced feedback inhibition of gamma-glutamyl cysteine synthetase in the gamma-glutamyl cycle, which ultimately leads to overproduction and accumulation of 5-oxoproline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.label: 3-Methylglutaric aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.definition: An abnormally increased level of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.label: Elevated urinary norepinephrine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.definition: The concentration of noradrenaline in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.label: Impaired lymphocyte transformation with phytohemagglutinin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.definition: Normal peripheral blood lymphocytes, when stimulated by phytohemagglutinin (PHA) are cytotoxic for homologous and heterologous cells but not for autologous cells in monolayer culture. The cytotoxic effect is thought to be indicative of the immunological competence of the lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.label: Hyperalaninemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.definition: An increased concentration of alanine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.label: Low cholesterol esterification rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000334.definition: A reduction in the rate of cholesterol esterification.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.label: Decreased circulating renin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.definition: An decreased level of renin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.label: Endopolyploidy on chromosome studies of bone marrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.definition: An increase in the number of chromosome sets per cell in bone marrow cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.label: Propionyl-CoA carboxylase deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.definition: An abnormality of amino acid metabolism characterized by a decreased level of propionyl-CoA carboxylase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.label: Hyperthreoninemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.definition: An increased concentration of threonine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.label: Aminoaciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.definition: An increased concentration of an amino acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.label: Thymic hormone decreased
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.definition: A reduction in the level of thymic horomone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.label: Elevated intracellular cystine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.definition: An increased concentration of cystine within cells. This finding can be demonstrated on leukocytes, but is not specific to blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.label: Decreased urinary sulfate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000335.definition: Decreased concentration of sulfate in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.label: Tryptophanuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.definition: An increased concentration of tryptophan in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.label: Increased VLDL cholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.definition: An increase in the amount of very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.label: Abdominal situs inversus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.definition: A left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the viscera of the abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.label: Abnormal femoral neck morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.definition: An abnormality of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.label: Abnormal femoral head morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000336.definition: An abnormality of the femoral head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.label: Flat capital femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.definition: An abnormal flattening of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.label: Enlargement of the proximal femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.definition: An abnormal enlargement of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.label: Narrow greater sciatic notch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.definition: A narrowing of the sacrosciatic notch, i.e., the deep indentation in the posterior border of the hip bone at the point of union of the ilium and ischium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.label: Steppage gait
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.definition: An abnormal gait pattern that arises from weakness of the pretibial and peroneal muscles due to a lower motor neuron lesion. Affected patients have footdrop and are unable to dorsiflex and evert the foot. The leg is lifted high on walking so that the toes clear the ground, and there may be a slapping noise when the foot strikes the ground again.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.label: Axonal degeneration/regeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000337.definition: A pattern of simultaneous degeneration and regeneration of axons (see comment).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000338.label: Decreased number of peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000338.definition: A loss of myelinated nerve fibers in the peripheral nervous system (in general, this finding can be observed on nerve biopsy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000338.label: Onion bulb formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000338.definition: Repeated episodes of segmental demyelination and remyelination lead to the accumulation of supernumerary Schwann cells around axons, which is referred to as onion bulb formation. This finding affects peripheral nerves.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000338.label: Peripheral axonal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000338.definition: Atrophic changes of axons of the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000338.label: Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000338.definition: A reduced number of large myelinated nerve fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.label: Sensory axonal neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.definition: An axonal neuropathy of peripheral sensory nerves.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.label: Gowers sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.definition: A phenomenon whereby patients are not able to stand up without the use of the hands owing to weakness of the proximal muscles of the lower limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.label: Thenar muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.definition: Wasting of thenar muscles, which are located on palm of the hand at the base of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.label: Muscle spasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.label: Syringomyelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.definition: Dilated, glial-lined cavity in spinal cord. This cavity does not communicate with the central canal, and usually is between the dorsal columns unilaterally or bilaterally along the side of the cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.label: Generalized hypotonia due to defect at the neuromuscular junction
Abnormal synaptic transmission at the neuromuscular junction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000339.definition: Any abnormality of the neuromuscular junction, which is the synapse between the motor end plate of a motor neuron and the skeletal muscle fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.label: Basal lamina onion bulb formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.definition: A type of onion bulb formation prominently affecting the area of the basal lamina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.label: Paresthesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.definition: Abnormal sensations such as tingling, pricking, or numbness of the skin with no apparent physical cause.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.label: Decreased miniature endplate potentials
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.label: EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.definition: A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to a greater than normal decrease in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.label: Distal sensory impairment of all modalities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000340.definition: Reduced ability to sense pain, temperature, touch, vibration stimuli in the distal regions of the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.label: Proximal femoral metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the proximal metaphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.label: Atlantoaxial abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.definition: An anomaly of the atlantoaxial joint, i.e., of the joint between the first (atlas) and second (axis) cervical vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.label: Atlantoaxial dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.definition: Partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.label: Spinal canal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.label: Coronal cleft vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.definition: Frontal schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.label: Back pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the back.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.label: Low back pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000341.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the lower back.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000342.label: Vertebral segmentation defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000342.definition: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation during development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000342.label: CNS hypomyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000342.definition: Reduced amount of myelin in the central nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000343.label: Decreased motor nerve conduction velocity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000343.definition: A type of decreased nerve conduction velocity that affects the motor neuron.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000343.label: Prolonged miniature endplate currents
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000343.definition: An abnormal prolongation of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000343.label: Absent Achilles reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000343.definition: Absence of the Achilles reflex (also known as the ankle jerk reflex), which can normally be elicited by tapping the tendon is tapped while the foot is dorsiflexed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.label: Decreased size of nerve terminals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.definition: A reduction in the size of nerve terminals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.label: EMG: chronic denervation signs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.definition: Evidence of chronic denervation on electromyography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.label: EMG: neuropathic changes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.definition: The presence of characteristic findings of denervation on electromyography (fibrillations, positive sharp waves, and giant motor unit potentials).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.label: Axonal loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.definition: A reduction in the number of axons in the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.label: Decreased sensory nerve conduction velocity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.definition: Reduced speed of conduction of the action potential along a sensory nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.label: Cold-induced muscle cramps
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000344.definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by exposure to cold temperatures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.label: Axonal regeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.definition: The presence of axonal regeneration following a previous axonal lesion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.label: Increased rate of premature chromosome condensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.definition: An increased rate of premature chromosome condensation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.label: Antineutrophil antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against neutrophils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.label: Platelet antibody positive
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.definition: The presence in the serum of autoantibodies directed against thrombocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.label: Elevated circulating long chain fatty acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.definition: Increased concentration of long-chain fatty acids in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.label: Low urinary cyclic AMP response to PTH administration
EMG abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.definition: Abnormal results of investigations using electromyography (EMG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.label: EMG: myopathic abnormalities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.definition: The presence of abnormal electromyographic patterns indicative of myopathy, such as small-short polyphasic motor unit potentials.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.label: Polyclonal elevation of IgM
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000345.definition: A heterogeneous increase in IgM immunoglobulins characterized by a diffuse band on serum electrophoresis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.label: Decreased circulating total IgA
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.definition: Undetectable serum immunoglobulin A level at a value < 5 mg/dL (0.05 g/L).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.label: Increased urinary O-linked sialopeptides
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.definition: Excretion of peptides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.label: Increased extraneuronal autofluorescent lipopigment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.definition: Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the extraneuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.label: Paradoxical increased cortisol secretion on dexamethasone suppression test
Atlantoaxial instability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.definition: Abnormally increased movement at the junction between the first cervical (atlas) and the second cervical (axis) vertebrae as a result of either a bony or ligamentous anomaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.label: Abnormal vertebral morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.definition: An abnormality of one or more of the vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.label: Peripheral dysmyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000346.definition: Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths. Dysmyelination is distinguished from demyleination where there is destruction or damage of previously normal myelination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.label: Paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.definition: Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Motor paralysis results from deficits of the upper motor neurons (corticospinal, corticobulbar, or subcorticospinal). Motor paralysis is often accompanied by an impairment in the facility of movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.label: Hypocalcemic tetany
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.definition: Hyperexcitability of the neuromuscular system related to abnormally low level of calcium in the blood, resulting in carpopedal or generalized spasms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.label: Fatigable weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.definition: A type of weakness that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.label: Somatic sensory dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.definition: An abnormality of the primary sensation that is mediated by peripheral nerves (pain, temperature, touch, vibration, joint position). The word hypoesthesia (or hypesthesia) refers to a reduction in cutaneous sensation to a specific type of testing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.label: Peripheral axonal neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000347.definition: An abnormality characterized by disruption of the normal functioning of peripheral axons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000348.label: Segmental peripheral demyelination/remyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000348.definition: A segmental pattern of demyelination and regeneration (remyelination) affecting peripheral nerves.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000348.label: EMG: axonal abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000348.definition: Electromyographic (EMG) findings characteristic of axonal neuropathy, with normal or slightly decreased nerve conduction velocities, normal or slightly prolonged distal latencies, but significantly reduced motor potentials and sensory amplitudes. There may be spontaneous activity upon needle EMG studies, such as increased insertional activity, positive sharp waves, and fibrillation potentials.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000348.label: Upper limb muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000348.definition: Weakness of the muscles of the arms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000348.label: Babinski sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000348.definition: Upturning of the big toe (and sometimes fanning of the other toes) in response to stimulation of the sole of the foot. If the Babinski sign is present it can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.label: obsolete Defective dehydrogenation of isovaleryl CoA and butyryl CoA
Elevated urine pyrophosphate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.definition: An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the urine. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.label: High urinary gonadotropin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.definition: An elevated concentration of a gonadotropin hormone (stimulating hormone or luteinizing hormone) in the urine, consistent with the diagnosis of primary hypogonadism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.label: Antinuclear antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against nuclei or nuclear components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.label: obsolete Loss of heterozygosity, multiple chromosomes
Increased circulating IgM level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin M in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.label: Disproportionate short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000349.definition: A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to differing extents.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000350.label: Mild short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000350.definition: A mild degree of short stature, more than -2 SD but not more than -3 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000350.label: Proportionate short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000350.definition: A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to a comparable extent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000351.label: Severe short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000351.definition: A severe degree of short stature, more than -4 SD from the mean corrected for age and sex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000351.label: Reduced ratio of renal calcium clearance to creatinine clearance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000351.definition: A reduction of the ratio of renal calcium clearance to creatinine clearance to below 0.01.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000351.label: Deficiency or absence of cytochrome b(-245)

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.label: Disproportionate short-trunk short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.label: Decreased methionine synthase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.definition: A reduction in methionine synthase activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.label: Orotic acid crystalluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.definition: Formation of crystals owing to an increased concentration of orotic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.label: Hyperprostaglandinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.definition: An increased concentration of prostaglandin in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.label: Elevated circulating calcitonin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.definition: Concentration of calcitonin, a 32-amino acid polypeptide hormone that is produced primarily by the parafollicular cells of the thyroid, in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.label: Parathormone-independent increased renal tubular calcium reabsorption
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000352.definition: An increase in the reabsorption of calcium by the renal tubulus that is not associated with increased parathormone levels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.label: Elevated circulating glutaric acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.definition: An increased concentration of glutaric acid in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.label: Ornithinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.definition: Level of ornithine in the urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.label: Reduced acetaldehyde dehydrogenase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.definition: Decreased level of acetaldehyde dehydrogenase (ALDH). ALDH and alcohol dehydrogenase (ADH) are the primary enzymes involved in alcohol metabolism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.label: Reduced xanthine dehydrogenase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.definition: An abnormal reduction in xanthine dehydrogenase level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.label: 3-Methylglutaconic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.definition: An increased amount of 3-methylglutaconic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.label: Decreased fumarate hydratase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.definition: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of fumarate hydratase activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.label: Hypouricemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.definition: An abnormally low level of uric acid in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.label: Increased iduronate sulfatase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000353.definition: An increased level of iduronate-2-sulfatase activity in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.label: Impaired platelet aggregation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.definition: An impairment in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.label: Urinary glycosaminoglycan excretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.definition: Excretion of glycosaminoglycan in the urine. Glycosaminoglycans are long unbranched polysaccharides consisting of a repeating disaccharide unit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.label: Increased serum pyruvate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.definition: An increased concentration of pyruvate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.label: Exercise intolerance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.definition: A functional motor deficit where individuals whose responses to the challenges of exercise fail to achieve levels considered normal for their age and gender.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.label: Shoulder girdle muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.definition: The shoulder, or pectoral, girdle is composed of the clavicles and the scapulae. Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.label: Subsarcolemmal accumulations of abnormally shaped mitochondria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.definition: An abnormally increased number of mitochondria in the cytoplasma adjacent to the sarcolemma (muscle cell membrane), whereby the mitochondria also possess an abnormal morphology.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.label: Abnormality of connective tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000354.definition: Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.label: Predominantly lower limb lymphedema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.definition: Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised lymphatic system, affecting mainly the legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.label: Muscle stiffness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.definition: A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.label: Type 2 muscle fiber atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.definition: Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 2 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.label: Muscle fiber splitting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.definition: Fiber splitting or branching is a common finding in human and rat skeletal muscle pathology. Fiber splitting refers to longitudinal halving of the complete fiber, while branching originates from a regenerating end of a necrotic fiber as invaginations of the sarcolemma. In fiber branching, one end of the fiber remains intact as a single entity, while the other end has several branches.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.label: Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.definition: An abnormally high degree of muscle fiber size variation. This phenotypic feature can be observed upon muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.label: Viral infection-induced rhabdomyolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000355.definition: Rhabdomyolysis induced by a viral infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.label: Muscular dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.definition: The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness and wasting, defects in muscle proteins, and histological features of muscle fiber degeneration (necrosis) and regeneration. If possible, it is preferred to use other HPO terms to describe the precise phenotypic abnormalities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.label: Decreased LDL cholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.definition: An decreased concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.label: Folate-dependent fragile site at Xq28
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.definition: The presence of a folate sensitive fragile site at chromosome Xq28.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.label: Elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.definition: An increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR). The ESR is a test that measures the distance that erythrocytes have fallen after one hour in a vertical column of anticoagulated blood under the influence of gravity. The ESR is a nonspecific finding. An elevation may indicate inflammation or may be caused by any condition that elevates fibrinogen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.label: Increased serum prostaglandin E2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.definition: An increased concentration of prostaglandin E2 in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.label: Decreased glucosephosphate isomerase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000356.definition: A decreased level of glucose-6-phosphate isomerase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.label: Molybdenum cofactor deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.definition: Absence of molybdenum cofactor(2-), a cofactor for enzymes including sulfite oxidase, xanthine oxidoreductase, and aldehyde oxidase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.label: Propionic acidemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.definition: Increased concentration of proprionic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.label: Low plasma citrulline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.definition: A decreased concentration of citrulline in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.label: Increased total bilirubin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.definition: Increased concentration of total (conjugated and unconjugated) bilirubin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.label: Positive regitine blocking test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.definition: A positive response to the regitine blocking test consisting of a substantial reduction in blood pressure following administration of regitine, indicative of the presence of increased levels of epinephrine and norepinephrine in the circulation, which is seen in pheochromocytoma-associated hypertension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.label: Increased intracellular sodium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.definition: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the cytosol.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.label: Congenital onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000357.definition: A phenotypic abnormality that is present at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000358.label: Adult onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000358.definition: Onset of disease manifestations in adulthood, defined here as at the age of 16 years or later.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000358.label: Late onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000358.definition: A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms after the age of 60 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000358.label: Insidious onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000358.definition: Gradual, very slow onset of disease manifestations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000359.label: Infantile onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000359.definition: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between 28 days to one year of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000359.label: Middle age onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000359.definition: A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms at the age of 40 to 60 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000360.label: Absent urinary urothione
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000360.definition: Lack of urothione (the urinary metabolite of molybdenum cofactor) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000360.label: 4-hydroxyphenylacetic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000360.definition: Increased concentration of 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000360.label: Foam cells with lamellar inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000360.definition: The presence of foam cells that contain lamellar inclusion bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000361.label: Fibroblast metachromasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000361.definition: Increased cytoplasmic staining of fibroblasts with toluidine blue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000361.label: Positive ferric chloride test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000361.definition: If positive, the ferric chloride test indicates an increased concentration of phenols in the urine or blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000361.label: Antiphospholipid antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000361.definition: The presence of circulating autoantibodies to phospholipids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000361.label: Trimethylaminuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000361.definition: Increased concentration of trimethylamine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000362.label: Juvenile onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000362.definition: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between the age of 5 and 15 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000362.label: Neonatal onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000362.definition: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease within the first 28 days of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000363.label: Amyoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000363.definition: Congenital lack of development of the muscles, which are then replaced by a mixture of dense fat and fibrous tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000363.label: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue in limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000363.definition: Loss (disappearance) of previously present subcutaneous fat tissue in arm or leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000363.label: Reduced 4-Hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000363.definition: An abnormal reduction in 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000363.label: Elevated urinary epinephrine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000363.definition: The concentration of epinephrine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.label: CNS foam cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.definition: The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.label: Hemoglobinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.definition: The presence of free hemoglobin in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.label: Type I transferrin isoform profile
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.definition: Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type I congenital disorder of glycosylation. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.label: Prolonged partial thromboplastin time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.definition: Increased time to coagulation in the partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test, a measure of the intrinsic and common coagulation pathways. Phospholipid, and activator, and calcium are mixed into an anticoagulated plasma sample, and the time is measured until a thrombus forms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.label: Bicarbonaturia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.definition: Abnormally increased concentration of hydrogencarbonate in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.label: Electron transfer flavoprotein-ubiquinone oxidoreductase defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.definition: A deficiency of the electron transfer flavoprotein-ubiquinone oxidoreductase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.label: Lacticaciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000364.definition: An increased concentration of lactic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.label: Foam cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.definition: The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, where they ingest low-density lipoproteins and become laden with lipids, giving them a foamy appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.label: Recurrent myoglobinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.definition: Recurring episodes of myoglobinuria, i.e., of the presence of myoglobin in the urine. This is usually a consequence of rhabdomyolysis, i.e., of the destruction of muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.label: Cellular metachromasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.definition: Metachromasia (also known as metachromacy) is a characteristic color change which certain aniline dyes exhibit when bound to particular substances or when concentrated in solution. For example, the basic dye toluidine blue becomes distinctly pink when bound to cartilage matrix. In the sense used here, the metachromasia refers to a change in color not observed with normal tissues, anomalous staining with the cationic dyes toluidine blue O and Alcian blue resulting from excessive amounts of the polyanionic glycosaminoglycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.label: Reduced dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.definition: An abnormal reduction in dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase (NADP+) level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.label: Reduced level of N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase II
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.definition: An abnormality of glycoprotein metabolism related to a decreased level of alpha-1,6-mannosylglycoprotein 2-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.label: Decreased beta-glucocerebrosidase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.definition: Reduced level of the enzyme beta-glucosidase, an enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of glucosylceramide into ceramide and glucose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.label: Vascular granular osmiophilic material deposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.definition: Accumulation of granular osmiophilic material in blood vessel walls. Osmiophilic material becomes black upon staining with osmium tetroxide. Deposition of granular osmiophilic material (GOM) is the vascular pathological hallmark of CADASIL, which is the most prevalent hereditary small vessel disease and is caused by missense mutations in the NOTCH3 gene. GOM have been shown to contain NOTCH3 ectodomain (NOTCH3ECD) and extracellular matrix proteins, and can be visualized ultrastructurally in the tunica media of small arteries and capillaries. These electron dense GOM deposits are located in the basement membrane of mural cells, i.e. vascular smooth muscle cells and pericytes. In both manifest and pre-manifest CADASIL patients, GOM deposits are present not only in brain vessels, but also in vessels of other organs, such as the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.label: Hypomethioninemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000365.definition: A decreased concentration of methionine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000366.label: Amyotrophy of the musculature of the pelvis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000366.definition: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000367.label: Onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000367.definition: The age group in which disease manifestations appear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000367.label: Progressive
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000367.definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that increases in scope or severity over the course of time, i.e., that worsens with age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000367.label: Slowly progressive
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000367.definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that only slowly increases in scope or severity over the course of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000367.label: Rapidly progressive
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000367.definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that quickly increases in scope or severity over the course of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.label: Nonprogressive
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that does not increase in scope or severity over the course of time, i.e., that does not worsen with age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.label: Variable progression rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.definition: Applies to a disease manifestation that quickly increases in scope or severity with a rate that varies. For instance, progression may be slow in one time period and rapid in another.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.label: Centrally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.definition: An abnormality in which the nuclei of sarcomeres take on an abnormally central localization (or in which this feature is found in an increased proportion of muscle cells).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.label: Cytochrome C oxidase-negative muscle fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.definition: An abnormally reduced activity of the enzyme cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.label: Multiple mitochondrial DNA deletions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000368.definition: The presence of multiple deletions of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.label: Limb muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.definition: Reduced strength and weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.label: Scapular winging
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.definition: Abnormal protrusion of the scapula away from the surface of the back.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.label: Distal amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.definition: Muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.label: Late-onset proximal muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.definition: Lack of strength of the proximal musculature occurring late in the clinical course.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.label: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.label: Scapuloperoneal amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000369.definition: Muscular atrophy in the distribution of shoulder girdle and peroneal muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000370.label: Generalized amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000370.definition: Generalized (diffuse, unlocalized) amyotrophy (muscle atrophy) affecting multiple muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000370.label: Proximal muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000370.definition: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000370.label: Calf muscle pseudohypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000370.definition: Enlargement of the muscles of the calf due to their replacement by connective tissue or fat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.label: Exercise-induced muscle cramps
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by physical exertion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.label: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.definition: Abnormal increase in muscle size and mass not due to training.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.label: Muscle fiber necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.definition: Abnormal cell death involving muscle fibers usually associated with break in, or absence of, muscle surface fiber membrane and resulting in irreversible damage to muscle fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.label: Myofibrillar myopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.definition: Myofibrillar structural changes characterized by abnormal intracellular accumulation of the intermediate filament desmin and other proteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.label: Muscle mounding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000371.definition: Percussion-induced, local prolonged contractions (mounding) in muscle persisting for several seconds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000372.label: Generalized muscle hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000372.definition: Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle tissue in a generalized (not localized) distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000372.label: Neck flexor weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000372.definition: Weakness of the muscles involved in neck flexion (sternocleidomastoid, longus capitus, longus colli, and scalenus anterior).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000372.label: Shoulder girdle muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000372.definition: Amyotrophy affecting the muscles of the shoulder girdle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.label: EMG: myotonic runs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.definition: Spontaneous, repetitive electrical activity demonstrated by electromyography (EMG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.label: Quadriceps muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.definition: Weakness of the quadriceps muscle (that is, of the muscle fasciculus of quadriceps femoris).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.label: Autophagic vacuoles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.definition: The lysosomal-vacuolar pathway has a role in the controlled intracellular digestion of macromolecules such as protein complexes and organelles. This feature refers to the presence of an abnormally increased number of autophagic vacuoles in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.label: Mitochondrial myopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.definition: A type of myopathy associated with mitochondrial disease and characterized by findings on biopsy such as ragged red muscle fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.label: Exercise-induced myalgia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000373.definition: The occurrence of an unusually high amount of muscle pain following exercise.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.label: Myotonia with warm-up phenomenon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.definition: Myotonia that occurs after a period of rest and decreases with continuing exercise.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.label: Genetic anticipation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.definition: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that exhibits anticipation, the increase in severity and/or an earlier age of onset in subsequent generations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.label: Genetic anticipation with paternal anticipation bias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.definition: A type of genetic anticipation observed predominantly upon transmission from affected males.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.label: Sporadic
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.definition: Cases of the disease in question occur without a previous family history, i.e., as isolated cases without being transmitted from a parent and without other siblings being affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.label: Pelvic girdle muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000374.definition: Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000375.label: Increased muscle fatiguability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000375.definition: An abnormal, increased fatiguability of the musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000375.label: Episodic flaccid weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000375.definition: Recurrent episodes of muscle flaccidity, a type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000375.label: Type 1 fibers relatively smaller than type 2 fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000375.definition: The presence of abnormal muscle fiber size such that type 1 fibers are smaller than type 2 fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000375.label: Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000375.definition: A reduced amount of fat tissue in the lowest layer of the integument. This feature can be appreciated by a reduced skinfold thickness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.label: Percussion-induced rapid rolling muscle contractions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.definition: Mechanical percussion (i.e., striking a muscle with a reflex hammer) leads to spreading waves of muscle contractions that begin proximally and spread laterally across the muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.label: Calcinosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.definition: Formation of calcium deposits in any soft tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.label: Uterus didelphys
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.definition: A malformation of the uterus in which the uterus is present as a paired organ as a result of the failure of fusion of the mullerian ducts during embryogenesis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.label: Bruxism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.definition: Bruxism is characterized by the grinding of the teeth including the clenching of the jaw and typically occur during sleep, but also can occur while the affected individual is awake.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.label: Nevus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.definition: A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.label: Psoriasiform dermatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000376.definition: A skin abnormality characterized by redness and irritation, with thick, red skin that displays flaky, silver-white patches (scales).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000377.label: Pulp calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000377.definition: Pulp calcifications may appear as punctate calcifications, irregular, roughly spherical mineralized masses in any part of the pulp. It may occur isolated or associated to calcifications elsewhere such as the carotid arteries and kidneys. The diagnosis pulp calcifications can be established using radiological studies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000377.label: Stage 5 chronic kidney disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000377.definition: A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000377.label: Pili torti
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000377.definition: Pili (from Latin pilus, hair) torti (from Latin tortus, twisted) refers to short and brittle hairs that appear flattened and twisted when viewed through a microscope.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000378.label: Eunuchoid habitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000378.definition: A body habitus that is tall, slim and underweight, with long legs and long arms (i.e., arm span exceeds height by 5 cm or more).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000378.label: Decreased CSF homovanillic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000378.definition: Decreased concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000378.label: Type 1 and type 2 muscle fiber minicore regions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000378.definition: Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in type 1 and type 2 muscle fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000378.label: Minicore myopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000378.definition: Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in muscle fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000379.label: Short middle phalanx of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000379.definition: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of middle phalanx of toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000379.label: Irregular iliac crest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000379.definition: Irregularity of the iliac crest, which is the superior border of the wing of the ilium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000379.label: Limb-girdle muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000379.definition: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000379.label: Nemaline bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000379.definition: Nemaline rods are abnormal bodies that can occur in skeletal muscle fibers. The rods can be observed on histological analysis of muscle biopsy tissue or upon electron microscopy, where they appear either as extensions of sarcomeric Z-lines, in random array without obvious attachment to Z-lines (often in areas devoid of sarcomeres) or in large clusters localized at the sarcolemma or intermyofibrillar spaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000380.label: Muscle abnormality related to mitochondrial dysfunction
Type 1 muscle fiber predominance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000380.definition: An abnormal predominance of type I muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000380.label: Rimmed vacuoles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000380.definition: Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000380.label: Reduced intrathoracic adipose tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000380.definition: An abnormally reduced amount of adipose tissue in the thoracic cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000381.label: Neonatal death
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000381.definition: Death within the first 28 days of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000381.label: Death in childhood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000381.definition: Death in during childhood, defined here as between the ages of 2 and 10 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000382.label: Stillbirth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000382.definition: Death of the fetus in utero after at least 22 weeks of gestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000382.label: Variable expressivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000382.definition: A variable severity of phenotypic features.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000382.label: Typified by incomplete penetrance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000382.definition: Description of conditions in which not all individuals with a given genotype exhibit the disease. Penetrance is the proportion that develop disease given a lifespan of 80 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000383.label: Typified by age-related disease onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000383.definition: Description of conditions in which age of onset is typically later in life and in which penetrance is dependent on the age of the subject.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000383.label: Shoulder dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000383.definition: A displacement or misalignment of the humerus with respect to the other bones of the should joint. Note that a subluxation is a partial dislocation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000383.label: Shoulder subluxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000383.definition: A partial dislocation of the shoulder joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000383.label: Soft-tissue ossification around the shoulders
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000383.definition: Formation of calcified tissue in the soft tissues surrounding the shoulder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000384.label: Delayed upper limb epiphyseal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000384.definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more long bones of the upper limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000384.label: Fragmented epiphyses of the upper limbs
Irregular epiphyses of the upper limbs
Round epiphyses of the upper limbs
Small epiphyses of the upper limbs
Wide epiphyseal plates of the upper limbs
Cupped metaphyses of the upper limbs
Flared upper limb metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000384.definition: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones of the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000385.label: Lytic defects in metaphyses of the upper limbs
Normal density transverse bands in metaphyses of the upper limbs
Sclerosis with transverse striations in metaphyses of the upper limbs
Sclerosis of metaphyses of the upper limbs
Spurred metaphyses of the upper limbs
Upper limb metaphyseal widening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000385.definition: Increased width (breadth) of metaphyses of the arms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000385.label: Cortical diaphyseal irregularity of the upper limbs
Cortical diaphyseal thickening of the upper limbs

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000386.label: Diaphyseal sclerosis of the upper limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000386.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses of the arms. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000386.label: Broad diaphyses of the upper limbs
Absent humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000386.definition: Missing humerus bone associated with congenital failure of development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000386.label: Bowed humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000386.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000387.label: Humeral exostoses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000387.definition: Presence of more than one exostosis originating in one or noth humerus bones. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000387.label: Humeral lytic defects
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000387.definition: Destruction of an area of humerus bone due to a disease process, such as cancer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000388.label: Slender humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000388.definition: Reduction in diameter of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000389.label: Abnormality of the humeral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000389.definition: An anomaly of the humeral epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000389.label: Absent humeral epiphyseal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000389.definition: Lack of formation of bone in the epiphysis of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000389.label: Advanced ossification of the humeral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000389.definition: Ossification of the humeral epiphysis at an earlier age than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000389.label: Delayed humeral epiphyseal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000389.definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the humeral epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000389.label: Irregular ossification of the humeral epiphyses

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000390.label: Stippled calcification of the humeral epiphyses
Epiphyseal stippling of the humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000390.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the humeral epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000390.label: Broad humeral epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000390.definition: Increased width of the humeral epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000390.label: Wide epiphyses of the upper limbs
Abnormality of the humeral epiphyseal plate
Broad humeral epiphyseal plate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000390.definition: Increased width of the humeral epiphyseal growth plate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000390.label: Corner fracture of metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000390.definition: Fracture or fragmentation at the lateral portion of the metaphysis of a long bone. The radiographic appearance is that of a small corner of metaphysis separated from the metaphyseal edge by thin linear radiolucency. This feature can be observed in child abuse but fragmented appearance of the metaphysis or facture-like lesions can also be detected in the setting of certain skeletal dysplasias.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000390.label: Cortical subperiosteal resorption of humeral metaphyses

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000391.label: Flared humeral metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000391.definition: Flaring (increase of width with a splayed appearance) of the humeral metaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000391.label: Lytic defects of the humeral metaphysis
Sclerotic humeral metaphysis with longitudinal striations

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000392.label: Abnormal humeral diaphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000392.definition: An anomaly of the humeral diaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000392.label: Cortical irregularity of humeral diaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000392.definition: An abnormal irregularity of the cortical surface of the diaphysis (shaft) of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000392.label: Ground glass opacity of humeral diaphysis

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000393.label: Periosteal new bone of humeral diaphysis
Wide humeral diaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000393.definition: Increased width of the humeral diaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000393.label: Humeroulnar synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000393.definition: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the ulna and the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000394.label: Abnormality of the joint spaces of the elbow
Narrow joint spaces of the elbow
Irregular articular surfaces of the elbow joints
Abnormality of the epiphyses of the elbow
Delayed elbow epiphyseal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000394.definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more long bones that are part of the elbow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000395.label: Distal humeral metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000395.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis at the distal end of the humerus (at the elbow).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000395.label: Sclerotic foci of metaphyses of the elbow
Absent forearm bone
