http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000395.definition: Absence of one or more forearm bones associated with congenital failure of development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000395.label: Bone-in-a-bone appearance of forearm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000395.definition: A descriptive term for a forearm bone that appears to have an additional bone within it on radiography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000395.label: Bowed forearm bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000395.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting either the radius, the ulna, or both.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000395.label: Cortical thickening of the forearm bones

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000396.label: Fractured forearm bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000396.definition: Bone fracture in the radius, ulna, or wrist.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000396.label: Lytic defects of the forearm bones

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000397.label: Broad forearm bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000397.definition: Abnormally wide bone of the skeleton of forearm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000397.label: Absent radius
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000397.definition: Missing radius bone associated with congenital failure of development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000398.label: Aplasia of the ulna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000398.definition: Missing ulna bone associated with congenital failure of development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000399.label: Osteosclerosis of the ulna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000399.definition: Osteosclerosis (increased density related to increased bone mass) of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000399.label: Slender ulna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000399.definition: Reduction in diameter of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000399.label: Dislocated wrist
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000399.definition: An injury of the wrist with displacement of any of the eight carpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000400.label: Cone-shaped distal radial epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000400.definition: The distal epiphysis (rounded portion of bone at the far end of the radius distal to the growth plate) has an abnormal cone-shaped appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000401.label: Premature fusion of the radial epiphyseal plates
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000401.definition: A premature fusion of the epiphyseal plates of the radius. Epiphyseal plates are located at the distal and proximal ends of the long bones, in this case of the radius and premature fusion will have an effect on the growh of the radial bone, inhibiting or at least disturbing the normal growth and development of the bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000401.label: Broad radial epiphyseal plate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000401.definition: Abnormal increase in width of the epiphyseal growth plate of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000401.label: Flared radial metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000401.definition: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000401.label: Radial metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000401.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000402.label: Irregular ossification of the radial metaphysis
Sclerotic radial metaphysis with longitudinal striations
Broad radial metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000402.definition: Increase in width (breadth) of the radial metaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000402.label: Abnormality of radial diaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000402.definition: An anomaly of the radial diaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000403.label: Broad radial diaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000403.definition: Increase in width of the diaphysis of radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000403.label: Abnormal olecranon morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000403.definition: Any structural abnormality of the olecranon, a bony eminence of the proximal ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000403.label: obsolete Bony spicule of ulnar epiphyseal plate
Abnormal ulnar metaphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000403.definition: Any structural abnormality of the portion of the ulna between the epiphysis and the diaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000404.label: Ulnar metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000404.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000404.label: Sloping ulnar metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000404.definition: A sloped configuration of the metaphysis (shaft) of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000404.label: Wide ulnar metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000404.definition: Increase in width (breadth) of the ulnar metaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.label: Absent hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.definition: The total absence of the hand, with no bony elements distal to the radius or ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.label: Advanced ossification of the hand bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.definition: Ossification of hand bones at an earlier age than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.label: Delayed ossification of the hand bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.definition: Ossification of hand bones is less advanced than would be expected according to age-adjusted norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.label: Dysharmonic maturation of the hand bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.definition: Pattern of hand-wrist development does not fit the normal sequence of ossification of the individual bones of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.label: Sclerosis of hand bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.definition: Osteosclerosis affecting one or more bones of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.label: Mitten deformity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.definition: Fusion of the hands and feet by a thin membrane of skin (scarring) seen in forms of dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa and leading to a "mitten" hand deformity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.label: Radial club hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000405.definition: Wrist is bent inward toward the thumb because of a congenital defect associated with shortening or absence of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000406.label: Trident hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000406.definition: A hand in which the fingers are of nearly equal length and deflected at the first interphalangeal joint, so as to give a forklike shape consisting of separation of the first and second as well as the third and fourth digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000408.label: obsolete Laterally deviated terminal thumb phalanx

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000409.label: obsolete Advanced maturation/advanced ossification of terminal thumb phalanx epiphysis
Deviation of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000409.definition: Deviated fingers is a term that should be used if one or more fingers of the hand are deviated from their normal position, either to the radial or ulnar side. A deviation of a finger can be caused by an abnormal form of one or more of the phalanges of the affected finger, or by a deviation or displacement of one or more phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000409.label: Macrodactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000409.definition: Significant increase in the length and girth of most or all of a digit compared to its contralateral digit (if unaffected) or compared to what would be expected for age/body build. The increased girth is accompanied by an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension AND the lateral dimension of the digit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000410.label: Abnormal 2nd finger morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000410.definition: An anomaly of the second finger, also known as the index finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000411.label: obsolete Radially deviated index finger phalanges
Midline nasal groove
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000411.definition: An abnormal groove on the midline of the nose that may extend to the nasal tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000412.label: obsolete Radially displaced proximal index finger phalanx
Midline defect of the nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000412.definition: This term groups together three conditions that presumably represent different degrees of severity of a midline defect of the nose or nasal tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000413.label: Dimple on nasal tip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000413.definition: An abnormal indentation of the skin in the region of the nasal tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000413.label: obsolete Metaphyseal abnormality of middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
obsolete Flared metaphysis of middle phalanx of index finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000414.label: obsolete Radially deviated terminal index finger phalanx
obsolete Duplication of terminal index finger phalanx

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000415.label: Abnormal 3rd finger morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000415.definition: An anomaly of the third finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000416.label: obsolete Periosteal new bone of middle finger phalanges
obsolete Radially pointed middle finger phalanges
obsolete Radially pointed proximal middle-finger phalanx

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000417.label: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
obsolete Accessory middle phalanx of middle finger
obsolete Periosteal new bone of middle phalanx of middle-finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000418.label: Short distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000418.definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the distal phalanx of the third finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000418.label: obsolete Abnormality of the epiphyses of the terminal phalanx of the middle finger
obsolete Cone-shaped epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger
obsolete Fused epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger
obsolete Large epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger
obsolete Prematurely fused epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000419.label: obsolete Bracket epiphyses of the 4th finger
obsolete Expanded phalanges of the ring finger
obsolete Hypoplastic phalanges of the ring finger
Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000419.definition: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th (ring) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000419.label: obsolete Short phalanges of the ring finger
Symphalangism of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000419.definition: Fusion of two or more bones of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000419.label: obsolete Wide/broad phalanges of the ring finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000420.label: obsolete Expanded proximal phalanx of the ring finger
obsolete Lytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger
obsolete Short proximal phalanx of the ring finger
Abnormal 5th finger morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000420.definition: An abnormality affecting one or both 5th fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000420.label: Clinodactyly of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000420.definition: Clinodactyly refers to a bending or curvature of the fifth finger in the radial direction (i.e., towards the 4th finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000421.label: Abnormal 5th finger phalanx morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000421.definition: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th (little) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000421.label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000421.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the phalanges of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000421.label: Symphalangism of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000421.definition: Fusion of two or more bones of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000421.label: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.label: Short middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.definition: Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the fifth finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.label: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.definition: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.label: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.definition: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.label: Curved distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.definition: Curved appearance of the distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.label: Short distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000422.definition: Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the fifth finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.label: Subluxation of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the little finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.definition: A partial dislocation of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the little finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.label: Carpal bone aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.definition: Congenital absence of a carpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.label: Accessory carpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.definition: The presence of more than the normal number of carpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.label: Advanced ossification of carpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.definition: Ossification of carpal bones at an abnormally early age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.label: Bone-in-a-bone appearance of carpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.definition: The bone-in-bone sign is a radiographic finding produced by increased sclerosis (abnormally dense bone) occurring intermittently with zones of relatively normal bone density. This term should be used to describe such a finding in the carpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.label: Irregular carpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000423.definition: Carpal bones with irregular or fragmented margins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000424.label: Stippled calcification in carpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000424.definition: Point-shaped (punctate) calcifications affecting the carpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000424.label: Delayed ossification of the scaphoid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000424.definition: Formation of bone tissue of scaphoid is less than expected for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000425.label: Lunate-triquetral fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000425.definition: Osseous fusion of the lunate and triquetrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000425.label: Delayed ossification of the trapezium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000425.definition: Formation of bone tissue of trapezium is less than expected for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000425.label: Delayed ossification of the trapezoid bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000425.definition: Formation of bone tissue of trapezoid is less than expected for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000426.label: Narrow small joints of the hand
Osteoarthritis of the small joints of the hand
Subluxation of the small joints of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000426.definition: A partial dislocation of some or all of the small joints of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000427.label: Exostoses of hand bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000427.definition: Abnormal formation of new bone on the surface of a bone of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000427.label: Synostosis involving bones of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000427.definition: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000428.label: Narrow palm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000428.definition: For children from birth to 4 years of age, the palm width is more than 2 SD below the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is below the 5th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately narrow for its length.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.label: Sclerosis of hand bones with transverse striations
Subluxation of metacarpal phalangeal joints
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.definition: A partial dislocation affecting some or all of the metacarpophalangeal joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.label: Abnormal gastric mucosa morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.definition: An abnormality of the gastric mucous membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.label: Abnormality of the biliary system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.definition: An abnormality of the biliary system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.label: Abnormality of the abdominal wall
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.definition: The presence of any abnormality affecting the abdominal wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.label: Hernia of the abdominal wall
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000429.definition: The presence of a hernia in the abdominal wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000430.label: Abnormal muscle fiber morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000430.definition: Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000430.label: Involuntary movements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000430.definition: Involuntary contractions of muscle leading to involuntary movements of extremities, neck, trunk, or face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000430.label: Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000430.definition: Developmental defect characterized by an anomalous anatomic location of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000430.label: Ventricular preexcitation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000430.definition: An abnormality in which the cardiac ventricles depolarize too early as a result of an abnormality of cardiac conduction pathways such as an accessory pathway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000431.label: Decreased circulating antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000431.definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000431.label: Decreased circulating IgG level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000431.definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin G (IgG) in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.label: Vaginal fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.definition: The presence of a fistula of the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.label: Bladder fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.definition: The presence of a fistula connecting the urinary bladder to another organ or the skin. The fistula can involve the bowel, the vagina, or rarely, the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.label: Short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.definition: A height below that which is expected according to age and gender norms. Although there is no universally accepted definition of short stature, many refer to "short stature" as height more than 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender (or below the 3rd percentile for age and gender dependent norms).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.label: Abnormality of body weight
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.definition: An abnormal increase or decrease of weight or an abnormal distribution of mass in the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.label: Cachexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.definition: Severe weight loss, wasting of muscle, loss of appetite, and general debility related to a chronic disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.label: Abnormal vitreous humor morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.definition: Any structural anomaly of the vitreous body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.label: Abnormal anterior eye segment morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000432.definition: An abnormality of the anterior segment of the eyeball (which comprises the structures in front of the vitreous humour: the cornea, iris, ciliary body, and lens).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.label: Increased skull ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.definition: An increase in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.label: Decreased skull ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.definition: A reduction in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.label: Bone-marrow foam cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.definition: The presence of foam cells in the bone marrow, generally demonstrated by bone-marrow aspiration or biopsy. Foam cells have a vacuolated appearance due to the presence of complex lipid deposits, giving them a foamy or soap-suds appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.label: Dermal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.definition: Partial or complete wasting (atrophy) of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.label: Myelin outfoldings
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.definition: The presence of excessive redundant myelin in the peripheral nerve sheath.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.label: Abnormality of amino acid metabolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.definition: Abnormality of an amino acid metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.label: Abnormal circulating aromatic amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a aromatic amino acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.label: Abnormal circulating sulfur amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000433.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a sulfur amino acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.label: Abnormality of galactoside metabolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.definition: Abnormality of galactoside metabolism. A galactoside is a glycoside (a suger moiety bound to some other moiety) containing galactose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.label: Ganglioside accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.definition: Defects in the lysosomal glycosidases or specific co-activators, result in accumulation of the substrates, such as glycosphingolipids, including gangliosides in GM1 gangliosidosis (Tay-Sachs disease) and GM2 gangliosidosis (Sandhoff disease).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.label: Weakness of muscles of respiration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.definition: Reduced function of the muscles required to generate subatmospheric pressure in the thoracic cavity during breathing: the diaphragm, the external intercostal and the interchondral part of the internal intercostal muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.label: Abnormality of bone mineral density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.definition: This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.label: Reduced bone mineral density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000434.definition: A reduction of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.label: Abnormal circulating purine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a purine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.label: Abnormal circulating pyrimidine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a pyrimidine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.label: Abnormal circulating carboxylic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.label: Abnormal circulating leucine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.definition: Any deviation from the normal circulation of leucine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.label: Abnormal circulating fatty-acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000435.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.label: Abnormality of acid-base homeostasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.definition: An abnormality of the balance or maintenance of the balance of acids and bases in bodily fluids, resulting in an abnormal pH.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.label: Abnormal circulating leptin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.definition: An abnormal concentration of leptin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.label: Abnormal enteric ganglion morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.definition: An abnormality of the enteric nervous system, which comprises two types of ganglia, the myenteric (Auerbach's) and submucosal (Meissner's) plexuses. The enteric nervous system functions to control gut movement, fluid exchange between the gut and its lumen, and local blood flow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.label: Abnormal circulating calcium concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of calcium in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.label: Abnormal circulating nitrogen compound concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a nitrogen compound in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.label: Abnormal circulating tryptophan concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of tryptophan in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.label: Increased circulating purine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.definition: Abnormally elevated concentration of a purine compound. Purine compounds are aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.label: Decreased circulating purine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000436.definition: Abnormally reduced concentration of a purine compound. Purine compounds are aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.label: Reduced consciousness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.definition: Abnormally diminished level of attention, responsiveness, or wakefulness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.label: Focal dystonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.definition: A type of dystonia that is localized to a specific part of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.label: Hemiplegia/hemiparesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.definition: Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.label: Neoplasm of the nervous system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.label: Neuroblastic tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.definition: A family of tumors arising in the embryonal remnants of the sympathetic nervous system, which includes neuroblastoma, ganglioneuroblastoma, and ganglioneuroma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.label: Hematological neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.definition: Neoplasms located in the blood and blood-forming tissue (the bone marrow and lymphatic tissue).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.label: Abnormality of alkaline phosphatase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000437.definition: An abnormality of alkaline phosphatase level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.label: Aortic valve calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.definition: Deposition of calcium salts in the aortic valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.label: Supravalvular aortic stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.definition: A pathological narrowing in the region above the aortic valve associated with restricted left ventricular outflow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.label: Mitral valve calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.definition: Abnormal calcification of the mitral valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.label: Hypoplastic left heart
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.definition: Underdevelopment of the left side of the heart. May include atresia of the aortic or mitral orifice and hypoplasia of the ascending aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.label: Type I truncus arteriosus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.definition: Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) with a short pulmonary trunk arises from the truncus arteriosus, giving rise to both pulmonary arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.label: Gastrointestinal inflammation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.definition: Inflammation of the alimentary part of the gastrointestinal system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.label: Enterocolitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.definition: An inflammation of the colon and small intestine. However, most conditions are either categorized as Enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or Colitis (inflammation of the large intestine).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.label: Microcolon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.definition: A colon of abnormally small caliber.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.label: Intestinal pseudo-obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000438.definition: A functional rather than mechanical obstruction of the intestines, associated with manifestations that resemble those caused by an intestinal obstruction, including distension, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, constipation or diarrhea, in an individual in whom a mechanical blockage has been excluded.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.label: Hamartomatous polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.definition: Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas. These can occur throughout the gastrointestinal tract. Hamartomatous polyps are composed of the normal cellular elements of the gastrointestinal tract, but have a markedly distorted architecture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.label: Prune belly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.definition: A kind of congenital defect of the anterior abdominal wall in which the intestines are evident through the thin, lax, and protruding abdominal wall in affected infants.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.label: Malnutrition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.definition: A deficiency in the intake of energy and nutrients.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.label: Ectopic anus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.definition: Abnormal displacement or malposition of the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.label: Peptic ulcer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000439.definition: The term peptic ulcer refers to acid peptic injury of the digestive tract, resulting in mucosal break reaching the submucosa. Peptic ulcers are usually located in the stomach or proximal duodenum, but they can also be found in the oesophagus or Meckel's diverticulum. Infection with Helicobacter pylori and the use of non steroidal antiinflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or aspirin are the main risk factors of both gastric and duodenal peptic ulcers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000440.label: Meconium ileus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000440.definition: Obstruction of the intestine due to abnormally thick meconium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000440.label: Abnormality of the sense of smell
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000440.definition: An anomaly in the ability to perceive and distinguish scents (odors).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000440.label: Hyposmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000440.definition: A decreased sensitivity to odorants (that is, a decreased ability to perceive odors).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.label: Deviated nasal septum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.definition: Positioning of the nasal septum to the right or left in contrast to the normal midline position of the nasal septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.label: Abnormality of the pulmonary artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.definition: An abnormality of the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.label: Pulmonary artery stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.definition: An abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.label: Intermittent claudication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.definition: Intermittent claudication is a symptom of peripheral arterial occlusive disease. After having walked over a distance which is individually characteristic, the patients experience pain or cramps in the calves, feet or thighs which typically subsides on standing still.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.label: Thrombophlebitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.definition: Inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.label: Recurrent thrombophlebitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000441.definition: Repeated episodes of inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.label: Arterial thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.definition: The formation of a blood clot inside an artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.label: Elevated systolic blood pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.definition: Abnormal increase in systolic blood pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.label: Biparietal narrowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.definition: A narrowing of the biparietal diameter (i.e., of the transverse distance between the protuberances of the two parietal bones of the skull).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.label: Cranium bifidum occultum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.definition: Cranium bifidum occultum, also known as Catlin mark, is a congenital midline skull defect presenting as an enlarged posterior fontanelle in the upper posterior angle of the parietal bone close to the intersection of the sagittal and lambdoid sutures.1, 2, 3 Cranium bifidum occultum occurs due to a defect in intramembranous ossification, a process through which skull bones (frontal, parietal, squamous temporal and occipital bones superior to the mendosal suture) ossify under a vascularized membrane toward the midline to cover the brain.1, 4, 5 Unlike cranium bifidum cysticum, cranium bifidum occultum does not have herniation of intracranial contents. As the skull grows, the midline cranium bifidum occultum defect is separated into bilateral enlarged parietal foramina (EPF) by a midline osseous bridge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.label: Abnormal cheek morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.definition: An abnormality of the cheek- one of two bilateral soft tissue facial structures in the region of the face inferior to the eyes and between the nose and the ear. "Buccal" means relating to the cheek. The cheek is part of the midface

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.label: Elfin facies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.definition: This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.label: Recurrent viral infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000442.definition: Increased susceptibility to viral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.label: Severe combined immunodeficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.definition: A type of primary immune deficiency that is characterized by a more severe defect in both the T- and B-lymphocyte systems.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.label: Complement deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.definition: An immunodeficiency defined by the absent or suboptimal functioning of one of the complement system proteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.label: Agammaglobulinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.definition: A lasting absence of total IgG and total IgA and total IgM in the blood circulation, whereby at most trace quantities can be measured.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.label: Secretory IgA deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.definition: Deficiency of secretory IgA (polymers of 2-4 IgA monomers are linked by two additional chains) and is the primary antibody response at the mucosal level, where it forms immune complexes with pathogens and allergens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.label: Decreased circulating complement C8 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.definition: Concentration of the complement component C8 in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.label: Cranial hyperostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.definition: Excessive growth of the bones of cranium, i.e., of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.label: Hyperostosis frontalis interna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.definition: Bony overgrowth of the internal (endosteal) surface of the frontal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.label: Craniofacial dysostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000443.definition: A characteristic appearance resulting from defective ossification of craniofacial bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.label: Coronal craniosynostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.definition: Premature closure of the coronal suture of skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.label: Sagittal craniosynostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.definition: A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the sagittal suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.label: Lambdoidal craniosynostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.definition: A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the lambdoidal suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.label: Spherocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.definition: The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.label: Elliptocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.definition: The presence of elliptical, cigar-shaped erythrocytes on peripheral blood smear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.label: Stomatocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.definition: The presence of erythrocytes with a mouth-shaped (stoma) area of central pallor on peripheral blood smear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.label: Poikilocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.definition: The presence of abnormally shaped erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.label: Fulminant hepatic failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000444.definition: Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.label: Preauricular skin furrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.definition: A groove of the skin immediately in front of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.label: Postauricular skin tag
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.definition: A rudimentary tag of ear tissue often containing a core of cartilage and located just in back of the auricle (outer part of the ear).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.label: Abnormality of the middle ear ossicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.definition: An abnormality of the middle-ear ossicles (three small bones called malleus, incus, and stapes) that are contained within the middle ear and serve to transmit sounds from the air to the fluid-filled labyrinth (cochlea).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.label: Overfolding of the superior helices
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.definition: A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.label: Dilatated internal auditory canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.definition: The presence of a dilated inner part of external acoustic meatus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.label: Exostosis of the external auditory canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000445.definition: A benign bony growth projecting outward from a bone surface within the external auditory canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.label: Congenital earlobe sinuses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.definition: Pits in the earlobes at the location where ears are typically pierced for earrings.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.label: Absent brainstem auditory responses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.definition: Lack of measurable response to stimulation of auditory evoked potentials.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.label: Postauricular pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.definition: Benign congenital lesion of the postauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.label: Preauricular pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.definition: Small indentation anterior to the insertion of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.label: Anomalous tracheal cartilage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000446.definition: An abnormality of the C-shaped rings of hyaline cartilage, normally 16 to 20 in number, that occupy the anterior two-thirds of the circumference of the trachea (the posterior portion of the ring is completed by fibrous and smooth muscle tissue).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000447.label: Atretic occipital cephalocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000447.definition: A congenital defect in the occipital region of the skull, covered by skin of the scalp and containing meninges or remnants of glial or neural tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000447.label: Aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000447.definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp vertex, often just lateral to the midline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000447.label: Persistent open anterior fontanelle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000447.definition: The anterior fontanelle generally ossifies by around the 18th month of life. A persistent open anterior fontanelle is diagnosed if closure is delayed beyond this age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000447.label: Aplasia cutis congenita over parietal area
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000447.definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp in the parietal area.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.label: Progressive macrocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.definition: The progressive development of an abnormally large skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.label: Relative macrocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.definition: A relatively mild degree of macrocephaly in which the head circumference is not above two standard deviations from the mean, but appears dysproportionately large when other factors such as body stature are taken into account.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.label: Craniofacial asymmetry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.definition: Asymmetry of the bones of the skull and the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.label: Cessation of head growth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.definition: Stagnation of head growth seen as flattening of the head circumference curve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.label: Acrobrachycephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.definition: An abnormality of head shape characterized by the presence of a short, wide head as well as a pointy or conical form of the top of the head owing to premature closure of the coronal and lambdoid sutures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.label: Macrocephaly at birth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000448.definition: The presence of an abnormally large skull with onset at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000449.label: Large posterior fontanelle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000449.definition: An enlargement of the posterior fontanelle relative to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000449.label: Widely patent fontanelles and sutures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000449.definition: An abnormally increased width of the cranial fontanelles and sutures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000449.label: Craniofacial hyperostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000449.definition: Excessive growth of the craniofacial bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000449.label: Chronic rhinitis due to narrow nasal airway

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000450.label: Bilateral choanal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000450.definition: Bilateral absence (atresia) of the posterior nasal aperture (choana).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000451.label: Pancreatic islet-cell hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000451.definition: Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000452.label: Long eyebrows
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000452.definition: Increased length of the hairs of the eyebrows.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000452.label: Temporal hypotrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000452.definition: Reduced or lacking hair growth in the temporal region (i.e., around the temples on the side of the skull).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000452.label: Large clumps of pigment irregularly distributed along hair shaft
Generalized hypotrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000452.definition: Reduced or lacking hair growth in a generalized distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000453.label: Sacral hypertrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000453.definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the sacral region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000453.label: Anterior cervical hypertrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000453.definition: Anterior cervical hypertrichosis (ACH) or 'hairy throat' refers to the presence of a tuft of terminal hair on the anterior neck, just above the laryngeal prominence.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000454.label: Congenital, generalized hypertrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000454.definition: A confluent, generalized overgrowth of silvery blonde to gray lanugo hair at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000455.label: Cervical platyspondyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000455.definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates affecting the cervical spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000456.label: Increased spinal bone density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000456.definition: Increased bone density affecting the bones of the spine (vertebral column).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000456.label: Pear-shaped vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000456.definition: Bulbous appearance of the anterior vertebral bodies, such that the vertebral bodies have the greatest vertical height anteriorly as well as bulbous anterior superior-inferior contours.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000456.label: Beaking of vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000456.definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000457.label: Increased vertebral height
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000457.definition: Increased top to bottom height of vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000457.label: Anterior wedging of T11
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000457.definition: An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T11 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000457.label: Sclerotic vertebral endplates
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000457.definition: Sclerosis (increased density) affecting vertebral end plates.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000458.label: Anterior scalloping of vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000458.definition: An excessive concavity of the anterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000458.label: Biconcave vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000458.definition: Exaggerated concavity of the anterior or posterior surface of the vertebral body, i.e., the upper and lower vertebral endplates are hollowed inward.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000459.label: Thoracic platyspondyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000459.definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance beween the vertebral endplates affecting the thoracic spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000459.label: Hump-shaped mound of bone in central and posterior portions of vertebral endplate
Supernumerary vertebral ossification centers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000459.definition: Three ossification sites are present in typical vertebral bodies (C3-L5): a single ossification center in the vertebral body, and one each in the two neural arches. This term applies if there are additional vertebral ossification centers present during the development and maturation of the spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000459.label: Absent or minimally ossified vertebral bodies

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.label: Spina bifida occulta at L5
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.definition: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of the vertebra L5 with intact overlying skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.label: Cervical C2/C3 vertebral fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.definition: Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C2 and C3, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development, leading to a short neck with a low hairline at the back of the head, and restricted mobility of the upper spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.label: Absent vertebral body mineralization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.definition: A lack of bone mineralization of the vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.label: Unossified vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.definition: A lack of ossification of the vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.label: Anterior beaking of lower thoracic vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the lower thoracic vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.label: Anteriorly placed odontoid process
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000460.definition: Anterior mislocalization of the dens of the axis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000461.label: Lumbar spinal canal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000461.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the lumbar spinal canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000461.label: Spina bifida occulta at S1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000461.definition: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of S1 with intact overlying skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000461.label: Cleft vertebral arch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000461.definition: A discontinuity of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000461.label: Butterfly vertebral arch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000461.definition: Butterfly vertebrae have a cleft through the body of the vertebrae and a funnel shape at the ends.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000462.label: Enlarged vertebral pedicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000462.definition: Increased size of the vertebral pedicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000462.label: Progressive intervertebral space narrowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000462.definition: A progressive form of decreased height of the intervertebral disk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000462.label: Biconvex vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000462.definition: Presence of abnormal convexity of the upper and lower end plates of the vertebrae, i.e., an exaggerated bulging out of the upper and lower vertebral end plates.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.label: Anterior beaking of thoracic vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of thoracic vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.label: Decreased cervical spine flexion due to contractures of posterior cervical muscles
Cervical segmentation defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.definition: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation of cervical vertebrae during development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.label: Lower thoracic kyphosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.definition: Over curvature of the lower thoracic region, leading to a round back or if sever to a hump.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.label: Cervical C5/C6 vertebrae fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.definition: Fusion of the C5 and C6 cervical vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.label: Elevated amniotic fluid alpha-fetoprotein
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000463.definition: An elevation of alpha-feto protein measured in the amniotic fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000466.label: Hypoplasia of facial musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000466.definition: Underdevelopment of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000466.label: Frontalis muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000466.definition: Reduced strength of the frontalis muscle (which is located on the forehead).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000466.label: Facial midline hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000466.definition: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the midline region of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000467.label: Decreased facial expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000467.definition: A reduced degree of voluntary and involuntary facial movements involved in responded to others or expressing emotions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000468.label: Deep longitudinal plantar crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000468.definition: Narrow, paramedian longitudinal depressions in the plantar skin of the forefoot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000468.label: Talipes valgus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000468.definition: Outward turning of the heel, resulting in clubfoot with the person walking on the inner part of the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000468.label: Short third metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000468.definition: Underdevelopment of the Third metatarsal bone leading to a short (hypoplastic) third metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.label: Thickened Achilles tendon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.definition: An abnormal thickening of the Achilles tendon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.label: 2-3 toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes two and three.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.label: 4-5 toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes four and five.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.label: Calcaneal epiphyseal stippling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the calcaneus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.label: Osteoporotic metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000469.definition: Decrease in mass and density of the metatarsal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000471.label: Renal malrotation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000471.definition: An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal orientation of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000471.label: Reversible renal failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000471.definition: Acute renal failure with resolution of manifestations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000471.label: Axial malrotation of the kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000471.definition: An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal axial orientation of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000471.label: Hyperechogenic kidneys
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000471.definition: An increase in amplitude of waves returned in ultrasonography of the kidney, which is generally displayed as increased brightness of the signal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000472.label: Thickened glomerular basement membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000472.definition: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM), reflecting an increase in thickness (subjective estimate) of the basal lamina of the glomerulus of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000472.label: Calcium nephrolithiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000472.definition: The presence of calcium-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000472.label: Impaired renal concentrating ability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000472.definition: A defect in the ability to concentrate the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000472.label: Acute tubulointerstitial nephritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000472.definition: Acute inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000473.label: Impaired renal uric acid clearance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000473.definition: A reduction in the ability of the kidneys to remove uric acid from the serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000473.label: Renal cortical microcysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000473.definition: Cysts of microscopic size confined to the cortex of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000473.label: Crossed fused renal ectopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000473.definition: A developmental anomaly in which the kidneys are fused and localized on the same side of the midline. This anomaly is thought to result from disruption of the normal embryologic migration of the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000473.label: Global glomerulosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000473.definition: Obliteration of the glomerular capillary lumen by increased collagenous matrix, with or without hyalinosis or foam cells. Sclerosis involves 100% of the glomerular tuft. Relative to other patent glomeruli in the sample, glomerular size is preserved, or increased/decreased by no more than 50%.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000474.label: Abnormal renal collecting system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000474.definition: An abnormality of the renal collecting system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000474.label: Chronic tubulointerstitial nephritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000474.definition: Chronic inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000474.label: Glomerular subendothelial electron-dense deposits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000474.definition: Electron dense deposits at the glomerular basement membrane,

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000474.label: Atrial flutter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000474.definition: A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. Pathophysiologically, atrial flutter is a form of atrial reentry in which there is a premature electrical impulse creates a self-propagating circuit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.label: Paroxysmal ventricular tachycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.definition: Episodes of ventricular tachycardia that have a sudden onset and ending.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.label: Congenital atrioventricular dissociation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.definition: A form of atrioventricular (AV) dissociation (i.e., the atria and the ventricles are under the control of two separate pacemakers) with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.label: Permanent atrial fibrillation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.definition: Atrial fibrillation (AF) that cannot be successfully terminated by cardioversion, and longstanding (more than 1 year) AF, where cardioversion is not indicated or has not been attempted, is termed permanent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.label: Supraventricular tachycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.definition: Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an abnormally increased heart rate (over 100 beats per minute at rest) with origin above the level of the ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.label: Ventricular tachycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.definition: A tachycardia originating in the ventricles characterized by rapid heart rate (over 100 beats per minute) and broad QRS complexes (over 120 ms).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.label: Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.definition: Episodes of atrial fibrillation that typically last for several hours up to one day and terminate spontaneously.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.label: Effort-induced polymorphic ventricular tachycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.definition: Polymorphic ventricular arrhythmias of varying morphologythat do not exist under resting conditions but appear only upon physical exercise or catecholamine administration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000475.label: obsolete Nodular calcific aortic valve disease

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000476.label: Hypoplasia of right ventricle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000476.definition: Underdevelopment or reduced size of the heart right ventricle, often due to a reduced number of cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000476.label: Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000476.definition: An episodic form of supraventricular tachycardia with abrupt onset and termination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000476.label: Myxomatous mitral valve degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000476.definition: Myxomatous mitral valve is defined as the presence of excess leaflet tissue and leaflet thickening greater than 5 mm, resulting in a prolapse greater than 2 mm into the left atrium on parasternal long axis view.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000476.label: Sparse anterior scalp hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000476.definition: Decreased number of head hairs per unit area on the anterior region of the scalp.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.label: Elbow hypertrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the elbow region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.label: Duodenal polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.definition: Presence of multiple polyps in the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.label: Juvenile gastrointestinal polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.definition: The presence of multiple juvenile polyps in the stomach and intestine. The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. The juvenile polyp has a spherical appearance and is microscopically characterized by overgrowth of an oedematous lamina propria with inflammatory cells and cystic glands. Juvenile polyps are a specific type of hamartomatous polyps.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.label: Malrotation of colon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.definition: An anatomical anomaly that results from an abnormal rotation of the gut as it returns to the abdominal cavity during embryogenesis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.label: Fulminant hepatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.definition: Acute hepatitis complicated by acute liver failure with hepatic encephalopathy occurring less than 8 weeks after the onset of jaundice.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.label: Intestinal lymphedema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000478.definition: Fluid retention and edema in the intestine caused by a compromised lymphatic system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.label: Esophageal ulceration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.definition: Defect in the epithelium of the esophagus, essentially an open sore in the lining of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.label: Rectoperineal fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.definition: The presence of a fistula between the perineum and the rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.label: Malrotation of small bowel
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.definition: A deviation from the normal rotation of the midgut during embryologic development with mislocalization of the small bowel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.label: Hamartomatous stomach polyps
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.definition: Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas located in the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.label: Multiple small bowel atresias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.definition: The presence of multiple areas of atresia affecting the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.label: Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000479.definition: Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000480.label: Episodic hemolytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000480.definition: A form of hemolytic anemia that occurs in repeated episodes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000480.label: Congenital hemolytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000480.definition: A form of hemolytic anemia with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000480.label: Acute myeloid leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000480.definition: A form of leukemia characterized by overproduction of an early myeloid cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000480.label: Neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000480.definition: Low platelet count associated with maternal platelet-specific alloantibodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.label: Congenital hypoplastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.definition: A type of hypoplastic anemia with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.label: B Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.definition: A type of ALL characterized by elevated levels of B-cell lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.label: Post-transfusion thrombocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.definition: Sudden onset of thrombocytopenia (reduced platelet count) within 5-10 days of the transfusion of blood products. The clinical presentation is post-transfusion purpura (PTP), wigth severe thrmbocytopenia, epistaxis, and hemorrhages.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.label: Fava bean-induced hemolytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.definition: A kind of hemolytic anemia that is induced by the ingestion of fava beans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.label: Drug-sensitive hemolytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.definition: A form of hemolytic anemia that is triggered by ingestion of certain drugs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.label: Normocytic hypoplastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000481.definition: A type of hypoplastic anemia in which the erythrocytes have a normal cell volume (the mean corpuscular volume is within normal limits).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.label: Acute myelomonocytic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.definition: An acute leukemia characterized by the proliferation of both neutrophil and monocyte precursors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.label: Hypersegmentation of neutrophil nuclei
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.definition: An excessive division of the lobes of the nucleus of a neutrophil.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.label: Anisopoikilocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.definition: A type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence in the blood of erythrocytes of varying sizes and abnormal shapes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.label: Increased hemoglobin oxygen affinity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.definition: An abnormal increase in the binding affinity of hemoglobin for oxygen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.label: Folate-unresponsive megaloblastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.definition: A type of megaloblastic anemia that does not improve upon administration of folate. Since vitamin B12 acts by promoting recycling of folate, administration of vitamin B12 also does not improve this type of anemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.label: Refractory anemia with ringed sideroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000482.definition: A type of myelodysplastic syndrome characterized by less than 5% myeloblasts in the bone marrow, but with 15% or greater red cell precursors in the marrow being abnormal iron-stuffed cells called ringed sideroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000483.label: Recurrent thromboembolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000483.definition: Repeated episodes of obstruction of blood flow due to an embolus, i.e., blood clot that has traveled from its point of origin within the blood stream.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000483.label: Microspherocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000483.definition: The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped and reduced in size.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000483.label: Acute promyelocytic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000483.definition: A type of acute myeloid leukemia in which abnormal promyelocytes predominate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000483.label: Pyropoikilocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000483.definition: A form of severe hemolytic anemia characterized by erythrocyte morphology reminiscent of that seen in patients after a thermal burn.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.label: Hypochromic microcytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.definition: A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.label: Reduced factor XII activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.definition: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XII. Factor XII (fXII) is part of the intrinsic coagulation pathway and binds to exposed collagen at site of vessel wall injury, activated by high-MW kininogen and kallikrein, thereby initiating the coagulation cascade.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.label: Coombs-positive hemolytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.definition: A type of hemolytic anemia in which the Coombs test is positive.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.label: Acute monocytic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.definition: The accumulation of transformed primitive hematopoietic blast cells, which lose their ability of normal differentiation and proliferation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.label: Prolonged bleeding after surgery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.definition: Bleeding that persists longer than the normal time following a surgical procedure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.label: Ph-positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000484.definition: A subset of acute lymphoblastic leukemia that results from a reciprocal translocation between the ABL-1 oncogene and a breakpoint cluster region (BCR), resulting in a fusion gene, BCR-ABL, that encodes an oncogenic protein with constitutively active tyrosine kinase activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.label: Recurrent deep vein thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.definition: Repeated episodes of the formation of a blot clot in a deep vein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.label: Folate-responsive megaloblastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.definition: A type of megaloblastic anemia (i.e., anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal) that improves upon the administration of folate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.label: Reduced leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.definition: Decreased alkaline phosphatase measured within leukocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.label: Intermittent thrombocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.definition: Reduced platelet count that occurs sporadically, i.e., it comes and goes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.label: Reduced protein S activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.definition: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein S. Protein S is a cofactor of protein C.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.label: Normochromic microcytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.definition: A type of anemia characterized by an normal concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.label: Hyperchromic macrocytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.definition: A type of anemia characterized by abnormally large erythrocytes with abnormally high amounts of haemoglobin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.label: Amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia
