http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000485.definition: Thrombocytopenia related to lack of or severe reduction in the count of megakaryocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000486.label: Thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000486.definition: A type of megaloblastic anemia (i.e., anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal) that improves upon the administration of thiamine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000486.label: Refractory sideroblastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000486.definition: A type of sideroblastic anemia that is not responsive to treatment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000486.label: Impaired ADP-induced platelet aggregation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000486.definition: Abnormal platelet response to ADP as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ADP.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.label: Chronic hemolytic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.definition: An chronic form of hemolytic anemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.label: Perineal fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.definition: The presence of a fistula between the bowel and the perineum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.label: Incisional hernia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.definition: An abdominal hernia that occurs at a site of weakness in the abdominal wall resulting from an incompletely-healed surgical wound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.label: Spontaneous neonatal pneumothorax
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.definition: Pneumothorax occurring neonatally without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.label: Intercostal muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000487.definition: Lack of strength of the intercostal muscles, i.e., of the muscle groups running along the ribs that create and move the chest wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000488.label: Respiratory infections in early life
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000488.definition: Increased susceptibility to respiratory infections in early life, as manifested by recurrent episodes of respiratory infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000488.label: Respiratory failure requiring assisted ventilation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000488.definition: A state of respiratory distress that requires a life saving intervention in the form of gaining airway access and instituting positive pressure ventilation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000488.label: Intermittent episodes of respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000489.label: Elevated pulmonary artery pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000489.definition: An abnormally elevated blood pressure in the circulation of the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000489.label: Recurrent infections due to aspiration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000489.definition: Increased susceptibility to infections due to aspiration, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infections due to aspiration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000489.label: Stress/infection-induced lactic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000489.definition: A form of lactic acidemia that occurs in relation to stress or infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000489.label: Persistent lactic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000489.definition: A continuous form of lactic acidemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.label: Severe lactic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.definition: A severe form of lactic acidemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.label: Exercise-induced lactic acidemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.definition: A form of lactic acidemia that occurs following exercise or exertion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.label: Congenital lactic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.definition: A form of lactic acidemia with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.label: Maturity-onset diabetes of the young
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.definition: The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.label: Reduced circulating vitamin A concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000490.definition: Concentration of vitamin A below the lower limit of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000491.label: Episodic metabolic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000491.definition: Repeated transient episodes of metabolic acidosis, that is, of the buildup of acid or depletion of base due to accumulation of metabolic acids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000491.label: Intermittent lactic acidemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000491.definition: An intermittent (discontinuous) form of lactic acidemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000491.label: Recurrent infantile hypoglycemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000491.definition: Recurrent episodes of decreased concentration of glucose in the blood occurring during the infantile period.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000491.label: Hyperchloremic metabolic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000491.definition: A form of metabolic acidosis with increased serum chloride levels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.label: Abnormal magnesium concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.definition: An abnormality of magnesium ion homeostasis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.label: Hyperphenylalaninemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.definition: An increased concentration of L-phenylalanine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.label: Abnormal oral glucose tolerance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.definition: An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral administration of glucose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.label: Chronic lactic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.definition: A chronic form of lactic acidemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.label: Orthostatic hypotension due to autonomic dysfunction
Pulmonary artery dilatation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000492.definition: An abnormal widening of the diameter of the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.label: Arteriosclerosis of small cerebral arteries
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.definition: Arteriosclerosis (increased thickness, increased stiffness, loss of elasticity) of the small arteries of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.label: Ascending aortic dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.definition: A separation of the layers within the wall of the ascending aorta. Tears in the intimal layer result in the propagation of dissection (proximally or distally) secondary to blood entering the intima-media space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.label: Pulmonary artery atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.definition: A congenital anomaly with a narrowing or complete absence of the opening between the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.label: Venous thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.definition: Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.label: Pulmonary artery aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.definition: An aneurysm (severe localized balloon-like outward bulging) in the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.label: Tortuous cerebral arteries
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000493.definition: Excessive bending, twisting, and winding of a cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.label: Generalized arterial calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts, affecting arteries distributed throughout the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.label: Extrahepatic portal hypertension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.definition: Increased pressure in the pre-hepatic portal vein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.label: Aortic aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.definition: Aortic dilatation refers to a dimension that is greater than the 95th percentile for the normal person age, sex and body size. In contrast, an aneurysm is defined as a localized dilation of the aorta that is more than 150 percent of predicted (ratio of observed to expected diameter 1.5 or more). Aneurysm should be distinguished from ectasia, which represents a diffuse dilation of the aorta less than 50 percent of normal aorta diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.label: Accelerated atherosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.definition: Atherosclerosis which occurs in a person with certain risk factors (e.g., SLE, diabetes, smoking, hypertension, hypercholesterolaemia, family history of early heart disease) at an earlier age than would occur in another person without those risk factors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.label: Dilatation of the cerebral artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.definition: The presence of a localized dilatation or ballooning of a cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.label: Extracranial internal carotid artery dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the extracranial portion of the internal carotid artery wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.label: Arteriovenous fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.definition: An abnormal connection between an artery and vein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.label: Vascular tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000494.definition: Abnormal twisting of arteries or veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000495.label: Peripheral arterial stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000495.definition: Narrowing of peripheral arteries with reduction of blood flow to the limbs. This feature may be quantified as an ankle-brachial index of less than 0.9, and may be manifested clinically as claudication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000495.label: Pulmonary arteriovenous fistulas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000495.definition: A rare vascular anomaly with a direct communication between pulmonary artery and pulmonary vein without an intervening capillary bed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000495.label: obsolete Dilatation of the descending aorta
Generalized arterial tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000495.definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of arteries affecting most or all arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000495.label: Descending thoracic aorta aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000495.definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.label: Absent pulmonary artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.definition: A congenital defect with aplasia (absence) of one of the right or left pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.label: Pulmonary artery sling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.definition: An anomalous origin of the left pulmonary artery, such that it arises from the posterior aspect of the right pulmonary artery and passes between the trachea and esophagus to reach the left hilum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.label: Thoracic aorta calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the thoracic aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.label: Calcification of the aorta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.label: Pulmonary arterial medial hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.definition: Increase in mass of the tunica media of the arteries in the pulmonary circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.label: Medial calcification of large arteries
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of large (conduit) arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.label: Recurrent cerebral hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.definition: Recurrent bleeding into the parenchyma of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.label: Peripheral pulmonary artery stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000496.definition: Stenosis of a peripheral branch of the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.label: Ascending tubular aorta aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the tubular part of the ascending aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.label: Elevated mean arterial pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.definition: An abnormal increase in the average blood pressure in an individual during a single cardiac cycle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.label: Coarctation of abdominal aorta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.definition: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the abdominal aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.label: Erlenmeyer flask deformity of the femurs
Bilateral radial aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.definition: Missing radius bone on both sides associated with congenital failure of development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.label: Metaphyseal sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000497.definition: Abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000498.label: Metaphyseal rarefaction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000498.definition: Reduction in density of metaphyseal bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000498.label: Mesomelic leg shortening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000498.definition: Shortening of the middle parts of the leg in relation to the upper and terminal segments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000499.label: Rhizomelic arm shortening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000499.definition: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the arm (i.e. the humerus).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000499.label: Slender long bones with narrow diaphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000499.definition: Reduced diameter of a long bone with a more pronounced reduction of the diameter of the diaphysis of the long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000499.label: Multicentric ossification of proximal humeral epiphyses

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000500.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000500.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000500.label: Flattened proximal radial epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000500.definition: An abnormally flat form of the proximal epiphysis of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000500.label: Femoral bowing present at birth, straightening with time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000500.definition: Congenital onset bending or abnormal curvature of the femur that normalizes with age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000500.label: Dumbbell-shaped humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000500.definition: The humerus is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000501.label: Osteomyelitis leading to amputation due to slow healing fractures
Mesomelic arm shortening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000501.definition: Shortening of the middle parts of the arm in relation to the upper and terminal segments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000501.label: Dysplastic distal radial epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000501.definition: Abnormally developed (dysplastic) distal epiphysis of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000502.label: Hypoplastic distal humeri
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000502.definition: Underdevelopment of the distal portion of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.label: Distal ulnar hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.definition: Underdevelopment of the distal portion of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.label: Shortening of all phalanges of the toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.definition: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of all phalanges of the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.label: Unilateral ulnar hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.definition: Underdevelopment of the ulna on only one side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.label: Proximal radio-ulnar synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.definition: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the proximal portions of the radius and the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.label: Multiple long-bone exostoses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000503.definition: Multiple exostoses originating in long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000504.label: Irregular capital femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000504.definition: Irregular surface of the normally relatively smooth capital femoral epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000504.label: Proximal humeral metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000504.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis at the proximal end of the humerus (at the shoulder).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000504.label: Diaphyseal cortical sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000504.definition: An elevation in bone density of the cortex of one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000505.label: Anterolateral radial head dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000505.definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an anterolateral direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000505.label: Metaphyseal spurs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000505.definition: Bony outgrowths that extend laterally from the margin of the metaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000506.label: Cone-shaped epiphyses fused within their metaphyses
Proximal fibular overgrowth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000506.definition: Overgrowth of the proximal part of the fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000507.label: Proximal radial head dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000507.definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an proximal direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000507.label: Hyperextensibility at wrists
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000507.definition: The ability of the wrist joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000508.label: Anterior radial head dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000508.definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an anterior direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000508.label: Limited knee flexion/extension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000508.definition: A limited ability of the knee joint to perform extension and flexion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000508.label: Abnormal metaphyseal trabeculation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000508.definition: An abnormality of the pattern of trabecula (small interconnecting rods of bone) in a metaphyseal region of bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000509.label: Lateral femoral bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000509.definition: A lateral bending or abnormal curvature of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000509.label: Streaky metaphyseal sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000509.definition: The presence of streaks (bands) of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000509.label: Absent proximal radial epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000509.definition: Absence of the proximal radial epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000509.label: Distal femoral bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000509.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the distal portion of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.label: Premature birth following premature rupture of fetal membranes
High-frequency hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.definition: A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the higher frequencies of sound (3,000 to 6,000 Hz).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.label: Cochlear degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.definition: Deterioration or loss of the tissues of the cochlea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.label: Calcification of the auricular cartilage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.definition: Ossification affecting the external ear cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.label: Abnormality of the vertebral endplates
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.definition: Any abnormality of the vertebral end plates, which are the top and bottom portions of the vertebral bodies that interface with the vertebral discs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.label: Abnormal sacrum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.definition: An abnormality of the sacral bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.label: Abnormal intervertebral disk morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.definition: Any structural abnormality of the intervertebral disk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.label: Abnormality of the Achilles tendon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000510.definition: An abnormality of the Achilles tendon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.label: Atrial fibrillation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.definition: An atrial arrhythmia characterized by disorganized atrial activity without discrete P waves on the surface EKG, but instead by an undulating baseline or more sharply circumscribed atrial deflections of varying amplitude an frequency ranging from 350 to 600 per minute.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.label: obsolete Dilatation of the ascending aorta
Abdominal aortic aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the abdominal aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.label: Aortic arch aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic arch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.label: obsolete Abnormalities of the peripheral arteries
Supraventricular arrhythmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.definition: A type of arrhythmia that originates above the ventricles, whereby the electrical impulse propagates down the normal His Purkinje system similar to normal sinus rhythm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.label: Arterial tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.label: Elevated diastolic blood pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000511.definition: Abnormal increase in diastolic blood pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000512.label: Abnormal cardiac atrium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000512.definition: Any structural abnormality of a cardiac atrium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000512.label: Posterior scalloping of vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000512.definition: An excessive concavity of the posterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.label: Pericardial constriction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.definition: Compression of the heart caused by rigid, thickened, or fused pericardial membranes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.label: Right ventricular dilatation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.definition: Enlargement of the chamber of the right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.label: Absence of the pulmonary valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.definition: Refers to the specific combination of defects with a severely dysplastic pulmonary valve and massively dilated branch pulmonary arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.label: Abnormal T-wave
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.definition: An abnormality of the T wave on the electrocardiogram, which mainly represents the repolarization of the ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.label: Mitral annular calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000513.definition: Mitral annular calcification (MAC) results from progressive calcium deposition along and beneath the mitral valve annulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.label: Anomalous origin of right pulmonary artery from ascending aorta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.definition: The right pulmonary artery originates from the ascending aorta in the presence of a pulmonary valve and main pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.label: Ventricular septal hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.definition: The dividing wall between left and right sides of the heart, thickens and bulges into the left ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.label: Coronary artery stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.definition: Abnormal narrowing of the coronary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.label: Cardiac valve calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.definition: Abnormal calcification of a cardiac valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.label: Pulmonary valve defects
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000514.definition: Any defect in the valve connecting the heart and the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.label: Abnormal atrioventricular conduction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.definition: An impairment of the electrical continuity between the atria and ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.label: Preductal coarctation of the aorta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.definition: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized proximal to the ductus arteriosus, i.e., to the preductal region of aortic arch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.label: Histiocytoid cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.definition: A type of cardiomyopathy characterized pathologically by hamartomatous lesions of cardiac Purkinje cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.label: Ventricular escape rhythm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.definition: A ventricular escape rhythm occurs whenever higher-lever pacemakers in AV junction or sinus node fail to control ventricular activation. Escape rate is usually 20-40 bpm, often associated with broad QRS complexes (at least 120 ms).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.label: Concentric hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000515.definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an symmetrical and concentric pattern of hypertrophy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.label: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.definition: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return refers to a congenital malformation in which all four pulmonary veins do not connect normally to the left atrium, but instead drain abnormally to the right atrium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.label: Abnormal left ventricular function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.definition: Inability of the left ventricle to perform its normal physiologic function. Failure is either due to an inability to contract the left ventricle or the inability to relax completely and fill with blood during diastole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.label: Dysplastic pulmonary valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.definition: A congenital malformation of the pulmonary valve characterized by leaflet deformation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.label: Shortened PR interval
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.definition: Reduced time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex). In adults, normal values are 120 to 200 ms long.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.label: Elevated right atrial pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000516.definition: An abnormal increase in magnitude of the pressure in the right atrium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.label: Complete heart block with broad QRS complexes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.definition: A type of third degree heart block in which the escape rhythm arises at a relatively low part of the conduction system (below the atrioventricular node), which produces a wide QRS complex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.label: Left posterior fascicular block
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.definition: Conduction block in the posterior division of the left bundle branch of the bundle of His.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.label: Membranous subvalvular aortic stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.definition: Subvalvular stenosis is caused by a diaphragm-like membrane. The stenosis is clinically manifested like any other form of aortic stenosis but is often associated with some aortic insufficiency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.label: Dysplastic aortic valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.definition: A congenital malformation of the aortic valve characterized by leaflet deformation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.label: Premature arteriosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.definition: Arteriosclerosis occurring at an age that is younger than usual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.label: Complete heart block with narrow QRS complexes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000517.definition: A type of third degree heart block in which the escape rhythm arises at the atrioventricular node, which produces a narrow QRS complex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.label: Tricuspid regurgitation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.definition: Failure of the tricuspid valve to close sufficiently upon contraction of the right ventricle, causing blood to regurgitate (flow backward) into the right atrium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.label: Premature coronary artery atherosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.definition: Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries before age of 45.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.label: Bicuspid pulmonary valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.definition: The presence of a bicuspid pulmonary valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.label: Pericardial lymphangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.definition: An abnormal dilatation of lymph vessels in the pericardium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.label: Prolonged QTc interval
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.definition: A longer than normal interval (corrected for heart rate) between the Q and T waves in the heart's cycle. Prolonged QTc can cause premature action potentials during late phase depolarizations thereby leading to ventricular arrhythmias and ventricular fibrillations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.label: Global systolic dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.definition: A reduced ejection fraction and an enlarged left ventricle chamber, the latter by an increased resistance to filling with increased filling pressures. Systolic dysfunction is clinically associated with left ventricular failure in the presence of marked cardiomegaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.label: Synovial lining hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000518.definition: Synovial hyperplasia involves proliferation of mesenchymal stromal/stem cells and leads to synovial thickening, which can be observed radiographically.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000519.label: Flattened metatarsal heads
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000519.definition: Abnormally flat shape of the heads of the metatarsal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000519.label: Generalized morning stiffness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000519.definition: A sensation of stiffness in the joints that occurs following waking up in the morning.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000519.label: Stiff interphalangeal joints
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000519.definition: Interphalangeal joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in the interphalangeal joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000519.label: Aplasia of the abdominal wall musculature

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.label: Helicobacter pylori infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.definition: A recurrent infection of the GI tract with helicobacter pylori, a gram-negative, microaerophilic bacterium usually found in the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.label: Spontaneous esophageal perforation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.definition: The occurrence of the full-thickness tear (perforation) of the wall of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.label: Pancreatic pseudocyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.definition: Cyst-like space not lined by epithelium and contained within the pancreas. Pancreatic pseudocysts are often associated with pancreatitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.label: Secretory diarrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.definition: Watery voluminous diarrhea resulting from an imbalance between ion and water secretion and absorption.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.label: Intrahepatic bile duct cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000520.definition: The presence of cyst of the intrahepatic bile duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.label: Anal mucosal leukoplakia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.definition: Leukoplakia is a precancerous dermatosis of mucous membranes analogous Leukoplakia is basically a chronic inflammatory hypertrophy in which anaplasia and malignant dyskeratosis may develop and subsequently advance to an invasive squamous cell cancer. The clinical diagnosis of primary anal leukoplakia is indicated by single or multiple slightly raised,irregular, marginated, grayish-white keratinized' patches in the anal canal. Tissue biopsy is necessary for confirmation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.label: Pancreatic calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.definition: The presence of abnormal calcium deposition lesions in the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.label: Intestinal obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.definition: Blockage or impairment of the normal flow of the contents of the intestine towards the anal canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.label: Frequent Giardia lamblia infestation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.definition: Increased susceptibility to Giardia lamblia infection of the intestine, as manifested by a medical history of multiple episodes of Giardia lamblia intestinal infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.label: Impaired mastication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.definition: An abnormal reduction in the ability to masticate (chew), i.e., in the ability to crush and ground food in preparation for swallowing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.label: Anoperineal fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.definition: The presence of a fistula (abnormal tunnel) between the anal canal and the perineum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.label: Absence of intrinsic factor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000521.definition: Absence of gastric intrinsic factor, which is normally produced by the parietal cells of the stomach, and is required for the absorption of vitamin B12.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000522.label: Bowel diverticulosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000522.definition: The presence of multiple diverticula of the intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000522.label: Rectal abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000522.definition: A collection of pus in the area of the rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000522.label: Intestinal edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000522.definition: Accumulation of cell free, noninflammatony fluid within the wall of the intestinal tract producing uniform thickening of the mucosal folds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000522.label: Adenomatous colonic polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000522.definition: Presence of multiple adenomatous polyps in the colon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.label: Pancreatic dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.label: Hypoplasia of the gallbladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.definition: The presence of a hypoplastic gallbladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.label: Jejunal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.definition: A developmental defect resulting in abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the jejunum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.label: Chronic calcifying pancreatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.definition: A form of chronic pancreatitis that is characterized by calcification.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.label: Degenerative liver disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000523.definition: The presence of degenerative changes of the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.label: Total intestinal aganglionosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.definition: A congenital defect characterized by the lack of ganglion cells in the entire intestine, i.e., the aganglionic segment comprises the entire large and small bowel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.label: Extrahepatic biliary duct atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.definition: Atresia in the extrahepatic bile duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.label: Partial abdominal muscle agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.definition: Failure to form of portions of the abdominal musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.label: Giant hypertrophic gastritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.definition: A type of gastritis characterized by excessive proliferation of the gastric mucosa and diffuse thickening of the gastric mucosal folds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.label: Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
Intrahepatic biliary atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000524.definition: Atresia in the intrahepatic bile duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000525.label: Absence of pectoralis minor muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000525.definition: Aplasia (congenital absence) of the pectoralis minor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000525.label: Unilateral absence of pectoralis major muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000525.definition: Aplasia (congenital absence) of the pectoralis minor on only one side of the chest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000525.label: Abnormal facility in opposing the shoulders
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000525.definition: Increased range of shoulder movement related to aplasia or hypoplasia of the clavicles that results in the ability to approximate the shoulders in front of the chest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.label: Abnormal synovial membrane morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.definition: Any structural anomaly of the synovium, which is a membrane that lines the cavity of synovial joints and consists of a lining layer of macrophage-like synoviocytes and fibroblast-like synoviocytes, as well as a sublining of connective tissue. Synovial cells are thought to contribute to joint homeostasis by secreting various factors such as hyaluronic acid and lubricin important for joint lubrication and function, as well as disposing of the waste products.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.label: Gastritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.definition: The presence of inflammation of the gastric mucous membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.label: Abnormal jejunum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.definition: An abnormality of the jejunum, i.e., of the middle section of the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.label: Intestinal polyp
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.definition: A discrete abnormal tissue mass that protrudes into the lumen of the intestine and is attached to the intestinal wall either by a stalk, pedunculus, or a broad base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.label: Premature delivery because of cervical insufficiency or membrane fragility
Miscarriage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000526.definition: A pregnancy that ends at a stage in which the fetus is incapable of surviving on its own, defined as the spontaneous loss of a fetus before the 22th week of pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000527.label: Prominent nasolabial fold
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000527.definition: Exaggerated bulkiness of the crease or fold of skin running from the lateral margin of the nose, where nasal base meets the skin of the face, to a point just lateral to the corner of the mouth (cheilion, or commissure).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000527.label: Absent nasal septal cartilage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000527.definition: Lack of the cartilage of the nasal septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000528.label: Depressed nasal bridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000528.definition: Posterior positioning of the nasal root in relation to the overall facial profile for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000529.label: Intimal thickening in the coronary arteries
Arterial dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000529.definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of an artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000529.label: Pseudocoarctation of the aorta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000529.definition: Pseudocoarctation is a congenital anomaly of kinking, or buckling, of the aorta without a pressure gradient across the lesion. It is characterized by elongation and kinking of the aorta at the level of the ligamentum arteriosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000529.label: Premature occlusive vascular stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000529.definition: Peripheral arterial stenosis with onset before the age of 50 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000529.label: obsolete Atrioventricular canal defect with right ventricle aorta and pulmonary atresia

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.label: Persistent left superior vena cava
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.definition: A rare congenital vascular anomaly that results when the left superior cardinal vein caudal to the innominate vein fails to regress.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.label: Carotid artery tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the carotid arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.label: Aortic arch calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the arch of aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.label: Cerebral venous thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.definition: Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a cerebral vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.label: Capillary hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000530.definition: The presence of a capillary hemangioma, which are hemangiomas with small endothelial spaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.label: Large vessel vasculitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.definition: A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) affecting large arteries such as the aorta and branches of the aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.label: Agenesis of pulmonary vessels
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.definition: A developmental defect characterized by the lack of formation of the pulmonary blood vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.label: Pulmonary aterial intimal fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.definition: Formation of excess fibrous connective tissue in the tunica intima (innermost layer) of arteries in the pulmonary circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.label: Arterial fibromuscular dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.definition: An arterial lesion that is characterized by either intimal fibroplasia, with neointimal lesions of cells and matrix deposition, or medial fibroplasia, in which there is loss of smooth muscle cells and increased deposition of collagen and proteoglycans in the medial layer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.label: Anomalous branches of internal carotid artery
Increased pulmonary vascular resistance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.definition: Pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) more than 3 wood units, as defined by the current definition of pulmonary hypertension. 95% of individuals have a PVR of less than 2.4 wood units.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.label: Cerebral vasculitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000531.definition: Inflammation of the blood vessels within the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.label: Mandibulofacial dysostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.definition: A type of craniofacial dysostosis associated with abnormalities of the external ears, mirognathia, macrostomia, coloboma of the lower eyelid, and cleft palate. This is a bundled term that is left in the HPO now for convenience with legacy annotations but should not be used for new annotations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.label: Hemifacial hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.definition: Unilateral overgrowth of facial tissues, including muscles, bones and skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.label: Disturbance of facial expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.definition: An abnormality of the gestures or movements executed with the facial muscles with which emotions such as fear, joy, sadness, surprise, and disgust can be expressed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.label: Extension of hair growth on temples to lateral eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.definition: A pattern of hair growth in which there is hair extending from the temples to the lateral eyebrows.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.label: Progeroid facial appearance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000532.definition: A degree of wrinkling of the facial skin that is more than expected for the age of the individual, leading to a prematurely aged appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000533.label: Recurrent mandibular subluxations
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000533.definition: Recurrent partial dislocations of the mandible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000533.label: Sparse lateral eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000533.definition: Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of lateral eyebrow hairs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000533.label: Abnormality of complement system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000533.definition: An abnormality of the complement system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.label: Autonomic bladder dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.definition: Abnormal bladder function (increased urge or frequency of urination or urge incontinence) resulting from abnormal functioning of the autonomic nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.label: Abnormal carotid artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.definition: Any structural abnormality of the carotid arteries, including the common carotid artery and its' arterial branches.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.label: Abnormal vena cava morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.definition: An abnormality of the structure of the veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body into the heart, i.e., the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.label: Tracheal cartilaginous sleeve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.definition: Tracheal cartilaginous sleeve (TCS) is a rare congenital airway malformation in which distinct tracheal rings are replaced by a continuous cartilaginous segment. Vertically fused C- or O-shaped cartilaginous rings can extend from the subglottis to the carina or bronchus with little to no pars membranacea posteriorly. Comment:Tracheal cartilaginous sleeve has been associated with various craniosynostosis syndromes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.label: Inspiratory stridor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000534.definition: Inspiratory stridor is a high pitched sound upon inspiration that is generally related to laryngeal abnormalities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.label: Severe T-cell immunodeficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.definition: A primary immune deficiency that is characterized by defects or deficiencies of T-lymphocytes that causes specific susceptibility to intracellular micro-organisms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.label: Recurrent herpes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.definition: Increased susceptibility to herpesvirus, as manifested by recurrent episodes of herpesvirus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.label: Lack of T cell function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.definition: Complete inability of T cells to perform their functions in cell-mediated immunity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.label: Decreased circulating complement factor I concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.definition: Concentration of the complement component factor I in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.label: Defective B cell differentiation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.definition: Reduced functionality of the process in which a precursor cell type acquires the specialized features of a B cell. A B cell is a lymphocyte of B lineage with the phenotype CD19-positive and capable of B cell mediated immunity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.label: Aplasia of the thymus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000535.definition: Absence of the thymus. This feature may be appreciated by the lack of a thymic shadow upon radiographic examination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.label: Susceptibility to chickenpox
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.definition: Increased susceptibility to chicken pox, as manifested by recurrent episodes of chicken pox.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.label: Humoral immunodeficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.definition: A general term referring to a defect in immunity resulting from impaired antibody production.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.label: Severe B lymphocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.definition: A severe form of B lymphocytopenia in which the count of B cells is very low or absent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.label: Recurrent streptococcus pneumoniae infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.definition: Increased susceptibility to streptococcus pneumoniae infections as manifested by a history of recurrent infections by streptococcus pneumoniae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.label: Abnormality of humoral immunity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.definition: An abnormality of the humoral immune system, which comprises antibodies produced by B cells as well as the complement system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.label: Decreased circulating complement factor H concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000536.definition: Concentration of the complement component factor H in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000537.label: Abnormality of B cell physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000537.definition: An abnormality of the physiological functioning of B cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000537.label: Cellular immunodeficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000537.definition: An immunodeficiency characterized by defective cell-mediated immunity or humoral immunity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000537.label: Recurrent Haemophilus influenzae infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000537.definition: Increased susceptibility to Haemophilus influenzae infections as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection by Haemophilus influenzae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.label: Recurrent meningococcal disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.definition: Recurrent infections by Neisseria meningitidis (one of the most common causes of bacterial meningitis), which is also known as meningococcus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.label: Defective B cell activation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.definition: A reduced ability of a B cell to become activated, i.e., the change in morphology and behavior of

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.label: Recurrent protozoan infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.definition: Increased susceptibility to protozoan infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of protozoan infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.label: Combined immunodeficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.definition: A group of phenotypically heterogeneous genetic disorders characterized by profound deficiencies of T- and B-cell function, which predispose the patients to both infectious and noninfectious complications.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.label: Depletion of components of the alternative complement pathway
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000538.definition: An abnormal reduction in the components of the alternative complement pathway, such as the C3 protein or its cleavage products.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000539.label: Recurrent opportunistic infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000539.definition: Increased susceptibility to opportunistic infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection by opportunistic agents, i.e., by microorganisms that do not usually cause disease in a healthy host, but are able to infect a host with a compromised immune system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000539.label: Susceptibility to coronavirus 229e
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000539.definition: Increased susceptibility to coronavirus 229e, as manifested by recurrent episodes of coronavirus 229e.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.label: Reduction of neutrophil motility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.definition: An abnormal reduction of the cell motility of neutrophils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.label: Recurrent candida infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.definition: An increased susceptibility to candida infections, as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of candida infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.label: T lymphocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.definition: An abnormally low count of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.label: Increased B cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.definition: An abnormal increase from the normal count of B cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.label: Recurrent bacterial skin infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.definition: Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections of the skin, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infectious dermatitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.label: Decreased proportion of CD4-positive helper T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.definition: A decreased proportion of circulating CD4-positive helper T cells relative to total T cell count.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000540.label: obsolete Markedly reduced T cell function

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.label: Chronic intestinal candidiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.definition: Persistent overgrowth of Candida albicans in the gastrointestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.label: Increased alpha-globulin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.definition: An abnormally increased level of circulating alpha-globulin. Alpha globulins are a group of serum proteins defined by their mobility on serum electrophoresis. The alpha1-protein fraction is comprised of alpha1-antitrypsin, thyroid-binding globulin, and transcortin. Ceruloplasmin, alpha2-macroglobulin, and haptoglobin contribute to the alpha2-protein band. The alpha2 component is increased as an acute-phase reactant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.label: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.definition: A decreased proportion of circulating CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells relative to total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.label: Decreased circulating complement factor B concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.definition: Concentration of the complement component factor B in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.label: Decreased T cell activation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000541.definition: Decreased or impaired activation of T cells in response to a mitogen, cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or an antigen for which it is specific.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.label: Recurrent gram-negative bacterial infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.definition: Increased susceptibility to infection by gram-negative bacteria, as manifested by a medical history of repeated or frequent infections by these agents.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.label: Decreased circulating complement C3 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.definition: Concentration of the complement component C3 in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.label: Absence of CD8-positive T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.definition: Lack of detectible CD8-positive T cells

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.label: Dysfunctional alternative complement pathway
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.definition: An abnormality of the functioning of any aspect of the alternative complement pathway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.label: Absent specific antibody response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.definition: Absence of specific immunoglobulins directed against a specific antigen or microorganism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.label: Recurrent sinopulmonary infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.definition: An increased susceptibility to infections involving both the paranasal sinuses and the lungs, as manifested by a history of recurrent sinopulmonary infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.label: Recurrent systemic pyogenic infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000542.definition: Increased susceptibility to systemic pyogenic infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of systemic pyogenic infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000543.label: Recurrent Neisserial infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000543.definition: Recurrent infections by bacteria of the genus Neisseria, including N. meningitidis (one of the most common causes of bacterial meningitis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000543.label: Transient hypogammaglobulinemia of infancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000543.definition: At birth, newborns are endowed with maternal antibodies. IgG production normally begins at the age of two months. A delay in recovery from this physiological hypogammaglobulinemia between the 3rd and the 6th month of life, and of recovery period between 18 and 36 months defines transient newborn hypogammaglobulinemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000543.label: Impaired T cell function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000543.definition: Abnormally reduced ability of T cells to perform their functions in cell-mediated immunity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000543.label: Recurrent infections in infancy and early childhood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000543.definition: Recurrent infections at an early age with improvement in later childhood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000544.label: Sclerotic cranial sutures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000544.definition: An increased density in the cranial sutures following obliteration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000544.label: Widely patent coronal suture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000544.definition: The presence of a coronal suture (the cranial suture that separates the frontal and parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000544.label: Enlarged posterior fossa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000544.definition: Abnormal increased size of the posterior cranial fossa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000544.label: Obtuse angle of mandible
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000544.definition: Abnormally flat (obtuse) angle of the mandible. The angle of the mandibular, located at the junction between the body and the ramus of the mandible, is normally close to being a right angle. This terms describes an abnormal increase of this angle such that the mandible appears flatter than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000545.label: Calvarial osteosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000545.definition: An increase in bone density affecting the calvaria (roof of the skull).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000545.label: Absent/hypoplastic paranasal sinuses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000545.definition: Aplasia or hypoplasia of the paranasal sinuses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000545.label: Premature closure of fontanelles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000545.definition: Normally, the posterior and lateral fontanelles are obliterated by about six months after birth, the anterior fontanelle closes by about the middle of the second year. This term refers to the situation in which the fontanelles close at an inappropriately early time point.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000546.label: Calcification of falx cerebri
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000546.definition: The presence of calcium deposition in the falx cerebri.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000546.label: Craniofacial osteosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000546.definition: Abnormally increased density of craniofacial bone tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000546.label: Facial hyperostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000546.definition: Excessive growth (overgrowth) of the facial bones, that is of the facial skeleton.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000546.label: Flat occiput
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000546.definition: Reduced convexity of the occiput (posterior part of skull).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.label: Fusion of middle ear ossicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.definition: Bony fusion of malleus, incus, and stapes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.label: Decreased calvarial ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.definition: Abnormal reduction in ossification of the calvaria (roof of the skull consisting of the frontal bone, parietal bones, temporal bones, and occipital bone).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.label: Widely patent sagittal suture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.definition: The presence of a sagittal suture (the cranial suture that separates the left and right parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.label: Progressive sclerosis of skull base
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.definition: Progressively increasing bone density of the skull base without significant changes in bony contour.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.label: Decreased circulating IgE
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000547.definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin E (IgE) in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000548.label: Abnormality of the alternative complement pathway
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000548.definition: A deviation in any aspect of the alternative complement pathway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000548.label: Secondary microcephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000548.definition: Head circumference which falls below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender because of insufficient head growth after birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000548.label: Small fontanelle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000548.definition: A fontanelle that is small for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000548.label: Prominent metopic ridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000548.definition: Vertical bony ridge positioned in the midline of the forehead.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000549.label: Postnatal macrocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000549.definition: The postnatal development of an abnormally large skull (macrocephaly).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000549.label: Metopic suture patent to nasal root
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000549.definition: The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone in infants and usually fuses by the age of six years. The suture runs from the bregma (the point on the skull at which the coronal suture is intersected perpendicularly by the sagittal suture) to the nasion or nasal root. This term applies if the suture is widely patent from bregma to nasal root.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000549.label: Midline skin dimples over anterior/posterior fontanelles

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000550.label: Chronic myelogenous leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000550.definition: A myeloproliferative disorder characterized by increased proliferation of the granulocytic cell line without the loss of their capacity to differentiate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000550.label: Hemoglobin Barts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000550.definition: Normal adult hemoglobin is composed of two chains each of alpha and beta globin. Hb Barts (Hemoglobin Barts) is a tetramer with four gamma globin chains, and is essentially pathognomonic for one or another form of alpha thalassemia. Hb Barts has an extremely high affinity for oxygen, resulting in almost no oxygen delivery to the tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000550.label: Monoclonal immunoglobulin M proteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000550.definition: Presence of a monoclonal immunoglobulin M protein in the serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.label: Transient erythroblastopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.definition: A transient reduction in the number of erythroblasts in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.label: Heinz body anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.definition: Anemia characterized by abnormal intracellular inclusions, composed of denatured hemoglobin, found on the membrane of red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.label: Impaired neutrophil killing of staphylococci
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.definition: A reduction in the ability of neutrophils to kill the gram-positive bacteria, staphylococcus, which is commonly known as staph.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.label: Increased megakaryocyte count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.definition: Increased megakaryocyte number, i.e., of platelet precursor cells, present in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.label: T-cell lymphoma/leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.definition: A type of T-cell lymphoma in which cancerous T-cells may present in the blood (leukemia), lymph nodes (lymphoma), skin or in multiple areas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.label: Increased mean corpuscular volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000551.definition: Larger than normal size of erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.label: Chronic disseminated intravascular coagulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.definition: A chronic form of disseminated intravascular coagulation in which a persistent weak or intermittent activating stimulus is present and destruction and production of coagulation factors and platelets are balanced.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.label: Disseminated intravascular coagulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.definition: Disseminated intravascular coagulation is characterized by the widespread activation of coagulation, which results in the intravascular formation of fibrin and ultimately thrombotic occlusion of small and midsize vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.label: Pyridoxine-responsive sideroblastic anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.definition: A type of sideroblastic anemia that is alleviated by pyridoxine (vitamin B-6) treatment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.label: Lymphoid leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.definition: A malignant lymphocytic neoplasm of B-cell or T-cell lineage involving primarily the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. This category includes precursor or acute lymphoblastic leukemias and chronic leukemias.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.label: Reduced kininogen activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.definition: Reduction in the amount of kininogen, which functions as a cofactor in the contact phase of the intrinsic blood coagulation cascade.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.label: Bone marrow hypocellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000552.definition: A reduced number of hematopoietic cells present in the bone marrow relative to marrow fat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.label: Biphenotypic acute leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.definition: A type of actue leukemia with features characteristic of both the myeloid and lymphoid lineages. These leukemias are for this reason are designated mixed-lineage, hybrid or biphenotypic acute leukemias.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.label: Transient myeloproliferative syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.definition: A unique clonal neoplastic disorder that is linked to trisomy 21, is restricted to neonatal period, and spontaneously regresses. It often has characteristics of megakaryocytic lineage and is associated with GATA1 mutations in myeloblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.label: Exercise-induced hemolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.definition: A form of hemolytic anemia that can be triggered by exertion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.label: Decreased mean platelet volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.definition: Average platelet volume below the lower limit of the normal reference interval.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.label: T cell chronic lymphocytic lymphoma/leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000553.definition: A form of lymphoid leukemia or lymphoma in which too many T-cell lymphoblasts are found in the blood, bone marrow, and tissues. Leukemia or lymphoma classification depends on which feature is more prominent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.label: Red blood cell keratocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.definition: A form of poikilocytosis in which the abnormally shaped erythrocytes have notches that results in projections that look like horns.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.label: Congenital agranulocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.definition: Congenital onset of a marked decrease in the number of granulocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.label: Prolonged whole-blood clotting time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.definition: An abnormal prolongation (delay) in the time required by whole blood to produce a visible clot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.label: Reduced protein C activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.definition: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein C. Protein C is activated to protein Ca by thrombin bound to thrombomodulin. Activated protein C degrades factors VIIIa and Va.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.label: Myeloproliferative disorder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000554.definition: Proliferation (excess production) of hemopoietically active tissue or of tissue which has embryonic hemopoietic potential.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000555.label: Chronic lymphatic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000555.definition: A chronic lymphocytic/lymphatic/lymphoblastic leukemia (CLL) is a neoplastic disease characterized by proliferation and accumulation (blood, marrow and lymphoid organs) of morphologically mature but immunologically dysfunctional lymphocytes. A CLL is always a B-cell lymphocytic leukemia as there are no reports of cases of T-cell lymphocytic leukemias.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000555.label: Abnormality of the metopic suture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000555.definition: The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone of the skull in infants and children and generally undergoes fusion by the age of six. A persistent frontal suture is referred to as a "metopic suture".

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000555.label: Abnormal zygomatic arch morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000555.definition: An abnormality of the zygomatic arch, also known as the cheek bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000555.label: Chronic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000555.definition: A slowly progressing leukemia characterized by a clonal (malignant) proliferation of maturing and mature myeloid cells or mature lymphocytes. When the clonal cellular population is composed of myeloid cells, the process is called chronic myelogenous leukemia. When the clonal cellular population is composed of lymphocytes, it is classified as chronic lymphocytic leukemia, hairy cell leukemia, or T-cell large granular lymphocyte leukemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.label: Imbalanced hemoglobin synthesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.definition: Normal hemoglobin synthesis is characterized by production of equal amounts of alpha and beta globins. This term refers to a deviation from this pattern and is the main characteristic of the various forms of thalassemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.label: Abnormal bone marrow cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.definition: An anomaly of the form or number of cells in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.label: Multiple renal cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.definition: The presence of many cysts in the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.label: Decreased numbers of nephrons
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.definition: A reduction in the count of nephrons per kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.label: Absence of renal corticomedullary differentiation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.definition: A lack of differentiation between renal cortex and medulla on diagnostic imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.label: Reduced renal corticomedullary differentiation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.definition: Reduced differentiation between renal cortex and medulla on diagnostic imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.label: Renal magnesium wasting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000556.definition: High urine magnesium in the presence of hypomagnesemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000557.label: Non-acidotic proximal tubulopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000557.definition: A type of proximal renal tubulopathy characterized by resorption defects leading to glycosuria, aminoaciduria, tubular proteinuria, renal hypophosphatemia, and urate tubular hyporeabsorption without bicarbonate loss.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000557.label: Hemolytic-uremic syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000557.definition: A thrombotic microangiopathy with presence of non-immune, intravascular hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia and acute kidney injury. A vicious cycle of complement activation, endothelial cell damage, platelet activation, and thrombosis is the hallmark of the disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000557.label: Tubulointerstitial fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000557.definition: A progressive detrimental connective tissue deposition (fibrosis) on the kidney parenchyma involving the tubules and interstitial tissue of the kidney. Tubulointerstitial injury in the kidney is complex, involving a number of independent and overlapping cellular and molecular pathways, with renal interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy (IF/TA) as the final common pathway. However, IF and TA are separable, as shown by the profound TA in renal artery stenosis, which characteristically has little or no fibrosis (or inflammation). For new annotations it is preferable to annotate to the specific HPO terms for Renal interstitial lfibrosis and/or Renal tubular atrophy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000557.label: Impaired renal ltubular reabsorption of chloride
