http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000557.definition: Any impairment of reabsorption of chloride by the kidney in order to not lose too much chloride in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000558.label: Duplication of renal pelvis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000558.definition: A duplication of the renal pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000558.label: Tubular basement membrane disintegration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000558.definition: DIsruption and breaking up of the basement membrane of the tubules of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000558.label: Renal cell carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000558.definition: A type of carcinoma of the kidney with origin in the epithelium of the proximal convoluted renal tubule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000558.label: Patchy palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000558.definition: A focal type of palmoplantar keratoderma in which only certain areas of the palms and soles are affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000559.label: Giant melanosomes in melanocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000559.definition: The presence of large spherical melanosomes (1 to 6 micrometer in diameter) in the cytoplasm of melanocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000559.label: Macular hypopigmented whorls, streaks, and patches
Congenital alopecia totalis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000559.definition: Loss of all scalp hair with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000559.label: Facial telangiectasia in butterfly midface distribution
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000559.definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin in a butterfly midface distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000560.label: Congenital giant melanocytic nevus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000560.definition: The giant congenital nevus is greater than 8 cm in size, pigmented and often hairy. A giant congenital nevus is smaller in infants and children, but it usually continues to grow with the child.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000560.label: Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000560.definition: Large hypermelanotic macules with jagged borders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000560.label: Bilobate gallbladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000560.definition: The presence of a bilobed gallbladder, related to a duplication of the gallbladder primordium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000561.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the femur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000561.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000561.label: Accelerated skeletal maturation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000561.definition: An abnormally increased rate of skeletal maturation. Accelerated skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000561.label: Thoracolumbar kyphosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000561.definition: Hyperconvexity of the thoracolumbar spine producing a rounded or humped appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.label: Hypermobility of interphalangeal joints
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.definition: The ability of the interphalangeal joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.label: Trapezoidal vertebral body
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.definition: An anomalous trapezoidal appearance of a vertebral body. A trapezoid is a four-sided shape that has two sides that are parallel and two sides that are not parallel. In this case, the two lateral sides of the vertebra are parallel, and the top and the bottom are slanted with respect to each other such that the vertebra is shorter in the fron or back than on the other side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.label: Broad long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.definition: Increased cross-section (diameter) of the long bones. Note that widening may primarily affect specific regions of long bones (e.g., diaphysis or metaphysis), but this should be coded separately.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.label: Absent ossification of calvaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.definition: Absent ossification of the calvaria (vault of the skull).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.label: Posterior fusion of lumbosacral vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.definition: Bony fusion of the posterior part of the L5 vertebral body with the sacrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.label: Type D brachydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000562.definition: This type of brachydactyly is characterized by short and broad terminal phalanges of the thumbs and big toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000563.label: Decreased anterioposterior diameter of lumbar vertebral bodies
Hyperextensible hand joints
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000563.definition: The ability of the joints of the hand to move beyond their normal range of motion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000564.label: Intervertebral disk calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000564.definition: The presence of abnormal calcium deposition of the intervertebral disk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000564.label: Bilateral ulnar hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000564.definition: Underdevelopment of the ulna on both sides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000565.label: 2-5 finger cutaneous syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000565.definition: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the second to the fifth fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000565.label: Cortical sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000565.definition: Sclerosis (abnormal hardening) of cortical bone, characterized by increased radiodensity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000565.label: Multiple digital exostoses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000565.definition: Multiple exostoses originating in the fingers and toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000565.label: Positional foot deformity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000565.definition: A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the muscle and soft tissue. In contrast if the bones of the foot are affected the term structural foot deformity applies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000566.label: Salmonella osteomyelitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000566.definition: Osteomyelitis caused by infection with the bacteria, salmonella.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000566.label: Massively thickened long bone cortices
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000566.definition: Extreme thickening of the cortex of long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000566.label: Os odontoideum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000566.definition: Separation of the odontoid process from the body of the axis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000567.label: Bilateral intracerebral calcifications
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000567.definition: Deposition of calcium salts on both sides of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000567.label: Dupuytren contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000567.definition: An abnormality of the hand resulting from contracture of the palmar fascia with a fixed flexion deformity of the metacarpophalangeal (MCP) joints and the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000568.label: Tongue-like lumbar vertebral deformities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000568.definition: A tongue-like protusion from the anterior aspect of lumbar vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000568.label: Distal arthrogryposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000568.definition: An inherited primary limb malformation disorder characterized by congenital contractures of two or more different body areas and without primary neurologic and/or muscle disease that affects limb function.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000568.label: Patchy osteosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000568.definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000568.label: Dysplastic distal thumb phalanges with a central hole

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000569.label: Joint hyperflexibility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000569.definition: Increased mobility and flexibility in the joint due to the tension in tissues such as ligaments and muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000569.label: Partial fusion of proximal row of carpal bones
Postaxial polydactyly type A
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000569.definition: Supernumerary digits located at the ulnar side of the hand with a complete extra finger and extra metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000570.label: Increased bone density with cystic changes
Bilateral triphalangeal thumbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000570.definition: A bilateral form of triphalangeal thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000572.label: Shortening of all metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000572.definition: Abnormal reduction in length of all metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000572.label: Hyperextensible thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000572.definition: The ability of the thumb joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000572.label: Nonopposable triphalangeal thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000572.definition: A form of triphalangeal thumb that cannot be placed opposite the fingers of the same hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000573.label: Cortical irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000573.definition: An abnormal irregularity of cortical bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000573.label: Spinal stenosis with reduced interpedicular distance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000573.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal related to a reduction in the interpedicular distance (i.e., the distance measured between the pedicles on frontal [coronal] imaging).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000573.label: Posterior subluxation of radial head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000573.definition: Partial dislocation of the head of the radius in the posterior direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000574.label: Avascular necrosis of the capital femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000574.definition: Avascular necrosis of the proximal epiphysis of the femur occurring in growing children and caused by an interruption of the blood supply to the head of the femur close to the hip joint. The necrosis is characteristically associated with flattening of the femoral head, for which reason the term coxa plana has been used to refer to this feature in the medical literature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000574.label: obsolete Generalized osteoporosis with pathologic fractures
Osteosclerosis of the base of the skull
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000574.definition: An increase in bone density affecting the basicranium (base of the skull).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000575.label: Lower-limb joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000575.definition: A limitation in the passive range of motion of a joint of the lower limb resulting from loss of elasticity in the periarticular tissues owing to structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules or skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000575.label: Neonatal epiphyseal stippling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000575.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses during the neonatal period.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000575.label: Basilar impression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000575.definition: Abnormal elevation of the floor of the posterior fossa including occipital condyles and foramen magnum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000575.label: Small flat posterior fossa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000575.definition: An abnormally small and flat configuration of the posterior cranial fossa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000576.label: 2-4 toe cutaneous syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000576.definition: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the toes 2, 3, and 4.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000576.label: Fifth finger distal phalanx clinodactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000576.definition: Bending or curvature of the distal phalanx of little finger in the radial direction (i.e., towards the 4th finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000577.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tibia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000577.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000577.label: Short forearm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000577.definition: Underdevelopment of both forearm bones, the ulna and the radius, resulting in a shortened forearm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000578.label: Absent fourth finger distal interphalangeal crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000578.definition: Absence of the distal interphalangeal flexion creases of the fourth finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000578.label: Lumbar platyspondyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000578.definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance beween the vertebral endplates affecting the lumbar spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000578.label: Generalized osteosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000578.definition: An abnormal increase of bone mineral density with generalized involvement of the skeleton.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000579.label: Cortical thickening of long bone diaphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000579.definition: Abnormal thickening of the cortex of the diaphyseal region of long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000579.label: Shortening of all distal phalanges of the toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000579.definition: Abnormally short distal phalanx of toe of all toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000579.label: Posterior radial head dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000579.definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an posterior direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000581.label: Supernumerary ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000581.definition: The presence of more than 12 rib pairs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000581.label: Postaxial polysyndactyly of foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000581.definition: Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the foot on the lateral side (i.e., on the side of the little toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000581.label: Short middle phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000581.definition: Short (hypoplastic) middle phalanx of finger, affecting one or more fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000582.label: Clinodactyly of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000582.definition: Bending or curvature of a second toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000583.label: Flexion contracture of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000583.definition: One or more bent (flexed) toe joints that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000583.label: Dysharmonic delayed bone age
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000583.definition: A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is a delay in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000583.label: obsolete Joint swelling onset late infancy
obsolete Joint dislocations in young adult

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000584.label: Calcific stippling of infantile cartilaginous skeleton
Rounded middle phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000584.definition: An abnormally round shape of the middle phalanx of the finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000584.label: Diffuse cerebral calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000584.definition: Generalized deposition of calcium salts within the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000585.label: Multiple prenatal fractures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000585.definition: The presence of bone fractures in the prenatal period that are diagnosed at birth or before.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000585.label: Ulnar radial head dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000585.definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an ulnar direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000586.label: Type E brachydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000586.definition: In type E brachydactyly, shortening of the fingers is mainly in the metacarpals and metatarsals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000586.label: Pseudoarthrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000586.definition: A pathologic entity characterized by a developmental defect in a long bone leading to bending and pathologic fracture, with inability to form a normal bony callus with subsequent fibrous nonunion, leading to the pseudarthrosis (or "false joint").

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000586.label: Opposable triphalangeal thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000586.definition: A form of triphalangeal thumb that can be placed opposite the fingers of the same hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000586.label: Metaphyseal enchondromatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000586.definition: An enchondroma is a benign growth of cartilage that develops within the medullary cavity of bone. Enchondromatosis refers to the presence of multiple enchondromas, and this term refers to the presence of multiple enchondromas within the medulla of metaphyseal bone. Radiographically an enchondroma presents a an oval, linear, or pyramidal osteolytic (radiolucent) lesion with well defined margins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000587.label: Metaphyseal chondrodysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000587.definition: An abnormality of skeletal development characterized by a disturbance of the metaphysis and its histological structure with relatively normal epiphyses and vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000587.label: Brachytelomesophalangy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000587.definition: Disproportionately short middle and distal phalanges compared to the hand/foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000587.label: Polysyndactyly of hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000587.definition: Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the great toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000587.label: Enlarged sagittal diameter of the cervical canal
Congenital finger flexion contractures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000587.definition: Multiple bent (flexed) finger joints that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000588.label: Metacarpophalangeal synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000588.definition: Fusion of a metacarpal bone with the proximal phalanx of the finger distal to it across the corresponding metacarpophalangeal joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000588.label: Absent ossification of cervical vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000588.definition: A lack of bone mineralization of one or more body of cervical vertebra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000588.label: Aphalangy of the hands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000588.definition: Absence of a digit or of one or more phalanges of a finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000589.label: Hyperostosis cranialis interna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000589.definition: Bony overgrowth of the internal (endosteal) surface of the calvaria and the base of skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000589.label: Progressive forearm bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000589.definition: Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of the forearm skeleton.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000589.label: Double first metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000589.definition: Duplication of the metacarpal I bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000589.label: Radial deviation of thumb terminal phalanx

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000590.label: Fifth metacarpal with ulnar notch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000590.definition: Presence of an angular or V -shaped indentation on the ulnar side of the fifth metacarpal bone (i.e., on the sides towards the fifth finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000590.label: Abnormal cervical curvature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000590.definition: The presence of an abnormal curvature of the cervical vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000590.label: Delayed pneumatization of the mastoid process
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000590.definition: An abnormally reduced degree of pneumatization (i.e., formation of air cells) in the mastoid process with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.label: Rhomboid or triangular shaped 5th finger middle phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.definition: Rhomboid or triangular shaped 5th (little) finger middle phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the metacarpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.label: Abnormal metacarpal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.definition: Any abnormal shape or structure of the metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.label: Supernumerary metacarpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.definition: The presence of more than the normal number of metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.label: Abnormal finger phalanx morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000591.definition: Abnormalities affecting the phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.label: Abnormal epiphysis morphology of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand. Note that this includes the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.label: obsolete Abnormal ossification of hand bones
Abnormal hand morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.definition: Any structural anomaly of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.label: Abnormal hand epiphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.definition: Any abnormality of the epiphyses of the phalanges or metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.label: Abnormal hand cortical bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.definition: An anomaly of the outer shell (cortex) of a hand bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000592.definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000593.label: Abnormal epiphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000593.definition: An anomaly of epiphysis, which is the expanded articular end of a long bone that developes from a secondary ossification center, and which during the period of growth is either entirely cartilaginous or is separated from the shaft by a cartilaginous disk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000593.label: Abnormal renal corticomedullary differentiation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000593.definition: An abnormality of corticomedullary differentiation (CMD) on diagnostic imaging such as magnetic resonance imaging, computer tomography, or sonography. CMD is a difference in the visualization of cortex and medulla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000593.label: Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000593.definition: Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the motile cilium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.label: Desquamative interstitial pneumonitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.definition: Diffuse filling of the distal airsspaces of the lungs, the alveoli, with macrophages. Desquamative interstitial pneumonitis (DIP) is characterized additionally by thickend alveolar septa and by a sparse inflammatory infiltrate that often includes plasma cells and occasional eosinophils. The alveoli are lined by plump cuboidal pneumocytes. Lymphoid aggregates may be present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.label: Bilateral lung agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.definition: Bilateral lack of development of the lungs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.label: Laryngeal obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.definition: Blockage of the upper airway at the level of the larynx often accompanied by respiratory distress.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.label: Ventilator dependence with inability to wean
Decreased sensitivity to hypoxemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.definition: Reduced tendency to respond to a reduced concentration of oxygen in the blood by increasing respiration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.label: Multiple pulmonary cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.definition: The presence of multiple lung cysts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.label: Apneic episodes in infancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000594.definition: Recurrent episodes of apnea occurring during infancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000595.label: Laryngeal web
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000595.definition: A membrane-like structure that extends across the laryngeal lumen close to the level of the vocal cords.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000595.label: Anteroposteriorly shortened larynx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000595.definition: Abnormal shortening of the larynx in the anteroposterior (front to back) axis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000596.label: Hypoargininemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000596.definition: A decreased concentration of arginine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000596.label: Temperature instability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000596.definition: Disordered thermoregulation characterized by an impaired ability to maintain a balance between heat production and heat loss, with resulting instability of body temperature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000597.label: Respiratory acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000597.definition: Acidosis because of respiratory retention of carbon dioxide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000597.label: Fructose intolerance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000597.definition: Reduced intestinal absorption of fructose. Breath testing after ingestion of fructose has been widely adopted as a standard method of identifying fructose malabsorption and intolerance. A dose of 25 g of fructose dissolved in a 10% solution is generally accepted as the appropriate dose of fructose for clinical use of H2 and CH4 breath testing. High levels of hydrogen in exhaled breath subsequent hours indicate fructose intolerance. Presence of malabsorption and reproduction of symptoms during a breath test provides the best objective evidence and symptom correlation for fructose intolerance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000597.label: Type II diabetes mellitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000597.definition: A type of diabetes mellitus initially characterized by insulin resistance and hyperinsulinemia and subsequently by glucose interolerance and hyperglycemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000597.label: Metabolic ketoacidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000597.definition: A metabolic acidosis due to accumulation of ketone bodies generally observed in the setting of poor nutritional intake.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000598.label: Elevated maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000598.definition: An elevation of alpha-feto protein in the maternal serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000598.label: Multinodular goiter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000598.definition: Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to multiple nodules in the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000598.label: Congenital muscular torticollis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000598.definition: A congenital form of torticollis resulting from shortening of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and leading to a limited range of motion in both rotation and lateral bending.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000598.label: Redundant neck skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000598.definition: Excess skin around the neck, often lying in horizontal folds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.label: Thyroid hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.label: Limited neck flexion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.definition: Reduced abilty to lower the chin towards the chest by bending the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.label: Nodular goiter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.definition: Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to one or more nodules in the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.label: Decreased adipose tissue around neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.definition: Reduced amount of adipose tissue in the region of the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.label: Ureteral atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000599.definition: A developmental defect defined by the failure of the formation of the lumen (tube) of the ureter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000600.label: Ureteral obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000600.definition: Obstruction of the flow of urine through the ureter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000600.label: Hypotrophy of the small hand muscles
Broad phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000600.definition: Increased side-to-side width of one or more phalanges of the fingers or toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000601.label: Cuboidal metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000601.definition: Severely shortened metacarpal with a cuboidal appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000601.label: Delayed phalangeal epiphyseal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000601.definition: Delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000602.label: Metaphyseal cupping of metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000602.definition: Metaphyseal cupping affecting the metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000604.label: Y-shaped metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000604.definition: Y-shaped metacarpals are the result of a partial fusion of two metacarpal bones, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Y-shaped metacarpals may be seen in combination with polydactyly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000604.label: Distal widening of metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000604.definition: Abnormal increase in width of the distal region of the metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000605.label: Cone-shaped metacarpal epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000605.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpal bones, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000606.label: Multiple carpal ossification centers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000606.definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000607.label: Metacarpophalangeal joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000607.definition: A chronic loss of joint motion in metacarpophalangeal joints due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000607.label: Absent proximal finger flexion creases
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000607.definition: Absence of the proximal interphalangeal flexion creases of the fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000609.label: Malaligned carpal bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000609.definition: Malalignement of carpal bone angles either with respect to each other, to the corresponding metacarpals or with respect to the wrist (radius and ulna).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000609.label: 3-4 finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000609.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers three and four.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000609.label: Metacarpophalangeal joint hyperextensibility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000609.definition: Increased mobility of one ore more metacarpophalangeal joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000610.label: Finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000610.definition: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000610.label: Fingerpad telangiectases
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000610.definition: Telangiectasia (small dilated blood vessels) located in the fingerpads at the tips of the fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000610.label: Tapered metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000610.definition: Metacarpal that becomes thinner toward the distal end.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000610.label: Absent phalangeal crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000610.definition: Absence of one or more interphalangeal creases (i.e., of the transverse lines in the skin between the phalanges of the fingers).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000611.label: Shortening of all middle phalanges of the fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000611.definition: Short, hypoplastic middle phalanx of finger, affecting all fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000611.label: Expanded phalanges with widened medullary cavities
Multiple palmar creases
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000611.definition: The presence of multiple creases on the palm of the hand (more than the normal three major creases (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, and thenar crease).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000611.label: Shortening of all distal phalanges of the fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000611.definition: Hypoplasia of all of the distal phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000611.label: Proximal tapering of metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000611.definition: Some or all of the metacarpal bones (i.e., metacarpal II to V) have a pointed proximal appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000612.label: Acral ulceration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000612.definition: A type of digital ulcer that manifests as an open sore on the surface of the skin at the tip of a finger or toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000612.label: Long proximal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000612.definition: Increased length of the proximal phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000612.label: Drumstick terminal phalanges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000612.definition: Rounding and broadening of the tufts of the distal phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000613.label: Enlarged metacarpal epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000613.definition: Abnormally large size of one or more growth plates (epiphyses) of the metacarpal bones (i.e., the tubular bones of the hand between the carpus and the phalanges).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.label: Premature fusion of phalangeal epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.definition: Fusion of the epiphysis and metaphysis of one or more phalanges prior to the normal age or stage of growth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.label: Abnormal finger flexion crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.definition: Anomalous flexion crease (i.e., a transverse line that crosses the skin of a finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.label: Shortening of all proximal phalanges of the fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.definition: Congenital hypoplasia of proximal phalanx of finger or all fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.label: Central Y-shaped metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.definition: A central Y-shaped metacarpal is the result of a partial fusion of two central metacarpals (i.e., metacarpals 2-4) of the hand, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Central Y-shaped metacarpals may be seen as a result of a central polydactyly with partial fusion of the duplicated metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.label: Broad metacarpal epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000614.definition: Increased side-to-side width of the metacarpal epiphyses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.label: Swan neck-like deformities of the fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.definition: A swan neck deformity describes a finger with a hyperextended PIP joint and a flexed DIP joint. The most common cause for a swan neck-like deformity is a disruption of the end of the extensor tendon. Conditions that loosen the PIP joint and allow it to hyperextend, for example conditions that weaken the volar plate, can produce a swan neck deformity of the finger. One example is rheumatoid arthritis. Another cause are conditions that tighten up the small (intrinsic) muscles of the hand and fingers, for example hand trauma or nerve disorders, such as cerebral palsy, Parkinson's disease, or stroke.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.label: Proximal symphalangism of hands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.definition: The term proximal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the proximal interphalangeal joint (PIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the proximal interphalangeal finger creases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.label: Long phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.definition: Increased length of multiple or a single phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.label: Ulnar deviation of thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.definition: Bending or curvature of a thumb towards the ulnar side (towards the ring finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.label: Mesoaxial hand polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000615.definition: The presence of a supernumerary finger (not a thumb) involving the third or fourth metacarpal with associated osseous syndactyly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000616.label: Irregular metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000616.definition: Irregular morphology of one or more metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000616.label: Short metacarpals with rounded proximal ends
Soft tissue swelling of interphalangeal joints

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000617.label: Chess-pawn distal phalanges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000617.definition: A morphological abnormality of distal phalanges such that they have the appearance of chess pawns.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000617.label: Flattened, squared-off epiphyses of tubular bones
Metacarpal diaphyseal endosteal sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000617.definition: Increase in bone density in the diaphyseal (shaft) region of a metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000617.label: Two carpal ossification centers present at birth

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000618.label: Decreased palmar creases
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000618.definition: Poorly defined or shallow palmar creases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000619.label: Deep palmar crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000619.definition: Excessively deep creases of the palm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000619.label: Tapered phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000619.definition: Phalanges of the fingers becoming thinner toward the distal end.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000619.label: Thimble-shaped middle phalanges of hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000619.definition: The middle phalanx of finger resembles a thimble, a small metal cap to protect the finger while sewing that has a broad (proximal) base and narrower top, whereby both base and top are flat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000620.label: Decreased movement range in interphalangeal joints
Irregular phalanges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000620.definition: Alteration of the normally smooth radiographic contour of phalanges producing an irregular appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000620.label: Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of second finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000620.definition: Presence of an additional phalanx-like bone, producing an extra, wedge-shaped bone at the base of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000620.label: Metaphyseal cupping of proximal phalanges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000620.definition: Metaphyseal cupping affecting the proximal phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000621.label: Thin proximal phalanges with broad epiphyses of the hand
Single interphalangeal crease of fifth finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000621.definition: Presence of only one (instead of two, as normal) interphalangeal crease of the fifth finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000621.label: Limited mobility of proximal interphalangeal joint

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000622.label: Tapering pointed ends of distal finger phalanges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000622.definition: A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end such that the tip of the phalanx comes to a point (this feature can be observed on radiograms).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000622.label: Osteoarthritis of the first carpometacarpal joint

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000623.label: Expanded metacarpals with widened medullary cavities
Osteoarthritis of the distal interphalangeal joint
Osteolysis involving tarsal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000623.definition: An increased resorption of bone matrix by osteoclasts leading to bony defects involving the tarsal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000623.label: Slender metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000623.definition: Decreased width of the metacarpal bones (that is, reduced diameter).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000623.label: Shortening of all middle phalanges of the toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000623.definition: Abnormal shortening of all middle phalanges of toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000624.label: Limited wrist movement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000624.definition: An abnormal limitation of the mobility of the wrist.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000625.label: Elevated circulating alpha-fetoprotein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000625.definition: Concentration of alpha-fetoprotein in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000626.label: Abnormal phalangeal joint morphology of the hand
Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000626.definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000626.label: Fluctuating splenomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000626.definition: Intermittently increased size of the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000627.label: Pancreatic lymphangiectasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000627.definition: The presence of lymphangiectasis in the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000627.label: Reduced pancreatic beta cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000627.definition: Reduced number of beta cells in the pancreatic islets of Langerhans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000627.label: Ectopic pancreatic tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000627.definition: The presence of pancreatic tissue outside the normal pancreas, in many cases along the foregut and proximal midgut.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.label: Generalized hypoplasia of dental enamel
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.definition: A generalized form of developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.label: Multiple unerupted teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.definition: The presence of multiple embedded tooth germs which have failed to erupt.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.label: Enamel hypomineralization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.definition: A decreased amount of enamel mineralization. Hypomineralized enamel has a brown discoloration and brittle aspect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.label: Advanced eruption of teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.definition: Premature tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD earlier than the mean eruption age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.label: Agenesis of central incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000628.definition: Agenesis of one or more central incisors, i.e., of lower secondary incisor, lower primary incisor, upper secondary incisor, or of upper central primary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000629.label: Discolored lateral incisors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000629.definition: The presence of discolored lateral incisors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000629.label: Marked delay in eruption of permanent teeth
Agenesis of maxillary central incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000629.definition: Agenesis of upper secondary incisor or of upper central primary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000629.label: Enamel hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000629.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000629.label: Prolonged bleeding after dental extraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000629.definition: Prolonged bleeding post dental extraction sufficient to require medical intervention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000630.label: Dagger-shaped pulp calcifications
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000630.definition: Dagger-shaped calcifications in the dental pulp.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000631.label: Widely spaced primary teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000631.definition: Increased space between the primary teeth. Note this phenotype should be distinguished from increased space due purely to microdontia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000631.label: Solitary median maxillary central incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000631.definition: A single maxillary central incisor positioned in the midline with morphological symmetry of the crown and bordered by lateral incisors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000631.label: Irregularly spaced teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000631.definition: Irregular distribution of the teeth along the dental arch, i.e., and irregular spatial pattern of teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000632.label: Premature loss of primary teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000632.definition: Loss of the primary (also known as deciduous) teeth before the usual age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000632.label: Alveolar process hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000632.definition: Underdevelopment of the alveolar process (also known as alveolar bone).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.label: Supernumerary maxillary incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.definition: The presence of a supernumerary, i.e., extra, maxillary incisor, either the primary maxillary incisor or the permanent maxillary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.label: Crowded maxillary incisors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.definition: A type of dental misalignment with crowded central incisors, i.e., of maxillary secondary incisor, or of maxillary central primary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.label: Hypoplasia of the primary teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the primary teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.label: Persistence of primary teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.definition: Persistence of the primary teeth beyond the age by which they normally are shed and replaced by the permanent teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.label: Short dental root
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.definition: Tooth root length more than 2 SD below mean, or subjectively apparently decreased tooth root length.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.label: Premature eruption of permanent teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.definition: Premature tooth eruption of the permanent dentition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.label: Malformation of mandibular premolar
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.definition: An abnormality of the morphology of secondary premolar tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.label: Conical mandibular incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000633.definition: An abnormal conical morphology of the primary or permanent mandibular incisors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.label: Peg-shaped maxillary lateral incisors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.definition: A tooth crown with its mesial and distal sides converging or tapering toward the incisal edge causing severe reduction of mesiodistal diameter

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.label: Abnormal primary molar morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.definition: An abnormality of morphology of primary molar.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.label: Screwdriver-shaped incisors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.definition: An abnormality of morphology of the incisor tooth in which the tooth is shaped like a screwdriver blade, i.e., having a rhomboid shape.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.label: Microdontia of primary teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.definition: Decreased size of the primary teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.label: Agenesis of permanent teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000634.definition: A congenital defect characterized by the absence of one or more permanent teeth, including oligodontia, hypodontia, and adontia of the of permanent teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.label: Pulp obliteration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.definition: Mineralized substance filling the entire dental pulp space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.label: Failure of eruption of permanent teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.definition: Lack of tooth eruption of the secondary dentition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.label: Hypoplasia of the tooth germ
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the tooth germ, i.e., of the structure that forms in odontogenesis that will develop into a tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.label: Agenesis of mandibular central incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.definition: Agenesis of lower secondary incisor or lower primary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.label: Premature loss of permanent teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.definition: Premature loss of the permanent teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.label: Shovel-shaped maxillary central incisors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000635.definition: A tooth with a crown with marked lingual or palatal marginal ridges causing scooped lingual or palatal surfaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000636.label: Crumpled long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000636.definition: An crumpled radiographic appearance of the long bones, as if the long bone had been crushed together producing irregularities. This feature is the result of multiple fractures and repeated rounds of ineffective healing, as can be seen for instance in severe forms of osteogenesis imperfecta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000636.label: Irregular patellae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000636.definition: An alteration of the normally relatively smooth margins of the kneecap in radiographic images leading to an irregular contour.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000637.label: Distal ulnar epiphyseal stippling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000637.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the distal epiphysis of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000637.label: Broad long bone diaphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000637.definition: Increased width of the diaphysis of long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000637.label: Dumbbell-shaped femur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000637.definition: The femur is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.label: Knee flexion contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.definition: A type of knee joint contracture in which the knee is in a fixed bent (flexed) configuration such that it cannot be straightened actively or passively.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.label: Rudimentary fibula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.definition: Absent or nearly absent fibula. (Does not include aplastic)

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.label: Progressive bowing of long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.definition: Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of a long bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.label: Club-shaped distal femur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.definition: An abnormal conformation of the femur that becomes gradually enlarged towards the distal end. This feature affects the distal femoral metaphysis and epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.label: Short lower limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.definition: Shortening of the legs related to developmental hypoplasia of the bones of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.label: Hypoplastic distal radial epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.definition: Underdevelopment of the distal epiphysis of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.label: Wide distal femoral metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.definition: Increased width of the distal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.label: Limited knee flexion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000638.definition: Reduced ability to flex (bend) the knee joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.label: Anterior tibial bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.definition: An abnormal anterior bending or curvature of the tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.label: Overtubulated long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.definition: Overconstriction, or narrowness of the diaphysis and metaphysis of long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.label: Increased density of long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.definition: An abnormal increase in the bone density of the long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.label: Limited pronation/supination of forearm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.definition: A limitation of the ability to place the forearm in a position such that the palm faces anteriorly (supination) and to place the forearm in a position such that the palm faces posteriorly (pronation).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.label: Flat distal femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000639.definition: An abnormal flattening of the distal epiphysis of femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000640.label: Club-shaped proximal femur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000640.definition: An abnormal conformation of the femur that becomes gradually enlarged towards the proximal end. This feature affects the proximal femoral metaphysis and epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000640.label: Irregular distal femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000640.definition: Anomaly of the contour of the Distal epiphysis of femur such that its normally smooth appearance is irregular.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000640.label: Progressive leg bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000640.definition: Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000641.label: Distal tibial bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000641.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the distal portion of the tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000641.label: Cortically dense long tubular bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000641.definition: Increased density of the compact bone of long bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000642.label: Asymmetric radial dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000642.definition: The presence of asymmetric developmental dysplasia of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000642.label: Peg-like central prominence of distal tibial metaphyses
Broad femoral neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000642.definition: An abnormally wide femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000643.label: Proximal femoral metaphyseal abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000643.definition: An anomaly of the metaphysis of the proximal femur (close to the hip).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000643.label: Radial dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000643.definition: Radial dysplasia, also known as radial longitudinal deficiency, includes radial clubhand and is a disfiguring, and potentially disabling, congenital limb anomaly. The entire upper limb may be involved, although the defect is most evident in the forearm and hand. Affected children suffer a variable degree of hypoplasia or absence of the preaxial skeleton and soft tissues, in particular the thumb, radius, and dorsoradial soft tissues. The hand is usually radially deviated and subluxated off the distal aspect of the ulna, the ulna may be shortened and have a bow-shaped deformity, and there is no true wrist (radiocarpal) joint in Bayne2 type-III and IV radial dysplasia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000643.label: Hypoplasia of proximal radius
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000643.definition: Proximal radial shortening owing to a congenital defect of development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000643.label: Disproportionate prominence of the femoral medial condyle
Enlargement of the distal femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000643.definition: An abnormal enlargement of the distal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000644.label: Increased density of long bone diaphyses
Hypoplasia of proximal fibula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000644.definition: Underdevelopment or shortening of the end of the fibula (calf bone) nearest the knee.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000645.label: Multicentric ossification of proximal femoral epiphyses
Lateral displacement of the femoral head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000645.definition: A developmental anomaly with lateral displacement of the femoral head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000645.label: Delayed patellar ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000645.definition: Formation of bone in the patella later than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000645.label: Irregular proximal tibial epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000645.definition: Anomaly of the contour of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia such that its normally smooth appearance is irregular.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000645.label: Dorsal subluxation of ulna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000645.definition: Partial dislocation of the ulna in the dorsal direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000646.label: Proximal femoral epiphysiolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000646.definition: Slipped capital femoral epiphysis is defined as a posterior and inferior slippage of the proximal epiphysis of the femur onto the metaphysis (femoral neck), occurring through the physeal plate during the early adolescent growth spurt.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000646.label: Generalized bone demineralization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000646.definition: A generalized decrease in bone mineral density.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000646.label: Periosteal thickening of long tubular bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000646.definition: Thickening of the periosteum of long bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000646.label: Limited shoulder movement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000646.definition: A limitation of the range of movement of the shoulder joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.label: Thin long bone diaphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.definition: Decreased width of the diaphysis of long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.label: Anterior bowing of long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.definition: An abnormal anterior curvature of a long bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.label: Abnormality of the pancreatic islet cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.definition: An abnormality of the islet of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells. These are the alpha cells, which produce glucagon, the beta cells, which produce insulin and amylin, the delta cells, which produce somatostatin, the PP cells, which produce pancreatic polypeptide, and the epsilon cells, which produce ghrelin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.label: Abnormality of the alveolar ridges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.definition: Any abnormality of the alveolar ridges (on the upper or lower jaws). The alveolar ridges contain the sockets (alveoli) of the teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.label: Abnormal dental pulp morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000647.definition: An abnormality of the dental pulp.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.label: Premature loss of teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.definition: Exfoliation of a tooth more than 2 SD earlier than the normal age for the deciduous teeth and not related to traume or neglect. Exfoliation of a permanent tooth is per se abnormal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.label: Abnormality of primary teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.definition: Any abnormality of the primary tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.label: Abnormal dental morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.definition: An abnormality of the morphology of the tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.label: Abnormal number of teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.definition: The presence of an altered number of of teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.label: Abnormal dental root morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.definition: An abnormality of the dental root.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.label: Bowing of the long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of a long bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.label: Bowing of the arm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting a long bone of the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.label: Abnormal femoral metaphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000648.definition: An anomaly of the femoral metaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fibula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the lower limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the lower limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ulna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the upper limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the upper limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the patella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the patella.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.label: Abnormal femoral epiphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000649.definition: An anomaly of a growth plate of a femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.label: Abnormal lower limb epiphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.definition: An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of one or both legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the carpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the carpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving forearm bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of one or more forearm bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.label: obsolete Anomaly of the limb diaphyses morphology
Abnormal limb epiphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.definition: An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of a limb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.label: Diverticulosis of trachea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000650.definition: Tracheal diverticula are blind-ended outpouchings arising from the trachea. They are usually an incidental finding. Occasionally they can mimic pneumomediastinum. Tracheal diverticula are either congenital or acquired, in the latter case the most common causes are prolonged increased intraluminal pressure, e.g. chronic cough, COPD, tracheomalacia, and iatrogenic (e.g. post-surgical).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.label: Chronic pulmonary obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.definition: An anomaly that is characterized progressive airflow obstruction that is only partly reversible, inflammation in the airways, and systemic effects or comorbities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.label: Laryngeal stridor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.definition: An abnormal high-pitched noisy sound, occurring during inhalation or exhalation caused by the incomplete obstruction in the throat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.label: Hypersensitivity pneumonitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.definition: Hypersensitivity pneumonitis involves inhalation of an antigen. This leads to an exaggerated immune response and a following inflammation of the alveoli within the lungs. The main feature of chronic hypersensitivity pneumonitis on lung biopsies is expansion of the interstitium by lymphocytes accompanied by an occasional multinucleated giant cell or loose granuloma. After exposure to the provoking antigen, following symptoms can be seen: fever, chills, malaise, cough, hemoptysis, chest tightness, dyspnea, rash, swelling and headache and can be completely reversible, based on the duration of the illness, categorized as acute (HP:0011009), subacute (HP:0011011), and chronic (HP:0011010).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.label: Intraalveolar phospholipid accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.definition: Accumulation of amorphous PAS-positive material in the space betweem alveolar macrophages, sometimes as condensed form (oval bodies) are typically found in alveolar proteinosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.label: Pulmonary venous occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000651.definition: Substantial narrowing or blockage of small pulmonary veins as a result of disorganized smooth muscle hypertrophy and collagen matrix deposition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000652.label: Pulmonary lymphangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000652.definition: Abnormal dilatation of the pulmonary lymphatic vessels. Lymphatic fluid in the lung is derived from normal leakage of fluid out of the blood capillaries in the lung. In pulmonary lymphangiectasia, the pulmonary lymphatics are not properly connected and become dilated with fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000652.label: Lymphocytic interstitial pneumonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000652.definition: Lymphocytic interstitial pneumonitis is a benign lymphoproliferative disorder of the lung that is characterized by the presence of a dense, predominantly lymphocytic interstitial infiltrate (lymphocytes, plasma cells, other elements of the lymphoreticular system) that expands the alveolar septa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000652.label: Chronic lung disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000652.definition: According to the definitions of the American and British Thoracic Societies, including pulmonary functional tests, X-rays, and CT scans for items such as fibrosis, bronchiectasis, bullae, emphysema, nodular or lymphomatous abnormalities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000652.label: Abnormal pulmonary lymphatics
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000652.definition: An abnormality of the pulmonary lymphatic chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.label: Abnormal pulmonary interstitial morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.definition: Abnormality of the lung parenchyma extending to the pulmonary interstitium and leading to diffuse pulmonary fibrosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.label: Recurrent pneumonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.definition: An increased susceptibility to pneumonia as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of pneumonia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.label: Recurrent intrapulmonary hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.definition: A recurrent hemorrhage occurring within the lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.label: Airway obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.definition: Obstruction of conducting airways of the lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.label: Recurrent bronchopulmonary infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000653.definition: An increased susceptibility to bronchopulmonary infections as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchopulmonary infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000654.label: obsolete Chronic obstructive airway disease from birth
Extrapulmonary sequestrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000654.definition: A type of pulmonary sequestration that is completely enclosed in its own pleural sac, occurring above, within, or below the diaphragm, and without communication with the tracheobronchial tree.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000654.label: Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000654.definition: Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation, a condition most commonly associated with hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia, is an abnormal communication between the pulmonary artery and pulmonary vein without an intervening capillary communication. HRCT images usually show a coarse spidery appearance of the peripheral vascular markings in the lungs. More specific findings are obtained in the pulmonary angiogram where the normally invisible capillary phase is replaced by irregular vascular channels bridging the peripheral branches of pulmonary arteries and veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000655.label: Acute hepatic failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000655.definition: Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as acute if there is onset of encephalopathy within 8 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000655.label: Diffuse hepatic steatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000655.definition: A diffuse form of hepatic steatosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000655.label: Decreased mitochondrial complex III activity in liver tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000655.definition: Decreased activity of complex III of the mitochondrion in the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000655.label: Hepatic calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000655.definition: The presence of abnormal calcium deposition in the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.label: Biliary hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.definition: Hyperplasia of the biliary tree, as manifested by increased size of bile ducts, dilated lumen, and histologically by an increased number of epithelial cells or hyperplasia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.label: Viral hepatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.definition: Inflammation of the liver due to infection with a virus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.label: Malformation of the hepatic ductal plate
Fluctuating hepatomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.definition: Intermittently increased size of the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.label: Increased hepatocellular lipid droplets
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.definition: An abnormal increase in the amount of intracellular lipid droplets in hepatocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.label: Increased hepatic glycogen content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000656.definition: An increase in the amount of glycogen stored in hepatocytes compared to normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000657.label: Reduced number of intrahepatic bile ducts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000657.definition: The presence of reduced numbers of intrahepatic bile duct than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000657.label: Acute hepatic steatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000657.definition: An acute form of hepatic steatosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000657.label: Macronodular cirrhosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000657.definition: A type of cirrhosis characterized by the presence of large regenerative nodules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000657.label: Prolonged neonatal jaundice
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000657.definition: Neonatal jaundice refers to a yellowing of the skin and other tissues of a newborn infant as a result of increased concentrations of bilirubin in the blood. Neonatal jaundice affects over half of all newborns to some extent in the first week of life. Prolonged neonatal jaundice is said to be present if the jaundice persists for longer than 14 days in term infants and 21 days in preterm infants.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.label: Portal fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.definition: Fibroblast proliferation and fiber expansion from the portal areas to the lobule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.label: Depletion of mitochondrial DNA in liver
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.definition: An abnormal reduction in the number of mitochondria in hepatocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.label: Reye syndrome-like episodes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.definition: Repeated occurrences of acute noninflammatory encephalopathy and fatty degenerative liver failure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.label: Congenital pseudoarthrosis of the clavicle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.definition: The two portions of the clavicle (corresponding to the two primary ossification centers of the clavicle) are connected by a fibrous bridge that is contiguous with the periosteum, and a synovial membrane develops, resulting in a clavicle with a bipartite appearance radiographically. Congenital pseudarthrosis of the clavicle generally presents as a painless mass or swelling over the clavicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.label: Straight clavicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000658.definition: An abnormally straight configuration of the clavicle, a tubular bone which normally is doubly curved .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000659.label: Absent glenoid fossa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000659.definition: Lack of development of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000659.label: Scapulohumeral synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000659.definition: Bony fusion between the humerus and scapula, leading to an impairment in mobility of the affected shoulder joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000659.label: Diaphragmatic paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000659.definition: The presence of a paralyzed diaphragm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000659.label: Irregular ossification at anterior rib ends

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000660.label: Irregular chondrocostal junctions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000660.definition: Irregular surface of the normally relatively smooth border between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000660.label: Precocious costochondral ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000660.definition: Early ossification of the costochondral junction, which is the joint between the ribs and costal cartilage in the front of the rib cage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000660.label: Midclavicular hypoplasia
