http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000660.definition: Underdevelopment of the middle portion of the clavicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000661.label: Wide intermamillary distance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000661.definition: A larger than usual distance between the left and right nipple.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000661.label: Decreased number of sternal ossification centers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000661.definition: A less than normal number of sternal ossification centers. The sternum is initially formed from bilateral sternal plates that chondrify and begin to fuse with ribs at 10 weeks gestational age. Ossification starts in the manubrium and upper part of the sternal body at the 6th month, in the middle of the sternal body at the 7th month, in the lower part of the body during the 1st postnatal year and in the xiphoid process between years 5 and 18. The number of ossification centers vary up to six, and it is the ossification centers that are visualized by prenatal ultrasound. This term describes a reduction in the number of ossification centers compared with age-related norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000661.label: Absent in utero rib ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000661.definition: Lack of formation and mineralization of the ribs in utero.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000661.label: Anterior rib punctate calcifications
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000661.definition: Deposition of calcium salts in point-like foci within the anterior portion of one or more ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000662.label: Costochondral joint sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000662.definition: Abnormal increase in density of the tissue at the costochondral junctions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000662.label: Multifocal breast carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000662.definition: Breast carcinoma that is bilateral or otherwise multifocal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000662.label: Absent sternal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000662.definition: Lack of formation of mineralized bony tissue of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000663.label: Glenoid fossa hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000663.definition: Underdevelopment of the glenoid fossa, which is the cavity in the lateral part of the scapula which articulates with the head of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000663.label: Osteosclerosis of ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000663.definition: Osteosclerosis of ribs (increased density related to increased bone mass).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000663.label: Midclavicular aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000663.definition: Developmental defect resulting in congenital absence of the middle portion of the clavicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000664.label: Multiple rib fractures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000664.definition: More than one fracture of the ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000664.label: Thin clavicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000664.definition: Abnormally reduced diameter (cross section) of the clavicles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000664.label: Costal cartilage calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000664.definition: Calcification of the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage found at the anterior ends of the ribs which serve to prolong the ribs forward and contribute to the elasticity of the walls of the thorax.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000664.label: Costochondral pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000664.definition: Chest wall pain in the area of the costochondral junctions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000665.label: Thickening of the lateral border of the scapula

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000666.label: Aplastic clavicle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000666.definition: Absence of the clavicles as a developmental defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000666.label: Coat hanger sign of ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000666.definition: An abnormal morphology of the ribs consisting of shorted, abnormally curved ribs. On posteroanterior chest radiography, the ribs show a curvature resembling that of a coat hanger (clothes hanger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000667.label: Prolonged QRS complex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000667.definition: Increased time for the complex comprised of the Q wave, R wave, and S wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).. In adults, normal values are 0.06 - 0.10 sec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000667.label: Granulomatous coronary arteritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000667.definition: Inflammation of the coronary arteries involving a granulomatous response, i.e., a non-specific inflammatory response involving granulomas, defined as a compact organized collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes including epithelioid and giant cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.label: Premature ventricular contraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.definition: Premature ventricular contractions (PVC) or ventricular extrasystoles are premature contractions of the heart that arise in response to an impulse in the ventricles rather than the normal impulse from the sinoatrial (SA) node.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.label: Abnormal ventricular filling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.definition: An abnormality of filling of a ventricle with blood during diastole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.label: Ventricular preexcitation with multiple accessory pathways
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.definition: A form of ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of multiple accessory pathways for cardiac conduction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.label: Endocardial fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.definition: The presence of excessive connective tissue in the endocardium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.label: Aortic tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.label: Bacterial endocarditis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000668.definition: A bacterial infection of the endocardium, the inner layer of the heart, which usually involves the heart valves.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.label: Pulmonic valve myxoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.definition: A benign tumor of connective tissue containing mucous or gelatinous material (myxoma) localized in the pumonic valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.label: Short chordae tendineae of the tricuspid valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.definition: Abnormally short chordae tendineae of the tricuspid valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.label: Early progressive calcific cardiac valvular disease
Atrioventricular canal defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.definition: A defect of the atrioventricular septum of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.label: Dilatation of the ventricular cavity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.definition: A localized outpouching of ventricular cavity that is generally associated with dyskinesia and paradoxical expansion during systole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.label: Premature atrial contractions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000669.definition: A type of cardiac arrhythmia with premature atrial contractions or beats caused by signals originating from ectopic atrial sites.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000670.label: Coronary artery dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000670.definition: Acute occurrence of a dissection (tear within the tunica intima and entry of blood into the tunica media) of a coronary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000670.label: Abnormal coronary artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000670.definition: Any structural abnormality of the coronary arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000670.label: Abnormal atrioventricular valve morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000670.definition: An abnormality of an atrioventricular valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000670.label: Abnormality of the hepatic vasculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000670.definition: An abnormality of the hepatic vasculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000671.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the clavicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000671.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the clavicles (collar bones).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000671.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the thorax

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000672.label: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000672.definition: A form of acute leukemia characterized by excess lympoblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000672.label: Pancreatic adenocarcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000672.definition: The presence of an adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000672.label: T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000672.definition: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia of T-cell origin. It comprises about 15% of childhood cases and 25% of adult cases. It is more common in males than females.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.label: Follicular thyroid carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.definition: The presence of an follicular adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.label: Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.definition: A type of papillary renal cell carcinoma in which the papillae are covered by large eosinophilic cells with pleomorphic nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and nuclear pseudostratification.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.label: Acute megakaryocytic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.definition: A rare subtype of acute myeloid leukemia evolving from primitive megakaryoblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.label: Renal cortical adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.definition: The presence of an adenoma in the cortex of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.label: Extraadrenal pheochromocytoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.definition: Pheochromocytoma not originating from the adrenal medulla but from another source such as from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.label: Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000673.definition: Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin is a malignant tumor of squamous epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000674.label: Transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000674.definition: The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder with origin in a transitional epithelial cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000674.label: Adrenocortical carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000674.definition: A malignant neoplasm of the adrenal cortex that may produce hormones such as cortisol, aldosterone, estrogen, or testosterone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000674.label: Adrenal pheochromocytoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000674.definition: Pheochromocytoma originating from the adrenal medulla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000675.label: Paraspinal neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000675.definition: A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) localized adjacent to the spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000675.label: Neoplasm of the stomach
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000675.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000675.label: Cutaneous leiomyosarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000675.definition: The presence of leiomyosarcoma of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000675.label: Malignant genitourinary tract tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000675.definition: The presence of a malignant neoplasm of the genital system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000676.label: Renal pelvic carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000676.definition: The presence of a carcinoma in the renal pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000676.label: Chondrosarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000676.definition: A slowly growing malignant neoplasm derived from cartilage cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000676.label: Papillary renal cell carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000676.definition: The presence of renal cell carcinoma in the renal papilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000676.label: Pituitary prolactin cell adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000676.definition: A type of pituitary adenoma originating in prolactin secreting cells. This kind of adenoma is characterized by overproduction of prolactin, and may cause loss of menstrual periods and breast milk production in women.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.label: Clear cell renal cell carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.definition: A subtype of renal cell carcinoma thought to originate from mature renal tubular cells in the proximal tubule of the nehpron.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.label: Duodenal adenocarcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.definition: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.label: Renal angiomyolipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.definition: A benign renal neoplasm composed of fat, vascular, and smooth muscle elements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.label: Ovarian papillary adenocarcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.definition: The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.label: Multiple myeloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.definition: A malignant plasma cell tumor growing within soft tissue or within the skeleton.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.label: Benign genitourinary tract neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000677.definition: A non-malignant neoplasm of the genitourinary system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000678.label: Parathyroid carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000678.definition: A malignancy of the parathyroid glands. Parathyroid carcinoma usually secretes parathyroid hormone, leading to hyperparathyroidism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000678.label: Hurthle cell thyroid adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000678.definition: A kind of thyroid adenoma characterized by the presence of oxyphil cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000678.label: Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000678.definition: Muscular dystrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle (the hips and shoulders).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000679.label: Loss of ability to walk in first decade

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000680.label: Abnormal anterior horn cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000680.definition: Any anomaly of the anterior horn cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000680.label: Vivid hallucination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000680.definition: Perceptual experiences that are vivid, intense, and sensory in nature occur in the absence of corresponding stimuli from the external environment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000680.label: Cerebral hypomyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000680.definition: Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the white matter of the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000681.label: White mater abnormalities in the posterior periventricular region
Focal hemiclonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000681.definition: A type of focal clonic seizure characterized by sustained rhythmic jerking rapidly involves one side of the body at seizure onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000681.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cerebellar vermis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000681.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000681.label: 4-layered lissencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000681.definition: A form of lissencephaly in which the cortex is thickened and has four more or less disorganized layers rather than six normal layers resulting from incomplete neuronal migration during brain development. At neuropathological examination, a 4-layered cortex consists of an upper molecular layer, a second thin cellular layer containing pyramidal neurons usually observed in layer V, a third pale poorly cellular layer and a fourth thick deep layer made up of neurons which had failed to migrate. Radiologocally would manifest as agyria or pachygyria with cortical thickness greater than 10 mm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000682.label: Frontal polymicrogyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000682.definition: A type of polymicrogyria with a gradient of severity (anterior more severe than posterior) extending from frontal poles posteriorly to precentral gyrus and inferiorly to frontal operculum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000682.label: Pallor of dorsal columns of the spinal cord
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000682.definition: An abnormally pale appearance of the dorsal portion of the gray substance of the spinal cord. This finding can be observed by histological examination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000682.label: Severe muscular hypotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000682.definition: A severe degree of muscular hypotonia characterized by markedly reduced muscle tone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000683.label: obsolete Severe neonatal hypotonia in males
Developmental stagnation at onset of seizures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000683.definition: A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills, following the onset of epilepsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000683.label: Congenital Horner syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000683.definition: A type of Horner syndrome with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000684.label: Absent patellar reflexes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000684.definition: Absence of the knee jerk reflex, which can normally be elicited by tapping the patellar tendon with a reflex hammer just below the patella.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000684.label: Hypodysplasia of the corpus callosum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000684.definition: Developmental defect characterized by a small and malformed corpus callosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.label: Hypoplasia of the ventral pons
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.definition: Underdevelopment of the ventral portion of the pons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.label: Symmetric spinal nerve root neurofibromas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.definition: Multiple neurofibromas of the spinal nerve roots with a symmetric distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.label: Episodic generalized hypotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.definition: The occurrence of repeated episodes of generalized muscular hypotonia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.label: Cerebellar vermis atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.definition: Wasting (atrophy) of the vermis of cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.label: Impaired distal proprioception
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000685.definition: A loss or impairment of the sensation of the relative position of parts of the body and joint position occuring at distal joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000686.label: Severe expressive language delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000686.definition: A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000686.label: Sensorimotor polyneuropathy affecting arms more than legs

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000687.label: Lobar holoprosencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000687.definition: A type of holoprosencephaly in which most of the right and left cerebral hemispheres and lateral ventricles are separated but the most rostral aspect of the telencephalon, the frontal lobes, are fused, especially ventrally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000687.label: Symmetrical progressive peripheral demyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000687.definition: A symmetric and progressive loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000687.label: Pontocerebellar atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000687.definition: Atrophy affecting the pons and the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000688.label: Diffuse peripheral demyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000688.definition: A diffuse loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000688.label: Impaired distal vibration sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000688.definition: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration in the distal portions of the limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000688.label: Intellectual disability, progressive
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000688.definition: The term progressive intellectual disability should be used if intelligence decreases/deteriorates over time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000688.label: Intellectual disability, borderline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000688.definition: Borderline intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 70-85.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000689.label: Frontotemporal cerebral atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000689.definition: Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the frontotemporal cerebrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000689.label: Hypnopompic hallucination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000689.definition: Brief hallucinations that occur as you wake up in the morning, in a state that falls somewhere between dreaming and being fully awake.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000689.label: Abducens palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000689.definition: Malfunction of the abducens nerve as manifested by impairment of the ability of the affected eye to be moved outward. Patients who develop abducens nerve palsy often present with binocular horizontal diplopia, which is a double vision when looking at objects side by side. There will be a notable weakness of the ipsilateral lateral rectus muscle leading to a deficit in of eye abduction on the affected side. Some patients may present with a constant head turning movement to maintain binocular fusion and to lessen the degree of diplopia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000690.label: Congenital intracerebral calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000690.definition: The presence of calcium deposition within brain structures that is present already at the time of birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000691.label: Intraaxonal accumulation of curvilinear autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000691.definition: Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material within axons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000691.label: Abnormal aggressive, impulsive or violent behavior

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000692.label: Axial muscle stiffness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000692.definition: Stiffness (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) of the axial musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000692.label: Unilateral polymicrogyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000692.definition: Excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of one side of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000692.label: Hypoglycemic encephalopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000692.definition: Brain damage related to a lowering of blood glucose below a critical level (around 30 mg/dl), which may lead to confusion, lethargy and delirium followed by seizures and coma. Prolonged hypoglycemia may lead to irreversible brain damage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.label: Frontoparietal cortical dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the cortex of frontal lobe and the cortex of parietal lobe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.label: Pericallosal lipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.definition: Pericallosal lipomas are congenital soft masses of adipose cells encapsulated by a thin layer of fibrous tissue, appearing adjacent to the corpus callosum of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.label: Transient psychotic episodes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.definition: Relatively short-lived periods of psychosis are characterized by the sudden onset of severe disturbances in perception, thinking, and behavior. These episodes typically last for a brief duration, generally ranging from a few days to a few weeks, and are often triggered by a significant stressor or traumatic event.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.label: Congenital nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.definition: Nystagmus dating from or present at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.label: Impaired distal tactile sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.definition: A reduced sense of touch (tactile sensation) on the skin of the distal limbs. This is usually tested with a wisp of cotton or a fine camel's hair brush, by asking patients to say 'now' each time they feel the stimulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.label: Impaired vibration sensation at ankles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000693.definition: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration at the ankles. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to the malleoli of the ankles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000694.label: Abolished vibration sense
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000694.definition: A complete loss of the ability to perceive vibration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000694.label: Recurrent meningitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000694.definition: An increased susceptibility to meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of meningitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000695.label: Olivopontocerebellar hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000695.definition: Hypoplasia of the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000695.label: obsolete Loss of ability to walk
Abnormal auditory evoked potentials
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000695.definition: An abnormality of the auditory evoked potentials, which are used to trace the signal generated by a sound, from the cochlear nerve, through the lateral lemniscus, to the medial geniculate nucleus, and to the cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000695.label: Proximal spinal muscular atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000695.definition: Proximal spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000696.label: Choroid plexus calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000696.definition: The presence of calcium deposition in the choroid plexus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000696.label: Gait instability, worse in the dark

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000697.label: Periventricular leukomalacia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000697.definition: Periventricular leukomalacia is characterized by diffuse injury of deep cerebral white matter, accompanied in its most severe form by focal necrosis. The neuropathologic hallmarks of PVL are microglial activation and focal and diffuse periventricular depletion of premyelinating oligodendroglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000697.label: Necrotizing encephalopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000697.definition: A type of encephalopathy (brain disease, damage, or malfunction accompanied by an altered mental state) that is characterized by evidence of necrosis of brain tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000697.label: Deficit in grammar
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000697.definition: Deficit in grammar, including syntax and morphology.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000697.label: Sleep-wake cycle disturbance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000697.definition: Any abnormality of an individual's circadian rhythm that affects the timing of sleeping and being awake is referred to as a sleep-wake disorder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000698.label: Progressive leukoencephalopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000698.definition: Leukoencephalopathy that gets more severe with time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000698.label: obsolete Distal sensory loss of all modalities
Alobar holoprosencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000698.definition: A type of holoprosencephaly characterized by the presence of a single ventricle and no separation of the cerebral hemisphere. The single midline ventricle is often greatly enlarged.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000698.label: Dysplastic corpus callosum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000698.definition: Dysplasia and dysgenesis of the corpus callosum are nonspecific descriptions that imply defective development of the corpus callosum. The term dysplasia is applied when the morphology of the corpus callosum is altered as a congenital trait. For instance, the corpus callosum may be hump-shaped, kinked, or a striped corpus callosum that lacks an anatomically distinct genu and splenium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000699.label: Myelin-dependent gliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000699.definition: A type of gliosis that occurs in the vicinity of injured neurons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000699.label: Basal ganglia gliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000699.definition: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000700.label: Loss of Purkinje cells in the cerebellar vermis
Motor axonal neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000700.definition: Progressive impairment of function of motor axons with muscle weakness, atrophy, and cramps. The deficits are length-dependent, meaning that muscles innervated by the longest nerves are affected first, so that for instance the arms are affected at a later age than the onset of deficits involving the lower leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000700.label: Cavitation of the basal ganglia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000700.definition: The formation of small cavities in the tissue of the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000701.label: Poor fine motor coordination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000701.definition: An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of small muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Fine motor skills are required to mediate movements of the wrists, hands, fingers, feet, and toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000701.label: Fourth cranial nerve palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000701.definition: Paralysis of the fourth cranial (trochlear) nerve manifested as weakness of the superior oblique muscle which causes vertical diplopia that is maximal when the affected eye is adducted and directed inferiorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000701.label: Poor gross motor coordination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000701.definition: An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of large muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Gross motor skills are required to mediate movements of the arms, legs, and other large body parts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000701.label: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000701.definition: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) manifests at age 2-3 years or by first grade at the latest. The main symptoms are distractibility, impulsivity, hyperactivity, and often trouble organizing tasks and projects, difficulty going to sleep, and social problems from being aggressive, loud, or impatient.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000702.label: Antenatal intracerebral hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000702.definition: Cerebral hemorrhage that occurs before birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000702.label: Pseudobulbar paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000702.definition: Bilateral impairment of the function of the cranial nerves 9-12, which control musculature involved in eating, swallowing, and speech. Pseudobulbar paralysis is characterized clinically by dysarthria, dysphonia, and dysphagia with bifacial paralysis, and may be accompanied by Pseudobulbar behavioral symptoms such as enforced crying and laughing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000702.label: Poorly formed metencephalon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000702.definition: A morphological abnormality of the metencephalon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000702.label: Cerebral berry aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000702.definition: A small, sac-like aneurysm (outpouching) of a cerebral blood vessel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000703.label: Cerebellar dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000703.definition: Cerebellar dysplasia (abnormal growth or development) is defined by abnormal cerebellar foliation, white matter arborization, and gray-white matter junction. Cerebellar dysplasia is a neuroimaging finding that describes abnormalities of both the cerebellar cortex and white matter and is associated with variable neurodevelopmental outcome. Dysplasia may globally involve the cerebellum or affect only one cerebellar hemisphere. In addition, cerebellar dysplasia may be associated with cortical/subcortical cysts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000703.label: Symmetric lesions of the basal ganglia

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000704.label: Chronic lymphocytic meningitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000704.definition: Meningitis that persists for more than 4 weeks, and lymphocytes are present in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000704.label: Atrophy of the dentate nucleus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000704.definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of dentate nucleus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000704.label: Large basal ganglia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000704.definition: Increased size of the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000705.label: Proximal hyperreflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000705.definition: Hyperactive stretch reflexes of muscles that move proximal joints (elbow, knee).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000705.label: Generalized cerebral atrophy/hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000705.definition: Generalized atrophy or hypoplasia of the cerebrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000706.label: Aplasia of the inferior half of the cerebellar vermis
Progressive language deterioration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000706.definition: Progressive loss of previously present language abilities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000706.label: Disorganization of the anterior cerebellar vermis
Proximal limb muscle stiffness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000706.definition: Stiffness of the limbs (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) occurring in the proximal limb muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000706.label: Distal peripheral sensory neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000706.definition: Peripheral sensory neuropathy affecting primarily distal sensation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000706.label: Inferior cerebellar vermis hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000706.definition: Underdevelopment of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000707.label: Thick corpus callosum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000707.definition: Increased vertical dimension of the corpus callosum. This feature can be visualized by sagittal sections on magnetic resonance tomography imaging of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000707.label: Extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000707.definition: Muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000707.label: Decreased amplitude of sensory action potentials
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000707.definition: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000708.label: Dilated third ventricle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000708.definition: An increase in size of the third ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000708.label: Facial-lingual fasciculations
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000708.definition: Fasciculations affecting the tongue muscle and the musculature of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000709.label: Paroxysmal choreoathetosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000709.definition: Episodes of choreoathetosis that can occur following triggers such as quick voluntary movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000709.label: Chiari type I malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000709.definition: Arnold-Chiari type I malformation refers to a relatively mild degree of herniation of the posteroinferior region of the cerebellum (the cerebellar tonsils) into the cervical canal with little or no displacement of the fourth ventricle. It is characterized by one or both pointed (not rounded) cerebellar tonsils that project 5 mm below the foramen magnum, measured by a line drawn from the basion to the opisthion (McRae Line)

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000710.label: Hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000710.definition: A darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000710.label: Infantile encephalopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000710.definition: Encephalopathy with onset in the infantile period.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000710.label: Segmental peripheral demyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000710.definition: A loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers from segments of the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000710.label: Demyelinating peripheral neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000710.definition: Demyelinating neuropathy is characterized by slow nerve conduction velocities with reduced amplitudes of sensory/motor nerve conduction and prolonged distal latencies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000712.label: Subcortical dementia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000712.definition: A particular type of dementia characterized by a pattern of mental defects consisting prominently of forgetfulness, slowness of thought processes, and personality or mood change.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000712.label: Proximal amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000712.definition: Amyotrophy (muscular atrophy) affecting the proximal musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000713.label: Acute demyelinating polyneuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000713.definition: Acute progressive areflexic weakness and mild sensory changes resulting from myelin breakdown and axonal degeneration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000713.label: Pallidal degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000713.definition: Neurodegeneration involving the globus pallidus,a part of the basal ganglia that is involved in the regulation of voluntary movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000714.label: Distal upper limb amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000714.definition: Muscular atrophy of distal arm muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000715.label: Asymmetric limb muscle stiffness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000715.definition: Stiffness of the limbs (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) occurring in an asymmetric pattern.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000715.label: Progressive extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000715.definition: A progressive degree of muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000715.label: Fluctuations in consciousness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000715.definition: Changes in one's level of awareness and responsiveness to their environment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000716.label: Diffuse demyelination of the cerebral white matter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000716.definition: A diffuse loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000716.label: obsolete Corticospinal tract disease in lower limbs
Periventricular heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000716.definition: A form of gray matter heterotopia were the mislocalized gray matter is typically located periventricularly, also sometimes called subependymal heterotopia. Periventricular means beside the ventricles. This is by far the most common location for heterotopia. Subependymal heterotopia present in a wide array of variations. There can be a small single node or a large number of nodes, can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, can be small or large, single or multiple, and can form a small node or a large wavy or curved mass.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000716.label: Paroxysmal dyskinesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000716.definition: Episodic bouts of involuntary movements with dystonic, choreic, ballistic movements, or a combination thereof. There is no loss of consciousness during the attacks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000717.label: Absent smooth pursuit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000717.definition: A complete lack of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.label: Interosseus muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.definition: Atrophy of the interosseus muscles (including the palmar interossei that lie on the anterior aspect of the metacarpals, the dorsal interosseus muscles of the hand, which lie between the intercarpals, the plantar interosseus muscles, which lie underneath the metatarsal bones, and the dorsal interossei, which are located between the metatarsal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.label: Peripheral hypomyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.definition: Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.label: Focal T2 hyperintense basal ganglia lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.definition: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.label: Loss of consciousness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.definition: Loss of alertness and orientation to place and time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.label: Focal lissencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.definition: A congenital absence of the convolutions of the cerebral cortex and a poorly formed sylvian fissure that affects a particular part of the cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.label: Congenital facial diplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000718.definition: Facial diplegia (that is, bilateral facial palsy) with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000719.label: Neuronal loss in the cerebral cortex
Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure on awakening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000719.definition: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure of either generalized or focal onset occurring on or soon after wakening (typically within 90 minutes of waking, regardless of the time of day).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.label: Episodic hypersomnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.definition: Recurrent episodes of severe hypersomnia are accompanied by cognitive and behavioral disturbances, including confusion, derealization, apathy, compulsive eating, and hypersexuality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.label: Cerebral artery atherosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.definition: The formation of the formation of fibrofatty lesions in the wall of an artery located in the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.label: Hemimegalencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.definition: Enlargement of all or parts of one cerebral hemisphere.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.label: Photosensitive tonic-clonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.definition: Generalized-onset tonic-clonic seizures that are provoked by flashing or flickering light.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.label: Irregular myelin loops
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.definition: Presence of irregular redundant loops of focally folded myelin in a peripheral nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.label: Facial paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000720.definition: Complete loss of ability to move facial muscles innervated by the facial nerve (i.e., the seventh cranial nerve).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000721.label: Lower limb amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000721.definition: Muscular atrophy affecting the lower limb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000721.label: Periodic hyperkalemic paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000721.definition: Episodes of muscle weakness associated with elevated levels of potassium in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000722.label: Macrogyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000722.definition: Increased size of cerebral gyri, often associated with a moderate reduction in the number of sulci of the cerebrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000722.label: Intracerebral periventricular calcifications
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000722.definition: The presence of calcium deposition in the cerebral white matter surrounding the cerebral ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000723.label: Decreased distal sensory nerve action potential
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000723.definition: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential in distal nerve segments. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000723.label: Spinocerebellar tract disease in lower limbs
Clusters of axonal regeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000723.definition: Groups of small caliber axons in peripheral nerve biospies indicative of axonal regeneration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000724.label: Progressive gait ataxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000724.definition: A type of gait ataxia displaying progression of clinical severity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000724.label: Decreased number of small peripheral myelinated nerve fibers

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000725.label: Recurrent external ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000725.definition: Alternating and recurrent weakness of the external ocular muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000725.label: Abnormal pyramidal sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000725.definition: Functional neurological abnormalities related to dysfunction of the pyramidal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000725.label: Severe demyelination of the white matter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000725.definition: A severe loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.label: Type II lissencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.definition: A form of lissencephaly characterized by an uneven cortical surface with a so called 'cobblestone' appearace. There are no distinguishable cortical layers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.label: Symmetric peripheral demyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.definition: A symmetric loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.label: Spinocerebellar atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.definition: Atrophy affecting the cerebellum and the spinocerebellar tracts of the spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.label: Cerebral dysmyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.definition: Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths of the white matter of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.label: Chronic axonal neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.definition: An abnormality characterized by chronic impairment of the normal functioning of the axons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.label: Spinal muscular atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000726.definition: Muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000727.label: Atypical absence seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000727.definition: An atypical absence seizure is a type of generalised non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by interruption of ongoing activities and reduced responsiveness. In comparison to a typical absence seizure, changes in tone may be more pronounced, onset and/or cessation may be less abrupt, and the duration of the ictus and post-ictal recovery may be longer. Although not always available, an EEG often demonstrates slow (<3 Hz), irregular, generalized spike-wave activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000727.label: Recurrent bacterial meningitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000727.definition: An increased susceptibility to bacterial meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of bacterial meningitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000727.label: Paucity of anterior horn motor neurons

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000728.label: Developmental stagnation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000728.definition: A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000728.label: Facial palsy secondary to cranial hyperostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000728.definition: Paralysis of the facial nerves on the basis of overgrowth of the cranial bones causing impingement upon the seventh cranial nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000728.label: Horizontal jerk nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000728.definition: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements, in which the movement in one direction is faster than in the other.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000728.label: Limb fasciculations
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000728.definition: Fasciculations affecting the musculature of the arms and legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000729.label: Posterior fossa cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000729.definition: A discrete posterior fossa cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) collection that does not communicate directly with the fourth ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000730.label: Oromotor apraxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000730.definition: Oral-motor apraxia is the inability to volitionally sequence oral movements of the speech structure for nonspeech tasks in the absence of neuromuscular deficits such as paralysis or muscle weakness. Oral-motor apraxia is diagnosed when, despite intact sensory motor function an individual is unable to use these effector systems under voluntary control.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000730.label: Bipolar affective disorder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000730.definition: Bipolar disorder is an illness of mood characterized by alternating episodes of elevated and depressed moods, which are interspersed with euthymic periods.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000730.label: CNS demyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000730.definition: A loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000732.label: Deep white matter hypodensities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000732.definition: Multiple areas of darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the deep cerebral white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000732.label: Generalized dystonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000732.definition: A type of dystonia that affects all or most of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000732.label: Impaired pain sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000732.definition: Reduced ability to perceive painful stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.label: Focal hemifacial clonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.definition: Focal seizure characterized at onset by clonic movements affecting half of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.label: Hypoplasia of the frontal lobes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.definition: Underdevelopment of the frontal lobe of the cerebrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.label: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with focal onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.definition: A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with focal onset is a focal-onset seizure which progresses into a bilateral tonic-clonic phase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.label: Recurrent encephalopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.definition: Recurrent episodes of brain dysfunction that may be triggered by factors such as metabolic disturbances or infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.label: Hypermetric saccades
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000733.definition: A saccade that overshoots the target with the dynamic saccade.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000734.label: Lower limb muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000734.definition: Weakness of the muscles of the legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000734.label: Diffuse swelling of cerebral white matter
Abnormal morphology of the limbic system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000734.definition: Any structural anomaly of the limbic system, a set of midline structures surrounding the brainstem of the mammalian brain, originally described anatomically, e.g., hippocampal formation, amygdala, hypothalamus, cingulate cortex. Although the original designation was anatomical, the limbic system has come to be associated with the system in the brain subserving emotional functions. As such, it is very poorly defined and doesn't correspond closely to the anatomical meaning any longer. [BirnLex].

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000735.label: Upper limb postural tremor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000735.definition: A type of tremors that is triggered by holding an arm in a fixed position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000735.label: Focal-onset seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000735.definition: A focal-onset seizure is a type of seizure originating within networks limited to one hemisphere. They may be discretely localized or more widely distributed, and may originate in subcortical structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000736.label: Abnormal pons morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000736.definition: A structural abnormality of the pons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000736.label: Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the central nervous system
Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the cerebrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000736.definition: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebrum, also known as the telencephalon, the largest and most highly developed part of the human brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.label: Corpus callosum atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.definition: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the corpus callosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.label: Abnormal septum pellucidum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.definition: An abnormality of the septum pellucidum, which is a thin, triangular, vertical membrane separating the lateral ventricles of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.label: Abnormal choroid plexus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.definition: An abnormality of the choroid plexus, which is the area in the cerebral ventricles in which cerebrospinal fluid is produced by modified ependymal cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.label: Abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.definition: An abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials (SSEP), i.e., of the electrical signals of sensation going from the body to the brain in response to a defined stimulus. Recording electrodes are placed over the scalp, spine, and peripheral nerves proximal to the stimulation site. Clinical studies generally use electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to elicit potentials. SSEP testing determines whether peripheral sensory nerves are able to transmit sensory information like pain, temperature, and touch to the brain. Abnormal SSEPs can result from dysfunction at the level of the peripheral nerve, plexus, spinal root, spinal cord, brain stem, thalamocortical projections, or primary somatosensory cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.label: Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the gastrointestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.label: Neoplasm of the genitourinary tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000737.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the genitourinary system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000738.label: Facial telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000738.definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000738.label: Aplasia cutis congenita of scalp
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000738.definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000739.label: Postnatal-onset ichthyosiform erythroderma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000739.definition: A type of ichthyosiform erythroderma with postnatal onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000739.label: Early cutaneous photosensitivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000739.definition: Photosensitivity of the skin occurring early in life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000739.label: Axillary apocrine gland hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000739.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the apocrine sweat glands in the region of the axilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000740.label: Macular atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000740.definition: Well-demarcated area(s) of partial or complete depigmentation in the macula, reflecting atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium with associated retinal photoreceptor loss.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000740.label: Areas of hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation that do not follow Blaschko lines
Nonepidermolytic palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000740.definition: Abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles charactersized by hyperkeratosis of the stratum corneum with no evidence of epidermolysis characteristic of epidermolytic hyperkeratosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000740.label: Excessive skin wrinkling on dorsum of hands and fingers
Tegumentary leishmaniasis susceptibility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000740.definition: Increased susceptibility to infection by the protozan parasite of the genus Leishmania.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000740.label: obsolete Absence of subcutaneous fat over entire body except buttocks, hips, and thighs

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000741.label: Palmoplantar hyperhidrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000741.definition: An abnormally increased perspiration on palms and soles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000741.label: Nevus flammeus of the forehead
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000741.definition: Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the forehead.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000741.label: Neonatal wrinkled skin of hands and feet
Discoid lupus rash
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000741.definition: Cutaneous lesion that develops as a dry, scaly, red patch that evolves to an indurated and hyperpigmented plaque with adherent scale. Scarring may result in central white patches (loss of pigmentation) and skin atrophy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000742.label: Spontaneous hematomas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000742.definition: Spontaneous development of hematomas (hematoma) or bruises without significant trauma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000742.label: Telangiectases of the cheeks
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000742.definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the cheeks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000742.label: Telangiectasia of the oral mucosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000742.definition: Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the oral mucosa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000742.label: Few cafe-au-lait spots
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000742.definition: The presence of two to five cafe-au-lait macules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000743.label: Generalized edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000743.definition: Generalized abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000743.label: Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000743.definition: An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000743.label: Plaque-like facial hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000743.definition: Hemangioma is a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells. This term refers to facial hemangiomas that have a plaque-like morphology.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000743.label: Multiple cutaneous leiomyomas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000743.definition: The presence of multiple leiomyomas of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000743.label: Mottled pigmentation of the trunk and proximal extremities

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000744.label: Partial albinism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000744.definition: Absence of melanin pigment in various areas, which is found at birth and is permanent. The lesions are known as leucoderma and are often found on the face, trunk, or limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000744.label: Palmoplantar blistering
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000744.definition: A type of blistering that affects the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000744.label: Diffuse palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000744.definition: Diffuse abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000745.label: Increased groin pigmentation with raindrop depigmentation
Ipsilateral lack of facial sweating
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000745.definition: Inability to sweat on the same side of the face that is affected by ptosis and miosis. This is a feature of Horner syndrome.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000745.label: Flexural lichenification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000745.definition: Lichenification affecting primarily flexural areas of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.label: Autoamputation of digits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.definition: The spontaneous detachment of a digit (finger or toe) from the body due to long standing pathology.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.label: Bitot spots of the conjunctiva
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.definition: Keratinization of the bulbar conjunctiva near the limbus (corneoscleral junction), resulting in a raised spot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.label: Sparse facial hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.definition: Reduced number or density of facial hair.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.label: Honeycomb palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.definition: Abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles with an honeycomb pattern.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.label: Perifollicular hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.definition: Increased amount of keratin (visible as white scales) surrounding hair follicles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.label: Palmoplantar cutis gyrata
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000746.definition: Cutis gyrata of palms and soles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000747.label: Periarticular subcutaneous nodules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000747.definition: Subcutaneous nodules that are located in the vicinity of joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000747.label: Axillary and groin hyperpigmentation and hypopigmentation
Congenital bullous ichthyosiform erythroderma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000747.definition: An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin that presents at birth or shortly thereafter with generalized erythema, blistering, erosions, and peeling. In the subsequent months, erythema and blistering improves but patients go on to develop hyperkeratotic scaling that is especially prominent along the joint flexures, neck, hands and feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000747.label: Abnormal dermatoglyphics
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000747.definition: An abnormality of dermatoglyphs (fingerprints), which are present on fingers, palms, toes, and soles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000747.label: Congenital nonbullous ichthyosiform erythroderma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000747.definition: The term collodion baby applies to newborns who appear to have an extra layer of skin (known as a collodion membrane) that has a collodion-like quality. It is a descriptive term, not a specific diagnosis or disorder (as such, it is a syndrome). Affected babies are born in a collodion membrane, a shiny waxy outer layer to the skin. This is shed 10-14 days after birth, revealing the main symptom of the disease, extensive scaling of the skin caused by hyperkeratosis. With increasing age, the scaling tends to be concentrated around joints in areas such as the groin, the armpits, the inside of the elbow and the neck. The scales often tile the skin and may resemble fish scales.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000748.label: Decreased sweating due to autonomic dysfunction
Diffuse telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000748.definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) with a diffuse localization.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000749.label: Linear arrays of macular hyperkeratoses in flexural areas
Discrete 2 to 5-mm hyper- and hypopigmented macules
Focal friction-related palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000749.definition: Hyperkeratosis affecting the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot in areas exposed to friction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000749.label: Recurrent staphylococcal infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000749.definition: Increased susceptibility to staphylococcal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of staphylococcal infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000750.label: Decreased number of sweat glands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000750.definition: The presence of fewer than normal sweat glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000750.label: Streaks of hyperkeratosis along each finger onto the palm
Follicular hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000750.definition: A skin condition characterized by excessive development of keratin in hair follicles, resulting in rough, cone-shaped, elevated papules resulting from closure of hair follicles with a white plug of sebum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000750.label: Congenital absence of skin of limbs
Punctate palmar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000750.definition: Tiny bumps of thickened skin (hyperkeratosis) on the palms of the hands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000751.label: Edema of the dorsum of hands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000751.definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the hands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000751.label: Redundant skin on fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000751.definition: Loose and sagging skin of the fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000751.label: Palmoplantar cutis laxa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000751.definition: Loose, wrinkled skin of hands and feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000751.label: obsolete Lack of subcutaneous fatty tissue

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000752.label: Yellow subcutaneous tissue covered by thin, scaly skin

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000753.label: Congenital posterior occipital alopecia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000753.definition: Loss of hair in the occipital region of the scalp with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000753.label: Aplasia cutis congenita of midline scalp vertex
Severe photosensitivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000753.definition: A severe degree of photosensitivity of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000754.label: Frontal cutaneous lipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000754.definition: Presence of a cutaneous lipoma on the forehead.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000754.label: Absent pigmentation of the ventral chest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000754.definition: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the anterior chest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000754.label: Piebaldism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000754.definition: Piebaldism is characterized by stable and persistent, well-circumscribed depigmented patches present at birth affecting the skin of the face, trunk, and extremities in a symmetrical distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000754.label: Congenital palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000754.definition: Abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles that is present at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000754.label: obsolete Palmoplantar keratosis with erythema and scale
Desquamation of skin soon after birth

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000755.label: Confetti hypopigmentation pattern of lower leg skin
Plantar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000755.definition: Hyperkeratosis affecting the sole of the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000756.label: obsolete Telangiectases in sun-exposed and nonexposed skin
Multiple cafe-au-lait spots
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000756.definition: The presence of six or more cafe-au-lait spots.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000756.label: Generalized seborrheic dermatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000756.definition: Seborrheic dermatitis that is not localized to any one particular region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000757.label: Hyperkeratosis lenticularis perstans
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000757.definition: Hyperkeratosis lenticularis perstans (HLP), also known as Flegel disease, is a keratinization abnormality characterized by small, asymptomatic erythematous papules that leave characteristic punctate bleeding when they become detached. The lesions generally occur symmetrically along the top of the foot and on the legs, appearing more rarely on the arms, forearms, palms, and soles, and even on the oral mucosa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000757.label: Late onset atopic dermatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000757.definition: A form of atopic dermatitis with onset in adulthood characterized by atopic red face, chronic lichenified eczema on the trunk, subacute or psoriasiform dermatitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000757.label: Palmar neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000757.definition: A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) localized in the palm of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000758.label: Reticular hyperpigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000758.definition: Increased pigmentation of the skin with a netlike (reticular) pattern.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000758.label: Aplasia cutis congenita on trunk or limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000758.definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the trunk or the limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000759.label: Aplasia cutis congenita over posterior parietal area
Aplasia/Hypoplastia of the eccrine sweat glands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000759.definition: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the eccrine sweat glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000759.label: Painful subcutaneous lipomas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000759.definition: The presence of multiple subcutaneous lipoma that cause pain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000759.label: Bilateral single transverse palmar creases
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000759.definition: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease on both hands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000760.label: Hypoproteinemic edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000760.definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body because of decreased osmotic pressure of plasma (hypoproteinemia).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000761.label: Spinous keratoses of palms and soles
Nevus flammeus nuchae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000761.definition: Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the neck. This is one of the most common birthmarks and present in approximately 25% of all newborns.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000761.label: Subcutaneous calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000761.definition: Deposition of calcium salts in subcutaneous tissue (i.e., the the lowermost layer of the integument).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000762.label: Cutaneous leiomyoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000762.definition: The presence of leiomyoma of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000763.label: Bilateral microphthalmos
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000763.definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of both eyes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000763.label: Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000763.definition: An acute condition characterized by sudden visual loss (usually discovered in the morning), optic disc edema at onset, optic disc-related visual field defects. Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy can be associated with flame hemorrhages on the swollen disc or nearby neuroretinal layer, and sometimes with nearby cotton-wool exudates.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.label: Dyschromatopsia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.definition: A form of colorblindness in which only two of the three fundamental colors can be distinguished due to a lack of one of the retinal cone pigments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.label: Congenital stationary night blindness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.definition: A nonprogressive (i.e., stationary) form of difficulties with night blindness with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.label: Peripheral tractional retinal detachment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.definition: Tractional retinal detachment at the periphery of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.label: Absent lower eyelashes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.definition: Lack of eyelashes on the lower lid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.label: Congenital extraocular muscle anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.definition: Congenital abnormality of the extraocular muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.label: Punctate cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.definition: A type of cataract with punctate opacities of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.label: Congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000764.definition: Sharply demarcated, congenital hyperpigmentation of the retinal pigment epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000765.label: Eversion of lateral third of lower eyelids
Lacrimal gland aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000765.definition: A congenital defect of development characterized by absence of the lacrimal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000765.label: Diffuse nuclear cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000765.definition: Opacity of the entire lens nucleus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000765.label: obsolete Decreased retinal pigmentation with dispersion

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000766.label: Peripheral cystoid retinal degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000766.definition: Degenerative changes of the peripheral retina consisting of close-packed tiny cystic spaces at the outer plexiform/inner nuclear retinal level. The degeneration is very common in adult eyes and starts adjacent to the ora serrata and extends circumferentially and posteriorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000767.label: Abnormal vestibulo-ocular reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000767.definition: An abnormality of the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR). The VOR attempts to keep the image stable on the retina. Ideally passive or active head movements in one direction are compensated for by eye movements of equal magnitude.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000767.label: Vitelliform-like macular lesions
