http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000767.definition: Vitelliform maculopathy is a sharply demarcated lesion caused by the accumulation of material, often lipofuscin in the subretinal space underlying the macula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000767.label: Lacrimal duct stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000767.definition: Narrowing of a tear duct (lacrimal duct).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000768.label: Abnormal pupillary function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000768.definition: A functional abnormality of the pupil.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000768.label: Undetectable light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000768.definition: Absence of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000769.label: Abnormal pupillary light reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000769.definition: An abnormality of the reflex that controls the diameter of the pupil, in response to the intensity of light that falls on the retina of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000770.label: Ocular anterior segment dysgenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000770.definition: Abnormal development (dysgenesis) of the anterior segment of the eye globe. These structures are mainly of mesenchymal origin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000770.label: Paroxysmal involuntary eye movements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000770.definition: Sudden-onset episode of abnormal, involuntary eye movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000770.label: Congenital aphakia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000770.definition: Absence of the crystalline lens of the eye as a result of a developmental defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000770.label: Band-shaped corneal dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000770.definition: A type of genetically determined disease of the cornea with corneal lesions with a band-like shape.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000771.label: Uveal melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000771.definition: A malignant melanoma originating within the eye. The tumor originates from the melanocytes in the uvea (which comprises the iris, ciliary body, and choroid).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000771.label: Chronic irritative conjunctivitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000771.definition: A chronic irritative conjunctivitis, which commonly presents with general irritation and redness of the eyes, with a burning, dry, or foreign-body sensation of the eyes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.label: Flat cornea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.definition: Cornea plana is an abnormally flat shape of the cornea such that the normal protrusion of the cornea from the sclera is missing. The reduced corneal curvature can lead to hyperopia, and a hazy corneal limbus and arcus lipoides may develop at an early age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.label: Saccular conjunctival dilatations
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.definition: Presence of multiple dilatations (sac-like outpouchings) in the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.label: Retinal pigment epithelial atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.definition: Atrophy (loss or wasting) of the retinal pigment epithelium observed on fundoscopy or fundus imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.label: Opacification of the corneal epithelium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.definition: Lack of transparency of the corneal epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.label: Congenital miosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000772.definition: Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil of congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000773.label: Iris hypopigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000773.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation of the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000773.label: Chorioretinal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000773.definition: Abnormal development of the choroid and retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000773.label: Bone spicule pigmentation of the retina
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000773.definition: Pigment migration into the retina in a bone-spicule configuration (resembling the nucleated cells within the lacuna of bone).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000775.label: Macular dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000775.definition: Macular dystrophy is a nonspecific term for premature retinal cell aging and cell death, generally confied to the macula in which no clear extrinsic cause is evident.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000775.label: obsolete Slitlike anterior chamber angles in children
Opacification of the corneal stroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000775.definition: Reduced transparency of the stroma of cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.label: Pericentral scotoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.definition: A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) that surrounds the central fixation point.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.label: Retinal telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.definition: Dilatation of small blood vessels of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.label: Deep anterior chamber
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.definition: Increased depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is increased.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.label: Optic disc hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.definition: Underdevelopment of the optic disc, that is of the optic nerve head, where ganglion cell axons exit the eye to form the optic nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.label: Central retinal vessel vascular tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000776.definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of retinal blood vessels (arteries, arterioles, veins, venules).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000777.label: Impaired smooth pursuit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000777.definition: An impairment of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000777.label: Vitreoretinopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000777.definition: Ocular abnormality characterised by premature degeneration of the vitreous and the retina that may be associated with increased risk of retinal detachment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000777.label: Chorioretinal scar
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000777.definition: Fibrous connective tissue resulting from incomplete healing of a wound (i.e., a scar) located in the choroid and retina or the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000777.label: Posterior retinal neovascularization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000777.definition: A type of retinal neovascularization that affects the posterior pole of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000778.label: Cortical pulverulent cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000778.definition: A type of cataract characterized by punctate, dust-like opacities within the cortical region of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000778.label: obsolete Butterfly retinal pigment epithelial dystrophy
Posterior subcapsular cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000778.definition: A type of cataract affecting the posterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the Lens capsule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000779.label: Patchy atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000779.definition: Wasting (atrophy) of the retinal pigment epithelium present in small, isolated areas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000779.label: Granular macular appearance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000779.definition: Mottled (spotted or blotched with different shades) pigmentary abnormality of the macula lutea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000779.label: Anterior cortical cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000779.definition: A cataract that affects the anterior part of the cortex of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000779.label: Conjunctival whitish salt-like deposits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000779.definition: The presence of whitish deposits in the conjunctiva resembling salt. May be related to calcinosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000780.label: Increased axial length of the globe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000780.definition: Abnormal largeness of the eye with an axial length > 2.5 standard deviations from population mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000780.label: Granular corneal dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000780.definition: The presence of central, fine, whitish granular lesions in the stroma of the cornea. This type of corneal dystrophy is usually asymptomatic and begins in childhood and shows a slow progression. Later in the course, the corneal epithelium and Bowman's layer may be affected. Histologically, the cornea shows a uniform deposition of hyaline material.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000780.label: Monochromacy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000780.definition: Complete color blindness, a complete inability to distinguish colors. Affected persons cannot perceive colors, but only shades of gray.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.label: Horizontal pendular nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.definition: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements of equal velocity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.label: Herpetiform corneal ulceration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.definition: The presence of one or more dendritic corneal epithelial ulcers characterized by a treelike branching linear pattern with feathery edges and terminal bulbs. Herpetiform corneal ulcers can be identified by fluorescein staining.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.label: Nongranulomatous uveitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.definition: A form of uveitis that is not associated with the formation of granulomas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.label: Retinal pigment epithelial mottling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.definition: Mottling (spots or blotches with different shades) of the retinal pigment epithelium, i.e., localized or generalized fundal pigment granularity associated with processes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.label: Abnormal distribution of retinal arterioles and venules
Horizontal supranuclear gaze palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.definition: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a horizontal direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.label: Central heterochromia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.definition: The presence of distinct colors in the central (pupillary) zone of the iris than in the mid-peripheral (ciliary) zone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.label: Presenile cataracts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000781.definition: Presenile cataract is a kind of cataract that occurs in early adulthood, that is, at an age that is younger than usual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000782.label: Lacrimal punctal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000782.definition: Congenital absence or closure of the opening of the lacrimal punctum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000782.label: Total ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000782.definition: Paralysis of both the extrinsic and intrinsic ocular muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000782.label: obsolete Cataracts develop in second or third decade

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000783.label: Adult-onset night blindness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000783.definition: Inability to see well at night or in poor light with onset in adulthood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000783.label: Nonprogressive restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000783.definition: Nonprogressive restriction of movement of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000783.label: Progressive cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000783.definition: A kind of cataract that progresses with age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000784.label: Long upper eyelashes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000784.definition: Increased length of the upper eyelashes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000784.label: Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000784.definition: Deposition of hyaline extracellular material (amyloid) into the vitreous humor, which can manifest as vitreous opacities and reduced visual acuity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000785.label: Punctate opacification of the cornea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000785.definition: Punctate opacification (reduced transparency) of the corneal stroma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000785.label: Chorioretinal lacunae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000785.definition: Punched out lesions in the pigmented layer of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000785.label: Congenital horizontal nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000785.definition: Horizontal nystagmus dating from or present at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000786.label: Retinal calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000786.definition: Deposition of calcium salts in the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000786.label: Restrictive partial external ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000786.definition: Fibrosis of only some of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000787.label: Choroidal hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000787.definition: The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the choroid. These are generally reddish or orange or can have increased pigmentation maiking them difficult to distinguish from choroidal melanomas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000787.label: Almond-shaped palpebral fissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000787.definition: A shape created by an acute downward arching of the upper eyelid and upward arching of the lower eyelid, toward the medial canthus, which gives the outline of the palpebral fissures the configuration of an almond. Thus, the maximum distance between the fissures is offset from, and medial to, the center point.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000787.label: Allergic conjunctivitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000787.definition: Allergic Conjunctivitis is an allergic inflammation of the conjunctiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000788.label: Slowed horizontal saccades
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000788.definition: An abnormally slow velocity of horizontal saccadic eye movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000788.label: Absent extraocular muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000788.definition: Congenital absence of the extraocular muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000788.label: Iridescent posterior subcapsular cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000788.definition: A type of posterior subcapsular cataract characterized by an iridescent color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000789.label: Hypopigmentation of the fundus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000789.definition: Reduced pigmentation of the fundus, typically generalised. Fundoscopy may reveal a low level pigment in both RPE and choroid with clear visibility of choroidal vessels (pale/albinoid) or low pigment level in the RPE with deep pigment in choroid so that visible choroidal vessels are separated by deeply pigmented zones (tesselated/tigroid).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000789.label: Retinal nonattachment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000789.definition: Failure of attachment of the retina during development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000790.label: Vitreous hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000790.definition: Bleeding within the vitreous compartment of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000790.label: Paravenous chorioretinal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000790.definition: Chorioretinal atrophy along the retinal veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000790.label: Ocular hypertension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000790.definition: Intraocular pressure that is 2 standard deviations above the population mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000791.label: Reticular retinal dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000791.definition: A type of of patterned retinal dystrophy that shows a reticular pattern of pigmentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000791.label: Polymorphous posterior corneal dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000791.definition: This corneal dystrophy affects the posterior limiting membrane of the cornea and is characterized by polymorphous plaques of calcium deposits in the deep stromal layers of the cornea, and occasionally by vesicular lesions of the endothelium and edema of the deep corneal stroma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000791.label: obsolete Small anterior lens surface opacities
Tractional retinal detachment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000791.definition: A type of retinal detachment arising due to a combination of contracting retinal membranes, abnormal vitreoretinal adhesions, and vitreous changes. It is usually seen in the context of diseases that induce a fibrovascular response, e.g. diabetes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000792.label: Lacrimal duct aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000792.definition: A congenital defect resulting in absence of the lacrimal duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000792.label: Abnormal flash visual evoked potentials
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000792.definition: Anomaly of the visual evoked potentials elicited by a flash stimulus, generally a flash of light subtending an angle of at least 20 degrees of the visual field and presented in a dimly lit room.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000792.label: Peripheral retinal detachment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000792.definition: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium occuring near the outer limit (periphery) of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.label: Bilateral congenital mydriasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.definition: Congenital abnormal dilation of the pupil on both sides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.label: Broad lateral eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.definition: Regional increase in the width (height) of the lateral eyebrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.label: Restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.definition: Fibrosis of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.label: Reticular pigmentary degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.definition: A type of retinal reticular pigmentation that forms a polygonal, netlike arrangement of hyperpigmented lines forming geometric patterns in the fundus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.label: Blue cone monochromacy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000793.definition: A form of monochromacy in which vision is derived from the remaining preserved blue (S) cones and rod photoreceptors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.label: Limited extraocular movements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.definition: Limited mobility of the eye within its socket.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.label: Internal ophthalmoplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.definition: Paralysis of the iris and ciliary apparatus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.label: Congenital stapes ankylosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.definition: A form of stapes ankylosis with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.label: Unilateral narrow palpebral fissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.definition: A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures on one side only.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.label: Pericentral retinitis pigmentosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.definition: A subtype of retinitis pigmentosa in which, instead of the pathology starting in the mid-periphery like typical retinitis pigmentosa, the disease starts in the near periphery closer to the vascular arcades and tends to spare the far periphery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.label: Dense posterior cortical cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000794.definition: A type of posterior cortical cataract characterized by dense lenticular opacities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000795.label: Peripapillary chorioretinal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000795.definition: Chorioretinal atrophy concentrated around the optic papilla (i.e., the optic nerve head).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000795.label: Optic atrophy from cranial nerve compression

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000796.label: Pattern dystrophy of the retina
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000796.definition: A spectrum of fundoscopic appearances characterized by the development of a variety of patterns of deposits predominantly in the macular area. The deposits are typically bilateral, relatively symmetrical, yellow/white and associated with changes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium. With time, retinal atrophy may occur. A number of pattern dystrophy subtypes have been described including butterfly-shaped dystrophy, reticular dystrophy (net-like pattern) and fundus pulverulentus (granular, mottled pigmentation).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000796.label: Remnants of the hyaloid vascular system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000796.definition: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth. This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.label: Lamellar cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.definition: A congenital cataract in which opacity is limited to layers of the lens external to the nucleus (i.e., the perinuclear region), i.e., between the nuclear and cortical layers of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.label: Retinal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.label: Hypometric horizontal saccades
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.definition: Saccadic undershoot of horizontal saccadic eye movements, i.e., a horizontal saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.label: Cerulean cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.definition: Cerulean cataracts are a kind of congenital cataract having peripheral bluish and white opacifications in concentric layers with occasional central lesions arranged radially. Although the opacities may be observed during fetal development and childhood, usually visual acuity is only mildly reduced until adulthood, when lens extraction is generally necessary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.label: Gaze-evoked horizontal nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000797.definition: Horizontal nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000798.label: obsolete Concentric narrowing of visual field
Electronegative electroretinogram
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000798.definition: A dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram in which the b-wave that is of markedly lower amplitude than the associated a-wave (source: Holder GE., Inherited Chorioretinal Dystrophies: A Textbook and Atlas; 2014; p.17; ISBN 978-3-540-69466-3).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000798.label: Retinal arteriolar occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000798.definition: Blockage of retinal arteriole, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to affected regions of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000798.label: Macular hypopigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000798.definition: Decreased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000798.label: Intraretinal exudate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000798.definition: Retinal exudate within the retinal tissue itself.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000799.label: Hypoplastic iris stroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000799.definition: Underdevelopment of the stroma of iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000799.label: Malformed lacrimal duct
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000799.definition: Congenital malformation of the lacrimal duct associated with incomplete development of the bony nasolacrimal canal or craniofacial anomalies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000799.label: Peripheral visual field loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000799.definition: Loss of peripheral vision with retention of central vision, resulting in a constricted circular tunnel-like field of vision.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000800.label: Decreased corneal reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000800.definition: An abnormally reduced response to stimulation of the cornea (by touch, foreign body, blowing air). The corneal reflex (also known as the blink reflex, normally results in an involuntary blinking of the eyelids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000800.label: Foveal hyperpigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000800.definition: Increased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000800.label: Abnormality of macular pigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000800.definition: Abnormality of macular or foveal pigmentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000801.label: Peripheral opacification of the cornea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000801.definition: Reduced transparency of the peripheral region of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000801.label: Central fundal arteriolar microaneurysms
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000801.definition: Microscopic aneurysms of the retinal arterioles near the central part of the fundus, visible as small round dark red dots on the retinal surface (not arising from visible vessels) that are by definition less than the diameter of the major optic veins as they cross the optic disc.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000801.label: obsolete Depigmented lesions of the retinal pigment epithelium
Superior lens subluxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000801.definition: Partial dislocation of the lens in a superior direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000802.label: Cystoid macular degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000802.definition: A form of macular degeneration characterized by the presence of multiple cysts in the macula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000803.label: Posterior Y-sutural cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000803.definition: A type of sutural cataract in which the opacity follows the posterior Y suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000803.label: Retinitis pigmentosa inversa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000803.definition: Retinitis pigmentosa inversa is form of retinal degeneration characterized by areas of retinal/chorioretinal degeneration with pigment migration in the macular area (in contrast to retinitis pigmentosa which, at early disease stages, predominantly affects the retinal periphery).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000803.label: Absent anterior chamber of the eye
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000803.definition: Absence of the anterior chamber of the eye owing to a developmental defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000803.label: Aplastic/hypoplastic lacrimal glands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000803.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000804.label: Retinal arteriolar constriction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000804.definition: Decreased retinal arteriolar diameters, which may decrease blood flow and slow oxygen delivery to regions of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000804.label: Abnormal retinal vascular morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000804.definition: A structural abnormality of retinal vasculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000804.label: Abnormality of the vasculature of the eye
Abnormal line of Schwalbe morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000804.definition: An abnormality of the line of Schwalbe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000804.label: Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000804.definition: An abnormality of an extraocular muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.label: Abnormality of the palpebral fissures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.definition: An anomaly of the space between the medial and lateral canthi of the two open eyelids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.label: obsolete Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium
Retinal fold
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.definition: A wrinkle of retinal tissue projecting outward from the surface of the retina and visible as a line on fundoscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the iris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.label: Abnormal morphology of the conjunctival vasculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.definition: Any abnormality of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the uvea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000805.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the uvea, the pigmented middle layer of the eye consisting of the iris and ciliary body together with the choroid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fovea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.definition: Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior segment of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the lens
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.label: Ichthyosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.definition: An abnormality of the skin characterized the presence of excessive amounts of dry surface scales on the skin resulting from an abnormality of keratinization.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.label: Abnormal blistering of the skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.definition: The presence of one or more bullae on the skin, defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.label: Neoplasm of the skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000806.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.label: Maternal hypertension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.definition: Increased blood pressure during a pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.label: Maternal virilization in pregnancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.definition: Virilization (deepening of voice, facial hirsutism and scalp hair loss) with onset during pregnancy (usually towards the end of the first trimester) and regression several months post-partum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.label: Low maternal circulating estriol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.definition: An abnormally low concentration of serum conjugated estriol as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.label: Osteoporotic tarsals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.definition: Reduction in bone mineral density affecting any or all of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.label: Absent fifth metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000807.definition: A developmental abnormality characterized by the absence of the fifth metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000808.label: Hallux varus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000808.definition: Medial deviation of the great toe owing to a deformity of the great toe joint causing the hallux to deviate medially.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000808.label: Pes valgus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000808.definition: An outward deviation of the foot at the talocalcaneal or subtalar joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000808.label: Nonossified fifth metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000808.definition: The presence of a fifth metatarsal bone that has not undergone ossification at an age when ossification is usually visible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000808.label: Abnormality of the fifth metatarsal bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000808.definition: An anomaly of the fifth metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000809.label: Widely spaced toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000809.definition: An overall widening of the spaces between the digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000809.label: Medially deviated second toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000809.definition: Medial deviation of the second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000810.label: Expanded metatarsals with widened medullary cavities
Delayed tarsal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000810.definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000810.label: Plantar crease between first and second toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000810.definition: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot located between the first and second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000810.label: Advanced tarsal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000810.definition: Precocious (accelerated) maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000811.label: Plantar flexion contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000811.definition: A type of contracture in which the plantar flexion muscles are contracted.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000811.label: Metatarsal diaphyseal endosteal sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000811.definition: Osteosclerosis of the endosteal surface of the diaphyses (shafts) of the metatarsal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000811.label: Clinodactyly of the 3rd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000811.definition: Bending or curvature of a third toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000811.label: Flexion limitation of toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000811.definition: Limitation of the ability to bend the toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000812.label: Calcaneonavicular fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000812.definition: Synostosis of the calcaneus with the navicular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000812.label: Talipes calcaneovarus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000812.definition: A congenital deformity characterized by a dorsiflexed, inverted, and adducted foot, i.e., a combination of talipes calcaneus and talipes varus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000812.label: Bipartite calcaneus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000812.definition: A two-part calcaneus, a finding that probably results from delayed coalescence of two primary calcaneal centers of ossification.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000813.label: Tarsal stippling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000813.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more tarsal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000813.label: Medial rotation of the medial malleolus
Irregular tarsal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000813.definition: Defective ossification in an irregular pattern of the seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000813.label: Equinus calcaneus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000813.definition: Abnormal plantar flexion of the calcaneus relative to the longitudinal axis of the tibia. This results in the angle between the long axis of the tibia and the long axis of the heel bone (calcaneus) being greater than 90 degrees.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000814.label: Delayed calcaneal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000814.definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of the calcaneus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000814.label: Impaired epinephrine-induced platelet aggregation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000814.definition: Abnormal response to epinephrine as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of epinephrine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.label: Elevated serum transaminases during infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.definition: Elevations of the levels of SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) that occur during infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.label: Prolonged prothrombin time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.definition: Increased time to coagulation in the prothrombin time test, which is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. The results of the prothrombin time test are often expressed in terms of the International normalized ratio (INR), which is calculated as a ratio of the patient's prothrombin time (PT) to a control PT standardized for the potency of the thromboplastin reagent developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) using the formula: INR is equal to Patient PT divided by Control PT.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.label: Periodic hypokalemic paresis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.definition: Episodes of muscle weakness associated with reduced levels of potassium in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.label: Mucopolysacchariduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.definition: Excessive amounts of mucopolysaccharide in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.label: Hyperapobetalipoproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000815.definition: Hyperapobetalipoproteinemia is defined as the combination of a normal low density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol in the face of an increased LDL apolipoprotein B (apoB) protein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.label: 3-hydroxydicarboxylic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.definition: The concentration of 2-hydroxydicarboxylic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.label: Absent leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.definition: Alkaline phosphatase levels measured within leukocytes is below detectable levels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.label: Asymptomatic hyperammonemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.definition: An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood not associated with symptoms such as encephalopathy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.label: Decreased circulating cortisol level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.definition: Abnormally reduced concentration of cortisol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.label: Decreased helper T cell proportion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.definition: Reduced proportion of helper T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.label: Decreased beta-galactosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.definition: Abnormally decreased rate of beta-galactosidase activity. Beta-galactosidase activity can be measured in leukocyte, fibroblast, or plasma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.label: Very long chain fatty acid accumulation
Reduced factor VII activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000816.definition: Reduced activity of coagulation factor VII. Factor VII is part of the extrinsic coagulation pathway, which is initiated at the site of injury in response to the release of tissue factor (fIII). Tissue factor and activated factor VII catalyze the activation of factor X.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000817.label: Decreased Arden ratio of electrooculogram
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000817.definition: An abnormal reduction in the Arden ratio, which is the ratio between the light peak and the dark trough of the smoothed (physiologic) EOG record.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000818.label: Abetalipoproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000818.definition: An absence of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000818.label: Precocious puberty in males
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000818.definition: The onset of puberty before the age of 9 years in boys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000818.label: Adrenocortical cytomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000818.definition: The presence of large polyhedral cells with eosinophilic granular cytoplasm and enlarged nuclei in the adrenal cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000818.label: Absence of secondary sex characteristics
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000818.definition: No secondary sexual characteristics are present at puberty.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000819.label: Thyroid agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000819.definition: The congenital absence of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000819.label: Multiple pancreatic beta-cell adenomas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000819.definition: The presence of multiple pancreatic islet cell adenomas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000819.label: Congenital hypoparathyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000819.definition: Deficiency of parathyroid hormone with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.label: Primary hyperparathyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.definition: A type of hyperparathyroidism caused by a primary abnormality of the parathyroid glands (e.g., adenoma, carcinoma, hyperplasia). Primary hyperparathyroidism is associated with hyercalcemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.label: Reduced circulating prolactin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.definition: A reduced level of prolactin in the blood circulation. Prolactin is a protein hormone that is secreted by lactotrophs in the anterior pituitary and that stimulates mammary gland development and milk production.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.label: Precocious puberty with Sertoli cell tumor
Insulin-dependent but ketosis-resistant diabetes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.definition: Ketosis-resistant diabetes is a synonym for type II diabetes. This term thus refers to a form of type II diabetes in which patients are dependent on insulin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.label: Primary adrenal insufficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.definition: Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands as a result of a primary defect in the glands themselves.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.label: Premature ovarian insufficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000820.definition: Amenorrhea due to loss of ovarian function before the age of 40. Primary ovarian inssuficiency (POI) is a state of female hypergonadotropic hypogonadism. It can manifest as primary amenorrhea with onset before menarche or secondary amenorrhea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000821.label: Gonadotropin deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000821.definition: A reduced ability to secrete gonadotropins, which are protein hormones secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary gland, including the hormones follitropin (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000821.label: Decreased serum estradiol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000821.definition: A reduction below normal concentration of estradiol in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000821.label: Adrenal gland dysgenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000821.definition: Abnormal development of the adrenal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000822.label: Compensated hypothyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000822.definition: Condition associated with a raised serum concentration of thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) but a normal serum free thyroxine (FT4).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000822.label: Pituitary resistance to thyroid hormone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000822.definition: A condition in which the pituitary gland is partially resistant to thyroid hormone, so that it continues to secrete thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) until the blood level of thyroid hormone rises higher than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000822.label: Thyroid lymphangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000822.definition: The presence of lymphangiectasis of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000823.label: Elevated circulating follicle stimulating hormone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000823.definition: An elevated concentration of follicle-stimulating hormone in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000823.label: Decreased circulating progesterone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000823.definition: An reduced concentration of progesterone in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000823.label: Hypothalamic hypothyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000823.definition: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyrotropin-releasing hormone activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000823.label: Adrenal medullary hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000823.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the adrenal medulla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000824.label: Pseudohypoaldosteronism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000824.definition: A state of renal tubular unresponsiveness or resistance to the action of aldosterone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000824.label: Congenital adrenal hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000824.definition: A type of adrenal hypoplasia with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000824.label: Pituitary hypothyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000824.definition: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyroid-stimulating hormone secretion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000824.label: Euthyroid hyperthyroxinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000824.definition: Increased levels of thyroxine without evidence of clinical thyroid disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000825.label: Congenital goiter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000825.definition: An enlargement of the thyroid gland with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000825.label: Adrenocortical adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000825.definition: Adrenocortical adenomas are benign tumors of the adrenal cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000825.label: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000825.definition: A type of adrenal hyperplasia with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000825.label: Adrenocorticotropin receptor defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000825.definition: Adrenal insufficiency secondary to a defect in the ACTH receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000826.label: Pancreatic islet cell adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000826.definition: The presence of an adenoma of the pancreas with origin in a pancreatic B cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000826.label: Thyroid defect in oxidation and organification of iodide
Neutrophil inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000826.definition: The presence of intracellular inclusion bodies (aggregates of stainable substances, usually proteins) in neutrophils. Cytoplasmic neutrophil inclusions (oval, basophilic) are also known as Doehle bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000826.label: Increased red cell hemolysis by shear stress

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000827.label: Abnormal cartilage collagen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000827.definition: Abnormal morphology of collagen fibers in cartilage. In cartilage, collagen II, actually a collagen II:IX:XI heterofibril, is by far the most important type of collagen. A number of abnormalities may be appreciated by electron micrography or biochemical investigations, including sparse collagen fibers in the cartilage matrix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000827.label: Abnormal blood zinc concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000827.definition: An abnormality of zinc ion homeostasis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000828.label: Acute hyperammonemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000828.definition: An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood with sudden onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000828.label: Unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000828.definition: An increased amount of unconjugated (indirect) bilurubin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000828.label: Fasting hyperinsulinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000828.definition: An increased concentration of insulin in the blood in the fasting state, i.e., not as the response to food intake.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000829.label: Partial complement factor H deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000829.definition: A partial reduction in level of the complement component Factor H in circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000829.label: Pituitary corticotropic cell adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000829.definition: A type of pituitary adenoma that produces adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000829.label: Long-chain dicarboxylic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000829.definition: An increase in the level of long-chain dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000829.label: Transient hyperphenylalaninemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000829.definition: A condition of not having consistently high levels of phenylalanine in the blood but of experiencing temporary hyperphenylalaninemia following ingestion of large quantities of phenylalanine (for instance, following an oral loading test with phenylalanine).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000830.label: Dermatan sulfate excretion in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000830.definition: An increased concentration of dermatan sulfate in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000830.label: Olivary degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000830.definition: Degeneration of the olivary bodies, prominent oval structures in the medulla oblongata.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000830.label: Exercise-induced myoglobinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000830.definition: Presence of myoglobin in the urine following exercise.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000830.label: Medium chain dicarboxylic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000830.definition: An increase in the level of medium chain dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000831.label: Spinal cord posterior columns myelin loss
Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex II
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000831.definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000831.label: Decreased plasma free carnitine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000831.definition: A decreased concentration of free (unbound) carnitine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000831.label: Abnormal mitochondria in muscle tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000831.definition: An abnormality of the mitochondria in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000831.label: Elevated leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000831.definition: Increased alkaline phosphatase measured within leukocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.label: Impaired collagen-induced platelet aggregation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.definition: Abnormal response to collagen or collagen-mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition collagen or collagen-mimetics.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.label: Reduced factor X activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.definition: Reduced activity of coagulation factor X. The extrinsic and intrinsic pathways converge at factor X (fX). The extrinsic pathway activates fX by means of d factor VII with its cofactor, tissue factor. The intrinsic pathway activates fX by means of the tenase complex (Ca2+ and factors VIIIa, IXa and X) on the surface of activated platelets. Factor Xa in turn activates prothrombin (factor II) to thrombin (factor IIa).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.label: Abnormal mitochondrial morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.definition: Any structural anomaly of the mitochondria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.label: Abnormal light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.definition: An abnormality of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.label: Reduced circulating vitamin B6 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of vitamin B6 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.label: Microscopic nephrocalcinosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000832.definition: The presence of microscopic crystalline calcium precipitates in the form of oxalate and/or phosphate in the renal parenchyma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000833.label: Reduced von Willebrand factor activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000833.definition: Decreased activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000833.label: Partial functional complement factor D deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000833.definition: A partial reduction in level of the complement component Factor D in circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000833.label: Diaminoaciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000833.definition: An increased urine level of any amino acid carrying two amino groups (Asparagine, glutamine and lysine, cystine, ornithine).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000834.label: Distal renal tubular acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000834.definition: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of acid secretion by the alpha intercalated cells of the cortical collecting duct of the distal nephron. The urine cannot be acidified below a pH of 5.3, associated with acidemia and hypokalemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000834.label: Elevated circulating branched chain amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000834.definition: Concentration of a branched chain amino acid in the blood above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000834.label: Hypoplasia of the iris dilator muscle
Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex IV
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000834.definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000834.label: Decreased circulating IgG2 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000834.definition: A reduction in immunoglobulin levels of the IgG2 subclass in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.label: Impaired platelet adhesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.definition: An abnormality of adhesion of thrombocytes. Normally, platelets adhere to collagen in the vascular subendothelium within seconds of injury via a receptor made up of glycoprotein Ia and IIa and GPVI and to vWF via receptor GPIb/IX/V. The adherent platelets then release granules that lead to platelet activation and aggregation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.label: Neutral hyperaminoaciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.definition: The presence of an abnormally increased concentration of neutral amino acids in the urine. The neutral amino acids are tryptophan, alanine, asparagine, glutamine, histidine, isoleucine, leucine, phenylalanine, serine, threonine, tyrosine and valine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.label: Factor X activation deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.definition: Reduced ability to transform factor X into its activated form factor Xa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.label: Reduced factor XIII activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.definition: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XIII (also known as fibrin stabilizing factor). Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.label: Hyperprolinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000835.definition: An increased concentration of proline in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.label: Neonatal hypoproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.definition: A neonatal decreased concentration of proteins in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tarsal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the tarsal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.label: Abnormality of the calcaneus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.definition: An abnormality of the calcaneus, also known as the heel bone, one of the or heel bone, one of the components of the tarsus of the foot which make up the heel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.label: Foot joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.definition: Contractures of one or more joints of the feet meaning chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.label: Tarsal synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.definition: Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the tarsus (calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, cuneiiform bones).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.label: Abnormal tarsal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000836.definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000837.label: Abnormal metatarsal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000837.definition: Any abnormal process of ossification of the metatarsal bones, which normally are each ossified from two centers: one for the body, and one for the head (metatarsal II,III,IV, and V) and one for the body and one for the base (metatarsal I). The ossification process begins in the center of the body about the ninth week, and extends toward either extremity. The center for the base of the first metatarsal appears about the third year, and the centers for the heads of the other bones between the fifth and eighth years. They join the bodies between the eighteenth and twentieth years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000837.label: Abnormal circulating vitamin A concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000837.definition: Concentration of vitamin A in the blood circulation outside limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000838.label: Slow-growing nails
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000838.definition: Nails whose growth is slower than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000838.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nails
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000838.definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the nail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.label: Recurrent loss of toenails and fingernails
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.definition: Repeated loss, or shedding, of the nails of the fingers and toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.label: Dystrophic fingernails
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.definition: The presence of misshapen or partially destroyed nail plates, often with accumulation of soft, yellow keratin between the dystrophic nail plate and nail bed, resulting in elevation of the nail plate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.label: Subungual hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.definition: A thickening of the stratum corneum in the region beneath the nails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.label: Congenital curved nail of fourth toe
Chronic monilial nail infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.definition: Chronic infection of the nails by Candida species.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.label: Hypoplastic fifth fingernail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.definition: A nail of the fifth finger that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped nail of little finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.label: Circumungual hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000839.definition: A thickening of the stratum corneum, the outer layer of the skin, in the region surrounding the nails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000840.label: Onycholysis of distal fingernails
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000840.definition: Detachment of the distal fingernails from the nail bed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000840.label: Ridged fingernail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000840.definition: Longitudinal, linear prominences in the fingernail plate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000840.label: Nail dystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000840.definition: Onychodystrophy (nail dystrophy) refers to nail changes apart from changes of the color (nail dyschromia) and involves partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000841.label: Intervertebral disc degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000841.definition: The presence of degenerative changes of intervertebral disk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000842.label: Punctate vertebral calcifications
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000842.definition: The presence of punctiform calcification of the bone of the vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000842.label: Vertebral wedging
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000842.definition: An abnormal shape of the vertebral bodies whereby the vertebral bodies are thick on one side and taper to a thin edge at the other.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000842.label: Spinal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000842.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000842.label: Vertebral clefting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000842.definition: Schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000843.label: Anterior beaking of lumbar vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000843.definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies of the lumbar spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000843.label: Anterior wedging of L1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000843.definition: An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L1 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000843.label: Absent in utero ossification of vertebral bodies
Vertebral arch anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000843.definition: A morphological abnormality of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000843.label: Lumbar hemivertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000843.definition: Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the lumbar spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.label: C1-C2 vertebral abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.definition: Any abnormality of the atlas and the axis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.label: Herniation of intervertebral nuclei
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.definition: The presence of one or more herniated nucleus pulposus of intervertebral disk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.label: Vertebral hyperostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.definition: Excessive growth of the bones of the vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.label: Neuropathic spinal arthropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.definition: A progressive disorder of vertebral joint degeneration that occurs in the setting of any condition characterized by decreased afferent innervation, involving loss of deep pain and proprioceptive sensation in the vertebral column. Patients most commonly present with symptoms of lower back pain, sitting imbalance, progressive spinal deformity (usually kyphosis), and an audible clicking sound on changing postures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.label: Posterior wedging of vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.definition: An abnormality of the shape of vertebrae, such that they are wedge-shaped (narrow towards the back).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.label: Cervical spinal canal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000844.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the cervical spinal canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.label: Narrow vertebral interpedicular distance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.definition: A reduction of the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.label: Lumbar kyphosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.definition: Over curvature of the lumbar region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.label: Dysplastic sacrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.definition: A developmental defect of the sacrum characterized by partial or disordered development of the sacrum in which portions of the sacrum, which normally is formed by fusion of five sacral vertebrae S1-S5, fail to form or fail to form normally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.label: C2-C3 subluxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.definition: A partial dislocation of the intervertebral joint between the second and third cervical vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.label: Caudal interpedicular narrowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.definition: Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column. Note that normally, the interpedicular distances get progressively wider as one proceeds down the spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.label: Progressive congenital scoliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.definition: A progressive form of scoliosis with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.label: Cervical vertebral agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000845.definition: Agenesis of one or more vertebrae of the cervical vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000846.label: Absent spinous processes of lower thoracic and lumbar vertebrae
Absent vertebra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000846.definition: A developmental defect characterized by agenesis of one or more vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000846.label: Thoracic hemivertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000846.definition: Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the thoracic spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000846.label: Abnormal sacral segmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000846.definition: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation of sacral vertebrae during development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000846.label: Cervical vertebral dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000846.definition: Dysplasia of the cervical vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000847.label: Lower thoracic interpediculate narrowness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000847.definition: A reduction of the distance between the lower thoracic vertebral pedicles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000847.label: Narrow anterio-posterior vertebral body diameter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000847.definition: An abnormal reduction of the anterioposterior diameter of the vertebral body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000847.label: Poorly ossified cervical vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000847.definition: Decreased ossification of the cervical vertebral bodies, i.e., of the Cervical vertebrae set.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000848.label: Cervical spondylosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000848.definition: Arthrosis, i.e., of degenerative joint disease, affecting the cervical vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000848.label: Cervical vertebral bodies with decreased anteroposterior diameter
Thoracolumbar interpediculate narrowness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000848.definition: A reduction of the distance between thoracolumbar vertebral pedicles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000848.label: Lumbar interpedicular narrowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000848.definition: Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between lumbar vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000848.label: Spondylolisthesis at L5-S1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000848.definition: Complete bilateral fractures of the pars interarticularis resulting in the anterior slippage of the fifth lumbar vertebral body (L5) onto the sacrum (level S1).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000849.label: Premature anterior fontanel closure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000849.definition: Early closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000849.label: Inferior lens subluxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000849.definition: Partial displacement of the lens in the inferior direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000849.label: High hypermetropia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000849.definition: A severe form of hypermetropia with over +5.00 diopters.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000850.label: Median cleft lip and palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000850.definition: Cleft lip or palate affecting the midline region of the palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000850.label: Moderate sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000850.definition: The presence of a moderate form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000851.label: Central posterior corneal opacity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000851.definition: Reduced transparency of the central posterior portion of the corneal stroma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000851.label: Bilateral conductive hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000851.definition: A bilateral type of conductive hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000851.label: Abnormality of the vertebral spinous processes
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the sacrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000851.definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the sacral bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000851.label: Abnormal coccyx morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000851.definition: Any structural abnormality of the coccyx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000852.label: Posterior helix pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000852.definition: Permanent indentation on the posteromedial aspect of the helix that may be sharply or indistinctly delineated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000852.label: Congenital sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000852.definition: A type of hearing impairment caused by an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000852.label: Long hairs growing from helix of pinna
Absence of acoustic reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000852.definition: Absence of the acoustic reflex, an involuntary contraction of the stapedius muscle that occurs in response to high-intensity sound stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000853.label: Cleft at the superior portion of the pinna

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000854.label: Low-frequency hearing loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000854.definition: A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the low frequencies of sound (125 Hz to 1000 Hz).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000854.label: Abnormally folded helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000854.definition: Any structural anomaly of the border of the helix, which usually forms a rolled rim but is highly variable in shape.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000855.label: Cochlear malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000855.definition: The presence of a malformed cochlea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000855.label: Absent vestibular function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000855.definition: Complete lack of functioning of the vestibular apparatus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000856.label: Vestibular areflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000856.definition: Vestibular areflexia can be measured as the absence of the caloric nystagmus response in electronystagmography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000856.label: Microtia, second degree
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000856.definition: Median longitudinal length of the ear more than two standard deviations below the mean in the presence of some, but not all, parts of the normal ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000857.label: External ear malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000857.definition: A malformation of the auricle of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000857.label: Low-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000857.definition: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment that affects primarily the lower frequencies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000857.label: Underfolded helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000857.definition: Underdevelopment of the helix that either affects the entire helix, or is localized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000858.label: Underfolded superior helices
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000858.definition: A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a lesser degree than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000858.label: Mild neurosensory hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000858.definition: The presence of a mild form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000858.label: Slit-like opening of the exterior auditory meatus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000858.definition: A type of stenosis of the external auditory meatus in which the opening of the external auditory meatus appears as a vertical slit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000858.label: Hypoplastic helices
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000858.definition: Underdevelopment of the helix, i.e., of the outer rim of the pinna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000859.label: Congenital conductive hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000859.definition: A type of conductive deafness with congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000859.label: Prominent antitragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000859.definition: Increased anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000859.label: Postlingual sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000859.definition: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with onset after the acquisition of speech.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000859.label: Mild conductive hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000859.definition: A mild form of conductive hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000860.label: Supraauricular pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000860.definition: Benign congenital lesion of the supraauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000860.label: Progressive conductive hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000860.definition: A progressive type of conductive deafness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000860.label: Abnormal middle ear morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000860.definition: An abnormality of the morphology or structure of the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000861.label: Infantile sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000861.definition: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with infantile onset.
