http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000861.label: Adult onset sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000861.definition: The presence of sensorineural deafness with late onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000861.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000861.definition: A bilateral form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000862.label: Severe sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000862.definition: A severe form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000862.label: Abnormality of the stapes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000862.definition: An abnormality of the stapes, a stirrup-shaped ossicle in the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000862.label: Pulsatile tinnitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000862.definition: Pulsatile tinnitus is generally classified a kind of objective tinnitus, meaning that it is not only audible to the patient but also to the examiner on auscultation of the auditory canal and/or of surrounding structures with use of an auscultation tube or stethoscope. Usually, pulsatile tinnitus is heard as a lower pitched thumping or booming, a rougher blowing sound which is coincidental with respiration, or as a clicking, higher pitched rhythmic sensation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000863.label: Ureteral dysgenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000863.definition: A developmental anomaly of the ureter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000863.label: Agonadism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000863.definition: Absence of sex glands (gonads are the organs that produce gametes; testis in males and ovary in females).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000863.label: Hypertrophy of the urinary bladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000863.definition: Abnormal enlargement of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000864.label: Nephroblastomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000864.definition: Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney. Nephroblastomatosis represents a complex abnormality of nephrogenesis and has been defined as the persistence of metanephricblastema into infancy and childhood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000865.label: Uric acid urolithiasis independent of gout
Autonomic erectile dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000865.definition: Impotence (inability to develop or maintain an erection) resulting from abnormal functioning of the autonomic nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000865.label: Crescentic glomerulonephritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000865.definition: A type of extracapillary glomerulonephritis characterized by the formation of crescent-like cellular proliferation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000865.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fallopian tube
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000865.definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000865.label: Multiple small medullary renal cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000865.definition: The presence of many cysts in the medulla of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000866.label: Renotubular dysgenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000866.definition: A developmental defect characterized by absence or poor development of proximal renal tubules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000866.label: Gonadal dysgenesis, male
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000866.definition: Unusual gonadal development in a person with a 46,XY male karyotype, leading to an unassigned sex differentiation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000866.label: Abnormal spermatogenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000866.definition: Incomplete maturation or aberrant formation of the male gametes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000867.label: Calcium oxalate nephrolithiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000867.definition: The presence of calcium- and oxalate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000867.label: Congenital megaureter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000867.definition: A developmental disturbance with extreme ureteral dilatation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000867.label: Congenital nephrotic syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000867.definition: Nephrotic syndrome with onset within the first three months of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000867.label: Renal hypoplasia/aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000867.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000868.label: Renal tubular epithelial necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000868.definition: Coagulative necrosis of tubular epithelial cells, defined as cells with increased cytoplasmic eosinophilia and nucleus that has a condensed chromatin pattern with fuzzy nuclear contour or has barely visible nuclear basophilic staining. The extent of cortical tubular necrosis is scoredsemiquantitatively as none, mild (less than 25% tubules with necrosis), moderate (25-50 percent), and severe (over 50%).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000868.label: Enlarged labia minora
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000868.definition: Increase in size of the folds of skin between the outer labia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000868.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the uterus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000868.definition: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000868.label: Bilateral cryptorchidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000868.definition: Absence of both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000869.label: Solitary bladder diverticulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000869.definition: Presence of a single diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000869.label: Renal hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000869.definition: A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that are native to the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000869.label: Hypoplasia of the fallopian tube
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000869.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000870.label: Gonadal calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000870.definition: Deposition of calcium salts in gonadal tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000870.label: Partial development of the penile shaft

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000871.label: Benign prostatic hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000871.definition: The presence of non-malignant hyperplasia of the prostate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000871.label: Urethrovaginal fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000871.definition: The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the urethra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000871.label: Unilateral renal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000871.definition: A unilateral form of atrophy of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000871.label: Unilateral renal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000871.definition: A unilateral form of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000872.label: Urethral diverticulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000872.definition: The presence of a diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urethra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000872.label: Gonadal dysgenesis with female appearance, male
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000872.definition: Unusual gonadal development in a person with a 46,XY male karyotype, leading to a more female sex differentiation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000873.label: Female external genitalia in individual with 46,XY karyotype
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000873.definition: The presence of female external genitalia in a person with a male karyotype.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000873.label: Renal hypophosphatemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000873.definition: Renal hypophosphatemia is defined as reduced serum phosphate (e.g., below 0.70 mmol/l) and an inappropriately high renal phosphate excretion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000873.label: Decreased testicular size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000873.definition: Reduced volume of the testicle (the male gonad).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000873.label: Partially duplicated kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000873.definition: The presence of a partially duplicated kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000874.label: Longitudinal vaginal septum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000874.definition: The presence of a longitudinal vaginal septum, thereby creating a vaginal duplication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000874.label: Coronal hypospadias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000874.definition: A mild form of hypospadias in which the urethra opens just under the corona glandis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000874.label: Abnormal aryepiglottic fold morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000874.definition: An abnormality of the aryepiglottic fold.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000874.label: Cartilaginous ossification of larynx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000874.definition: Ossification affecting the set of cartilages of larynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.label: Laryngeal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.definition: Congenital absence of the lumen of the larynx. Laryngeal atresia is a rare condition. If the laryngeal opening fails to develop, fluid secreted by the lungs cannot be expelled. In a fetus with laryngeal atresia, the lungs are either normal or hyperplastic, not hypoplastic. Mortality is reported as 100%. At obstetric US examination, views of the fetal neck demonstrate a dilated trachea filled with trapped fluid. Views of the fetal chest show enlarged, hyperechoic lungs, with dilated fluid-filled bronchi. Fetal ascites is usually present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.label: Laryngeal cleft
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.definition: Presence of a gap in the posterior laryngotracheal wall with a continuity between the larynx and the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.label: Laryngeal cartilage malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.definition: A malformation of the laryngeal cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.label: Laryngeal calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.definition: Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the laryngeal tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.label: Bowing of the vocal cords
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.definition: Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the vocal folds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.label: Unilateral vocal cord paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000875.definition: A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on one side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.label: Violent behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.definition: Conduct and/or behavior, both verbal and non-verbal, including but not limited to verbal and/or physical aggression, attacks, threats, harassment, intimidation, and other disruptive behaviors in any form or through any medium, that cause or have the potential to cause a reasonable person to fear physical harm from any individual(s) or group(s) towards any person(s) or property. This is commonly defined as a violent act characterized by the use of physical force, anger, or sudden intense activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.label: No social interaction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.definition: Lack of intentional participation in interactions with another person.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.label: Auditory hallucination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.definition: Perception of sounds without auditory stimulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.label: Self-mutilation of tongue and lips due to involuntary movements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.definition: Uncontrolled movements result in tissue damage to the tongue and lips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.label: Abnormal sexual behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000876.definition: An explicit or perceived action, demonstration, conduct, or language (verbal and written) of a sexual nature that goes against generally accepted norms, rules, and procedures. It is considered unacceptable within the context in which it occurs, or it may be both culturally acceptable and atypical/uncommon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.label: Obsessive-compulsive trait
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.definition: The presence of one or more obsessive-compulsive personality traits. Obsessions refer to persistent intrusive thoughts, and compulsions to intrusive behaviors, which the affected person experiences as involuntary, senseless, or repugnant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.definition: The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the external ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.definition: The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of all or part of the external ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of all or part of the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the inner ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the inner ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.label: Abnormal renal artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.definition: Any structural abnormality of the renal artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.label: Abnormal vocal cord morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000877.definition: An abnormality of the vocal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.label: Wide proximal femoral metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.definition: Increased width of the proximal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.label: Wide capital femoral epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.definition: Abnormally wide morphology of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.label: Delayed ossification of pubic rami
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of the rami (branches) of the pubic bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.label: Iliac crest serration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.definition: Irregularities of the iliac crest that produce the appearance of a lace border around it.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.label: Delayed pubic bone ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of the pubic bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.label: Cone-shaped capital femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000878.definition: A cone-shaped deformity of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000879.label: Dysplastic iliac wing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000879.definition: A general term that describes a congenital defect in the iliac wing resulting from abnormal development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000879.label: Femoral retroversion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000879.definition: An abnormal backward rotation of the hip relative to the knee such that the hips are externally rotated with the foot pointed outward instead of straight ahead (out-toeing).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000879.label: Early ossification of capital femoral epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000879.definition: Developmental acceleration of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000879.label: Widened greater sciatic notch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000879.definition: The sacroiliac joint in the bony pelvis connects the sacrum and the ilium of the pelvis, which are joined by strong ligaments. The notch is located directly superior to the joint. This term refers to a increase in the lateral dimension of the notch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000880.label: Limited hip movement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000880.definition: A decreased ability to move the femur at the hip joint associated with a decreased range of motion of the hip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000880.label: Broad femoral head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000880.definition: Increased width of the femoral head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000880.label: Acetabular dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000880.definition: A smaller than normal acetabulum that has insufficient femoral head coverage leading to abnormal hip joint contact pressures, instability and pain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000880.label: High iliac wing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000880.definition: Increased height of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000881.label: Aplastic pubic bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000881.definition: A developmental defect characterized by lack of development of the pubis bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000881.label: Large iliac wing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000881.definition: Increased size of the ilium ala.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000881.label: Narrow femoral neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000881.definition: An abnormally reduced diameter of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.label: Absent ossification of capital femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.definition: Lack of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.label: Hypoplastic ischiopubic ramus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.definition: Underdevelopment of the ischiopubic ramus, which is comprised of the inferior pubic ramus and the inferior ramus of the ischium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.label: Inferior pubic ramus hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.definition: Underdevelopment of the lower branch of the pubis bone (inferior pubic ramus).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.label: Hypoplastic iliac body
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.definition: Underdevelopment of the body of ilium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.label: Dislocation of the femoral head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.definition: Joint dislocation of the femoral head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.label: Delayed proximal femoral epiphyseal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.definition: Developmental delay of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.label: Delayed femoral head ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000882.definition: Delayed ossification of the femoral head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000883.label: Hypoplastic pubic ramus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000883.definition: Underdevelopment of a ramus (branch) of the pubic bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000883.label: Multicentric femoral head ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000883.definition: There is normally one ossification center in the head of the femur. This term applies if there are multiple such centers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000884.label: Mesomelic short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000884.definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by disproportionate shortening of the medial parts of the extremities (forearm or lower leg).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000884.label: Severe intrauterine growth retardation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000884.definition: Intrauterine growth retardation that is 4 or more standard deviations below average, corrected for sex and gestational age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000884.label: Moderately short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000884.definition: A moderate degree of short stature, more than -3 SD but not more than -4 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000885.label: Severe postnatal growth retardation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000885.definition: Severely slow or limited growth after birth, being four standard deviations or more below age- and sex-related norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000885.label: Moderate postnatal growth retardation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000885.definition: A moderate degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between three and four standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000885.label: Neonatal short-trunk short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000885.definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with congenital onset recognizable at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000886.label: Failure to thrive secondary to recurrent infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000886.definition: Insufficient weight gain or inappropriate weight loss for a child, that is attributed to an endogenous recurrent infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000887.label: Feeding difficulties in infancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000887.definition: Impaired feeding performance of an infant as manifested by difficulties such as weak and ineffective sucking, brief bursts of sucking, and falling asleep during sucking. There may be difficulties with chewing or maintaining attention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000887.label: Disproportionate short-limb short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000887.definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short limbs but an average-sized trunk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000888.label: Mild intrauterine growth retardation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000888.definition: Intrauterine growth retardation that is at least 2 standard deviations (SD) below average, but not as low as 3 SD, corrected for sex and gestational age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000889.label: Postnatal growth retardation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000889.definition: Slow or limited growth after birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000890.label: Rhizomelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000890.definition: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of limbs (i.e. the femur and humerus).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000891.label: Childhood-onset truncal obesity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000891.definition: Truncal obesity with onset during childhood, defined as between 2 and 10 years of age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000892.label: Neonatal short-limb short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000892.definition: A type of short-limbed dwarfism that is manifest beginning in the neonatal period.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000892.label: Childhood-onset short-trunk short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000892.definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with onset in childhood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000893.label: Generalized neonatal hypotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000893.definition: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period and affecting the entire musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000893.label: Axial hypotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000893.definition: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000894.label: Distal lower limb amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000894.definition: Muscular atrophy of distal leg muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000894.label: Loss of ability to walk in early childhood
Pelvic girdle amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000894.definition: Atrophy of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as hip girdle), i.e., the gluteal muscles, the lateral rotators, the adductors, the psoas major and the iliacus muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000894.label: Infantile muscular hypotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000894.definition: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in infancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000894.label: Proximal upper limb amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000894.definition: Muscular atrophy affecting proximally located muscles of the arms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.label: Shoulder muscle hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.definition: Underdevelopment of muscles of the shoulder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.label: Intrinsic hand muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.definition: Atrophy of the intrinsic muscle groups of the hand, comprising the thenar and hypothenar muscles; the interossei muscles; and the lumbrical muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.label: Progressive distal muscular atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.definition: Progressive muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.label: Proximal lower limb amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.definition: Muscular atrophy affecting proximally located muscles of the legs, i.e., of the thigh.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.label: Distal upper limb muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000895.definition: Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the arms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.label: Calf muscle hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.definition: Underdevelopment of the muscuklature of the calf.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.label: Tibialis muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.definition: Muscle weakness affecting the tibialis anterior muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.label: Nonprogressive muscular atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.definition: Muscular atrophy that does not display a progression in severity with time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.label: Exercise-induced muscle stiffness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.definition: A type of muscle stiffness that occurs following physical exertion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.label: Muscle hypertrophy of the lower extremities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000896.definition: Muscle hypertrophy primarily affecting the legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000897.label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000897.definition: Decreased activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.label: Calf muscle hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.definition: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the calf muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.label: Neck muscle hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.definition: Underdevelopment of muscles of the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.label: Increased intramuscular fat
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.definition: An abnormal increase in the amount of intramuscular fat tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.label: Agenesis of the diaphragm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.definition: Congenital lack, i.e., aplasia of the diaphragm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.label: Pelvic girdle muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000898.definition: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles that attach to the pelvic girdle (the gluteal muscles, the lateral rotators, adductor magnus, adductor brevis, adductor longus, pectineus, and gracilis muscles).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000899.label: Exercise-induced leg cramps
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000899.definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles of the leg brought on by physical exertion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000899.label: Increased intraabdominal fat
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000899.definition: An abnormal increase in the amount of intraabdominal fat tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000899.label: Proximal muscle weakness in lower limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000899.definition: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles of the legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000899.label: Proximal muscle weakness in upper limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000899.definition: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles of the arms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000900.label: Loss of truncal subcutaneous adipose tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000900.definition: Loss (reduction of previously present) of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the region of the trunk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000900.label: Increased subcutaneous truncal adipose tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000900.definition: The presence of an abnormally increased amount of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the trunk of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000900.label: Weakness of the intrinsic hand muscles

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000901.label: Hypoplasia of serratus anterior muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000901.definition: Underdevelopment of the serratus anterior muscle, which is involved in abduction, upward Rotation, and elevation of the scapula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000901.label: Upper limb muscle hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000901.definition: Underdevelopment of muscles of the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000901.label: Loss of gluteal subcutaneous adipose tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000901.definition: Loss (reduction of previously present) of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the gluteal region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000901.label: Progressive loss of facial adipose tissue

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.label: Exercise-induced muscle fatigue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.definition: An abnormally increased tendency towards muscle fatigue induced by physical exercise.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.label: Abdominal wall muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.definition: Decreased strength of the abdominal musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.label: Increased connective tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.definition: The presence of an abnormally increased amount of connective tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.label: Hypoplasia of latissimus dorsi muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.definition: Underdevelopment of the latissimus dorsi muscle, which is involved in adduction, extension, internal rotation, and transverse extension of the shoulder and assists in movement of the scapula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.label: Foot dorsiflexor weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.definition: Weakness of the muscles responsible for dorsiflexion of the foot, that is, of the movement of the toes towards the shin. The foot dorsiflexors include the tibialis anterior, the extensor hallucis longus, the extensor digitorum longus, and the peroneus tertius muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.label: Generalized weakness of limb muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000902.definition: Generalized weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000903.label: Amyotrophy of ankle musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000903.definition: Atrophy of the muscles of the ankle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000904.label: Peroneal muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000904.definition: Atrophy of the peroneous muscles, peroneus longus (also known as Fibularis longus), Peroneus brevis (also known as fibularis brevis, and Peroneus tertius (also known as fibularis tertius).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.label: Quadriceps muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.definition: Muscular atrophy involving the quadriceps muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.label: Increased muscle glycogen content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.definition: An increased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.label: Distal lower limb muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.definition: Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.label: Generalized limb muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.definition: Generalized (unlocalized) atrophy affecting muscles of the limbs in both proximal and distal locations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.label: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue from upper limbs
Increased muscle lipid content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000905.definition: An abnormal accumulation of lipids in skeletal muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.label: Scapular muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.definition: Atrophy of the muscles that are responsible for moving the scapula, which are the levator scapulae, the infraspinatus muscle, the teres major, the teres minor, and the supraspinatus muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.label: Infantile axial hypotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.definition: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk and with onset in infancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.label: Progressive distal muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.definition: Progressively reduced strength of the distal musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.label: Generalized lipodystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.definition: Generalized degenerative changes of the fat tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.label: Progressive spinal muscular atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000906.definition: Progressive spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000907.label: Inflammatory myopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000907.definition: Chronic muscle inflammation accompanied by muscle weakness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000907.label: Decreased Achilles reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000907.definition: Decreased intensity of the Achilles reflex (also known as the ankle jerk reflex), which can be elicited by tapping the tendon is tapped while the foot is dorsiflexed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000907.label: Progressive proximal muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000907.definition: Lack of strength of the proximal muscles that becomes progressively more severe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000907.label: Weakness of long finger extensor muscles

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000908.label: Midline notch of upper alveolar ridge
Alveolar ridge overgrowth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000908.definition: Increased width of the alveolar ridges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000908.label: Speech articulation difficulties
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000908.definition: Impairment in the physical production of speech sounds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000909.label: Chronic oral candidiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000909.definition: Chronic accumulation and overgrowth of the fungus Candida albicans on the mucous membranes of the mouth, generally manifested as associated with creamy white lesions on the tongue or inner cheeks, occasionally spreading to the gums, tonsils, palate or oropharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000909.label: Median cleft palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000909.definition: Cleft palate of the midline of the palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.label: Submucous cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.definition: A cleft of the lip with overlying mucous membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.label: Anterior open-bite malocclusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.definition: Anterior open bite is a malocclusion characterized by a gap between the anterior teeth (incisors), that is, by a deficiency in the normal vertical overlap between antagonist incisal edges when the posterior teeth are in occlusion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pubic bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the pubic bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.label: Abnormal ossification of the pubic bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.definition: Abnormal ossification (bone tissue formation) affecting the pubic bone, also known as the pubis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.label: Abnormal pelvis bone ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the bony pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.label: Abnormal ossification involving the femoral head and neck
Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the femoral head and neck
Denervation of the diaphragm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000910.definition: Interruption of the innervation of the diaphragm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.label: Diaphragmatic eventration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.definition: A congenital failure of muscular development of part or all of one or both hemidiaphragms, resulting in superior displacement of abdominal viscera and altered lung development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.label: Aplasia of the left hemidiaphragm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.definition: Congenital absence of the left half of the diaphragm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.label: Diaphragmatic weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.definition: A decrease in the strength of the diaphragm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving the skeleton
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of one or more components of the skeleton.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the skull
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the maxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the maxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the mandible
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the mandible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the frontal sinuses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000911.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of frontal sinus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the sinuses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of a cranial sinus or sinuses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.label: Abnormal axial skeleton morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.definition: An abnormality of the axial skeleton, which comprises the skull, the vertebral column, the ribs and the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia affecting bones of the axial skeleton
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of bones of the axial skeleton.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.label: Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin
Abnormal adipose tissue morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.definition: An abnormality of adipose tissue, which is loose connective tissue composed of adipocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.label: Lipodystrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.definition: Degenerative changes of the fat tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.label: Increased adipose tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.definition: An increase in adipose tissue mass by hyperplastic growth (increase in the number of adipocytes) or by hypertrophic growth (increase in the size of adipocytes occurring primarily by lipid accumulation within the cell).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.label: Abnormality of the musculature of the limbs
Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the musculature of the extremities
Upper limb amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000912.definition: Muscular atrophy involving the muscles of the upper limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000913.label: Hand muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000913.definition: Muscular atrophy involving the muscles of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000913.label: Abnormality of the musculature of the thorax
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000913.definition: A disease or lesion affecting the muscles of the thorax.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000913.label: Abnormal tarsal bone mineral density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000913.definition: This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density of the tarsal bones, which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000913.label: Osteolysis involving bones of the feet
Duplication involving bones of the feet
Synostosis involving bones of the lower limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000913.definition: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones lower limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000913.label: Osteolysis involving bones of the lower limbs

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000914.label: Synostosis involving bones of the feet
Depletion of mitochondrial DNA in muscle tissue
Duplication of bones involving the upper extremities
Supernumerary bones of the axial skeleton
Abnormal cerebral artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000914.definition: Any structural anomaly of a cerebral artery. The cerebral arteries comprise three main pairs of arteries and their branches, which supply the cerebrum of the brain. These are the anterior cerebral artery, the middle cerebral artery, and the posterior cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000914.label: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000914.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000914.label: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000914.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000914.label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000914.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.label: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.definition: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.definition: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.label: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the little finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the little finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.label: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the little finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.label: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.label: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000915.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.label: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.definition: Absence or underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the middle phalanx of the little (5th) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.label: Absent middle phalanx of 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.definition: Absence of the middle phalanx of the little (5th) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.label: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.label: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the middle phalanx of the 5th finger is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.label: Broad middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000916.definition: Increased width of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.label: Triangular epiphyses of the metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpals. Thess epiphyses are located at the distal end of the metacarpals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.label: Abnormal 4th finger phalanx morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.definition: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 4th (ring) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.label: Curved middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.definition: Curved appearance of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.label: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.definition: Patchy increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.label: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.definition: Fusion of the proximal and middle phalanges of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.label: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.definition: Fusion of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger with another bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.label: Deviation of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000917.definition: Displacement of the 5th finger from its normal position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.label: Ulnar deviation of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.definition: Displacement of the 5th finger towards the ulnar side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.label: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.definition: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 5th (little) finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.label: Joint contracture of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 5th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.label: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.definition: Proximal interphalangeal (PIP) flexion deformity of the little finger. That is, the PIP joint of a little finger is bent (flexed) and cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.label: Contracture of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.label: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.definition: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the fifth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.definition: A secondary ossification center in the distal phalanx of the fifth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.label: Fragmentation of the metacarpal epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000918.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Irregular epiphyses of the metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphyses of the metacarpals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Ivory epiphyses of the metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the metacarpals, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: Absence or underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the proximal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Pseudoepiphyses of the metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: A pseudoepiphysis is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis. The normal metacarpal epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones. Accessory epiphyses (which are also known as pseudoepiphyses) can also occasionally be observed at the proximal ends of the metacarpals, usually involving the 2nd metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Small epiphyses of the metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphyses located at the distal end of the metacarpals in respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Epiphyseal stippling of the metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the metacarpals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Absent metacarpal epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: Absence of the epiphyses of the metacarpal bones, which are normally located at the distal ends of the metacarpals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the fifth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.label: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000919.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000920.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000920.definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000920.definition: An abnormality of the middle phalanx of the fifth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000920.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000920.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the little finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000920.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000920.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000920.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the little finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000921.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000921.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000922.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.label: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.label: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the ring finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.definition: A secondary ossification center in the distal phalanx of the fourth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.label: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000925.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the ring finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the fourth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: A secondary ossification center in the proximal phalanx of the fourth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.label: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000926.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.label: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.label: Deviation of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.definition: Displacement of the 4th finger from its normal position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.label: Joint contracture of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 4th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.label: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. That is, the PIP joint of a fourth finger is bent (flexed) and cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.label: Contracture of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.label: Ulnar deviation of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.definition: Displacement of the 4th finger towards the ulnar side (i.e., towards the 5th finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.label: Radial deviation of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000927.definition: Displacement of the 4th finger towards the radial side (i.e., towards the thumb).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000928.label: Short 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000928.definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the fourth finger, also known as the ring finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000928.definition: Curved appearance of the distal phalanx of the 4th (ring) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.definition: Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the fourth finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.label: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.definition: Absence of the distal phalanx of the ring (4th) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.label: Broad distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.definition: Increased width of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.label: Broad middle phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.definition: Increased width of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.label: Absent middle phalanx of 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.definition: Absence of the middle phalanx of the ring (4th) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.label: Short middle phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.definition: Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the 4th finger, also known as the ring finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.label: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the middle phalanx of the 4th finger is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.label: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000929.definition: Absence of the proximal phalanx of the ring (4th) finger.

Short proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.definition: Hypoplastic/small proximal phalanx of the fourth finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.label: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the distal phalanx of the 4th finger is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.label: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the fourth finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.label: Distal/middle symphalangism of 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.definition: Fusion of the terminal/distal and middle phalanges of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.label: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.definition: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 4th (ring) finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.label: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the fourth finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.label: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.definition: Fusion of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger with another bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.label: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000930.definition: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 4th (ring) finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.label: Broad proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.label: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.label: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the fourth finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger with another bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.label: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.definition: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 4th (ring) finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.definition: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 3rd (middle) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000931.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 3rd finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 3rd finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000932.label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000932.definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 3rd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000932.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000932.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.label: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger with the 3rd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger with the 3rd metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.label: Deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.definition: Displacement of the hand or of fingers of the hand from their normal position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.label: Radial deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand
Radial deviation of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.definition: An abnormal position of the hand in which the wrist is bent toward the radius (i.e., toward the thumb).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.label: Ulnar deviation of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.definition: Divergence of the longitudinal axis of the hand at the wrist in a posterior (ulnar) direction (i.e., towards the little finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.label: Absent epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.definition: Absence of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.label: Bracket epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000948.definition: An abnormality of the second finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Enlarged epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Irregular epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Ivory epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.definition: A secondary ossification center in the second finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Small epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Triangular epiphyses of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000949.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.label: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.definition: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the second finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.label: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.label: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.label: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
