http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000950.definition: A secondary ossification center in the distal phalanx of the second finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000951.label: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000951.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000951.label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000951.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000951.label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000951.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000951.label: Absent epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Bracket epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000951.definition: An abnormality of the middle phalanx of the second finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000951.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Enlarged epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Irregular epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Ivory epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000952.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000952.definition: A secondary ossification center in the middle phalanx of the second finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000952.label: Small epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Stippling of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Triangular epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000952.definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the second finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000952.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.label: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.definition: A secondary ossification center in the proximal phalanx of the second finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.label: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Short 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.definition: Hypoplasia of the second finger, also known as the index finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.label: Flexion contracture of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 2nd finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 2nd finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.label: Contracture of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000953.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 2nd finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000954.label: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000954.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000954.label: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000954.definition: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 2nd (index) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000954.label: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Triangular shaped phalanges of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000954.definition: Triangular shaped phalanges of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000954.label: Bullet-shaped phalanges of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000954.definition: A second finger with short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
Patchy sclerosis of 2nd finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
Abnormality of the hairline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.definition: The hairline refers to the outline of hair of the head. An abnormality of the hairline can refer to an unusually low or high border between areas of the scalp with and without hair or to abnormal projections of scalp hair.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.label: Preauricular hair displacement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.definition: An tongue-like extension of hair towards the cheeks, in which hair growth extends in front of the ear to the lateral cheekbones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Broad distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.definition: Increased width of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.label: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000955.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.label: Curved distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.definition: Curved appearance of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.label: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the second finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.label: Distal/middle symphalangism of 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.definition: Fusion of the terminal/distal and middle phalanges of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.label: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.definition: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.label: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Short distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the distal phalanx of the second finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Broad middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000956.definition: Increased width of the middle phalanx of the second finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.label: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.label: Curved middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.definition: Curved appearance of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.label: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the second finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.label: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.definition: Fusion of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger with another bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.label: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.definition: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.label: Absent middle phalanx of 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.definition: Absence of the middle phalanx of the index (2nd) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.label: Short middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the middle phalanx of the second finger, also known as the index finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.label: Proximal/middle symphalangism of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000957.definition: Fusion of the proximal and middle phalanges of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Broad proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.label: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.label: Curved proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.definition: Curved appearance of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.label: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with another bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.label: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.definition: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.label: Vestibular schwannoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000958.definition: A vestibular schwannoma (also known as acoustic neuroma, acoustic neurinoma, or acoustic neurilemoma) is a benign, usually slow-growing tumor that develops from the VIIIth cranial nerve supplying the inner ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.label: Abnormality of the vestibulocochlear nerve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.definition: Any structural anomaly of the vestibulocochlear nerve. The vestibulocochlear nerve consists of the vestibular and cochlear nerves, also known as cranial nerve eight (CN VIII). Each nerve has distinct nuclei within the brainstem. The vestibular nerve is primarily responsible for maintaining body balance and eye movements, while the cochlear nerve is responsible for hearing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.label: Astrocytoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.definition: Astrocytoma is a neoplasm of the central nervous system derived from astrocytes. Astrocytes are a type of glial cell, and thus astrocytoma is a subtype of glioma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.label: Peripheral schwannoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.definition: The presence of a peripheral schwannoma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.label: Retinal hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.definition: A hamartoma (a benign, focal malformation consisting of a disorganized mixture of cells and tissues) of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.label: Occasional neurofibromas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.definition: Neurofibromas present in a smaller number than usually seen in neurofibromatosis type 1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.label: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.definition: Absence of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.label: Short proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.label: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with the 2nd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with the 2nd metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.label: Abnormality of thumb epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000959.definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, and distal phalanges of the thumb and/or the 1st metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.label: Thumb contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.definition: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the thumb joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin. The term camptodactyly is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.label: Abnormality of thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.definition: A structural anomaly of one or more phalanges of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.label: Deviation of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.definition: Displacement of the thumb from its normal position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.label: Complete duplication of distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.label: Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.definition: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.label: Duplication of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000960.definition: Partail or complete duplication of the first metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.label: Bifid distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.definition: Complete or partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.definition: Complete or partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.label: Bifid proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.definition: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is partially duplicated. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.label: Complete duplication of the first metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.definition: Complete duplication of the first metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.label: Bifid first metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.definition: Partial duplication of the first metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.label: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.definition: Any anomaly of the distal phalanx of thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.label: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000961.definition: An anomaly of the shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.label: obsolete Radial deviation of the thumb
obsolete Ulnar deviation of the thumb
Distally placed thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.definition: Insertion of thumb at a more distal location than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.label: Carpometacarpal thumb joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the carpometacarpal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is formed by the first metacarpal and the trapezial bone and is also called Articulatio carpometacarpalis pollicis, carpometacarpal articulation of thumb, carpometacarpal joint of thumb or first carpometacarpal articulation. Seldom referred to as thumb saddle joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.label: Metacarpophalangeal thumb joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is also called Articulatio metacarpophalangealis pollicis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.label: Interphalangeal thumb joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is also called Articulatio interphalangealis pollicis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000962.definition: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is either small/hypoplastic or absent. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.label: Broad proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.label: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.label: Curved proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.label: Osteolytic defect of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.definition: An uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.label: Synostosis of thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.definition: Fusion of a phalanx of the thumb with another bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.label: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.definition: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.label: Absent proximal phalanx of thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.definition: Absence of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.label: Short proximal phalanx of thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000963.definition: Hypoplastic (short) proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.label: Synostosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with the 1st metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Broad distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.definition: Increased width of the distal phalanx of thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.label: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the distal phalanx of the thumb is affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.label: Curved distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.label: Osteolytic defect of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.label: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.definition: An uneven increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.label: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.definition: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the thumb. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.label: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000964.definition: Absence of the distal/terminal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.label: Short distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.definition: Hypoplastic (short) distal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.label: Bullet-shaped thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the thumb, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.label: Curved thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of a thumb phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.label: Osteolytic defect of thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of one or more phalanges of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.label: Patchy sclerosis of thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.definition: An uneven increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.label: Symphalangism of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.definition: Congenital fusion (ankylosis) of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.label: Triangular shaped thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.definition: Abnormal shape of one or more phalanges of the thumb such that affected phalanges resemble a triangle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the thumb
Partial absence of thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000965.definition: The absence of a phalangeal segment of a thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.definition: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.definition: This term applies if the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, which is located at the proximal end of the phalanx, does not appear in concordance with gender and age dependant norms as seen on x-rays. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.label: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.label: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.label: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.definition: Epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.label: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000966.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000967.definition: Epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: Uneven radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Absent epiphyses of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: Absence of one or more epiphyses of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Bracket epiphyses of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: An abnormality of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the thumb, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.label: Enlarged thumb epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000968.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.label: Fragmentation of thumb epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.definition: Epiphysis of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.label: Irregular thumb epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.definition: Uneven radiographic opacity of the one or more epiphyses of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.label: Ivory epiphysis of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.definition: Sclerosis of one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.definition: A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of one or more phalanges of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.label: Small thumb epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.definition: Abnormally small size of one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.label: Stippling of thumb epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in one or more distal interphalangeal joints of the fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000969.label: Osteolytic defects of the hand bones

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.label: Finger symphalangism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.definition: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the fingers. The synonymous term "symphalangism of the hand" may be translated as fusions of bones of varying digree, that involve at least one phalangeal bone of the hand. If bony fusions are referred to as "Symphalangism" the fusion occurs in a proximo-distal axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a radio-ulnar axis are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.label: Metacarpal synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.definition: Fusion involving two or more metacarpal bones (A synostosis of the first metacarpal and the proximal phalanx of the thumb can also be observed, note that the first metacarpal bone corresponds to a proximal phalanx).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.label: Carpal synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.definition: Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the carpus (scaphoid, lunate, triquetrum, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate, pisiform).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.label: Synostosis involving the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.definition: Fusion of the 1st metacarpal with another bone. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2 to 5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.label: Chronic CSF lymphocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.definition: Chronic cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) lymphocytosis is defined as the finding, in at least two serial CSF examinations, of more than 5 cells per cubic millimeter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.label: Increased CSF interferon alpha
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000970.definition: Increased concentration of interferon alpha in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.label: Chilblains
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.definition: Chilblains, also called perniosis, are an inflammatory skin condition related to an abnormal vascular response to the cold. We are unaware of a reliable estimate of incidence. It typically presents as tender, pruritic red or bluish lesions located symmetrically on the dorsal aspect of the fingers, toes, ears and nose. Less commonly, reports describe involvement of the thighs and buttocks. The lesions present hours after exposure to cold and usually resolve spontaneously in one to three weeks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.label: Retinal capillary hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.definition: A benign vascular tumor of the retina without any neoplastic characteristics.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.label: Spinal hemangioblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.definition: A hemangioblastoma of the spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.label: Papillary cystadenoma of the epididymis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.definition: A cystadenoma, an epithelial tumor, that originates within the head of the epididymis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.label: Subependymal nodules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.definition: Small nodular masses which originate in the subependymal region of the lateral ventricles and protrude into the ventricular cavity. They may represent subependymal hamartomas of tuberous sclerosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.label: Cortical tubers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.definition: Cortical tubers in the brain are hamartomatous lesions typically located at the gray-white matter interface, commonly in the frontal and parietal lobes. Cortical tubers are composed of abnormal glial and neural cells, and the size, number, and location vary among patients.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.label: Subependymal giant-cell astrocytoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.definition: A demarcated, largely intraventricular tumor in the region of the foramen of Monro composed of spindle to large plump or ganglion-like cells with eosinophilic to amphophilic cytoplasm and somewhat pleomorphic nuclei with occasional prominent nucleoli. These tumors are almost always associated with tuberous sclerosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.label: Hypomelanotic macule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000971.definition: Hypomelanotic macules ("ash leaf spots") are white or lighter patches of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by a lack of melanin. White ash leaf-shaped macules are considered to be characteristic of tuberous sclerosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Adenoma sebaceum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: The presence of a sebaceous adenoma with origin in the sebum secreting cells of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Shagreen patch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: A plaque representing a connective-tissue nevus. Connective tissue naevi are uncommon skin lesions that occur when the deeper layers of the skin do not develop correctly or the components of these layers occur in the wrong proportion. Shagreen patches are oval-shaped and nevoid, skin-colored or occasionally pigmented, smooth or crinkled. The word shagreen refers to a type of roughened untanned leather.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Dental enamel pits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: The presence of small depressions in the dental enamel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Abnormality of the subungual region
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: A lesion located beneath a fingernail or toenail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Subungual fibromas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: The presence of fibromata beneath finger or toenails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Bladder neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Renal neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Achromatic retinal patches
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: Areas of the retina lacking pigmentation. Punched out areas of chorioretinal hypopigmentation less than 1 disc diameter in size and tending to be located in the midperiphery of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Neoplasm of striated muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor) originating in striated muscle, either skeletal muscle or cardiac muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.label: Cardiac rhabdomyoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000972.definition: A benign tumor of cardiac striated muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.label: Rhabdomyoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.definition: A benign tumor of striated muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.label: Cerebral hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.definition: The presence of a hamartoma of the cerebrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.label: Plexiform neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.definition: A neurofibroma in which Schwann cells proliferate inside the nerve sheath, producing an irregularly thickened, distorted, tortuous structure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.label: Glioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.definition: The presence of a glioma, which is a neoplasm of the central nervous system originating from a glial cell (astrocytes or oligodendrocytes).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.label: Optic nerve glioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.definition: A glioma originating in the optic nerve or optic chiasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.label: Spinal neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.definition: A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) localized in the spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.label: Tibial pseudarthrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.definition: Pseudarthrosis, or "false joint" of the tibia is the result of a developmental failure in the tibia progressing to spontaneous fracture and subsequent fibrous nonunion. The fracture is rarely present at birth but commonly develops during the first 18 months of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.label: Lisch nodules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000973.definition: The presence of pigmented, oval and dome-shaped raised hamartomatous nevi of the iris..

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.label: Nephrosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.definition: Nephrosclerosis refers to thickening or scarring ("sclerosis") resulting from damage to the renal arterioles, also referred to as arteriosclerosis of the kidney arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.label: Stiff shoulders
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.definition: Shoulder joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in shoulders when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.label: Abnormal spinal dura mater morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.definition: An abnormality of the spinal dura mater, which is the outermost of the three layers of the meninges surrounding the spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.label: Spinal arachnoid cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.definition: Presence of arachnoid cysts of the spinal canal extradurally in the epidural space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.label: Thick nasal septum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.definition: Abnormally increased thickness of the nasal septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.label: Lumbosacral hirsutism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.definition: Abnormally increased hair growth in the lumbosacral region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.label: Large earlobe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000974.definition: Increased volume of the earlobe, that is, abnormally prominent ear lobules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.label: Aplasia of the pectoralis major muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.definition: Absence of the pectoralis major muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.label: Cleft in skull base
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.definition: A bony defect in the skull base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.label: Fibrous syngnathia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.definition: Complete or nearly complete soft tissue fusion of the alveolar ridges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.label: Ankyloblepharon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.definition: Partial fusion of the upper and lower eyelid margins by single or multiple bands of tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.label: Popliteal pterygium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.definition: A pterygium (or pterygia) occurring in the popliteal region (the back of the knee).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.label: Intercrural pterygium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.definition: A pterygium (or pterygia) in the intercrural (groin) region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.label: Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000975.definition: Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails is a rare and distinctive anomaly seen in popliteal pterygia syndrome.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.label: Antecubital pterygium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.definition: Pterygium affecting the elbow. This is a cutaneous web that can lead to severe flexion contracture of the elbow joint. Antecubital pterygium can be unilateral, bilateral, symmetric, or asysmmetric.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.label: Anterior clefting of vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.definition: Anterior schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.label: Facial wrinkling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.definition: Excessive wrinkling of the skin of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.label: Limb pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.definition: Chronic pain in the limbs with no clear focal etiology.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.label: Low hanging columella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.definition: Columella extending inferior to the level of the nasal base, when viewed from the side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.definition: Small or missing phalangeal bones of the fingers of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.label: Broad phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.definition: Increased width of the phalanges of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.label: Bullet-shaped phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000976.definition: The presence of short and wide phalanges which taper distally ("bullet shaped").

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the phalanges of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.label: Patchy sclerosis of finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.label: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.definition: Fusion of two or more phalangeal bones of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.label: Triangular shaped phalanges of the hand
Amniotic constriction ring
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.definition: Annular constrictions around the digits, limbs, or trunk, occurring congenitally (sometimes causing intrauterine autoamputation) and also associated with a wide variety of disorders. Constrictive amniotic bands are the result of primary amniotic rupture, which can lead to entanglement of fetal tissue (especially limbs) in fibrous amniotic strands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.label: Adactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.definition: The absence of all phalanges of all the digits of a limb and the associated soft tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.label: Absent thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.definition: Absent thumb, i.e., the absence of both phalanges of a thumb and the associated soft tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.label: Short thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.label: 3-4 toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000977.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes three and four.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.label: Iliac horns
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.definition: Horn-like malformations of the iliac crests with symmetrical bilateral central posterior iliac processes. A characteristic finding in the Nail-Patella syndrome. Iliac horns are visible on X-ray and may be palpable, but are asymptomatic.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.label: Lester's sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.definition: A zone of darker pigmentation around the central part of the iris with a roughly cloverleaf or flower shape.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the biceps
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the biceps muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the triceps
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the triceps muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the musculature of the thigh
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.definition: Absence or underdevelopment involving the musculature of the thigh.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the quadriceps
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the quadriceps muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.label: Perianal abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000978.definition: The presence of an abscess located around the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.label: Hemisacrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.definition: A hemisacral defect involving the sacral vertebrae S2 to S5. In hemisacrum, the first sacral vertebra is intact and there is agenesis involving only S2-S5.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.label: Bifid sacrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.definition: Presence of a bifid sacral bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.label: Presacral teratoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.definition: A type of sacrococcygeal teratoma located anterior to the sacrum and entirely inside the body (Altman type IV).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.label: Branchial anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.definition: Congenital developmental defect arising from the primitive branchial apparatus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.label: Branchial fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.definition: A congenital fistula in the neck resulting from incomplete closure of a branchial cleft.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.label: Branchial cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.definition: A branchial cyst is a remnant of embryonic development resulting from a failure of obliteration of a branchial cleft and consists of a subcutaneous cystic mass. Cysts are located anterior or posterior to the ear or in the submandibular region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.label: Cholesteatoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.definition: Cholesteatoma is a benign but potentially destructive growth consisting of keratinizing epithelium located in the middle ear and/or mastoid process. In cholesteatoma, a skin cyst grows into the middle ear and mastoid. The cyst is not cancerous but can erode tissue and cause destruction of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.label: Euthyroid goiter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.definition: A goiter that is not associated with functional thyroid abnormalities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.label: Supernumerary spleens
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000979.definition: The presence of two or more accessory spleens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.label: Maternal diabetes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.definition: Maternal diabetes can either be a gestational, mostly type 2 diabetes, or a type 1 diabetes. Essential is the resulting maternal hyperglycemia as a non-specific teratogen, imposing the same risk of congenital malformations to pregnant women with both type 1 and type2 diabetes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.label: Aplasia of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.definition: Absence of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.label: Short phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.definition: Short (hypoplastic) phalanx of finger, affecting one or more phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.label: Tooth agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.definition: The absence of one or more teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.label: Low-output congestive heart failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.definition: A form of heart failure characterized by reduced cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure owing to ischemic heart disease, hypertension, cardiomyopathy, and other causes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.label: Nephrogenic diabetes insipidus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.definition: A form of diabetes insipidus caused by failure of the kidneys to respond to vasopressin (AVP).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.label: Anomaly of the upper limb diaphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.definition: A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.label: Abnormal upper limb metaphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000980.definition: An anomaly of one or more metaphyses of the arms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.label: Abnormality of the elbow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.definition: An anomaly of the joint that connects the upper and the lower arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.label: Amelia involving the upper limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.definition: Amelia of one or both upper limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.label: Upper limb phocomelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.definition: Missing or malformed long bones of the upper limbs with the distal parts (the hands) connected to the variably shortened or even absent upper extremity, leading to a flipper-like appearance, as opposed to other forms of limb malformations were either the whole limb is missing (such as amelia), or the distal part of a limb is absent (peromelia).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.label: Upper limb peromelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.definition: Peromelia affecting only the upper limbs. That is, the distal parts of the arm are missing leading to stump formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the extremities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.label: Lower limb undergrowth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.definition: Leg shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the lower extremity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.label: Aplasia involving bones of the lower limbs
Amelia involving the lower limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.definition: Amelia of one or both legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.label: Lower limb phocomelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000981.definition: Phocomelia affecting only the lower limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.label: Lower limb peromelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.definition: Peromelia affecting only the lower limbs. That is, the distal parts of the leg are missing leading to stump formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.label: Forearm undergrowth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.definition: Forearm shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the forearm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.label: Aplasia involving bones of the upper limbs
Upper limb undergrowth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.definition: Arm shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the upper extremity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.label: Aplasia involving bones of the extremities
Limb undergrowth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.definition: Limb shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.label: Amelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.definition: Congenital absence (aplasia) of one or more limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.label: Peromelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.definition: The distal parts of the limbs are missing leading to a stump formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.label: Phocomelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000982.definition: Missing or malformed long bones of the extremities with the distal parts (such as hands and/or feet) connected to the variably shortened or even absent extremity, leading to a flipper-like appearance, as opposed to other forms of limb malformations were either the hole limb is missing (such as amelia), or the distal part of a limb is absent (peromelia).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.label: Peripheral neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.definition: Peripheral neuropathy is a general term for any disorder of the peripheral nervous system. The main clinical features used to classify peripheral neuropathy are distribution, type (mainly demyelinating versus mainly axonal), duration, and course.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.label: Mononeuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.definition: A focal lesion of a single peripheral nerve. Damage to a sensory nerve is accompanied by sensory impairment of all modalities in the affected anatomic distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.label: Abnormal distal phalanx morphology of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.definition: Any anomaly of distal phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.label: Abnormal middle phalanx morphology of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.definition: An anomaly of middle phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.label: Abnormal proximal phalanx morphology of the hand
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the distal phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.label: Broad distal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.definition: Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.label: Bullet-shaped distal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.definition: Short and wide distal phalanges that taper distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000983.label: Curved distal phalanges of the hand
Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the hand

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.label: Patchy sclerosis of distal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanges of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanges of the hand
Broad middle phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.definition: Increased width of the middle phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.label: Bullet-shaped middle phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.definition: Any of the middle phalanges with short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.label: Curved middle phalanges of the hand
Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanges of the hand
Patchy sclerosis of middle phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.label: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000984.definition: Fusion of a middle phalanx of a finger with another bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000985.label: Triangular shaped middle phalanges of the hand
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Broad proximal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000985.definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanges of the finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000985.label: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000985.definition: Short and wide proximal phalanges that taper distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000985.label: Curved proximal phalanges of the hand
Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Patchy sclerosis of proximal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000985.definition: Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanges of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000985.label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the hand
Triangular shaped proximal phalanges of the hand

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000987.label: Triangular shaped distal phalanges of the hand
Cerebellar ataxia associated with quadrupedal gait
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000987.definition: The presence of cerebellar signs and symptoms such as lack of balance associated with quadrupedal gait (locomotion on all four extremities with a 'bear-like' gait with the legs held straight).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000987.label: Simplified gyral pattern
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000987.definition: An abnormality of the cerebral cortex with fewer gyri but with normal cortical thickness. This pattern is usually often associated with congenital microcephaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.label: Broad distal phalanges of all fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.definition: Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger of all fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.label: Aplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand
Short distal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.definition: Short distance from the end of the finger to the most distal interphalangeal crease or the distal interphalangeal joint flexion point. That is, hypoplasia of one or more of the distal phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.definition: This term applies if one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.label: Tapered distal phalanges of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.definition: A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.label: Trichorrhexis nodosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.definition: Trichorrhexis nodosa is the formation of nodes along the hair shaft through which breakage readily occurs. It is thus a focal defect in the hair fiber that is characterized by thickening or weak points (nodes) that cause the hair to break off easily. The result is defective, abnormally fragile hair.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.label: Abnormality of secondary sexual hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.definition: Abnormality of the growth of secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty. In males, secondary sexual hair usually comprises body hair, including underarm, abdominal, chest, and pubic hair. In females, secondary sexual hair usually comprises a lesser degree of body hair, most prominently underarm and pubic hair.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.label: Localized hirsutism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000988.definition: Abnormally increased hair growth with a localized distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: High anterior hairline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the hairline and the glabella.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: Underdeveloped supraorbital ridges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: Flatness of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: Anotia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: Complete absence of any auricular structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: Telangiectasia of the ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: The presence of telangiectasia of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: Thickened ears
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: Increased thickness of the external ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: Abnormality of the crus of the helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: An abnormality of the crus of the helix, which is the horizontal piece of cartilage located outside the ear canal that divides the upper and lower parts of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: Abnormal antitragus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: An abnormality of the antitragus, which is a small tubercle opposite to the tragus of the ear. The antitragus and the tragus are separated by the intertragic notch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: Horizontal crus of helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: An abnormal horizontal axis orientation of the crus of the helix. That is, the main axis of the crus of the helix is perpendicular to the medial longitudinal axis of the ear, instead of sloping inferoposteriorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: Underdeveloped crus of the helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the crus of the helix. That is, flatter and/or shorter crus helix than average.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.label: Prominent crus of helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000989.definition: The presence of an abnormally prominent of the crus of the helix. That is, development of the crus helix to the same degree as an average antihelix stem or helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.label: Unilateral deafness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.definition: A unilateral absence of sensory perception of sound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.label: Crumpled ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.definition: Distortion of the course of the normal folds of the ear and the appearance of supernumerary crura and folds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.label: Cleft helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.definition: A notched form of the helix of the ear. That is, a defect in the continuity of the helix, which may occur at any point along its length.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.label: Conjunctival nodule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.definition: Presence of nodules in the conjunctiva of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.label: Thin ear helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.definition: Decreased thickness of the helix of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the earlobes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the ear lobes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.label: Attached earlobe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.definition: Attachment of the lobe to the side of the face at the lowest point of the lobe without curving upward.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.label: Anterior creases of earlobe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.definition: Sharply demarcated, typically linear and approximately horizontal, indentations in the outer surface of the ear lobe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.label: Uplifted earlobe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000990.definition: An abnormal orientation of the earlobes such that they point out- and upward. That is, the lateral surface of ear lobe faces superiorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.label: Aplasia of the middle ear ossicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.definition: Absence of the middle ear ossicles, malleus, incus, and stapes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.label: Abnormal temporal bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.definition: Abnormality of the temporal bone of the skull, which is situated at the sides and base of the skull roughly underlying the region of the face known as the temple.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the tragus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.label: Cyclopia
