http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.definition: Cyclopia is a congenital abnormality in which there is only one eye. That eye is centrally placed in the area normally occupied by the root of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.label: Corneal asymmetry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.definition: The presence of a size difference between the left and right cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.label: Anisocoria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.definition: Anisocoria, or unequal pupil size, may represent a benign physiologic variant or a manifestation of disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.label: Persistent pupillary membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.definition: The presence of remnants of a fetal membrane that persist as strands of tissue crossing the pupil.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.label: Ectopia pupillae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.definition: A malposition of the pupil owing to a developmental defect of the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.label: Retinoblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000991.definition: A tumor of the eye originating from cells of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.label: Nevus of Ota
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.definition: A dermal melanocytic hamartoma that presents as bluish hyperpigmentation on the face along the first or second branches of the trigeminal nerve. Nevus of Ota may involve the sclera.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.label: Duane anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.definition: A condition associated with a limitation of the horizontal ocular movement with retraction of the globe and narrowing of the palpebral fissure on adduction

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.label: Vascular remnant arising from the disc
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.definition: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.definition: Underdevelopment or absence of the nose or parts thereof.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.label: Epiphora
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.definition: Abnormally increased lacrimation, that is, excessive tearing (watering eye).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.label: Aplasia of the nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.definition: Complete absence of all nasal structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.label: Thick nasal alae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.definition: Increase in bulk of the ala nasi.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.label: Abnormal columella morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000992.definition: A structural abnormality of the columella.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.label: Asymmetry of the nares
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.definition: Asymmetry or size difference between the left and right nostril.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.label: Single naris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.definition: The presence of only a single nostril.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.label: Narrow naris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.definition: Slender, slit-like aperture of the nostril.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.label: Supernumerary naris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.definition: The presence of more than two nostrils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nasal septum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the nasal septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.label: Sunken cheeks
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000993.definition: Lack or loss of the soft tissues between the zygomata and mandible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.label: Asymmetry of the mandible
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.definition: Lack of symmetry between the left and right mandible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.label: Asymmetry of the mouth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.definition: The presence of an asymmetric mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.label: Duplication of thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.definition: Complete or partial duplication of the phalanges of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones (bifid), two separate bones appearing side to side, or completely duplicated phalanges (proximal and distal phalanx of the thumb and/or 1st metacarpal). In contrast to the phalanges of the digits 2-5 (proximal, middle and distal), the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.label: Complete duplication of thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.label: Partial duplication of thumb phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.label: Duplication of phalanx of 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000994.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.definition: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.definition: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.definition: Complete duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.definition: Partial duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.label: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.label: Duplication of phalanx of 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000995.definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of middle finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the third proximal phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of middle finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: Complete duplication of the third proximal phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000996.definition: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of middle finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.definition: Partial duplication of the third proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.label: Duplication of phalanx of 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.label: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the fourth proximal phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000997.definition: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.definition: Complete duplication of the fourth proximal phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.definition: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.definition: Partial duplication of the fourth proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.label: Duplication of phalanx of 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.label: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000998.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: Complete duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: Complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: Partial duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Duplication of phalanx of hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Complete duplication of phalanx of hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.label: Partial duplication of the phalanx of hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_000999.definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accessory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a pseudoepiphysis (see corresponding terms) sometimes also referred to as hyperphalangism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.definition: This term applies if one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.definition: This term applies if one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.label: Abnormal 1st metacarpal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001000.definition: A structural anomaly of the first metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.label: Abnormal 2nd metacarpal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.definition: Any abnormality of the second metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.label: Abnormal 3rd metacarpal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.definition: Any abnormality of the third metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.label: Abnormal 4th metacarpal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.definition: Any abnormality of the fourth metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.label: Abnormal 5th metacarpal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.definition: Any abnormality of the fifth metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.definition: In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits). The epiphysis of the first metacarpal is localized at the proximal end (as seen in the proximal phalanges of the other digits), whereas the epiphyses of the other metacarpal bones are located at the distal end. This term applies if the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is in any way abnormal, referring to age and gender depending norms, as seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.label: Bracket epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.definition: An epiphysis that curves around from its transverse orientation to a longitudinal one from proximal to distal along one side of the phalanx, thus resembling the letter 'C' and forming a bracket around the diaphysis. This results in a so called delta phalanx characterized by a triangular or trapezoidal shaped bone with a C-shaped epiphyseal plate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.label: Enlarged epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the 1st metacarpal with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001001.definition: Epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal having multiple bony fragments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.label: Irregular epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.definition: Uneven radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.label: Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.definition: The epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal appears hard and dense like ivory. An ivory epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.definition: The epiphysis of the first metacarpal is localized at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone although an accessory epiphysis may be located at the distal end of the metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.label: Small epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.label: Epiphyseal stippling of the first metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the first metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.label: Broad 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.definition: Increased width of the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.label: Bullet-shaped 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.definition: The presence of short and wide 1st metacarpal which tapers distally ("bullet shaped").

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.label: Curved 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001002.definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the first metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.label: Osteolytic defects of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the 1st metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.label: Patchy sclerosis of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.definition: Uneven increase in bone density within the 1st metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.label: Triangular shaped 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.definition: This term applies to a triangular shaped 1st metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.label: Short 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.definition: A developmental defect characterized by reduced length of the first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.label: Aplasia of the 1st metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.definition: Absent first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 2nd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 2nd metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.label: Aplasia of the 2nd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.definition: Absence of the second long bone of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.label: Short 2nd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.definition: Short second metacarpal bone because of developmental hypoplasia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 3rd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001003.definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 3rd metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.label: Aplasia of the 3rd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.definition: Absence of the third long bone of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 4th metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 4th metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.label: Aplasia of the 4th metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.definition: Absence of the fourth long bone of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 5th metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 5th metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.label: Aplasia of the 5th metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.definition: Absence of the fifth long bone of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.label: Aplasia of metacarpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.definition: Developmental defect associated with absence of one or more metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.label: Short metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001004.definition: Diminished length of one or more metacarpal bones in relation to the others of the same hand or to the contralateral metacarpal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.label: Deviation of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.definition: Displacement of the big toe from its normal position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.label: Abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.definition: An abnormal shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.label: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Abnormality of the first metatarsal bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.definition: An anomaly of the first metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.label: Broad hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.definition: Visible increase in width of the hallux without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the hallux
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hallux
Broad hallux phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001005.definition: An increase in width in one or more phalanges of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.label: Bullet-shaped hallux phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.label: Curved hallux phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hallux
Patchy sclerosis of hallux phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more phalanges of the big toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.label: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hallux
Triangular shaped phalanges of the hallux
Duplication of phalanx of hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.definition: Partial or complete duplication of one or more phalanx of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the first metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.label: Broad first metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.definition: Increased side-to-side width of the first metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.label: Bullet-shaped 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001006.definition: An abnormal morphology of the firstmetatarsal bone, which is short and wide and tapers distally, and lacks the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.label: Curved 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of a proximal phalanx of the 1st metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.label: Osteolytic defects of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the first metatarsal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.label: Duplication of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.definition: A developmental defect consisting in the duplication of the first metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Broad distal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.definition: An increase in width of the distal phalanx of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.label: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.definition: An abnormal morphology of the distal phalanx of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.label: Curved distal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001007.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001008.label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the hallux
Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the hallux
Duplication of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Broad proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001008.definition: Increased width of proximal phalanx of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001008.label: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001008.definition: An abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001008.label: Curved proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001008.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of the proximal phalanx of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001008.label: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the hallux
Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.definition: Partial or complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.definition: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.definition: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Complete duplication of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.definition: A developmental defect consisting in the complete duplication of the first metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.label: Partial duplication of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001009.definition: A developmental defect consisting in the duplication of part of the first metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001010.label: Complete duplication of hallux phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001010.definition: Complete duplication of one or more phalanx of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001010.label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the hallux
Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Short distal phalanx of hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001010.definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the distal phalanx of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001010.label: Absent first metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001010.definition: A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the first metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001010.label: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Short proximal phalanx of hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001010.definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the proximal phalanx of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001011.label: Aplasia of the phalanges of the hallux
Short phalanx of hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001011.definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of a phalanx of big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001011.label: Mesoaxial foot polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001011.definition: The presence of a supernumerary toe (not a hallux) involving the third or fourth metatarsal with associated osseous syndactyly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001011.label: Absent hallux epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001011.definition: Failure to form (agenesis) of one or more epiphyses of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001011.label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the hallux

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the hallux.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.definition: In contrast to the metatarsals 2-5, the first metatarsal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, whereas the proximal phalanx of the big toe is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits. This term applies to abnormalities of the epiphysis of the first metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.definition: In contrast to the metatarsals 2-5, the first metatarsal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, whereas the proximal phalanx of the big toe is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits. This term applies to abnormalities affecting the proximal phalanx of the hallux.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.label: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.definition: Failure to form (agenesis) of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.label: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.definition: The epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux surrounds the diaphysis, having a bracket-like form.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001012.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001013.label: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001013.definition: A pseudoepiphysis (an accessory epiphysis that does not significantly contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone) located in the proximal phalanx of the big toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001013.label: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001013.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the proximal phalanx of the hallux.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001013.label: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001013.definition: Failure to form (agenesis) of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001013.label: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001013.definition: The epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux surrounds the diaphysis, having a bracket-like form.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001014.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001014.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of the hallux.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001014.label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Absent epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001014.definition: Failure to form (agenesis) of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001015.label: Bracket epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001015.definition: The epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal surrounds the diaphysis, having a bracket-like form.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001015.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001015.definition: A conical (cone-shaped) appearance of the epiphysis of the first metatarsal of the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001015.label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001015.definition: The epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal appears hard and dense like ivory. An ivory epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001015.label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001016.label: Absent epiphyses of the toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001016.definition: Absence of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001016.label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the toes

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.label: Epiphyseal stippling of toe phalanges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of phalanges of the toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the toes
Broad phalanx of the toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.definition: Increased width of phalanx of one or more toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.label: Bullet-shaped toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.label: Curved toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more toe phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the toes
Patchy sclerosis of toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001017.label: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the toes

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.label: Triangular shaped phalanges of the toes
Duplication of phalanx of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.definition: Partial/complete duplication of one or more phalanx of toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.label: Abnormality of the distal phalanges of the toes
Abnormality of the middle phalanges of the toes
Abnormality of toe proximal phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.definition: A morphological anomaly of one or more proximal phalanges of one or more toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the distal phalanges of the toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.label: Broad distal phalanx of the toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.definition: Increased width of the distal phalanx of toe of one or more toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.label: Bullet-shaped distal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more distal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.label: Curved distal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more distal toe phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001018.label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the toes

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.label: Patchy sclerosis of distal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the distal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.label: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanges of the toes
Triangular shaped distal phalanges of the toes
Duplication of distal phalanx of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.definition: A partial or complete duplication of one or more distal phalanx of toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanges of the toes
Broad middle phalanges of the toes
Bullet-shaped middle toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more middle phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.label: Curved middle toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more middle toe phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanges of the toes
Patchy sclerosis of middle toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001019.definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the middle phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.label: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanges of the toes
Triangular shaped middle phalanges of the toes
Duplication of middle phalanx of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.definition: Partial or complete duplication of a middle phalanx of toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of proximal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.definition: Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of the proximal phalanx of the toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.label: Broad proximal phalanx of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.definition: An increase in width of one ore more proximal toe phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.label: Bullet-shaped proximal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.label: Curved proximal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of a proximal phalanx of one or more toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.label: Osteolytic defect of the proximal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal toe phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.label: Patchy sclerosis of proximal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001020.label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the toes

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.label: Triangular shaped proximal phalanges of the toes
Duplication of proximal phalanx of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.definition: Partial/complete duplication of a proximal phalanx of toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.label: Flexion contracture of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.definition: One or more bent (flexed) joints of the first (big) toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.label: Contracture of the tarsometatarsal joint of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the tarsometatarsal joint of the hallux due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The tarsometatarsal joints of the feet are also called Lisfranc's joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.label: Contracture of the interphalangeal joint of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.definition: The interphalangeal joint of the big toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.label: Contractures of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.definition: The joint between the first metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the first (big) toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.label: Structural foot deformity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001021.definition: A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the bones of the foot (as well as muscle and soft tissue). In contrast if only the muscle and soft tissue are affected the term positional foot deformity applies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 2nd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the second metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the third metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.definition: The normal epiphysis of the third metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the 4th metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.definition: The normal epiphysis of the fourth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 5th metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the fifth metacarpal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.label: Pseudoepiphysis of the 5th metacarpal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.definition: The normal epiphysis of the fifth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.label: Absent epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.definition: Absence of one or more epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.label: Bracket epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001022.definition: Bracket epiphysis refers to an abnormality in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the fingers of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Enlarged epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Irregular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Ivory epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Pseudoepiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: A secondary ossification center in the phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Small epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Epiphyseal stippling of finger phalanges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of phalanges of the fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Triangular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.label: Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001023.definition: Absence of one or more middle phalanx of a finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001024.label: Short proximal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001024.definition: Congenital hypoplasia of one or more proximal phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001024.label: Aplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Abnormality of the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001024.definition: Any anomaly of distal epiphysis of phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001024.label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
Abnormality of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Absent epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
Bracket epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001024.definition: An abnormality of the distal phalanges of the hand in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001024.label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
Enlarged epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001025.label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
Irregular epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
Ivory epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001025.definition: Distal epiphyses of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001025.label: Pseudoepiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001025.definition: A secondary ossification center in the distal phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001025.label: Small epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
Stippling of the epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
Triangular epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
Absent epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
Bracket epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001025.definition: An abnormality of the middle phalanges of the hand in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001025.label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001026.label: Enlarged epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001026.definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001026.label: Irregular epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
Ivory epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001026.definition: Epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001026.label: Pseudoepiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001026.definition: A secondary ossification center in the middle phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001026.label: Small epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
Stippling of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
Triangular epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
Absent epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Bracket epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001026.definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanges of the hand in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001027.label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Enlarged epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Irregular epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Ivory epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001027.definition: Epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001027.label: Pseudoepiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001027.definition: A secondary ossification center in the proximal phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001027.label: Small epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Stippling of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Triangular epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.label: Stomatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.definition: Stomatitis is an inflammation of the mucous membranes of any of the structures in the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.label: Cleft lower lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.definition: A gap in the lower lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.label: Thin lower lip vermilion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.definition: Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lower lip more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.label: Intra-oral hyperpigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.definition: Increased pigmentation, either focal or generalized, of the mucosa of the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.label: Oral synechia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.definition: Fibrous band between the mucosal surfaces of the upper and lower alveolar ridges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.label: Abnormal salivary gland morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.definition: Any abnormality of the salivary glands, the exocrine glands that produce saliva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.label: Abnormality of the submandibular glands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.definition: Any abnormality of the submandibular glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth, superior to the digastric muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.label: Abnormality of the sublingual glands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.definition: Any abnormality of the sublingual glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth anterior to the submandibular glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.label: Cleft maxillary alveolar ridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001028.definition: A gap (cleft) affecting one of the alveolar ridges, which are the protuberances in the mouth that contain the sockets (alveoli) of the teeth. An alveolar cleft can affect all structures of the alveolar ridge, including the gingiva, other mucosa, periosteum, alveolar bone, and teeth. Alveolar cleft occurs in response to divergence from normal development during frontonasal prominence growth, contact, and fusion. The most common alveolar portion of the cleft is located between the lateral incisor and the canine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.label: Short hard palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.definition: Distance between the labial point of the incisive papilla to the midline junction of the hard and soft palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased length of the hard palate (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.label: Prominent palatine ridges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.definition: Increased size and/or number of soft tissue folds on the palatal side of the maxillary alveolar ridge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the uvula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.definition: Underdevelopment or absence of the uvula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.label: Palate fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.definition: A fistula which connects the oral cavity and the pharyngeal area via the aspects of the soft palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.label: Ankyloglossia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.definition: Short or anteriorly attached lingual frenulum, associated with limited mobility of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.label: Bifid tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.definition: Tongue with a median apical indentation or fork.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.label: Smooth tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001029.definition: Glossy appearance of the entire tongue surface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.label: Abnormally low-pitched voice
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.definition: An abnormal decrease in the pitch of the voice.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.label: Spinal dysraphism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.definition: A heterogeneous group of congenital spinal anomalies that result from defective closure of the neural tube early in fetal life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.label: Spinal cord tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.definition: A neoplasm affecting the spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.label: Abnormal spinal meningeal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.definition: Any abnormality of the spinal meninges, the system of membranes (dura mater, the arachnoid mater, and the pia mater) which envelops the spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.label: Spinal meningeal diverticulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.definition: An outpouching of the spinal meninges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.label: Short thorax
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.definition: Reduced inferior to superior extent of the thorax.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.label: Stridor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.definition: Stridor is a high pitched sound resulting from turbulent air flow in the upper airway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.label: Asternia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.definition: The congenital absence of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.label: Bifid sternum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001030.definition: The sternal cleft is a rare congenital anomaly resulting from a fusion failure of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.label: Chylothorax
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.definition: Accumulation of excessive amounts of lymphatic fluid (chyle) in the pleural cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the breasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the breasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.label: Breast hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.definition: The presence of hypertrophy of the breast.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the diaphragm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the diaphragm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.label: Ebstein anomaly of the tricuspid valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.definition: Ebstein's anomaly refers to an abnormally placed and deformed tricuspid valve characterized by apical displacement of the septal and posterior tricuspid valve leaflets, leading to atrialization of the right ventricle with a variable degree of malformation and displacement of the anterior leaflet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the abdominal musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.label: Abnormal second toe morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001031.definition: An anomaly of the second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.label: Abnormal third toe morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.definition: An anomaly of the third toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.label: Abnormal fourth toe morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.definition: An anomaly of the fourth toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.label: Abnormal fifth toe morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.definition: An anomaly of the little toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 2nd toe
Abnormal morphology of phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.definition: An anomaly of a phalanx of second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.label: Flexion contracture of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.definition: One or more bent (flexed) joints of the second toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001032.label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 3rd toe

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001033.label: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 3rd toe
Flexion contracture of 3rd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001033.definition: One or more bent (flexed) joints of the third toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

Abnormality of the phalanges of the 4th toe
Flexion contracture of the 4th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001033.definition: One or more bent (flexed) joints of the fourth toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th toe
Flexion contracture of the 5th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001034.definition: One or more bent (flexed) joints of the fifth toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001034.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 2nd toe
Bullet-shaped 2nd toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001034.definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the second toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001035.label: Curved 2nd toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001035.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001035.label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 2nd toe
Patchy sclerosis of 2nd toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001035.definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the second toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001035.label: Second toe symphalangism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001035.definition: Fusion of the interphalangeal joints of the 2nd toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001035.label: Triangular shaped phalanges of the 2nd toe
Duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001035.definition: Partial or complete duplication of a phalanx of second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001035.label: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 3rd toe

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001036.label: Bullet-shaped 3rd toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001036.definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the third toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001036.label: Curved 3rd toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001036.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the third toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001036.definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the third toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001037.definition: An anomaly of the proximal phalanx of third toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001037.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the fourth toe.

Patchy sclerosis of 4th toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001037.definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

Triangular shaped phalanges of the 4th toe
Duplication of phalanx of the 4th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001037.definition: Partial or complete duplication of phalanx of fourth toe.
