http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001038.definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the fifth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001038.label: Curved 5th toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001038.definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the fifth toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001038.definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001042.definition: Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001042.definition: Complete duplication of a phalanx of second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.label: Aplasia of the phalanges of the 2nd toe
Short phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.definition: Reduced length of one or more phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.label: Absent distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.definition: Absence of distal phalanx of the second toe as a result of developmental aplasia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.label: Short distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.definition: Reduced length of the distal phalanx of the second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.label: Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Short middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.definition: Reduced length of the middle phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.label: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Short proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.definition: Reduced length of the proximal phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.label: Abnormal ventricular septum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001043.definition: A structural abnormality of the interventricular septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.label: Ectopic accesory toe-like appendage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.definition: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the fibular side of the foot, next top the little toe), preaxial (on the tibial side of the foot, next to the big toe) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between big and little toe), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.label: Ectopic accessory finger-like appendage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.definition: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the ulnar side of the hand, next to the little finger), preaxial (on the radial side of the hand, next to the thumb) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between thumb and little finger), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.label: Polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.definition: A congenital anomaly characterized by the presence of supernumerary fingers or toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.label: Bifid femur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.definition: A bifid or bifurcated appearance of the femur as seen on x-rays, possible appearing as a more or less severe bowing of the upper leg. Might be associated with hip dysplasia on the affected side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.label: Pulmonary insufficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.definition: The retrograde (backwards) flow of blood through the pulmonary valve into the right ventricle during diastole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.label: Primum atrial septal defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.definition: An ostium primum atrial septal defect is located in the most anterior and inferior aspect of the atrial septum. The ostium primum refers to an anterior and inferior opening (ostium) within the septum primum, which divides the rudimentary atrium during fetal development. The ostium primum is normally sealed by fusion of the superior and inferior endocardial cushions around 5 weeks' gestation. Ostium primum defects result from a failure of the fusion of the embryologic endocardial cushion and septum primum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.label: Tricuspid stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.definition: A narrowing of the orifice of the tricuspid valve of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.label: Anal fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.definition: An abnormal connection between the epithelialised surface of the anal canal and the perianal skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.label: Colonic atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001044.definition: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the colon. That is, there is an abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the colon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.label: Esophageal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the lumen of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the spleen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.label: Ectopia of the spleen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.definition: An abnormal (non-anatomic) location of the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.label: Pelvic bone asymmetry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.definition: Pelvic asymmetry refers to asymmetric positioning of landmarks on the two sides of the pelvis and may have a structural or functional etiology.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.label: Acetabular spurs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.definition: The presence of osteophytes (bone spurs), i.e., of bony projections originating from the acetabulum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.label: Steep acetabular roof
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.definition: An exaggeration of the normal arched form of the acetabular roof such that it takes on a steep appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.label: Abnormal greater sciatic notch morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.definition: An abnormality of the sacrosciatic notch, i.e., the deep indentation in the posterior border of the hip bone at the point of union of the ilium and ischium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.label: obsolete Widening of the sacrosciatic notch
Female pseudohermaphroditism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.definition: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In female pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is female (XX) and the gonads are ovaries, but the external genitalia are virilized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.label: True hermaphroditism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001045.definition: The presence of both ovarian and testicular tissues either in the same or in opposite gonads. Affected persons have ambiguous genitalia and may have 46,XX or 46,XY karyotypes or 46,XX/XY mosaicism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.label: Abnormality of the female genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.definition: Abnormality of the female genital system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.label: Abnormality of the male genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.definition: Abnormality of the male genital system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ovary
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.label: Aplasia of the ovary
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.definition: Aplasia, that is failure to develop, of the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.label: Streak ovary
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.definition: A developmental disorder characterized by the progressive loss of primordial germ cells in the developing ovaries of an embryo, leading to hypoplastic ovaries composed of wavy connective tissue with occasional clumps of granulosa cells, and frequently mesonephric or hilar cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.label: Precocious puberty in females
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.definition: The onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the testes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the testes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.label: Absent testis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001046.definition: Testis not palpable in the scrotum or inguinal canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.label: Supernumerary testes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.definition: The presence of more than two testes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.label: Oligosacchariduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.definition: Increased urinary excretion of oligosaccharides (low molecular weight carbohydrate chains composed of at least three monosaccharide subunits), derived from a partial degradation of glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.label: Abnormal circulating porphyrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.definition: An abnormality in the synthesis or catabolism of heme. Heme is composed of ferrous iron and protoporphyrin IX and is an essential molecule as the prosthetic group of hemeproteins such as hemoglobin, myoglobin, mitochondrial and microsomal cytochromes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.label: Porphyrinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.definition: Abnormally increased excretion of porphyrins in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.label: Bladder stones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.definition: Buildups of minerals that form in the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.label: Cloacal exstrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.definition: Cloacal exstrophy is a severe anterior abdominal wall defect in which the two hemibladders are visible and are separated by a midline intestinal plate, an omphalocele, and an imperforate anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the bladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.label: Patent urachus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001047.definition: Persistence of the urachal canal resulting in a canal between the bladder and the umbilicus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Urethral fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: The presence of an abnormal connection between the urethra and another organ or the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Urethral valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: The presence of an abnormal membrane obstructing the urethra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Acromelia of the upper limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: Shortening of the arms predominantly affecting terminal parts of the arm in relation to the upper and middle limb segments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Amniotic constriction rings of arms
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: Amniotic constriction rings affecting the arms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Hypertrophy of the upper limb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: Abnormal increase in size of the upper limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Hyperextensibility at elbow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: The ability of the elbow joint to move beyond its normal range of motion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Abnormality of the hypothenar eminence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: An abnormality of the hypothenar eminence, i.e., of the muscles on the ulnar side of the palm of the hand (i.e., on the side of the little finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Small hypothenar eminence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: Reduced muscle mass on the ulnar side of the palm, that is, reduction in size of the hypothenar eminence.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the palmar creases
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the palmar creases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.label: Absent palmar crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001048.definition: The absence of the major creases of the palm (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, or thenar crease).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Abnormality of the palmar creases
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: An abnormality of the creases of the skin of palm of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Digital constriction ring
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: A narrow segment of significantly reduced circumference of a digit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Osseous finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual finger bones. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Long metacarpals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: An abnormally increased length of the metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Acromelia of the lower limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: Shortening of the legs predominantly affecting terminal parts of the leg in relation to the upper and middle arm segments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Amniotic constriction rings of legs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: Amniotic constriction rings affecting the legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Hypertrophy of the lower limb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: Abnormal increase in size of the lower limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Sirenomelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: A developmental defect in which the legs are fused together.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Bipartite patella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: A developmental defect that occurs if the two halves of the patella fail to fuse in early childhood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.label: Patellar subluxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001049.definition: The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar subluxation refers to an unstable kneecap that does not slide centrally within its groove, i.e., a partial dislocation of the patella.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.label: Hyperextensibility of the knee
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.definition: The ability of the knee joint to extend beyond its normal range of motion (the lower leg is moved beyond a straight position with respect to the thigh).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.label: Limitation of knee mobility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.definition: An abnormal limitation of knee joint mobility.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.label: Fibular bowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.label: Fibular duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.definition: Duplication of the fibula. This may occur as a part of diplopodia (accessory tarsal or metatarsal bone). Diplopodia with double fibula is an extremely rare condition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.label: Increased length of the tibia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.definition: An abnormal increase in the length of the tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.label: Limitation of movement at ankles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.definition: An abnormal limitation of the mobility of the ankle joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.label: Abnormal plantar dermatoglyphics
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.definition: An abnormality of dermatoglyphs on the toes and soles, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of sole of foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.label: Foot asymmetry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.definition: A difference in size or shape between the left and right foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.label: Metatarsus valgus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001050.definition: A condition in which the anterior part of the foot rotates outward away from the midline of the body and the heel remains straight.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.label: Hypermobility of toe joints
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.definition: An ability of the toe joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.label: Long toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.definition: Toes that appear disproportionately long compared to the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.label: Pituitary calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.definition: Deposition of calcium salts in the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.label: Hyperpituitarism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.definition: Hypersecretion of one or more pituitary hormones. This can occur in conditions in which deficiency in the target organ leads to decreased hormonal feedback, or as a primary condition most usually in connection with a pituitary adenoma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the thymus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the thymus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.label: Ectopic thymus tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.definition: The presence of ectopic thymus tissue. Normally, cells of the ventral bud of the third pharyngeal pouch detach and migrate in the eighth gestational week caudally and medially towards the location of the mature thyroid. They migrate further retrosternally into the superior mediastinum. There are two main ways ectopic thymus tissue can develop. Either cells detach along the descensus path and proliferate, thereby forming accessory thymus tissue, or the entire gland fails to descend.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.label: Thyroglossal cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.definition: An abnormality of the thyroid gland owing to the presence of a fibrous cyst resulting from the persistence of the thyroglossal duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.label: Increased fetal movement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001051.definition: An abnormal increase in quantity or strength of fetal movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.label: Gait apraxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.definition: Gait apraxia affecting the ability to make walking movements with the legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.label: Dyslexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.definition: A learning disorder characterized primarily by difficulties in learning to read and spell. Dyslectic children also exhibit a tendency to read words from right to left and to confuse letters such as b and d whose orientation is important for their identification. Children with dyslexia appear to be impaired in phonemic skills (the ability to associate visual symbols with the sounds they represent).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.label: Alexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.definition: An acquired type of sensory aphasia where damage to the brain leads to the loss of the ability to read.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.label: Disturbed sensory perception
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.definition: Alteration or impairment in the processing or interpretation of sensory information can lead to abnormal perceptions or experiences.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.label: Finger agnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.definition: The examiner identified the inability to name, move, or touch specific fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.label: Dysgraphia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.definition: A writing disability in the absence of motor or sensory deficits of the upper extremities, resulting in an impairment in the ability to write regardless of the ability to read and not due to intellectual impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.label: Astereognosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.definition: Tactile agnosia refers to the inability to recognize objects by touch, while the inability to discriminate shape and size by touch is also a related condition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.label: Prosopagnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.definition: Inability to recognize faces of familiar persons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.label: Echolalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001052.definition: The repetition of words or phrases that are odd or used in a non-social manner. These can be words or phrases that the person has heard or invented.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.label: Palatal tremor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.definition: Palatal tremor (PT) is an involuntary, rhythmic and oscillatory movement of the soft palate. PT is a rare type of tremor involving the soft palate. It can be unilateral or bilateral.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.label: Spinal myoclonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.definition: Spinal myoclonus is generally due to a tumor, infection, injury, or degenerative process of the spinal cord, and is characterized by involuntary rhythmic muscle contractions, usually at a rate of more than one per second. Myoclonus occurs synchronously in several muscles and can be increased in severity and frequency by fatigue or stress, but is usually unaffected by sensory stimuli. Spinal myoclonus ceases during sleep or anesthesia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.label: Spasmus nutans
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.definition: The combination of pendular nystagmus, head nodding, and torticollis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.label: Transient global amnesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.definition: A paroxysmal, transient loss of memory function with preservation of immediate recall and remote memory but with a severe impairment of memory for recent events and ability to retain new information.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.label: Sleep apnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.definition: An intermittent cessation of airflow at the mouth and nose during sleep is known as sleep apnea. Apneas that last at least 10 seconds are considered significant, but individuals with sleep apnea may experience apneas lasting from 20 seconds up to 2 or 3 minutes. Patients may have up to 15 events per hour of sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.label: Central sleep apnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.definition: Sleep apnea results from a temporary loss of the central drive to the muscles responsible for breathing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.label: Wide cranial sutures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.definition: An abnormally increased width of the cranial sutures for age-related norms (generally resulting from delayed closure).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.label: Thin calvarium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001053.definition: The presence of an abnormally thin calvarium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Advanced pneumatization of cranial sinuses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: A degree of pneumatization that is increased compared to age-related norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Cutis gyrata of scalp
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: The presence of convoluted folds and furrows formed from thickened skin of the scalp, resembling cerebriform pattern. The scalp has convoluted and elevated folds, 1 to 2 cm in thickness. The convolutions generally cannot be flattened by traction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Vestibular nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: Nystagmus due to disturbance of the vestibular system; eye movements are rhythmic, with slow and fast components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Opsoclonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: Bursts of large-amplitude multidirectional saccades without intersaccadic interval

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Vertical nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: Vertical nystagmus may present with either up-beating or down-beating eye movements or both. When present in the straight-ahead position of gaze it is referred to as upbeat nystagmus or downbeat nystagmus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Downbeat nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: Downbeat nystagmus is a type of fixation nystagmus with the fast phase beating in a downward direction. It generally increases when looking to the side and down and when lying prone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Muscle fibrillation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: Fine, rapid twitching of individual muscle fibers with little or no movement of the muscle as a whole. If a motor neuron or its axon is destroyed, the muscle fibers it innervates undergo denervation atrophy. This leads to hypersensitivity of individual muscle fibers to acetyl choline so that they may contract spontaneously. Isolated activity of individual muscle fibers is generally so fine it cannot be seen through the intact skin, although it can be recorded as a short-duration spike in the EMG.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Muscle flaccidity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: A type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching, which results from loss of all or practically all peripheral motor nerves that innervated the muscle. Muscle tone is reduced and the affected muscles undergo extreme atrophy within months of the loss of innervation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Percussion myotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: A localized myotonic contraction in a muscle in reaction to percussion (tapping with the examiner's finger, a rubber percussion hammer, or a similar object).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.label: Weakness due to upper motor neuron dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001054.definition: Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Paralysis due to lesions of the principle motor tracts is related to a lesion in the corticospinal, corticobulbar or brainstem descending (subcorticospinal) neurons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.label: Paraplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.definition: Severe or complete weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.label: Paraplegia/paraparesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.definition: Weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities. Paraplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas paraparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.label: Oculogyric crisis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.definition: An acute dystonic reaction with blepharospasm, periorbital twitches, and protracted fixed staring episodes. There may be a maximal upward deviation of the eyes in the sustained fashion. Oculogyric crisis can be triggered by a number of factors including neuroleptic medications.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.label: Cutaneous finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.definition: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal joint of the adjacent fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.label: Overlapping fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.definition: A finger resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the hand is at rest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.label: Abnormality of the clivus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.definition: An abnormality of the clivus, which is the inclined bony region of the posterior cranial fossa located between the sella turcica and the foramen magnum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.label: Vertical clivus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001055.definition: An abnormal vertical orientation of the clivus (which normally forms a kind of slope from the sella turcica down to the region of the foramen magnum).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.label: Undulate clavicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.definition: An abnormally wavy surface or edge of the clavicles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.label: Undulate ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.definition: An abnormally wavy surface or edge of the ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.label: Bifid epiglottis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.definition: A midline anterior-posterior cleft of the epiglottis that involves at least two-thirds of the epiglottic leaf. It is a useful feature for clinical diagnosis because it appears to be very rare in syndromes other than Pallister-Hall-Syndrome and is also rare as an isolated malformation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the Epiglottis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.definition: This term applies if the Epiglottis is absent or hypoplastic.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.label: Hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.definition: A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that is native to the site of origin, e.g., exostoses, nevi and soft tissue hamartomas. Although most hamartomas are benign, some histologic subtypes, e.g., neuromuscular hamartoma, may proliferate aggressively such as mesenchymal cystic hamartoma, Sclerosing epithelial hamartoma, Sclerosing metanephric hamartoma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.label: Y-shaped metatarsals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.definition: Y-shaped metatarsals are the result of a partial fusion of two metatarsal bones, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Y-shaped metatarsals may be seen in combination with polydactyly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.label: Hamartoma of the eye
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.definition: A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) which can originate from any tissue of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.label: Elevated circulating 7-dehydrocholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001056.definition: Concentration of 7-dehydrocholesterol in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.label: Low maternal circulating alpha-fetoprotein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.definition: An abnormally low concentration of serum alpha-fetoprotein as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.label: Elevated circulating phytanic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.definition: An abnormal elevation of phytanic acid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.label: Dysplasia of the femoral head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the femoral head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.label: Intracranial cystic lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.definition: A cystic lesion originating within the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.label: Cone-shaped epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001057.definition: Cone-shaped epiphyses (also known as coned epiphyses) are epiphyses that invaginate into cupped metaphyses. That is, the epiphysis has a cone-shaped distal extension resulting from increased growth of the central portion of the epiphysis relative to its periphery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001058.label: Irregular epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001058.definition: An alteration of the normally smooth contour of the epiphysis leading to an irregular appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001058.label: Ivory epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001058.definition: Sclerosis of the epiphyses, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001058.label: Small epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001058.definition: Reduction in the size or volume of epiphyses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001058.label: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001058.definition: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at each end of a long bone, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.label: Abnormality of the distal femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.label: Abnormality of the proximal tibial epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.label: Abnormality of the distal tibial epiphysis
Abnormality of the proximal fibular epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.label: Abnormality of the distal fibular epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.label: Abnormality of the proximal radial epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.label: Abnormality of the distal radial epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.label: Abnormality of the proximal humeral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.label: Abnormality of the distal humeral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001059.definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.label: Abnormal distal ulnar epiphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.definition: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.label: Abnormal proximal ulnar epiphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.definition: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.label: Type 2 muscle fiber predominance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.definition: An abnormal predominance of type II muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.label: Odontogenic keratocysts of the jaw
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.definition: A benign uni- or multicystic, intraosseous tumor of odontogenic origin, with a characteristic lining of parakeratinized stratified squamous epithelium and potential for aggressive, infiltrative behaviour.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.label: Chalazion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.definition: A chronic epithelioid cell granulomatous inflammation of the meibomian gland caused by inflammation of a blocked meibomian gland. A chalazion or meibomian cyst appears as a painless tuberous swelling in the upper lid without loss of eyelashes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.label: Hordeolum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.definition: An acute purulent infection of the sebaceous glands of Zeis at the base of the eyelashes, of the apocrine sweat glands of Moll or the meibomian sebacious glands often caused by staphylococcus infections. Hordeola can either occur as Hordeola externa affecting the sebaceous glands of Zeis or the apocrine sweat glands of Moll or as Hordeola interna affecting the meibomian sebacious glands. In contrast to chalazia, hordeola are extremely painful and can cause extreme local swelling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.label: Hordeolum externum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.definition: Hordeola externa are acute purulent infections affecting the sebaceous glands of Zeis or the apocrine sweat glands of Moll, often caused by staphylococcus infections. In contrast to chalazia, hordeola are extremely painfull and can cause extreme local swelling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.label: Hordeolum internum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.definition: Hordeola interna are acute purulent infections affecting the meibomian sebacious glands, often caused by staphylococcus infections. In contrast to chalazia (chronic epithelioid cell granulomatous inflammation of the meibomian gland caused by inflammation of a blocked meibomian gland), hordeola are extremely painfull and can cause extreme local swelling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.label: Skin tags
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001060.definition: Cutaneous skin tags also known as acrochorda or fibroepithelial polyps are small benign tumors that may either form secondarily over time primarily in areas where the skin forms creases, such as the neck, armpit or groin or may also be present at birth, in which case they usually occur in the periauricular region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.label: Plantar pits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.definition: The presence of multiple pits (small, pinpoint-large indentations on the surface of the skin) located on the skin of sole of foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.label: Fibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.definition: Benign tumors that are composed of fibrous or connective tissue. They can grow in all organs, arising from mesenchyme tissue. The term "fibroblastic" or "fibromatous" is used to describe tumors of the fibrous connective tissue. When the term fibroma is used without modifier, it is usually considered benign, with the term fibrosarcoma reserved for malignant tumors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.label: Angiofibromas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.definition: Angiofibroma consist of many often dilated vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.label: Lung fibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.definition: The presence of a lung fibroma, a benign neoplasm that can present as a mass causing airway obstruction, cough, and hemoptysis, or present without symptoms as a solitary pulmonary nodule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.label: Ovarian fibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.definition: The presence of a fibroma of the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.label: Fibroadenoma of the breast
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001061.definition: A benign biphasic tumor of the breast with epithelial and stromal components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.label: Malar prominence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.definition: Prominence of the malar process of the maxilla and infraorbital area appreciated in profile and from in front of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.label: Cutaneous syndactyly of toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.definition: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between adjacent foot digits that involves at least half of the proximodistal length of one of the two involved digits; or, a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits of the foot that does not meet the prior objective criteria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.label: Neoplasm of the skeletal system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skeleton.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.label: Aplastic/hypoplastic toenail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the toenail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.label: Anterior pituitary dysgenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland, also known as the adenohypophysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.label: Anterior pituitary agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.definition: Absence of the anterior pituitary gland resulting from a developmental defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.label: Anterior pituitary hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.definition: Underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.label: Facial palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.definition: Facial nerve palsy is a dysfunction of cranial nerve VII (the facial nerve) that results in inability to control facial muscles on the affected side with weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure. This can either be present in unilateral or bilateral form.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.label: Abnormal morphology of the cortex of the humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001062.definition: Any abnormality affecting the cortex of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Abnormal metatarsal epiphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: Any abnormality of a metatarsal bone epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the feet
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: Any abnormality of the epiphyses of the feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Total anosmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: Inability to detect any qualitative olfactory sensation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Partial anosmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: Inability to perceive certain odorants (implies that the sense of smell is maintained for other classes of odorants).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Total hyposmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: Reduced ability to detect any qualitative olfactory sensation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Partial hyposmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: Reduced ability to perceive certain odorants (implies that the sense of smell is maintained for other classes of odorants).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Schizencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: The presence of a cleft in the cerebral cortex unilaterally or bilaterally, usually located in the frontal area.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Conjunctival amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: A form of amyloidosis that affects the conjunctiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of hepatic origin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: An abnormally increased level of liver isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.label: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of bone origin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001063.definition: An abnormally increased level of bone isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.label: Abnormality of the nasal cavity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.definition: Abnormality of the nasal cavity (the cavity includes and starts at the nares and reaches all the way through to the and includes the choanae, the posterior nasal apertures).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.label: Abnormality of the midnasal cavity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.definition: Abnormality of the midnasal cavity which includes the cavity between the nares and the choanae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.label: Midnasal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.definition: Absence or abnormal closure of the midnasal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.label: Midnasal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.definition: Abnormal narrowing (stenosis) of the midnasal cavity, i.e., of the middle nasal meatus, which in neonates can cause respiratory distress.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.label: Aplasia of the distal phalanges of the toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.definition: Absence of the distal phalanges of the toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.label: Cervical spine instability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.definition: An abnormal lack of stability of the cervical spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.label: Abnormal elasticity of skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.definition: Any abnormal increase or reduction in skin elasticity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.label: Dermal translucency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.definition: An abnormally increased ability of the skin to permit light to pass through (translucency) such that subcutaneous structures such as veins display an increased degree of visibility.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.label: Flat nasal alae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001064.definition: An abnormal degree of flatness of the Ala of nose, which can be defined as a reduced nasal elevation index (lateral depth of the nose from the tip of the nose to the insertion of the nasal ala in the cheek x 100 divided by the side-to-side breadth of the nasal alae).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Hypoplasia of the premaxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: An abnormality of the premaxilla (the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla) causing it to appear relatively small in size compared to the other parts of the maxilla or other facial structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Abnormal meningeal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: An abnormality of the Meninges, including any abnormality of the Dura mater, the Arachnoid mater, and the Pia mater.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Abnormal dura mater morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: An abnormality of the Dura mater.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Abnormality of the falx cerebri
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: An abnormality of the Falx cerebri.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Aplasia of the falx cerebri
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: A developmental defect characterized by aplasia of the Falx cerebri.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Epiphyseal stippling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Abnormal epiphyseal ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of an epiphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Patchy reduction of bone mineral density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: Patchy (irregular) reduction in bone density. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Patchy changes of bone mineral density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density. These changes can either be patchy reduction or increase of mineral density as seen on x-rays. Depending on the pathomechanism and the underlying disease, these changes can either appear solely as reduction or increase or as a combination of both (patches of bone showing an increased density while others are affected by reduction of mineral density).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.label: Patchy variation in bone mineral density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001065.definition: Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density with patches of bone showing an increased density side to side with patches that are affected by reduction of mineral density. This is sometimes referred to as a moth-eaten appearance on x-rays.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.label: Abnormal hand bone ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the skeleton of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.label: Absence of the third cerebral ventricle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.definition: A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the third ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.label: Abnormality of the diencephalon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.definition: An abnormality of the Diencephalon, which together with the cerebrum (telencephalon) makes up the forebrain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.label: Fusion of the left and right thalami
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.definition: A developmental defect characterized by fusion of the left and right halves of the thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.label: Bilateral coxa valga
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.definition: The presence of bilateral coxa valga.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.label: Hypoplasia of the anterior nasal spine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.definition: Underdevelopment of the anterior nasal spine of maxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.label: Aplasia of the maxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.definition: A congenital defect characterized by absence of the Maxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.label: Abnormal zygomatic bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.definition: An abnormality of the zygomatic bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.label: Hypoplasia of the zygomatic bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001066.definition: Underdevelopment of the zygomatic bone. That is, a reduction in size of the zygomatic bone, including the zygomatic process of the temporal bone of the skull, which forms part of the zygomatic arch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.label: Abnormality of the third metatarsal bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.definition: An abnormality of the third metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.label: Abnormal curvature of the vertebral column
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.definition: The presence of an abnormal curvature of the vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.label: Abnormal foot bone ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the skeleton of foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.label: Enuresis diurna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.definition: Enuresis occurring during waking hours of the day.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.label: Elevated tissue non-specific alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001067.definition: An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of renal origin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: An abnormally increased level of kidney isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Elevated intestinal alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, intestinal type in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Elevated placental alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, placental type in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Low tissue non-specific alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Low alkaline phosphatase of bone origin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: An abnormally reduced level of bone isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Low alkaline phosphatase of renal origin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: An abnormally reduced level of kidney isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Low alkaline phosphatase of hepatic origin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: An abnormally reduced level of liver isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Low intestinal alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, intestinal type in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Low placental alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, placental type in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.label: Mirror image polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001068.definition: A hand or foot with more than five digits that has a recognizable A/P axis of symmetry. The axis can lie within a normally formed or partially duplicated digit resembling a middle finger, index finger, thumb, toe, or hallux. Alternatively, the axis can be in an interdigital space with a flanking pair of digits that resemble a middle finger, index finger, thumb, toe or hallux. The most lateral digits on each side of the hand/foot typically resemble fifth fingers/toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: Mirror image hand polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: Mirror image duplication of digits affecting the hands only.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: Mirror image foot polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: Mirror image duplication of digits affecting the feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: 2-5 finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers two to five.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: Pulverulent cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: A kind of congenital cataract that is characterized by a hollow sphere of punctate opacities involving the fetal nucleus and that usually occurs bilaterally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: Lamellar pulverulent cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: A Lamellar cataract with a pulverulent (punctate, "dust-like" opacities) appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: Sutural cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: A type of congenital cataract in which the opacity follows the anterior or posterior Y suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: Polar cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: A type of Congenital cataract in which the opacities occupy the subcapsular cortex at the anterior or posterior pole of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: Anterior pyramidal cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: A type of anterior polar cataract which projects as a conical opacity into the anterior chamber.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: Nuclear pulverulent cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: A type of nuclear cataract involving congenital dust-like (pulverulent) opacity of the embryonal and fetal nucleus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.label: Triangular nuclear cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001069.definition: A nuclear cataract with a triangular form.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.label: Abnormal immunoglobulin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of immunoglobulins in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.label: Increased circulating antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.definition: An increased level of gamma globulin (immunoglobulin) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.label: 1-2 finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers one and two.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.label: 4-5 finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers four and five.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.label: 1-3 finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers one to three.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.label: 1-4 finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers one to four.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.label: 1-5 finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers one to five (complete syndactyly of all fingers of the hand).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.label: 2-4 finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001070.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of the fingers two to four.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.label: 3-5 finger syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers three to five.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.label: 1-2 toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes one and two.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.label: 1-4 toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes one to four.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.label: 1-5 toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes one to five (complete syndactyly of all toes of the foot).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.label: 2-4 toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes two to four.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.label: 2-5 toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes two to five.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.label: 3-5 toe syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes three to five.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.label: Osseous syndactyly of toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.definition: Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual bones of the toes. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a tibial-fibular axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.label: Abnormality of hair texture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001071.definition: An abnormality of the texture of the hair.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.label: Abnormal hair pattern
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.definition: An abnormality of the distribution of hair growth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.label: Abnormal hair whorl
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.definition: An abnormal hair whorl (that is, a patch of hair growing in the opposite direction of the rest of the hair).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.label: Asymmetry of the ears
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.definition: An asymmetriy, i.e., difference in size, shape or position between the left and right ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.label: Advanced pneumatization of the mastoid process
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.definition: An abnormally advanced degree of pneumatization (i.e., formation of air cells) in the mastoid process with respect to age-dependent norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.label: Prominent corneal nerve fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.definition: Abnormal prominence of the corneal nerve fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.label: Spontaneous rupture of the globe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.definition: Rupture of the eyeball not due to trauma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.label: Aplasia of the retina
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.definition: A developmental defect characterized by absence of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.label: Cherry red spot of the macula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001072.definition: Pallor of the perifoveal macula of the retina with appearance of a small circular reddish choroid shape as seen through the fovea centralis due to relative transparancy of the macula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.label: Double eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.definition: This may present as a partial or complete duplication of the eyebrows.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.label: Extension of eyebrows towards upper eyelid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.definition: The eyebrows extend towards - or even all the way down to - the margin of the upper eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.label: Nodular changes affecting the eyelids
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.definition: Nodular changes affecting the eyelids may have many different causes such as cystic lesions (chalaziae, hordeolae), lipogranulomas, melanomas, infectious diseases (Molluscum contagiosum) and many more.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.label: Naevus flammeus of the eyelid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.definition: Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.label: Fibrous dysplasia of the bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.definition: Tumor-like growths that consist of replacement of the medullary bone with fibrous tissue, causing the expansion and weakening of the areas of bone involved. Especially when involving the skull or facial bones, the lesions can cause externally visible deformities. The skull is often, but not necessarily, affected, and any other bone or bones may be involved. Fibrous dysplasia can either effect isolated bones (Monostotic fibrous dysplasia) or also generalized all bones of the body (Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.label: Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.definition: Fibrous dysplasia of the bones were lesions are localized in many bones throughout of the body. Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia is a cardinal feature of McCune-Albright syndrome.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.label: Monostotic fibrous dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.definition: Fibrous dysplasia of the bones were lesions are localized in only one bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.label: Osteopoikilosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001073.definition: Osteopoikilosis is a benign, asymptomatic sclerotic dysplasia of the bones. It affects both male and female and may be seen at any age. Radiographically sclerotic circular or ovoid lesions are usually symmetrically distributed in a periarticular location. Lesions can increase or decrease in size and number in serial radiographs or even disappear and do not have increased bone radiotracer uptake.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.label: Osteopathia striata
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.definition: A lamellar pattern visible on radiographs and mainly localized at the metaphyses of the long tubular bones. Pathologic-anatomical studies revealed that these benign signs on x-rays are the result of a juvenile metaphyseal bone necrosis. Calcifications in the necrotic marrow lead to this lamellar or lattice-like appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.label: Pedal edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.definition: An abnormal accumulation of excess fluid in the lower extremity resulting in swelling of the feet and extending upward to the lower leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.label: Edema of the upper limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin of the arms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.label: Short metatarsal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.definition: Diminished length of a metatarsal bone, with resultant proximal displacement of the associated toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.label: Absent metatarsal bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.definition: A developmental abnormality characterized by the absence (aplasia) of a metatarsal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.label: Aplasia of the phalanges of the toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.definition: Absence of a digit or of one or more phalanges of a toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.label: Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the toes
Medial flaring of the eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.definition: An abnormal distribution of eyebrow hair growth in the medial direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.label: Ectopic lacrimal punctum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.definition: Positioning of a lacrimal punctum other than at the medial margins of the eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.label: Blepharochalasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001074.definition: Blepharochalasis is characterized by recurrent, non-painful, nonerythematous episodes of eyelid edema. It has been divided into hypertrophic and atrophic forms. In the hypertrophic form recurrent edema results in orbital fat herniation through a weakened orbital septum. Most patients who have blepharochalasis present in an atrophic condition with atrophy of redundant eyelid skin and superior nasal fat pads.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.label: Dermatochalasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.definition: Loss of elasticity of the upper and lower eyelids causing the skin to sag and bulge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.label: Dimple chin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.definition: A persistent midline depression of the skin over the fat pad of the chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.label: Cleft mandible
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.definition: Midline deficiency of the mandible and some or all overlying tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.label: Abnormality of the temporomandibular joint
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.definition: An anomaly of the temporomandibular joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.label: Asymmetry of the maxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.definition: Asymmetry between the left and right sides of the maxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the premaxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the premaxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.label: Aplasia of the premaxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.definition: Absence of the premaxilla, which is the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.label: Abnormality of the premaxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.definition: An abnormality of the premaxilla, the most anterior part of the maxilla that usually bears the central and lateral incisors and includes the anterior nasal spine and inferior aspect of the piriform rim. The premaxilla contains the bone and teeth of the primary palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.label: Prominence of the premaxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001075.definition: Prominent positioning of the premaxilla in relation to the rest of the maxilla, the facial skeleton, or mandible. Not necessarily caused by an increase in size (hypertrophy of) the premaxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.label: Absent toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.definition: Aplasia of a toe. That is, absence of all phalanges of a non-hallux digit of the foot and the associated soft tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.label: Chordoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.definition: A chordoma is a tumor that arises from embryonic remnants of the notochord along the length of the neuraxis. Chordomas generally occur in the sacrum, intracranially at the clivus, or along the spinal axis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.label: Low insertion of columella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.definition: Insertion of the posterior columella below the nasal base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.label: Palmar hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.definition: Abnormal thickening of the skin localized to the palm of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.label: Ectopic calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.definition: Deposition of calcium salts in a tissue or location in which calcification does not normally occur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.label: Sacrococcygeal pilonidal abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.definition: The presence of a cyst, fistula, or abscess in the sacrococcygeal region (gluteal crease) characteristically accompanied by hair and skin folds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.label: Pilonidal sinus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001076.definition: A sinus in the coccygeal region (the region of the intergluteal cleft). A pilonidal sinus often contains hair and skin debris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.label: Pilonidal abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.definition: A hair-containing cyst or sinus usually in the coccygeal region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.label: Anomalous pulmonary venous return
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.definition: A developmental defect characterized by abnormal connection of one or more pulmonary veins to the superior or inferior vena cava, the right atrium, or the coronary sinus, resulting in a left-to-right shunt of oxygenated blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.label: Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.definition: A form of anomalous pulmonary venous return in which not all pulmonary veins drain abnormally. Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return frequently involves one or both of the veins from one lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.label: Cor triatriatum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.definition: The presence of an additional membrane in the left or right cardiac atrium which results in the subdivision of the affected atrium (and thus in total three atria, whence the name).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.label: Vascular ring
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.definition: A developmental defect of the aortic arch system in which the trachea and esophagus are completely encircled by connected segments of the aortic arch and its branches. This occurs if the normal process of regression and persistence of the bilateral embryonic aortic arches fails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.label: Tracheobronchmegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.definition: Marked widening of the trachea and major bronchi that may be predispose to chronic respiratory tract infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.label: Bronchomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.definition: Marked widening of the major bronchi that may be predispose to chronic respiratory tract infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.label: Large pelvis bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001077.definition: The presence of an abnormally large pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.label: Hyperacusis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.definition: Over-sensitivity to certain frequency ranges of sound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.label: Skin dimple
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.definition: Skin dimples are cutaneous indentations that are the result of tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) causing an indentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.label: Shoulder dimple
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.definition: A subtype of skin dimples occurring in the shoulder region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.label: Erythema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.definition: Redness of the skin, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.label: Uterine neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.label: Gonadal neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of a gonad.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.label: Urinary tract neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.label: Genital neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the genital system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.label: Testicular neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001078.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the testis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.label: Hypoplasia of the Leydig cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.definition: Underdevelopment of the interstitial (Leydig) cells of the testis. These cells produce testosterone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.label: Hyperplasia of the Leydig cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.definition: Hypertrophy or overdevelopment of the interstitial (Leydig) cells of the testis. These cells produce testosterone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.label: Bifid nail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.definition: A digit with two nails, with at least some soft tissue between them.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.label: Impaired visuospatial constructive cognition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.definition: Reduced ability affecting mainly visuospatial cognition which may be tested using pattern construction (for example by Differential Ability Scales, which test a person's strengths and weaknesses across a range of intellectual abilities).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.label: Hemangioblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.definition: A hemangioblastoma is a benign vascular neoplasm that arises almost exclusively in the central nervous system. Hemangioblastomas consist of a tightly packed cluster of small blood vessels forming a mass of up to 1 or 2 cm in diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.label: Lip freckle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.definition: Increased focal pigmentation of the vermilion of the lips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.label: Pinealoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001079.definition: A neoplasm of the pineal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: Absent cupid's bow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Lack of paramedian peaks and median notch of the upper lip vermilion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: Underdeveloped nasolabial fold
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Reduced bulkiness of the crease or fold of skin running from the lateral margin of the nose, where nasal base meets the skin of the face, to a point just lateral to the corner of the mouth (cheilion or commissure).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: Perioral hyperpigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Increased pigmentation, either focal or generalized, of the skin surrounding the vermilion of the lips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: Everted upper lip vermilion
