http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Inner aspect of the upper lip vermilion (normally apposing the teeth) visible in a frontal view, i.e., the presence of an everted upper lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: Tented upper lip vermilion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Triangular appearance of the oral aperture with the apex in the midpoint of the upper vermilion and the lower vermilion forming the base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: Upturned corners of mouth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Oral commissures positioned superior to the midline labial fissure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: U-Shaped upper lip vermilion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Gentle upward curve of the upper lip vermilion such that the center is placed well superior to the commissures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: Open bite
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Visible space between the dental arches in occlusion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: Protruding tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Tongue extending beyond the alveolar ridges or teeth at rest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.label: Broad uvula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001080.definition: Increased width of the uvula (subjective finding).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.label: Abnormal number of hair whorls
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.definition: More than two clockwise hair whorls.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.label: Abnormal position of hair whorl
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.definition: Hair growth from a single point on the scalp in any location other than lateral to the midline and close to the vertex of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.label: Nevus sebaceous
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.definition: A congenital, hairless plaque consisting of overgrown epidermis, sebaceous glands, hair follicles, apocrine glands and connective tissue. They are a variant of epidermal naevi. Sebaceous naevi most often appear on the scalp, but they may also arise on the face, neck or forehead. At birth, a sevaceous nevus typically appears as a solitary, smooth, yellow-orange hairless patch. Sebaceous naevi become more pronounced around adolescence, often appearing bumpy, warty or scaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.label: Epidermal nevus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.definition: Epidermal naevi are due to an overgrowth of the epidermis and may be present at birth (50%) or develop during childhood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.label: Linear nevus sebaceous
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.definition: A type of nevus sebaceous with a linear form, raised borders and yellowish color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.label: Generalized tonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.definition: A generalized tonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterised by bilateral limb stiffening or elevation, often with neck stiffening without a subsequent clonic phase. The tonic activity can be a sustained abnormal posture, either in extension or flexion, sometimes accompanied by tremor of the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.label: Atonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001081.definition: Atonic seizure is a type of motor seizure characterized by a sudden loss or diminution of muscle tone without apparent preceding myoclonic or tonic event lasting about 1 to 2 seconds, involving head, trunk, jaw, or limb musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Focal emotional seizure with crying
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: Focal emotional seizure with crying (dacrystic) is characterized by the presence of stereotyped crying, this may be accompanied by lacrimation, sad facial expression and sobbing. The subjective emotion of sadness may or may not be present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Focal emotional seizure with laughing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: Focal emotional seizure with laughing (gelastic) is characterized by bursts of laughter or giggling, usually without appropriate related emotion of happiness, and described as 'mirthless'.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Scintillating scotoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: A scintillating scotoma is a common visual aura that can preced a migraine, whereby a spot of flickering light near the center of the visual fields occurs. The spot prevents vision, and is thus termed scotoma. The scotoma can extend into one or more shimmering arcs of white or colored flashing lights.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Ridged cranial sutures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: An overlap of the bony plates of the skull in an infant, with or without early closure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Abnormal fifth cranial nerve morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: Any structural abnormality of the fifth cranial nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Abnormality of the eleventh cranial nerve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: Abnormality of the eleventh cranial nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Abnormality of the twelfth cranial nerve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: Abnormality of the twelfth cranial nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Abnormality of the seventh cranial nerve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: Abnormality of the seventh cranial nerve sometimes also referred to as the facial nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Hemifacial spasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: Intermittent clonic or tonic contraction of muscles supplied by facial nerve. Muscles are relaxed in between contractions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.label: Impaired temperature sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001082.definition: A reduced ability to discriminate between different temperatures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.label: Impaired tactile sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.definition: A reduced sense of touch (tactile sensation). This is usually tested with a wisp of cotton or a fine camel's hair brush, by asking patients to say 'now' each time they feel the stimulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.label: Impaired proprioception
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.definition: A loss or impairment of the sensation of the relative position of parts of the body and joint position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.label: Abnormality of pain sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.definition: Pain is an unpleasant sensation that can range from mild, localized discomfort to agony, whereby the physical part of pain results from nerve stimulation and is often accompanied by an emotional component. This term groups abnormalities in pain sensation presumed to result from abnormalities related to the specific nerve fibers that carry the pain impulses to the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.label: Spontaneous pain sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.definition: Spontaneous pain is a kind of neuropathic pain which occurs without an identifiable trigger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.label: Trophic changes related to pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.definition: Trophic changes is a term used to describe abnormalities in the area of pain that include primarily wasting away of the skin, tissues, or muscle, thinning of the bones, and changes in how the hair or nails grow, including thickening or thinning of hair or brittle nails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.label: Dissociated sensory loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.definition: A pattern of sensory loss with selective loss of touch sensation and proprioception without loss of pain and temperature, or vice-versa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.label: Decreased circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.definition: Decreased concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.label: High nonceruloplasmin-bound serum copper
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.definition: An increased concentration of non ceruloplasmin bound copper in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.label: Increased urinary copper concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001083.definition: An increased concentration of copper in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.label: Multifocal epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.definition: An abnormality in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG) and being identified at multiple locations (foci).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.label: EEG with focal slow activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.definition: Focal (localized) slow activity reflects focal dysfunction, not diffuse dysfunction (i.e., encephalopathy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.label: EEG with multifocal slow activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.definition: Multifocal slowing of cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.label: EEG with generalized slow activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.definition: Diffuse slowing of cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.label: EEG with persistent abnormal rhythmic activity
EEG with spike-wave complexes (<2.5 Hz)
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.definition: The presence of complexes of slow spikes and slow waves (<2.5 Hz) in electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.label: EEG with spike-wave complexes (2.5-3.5 Hz)
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.definition: The presence of complexes of spikes and waves (2.5-3.5 Hz) in electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.label: EEG with spike-wave complexes (>3.5 Hz)
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001084.definition: The presence of complexes of spikes and waves (>3.5 Hz) in electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.label: EEG with spike-wave complexes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.definition: Complexes of spikes (<70 ms) and sharp waves (70-200 ms), which are sharp transient waves that have a strong association with epilepsy, in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.label: EEG with burst suppression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.definition: The burst suppression pattern in electroencephalography refers to a characteristic periodic pattern of low voltage (<10 microvolts) suppressed background and a relatively shorter pattern of higher amplitude slow, sharp, and spiking complexes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.label: EEG with photoparoxysmal response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.definition: EEG abnormalities (epileptiform discharges) evoked by flashing lights or black and white striped patterns.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.label: EEG with periodic lateralized epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.definition: Periodic lateralized epileptiform discharges (PLEDs)are periodic, lateralized, and epileptiform. PLEDs show a relatively constant interval between discharges (0.5 to 3 seconds).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.label: EEG with generalized low amplitude activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.definition: An abnormal generalized reduction in amplitude of the cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.label: EEG with localized low amplitude activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.definition: An abnormal localized reduction in amplitude of the cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.label: EEG with periodic abnormalities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.definition: Periodically recurring abnormalities in the EEG.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.label: EEG with hyperventilation-induced epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.definition: Epileptiform discharges induced by hyperventilation (overbreathing) in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.label: Frank breech presentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001085.definition: A kind of breech presentation in which the hips are flexed and the knees are extended.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Complete breech presentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: A kind of breech presentation in which the hips are flexed and the knees are flexed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Incomplete breech presentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: A kind of breech presentation in which one or both hips are extended and one or both of the fetus' feet are pointing down and entering the birth canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Delayed fine motor development
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the fingers and hands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Receptive language delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: A delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Intellectual disability, severe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: Severe mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 20-34.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Oppositional defiant disorder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: An enduring pattern of uncooperative, defiant, and hostile behavior towards authority figures that does not involve major antisocial violations, is not accounted for by the child's developmental stage, and results in significant functional impairment. A certain level of oppositional behavior is common in children and adolescents.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Abdominal wall defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: An incomplete closure of the abdominal wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Dyssynergia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to smoothly perform the elements of a voluntary movement in the appropriate order and speed. With dyssynergia, a voluntary movement appears broken down into its component parts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Ocular dyssynergia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: A type of dyssynergia affecting eye movements and characterized by the inability to smoothly follow a visual target across the visual field.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.label: Asynergia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001086.definition: A type of dyssynergy characterized by the lack of the ability to smoothly perform the elements of a voluntary movement in the appropriate order and speed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.label: Sensory ataxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.definition: Incoordination of movement caused by a deficit in the sensory nervous system. Sensory ataxia can be distinguished from cerebellar ataxia by asking the patient to close his or her eyes. Persons with cerebellar ataxia show only a minimal worsening of symptoms, whereas persons with sensory ataxia show a marked worsening of symptoms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.label: T-wave inversion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.definition: An inversion of the T-wave (which is normally positive).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.label: Cervical spinal cord atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.definition: Atrophy of the cervical segment of the spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.label: Tendon xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.definition: The presence of xanthomas (intra-and extra-cellular accumulations of cholesterol) extensor tendons (typically over knuckles, Achilles tendon, knee, and elbows).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.label: Chaddock reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.definition: A diagnostic reflex elicited by stimulation of the skin over the surface of the lateral malleolus of the foot. The Chaddock refelx is present if there is extension of one or more or all of the toes with or without fanning of them when the external inframalleolar skin is stimulated. The Chaddock sign, similar to the Babinski sign, is taken to be an indication of disease of the spinocortical (pyramidal) tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.label: Abnormal circulating protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.definition: An abnormal level of a circulating protein in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.label: Monocular strabismus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.definition: A type of strabismus in which the fixating eye is always the same one, while the other eye is constantly deviated. Monocular strabismus is to be distinguished from alternating strabismus, in which either of the eyes 'squints' at different times.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.label: Fetal cystic hygroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001087.definition: The presence during the prenatal period of a cystic mass with multiple septa with multiple, asymmetric, thin-walled cysts near the posterior aspect of the neck. Fetal cystic hygroma can be defined as nuchal translucency with or without septations measuring greater than 3.0 mm. Increased NT refers to a measurement above the 95th centile, and the term is used irrespective of whether the collection of fluid is septated or not, and whether it is confined to the neck or envelopes the whole fetus. After 14 weeks, increased NT usually resolves, but in some cases it evolves into nuchal edema or cystic hygromas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.label: Increased nuchal translucency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.definition: Nuchal translucency is the sonographic appearance of subcutaneous accumulation of liquid in the back of the fetal neck in the first trimester of pregnancy (11-14 gestational weeks of pregnancy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.label: Abnormality of the umbilical cord
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.definition: An abnormality of the umbilical cord, which is the cord connecting the developing embryo or fetus to the placenta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.label: Pulmonary valve atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.definition: A congenital disorder of the pulmonary valve in which the orifice of the valve fails to develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.label: Aortic valve atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.definition: A congenital disorder of the aortic valve in which the orifice of the valve fails to develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.label: Acromelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.definition: Shortening of the extremities affecting primarily the distal parts of the limbs (hands and feet) in relation to the other segments of the limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.label: Avascular necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.definition: A disease where there is cellular death (necrosis) of bone components due to interruption of the blood supply.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.label: Osteochondritis dissecans
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.definition: A joint disorder caused by blood deprivation in the subchondral bone causing the subchondral bone to die in a process called avascular necrosis. The bone is then reabsorbed by the body, leaving the articular cartilage it supported prone to damage. The result is fragmentation (dissection) of both cartilage and bone, and the free movement of these osteochondral fragments within the joint space, causing pain and further damage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.label: Morbus Koehler
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.definition: Morbus Koehler is a Juvenile aseptic necrosis affecting the Os naviculare pedis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.label: Morbus Kienboeck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001088.definition: Morbus Kienboeck is a Juvenile aseptic necrosis affecting the Os lunatum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Morbus Osgood-Schlatter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: Morbus Osgood-Schlatter is a Juvenile aseptic necrosis affecting the Tuberositas tibiae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Morbus Scheuermann
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: A developmental growth retardation of the vertebral end plates that may lead to secondary destruction of the vertebral end plates and protrusion of the nucleus pulposus into the vertebral body (so called Schmorl's nodes as seen on x-rays).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Abnormal circulating branched chain amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a branched chain family amino acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Abnormal circulating phenylalanine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of phenylalanine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Abnormal circulating serine family amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a serine family amino acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Abnormal circulating glycine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glycine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Hypersarcosinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: An elevated plasma concentration of sarcosine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Hypersarcosinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: An elevated urinary concentration of sarcosine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Abnormal circulating sarcosine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: An deviation from the normal concentration of sarcosine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.label: Abnormal circulating aspartate family amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001089.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of an aspartate family amino acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.label: Abnormal circulating threonine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of threonine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.label: Abnormal circulating methionine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of methionine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.label: Abnormal circulating glutamine family amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a glutamine family amino acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.label: Abnormal circulating glutamine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glutamine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.label: Abnormal circulating histidine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.definition: An abnormality of a histidine metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.label: Hyperhistidinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.definition: An increased concentration of histidine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.label: Abnormal circulating proline concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of proline or a proline metabolite in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.label: Abnormal circulating lysine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of lysine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.label: Abnormal circulating arginine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001090.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of arginine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Hypervalinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: An increased concentration of valine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Hyperleucinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: An increased concentration of leucine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Abnormal circulating isoleucine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of isoleucine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Hyperisoleucinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: An increased concentration of isoleucine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Abnormal circulating valine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: Any deviation from the normal circulation of valine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Abnormal circulating pyruvate family amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: An abnormality of a pyruvate family amino acid metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Abnormal circulating alanine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: An abnormality of an alanine metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Abnormal circulating tyrosine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of tyrosine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Abnormal circulating cysteine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: An abnormality of a cysteine metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.label: Abnormal circulating homocysteine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001091.definition: An abnormality of a homocysteine metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.label: Zonular cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.definition: Zonular cataracts are defined to be cataracts that affect specific regions of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.label: Coralliform cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.definition: A 'coral-like' pattern of opacity in the lens of the eye. That is, a cataract with an irregular, stellate form.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.label: Membranous cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.definition: A form of cataract in which the lens substance has shrunk, leaving a collapsed, flattened capsule with little or no cortex or epithelium on the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.label: Anterior subcapsular cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.definition: A type of cataract affecting the anterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the lens capsule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.label: Posterior cortical cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.definition: A cataract that affects the posterior part of the cortex of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.label: Aculeiform cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.definition: A kind of nuclear cataract characterized by fiberglasslike or needlelike crystals projecting in different directions, through or close to the axial region of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.label: Abnormal blood inorganic cation concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.definition: An abnormality of divalent inorganic cation homeostasis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001092.label: obsolete Increased urinary orotic acid concentration

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.label: Abnormal blood monovalent inorganic cation concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.definition: An abnormality of monovalent inorganic cation homeostasis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.label: Abnormal circulating nucleobase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.definition: An abnormality of a nucleobase metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.label: Hyperxanthinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.definition: An increased level of xanthine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.label: Xanthinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.definition: An increased concentration of xanthine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.label: Abnormality of the upper urinary tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.definition: An abnormality of the upper urinary tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.label: Abnormality of the lower urinary tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.definition: An abnormality of the lower urinary tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.label: Abnormal nasal skeleton morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.definition: An abnormality of the nasal skeleton.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.label: Abnormal external nose morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.definition: An abnormality of the external nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.label: Abnormal nasal bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001093.definition: An abnormality of the nasal bone, comprising the left nasal bone and the right nasal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nasal bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the nasal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.label: Echogenic intracardiac focus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.definition: A finding of a focus of increased echogenicity upon prenatal ultrasound examination of the fetus. The foci may be present in one or both ventricles. Echogenic intracardiac focus (EICF) is defined as a focus of echogenicity comparable to bone, in the region of the papillary muscle in either or both ventricles of the fetal heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.label: Echogenic fetal bowel
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.definition: Echogenic bowel is defined as fetal bowel with homogenous areas of echogenicity that are equal to or greater than that of surrounding bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.label: Abnormal renal pelvis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.definition: An abnormality of the renal pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.label: Fetal pyelectasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.definition: Mild pyelectasis is defined as a hypoechoic spherical or elliptical space within the renal pelvis that measures at least 5mm and not more than 10 mm. The measurement is taken on a transverse section through the fetal renal pelvis using the maximum anterior-to-posterior measurement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.label: Dilatation of the renal pelvis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.definition: The presence of dilatation of the renal pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.label: Abnormality of ductus venosus blood flow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.definition: A first-trimester prenatal ultrasound finding of abnormal blood flow in the ductus venosus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.label: Abnormal fetal cardiovascular morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.definition: A structural abnormality of the fetal circulation system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.label: Abnormality of umbilical vein blood flow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001094.definition: A first-trimester prenatal ultrasound finding of abnormal blood flow in the umbilical vein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Abnormal fourth ventricle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: An abnormality of the fourth ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Abnormal third ventricle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: An abnormality of the third ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Mild fetal ventriculomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: A kind of ventriculomegaly occurring in the fetal period and usually diagnosed by prenatal ultrasound. Cerebral ventriculomegaly is defined by atrial measurements 10 mm or more. Mild ventriculomegaly (MVM) is defined as measurements between 10 and 15 mm. Measurements are obtained from an axial plane at the level of the thalamic nuclei just below the standard image to measure the BPD (PMID:16100637).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Noncommunicating hydrocephalus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: A form of hydrocephalus in which the flow of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) within the cerebral ventricular system or in the outlets of the CSF to the arachnoid space is obstructed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Hypoplastic right heart
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: Underdevelopment of the right-sided structures of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Dilatation of the bladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: The presence of a dilated urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Fetal megacystis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: Fetal megacystis is an abnormally enlarged bladder identified at any gestational age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Congenital posterior urethral valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: A developmental defect resulting in an obstructing membrane in the posterior male urethra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Bilateral renal agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: A bilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.label: Congenital pulmonary airway malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001095.definition: Congenital pulmonary airway malformation (CPAM) - previously known as congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) - is a relatively rare developmental malformation of the lower respiratory tract. It is a hamartomatous, dysplastic developmental abnormality of the lung characterized by abnormal airway patterning during lung branching morphogenesis and is formed by abnormal branching of the immature bronchioles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.label: Bronchopulmonary sequestration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.definition: The presence of microscopic cystic masses of nonfunctioning pulmonary tissue that lack an obvious communication with the tracheobronchial tree.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.label: Intralobar sequestration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.definition: A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is incorporated into the normal surrounding lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.label: Extralobar sequestration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.definition: A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is completely discrete from the normal lung and is surrounded by separate pleura.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.label: Absence of stomach bubble on fetal sonography
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.definition: By the 14th week of gestation it is nearly always possible to visualized the fluid-filled fetal stomach bubble on prenatal sonography. This term refers to the absence of a normal fetal stomach bubble on fetal ultrasonography performed at around 16 to 20 weeks' gestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.label: Abnormal circulating long-chain fatty-acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a long-chain fatty acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.label: Abnormal circulating phytanic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of phytanic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.label: Abnormal circulating fatty-acid anion concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid anion in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.label: Abnormal circulating carnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001096.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of carnitine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.label: Blood group antigen abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.definition: An abnormality of an erythrocyte cell surface molecule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.label: Absence of Lutheran antigen on erythrocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.definition: Absence of the Lutheran antigen (a type I integral membrane glycoprotein) from the surface of red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.label: Anemia of inadequate production
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.definition: A kind of anemia characterized by inadequate production of erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.label: Abnormal B cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.definition: A deviation from the normal count of B cells, i.e., the cells that are formed in the bone marrow, migrate to the peripheral lymphatic system, and mature into plasma cells or memory cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.label: B lymphocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.definition: An abnormal decrease from the normal count of B cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.label: Abnormal phagocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.definition: An abnormal functioning of phagocytosis. Phagocytosis is an elegant but complex process for the ingestion and elimination of pathogens, but it is also important for the elimination of apoptotic cells and hence fundamental for tissue homeostasis. Phagocytosis can be divided into four main steps: (i) recognition of the target particle, (ii) signaling to activate the internalization machinery, (iii) phagosome formation, and (iv) phagolysosome maturation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.label: Abnormality of immune system physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.definition: A functional abnormality of the immune system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.label: Abnormality of lipoprotein cholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001097.definition: An abnormal increase or decrease in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.label: Hyperlipoproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.definition: An abnormal increase in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.label: Hypolipoproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.definition: An abnormal decrease in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.label: Polygenic inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.definition: A mode of inheritance that depends on a mixture of major and minor genetic determinants possibly together with environmental factors. Diseases inherited in this manner are termed complex diseases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.label: Oligogenic inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.definition: A type of multifactorial inheritance governed by the simultaneous action of a few gene loci. It is recommended this term be used for traits governed by three loci, although it is noted that usage of this term in the literature is not uniform.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.label: Digenic inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.definition: A type of multifactorial inheritance governed by the simultaneous action of two gene loci.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.label: Abnormal cellular immune system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.definition: An abnormality of the morphology or counts of the cells that make up the immune system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.label: Abnormality of the extrinsic pathway
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.definition: An abnormality of the extrinsic pathway (also known as the tissue factor pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.label: Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001098.definition: An abnormality of the intrinsic pathway (also known as the contact activation pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.label: Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.definition: An abnormality of blood coagulation, common pathway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.label: Abnormal morphology of the abdominal musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.definition: An abnormality of the abdominal musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.label: Stress urinary incontinence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.definition: Involuntary urine leakage synchronous with exertion, or actions such as sneezing, or coughing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.label: Abnormal cerebral subcortex morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.definition: An abnormality of the cerebral subcortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.label: Abnormal corpus striatum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.definition: Abnormality of the striatum, which is the largest nucleus of the basal ganglia, comprising the caudate, putamen and ventral striatum, including the nucleus accumbens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.label: Abnormal circulating dicarboxylic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a dicarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.label: Abnormal circulating monocarboxylic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a monocarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.label: Chromosomal breakage induced by ionizing radiation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.definition: Increased amount of chromosomal breaks in cultured blood lymphocytes or other cells induced by treatment with ionizing radiation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.label: Increased susceptibility to spontaneous sister chromatid exchange
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001099.definition: An increase in the number of spontaneous sister chromatid exchanges observed in cell culture of lymphocytes or other cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.label: Increased bone mineral density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.definition: An abnormal increase of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones which is often referred to as osteosclerosis. Osteosclerosis can be detected on radiological examination as an increased whiteness (density) of affected bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.label: Osteopetrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.definition: Abnormally increased formation of dense trabecular bone tissue. Despite the increased density of bone tissue, osteopetrotic bones tend to be more fracture-prone than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.label: High myopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.definition: A severe form of myopia with greater than -6.00 diopters.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.label: Abnormal systemic arterial morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.definition: An abnormality of the systemic arterial tree, which consists of the aorta and other systemic arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.label: Mixed cirrhosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.definition: A type of cirrhosis characterized by the presence of regenerative nodules of a variety of sizes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.label: Abnormal morphology of the musculature of the neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.definition: An abnormality of the neck musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.label: Temporal pattern
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.definition: The speed at which disease manifestations appear and develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.label: Acute
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001100.definition: Sudden appearance of disease manifestations over a short period of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.label: Chronic
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.definition: Slow, creeping onset, slow progress and long continuance of disease manifestations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.label: Subacute
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.definition: Somewhat rapid onset and change of disease manifestations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.label: Abnormal circulating polysaccharide concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of a polysaccharide in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.label: Abnormal circulating carbohydrate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of a carbohydrate in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.label: Abnormal blood glucose concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.definition: An abnormality of the concentration of glucose in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.label: obsolete Abnormality of urine glucose concentration
Abnormal cellular physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.definition: An abnormality in a cellular process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.label: Abnormality of the cell cycle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001101.definition: An abnormality of the cell cycle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.label: Abnormality of mucopolysaccharide metabolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.definition: An abnormality of the metabolism of mucopolysaccharide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.label: Abnormal circulating unsaturated fatty acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of an unsaturated fatty acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.label: Abnormal circulating prostaglandin circulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a prostaglandin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.label: Abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.definition: An abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.label: Abnormal cardiovascular system physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.definition: Abnormal functionality of the cardiovascular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the vagina
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.label: Abnormal fallopian tube morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.definition: An abnormality of the fallopian tube.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.label: Internal hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001102.definition: The presence of hemorrhage within the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.label: Abnormal blood transition element cation concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.definition: An abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of transition element cation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.label: Abnormality of iron homeostasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.definition: An abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of iron cation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.label: Abnormality of fluid regulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.definition: An abnormality of the regulation of body fluids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.label: Impairment of fructose metabolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.definition: An impairment of a fructose metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.label: Amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.definition: The presence of amyloid deposition in one or more tissues. Amyloidosis may be defined as the extracellular deposition of amyloid in one or more sites of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.label: Abnormal renal cortex morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.definition: An abnormality of the cortex of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.label: Abnormality of renal excretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.definition: An altered ability of the kidneys to void urine and/or specific substances.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.label: Decreased urine output
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.definition: A decreased rate of urine production.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.label: Abnormal helix morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001103.definition: An abnormality of the helix. The helix is the outer rim of the ear that extends from the insertion of the ear on the scalp (root) to the termination of the cartilage at the earlobe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.label: Abnormal intrahepatic bile duct morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.definition: An abnormality of the intrahepatic bile duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cervical spine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the cervical vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.label: Abnormal circulating adrenocorticotropin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.definition: An abnormal concentration of corticotropin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.label: Abnormal number of permanent teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.definition: The presence of an altered number of of permanent teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.label: Agenesis of permanent maxillary central incisor
Agenesis of primary maxillary central incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.definition: Agenesis of upper central primary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.label: Agenesis of primary mandibular central incisor
Agenesis of permanent mandibular central incisor
Agenesis of primary maxillary lateral incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001104.definition: Agenesis of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the maxillary lateral primary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001105.label: Agenesis of permanent maxillary lateral incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001105.definition: Agenesis of one or more upper lateral secondary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001105.label: Agenesis of first permanent molar tooth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001105.definition: Agenesis of either maxillary first permanent molar or mandibular first permanent molar or both.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001105.label: Agenesis of second permanent molar
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001105.definition: Agenesis of either mandibular second permanent molar or maxillary second permanent molar.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.label: Dentinogenesis imperfecta limited to primary teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.definition: Developmental dysplasia of dentin affecting only the primary dentition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.label: Abnormality of dental structure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.definition: An abnormality of the structure or composition of the teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.label: Abnormal incisor morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.definition: An abnormality of morphology of the incisor tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.label: Abnormal number of incisors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.definition: The presence of an altered number of the incisor teeth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.label: Conical incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.definition: An abnormal conical morphology of the incisor tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.label: Mesiodens
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.definition: A supernumerary tooth in the midline between the maxillary central incisors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.label: Supernumerary tooth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001106.definition: The presence of one or more teeth additional to the normal number.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.label: Abnormal molar morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.definition: An abnormality of morphology of molar tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.label: Abnormal permanent molar morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.definition: An abnormality of morphology of permanent molar.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.label: Abnormality of dental color
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.definition: A developmental defect of tooth color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.label: Localized hypoplasia of dental enamel
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.definition: A localized form of developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.label: Impacted tooth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001107.definition: A tooth that has not erupted because of local impediments (overcrowding or fibrous gum overgrowth).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.label: Abnormal premolar morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.definition: An abnormality of morphology of premolar tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.label: Incisor macrodontia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.definition: Increased size of the incisor tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.label: Conical primary incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.definition: An abnormal conical morphology of the primary incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.label: Conical maxillary incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.definition: An abnormal conical morphology of either maxillary primary incisor tooth or maxillary permanent incisor tooth or both.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.label: Hypocalcification of dental enamel
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.definition: A form of hypomineralization of enamel characterized by reduced calcification.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.label: Hypomature dental enamel
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.definition: A form of hypomineralization of enamel characterized by a chalky appearance of the enamel with orange, brown, or white color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.label: Dentinogenesis imperfecta of primary and permanent teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.definition: Developmental dysplasia of dentin or both the primary dentition and the permanent dentition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.label: Talon cusp
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.definition: Talon cusp is an accessory cusp located near the cingulum (the portion of the lingual or palatal aspect of the tooth that forms a convex protuberance at the cervical third of the anatomic crown).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.label: Dens in dente
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001108.definition: An abnormality of the incisor characterized by invagination of the enamel, giving a radiographic appearance that suggests a tooth within a tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Fused teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: The union of two separately developing tooth germs typically leading to one less tooth than normal in the affected dental arch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Gemination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: The development of two teeth from a single tooth bud, leading to a larger fused tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Mulberry molar
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: Mulberry molars are irregular teeth generally affecting the first molars and are characterized by a grossly deformed crown imitating, as the name implies, the surface of a mulberry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Molarization of premolar
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: Increased size and molar morphology of premolar tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Increased overbite
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: Maxillary teeth cover the mandibular teeth when biting to an increased degree. The feature is defined as a vertical overlap of the maxillary incisors over the mandibular incisors that exceeds 2 mm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Overjet
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: An abnormal anteroposterior extension of the maxillary teeth beyond the plane of the mandibular teeth upon jaw closure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Peripheral demyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: A loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Epileptic spasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: A sudden flexion, extension, or mixed extension-flexion of predominantly proximal and truncal muscles that is usually more sustained than a myoclonic movement but not as sustained as a tonic seizure. Limited forms may occur: Grimacing, head nodding, or subtle eye movements. Epileptic spasms frequently occur in clusters. Infantile spasms are the best known form, but spasms can occur at all ages

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Speech apraxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: A type of apraxia that is characterized by difficulty or inability to execute speech movements because of problems with coordination and motor problems, leading to incorrect articulation. An increase of errors with increasing word and phrase length may occur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.label: Spastic hemiparesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001109.definition: Unilateral paresis (weakness) with spasticity of the affected muscles and increased tendon reflexes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.label: Intestinal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.definition: An abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.label: Ileal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.definition: An abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the ileum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.label: Abnormal left ventricular outflow tract morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.definition: An abnormality of the outflow tract of the left ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.label: Abnormality of blood volume homeostasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.definition: An abnormality in the amount of volume occupied by intravascular blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.label: Hypervolemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.definition: An increase in the amount of intravascular fluid, particularly in the volume of the circulating blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.label: Hypovolemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.definition: An decrease in the amount of intravascular fluid, particularly in the volume of the circulating blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.label: Recurrent aphthous stomatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001110.definition: Recurrent episodes of ulceration of the oral mucosa, typically presenting as painful, sharply circumscribed fibrin-covered mucosal defects with a hyperemic border.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Recurrent tonsillitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: Inflammation of the tonsils that has occurred repeatedly. The definition of recurrent may vary somewhat, but the criteria used recently as a measure of severity were five or more episodes of true tonsillitis per year, symptoms recurring for at least a year, and episodes that are disabling and that prevent normal functioning. In some cases recurrent tonsillitis may be related to immunosusceptibility. Evidence exists for a genetic predisposition for recurrent tonsillitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Abnormality of immune serum protein physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: An abnormality of the concentration or function of circulating immune proteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Abnormality of serum cytokine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: Abnormality of the cytokine levels in the blood, i.e., an abnormality of any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Abnormality of cytokine secretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a cytokine (i.e., any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Defective production of NFKB1-dependent cytokines
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: An impairment in the production by leukocytes of NFKB1-dependent cytokines such as tumor necrosis factor-alpha and interferon-alpha.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Abnormality of chemokine secretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a chemokine (a class of cytokines).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Abnormality of interferon secretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of interferons (a class of cytokines).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Abnormality of interleukin secretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of interleukins (a class of cytokines).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Abnormality of tumor necrosis factor secretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of tumor necrosis factor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.label: Abnormal nasal dorsum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001111.definition: An abnormality of the nasal dorsum, also known as the nasal ridge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Concave nasal ridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: Nasal ridge curving posteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Abnormal skin morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: Any morphological abnormality of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Abnormality of skin physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: Any abnormality of the physiological function of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: The presence of inflammation of the skin. That is, an abnormality of the skin resulting from the local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Abnormal epidermal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: An abnormality of the morphology of the epidermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Abnormality of dermal melanosomes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: An abnormality of the melanosomes, i.e., of the cellular organelles in which melanin pigments are synthesized and stored within melanocytes (the cells that produce pigment in the dermis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Nephroptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: A significant descent of the kidney as the patient moves from the supine to the erect position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Perioral eczema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: A type of eczema that occurs in the lips and perioral area.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Acute esophageal necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: A condition characterized by necrosis of the mucosal and submucosal layers of the esophagus not related to ingestion of caustic or other injurious agents. Endoscopically, there is a dark lesion ('black esophagus') distributed in a circumferential manner in the distal one-third of the esophagus with or without exudates. There is involvement of the distal esophagus ending sharply at the gastroesophageal junction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.label: Bilateral fetal pyelectasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001112.definition: A bilateral form of fetal pyelectasis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.label: Abnormal renal calyx morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.definition: Any abnormality of the morphology of the major calices or minor calices of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.label: Perianal dermatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.definition: The presence of a rash (change of color and texture) of the perianal skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.label: Chronic furunculosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.definition: A furuncle (boil) is a skin infection involving an entire hair follicle and nearby skin tissue. Chronic furunculosis refers to recurrent episodes of furuncles, often caused by recurrent staphylococcus infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.label: Increased sensitivity to ionizing radiation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.definition: An abnormally increased sensitivity to the effects of ionizing radiation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.label: Low-grade fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.definition: Mild fever that does not exceed 38.5 degrees centigrade.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the sweat glands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.definition: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the sweat glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.label: Non-pruritic urticaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.definition: Pale reddish slightly elevated papules and plaques of 0.5-3 cm in diameter and not accompanied by pruritus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.label: Abnormal skin adnexa morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.definition: An abnormality of the skin adnexa (skin appendages), which are specialized skin structures located within the dermis and focally within the subcutaneous fatty tissue, comprising three histologically distinct structures: (1) the pilosebaceous unit (hair follicle and sebaceous glands); (2) the eccrine sweat glands; and (3) the apocrine glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.label: Gastric duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001113.definition: Gastric duplication is a usually cystic malformation of gastrointestinal tract, usually attached to the greater curvature of the stomach and has no communication with the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.label: Gastrointestinal duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.definition: A spherical hollow structure with a smooth muscle coat, lined by a mucous membrane, and attached to any part of the gastrointestinal tract, from the base of the tongue to the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.label: Age-related cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.definition: A type of cataract (opacification of the lens) that forms during the course of aging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.label: Age-related nuclear cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.definition: A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the nucleus of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.label: Age-related cortical cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.definition: A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the cortex of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.label: Age-related posterior subcapsular cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.definition: A type of age-related cataract consisting of granular opacities occurring mainly in the central posterior cortex just under the posterior capsule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.label: Symptomatic seizures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.definition: A seizure that occurs in the context of a brain insult (systemic, toxic, or metabolic) and may not recur when the underlying cause has been removed or the acute phase has elapsed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.label: Dialeptic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.definition: A dialeptic seizure is a type of seizure characterised predominantly by reduced responsiveness or awareness and with subsequent at least partial amnesia of the event.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.label: Typical absence seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.definition: A typical absence seizure is a type of generalised non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by its sudden onset, interruption of ongoing activities, a blank stare, possibly a brief upward deviation of the eyes. Usually the patient will be unresponsive when spoken to. Duration is a few seconds to half a minute with very rapid recovery. Although not always available, an EEG would usually show 3 Hz generalized epileptiform discharges during the event.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.label: obsolete Absence seizures with special features
Absence seizure with eyelid myoclonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001114.definition: An absence with eyelid myoclonia seizure is a type of generalized non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by forced upward jerking of the eyelids during an absence seizure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.label: Myoclonic absence seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.definition: Myoclonic absence seizure is a type of generalized non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by an interruption of ongoing activities, a blank stare and rhythmic three-per-second myoclonic movements, causing ratcheting abduction of the upper limbs leading to progressive arm elevation, and associated with 3 Hz generalized spike-wave discharges on the electroencephalogram. Duration is typically 10-60 s. Whilst impairment of consciousness may not be obvious the ILAE classified this seizure as a generalized non-motor seizure in 2017.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.label: Atypical absence status epilepticus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.definition: Atypical absence status epilepticus is a type of generalized non-convulsive status epilepticus without coma that is semiologically a prolonged atypical absence seizure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.label: Early onset absence seizures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.definition: Typical absence seizures starting before the age of 4 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.label: Focal motor seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.definition: A type of focal-onset seizure characterized by a motor sign as its initial semiological manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.label: Focal autonomic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.definition: An autonomic seizure is a type of focal non-motor seizure characterized by alteration of autonomic nervous system function as the initial semiological feature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.label: obsolete Focal autonomic seizures with altered responsiveness
obsolete Focal autonomic seizures without altered responsiveness
Focal sensory seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.definition: A focal sensory seizure is a type seizure beginning with a subjective sensation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.label: Focal sensory seizure with auditory features
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.definition: A seizure characterized by elementary auditory phenomena including buzzing, ringing, drumming or single tones as its first clinical manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.label: Focal autonomic seizure with epigastric sensation/nausea/vomiting/other gastrointestinal phenomena
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001115.definition: A type of focal autonomic seizure characterised by symptoms or signs pertaining to the gastrointestinal system as the initial semiological feature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.label: Focal sensory seizure with gustatory features
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.definition: A seizure characterized by taste phenomena including acidic, bitter, salty, sweet, or metallic tastes as its first clinical manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.label: Focal sensory seizure with olfactory features
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.definition: Seizures characterized by olfactory phenomena as its first clinical manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.label: Focal sensory seizure with somatosensory features
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.definition: A seizure characterized by sensory phenomena including tingling, numbness, electric-shock like sensation, pain, sense of movement, or desire to move as its first clinical manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.label: Focal sensory seizure with visual features
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.definition: A seizure characterized by elementary visual hallucinations such as flashing or flickering lights/colours, or other shapes, simple patterns, scotomata, or amaurosis as its first clinical manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.label: Focal myoclonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.definition: A type of focal motor seizure characterized by sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction(s) of muscles(s) or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.label: Focal tonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.definition: A type of focal motor seizure characterized by sustained increase in muscle contraction, lasting a few seconds to minutes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.label: Focal seizure with eyelid myoclonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.definition: Focal seizure with eyelid myoclonia, not eyelid myoclonias in the context of absence seizures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.label: Generalized clonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001116.definition: Generalized clonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterised by sustained bilateral jerking, either symmetric or asymmetric, that is regularly repetitive and involves the same muscle groups.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.label: Generalized myoclonic-atonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.definition: A generalized myoclonic-atonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterized by a myoclonic jerk followed by an atonic motor component.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.label: Simple febrile seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.definition: A short generalized seizure, of a duration of <15 min, not recurring within 24 h, occurring during a febrile episode not caused by an acute disease of the nervous system intracranial infection or severe metabolic disturbance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.label: Complex febrile seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.definition: A febrile seizure that has any of the following features: focal semiology (or associated with post-ictal neurologic abnormalities beyond drowsiness, such as a Todd's paresis), prolonged seizure beyond 15 minutes, or recurring (occurring more than once) in a 24 hour period.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.label: Focal behavior arrest seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.definition: A type of focal non-motor seizure characterized by an arrest or pause of activities, freezing, or immobilization as the predominant semiological feature throughout the seizure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.label: Focal hyperkinetic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.definition: A focal seizure characterized at onset by predominantly proximal limb or axial muscles producing irregular sequential ballistic movements, such as pedaling, pelvic thrusting, thrashing, rocking movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.label: Focal motor seizure with version
