http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.definition: A type of focal motor seizure characterised by sustained, forced conjugate ocular, cephalic, and/or truncal rotation or lateral deviation from the midline as the initial semiological manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.label: EEG with constitutional variants
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.definition: An EEG with constitutional variants contains waves that are rare or unusual but not generally pathologic.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.label: Beta-EEG
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001117.definition: EEG dominated by diffuse beta-waves (>13 Hz).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: Partial beta-EEG
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: EEG dominated by diffuse beta waves (>13 Hz) with occipitally localized alpha waves (8-13 Hz).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: Low voltage EEG
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: EEG with an amplitude less than 30 microvolts without observable occipital alpha rhythm (8-13 Hz).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: Interictal epileptiform activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: Epileptiform activity refers to distinctive EEG waves or complexes distinguished from background activity found in in a proportion of human subjects with epilepsy, but which can also be found in subjects without seizures. Interictal epileptiform activity refers to such activity that occurs in the absence of a clinical or subclinical seizure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: EEG with hyperventilation-induced focal epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: Focal epileptiform discharges induced by hyperventilation (overbreathing) in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: EEG with hyperventilation-induced generalized epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: Generalized epileptiform discharges induced by hyperventilation (overbreathing) in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: EEG with focal epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: EEG discharges recorded in particular areas of a localized (focal) abnormality in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: Focal epileptiform discharges with limited propagation to contralateral hemisphere
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: Focal epileptiform discharges with spreading to contralateral hemisphere but without secondary generalization.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: Focal EEG discharges with propagation to ipsilateral hemisphere
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: Focal epileptiform discharges with spreading to the hemisphere on the same side of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: Focal EEG discharges with secondary generalization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: Focal EEG discharges that secondarily spread to both hemispheres and can then be recorded over the entire scalp.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.label: Bilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001118.definition: Epileptiform discharges being identified at multiple locations in both hemispheres.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: Uni- and bilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: Epileptiform discharges identified at multiple locations temporarily in both hemispheres and temporarily in one hemisphere.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: Unilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: Epileptiform discharges being identified at multiple locations in one hemisphere.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: Polymorphic focal epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: Focal epileptiform discharges of different shapes and frequencies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: EEG with focal spikes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: EEG with series of focal spikes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: Focal spikes occurring for several seconds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: EEG with focal sharp slow waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: EEG with focal sharp waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: EEG with focal spike waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: EEG with generalized epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: EEG discharges recorded on the entire scalp typically seen in persons with epilepsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.label: EEG with generalized sharp slow waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001119.definition: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.label: EEG with generalized polymorphic epileptiform discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.definition: Generalized epileptiform discharges of different shapes and frequencies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.label: EEG with continuous slow activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.definition: EEG showing diffuse slowing without interruption.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.label: EEG with intermittent slow activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.definition: Non-continuous diffuse slowing of electroencephalographic patterns.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.label: EEG with generalized slow activity grade 1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.definition: Slowing at frequencies between 7.5 and 8.5 Hz.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.label: EEG with generalized slow activity grade 2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.definition: Generalized slowing of EEG activity at frequencies between 4-7 Hz.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.label: EEG with generalized slow activity grade 3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.definition: Generalized slowing of EEG activity at frequencies between 0.5-3 Hz.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001120.label: EEG with generalized slow activity grade 4

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.label: EEG with occipital slowing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.definition: Slowing in occipital areas of the scalp EEG.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.label: EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade I
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.definition: Occurrence of epileptiform discharges in occipital regions during photic stimulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.label: EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade II
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.definition: Occurence of epileptiform discharges in occipital and central regions during photic stimulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.label: EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade III
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.definition: Occurrence of epileptiform discharges in occipital, central, temporal and parietal regions during photic stimulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.label: EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade IV
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.definition: Occurrence of generalized epileptiform discharges during photic stimulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.label: Abnormal shape of the frontal region
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.definition: An abnormal shape of the frontal part of the head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.label: Short face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001121.definition: Facial height (length) is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparent decrease in the height (length) of the face (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.label: Prominent forehead
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.definition: Forward prominence of the entire forehead, due to protrusion of the frontal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.label: Vertical forehead creases
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.definition: Vertical soft tissue creases in the midline of the forehead, often extending from the hairline to the brow, and seen with facial expression or when the face is at rest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.label: Depressed glabella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.definition: Posterior positioning of the glabella, i.e., of the midline forehead between the supraorbital ridges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.label: Metopic depression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.definition: Linear vertical groove in the midline of the forehead, extending from hairline to glabella.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.label: Epiblepharon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.definition: Redundant eyelid skin pressing the eyelashes against the cornea and/or conjunctiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the eyelid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.label: Elevated circulating C-reactive protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.definition: An abnormal elevation of the C-reactive protein level in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.label: Horizontal eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.definition: An eyebrow that extends straight across the brow, without curve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.label: Broad eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001122.definition: Regional increase in the width (height) of the eyebrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Laterally extended eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: An eyebrow that extends laterally beyond the orbital rim rather than turning gently downward at that location.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Prominent eyelashes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: Eyelashes that draw the attention of the viewer due to increased density and/or length and/or curl without meeting the criteria of trichomegaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Infra-orbital fold
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: Elevated ridge(s) of skin starting well below the medial aspect of the lower lid that curves gradually upward toward and/or across the nasal bridge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Antihelical shelf
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: Antihelix protrusion directed more anteriorly than laterally, forming a shelf overlying the posterior concha.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Absent antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: No discernible ridge between concha and triangular fossa and helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Additional crus of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: Supernumerary ridge or crus of the ear arising from the antihelix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Angulated antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: Antihelical ridge that forms an acute angle between the antitragus and its bifurcation (stem) instead of a gently curving arc.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Broad inferior crus of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: Increased width of the inferred cross-section of the inferior crus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Prominent inferior crus of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: Increased protrusion of the inferior crus relative to the prominence of the antihelix stem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.label: Underdeveloped inferior crus of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001123.definition: Decreased protrusion of the inferior crus relative to the prominence of the antihelix stem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Prominent stem of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: Increased protrusion of the antihelical ridge, proximal to its bifurcation, relative to the prominence of the helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Serpiginous stem of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: Posterior curving of the antihelix from its origin at the antitragus, traveling initially almost perpendicular to the descending helix and obscuring some of the concha.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Underdeveloped stem of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: Decreased protrusion of the antihelical ridge, proximal to its bifurcation, relative to the prominence of a normal helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Abnormality of inferior crus of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: An abnormality of the inferior crus of the antihelix is the lower cartilaginous ridge arising at the bifurcation of the antihelix that ends beneath the fold of the ascending helix, and separates the concha from the triangular fossa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Abnormality of stem of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: An abnormality of the stem of the antihelix, which is the part below the bifurcation of the antihelix into the inferior and superior crura.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Abnormality of superior crus of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: An abnormality of the superior crus of the antihelix is the upper cartilaginous ridge arising at the bifurcation of the antihelix that ends beneath the fold of the ascending helix, and separates the concha from the triangular fossa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Underdeveloped superior crus of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: Decreased protrusion of the superior crus relative to the prominence of a normal antihelix stem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Prominent superior crus of antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: Increased protrusion of the superior crus relative to the prominence of a normal antihelix stem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Everted antitragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: Positioning of the antitragus at an angle perpendicular to the plane of the ear (oriented away from the plane of the ear).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.label: Absent antitragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001124.definition: Absence of the anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Bifid antitragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: Double rather than single peak of the antitragus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Underdeveloped antitragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: Reduction in the anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Cryptotia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: Invagination of the superior part of the auricle under a fold of temporal skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Type I cryptotia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: A type of cryptotia associated with reduction in size of the antihelix and superior crus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Type II cryptotia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: A type of cryptotia associated with reduction in size of the antihelix and inferior crus that are affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Absent crus of helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: Continuum between the tragus and ascending helix, without any evidence of a posterior extension (crus) towards the concha.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Crus of helix connected to antihelix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: Extension of the ridge of the crus helix across the ear and connection of the crus to the antihelix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Serpiginous crus of helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: Curving course of the crus of the helix, approaching or joining the antitragus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Tragal bridge of crus of helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: The anterior origin of the crus encompasses the superior margin of the tragus, the crus overrides the upper portion of the conchal cavum and ends at the antihelix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.label: Expanded terminal portion of crus of helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001125.definition: Widening, rather than tapering, of the crus at its posterior border near the antihelix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Darwin notch of helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Small defect of the helical fold that lies at the junction of the superior and descending portions of the helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Darwin tubercle of helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Small expansion of the helical fold at the junction of the superior and descending portions of the helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Crimped helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Linear, circumferential indentation in the convexity of the outer surface of the helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Forward facing earlobe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Positioning of the anterior surface of the ear lobe in a more coronal plane than the remainder of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Discontinuous ascending root of helix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Interruption between the ascending helix and the crus helix, allowing the ascending helix to be attached directly to the mastoid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Cleft earlobe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Discontinuity in the convexity of the inferior margin of the lobe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Microtia, first degree
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Presence of all the normal ear components and the median longitudinal length more than two standard deviations below the mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Microtia, third degree
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Presence of some auricular structures, but none of these structures conform to recognized ear components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Absent tragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Lack of convexity or prominence of the contour of the ridge between the bottom of the incisura and the confluence of the ascending helix and crus helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.label: Bifid tragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001126.definition: Increased height of the tragal ridge with a shallow indentation at the apex, giving the appearance of a double peak.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.label: Duplicated tragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.definition: A complete or partial duplication of the tragus; expected to lie anterior to the normal tragus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.label: Prominent tragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.definition: Increase posterolateral protrusion of the tragus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.label: Underdeveloped tragus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.definition: Decreased posterolateral protrusion of the tragus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.label: Anisocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.definition: Abnormally increased variability in the size of erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.label: Recurrent mycobacterial infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.definition: Increased susceptibility to mycobacterial infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of mycobacterial infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.label: Recurrent mycobacterium avium complex infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.definition: Increased susceptibility to mycobacterial avium complex infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of mycobacterial infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.label: Abnormality of the urinary system physiology
Intrapulmonary sequestration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.definition: A type of pulmonary sequestration that occurs within the visceral pleura of normal lung tissue, usually without communication with the tracheobronchial tree.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.label: Abnormality of urine bicarbonate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001127.definition: An abnormal amount of hydrogencarbonate in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: Abnormality of urine calcium concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: An abnormality of calcium concentration in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: Abnormality of urine catecholamine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: An abnormal amount of urinary catecholamine concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: Abnormal hindbrain morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: An abnormality of the hindbrain, also known as the rhombencephalon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: Abnormal metencephalon morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: An abnormality of the metencephalon. The metencephalon is the part of the hindbrain that consists of the pons and the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: Short-segment aganglionic megacolon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment does not extend beyond the upper sigmoid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: Long-segment aganglionic megacolon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment extends proximal to the sigmoid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: Total colonic aganglionosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment comprises the entire colon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: EEG with occipital sharp slow waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: EEG with sharp slow waves in the occipital region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: EEG with parietal sharp slow waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: EEG with sharp slow waves in the parietal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.label: EEG with temporal sharp slow waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001128.definition: EEG with sharp slow waves in the temporal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: EEG with frontal sharp slow waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: EEG with sharp slow waves in the frontal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: EEG with central sharp slow waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: EEG with sharp slow waves in the central region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: EEG with occipital sharp waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: EEG with sharp waves in the occipital region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: EEG with central sharp waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: EEG with sharp waves in the central region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: EEG with frontal sharp waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: EEG with sharp waves in the frontal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: EEG with parietal sharp waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: EEG with sharp waves in the parietal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: EEG with temporal sharp waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: EEG with sharp waves in the temporal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: Abnormal digit morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: A morphological abnormality of a digit, i.e., of a finger or toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: Prominent digit pad
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips or toe tips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.label: Partial absence of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001129.definition: The absence of a phalangeal segment of a finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.label: Broad fingertip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.definition: Increased width of the distal segment of a finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.label: Absent foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.definition: The total absence of the foot, with no bony elements distal to the tibia or fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.label: Long palm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.definition: For children from birth to 16 years of age the length of the palm is more than the 97th centile; or, the length of the palm appears relatively long compared to the finger length or the limb length.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.label: Convex contour of sole
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.definition: The contour of the foot in lateral profile has a convex shape.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.label: Broad thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.definition: Increased thumb width without increased dorso-ventral dimension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.label: Partial absence of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.definition: The absence of a phalangeal segment of a toe or hallux.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.label: Splayed toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.definition: Divergence of digits along the anteroposterior axis (in the plane of the sole).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.label: Slender toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.definition: Toes that are disproportionately narrow (reduced girth) for the hand/foot size or build of the individual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.label: Tapered toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001130.definition: The gradual reduction in girth of the toe from proximal to distal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.label: Bridged palmar crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.definition: A crease that connects the proximal and distal transverse palmar creases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.label: Sydney crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.definition: Extension of the proximal transverse crease (five finger crease) to the ulnar edge of the palm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.label: Fused nails
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.definition: A nail plate that has a longitudinal separation with partially separated nails, each with a separate lateral radius of curvature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.label: Abnormal long bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.definition: An abnormality of size or shape of the long bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.label: Unicoronal synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.definition: Synostosis affecting only one of the coronal sutures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.label: Left unicoronal synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.definition: Synostosis affecting only the left coronal suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.label: Right unicoronal synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.definition: Unicoronal synostosis affecting only the right coronal suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.label: Bicoronal synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.definition: Synostosis affecting the right and the left coronal suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.label: Bilambdoid synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001131.definition: Premature synostosis of both lambdoid sutures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.label: Unilambdoid synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.definition: Premature synostosis of only one lambdoid suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.label: Left unilambdoid synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.definition: Premature synostosis of only the left lambdoid suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.label: Right unilambdoid synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.definition: Premature synostosis of only the right lambdoid suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.label: Cleft of chin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.definition: Incomplete fusion of the chin, resulting from a developmental defect and manifesting as a midline cleft or fissure of the chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.label: Multiple suture craniosynostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.definition: Craniosynostosis involving at least 2 cranial sutures, where the exact pattern of sutures fused has not been precisely specified.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.label: Anterior plagiocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.definition: Asymmetry of the anterior part of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.label: Posterior plagiocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.definition: Asymmetry of the posterior part of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.label: Abnormality of cranial sutures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001132.definition: Any anomaly of a cranial suture, that is one of the six membrane-covered openings in the incompletely ossified skull of the fetus or newborn infant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.label: Metopic synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.definition: Premature fusion of the metopic suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.label: Hemifacial atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.definition: Unilateral atrophy of facial tissues, including muscles, bones and skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.label: Hemifacial hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.definition: Unilateral underdevelopment of the facial tissues, including muscles and bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.label: Asymmetric crying face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.definition: Asymmetry observed in the face of a neonate or infant whose face appears symmetric at rest and asymmetric during crying as the mouth is pulled downward on one side while not moving on the other side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.label: Frontal hirsutism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.definition: Excessive amount of hair growth on forehead.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.label: Bitemporal forceps marks
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.definition: Bilateral temporal scarlike defects, which are said to resemble forceps marks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.label: Abnormality of mouth shape
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.definition: An abnormality of the outline, configuration, or contour of the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.label: Abnormality of upper lip vermillion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001133.definition: An abnormality of the vermilion border, the sharp demarcation between the lip (red colored) and the adjacent normal skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.label: Incomplete cleft of the upper lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.definition: A subtle unilateral cleft of the upper lip, which may appear as a small indentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.label: Long upper lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.definition: Increased width of the upper lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.label: Mild global developmental delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.definition: A mild delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.label: Moderate global developmental delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.definition: A moderate delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.label: Severe global developmental delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.definition: A severe delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.label: Moderate expressive language delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.definition: A moderate delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.label: Mild expressive language delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.definition: A mild delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.label: Abnormality of ocular abduction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.definition: An abnormality involving the movement of the eye outwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.label: Abnormal sixth cranial nerve morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001134.definition: Any structural abnormality of the abducens nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.label: Mild receptive language delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.definition: A mild delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.label: Moderate receptive language delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.definition: A moderate delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.label: Severe receptive language delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.definition: A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.label: Arterial intimal fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.definition: Formation of excess fibrous connective tissue in the tunica intima (innermost layer) of arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.label: Generalized abnormality of skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.definition: An abnormality of the skin that is not localized to any one particular region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.label: Localized skin lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.definition: A lesion of the skin that is located in a specific region rather than being generalized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.label: Regional abnormality of skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.definition: An abnormality of the skin that is restricted to a particular body region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.label: Dry hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001135.definition: Hair that lacks the lustre (shine or gleam) of normal hair.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.label: Acquired abnormal hair pattern
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.definition: An abnormality of the distribution of hair growth that is acquired during the course of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.label: Congenital abnormal hair pattern
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.definition: A congenital abnormality of the distribution of hair growth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.label: Abnormality of hair growth rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.definition: Hair whose growth rate deviates from the norm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.label: Patchy hypopigmentation of hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.definition: Reduced pigmentation of hair in patches.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.label: Epidermal thickening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.definition: Thickening of the epidermal layer of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.label: Mongolian blue spot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001136.definition: Congenital deep dermal melanosis in the sacral area.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Recurrent cutaneous fungal infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: Increased susceptibility to cutaneous fungal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of cutaneous fungal infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Recurrent viral skin infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: Increased susceptibility to viral skin infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral skin infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Aplasia of the inner ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: Absence of the inner ear due to a developmental defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Incomplete partition of the cochlea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: Incomplete formation of the cochlear partition. The scala vestibuli and scala tympani separated by the cochlear partition, except in the apical turn where the two scalae are in continuity via the helicotrema.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Incomplete partition of the cochlea type I
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: Incomplete partition I is also known as cystic cochleovestibular malformation, where the cochlea has no bony modiolus, resulting in an empty cystic cochlea. This is accompanied by a dilated cystic vestibule with developmental arrest at the fifth week of gestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Cochlear aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: Absence of the cochlea, a spiral shaped cavity in the inner ear, owing to a developmental defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Abnormal morphology of the vestibule of the inner ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: A morphological abnormality of the vestibule, the central part of the osseous labyrinth that is situated medial to the tympanic cavity, behind the cochlea, and in front of the semicircular canals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Aplasia of the vestibule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: Complete absence of the vestibule of the inner ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Hypoplasia of the vestibule of the inner ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: Underdevelopment of the vestibule of the inner ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.label: Dilated vestibule of the inner ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001137.definition: Dilatation of the vestibule of the inner ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.label: Abnormal semicircular canal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.definition: An abnormality of the morphology of the semicircular canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.label: Enlarged semicircular canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.definition: Increased size of the semicircular canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.label: Abnormality of the internal auditory canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.definition: An abnormality of the Internal acoustic meatus, i.e., of the canal in the petrous part of the temporal bone through which the cranial nerve VII and cranial nerve VIII traverse.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.label: Absent internal auditory canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.definition: Aplasia of the internal auditory canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.label: Narrow internal auditory canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.definition: Reduction in diameter of the internal auditory canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.label: Enlarged vestibular aqueduct
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.definition: Increased size of the vestibular aqueduct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.label: Enlarged cochlear aqueduct
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.definition: Increased size of the cochlear duct, i.e., of a duct that communicates between the perilymphatic space and the subarachnoid space, and transmits a vein from the cochlea to join the internal jugular.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.label: Functional abnormality of the inner ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001138.definition: An abnormality of the function of the inner ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.label: Abnormal inner ear morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.definition: A structural anomaly of the internal part of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cochlea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the cochlea, a spiral shaped cavity in the inner ear, owing to a developmental defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.label: Abnormality of the cochlear nerve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.definition: Any anomaly of the cohclear nerve, which is the part of the vestibulocochlear nerve that is responsible for transmitting auditory signals from the inner ear to the cochlear nuclei within the brainstem and ultimately to the primary auditory cortex within the temporal lobe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.label: Abnormality of the dorsal column of the spinal cord
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.definition: An abnormality of the dorsal columns, i.e., of the dorsal portion of the gray substance of the spinal cord. The dorsal column consists of the fasciculus gracilis and fasciculus cuneatus and itself is part of the dorsal funiculus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.label: Tibialis anterior muscle atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001139.definition: Wasting of the tibialis anterior muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.label: Abnormal CNS myelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.definition: An abnormality of myelination of nerves in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.label: Delayed peripheral myelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.definition: Delayed myelination in the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.label: Abnormal umbilical cord blood vessel morphology
Lethal short-trunk short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs that is lethal at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.label: Infancy onset short-trunk short stature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with onset in infancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.label: Moderate intrauterine growth retardation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.definition: Intrauterine growth retardation that is at least 3 standard deviations (SD) below average, but not as low as 4 SD, corrected for sex and gestational age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.label: Abnormal placental membrane morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001140.definition: Structural anomaly of the fetal membranes (also known as the amniochorionic or placental membranes), which comprise a vital intrauterine compartment, where they perform mechanical, immune, and endocrine functions to promote growth of the fetus and protection from environmental adversity. Amniochorionic membranes anatomically consist of a single layer of cuboidal amnion epithelial cells, chorionic trophoblasts, and scattered fibroblasts connected by a layer of type IV collagen-rich extracellular matrix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.label: Caesarian section
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.definition: Delivery of a fetus through surgical incisions made through the abdominal wall (laparotomy) and the uterine wall (hysterotomy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.label: Ventouse delivery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.definition: Delivery of newborn by means of a ventouse, a vacuum device used to assist the delivery of a baby when the second stage of labour has not progressed adequately.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.label: Shoulder dystocia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.definition: Shoulder dystocia occurs when the fetal anterior shoulder impacts against the maternal symphysis following delivery of the vertex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.label: Hydropic placenta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.definition: An abnormality of the placenta in which there are numerous cystic spaces within the placenta as well as placental enlargement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.label: Long umbilical cord
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.definition: Increased length of the umbilical cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.label: Abnormal insertion of umbilical cord
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.definition: Anomalous location of the insertion of umbilical cord in the placenta. Normally, the insertion is at least two centimers distant from the edge of the placenta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.label: Placental abruption
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001141.definition: Separation of the placenta from the uterus wall before delivery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Age of death
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: The age group when the cessation of life happens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Death in adolescence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: Death during adolescence, the period between childhood and adulthood (roughly between the ages of 10 and 19 years).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Abnormal blood chloride concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: An abnormality of chloride homeostasis or concentration in the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Hyperchloremia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: An abnormally increased chloride concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Increased serum zinc
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: An increased consentration of zinc in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Fetal ultrasound soft marker
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: An finding upon obstetric ultrasound examination performed at around 16 to 20 weeks of gestation that is abnormal but not clearly identifiable as a fetal anatomic malformation or growth restriction. Such findings are known as soft markers since they are associated with increased risk for fetal aneuploidy or other disorders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Fetal choroid plexus cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: Fetal choroid plexus cysts (CPCs) are sonographically discrete, small cysts found in the choroid plexus within the lateral cerebral ventricles of the developing fetus at 14 to 24 weeks gestation. Imaging of the choroid plexus is performed in the transverse plane of the fetal head at the same level that the lateral cerebral ventricle is evaluated. The choroid plexus should be inspected bilaterally for the presence of cysts. The size of CPCs is not of clinical relevance (PMID:16100637).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Enlarged fetal cisterna magna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: The cisterna magna is measured on a transaxial view of the fetal head angled 15 degrees caudal to the canthomeatal line. The anterior/posterior diameter is taken between the inferior/posterior surface of the vermis of the cerebellum to the inner surface of the cranium. An enlarged cisternal magna is defined by an anterior/posterior diameter of 10 mm or more (PMID:16100637).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Short fetal femur length
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: A short femur length is defined as either a measurement below the 2.5th percentile for gestational age or a measurement that is less than 0.9 of that predicted by the measured biparietal diameter. The femur should be measured with the bone perpendicular to the ultrasound beam and with epiphyseal cartilages visible but not included in the measurement (PMID:16100637).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.label: Short fetal humerus length
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001142.definition: A short humerus length is defined as a length below the 2.5th percentile for gestational age or as a measurement less than 0.9 of that predicted by the measured biparietal diameter. The humerus should be measured with the bone perpendicular to the ultrasound beam and with epiphyseal cartilages visible but not included in the measurement (PMID:16100637).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.label: Hypoplasia of fetal nasal bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.definition: On prenatal ultrasound, the nasal bone is a thin echogenic line within the bridge of the fetal nose. The fetus is imaged facing the transducer with the fetal face strictly in the midline. The angle of insonation is 90 degrees, with the longitudinal axis of the nasal bone as the reference line. Calibres are placed at each end of the nasal bone. Absence of the nasal bone or measurements below 2.5th percentile are considered significant (PMID:16100637).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.label: Fetal fifth finger clinodactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.definition: Fifth finger clinodactyly is defined by a hypoplastic or absent mid-phalanx of the fifth digit. Ultrasound identification of the fetal hand must first be undertaken and then appropriate magnification accomplished. The evaluation requires stretching of the 5 fingers. The diagnosis is established when the middle phalanx of the fifth finger is markedly smaller than normal or absent, which often causes the finger to be curved inward (PMID:16100637).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.label: High maternal circulating alpha-fetoprotein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.definition: Increase in the levels of maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein levels during pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.label: High maternal circulating chorionic gonadotropin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.definition: An abnormally high concentration of maternal serum human chorionic gonadotropin as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.label: Low maternal circulating chorionic gonadotropin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.definition: An abnormally low concentration of maternal serum human chorionic gonadotropin as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.label: Low maternal circulating PAPP-A concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.definition: An abnormally low concentration of serum PAPP-A (pregnancy associated plasma protein A), as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.label: Abnormal maternal serum screening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.definition: An abnormally elevated or decreased level of a maternal serum marker analytes used in screening for aneuploidy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.label: Maternal autoimmune disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.definition: A medical history of a fetus or child born to a mother with an autoimmune disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.label: Maternal teratogenic exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001143.definition: A medical history of exposure of the mother of a child or fetus to a teratogenic substance during pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.label: Alcohol-induced rhabdomyolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.definition: Rhabdomyolysis induced by intake of alcohol.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.label: Abnormal medulla oblongata morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.definition: An abnormality of the medulla oblongata, the lower half of the brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.label: Abnormal central motor function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.definition: An anomaly of the control or production of movement in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.label: Decorticate rigidity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.definition: A type of rigidity in which the arms are in flexion and adduction and the legs are extended. This signifies a lesion in the cerebral white matter, internal capsules, or thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.label: Athetoid cerebral palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.definition: A type of cerebral palsy characterized by slow, involuntary muscle movement and mixed muscle tone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.label: Ankle clonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.definition: Clonus is an involuntary tendon reflex that causes repeated flexion and extension of the foot. Ankle clonus is tested by rapidly flexing the foot upward.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.label: Knee clonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001144.definition: Clonus is an involuntary tendon reflex that causes repeated flexion and extension of the foot. Knee clonus can be tested by rapidly pushing the patella towards the toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.label: Unusual CNS infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.definition: A type of infection of the central nervous system that can be regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.label: Primary microcephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.definition: Head circumference below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.label: Functional abnormality of the middle ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.definition: An abnormality of the function of the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.label: Abnormality of the incus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.definition: An abnormality of the incus, an ossicle in the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.label: Abnormality of the malleus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.definition: An abnormality of the malleus, an ossicle in the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.label: Loss of eyelashes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.definition: This term refers to the loss of eyelashes that were previously present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.label: Abdominal symptom
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.definition: A subjective manifestation of disease localized to the abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.label: Esophageal carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001145.definition: The presence of a carcinoma of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Embryonal onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: Onset of disease at up to 8 weeks following fertilization (corresponding to 10 weeks of gestation).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Fetal onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: Onset prior to birth but after 8 weeks of embryonic development (corresponding to a gestational age of 10 weeks).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Young adult onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: Onset of disease at the age of between 16 and 40 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Childhood onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: Onset of disease at the age of between 1 and 5 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Aganglionosis of the small intestine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: A lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) affecting the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Duodenal aganglionosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: A lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) affecting the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the gallbladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the gallbladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Absent gallbladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: A developmental defect in which the gallbladder fails to form.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Facial tics
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: Sudden, repetitive, nonrhythmic motor movements (spasms), involving the eyes and muscles of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.label: Nasal regurgitation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001146.definition: Regurgitation of milk through the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.label: Nasogastric tube feeding in infancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.definition: Feeding problem necessitating nasogastric tube feeding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.label: Gastrostomy tube feeding in infancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.definition: Feeding problem necessitating gastrostomy tube feeding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.label: Villous atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.definition: The enteric villi are atrophic or absent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.label: Childhood onset sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.definition: Sensorineural hearing impairment with childhood onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.label: Persistent stapedial artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.definition: Persistence of the stapedial artery, which normally regresses during embryonic life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.label: Profound sensorineural hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.definition: Complete loss of hearing related to a sensorineural defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.label: Upbeat nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.definition: In primary position, the eyes drift slowly downward and then spontaneously beat upward. Upward gaze accentuates the nystagmus. The associated oscillopsias are often very irritating, but the symptoms are usually transient.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.label: True anophthalmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.definition: Absence of globe, optic nerve, chiasm and optic tracts. No evidence of ocular tissue on MRI scan or examination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.label: Abnormal lacrimal punctum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001147.definition: An abnormality of the lacrimal punctum, an opening on the eyelid close to the medial canthus that drains tears from the conjunctival sac into the lacrimal duct in the same eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.label: Unilateral microphthalmos
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.label: Abnormal lacrimal duct morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.definition: An abnormality of the lacrimal duct, a duct that drain tears from the conjunctiva, via the lacrimal puncta, into the lacrimal sac.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.label: Abnormal lacrimal gland morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.definition: Abnormality of the lacrimal gland, i.e., of the almond-shaped gland that secretes the aqueous layer of the tear film for each eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.label: Anterior synechiae of the anterior chamber
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.definition: Adhesions between the iris and the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.label: Posterior synechiae of the anterior chamber
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.definition: Adhesions between the iris and the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.label: Corneolenticular adhesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.definition: Developmental abnormality in which the lens and cornea are not separated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.label: Abnormality of corneal thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.definition: An abnormal anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.label: Increased corneal thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.definition: A increased anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.label: Abnormal corneal endothelium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001148.definition: Abnormality of the corneal endothelium, that is, the single layer of cells on the inner surface of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.label: Abnormal Descemet membrane morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.definition: Abnormality of Descemet's membrane, which is the basement membrane of the corneal endothelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.label: Reduced number of corneal endothelial cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.definition: A reduction in the number of corneal endothelial cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.label: Abnormal corneal stroma morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.definition: An abnormality of the stroma of cornea, also known as the substantia propria of cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.label: Central opacification of the cornea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.definition: Reduced transparency of the central portion of the corneal stroma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.label: Generalized opacification of the cornea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.definition: Generalized reduced transparency of the stroma of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.label: Abnormal corneal epithelium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.definition: Abnormality of the corneal epithelium, that is of the epithelial tissue that covers the front of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.label: Corneal neovascularization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.definition: Ingrowth of new blood vessels into the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.label: Iris neovascularization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001149.definition: New growth of vessels on the surface of the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.label: Anterior lenticonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.definition: A conical projection of the anterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.label: Posterior lenticonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.definition: A conical projection of the posterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.label: Bull's eye maculopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.definition: Progressive maculopathy characterized by concentric regions of hyper- and hypo-pigmentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.label: Cystoid macular edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.definition: Cystoid macular edema (CME) is any type of macular edema that involves cyst formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.label: Choroidal neovascularization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.definition: Choroidal neovascularization (CNV) is the creation of new blood vessels in the choroid layer of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.label: Macular flecks
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.definition: Pale often indistinct lesions of the macula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.label: Macular hole
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.definition: A macular hole is a small break in the macula, located in the center of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.label: Macular hyperpigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001150.definition: Increased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.label: Drusen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.definition: Drusen (singular, 'druse') are tiny yellow or white accumulations of extracellular material (lipofuscin) that build up in Bruch's membrane of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.label: Macular schisis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.definition: Splitting of the retina in the macular region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.label: Retinal cavernous angioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.definition: A benign tumor of the retina that appears as a grouping of blood-filled saccules within the inner retinal layers or on the surface of the optic disc. Retinal cavernous angioma are described as having a 'cluster of grapes' appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.label: Abnormality of binocular vision
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.definition: An abnormality of binocular vision, that is of the ability to synthesize the visual inputs from both eyes to a single image with perception of depth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.label: Abnormal stereopsis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.definition: Inability to make fine depth discriminations from parallax provided by the two eyes' different positions on the head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.label: Achromatopsia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.definition: A condition where the retina contains no functional cone cells, so that in addition to the absence of color discrimination, vision in lights of normal intensity is difficult.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.label: Cone monochromacy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.definition: The condition of having both rods and cones, but only a single kind of cone. Affected individuals have good pattern vision in daylight, but cannot distinguish between colors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.label: Dichromacy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.definition: Individuals affected by dichromacy possess only two types of cones, instead of three.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.label: Anomalous trichromacy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001151.definition: Individuals with anomalous trichromacy possess three types of cones, but one of the three types of cones has an abnormal spectral sensitivity compared to normal cones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Deuteranomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: A type of anomalous trichromacy associated with abnormal M photopigment, such that the absorption spectrum is shifted toward L wavelengths. Affected individuals have difficulties distinguishing between red and green.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Deuteranopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: Complete lack of the M photopigment, which is replaced with the L photopigment. Affected individuals tend to confuse red and green.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Protanopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: Blue and green cones only; no functional red cones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Iris cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: An iris cyst is composed of a single cell layer of epithelium and is filled with fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Iris melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: Malignant tumor of melanocytes affecting the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Iris nevus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: A benign brown pigmented area over the iris representing proliferation of melanocyte cells in the stromal layer of the iris. An iris nevus can be flat or occasionally slightly elevated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Abnormality of lens shape
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: An abnormal shape of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Lentiglobus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: Exaggerated curvature of the lens of the eye, producing an anterior or posterior spherical bulging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Solitary congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: Sharply demarcated hyperpigmentation which is congenital found in around 3-5% of the population and of no functional significance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.label: Multiple bilateral congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001152.definition: Sharply demarcated hyperpigmentation which is congenital.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Retinal hole
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: A small break in the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Vitritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: Inflammation of the vitreous body, characterized by the presence of inflammatory cells and protein exudate in the vitreous cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Subretinal exudate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: A type of retinal exudate located in the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Snowflake vitreoretinal degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: The appearance of yellow/white crystalline-like (hence the name) spots in the retina and thickening of the peripheral part of the vitreous.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Abnormal spatial orientation of the cardiac segments
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: Abnormality of the spatial relationship of the cardiac segments to other components of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Abnormal atrial arrangement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: Abnormality of the spatial relationship of the atria to other components of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Right atrial isomerism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: Right atrial isomerism is characterized by bilateral triangular, morphologically right atrial, appendages, both joining the atrial chamber along a broad front with internal terminal crest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Left atrial isomerism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: In left atrial isomerism there is a bilateral small finger-shaped morphologically left atrial appendage joining the atrial chamber along a narrow front without an internal terminal crest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Atrial situs inversus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: Mirror image atrial arrangement, with morphologic right atrium on the left hand side and morphologic left atrium on the right hand side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.label: Atrial situs ambiguous
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001153.definition: Common atrium without defining morphologic features.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.label: Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.definition: The essence of the lesion is the combination of discordant atrioventricular and ventriculo-arterial connections. Thus, the morphologically right atrium is connected to a morphologically left ventricle across the mitral valve, with the left ventricle then connected to the pulmonary trunk. The morphologically left atrium is connected to the morphologically right ventricle across the tricuspid valve, with the morphologically right ventricle connected to the aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.label: Criss-cross atrioventricular valves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.definition: Crossing of the inflow streams of the two ventricles, due to an apparent twisting of the heart about its long axis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.label: Criss-cross atrioventricular valves with superior-inferior ventricles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.definition: Criss-cross atrioventricular valves with a rare cardiac malformation characterized by the two ventricles lying one above the other instead of side by side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.label: Superior-inferior ventricles without criss-cross atrioventricular valves
Abnormal connection of the cardiac segments
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.definition: A deviance in the normal connections between two cardiac segements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.label: Abnormal atrioventricular connection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.definition: An abnormality of the circulatory connection between atria and ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.label: Absent left sided atrioventricular connection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.definition: A defect where there is no connection between the left atrium and left ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.label: Absent right sided atrioventricular connection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.definition: A defect where there is no connection between the right atrium and right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001154.label: Univentricular heart with absent left sided atrioventricular connection

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.label: Biventricular heart with straddling right sided atrioventricular valve and absent left sided atrioventricular connection
Right sided atrium to left ventricle and absent left sided atrioventricular connection
Ambiguous atrioventricular connection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.definition: With left or right cardiac isomerism in a biventricular, the atrioventricular connections are perforce ambiguous, in that one of the connections is concordant (e.g., right-sided morphologic right atrium connected to a morphologic right ventricle) and one of the connections is discordant (e.g., left-sided morphologic right atrium connected to a morphologic left ventricle).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.label: Discordant atrioventricular connection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.definition: Connection of the right atrium to the left ventricle and of the left atrium to the right ventricle in a biventricular heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.label: Double inlet atrioventricular connection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.definition: The condition in which both atria are joined to a single ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.label: Double inlet left ventricle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.definition: The condition in which both atria are joined to the left ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. Usually there is a hypoplastic right ventricle, which may be on the opposite side of the heart as usual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.label: Double inlet right ventricle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.definition: The condition in which both atria are joined to the right ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. Usually, the left ventricle is hypoplastic.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.label: Double inlet to single ventricle of indeterminate morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.definition: The condition in which both atria are joined to a single ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. The morphology of this ventricle does not allow one to determine if it corresponds to the left or right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001155.label: Double inlet to single ventricle with common atrioventricular orifice
Double inlet to single ventricle with two atrioventricular valves

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001156.label: Mitral atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001156.definition: A congenital defect with failure to open of the mitral valve orifice.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001156.label: Overriding atrioventricular valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001156.definition: An atrioventricular valve that empties into both ventricles. The valve overrides the interventricular septum above a ventricular septum defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001156.label: Straddling atrioventricular valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001156.definition: Anomalous insertion of the chordae tendinae or papillary muscles into the contralateral ventricle in the presence of a ventricular septum defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001156.label: Abnormal ventriculoarterial connection
