http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001187.definition: Presence of reduced amount of a membrane protein on the cell membrane of platelets. This feature is typically measured by flow cytometry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001187.label: Decreased platelet glycoprotein Ib-IX-V
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001187.definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of the glycoprotein complex Ib-IX-V.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Acute disseminated intravascular coagulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: An acute form of disseminated intravascular coagulation. Acute DIC can occur following sudden exposure of blood to procoagulants, with the compensatory hemostatic mechanisms becoming overwhelmed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Decreased platelet glycoprotein VI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein VI.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Decreased platelet P2Y12 receptor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of P2Y12 receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Abnormal platelet granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: An anomaly of alpha or dense granules or platelet lysosomes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Abnormal umbilical stump bleeding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: Abnormal bleeding of the umbilical stump following separation of the cord at approximately 7-10 days after birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Hemorrhage of the eye
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: Bleeding from vessels of the various tissues of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Hyphema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: Bleeding in the anterior chamber of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Choroid hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: Hemorrhage from the vessels of the choroid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Bleeding requiring red cell transfusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: Bleeding sufficiently severe as to require red cell transfusion (WHO Grade 3 or 4).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.label: Bleeding with minor or no trauma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001188.definition: Significant bleeding or hemorrhage without significant precipitating factor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Prolonged bleeding following procedure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: Prolonged or protracted bleeding following an invasive procedure or intervention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Post-partum hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: Significant maternal haemorrhage/blood loss following deilvery of a child.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Low levels of vitamin K
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin K.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Abnormal leukocyte count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: Number of leukocytes per volume of blood beyond normal limits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Impaired thromboxane A2 agonist-induced platelet aggregation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: Abnormal response to thromboxane as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thromboxane A2 receptor agonists.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: A type of anemia related to a reduction in the average life span of red blood cells in the peripheral circulation, which is normally around 120 days.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Subconjunctival hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: Bleeding beneath the mucous membrane that lines the inner surface of the eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Neutrophilia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: Increased number of neutrophils circulating in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Abnormality of circulating fibrinogen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: An abnormality of the level of activity of circulating fibrinogen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.label: Hyperfibrinogenemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001189.definition: Increased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.label: Hypofibrinogenemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.definition: Decreased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.label: Abnormal hemoglobin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.definition: Anomaly in the level or the function of hemoglobin, the oxygen-carrying protein of erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.label: HbH hemoglobin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.definition: Hemoglobin H (HbH) contains four beta-globin chains. It is normally not present at all in blood, but may make up about 1-40 percent of all hemoglobin in HbH disease, a subform of alpha thalassemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.label: Persistence of hemoglobin F
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.definition: Hemoglobin F (HbF) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin gamma chains. It is the main form of hemoglobin in the fetus during the last seven months of intrauterine development and in the half year of postnatal life. In adults it normally makes up less than one percent of all hemoglobin. This term refers to an increase in HbF above this limit. In beta thalassemia major, it may represent over 90 percent of all hemoglobin, and in beta thalassemia minor it may make up between 0.5 to 4 percent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.label: Reduced hemoglobin A
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.definition: Hemoglobin A (HbA) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin beta chains. HbA is normally the main adult hemoglobin, representing about 96-98 percent of all hemoglobin. This term represents a decreased in the proportion of HbA below this limit, and can be seen in various forms of thalassemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.label: Reduced beta/alpha synthesis ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.definition: A reduction in the ratio of production of beta globin to that of alpha globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of beta thalassemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.label: Reduced alpha/beta synthesis ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.definition: A reduction in the ratio of production of alpha globin to that of beta globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of alpha thalassemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.label: Unilateral radial aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.definition: Missing radius bone on one side only associated with congenital failure of development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.label: Flattened metacarpal heads
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001190.definition: Abnormally flat shape of the heads of the metacarpal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.label: Shortening of all phalanges of fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.definition: Abnormal reduction in length affecting all phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.label: Abnormal metacarpophalangeal joint morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.definition: An anomaly of a metacarpophalangeal joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.label: Abnormality of the glenoid fossa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.definition: An anomaly of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.label: Lumbar hypertrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the lumbar region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.label: Thoracic hypertrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the thoracic region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.label: Cardiovascular calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.definition: Abnormal calcification in the cardiovascular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.label: Toe extensor amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.definition: Atrophy of the extensor digitorum longus muscles, which mediate extension of the toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.label: Clinodactyly of the 4th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.definition: Bending or curvature of a fourth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.label: Pleural empyema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001191.definition: Accumulation of pus in the pleural cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Transudative pleural effusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: A type of pleural effusion with a transudate (extravascular fluid with low protein content and a low specific gravity). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Exudative pleural effusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: A type of pleural effusion with a exudate (extravascular fluid that has exuded out of a tissue or its capillaries due to injury or inflammation). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Abnormal activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: An increased or decreased activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex I
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex III
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial ATP synthase complex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, which makes ATP via oxidative phosphorylation, and is sometimes described as Complex V of the electron transport chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Proximal placement of hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: Proximal mislocalization of the big toe from its normal position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Short digit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: One or more digit that appears disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot, whereby either the entire digit or a specific phalanx is shortened.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Short proximal phalanx of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of proximal phalanx of toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.label: Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of third finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001192.definition: Presence of an additional phalanx-like bone, producing an extra, wedge-shaped bone at the base of the proximal phalanx of the third finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.label: Abnormal cerebellar peduncle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.definition: An anomaly of the cerebellar peduncles. The superior, middle, and inferior cerebellar peduncles emerge from the cerebellum. The superior cerebellar penduncles connect the cerebellum to the midbrain, the middle cerebellar peduncles connect the cerebellum to the pons, and the inferior cerebellar peduncle connects the medulla spinalis and medulla oblongata with the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.label: Abnormal superior cerebellar peduncle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.definition: An anomaly of the superior cerebellar peduncle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.label: Elongated superior cerebellar peduncle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.definition: Increased length of the superior cerebellar peduncle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.label: Dilatation of mesenteric artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the inferior mesenteric artery or superior mesenteric artery .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.label: Decreased urinary urate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.definition: Decreased concentration of urate in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.label: Decreased plasma total carnitine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.definition: A decreased concentration of total carnitine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.label: Hypoplastic fifth toenail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.definition: Underdeveloped nails of the fifth toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.label: 3-4 finger cutaneous syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001193.definition: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between fingers 3 and 4.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Anterior wedging of T12
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T12 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Anterior wedging of L2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L2 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Increased urinary sulfite level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: The concentration of SO3(2-), i.e., sulfite, in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Increased urinary thiosulfate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: Increased concentration of thiosulfate(2-) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Small vessel vasculitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) that affects blood vessels that are smaller than arteries, i.e., arterioles, venules, and capilllaries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia (BOOP) is and interstitial lung abnormalitiy characterized histopathologically by plugs of granulation tissue lying within small airways, alveolar ducts, and alveoli and by chronic inflammatory cell infiltration in alveolar walls. Patients with BOOP generally present with subacute illness, including shortness of breath, fever, malaise, and weight loss.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Bronchiolitis obliterans
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: Inflammation and fibrosis of the bronchioles leading to partial or complete obstruction of these airways.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Respiratory tract infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: An infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Recurrent acute respiratory tract infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: A history of repeated acute infections of the upper or lower respiratory tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.label: Acute infectious pneumonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001194.definition: Acute inflammation of the lung due to an infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.label: Aspiration pneumonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.definition: Pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.label: Acute aspiration pneumonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.definition: An acute episode of pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.label: Nodular regenerative hyperplasia of liver
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.definition: Diffuse benign transformation of the hepatic parenchyma into small regenerative nodules with minimal or no fibrosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.label: Hepatic granulomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.definition: The presence of multiple granulomas in the liver as based on pathological examination. Granulomas are small 0.5 to 2 mm collections of modified macrophages called epithelioid cells usually surrounded by lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.label: Intestinal lymphoid nodular hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.definition: A lymphoproliferative abnormality of the intestine characterized by numerous visible mucosal nodules measuring up to, and rarely exceeding, 0.5 cm in diameter Histologically, hyperplastic lymphoid follicles with large germinal centres are seen in the lamina propria and superficial submucosa. There is enlargement of the mucosal B cell follicles caused by hyperplasia of the follicle centres; surrounded by a normal appearing mantle zone. Disease may involve the stomach, the entire small intestine, and the large intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.label: Abnormal pectoral muscle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.definition: An abnormality of the pectoral muscle, comprising the pectoralis major, a thick, fan-shaped muscle of the anterior chest and the pectoralis minor, a thin, triangular muscle situated underneath the pectoralis major.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.label: Retinal perforation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.definition: A small hole through the whole thickness of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.label: Unilateral hypoplasia of pectoralis major muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001195.definition: Hypoplasia (underdevelopment) of the pectoralis minor on only one side of the chest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Substantia nigra gliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the substantia nigra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Non-obstructive azoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from a defect in the production of spermatozoa in the testes. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Obstructive azoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from post-testicular obstruction or retrograde ejaculation. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Pretesticular azoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, due to a hypothalamic or pituitary abnormality diagnosed with hypo-gonadotropic-hypogonadism. The diagnosis is made on the basis of low LH and FSH levels and low or normal testosterone levels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Intermittent painful muscle spasms
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: History of repeated intermittent involuntary muscle contractions that were painful.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Abnormal circulating citrulline concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of citrulline in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Elevated plasma citrulline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: An increased concentration of citrulline in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Decreased circulating copper concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: A reduced concentration of copper in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Feeding difficulties
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: Impaired ability to eat related to problems gathering food and getting ready to suck, chew, or swallow it.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.label: Elevated circulating luteinizing hormone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001196.definition: An elevated concentration of luteinizing hormone in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Cerebral amyloid angiopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: Amyloid deposition in the walls of leptomeningeal and cortical arteries, arterioles, and less often capillaries and veins of the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Dermatographic urticaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: An exaggerated whealing tendency when the skin is stroked, that is, formation of red, itchy bumps and lines on the skin as a result of pressure on the skin (for instance, stroking the skin with a pen or tongue depressor).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Hypoglycorrhachia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: Abnormally low glucose concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Paroxysmal lethargy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: Repeated episodes of sudden-onset and transient lethargy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Myelofibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: Replacement of bone marrow by fibrous tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Aminoglycoside-induced hearing loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: Partial or complete loss of hearing following ingestion of aminoglycoside antibiotics.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Elevated urinary catecholamine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: The concentration of a catecholamine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Elevated urinary homovanillic acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Elevated urinary vanillylmandelic acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: An increased concentration of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.label: Elevated urinary dopamine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001197.definition: The concentration of dopamine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Cholesterol gallstones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: Gallstones composed primarily of cholesterol, usually about 2-3 cm in length with an oval form and a yellow or green/brown color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Pigment gallstones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: Gallstones composed primarily of bilirubin and calcium salts (calcium bilirubinate) with a low cholesterol concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Black pigment gallstones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: A type of pigment gallstone that is hard and black, containing calcium carbonate and calcium phosphates.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Brown pigment gallstones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: A type of pigment gallstone that is brown, containing calcium fatty acids. These stones are softer than black pigment gallstones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Atretic gallbladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: Failure of formation of the lumen of the gallbladder, often associated with gallbladder hypoplasia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Acholic stools
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: Clay colored stools lacking bile pigment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Ectopic ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: Formation of abnormal, extraskeletal bony tissue, i.e., the presence of bone in soft tissue where bone normally does not exist.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Ectopic ossification in muscle tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Ectopic ossification in tendon tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within tendon tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.label: Ectopic ossification in ligament tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001198.definition: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within ligament tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.label: Abnormal neutrophil count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.definition: A deviation from the normal range of neutrophil cell counts in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.label: Abnormal neutrophil morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.definition: An abnormal form or size of neutrophils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.label: Impaired neutrophil bactericidal activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.definition: A reduction in the ability of neutrophils to kill bacteria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.label: Abnormal atrial septum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.definition: An abnormality of the interatrial septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.label: Atrial septal dilatation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.definition: A bulging of the interatrial septum towards one side. In adults, atrial septal aneurysm can be defined as a protrusion of the aneurysm of >10 mm beyond the plane of the atrial septum as measured by transesophageal echocardiography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.label: Elevated coagulation factor V activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.definition: Increased activity of coagulation factor V, Factor V, which is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa) is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.label: Postprandial hyperlactemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.definition: Abnormally increased level of blood lactate following a meal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.label: Postprandial hyperglycemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.definition: An increased concentration of glucose in the blood following a meal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.label: Paranoia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001199.definition: An inappropriate feeling of being persecuted or being the subject of hostility from others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: EEG with generalized spikes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: EEG with generalized polyspikes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: EEG with repetitive generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: Experiential epileptic aura
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: Affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: Affective epileptic aura
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: Affective auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: Focal cognitive seizure with deja vu/jamais vu
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by memory phenomena such as feelings of familiarity (deja vu) and unfamiliarity (jamais vu) as the initial semiological manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: Deja vu aura
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: A subjective feeling that an experience which is occurring for the first time has been experienced before.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: Jamais vu aura
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: A subjective feeling that an experience which has occurred before is being experienced for the first time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: Focal cognitive seizure with hallucination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by hallucination as the initial semiological manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: Focal cognitive seizure with illusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by an alteration of actual perception involving visual, auditory, somatosensory, olfactory, and/or gustatory phenomena as the initial semiological manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.label: EEG with central focal spike waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001200.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the central region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: EEG with frontal focal spike waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the frontal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: EEG with occipital focal spike waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the occipital region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: EEG with parietal focal spike waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the parietal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: EEG with temporal focal spike waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the temporal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: EEG with central focal spikes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the central region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: EEG with frontal focal spikes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the frontal region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: EEG with occipital focal spikes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the occipital region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: EEG with parietal focal spikes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the parietal region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: EEG with temporal focal spikes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the temporal region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.label: Lens luxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001201.definition: Complete dislocation of the lens of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Right aortic arch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: Aorta descends on right instead of on the left.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Persistent patent ductus venosus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: Persistence of blood flow through the ductus venosus for longer than the normal time after birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Congenital portosystemic venous shunt
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: A congenital defect of the vasculature such that there is a shunt (by-pass) of blood directly from the portal vein to the vena cava (i.e., the blood from the portal vein is not filtered through the liver).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Galactosuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: Elevated concentration of galactose in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Hypergalactosemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: Elevated concentration of galactose in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Abnormal circulating ornithine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: Deviation from the normal concentration of ornithine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Hyperornithinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: Increased concentration of ornithine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Laryngeal edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tissues of the larynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Hepatocellular adenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: A benign tumor of the liver of presumably epithelial origin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.label: Abnormal urine hormone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001202.definition: An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.label: Increased urinary cortisol level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.definition: Abnormally increased concentration of cortisol in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.label: Lipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.definition: Benign neoplasia derived from lipoblasts or lipocytes of white or brown fat. May be angiomatous or hibernomatous.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.label: Sacral lipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.definition: Presence of a lipoma in the region of the sacrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.label: Liposarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.definition: Malignant neoplasms which probably originate in primitive mesenchymal stem cell populations differentiating down a lipomatous pathway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.label: Steatocystoma multiplex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.definition: Multiple, localized or widespread, asymptomatic or inflammatory dermal cysts involving the pilosebaceous units. Lesions can appear anywhere on the body, but steatocystoma multiplex is more commonly involved with those areas of the skin with a high density of developed pilosebaceous units (e.g., the axilla, groin, neck, and proximal extremities).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.label: Sternocleidomastoid amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.definition: Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.label: Pectoralis amyotrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.definition: Wasting of the pectoral muscles, i.e., of the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.label: Corneal guttata
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.definition: Corneal guttata are droplet-like accumulations of non-banded collagen on the posterior surface of Descemet's membrane. The presence of focal thickenings of Descemet's membrane histologically named guttae. Cornea guttata can be easily diagnosed in vivo and ex vivo by means of specular microscopy as it gives dark areas where no endothelial cells are visible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.label: Descemet Membrane Folds
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001203.definition: Presence of folds in the Descemet membrane, which is the basement membrane of the endothelial (inner) cell layer of the cornea. Descemet membrane folds are generally a manifestation of inflammation or edema of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.label: Corneal stromal edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.definition: Abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling of the stroma of cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.label: Aspirin-induced asthma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.definition: A type of asthma in which aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) that inhibit cyclooxygen-ase 1 (COX-1) exacerbate bronchoconstriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.label: Pendular nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.definition: Rhythmic, involuntary sinusoidal oscillations of one or both eyes. The waveform of pendular nystagmus may occur in any direction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.label: Seesaw nystagmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.definition: Seesaw nystagmus is a type of pendular nystagmus where a half cycle consists of the elevation and intorsion of one eye, concurrently with the depression and extortion of the fellow eye. In the other half cycle, there is an inversion of the ocular movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.label: Retinal flecks
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.definition: Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.label: Areflexia of upper limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.definition: Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the upper limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.label: Hemeralopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.definition: A visual defect characterized by the inability to see as clearly in bright light as in dim light. The word hemeralopia literally means day blindness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.label: Oromandibular dystonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.definition: A kind of focal dystonia characterized by forceful contractions of the face, jaw, and/or tongue causing difficulty in opening and closing the mouth and often affecting chewing and speech.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.label: Laryngeal dystonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001204.definition: A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Anasarca
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: An extreme form of generalized edema with widespread and massive edema due to effusion of fluid into the extracellular space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Reactive hypoglycemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: Hypoglycermia following a meal (or more generally, after intake of glucose).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Low serum calcitriol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: A reduced concentration of calcitriol in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Decreased circulating calcifediol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: A reduced concentration of calcifediol in the blood. Calcifediol is also known as calcidiol, 25-hydroxycholecalciferol and 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Choroidal melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the choroid. The classic appearance of choroidal melanoma is a pigmented dome-shaped or collar button-shaped tumor with an associated exudative retinal detachment. Choroidal melanoma is usually pigmented, but can be variably pigmented and even amelanotic (non-pigmented).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Ciliary body melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the ciliary body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Cutaneous melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: The presence of a melanoma of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Superficial spreading melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: A type of melanoma that is flat and irregular in shape and color, with different shades of black and brown.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Nodular melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: A type of melanoma that starts as a raised area that is usually dark blackish-blue or bluish-red but may not have any color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.label: Lentigo maligna melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001205.definition: A subtype of melanoma in situ that typically develops on sun-damaged skin. The lesion is typically a large, irregularly pigmented macule that has developed from an ordinary lentigo (a small pigmented spot on the skin with a clearly-defined edge). Change to a malignant lentigo typically takes place over 20 years or more, and many patients accept the change as a consequence of aging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Acral lentiginous melanoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixutre of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Urinary excretion of sialylated oligosaccharides
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: Excretion of oligosaccharides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Bone cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: A fluid filled cavity that develops with a bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Aneurysmal bone cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: Radiographic features include a dilated, radiolucent lesion typically located eccentrically within the metaphyseal portion of the bone, with fluid levels visible on magnetic resonance imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Unicameral bone cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: A benign fluid filled simple cyst of bone filled with serous fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Multiple bony cystic lesions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: Presence of multiple cystic changes in multiple areas or multiple bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Increased urinary disaccharide excretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: Increased concentration of disaccharide in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Glycopeptiduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: Increased excretion of glycopeptides in the urine. Glycopeptides are peptides with carbohydrate moieties covalently attached to the side chains of the amino acid residues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Aspartylglucosaminuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: Excretion of excess amounts of aspartylglucosamine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.label: Keratan sulfate excretion in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001206.definition: An increased concentration of keratan sulfate in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Chondroitin sulfate excretion in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: An increased concentration of chondroitin sulfate (CHEBI:37397) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Abnormal circulating acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of an acylcarnitine, which is produced by reversible esterification of the 3-hydroxyl group of carnitine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: Excretion of urine with an acid pH, i.e., having an increased hydrogen ion concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Abnormal urinary acylglycine profile
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: An abnormal distribution of N-acylglycines in the urine. There are numerous different N-acylglycines, and this term refers to pathological alterations in their level or distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Tonic pupil
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: An abnormality of the pupillary light reaction characterized by a marked slowing of the light reaction of usually just one pupil. The pupil tends to be relatively dilated, and there is reduced accommodation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Personality disorder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: A personality disorder is a deeply ingrained pattern of behavior of a specified kind that deviates markedly from the norms of generally accepted behavior. It is typically apparent by the time of adolescence and causes long-term difficulties in personal relationships or functioning in society.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Borderline personality disorder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: A personality disorder characterized by impulsive behavior and unpredictable, capricious mood. Affected individuals show a tendency to have outbursts of emotion and an inability to control these behavioral explosions. They generally experience an intense fear of abandonment or instability and also struggle with feelings of emptiness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Histrionic personality disorder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: A personality disorder characterized by shallow and labile affectivity, self-dramatization, theatricality, exaggerated expression of emotions, suggestibility, egocentricity, self-indulgence, lack of consideration for others, easily hurt feelings, and continuous seeking for appreciation, excitement and attention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Motor conduction block
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: Blockade of impulses at a focal site along the course of a motor axon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.label: Abnormality of central motor conduction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001207.definition: Any anomaly of the conduction of motor nerve impulses in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.label: Cerebellar granular layer atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.definition: Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the granular cell layer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.label: Enlarged cerebellum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.definition: An abnormally increased size of the cerebellum compared to other brain structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.label: Cerebellar Purkinje layer atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.definition: Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the Purkinje cell layer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.label: Ubiquitin-positive cerebral inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.definition: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates that show positive staining with antibodies against ubiquitin within cells of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.label: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.definition: Any abnormality of the size of the skeletal muscle cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.label: Pyuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.definition: The presence of 10 or more white cells per cubic millimeter in a urine specimen, 3 or more white cells per high-power field of unspun urine, a positive result on Gram staining of an unspun urine specimen, or a urinary dipstick test that is positive for leukocyte esterase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.label: Abnormal urinary color
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.definition: An abnormal color of the urine, that is, the color of the urine appears different from the usual straw-yellow color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.label: Abnormal mitochondrial shape
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.definition: An anomaly in the surface contour of mitochondria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.label: Abnormal urinary odor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001208.definition: A deviation from the normal odor of the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.label: Abnormality of pancreas physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.definition: An anomaly of the function of the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.label: Abnormality of exocrine pancreas physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.definition: A functional anomaly of the acinar gland portion of the pancreas that secretes digestive enzymes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.label: Abnormality of endocrine pancreas physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.definition: A function abnormality of the endocrine pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.label: Abnormal pancreas size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.definition: A deviation from the normal size of the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.label: Intracranial epidermoid cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.definition: A congenital inclusion cysts that arises from ectodermal cells that normally form skin cells being left behind in the nervous system during development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.label: Intracranial dermoid cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.definition: A congenital inclusion cysts that arises from the inclusion of ectodermally committed cells at the time of neural tube closure (3rd-5th week of embryogenesis). The capsule of dermoid cysts consists of simple epithelium supported by collagen. In thicker parts, the lining is supplemented with dermis containing hair follicles, sebaceous glands, and apocrine glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.label: Edema of the dorsum of feet
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.label: Abnormality of circulating catecholamine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001209.definition: An abnormal catecholamine concentration in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.label: Abnormal circulating creatinine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.definition: An abnormal concentration of creatinine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.label: Decreased serum creatinine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.definition: An abnormally reduced amount of creatinine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.label: Abnormal mitochondrial number
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.definition: A deviation from the normal number of mitochondria per cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.label: Abnormality of the mitochondrion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.definition: An anomaly of the mitochondrion, the membranous cytoplasmic organelle the interior of which is subdivided by cristae. The mitochondrion is a self replicating organelle that is the site of tissue respiration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.label: Rhizomelic leg shortening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.definition: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the leg (i.e. the femur).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.label: Increased fibular diameter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.definition: Increased width of the cross sectional diameter of the fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.label: Open angle glaucoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.definition: A type of glaucoma defined by an open, normal appearing anterior chamber angle and raised intraocular pressure,

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.label: Angle closure glaucoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001210.definition: A type of glaucomatous optic neuropathy in an eye that has evidence of angle closure (i.e. significant iridotrabecular contact).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.label: Abnormality of circulating glucocorticoid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.definition: An abnormality of the concentration of a glucocorticoid in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.label: Abnormal circulating corticosterone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.definition: An abnormality of the concentration of corticosterone in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.label: Abnormal circulating creatine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of creatine in the blood circulation. Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarly for muscle cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.label: Endometrial carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.definition: A carcinoma of the endometrium, the mucous lining of the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.label: Abnormal circulating albumin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.definition: Deviation from normal concentration of albumin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.label: Hyperalbuminemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.definition: Elevation in the concentration of albumin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.label: Methemoglobinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001211.definition: Abnormally increased levels of methemoglobin in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.label: Methylmalonic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.definition: Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.label: Panuveitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which inflammation affects the anterior chamber, vitreous, retina or choroid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.label: Anterior uveitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the anterior chamber.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.label: Posterior uveitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the retina or choroid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.label: Intermediate uveitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the vitreous.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.label: Stomach cancer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.definition: A cancer arising in any part of the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.label: Uraciluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.definition: Increased concentration of uracil in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.label: Basal ganglia necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.definition: Death of cells in the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001212.label: Abnormality of bone marrow stromal cells

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.label: Abnormal erythroid lineage cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.definition: An anomaly of erythroid lineage cells, that is, of the erythropoietic cells in the lineage leading to and including erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.label: Abnormal number of erythroid precursors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.definition: A deviation from the normal count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.label: Erythroid hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.definition: Increased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.label: Erythroid hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.definition: Decreased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.label: Abnormal granulocytopoietic cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.definition: An anomaly of cells involved in the formation of a granulocytes, that is, of the granulocytopoietic cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.label: Granulocytic hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001213.definition: Decreased number of granulocyte precursors in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.label: obsolete Abnormality of cells of the lymphoid lineage
Pancreatic squamous cell carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.definition: A subtype of ductal pancreatic carcinoma that is thought to originate from squamous metaplasia of pancreatic ductal epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.label: Abnormal megakaryocyte morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.definition: Any structural anomaly of megakaryocytes. Mature blood platelets are released from the cytoplasm of megakaryocytes, which are bone-marrow resident cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.label: Abnormal monocyte morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.definition: Any structural anomaly of a myeloid mononuclear recirculating leukocyte that can act as a precursor of tissue macrophages, osteoclasts and some populations of tissue dendritic cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.label: Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow
Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.definition: Decreased quantity or activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.label: Reduced quantity of Von Willebrand factor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.definition: Decreased quantity of von Willebrand factor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.label: Multiple lineage myelodysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.definition: Myelodysplasia with dysplastic changes in two or more of the myeloid lineages: erythroid, granulocytic, megakaryocytic.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.label: Bilineage myelodysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001214.definition: Myelodysplasia with dysplastic changes in two of the myeloid lineages: erythroid, granulocytic, megakaryocytic.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Single lineage myelodysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: Abnormality/dysplasia of a single myeloid cell (erythroid, granulocytic, or megakaryocytic).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Hemothorax
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: The presence of blood in the pleural space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Foveoschisis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: Splitting of the retinal layers in the macula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Hypotriglyceridemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: An decrease in the level of triglycerides in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Anhedonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: Inability to experience pleasurable activities usually found enjoyable.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Decreased corneal sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: Reduced ability of the cornea to respond to stimulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Hemophagocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: Phagocytosis by macrophages of erythrocytes, leukocytes, platelets, and their precursors in bone marrow and other tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Subcortical cerebral atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: Atrophy of the cerebral subcortical white and gray matter, termed subcortical atrophy, reflects loss of nerve cells in the basal ganglia or fibers in the deep white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Carotid artery dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the carotid artery wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.label: Internal carotid artery dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001215.definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the internal carotid artery wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: Intracranial internal carotid artery dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the intracranial portion of the internal carotid artery wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: External carotid artery dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the external carotid artery wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: Common carotid artery dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the common carotid artery wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: Carotid artery dilatation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: A dilatation (balooning or bulging out of the vessel wall) of a carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: Asterixis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: A clinical sign indicating a lapse of posture and is usually manifest by a bilateral flapping tremor at the wrist, metacarpophalangeal, and hip joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: Oligodactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: Skin-picking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: Repetitive and compulsive picking of skin which results in tissue damage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: Hair-pulling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: A phenomenon in which persons repetitively pull out their own hair, resulting in noticeable hair loss.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: Head-banging
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: Habitual striking of one's own head against a surface such as a mattress or wall of a crib.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.label: Self-biting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001216.definition: Habitual biting of one's own body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Nail-biting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: Habitual biting of one's own fingernails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Stereotypical hand wringing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: Habitual clasping and wringing of the hands in the middle of the body, similar to a hand-washing movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Stereotypical body rocking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: Habitual repetitive movement of the entire body, front to back or side to side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Orthostatic tachycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: An increase in heart rate with standing of 30 beats per minute or more.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Glioblastoma multiforme
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: A tumor arising from glia in the central nervous system with macroscopic regions of necrosis and hemorrhage. Microscopically, glioblastoma multiforme is characterized by regions of pseudopalisading necrosis, pleomorphic nuclei and cells, and microvascular proliferation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Resistance to activated protein C
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: Poor anticoagulant response to activated protein C. A plasma is termed 'APC resistant' when the addition of exogenous APC fails to prolong its clotting time in an activated partial thromboplastin time assay.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Abnormal natural killer cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: An anomaly of the natural killer cell, which is a lymphocyte that can spontaneously kill a variety of target cells without prior antigenic activation via germline encoded activation receptors. It also regulates immune responses via cytokine release and direct contact with other cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Abnormal natural killer cell physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: A functional anomaly of the natural killer cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Reduced natural killer cell activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: Reduced ability of the natural killer cell to function in the adaptive immune response.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.label: Craniofacial dystonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001217.definition: A form of focal dystonia affecting the face and especially the jaw that is induced by the act of speaking. It is an involuntary contraction of the masticatory muscles, resulting in dysarthria or dysphagia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Cystic medial necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: A disorder of large arteries, in particular the aorta, characterized by an accumulation of basophilic ground substance in the media with cyst-like lesions associated with degenerative changes of collagen, elastin and the vascular smooth muscle cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Entrapment neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: Malfunction of a peripheral nerve resulting from mechanical compression of the nerve roots from internal or external causes and leading to a conduction block or axonal loss.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that originates in the oropharnyx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Hyperplastic colonic polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: Presence of multiple hyperplastic polyps in the colon. Hyperplastic polyps are generally about 5 mm in size and show hyperplastic mucosal proliferation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Increased HDL cholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: An elevated concentration of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Constrictive median neuropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: Injury to the median nerve caused by its entrapment at the wrist as it traverses through the carpal tunnel. Clinically, constrictive median neuropathy is characterized by pain, paresthesia, and weakness in the median nerve distribution of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Entrapment neuropathy of the ulnar nerve at elbow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: An entrapment neuropathy of the ulnar nerve in the cubital tunnel (in the elbow) characterized by numbness in the ring and little fingers and weakness of the intrinsic muscles in the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Increased erythrocyte protoporphyrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: Concentration of protoporphyrins in erythrocytes above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Hyperemesis gravidarum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: Excessive vomiting in early pregnancy, leading to the loss of 5% or more of body weight.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.label: Hodgkin lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001218.definition: A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.label: T-cell lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.definition: A type of lymphoma that originates in T-cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.label: B-cell lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.definition: A type of lymphoma that originates in B-cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.label: Cutaneous T-cell lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.definition: A type of T-cell lymphoma that exhibits malignant infiltration of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.label: Anaplastic large-cell lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.definition: A type of T-cell lymphoma that is characterized by so-called hallmark cells with a pleomorphic appearance that express the CD30 antigen, are lobulated, and have indented nuclei.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.label: Episodic hemiplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.definition: Transient episodes of weakness of the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.label: Cheyne-Stokes respiration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.definition: An abnormal pattern of respiration characterized by cycles of respiration that are increasingly deeper then shallower with possible periods of apnea. Affected patients may display a 10 to 20 second episode of hypoventilation or apnea, followed by respiration of increased depth and frequency over the course of about one minute. The cycle repeats every 45 seconds to 3 minutes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.label: Insulinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.definition: A type of tumor of the pancreatic beta cells that secretes excess insulin and can result in hypoglycemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.label: Juvenile colonic polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.definition: The presence of more than 5 juvenile polyps of the colon. The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. The juvenile polyp has a spherical appearance and is microscopically characterized by overgrowth of an oedematous lamina propria with inflammatory cells and cystic glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.label: Cluster headache
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001219.definition: A type of headache characterized by repeated attacks of unilateral pain lasting 15 to 180 minutes and associated with local autonomic signs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.label: Abnormality of prothrombin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.definition: An anomaly of clotting factor II, which is known as prothrombin, a vitamin K-dependent proenzyme that functions in the blood coagulation cascade.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.label: Increased serum bile acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.definition: An increase in the concentration of bile acid in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.label: Onychomycosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.definition: A fungal infection of the toenails or fingernails that tends to cause the nails to thicken, discolor, disfigure, and split.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.label: Recurrent vulvovaginal candidiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.definition: Recurrent infection involving the vulva, vagina, and adjacent crural areas, whereby the causative agent belongs to the genus Candida.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.label: Globozoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.definition: Any structural anomaly of the acrosome resulting in a round sperm head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.label: Abnormal sperm motility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.definition: An anomaly of the mobility of ejaculated sperm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.label: Reduced sperm motility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.definition: An abnormal reduction in the mobility of ejaculated sperm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.label: Immotile sperm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.definition: A lack of mobility of ejaculated sperm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.label: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001220.definition: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) is a lethal myeloproliferative disease of young childhood characterized clinically by overproduction of myelomonocytic cells and by the in vitro phenotype of hematopoietic progenitor hypersensitivity to granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Abnormal renal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: Any structural anomaly of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Abnormal renal physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: An abnormal functionality of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Abnormal glomerular filtration rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: An abnormally increased or reduced amount of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Decreased glomerular filtration rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: An abnormal reduction in the volume of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Increased glomerular filtration rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: An abnormal rise in the volume of water filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Testicular microlithiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: The deposition of calcium phosphate microliths within the seminiferous tubules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Entrapment neuropathy of suprascapular nerve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: An entrapment neuropathy of the suprascapular nerve, presenting with shoulder weakness confined to the supraspinatus muscle (this muscle initiates shoulder abduction) or to the infraspinatus (this muscle externally rotates the arm), as well as with pain in the posterior part of the shoulder and upper periscapular region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Increased urinary porphobilinogen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: The concentration of porphobilinogen in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Alveolar soft part sarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: A type of soft tissue sarcoma with a histological appearance reminiscent of alveoli because of its reticulated fibrous stroma enclosing groups of sarcoma cells, which resemble epithelial cells and are enclosed in alveoli walled with connective tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.label: Erythema nodosum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001221.definition: An erythematous eruption commonly associated with drug reactions or infection and characterized by inflammatory nodules that are usually tender, multiple, and bilateral.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.label: Non-caseating epithelioid cell granulomatosis
