http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.definition: The presence of multiple epithelioid cell granulomas consist of highly differentiated mononuclear phagocytes (epithelioid cells and giant cells) and lymphocytes, not exhibiting caseation (a form of necrosis in which the tissue changes into a dry, amorphous mass said to resemble cheese).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.label: Pretibial blistering
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.definition: A type of blistering that affects the skin of the tibial region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.label: Arachnoid hemangiomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.definition: The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the arachnoid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.label: Splenic rupture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.definition: A breach of the capsule of the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.label: Circulating immune complexes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.definition: Persistence of immune complexes in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.label: Ovarian teratoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.definition: The presence of a teratoma in the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.label: Urethral stricture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.definition: Narrowing of the urethra associated with inflammation or scar tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.label: Tension-type headache
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.definition: A type of headache that last hours with continuous pain of mild or moderate intensity, bilateral location, a pressing/tightening (non-pulsating) quality and that is not aggravated by routine physical activity such as walking or climbing stairs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.label: CSF pleocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001222.definition: An increased white blood cell count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Rhegmatogenous retinal detachment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: A type of retinal detachment associated with a retinal tear, that is, with a break in the retina that allows fluid to pass from the vitreous space into the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Exudative retinal detachment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: A type of retinal detachment arising from damage to the outer blood-retinal barrier that allows fluid to access the subretinal space and separate the neurosensory retina from the retinal pigment epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Shortened QT interval
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: Decreased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Intramuscular hematoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: Blood clot formed within muscle tissue following leakage of blood into the tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Agranulocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: Marked decrease in the number of granulocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Drug-induced agranulocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: A type of agranulocytosis related to ingestion of a specific medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Elevated sweat chloride
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: An increased concentration of chloride in the sweat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Urocanic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: An increased concentration of urocanic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Increased circulating chylomicron concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: Increased plasma concentrations of chylomicrons, the large lipid droplet (up to 100 mm in diameter) of reprocessed lipid synthesized in epithelial cells of the small intestine and containing triacylglycerols, cholesterol esters, and several apolipoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.label: Atransferrinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001223.definition: Absence of transferrin, a protein that transports iron, in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.label: Increased intramyocellular lipid droplets
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.definition: An abnormal increase in intracellular lipid droplets In a muscle. The number and size of these drops can increase with somd disorders of lipid metabolism affecting muscle. See PMID 20691590 for histological images.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.label: Levator palpebrae superioris atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.definition: Atrophy of the levator palpebrae superioris, the extraocular muscle that elevates the superior eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.label: Superior rectus atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.definition: Atrophy of the superior rectus, the extraocular muscle whose primary function is to elevate the globe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.label: Abnormal reproductive system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.definition: A structural or developmental anomaly of any of the tissues involved in the genital system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.label: Abnormal sex determination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.definition: Anomaly of primary or secondary sexual development or characteristics.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.label: Sex reversal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.definition: Development of the reproductive system is inconsistent with the chromosomal sex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.label: Oculomotor nerve palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.definition: Reduced ability to control the movement of the eye associated with damage to the third cranial nerve (the oculomotor nerve).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.label: Prolonged PR interval
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.definition: Increased time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.label: Abnormal ST segment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001224.definition: An electrocardiographic anomaly of the ST segment, which is the segment that connects the QRS complex and the T wave. The ST segment normally has a duration of 80 to 120 ms, is flat and at the same level (isoelectric) as the PR and TP segment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: ST segment depression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located inferior to the isoelectric line.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: ST segment elevation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located superior to the isoelectric line.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: Abnormal respiratory system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: A structural anomaly of the respiratory system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: Abnormal respiratory epithelium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: Any structural anomaly of the pseudostratified ciliated epithelium that lines much of the conducting portion of the airway, including part of the nasal cavity and larynx, the trachea, and bronchi.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: Ewing sarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: A malignant tumor of the bone which always arises in the medullary tissue, occurring more often in cylindrical bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: Dynein arm defect of respiratory motile cilia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: An anomaly of the dynein arms of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: Absent outer dynein arms
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: Absence of the outer dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: Absent inner dynein arms
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: Absence of the inner dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated within the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: Abnormal axonemal organization of respiratory motile cilia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the axoneme, which is the cytoskeletal structure that forms the inner core of the motile cilium and displays a canonical 9+2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia studded with dynein arms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.label: Absent inner and outer dynein arms
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001225.definition: Complete absence of the dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, that is, absence of the inner and the outer dynein arms, which normally are situated inside and outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.label: Abnormal central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.definition: A structural anomaly of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.label: Abnormal respiratory motile cilium physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.definition: Any functional anomaly of the respiratory motile cilia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.label: Abnormal ciliary motility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.definition: Any anomaly of the normal motility of motile cilia. Evaluation of ciliary beat frequency and ciliary beat pattern requires high-speed videomicroscopy of freshly obtained ciliary biopsies that are maintained in culture media under controlled conditions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.label: Absent central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.definition: Absence of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.label: Ciliary dyskinesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.definition: A deviation from the normally well coordinated pattern of intracellular and intercellular synchrony of motile cilia. Dyskinetic cilia usually beat out of synchrony relative to neighboring cilia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.label: T-wave alternans
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.definition: A periodic beat-to-beat variation in the amplitude or shape of the T wave in an EKG.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.label: Absent respiratory ciliary axoneme radial spokes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.definition: Absence of the radial spokes of the axoneme of the respiratory cilium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.label: Myxoid liposarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.definition: A liposarcoma that contains myxomatous tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.label: Abnormal muscle glycogen content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001226.definition: Any anomaly in the amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: Decreased muscle glycogen content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: A decreased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: Episodic upper airway obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: Intermittent episodes of increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: J wave
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: The J wave is a positive convex deflection that occurs at the junction of the QRS complex and ST segment, the J-point.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: Increased carotid artery intimal medial thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: An increase in the combined thickness of the intima and media of the carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: Autosomal dominant inheritance with paternal imprinting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that is imprinted with paternal silencing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: Autosomal dominant inheritance with maternal imprinting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that is imprinted with maternal silencing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: Digital flexor tenosynovitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: Inflammation of the flexor digitorum tendon, often associated with the Kanavel signs: (i) finger held in slight flexion, (ii) fusiform swelling, (iii) tenderness along the flexor tendon sheath, and (iv) pain with passive extension of the digit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: Hypoglycinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: An abnormally reduced concentration of glycine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: Abnormal circulating serine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of serine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.label: Hyposerinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001227.definition: Reduced concentration of serine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Hepatic amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: A form of amyloidosis that affects the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Chylous ascites
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: Extravasation of chyle into the peritoneal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Morbilliform rash
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: An exanthema consisting of widespread pink-to-red macules (flat spots of 2-10 mm in diameter) or papules (red bumps) that blanch with pressure. The macules and papules may cluster and merge to form sheets over several days.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Small distal femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: Reduced size of the Distal epiphysis of femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Small proximal tibial epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: Reduced size of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Abnormal hypothalamus physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: An abnormal functionality of the hypothalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Abnormal hypothalamus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: Any structural anomaly of the hypothalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Hypothalamic luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: Decreased secretion of luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone by the hypothalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Neoplasm of head and neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the head and neck region with origin in the lip, oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, or larynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.label: Facial neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001228.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.label: Fusion of gums
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.definition: A congenital defect with an abnormal joining of the gums of the upper and lower jaw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.label: Abnormal genital pigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.definition: An abnormal pigmentation pattern of the external genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.label: Abnormal occipital bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.definition: Abnormality of the occipital bone of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.label: Slender middle phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.definition: Reduced diameter of the middle phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.label: Slender distal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.definition: Reduced diameter of the distal phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.label: Slender proximal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.definition: Reduced diameter of the proximal phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.label: Long middle phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.definition: Increased length of the middle phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.label: Long distal phalanx of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001229.definition: Increased length of the distal phalanx of finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Ureteral agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: Failure of the ureter to undergo development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Type II transferrin isoform profile
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type II congenital disorder of glycosylation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Herpes simplex encephalitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: Infection of the brain parenchyma with herpes simplex virus, resulting in inflammation of the brain parenchyma with neurologic dysfunction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Abnormal aortic arch morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: An anomaly of the arch of aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Hypoplastic aortic arch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: Underdevelopment of the arch of aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Coarctation of the descending aortic arch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized to the region of the descending trunk of arch of aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Abnormal rib ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: An anomaly of the process of rib bone formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Spatulate ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: Ribs that are increased in width and taper to the posterior ends.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Decreased circulating complement C9 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: Concentration of the complement component C9 in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.label: Cutaneous amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001230.definition: The presence of amyloid deposition in the superficial dermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.label: Abnormal monocyte count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.definition: An anomaly in the number of monocytes, which are myeloid mononuclear recirculating leukocyte that can act as a precursor of tissue macrophages, osteoclasts and some populations of tissue dendritic cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.label: Monocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.definition: An increased number of circulating monocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.label: Monocytopenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.definition: An decreased number of circulating monocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.label: Heberden's node
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.definition: Bony swelling of the distal interphalangeal joint (DIP) associated with the formation of osteophytes (calcific spurs) of the articular (joint) cartilage that are visible radiographically.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.label: Bouchard's node
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.definition: Bony swelling of the proximal interphalangeal joint (PIP) associated with the formation of osteophytes (calcific spurs) of the articular (joint) cartilage that are visible radiographically.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.label: Fibrous tissue neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.definition: Any neoplasm composed of fibrous tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.label: Sacroiliac arthritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.definition: Inflammation of the sacroiliac joint, generally accompanied by lower back pain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.label: Occipital neuralgia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.definition: A distinct type of headache characterized by piercing, throbbing, or electric-shock-like chronic pain in the upper neck, back of the head, and behind the ears, usually on one side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.label: Absent pigmentation of the abdomen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001231.definition: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.label: Absent pigmentation of the limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.definition: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the arms and legs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.label: D-2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.definition: An increased concentration of 2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.label: Sleep myoclonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.definition: Myoclonus that occurs during the initial phases of sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.label: Myeloid leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.definition: A leukemia that originates from a myeloid cell, that is the blood forming cells of the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.label: Chronic myelomonocytic leukemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.definition: A myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm which is characterized by persistent monocytosis, absence of a Philadelphia chromosome and BCR/ABL fusion gene, fewer than 20 percent blasts in the bone marrow and blood, myelodysplasia, and absence of PDGFRA or PDGFRB rearrangement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.label: Abnormal celiac artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.definition: An anomaly of the celiac artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.label: Cementoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.definition: An odontogenic tumor of the cementum of tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.label: Tufted angioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001232.definition: A vascular tumor of the skin and subcutaneous tissues and characterized by slow angiomatous proliferation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.label: Pyelonephritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.definition: An inflammation of the kidney involving the parenchyma of kidney, the renal pelvis and the kidney calices.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.label: Abnormal autonomic nervous system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.definition: A structural abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.label: Abnormal autonomic nervous system physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.definition: A functional abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.label: Abnormal sudomotor regulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.definition: An abnormal regulation of the sweat glands by the sympathetic nervous system associated with abnormal perspiration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.label: Extrahepatic cholestasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.definition: Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in large bile ducts outside the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.label: Abnormality of folate metabolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.definition: An abnormality of the metabolism of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.label: Abnormal homeostasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.definition: An anomaly in the processes involved in the maintenance of an internal equilibrium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.label: Abnormal energy expenditure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.definition: Any anomaly in the utilization of energy (calories).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.label: Increased resting energy expenditure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001233.definition: An increase in the number of calories used per unit time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.label: Decreased resting energy expenditure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.definition: A reduction in the number of calories used per unit time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.label: Microprolactinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.definition: A pituitary prolactin cell adenoma of less than 10 mm diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.label: Macroprolactinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.definition: A pituitary prolactin cell adenoma of more than 10 mm diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.label: Decreased circulating ferritin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.definition: Abnormally reduced concentration of ferritin, a ubiquitous intracellular protein that stores iron, in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.label: Abnormal glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.definition: An anomaly of a glycosylation process, i.e., a process involved in the covalent attachment of a glycosyl residue to a substrate molecule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.label: Abnormal protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.definition: An anomaly of a protein glycosylation process, i.e., of a protein modification process that results in the addition of a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit to a protein amino acid, e.g. the addition of glycan chains to proteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.label: Abnormal protein N-linked glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.definition: An anomaly of protein N-linked glycosylation, i.e., an abnormality of the protein glycosylation process in which a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit is added to a protein via a nitrogen atom in an amino acid residue in a protein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.label: Decreased galactosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.definition: A reduction in the amount of galactose residues of N-glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.label: Abnormal sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001234.definition: An anomaly of the addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Decreased sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: Decreased addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Increased sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: Increased addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Abnormal fucosylation of protein N-linked glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: An anomaly of the addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Decreased fucosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: Decreased addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Increased fucosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: Increased addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Abnormal mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: An anomaly of the addition of mannose to N-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Decreased mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: Reduced addition of mannose to N-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Increased mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: Increased addition of mannose to N-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Abnormal protein O-linked glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: An anomaly of protein O-linked glycosylation, i.e., of the process in which a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit is added to a protein via the hydroxyl group of a serine or threonine residue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.label: Abnormal fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001235.definition: An anomaly of the addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.label: Decreased fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.definition: A reduction of the addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.label: Increased fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.definition: Increased addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.label: Abnormal sialylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.definition: An anomaly of the addition of sialic acids to O-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.label: Decreased sialylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.definition: An reduced addition of sialic acids to O-linked glycans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.label: Decreased urinary potassium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.definition: A decreased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.label: Hypophosphaturia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.definition: An abnormally decreased phosphate concentration in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.label: Basilar invagination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.definition: Projection of the tip of the dens more than 5 mm above a line joining the hard palate to the posterior lip of the foramen magnum (Chamberlain's line) or the tip of the dens is greater than 7 mm above McGregor's line (the back of the hard palate to the lowest point of the occipital squama).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.label: Extra fontanelles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.definition: Bony defects situated along the cranial suture lines or at the junction of the bone plates of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.label: Flat face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001236.definition: Absence of concavity or convexity of the face when viewed in profile.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.label: Prominence of the zygomatic bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.definition: Large or prominent malar surface of the zygomatic bone of the skull, which is convex and forms the prominence of the 'cheek bones'.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.label: Hyperplasia of midface
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.definition: Abnormally anterior positioning of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased convexity of the face, or increased nasolabial angle. The midface includes the maxilla, the cheeks, the zygomas, and the infraorbital and perialar regions of the face

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.label: Abnormal eye morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.definition: A structural anomaly of the globe of the eye, or bulbus oculi.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.label: Abnormal eye physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.definition: A functional anomaly of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.label: Hemianopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.definition: Partial or complete loss of vision in one half of the visual field of one or both eyes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.label: Fatigue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.definition: A subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.label: Abnormal circulating enzyme concentration or activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001237.definition: Concentration or activity of an enzyme is above or below the limits of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Reduced carnitine O-palmitoyltransferase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: Reduced carnitine O-palmitoyltransferase level, leading to a reduced activity of the reaction: palmitoyl-CoA + L-carnitine = CoA + L-palmitoylcarnitine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Delayed self-feeding during toddler years
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: A delay in the development of skills required to feed oneself in the toddler period (between one and three years of age).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Left-to-right shunt
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the left side of the heart to the right.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Bidirectional shunt
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from both right side of the heart to the left and vice versa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Rhinitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: Inflammation of the nasal mucosa with nasal congestion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Camptodactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers or toes cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Absent hallux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: Aplasia of the hallux, that is, a development defect such that the big toe does not develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Bronchitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: Inflammation of the large airways in the lung including any part of the bronchi from the primary bronchi to the tertiary bronchi.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Acute bronchitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: Inflammation of the large airways of the lung with rapid onset and short course usually associated with cough, mucus production, shortness of breath, wheezing, and chest tightness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.label: Appendicular hypotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001238.definition: Muscular hypotonia of one or more limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Anal fissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: A small tear in the thin, moist tissue (mucosa) that lines the anus. It appears as a crack or slit in the mucous membrane of the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Hyporeflexia of upper limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the upper limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Jaw hyporeflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in jaw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: An allergy is an immune response or reaction to substances that are usually not harmful.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Iodine contrast allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: Allergy to iodine contrast media used in radiological studies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Seasonal allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: An allergy experienced at a particular time of year when trees or grasses pollinate and elicit an allergic reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Biliary dyskinesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: A motility disorder characterized by biliary colic in the absence of gallstones with a reduced gallbladder ejection fraction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Aortic atherosclerotic lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: The presence of atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques in the aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Peripheral edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: An abnormal accumulation of interstitial fluid in the soft tissues of the limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.label: Pressure ulcer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001239.definition: A type of ulcer that is caused when an area of skin is subject to pressure over a prolonged period of time, ranging in range in severity from patches of discolored skin to open wounds that expose the underlying bone or muscle. The most common sites are the sacrum, coccyx, heels and the hips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Abnormal circulating aldolase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: An abnormal concentration of aldolase in the serum. Aldolase is an enzyme responsible for converting fructose 1,6-bisphosphate into the triose phosphates dihydroxyacetone phosphate and glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Abnormal urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: A deviation from normal of the concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Increased urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: A greater than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Decreased urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: A lower than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Abnormal urine citrate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: A deviation from normal of the concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Hypocitraturia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: A lower than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Hypercitraturia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: A greater than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Scissor gait
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: A type of spastic paraparetic gait in which the muscle tone in the adductors is marked. It is characterized by hypertonia and flexion in the legs, hips and pelvis accompanied by extreme adduction leading to the knees and thighs hitting, or sometimes even crossing, in a scissors-like movement. The opposing muscles (abductors) become comparatively weak from lack of use.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Medullary nephrocalcinosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal medulla (innermost part of the kidney).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.label: Cortical nephrocalcinosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001240.definition: The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal cortex (the outer portion of the kidney between the renal capsule and the renal medulla).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Pure red cell aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: A type of anemia resulting from suppression of erythropoiesis with little or no abnormality of leukocyte or platelet production. Erythroblasts are virtually absent in bone marrow; however, leukocyte and platelet production show little or no reduction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Premature pubarche
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: The onset of growth of pubic hair at an earlier age than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Premature adrenarche
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: Onset of adrenarche at an earlier age than usual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Notched primary central incisor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: The presence of a V-shaped indentation (notch) in the primary central incisor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Duodenal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: Wasting or decrease in size of all or part of the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Abnormal blood gas level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: An abnormality of the partial pressure of oxygen or carbon dioxide in the arterial blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Hypercapnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Hypocapnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: Abnormally reduced blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Hypoxemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: An abnormally low level of blood oxygen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.label: Hyperoxemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001241.definition: An abnormally high level of blood oxygen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.label: Meconium stained amniotic fluid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.definition: Amniotic fluid containing the earliest stools of a mammalian infant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.label: Congenital absence of foreskin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.definition: Congenital lack of the skin of prepuce of penis, that is, of the double-layered fold of skin and mucous membrane that covers the glans penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.label: Colonic inertia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.definition: The inability of the colon to modify stool to an acceptable consistency and move the stool from the cecum to the rectosigmoid area at least once every three days.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.label: Chorioretinitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.definition: An inflammation of the choroid and retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.label: Stercoral ulcer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.definition: An ulcer of the colon due to pressure and irritation from retained fecal masses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.label: Optic disc drusen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.definition: Optic disc drusen are acellular, calcified deposits within the optic nerve head. Optic disc drusen are congenital and developmental anomalies of the optic nerve head, representing hyaline-containing bodies that, over time, appear as elevated, lumpy irregularities on the anterior portion of the optic nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.label: Increased femoral anteversion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.definition: An increased degree of femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cerebral white matter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001242.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Cerebral white matter hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: Underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Episodic fatigue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: Intermittent and recurrent bouts of a subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Chronic fatigue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: Subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation that persists for six months or longer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Abnormal social behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: An abnormality of actions or reactions of a person taking place during interactions with others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Delayed early-childhood social milestone development
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: A failure to meet one or more age-related milestones of social behavior.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Ventral shortening of foreskin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: Reduction in length of the ventral (lower) skin of prepuce of penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Nonocclusive coronary artery atherosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: Coronary disease that has not progressed to the point of causing significant occlusion (blockage) of the coronary arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Abnormal gallbladder morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: A structural anomaly of the gallbladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Abnormal gallbladder physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: A functional anomaly of the gallbladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.label: Abnormal biliary tract physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001243.definition: A functional abnormality of the biliary tree.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.label: Abnormal biliary tract morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.definition: A structural abnormality of the biliary tree.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.label: Sphincter of Oddi dyskinesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.definition: Reduced motility through the sphincter of Oddi, resulting in impedance of bile and pancreatic juice flow from the common bile duct into the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.label: Gallbladder dyskinesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.definition: Reduced motility of the gallbladder with reduced emptying fraction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.label: Abnormal brain morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.definition: A structural abnormality of the brain, which has as its parts the forebrain, midbrain, and hindbrain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.label: Brain atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of brain tissue that was once present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.label: Decreased CSF 5-methyltetrahydrofolate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.definition: A reduced concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate(2-) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). 5-methyltetrahydrofolate is the active folate metabolite.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.label: Abnormal myelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.definition: Any anomaly in the process by which myelin sheaths are formed and maintained around neurons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.label: Sacroiliac joint synovitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001244.definition: Inflammation of the synovial membrane of the sacroiliac joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.label: Chronic constipation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.definition: Constipation for longer than three months with fewer than 3 bowel movements per week, straining, lumpy or hard stools, and a sensation of anorectal obstruction or incomplete defecation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.label: Acute constipation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.definition: Constipation of sudden onset and lasting for less than three months.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.label: Restless legs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.definition: Restless Leg Syndrome (RLS) is a condition characterized by an uncomfortable and restless sensation in the legs that occurs after going to bed, often leading to insomnia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.label: Bilateral wrist flexion contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.definition: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on the right and left sides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.label: Unilateral wrist flexion contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.definition: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on one side only.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.label: Medial arterial calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.label: Medial calcification of medium-sized arteries
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of medium-sized (muscular or distributive) arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.label: Medial calcification of small arteries
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of small arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.label: Hypnic headache
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001245.definition: A headache disorder that occurs exclusively at night, waking the affected individual from sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Dysmorphic inferior cerebellar vermis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: A structural anomaly of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Bacteriuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: The presence of bacteria in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Chin myoclonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: Involuntary and irregular twitches of the chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Elevated transferrin saturation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: An above normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Decreased transferrin saturation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: A below normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Elevated hepatic iron concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: An increased level of iron in liver tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Chronic respiratory acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: Longstanding impairment in ventilation such that the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) is elevated above the upper limit of the reference range (more than 45 mm Hg), with a normal or near-normal pH secondary to renal compensation and an elevated serum bicarbonate levels (more than30 mEq/L).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Acute respiratory acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: Sudden onset of impairment in ventilation such that the removal of carbon dioxide by the respiratory system is less than the production of carbon dioxide in the tissues, leading to an elevation of the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) above the normal limits (more than 45 mm Hg) with an accompanying acidemia (pH less than 7.35).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Chronic acidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: Longstanding abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.label: Infantile spasms
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001246.definition: Infantile spasms represent a subset of "epileptic spasms". Infantile Spasms are epileptic spasms starting in the first year of life (infancy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.label: Setting-sun eye phenomenon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.definition: An ophthalmologic sign in young children resulting from upward-gaze paresis. In this condition, the eyes appear driven downward, the sclera may be seen between the upper eyelid and the iris, and part of the lower pupil may be covered by the lower eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.label: Thick vermilion border
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.definition: Increased width of the skin of vermilion border region of upper lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.label: Eclabion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.definition: A turning outward of the lip or lips, that is, eversion of the lips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.label: Carotid artery occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.definition: Complete obstruction of a carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.label: Decreased circulating level of specific antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.definition: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against a specific antigen or microorganism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.label: Decreased specific pneumococcal antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.definition: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against pneumococci.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.label: Vocal tremor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.definition: A wavering, unsteady voice that reflects involuntary and approximately sinusoidal oscillation of motor unit firings of laryngeal muscles. Vocal tremor results in low frequency modulations of voice frequency or amplitude and intermittent voice instability.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.label: Temporomandibular joint ankylosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.definition: Bony fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.label: Temporomandibular joint crepitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001247.definition: Noises from the temporomandibular joint during mandibular movement (e.g., chewing). Temporomandibular joint crepitus is often described as a clicking, popping, grating sound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.label: Cerebral venous angioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.definition: A congenital malformation of veins which drain normal brain characterized by a caput medusae or an umbrellalike convergence of multiple venules on a single, or occasionally multiple, enlarged parenchymal or medullary vein, like the trunk of a tree or the shank of an umbrella. This dilated terminal vein penetrates the cortex to drain either (a) superficially to cortical veins or sinuses, (b) deeply to subependymal veins of the lateral ventricle and then into the galenic system, (c) to the fourth ventricle and then to the pontomesencephalic vein, or (d) to the precentral cerebellar vein and into the galenic system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.label: Frontal venous angioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.definition: A venous angioma of the frontal lobe of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.label: Abnormal alpha granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.definition: Defective structure, size or content of alpha granules, platelet organelles that contain several growth factors destined for release during platelet activation at sites of vessel wall injury.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.label: Abnormal dense granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.definition: Defective structure, size or content of dense granules, platelet organelles that contain granules proaggregatory factors such as adenosine diphosphate (ADP), adenosine triphosphate (ATP), ionized calcium, histamine and serotonin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.label: Abnormal surface-connected open canalicular system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.definition: An anomaly of the invaginations of the surface membrane that form the open canalicular system (OCS). The OCS serve as the pathway for transport of substances into the cells and as conduits for the discharge of alpha granule products secreted during the platelet release reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.label: Cerebellopontine angle arachnoid cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.definition: An arachnoid cyst located at the margin of the cerebellum and pons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.label: Intraventricular arachnoid cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.definition: An arachnoid cyst located within the ventricular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.label: Suprasellar arachnoid cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001248.definition: An arachnoid cyst that progressively enlarges from an abnormality in the membrane of Liliequist or in the interpeduncular cistern, and typically, expands from the prepontine space, displacing the floor of the third ventricle upwards, the pituitary stalk and optic chiasm upwards and forwards, and the mammillary bodies upwards and backwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.label: Abnormal dense tubular system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.definition: An anomaly of the intracellular membrane complexes known as the dense tubular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.label: Cerebral artery stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.definition: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of a cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.label: Middle cerebral artery stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.definition: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the middle cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.label: Anterior cerebral artery stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.definition: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the anterior cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.label: Posterior cerebral artery stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.definition: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of the posterior cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.label: Reduced maximal inspiratory pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.definition: A decrease in the maximum amount of negative pressure a person can generate during an inhalation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.label: Reduced maximal expiratory pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.definition: A decrease in the maximum amount of pressure of expired air achieved by a person after a full inspiration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.label: Nuchal cord
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.definition: A complication of pregnancy and delivery in which the umbilical cord wraps around the fetal neck once or multiple times.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.label: Descending aortic dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001249.definition: A separation of the layers within the wall of the descending aorta. Tears in the intimal layer result in the propagation of dissection (proximally or distally) secondary to blood entering the intima-media space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Verrucous papule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: A wartlike (with multiple small elevated projections) papule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Abnormal brainstem white matter morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: An anomaly of the white matter of brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Abnormality of the internal capsule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: An anomaly of the internal capsule, which is an area of white matter in the brain that separates the caudate nucleus and the thalamus from the putamen and the globus pallidus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Abnormal pituitary gland morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: An anomaly of the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Abnormal size of pituitary gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: A deviation from the normal size of the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Enlarged pituitary gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: An abnormally increased size of the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Small pituitary gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: An abnormally decreased size of the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Weakness of orbicularis oculi muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: Reduced strength of the orbicularis oculi, the circumorbital muscle in the face that closes the eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Metamorphopsia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: A visual anomaly in which images appear distorted. A grid of straight lines appears wavy and parts of the grid may appear blank.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.label: Reduced thyroxin-binding globulin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001250.definition: An abnormally decreased amount of thyroxin-binding globulin (TBG) in blood. TBG is responsible for carrying the thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and 3,5,3'-triiodothyronine (T3) in the bloodstream.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Extra-axial cerebrospinal fluid accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: An increased amount of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the subarachnoid space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Temporal optic disc pallor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: A pale yellow discoloration of the temporal (lateral) portion of the optic disc.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Diffuse optic disc pallor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: A pale yellow discoloration of the entire optic disc.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Upper limb pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Lower limb pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Hip flexor weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: Reduced ability to flex the femur, that is, to pull the knee upward.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: An extreme form of tetralogy of Fallot characterized by absence of flow from the right ventricle to the pulmonary arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Reduced catalase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: An abnormally decreased amount of catalase level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Abnormal circle of Willis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: An anomaly of the circle of Willis, also known as the cerebral arterial circle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.label: Hypoplastic posterior communicating artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001251.definition: A developmental anomnaly characterized by underdevelopment of the posterior communicating artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Dilation of Virchow-Robin spaces
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: Increased dimensions of the Virchow-Robin spaces (also known as perivascular spaces), which surround the walls of vessels as they course from the subarachnoid space through the brain parenchyma. Perivascular spaces are commonly microscopic, and not visible on conventional neuroimaging. This term refers to an increase of size of these spaces such that they are visible on neuroimaging (usually magnetic resonance imaging). The dilatations are regular cavities that always contain a patent artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Optic nerve aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: Congenital absence of the optic nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Spider hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: A form of telangiectasis characterized by a central elevated red dot the size of a pinhead, representing an arteriole, with numerous small blood vessels that radiate out thereby resembling the legs of a spider. Characteristically, compression of the central arteriole causes the entire lesion to blanch, and the lesion quickly refills once the compression is released.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Oral aversion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: Reluctance or refusal of a child to be breastfed or eat, manifested as gagging, vomiting, turning head away from food, or avoidance of sensation in or around the mouth (i.e. toothbrushing or face-washing).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Abnormal platelet shape
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: A deviation from the normal discoid platelet shape.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Abnormal alpha granule distribution
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: An anomalous location and arrangement of platelet alpha granules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Absence of alpha granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: A lack of platelet alpha granules. This typically results in the grey appearance of platelets in giemsa stained blood smears.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Abnormal alpha granule content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain hemostatic proteins such as fibrinogen, von Willebrand factor, and growth factors such as platelet-derived growth factor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Abnormal number of alpha granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: A deviation from the normal count of alpha granules per thrombocyte.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.label: Abnormal dense granule content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001252.definition: A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain adenosine triphosphate (ATP), adenosine diphosphate (ADP), serotonin, calcium, and pyrophosphate, which are secreted when platelets are activated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Abnormal number of dense granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: A deviation from the normal count of dense granules per thrombocyte.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: An unpleasant sensory and emotional experience associated with actual or potential tissue damage, or described in terms of such damage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Chronic pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: Persistent pain, usually defined as pain that has lasted longer than 3 to 6 months.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Allodynia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: Pain due to a stimulus that does not normally provoke pain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Dysesthesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: Painful sensations elicited by a nonpainful cutaneous stimulus such as a light touch or gentle stroking over affected areas of the body. Sometimes referred to as hyperpathia or hyperalgesia. Often perceived as an intense burning, dyesthesias may outlast the stimulus by several seconds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Abnormal synaptic transmission
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: An anomaly in the communication from a neuron to a target across a synapse. This is a four step process, comprising (i) synthesis and storage of neurotransmitters; (ii) neurotransmitter release; (iii) activation of postsynaptic receptors by the neurotransmitter; and (iv) inactivation of the neurotransmitter. Thus, this term is defined as an anomaly of neurotransmitter metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Maternal anticardiolipin antibody positive
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: The presence of circulating autoantibodies to anticardiolipin in the mother.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Food intolerance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: A detrimental reaction to a food, beverage, food additive, or compound found in foods that produces symptoms in one or more body organs and systems that is not mediated by an immune reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Gluten intolerance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: A detrimental reaction to the presence of gluten in food, which may include abdominal pain, fatigue, headaches and paresthesia, or celiac disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.label: Non-Hodgkin lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001253.definition: A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by the absence of multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.label: Axillary epidermoid cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.definition: An epidermoid cyst in the armpit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.label: Cephalohematoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.definition: Hemorrhage between the skull and periosteum of a newborn resulting from rupture of blood vessels that cross the periosteum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.label: Hemosiderinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.definition: The presence of hemosiderin in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.label: Elevated circulating aldolase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.definition: Concentration of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.label: Reduced circulating aldolase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.definition: Concentration of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.label: Skewed maternal X inactivation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.definition: A deviation from equal (50%) inactivation of each parental X chromosome in maternal cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.label: Abnormal involuntary eye movements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.definition: Anomalous movements of the eyes that occur without the subject wanting them to happen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.label: Fatty replacement of skeletal muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.definition: Muscle fibers degeneration resulting in fatty replacement of skeletal muscle fibers

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.label: Conjunctival lipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001254.definition: A lipoma (a benign tumor composed of adipose tissue) located in the conjunctiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.label: Colonic varices
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.definition: The presence of varices (enlarged and convoluted blood vessels) in the colon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.label: Absent neutrophil specific granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.definition: Lack of specific granules in neutrophils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.label: Increased neutrophil nuclear projections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.definition: Presence of an elevated number of projections from nuclei of neutrophils. These projections can have the shape of hooks, tags, or clubs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.label: Hypoplastic thumbnail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.definition: A thumbnail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped thumb nail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.label: Hyperbeta-alaninemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.definition: Increased concentration of beta-alanine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.label: EEG with centrotemporal focal spike waves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the centrotemporal region of the brain (also known as the central sulcus), i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.label: Abnormal T3/T4 ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.definition: A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that deviates from normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.label: Increased T3/T4 ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001255.definition: A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is higher than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Decreased T3/T4 ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is lower than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Unicuspid aortic valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: The presence of an aortic valve with one instead of the normal three cusps (flaps).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the hand, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the foot, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in tibia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the tibia, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in fibula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the fibula, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in radius
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the radius, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in ulna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the ulna, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Lower eyelid edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: Edema in the region of the Lower eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.label: Delayed menarche
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001256.definition: First period after the age of 15 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Synovial sarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: A type of mesenchymal tissue cell tumor that exhibits epithelial differentiation, which most frequently arises in the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Ureter fissus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: A partial duplication of the ureter where the duplicated ureters fuse to a single ureter before their insertion into the bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Ureter duplex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: A complete duplication of the ureter, where the duplicated ureters have separate insertions into the bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Global proximal tubulopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: A type of proximal renal tubulopathy characterized by resorption defects leading to glycosuria, aminoaciduria, tubular proteinuria, renal hypophosphatemia, and urate tubular hyporeabsorption with bicarbonate loss and resulting acidosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Mesangial hypercellularity
