http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: Increased numbers of mesangial cells per glomerulus, defined as more than 3 nuclei fully surrounded by matrix in one or more mesangial areas, not including perihilar region, on a standard 3-micron-thick tissue section, best evaluated on periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) stain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Abnormal nephron morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: A structural anomaly of the nephron.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Glomerular C3 deposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: The presence of complement 3 deposits in the glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Thin glomerular basement membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: Decreased thickness of the glomerular basement membrane (GBM), measured from endothelial to visceral epithelial plasma membrane and mainly attributable to a decrease in thickness of the lamina densa, generally to an overall thickness more than 2 standard deviations less than that of the normal mean GBM thickness for health age- and sex matched individuals. May be focal or diffuse, although the term thin GBMs generally implies thinning of over 50% of GBMs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Membranous nephropathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: A type of glomerulonephropathy characterized by thickening of the basement membrane and deposition of immune complexes in the subepithelial space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.label: Minimal change glomerulonephritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001257.definition: The presence of minimal changes visible by light microscopy but flattened and fused podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy in a person with nephrotic range proteinuria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.label: Calcium phosphate nephrolithiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.definition: The presence of calcium- and phosphate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.label: Simple renal cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.definition: An isolated cyst of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.label: Bilateral renal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.definition: A bilateral form of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.label: Unilateral renal hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.definition: One sided hypoplasia of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.label: Bilateral renal hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.definition: Two sided hypoplasia of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.label: Bilateral renal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.definition: A two-sided form of atrophy of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.label: Macroscopic hematuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.definition: Hematuria that is visible upon inspection of the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.label: Steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.definition: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication, defined as persistent proteinuria despite 60mg/m2 or 2mg/kg for 8 weeks, after insuring no infection or non-adherence to medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.label: Multidrug-resistant nephrotic syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001258.definition: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to any immunosuppresive treatment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Abnormal urine output
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: An abnormal amount of urine production.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Abnormal urinary electrolyte concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: An abnormality in the concentration of electrolytes in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Albuminuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: Increased concentration of albumin in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Nephrotic range proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: Severely increased amount of excretion of protein in the urine, defined as 3.5 grams per day or more in adults and 40 mg per meter-squared body surface area per hour in children.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Moderate albuminuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: The presence of moderately increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as and albumin-creatinine ratio (ACR) of 30 to 299 mg/gm (3.4 to 34 mg/mmol).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Mild proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: Mildly increased levels of protein in the urine (150-500 mg per day in adults).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Moderate proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: Moderately increased levels of protein in the urine (500-1000 mg per day in adults).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Heavy proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: Severely increased levels of protein in the urine (1000-3000 mg per day in adults).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Abnormal urine potassium concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: An abnormal concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.label: Abnormal urine phosphate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001259.definition: An abnormal phosphate concentration in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Abnormal urine chloride concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: An abnormal concentration of chloride in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Hypochloriduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: An decreased concentration of chloride in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Renal chloride wasting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: High urine chloride in the presence of hypochloridemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Abnormal urine sodium concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: An abnormal concentration of sodium in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Hyponatriuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: An abnormally decreased sodium concentration in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Hypernatriuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: An increased concentration of sodium(1+) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Renal sodium wasting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the urine in the presence of hyponatremia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Abnormal urine magnesium concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: An abnormal concentration of magnesium the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Hypermagnesiuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: An increased concentration of magnesium the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.label: Hypomagnesiuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001260.definition: An decreased concentration of magnesium the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.label: Abnormality of urinary uric acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.definition: Abnormal amount of urate in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.label: Abnormal urinary sulfate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.definition: Abnormal concentration of sulfate in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.label: Increased urinary sulfate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.definition: Elevated concentration of SO4(2-), i.e., sulfate, in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.label: Abnormal urine cytology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.definition: An anomalous finding in the examination of the urine for cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.label: Cylindruria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.definition: The presence of renal casts (cylindrical, cigar-shaped structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.label: Leukocyte cylindruria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.definition: Presence of leukocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.label: Erythrocyte cylindruria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.definition: Presence of erythrocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.label: Urachal cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.definition: A cyst located along the allantois canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.label: Multiple bladder diverticula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001261.definition: Presence of a many diverticula (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Cloacal abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: A developmental anomaly associated with the failure of rectum, vagina, and bladder to separate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Persistent cloaca
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: Developmental anomaly in which the vagina, bladder, and rectum fuse resulting in a common channel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Chronic kidney disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: Functional anomaly of the kidney persisting for at least three months.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Stage 1 chronic kidney disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: A type of chronic kidney disease with normal or increased glomerular filtration rate (GFR at least 90 mL/min/1.73 m2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Stage 2 chronic kidney disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: A type of chronic kidney disease with mildly reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73 m2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Stage 3 chronic kidney disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: A type of chronic kidney disease with moderately reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Stage 4 chronic kidney disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: A type of chronic kidney disease with severely reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 15-29 mL/min/1.73 m2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Pseudoexfoliation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: Deposition of fibrillar material that can be found on all anterior segment structures bathed by aqueous humor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Abnormal suspensory ligament of lens morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: An anomaly of the suspensory ligament of lens, also known as the ciliary zonule. These ligaments represent a series of fibers connecting the ciliary body and lens of the eye, holding the lens in place.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.label: Phakodonesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001262.definition: Tremulousness (trembling) of the lens of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.label: Abnormal trabecular meshwork morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.definition: An anomaly of the trabecular meshwork, which is the porelike structure surrounding the entire circumference of the anterior chamber at the base of the cornea and near the ciliary body. The trabecular mesh work is responsible for draining the aqueous humor into the canal of Schlemm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.label: Pigment deposition in the trabecular meshwork
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.definition: Accumulation of abnormal amounts of pigment within the trabecular meshwork.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.label: Abnormal intraocular pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.definition: An anomaly in the amount of force per unit area exerted by the intraocular fluid within the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.label: Asymmetry of intraocular pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.definition: A difference in the amount of intraocular pressure in the right and left eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.label: Iris pigment dispersion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.definition: Shedding of the pigment granules that normally adhere to the back of the iris into the aqueous humor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.label: Iris hypoperfusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.definition: Reduction in the amount of blood flow to the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.label: Renal calcium wasting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.definition: High urine calcium in the presence of hypocalcemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.label: Abnormal nervous system physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.definition: A functional anomaly of the nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.label: Abnormal nervous system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001263.definition: A structural anomaly of the nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Abnormality of intracranial pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: A deviation from the norm of the intracranial pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Decreased intracranial pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: A reduction of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Cerebellar agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: Cerebellar agenesis is defined by the near complete absence of cerebellar tissue with only remnants of the anterior vermis, flocculus, and/or middle cerebellar peduncles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Foveal hypopigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: Decreased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Increased caudate lactate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: An elevated concentration of lactate in the caudate nucleus. This finding can be elicited by magnetic resonance spectroscopy imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Enlarged peripheral nerve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: Increase in size of a peripheral nerve. This finding can be appreciated by palpation along the axis of the nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Retractile testis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: A testis that is located at the upper scrotum or lower inguinal canal and that can be made to descend completely into the scrotum without resistance by manual reduction but returns to its original position by the cremasteric reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Abnormal inflammatory response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: Any anomaly of the inflammatory response, a response to injury or infection characterized by local vasodilation, extravasation of plasma into intercellular spaces and accumulation of white blood cells and macrophages.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Decreased inflammatory response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: An abnormal reduction in the inflammatory response to injury or infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.label: Increased inflammatory response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001264.definition: A abnormal increase in the inflammatory response to injury or infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.label: Perisylvian polymicrogyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.definition: Polymicrogyria (an excessive number of small gyri or convolutions) that is maximal in perisylvian regions (the regions that surround the Sylvian fissures), which may be symmetric or asymmetric and may extend beyond perisylvian regions. The Sylvian fissures often extend posteriorly and superiorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.label: Abasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.definition: A severe form of gait ataxia such that an affected person cannot walk at all.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.label: Status asthmaticus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.definition: Severe asthma unresponsive to repeated courses of beta-agonist therapy such as inhaled albuterol, levalbuterol, or subcutaneous epinephrine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.label: Abnormal CSF dopamine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.definition: Abnormal concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.label: Elevated CSF dopamine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.definition: Increased concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.label: Reduced CSF dopamine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.definition: Decreased concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.label: Abnormal brain positron emission tomography
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.definition: A functional brain anomaly detectable by positron emission tomography (PET). PET scanning is a method for functional brain imaging, and its measurements reflect the amount of brain activity in the various regions of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.label: Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.definition: An anomaly detectable in [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) positron emission tomography (PET) brain scans. Glucose uptake measured with FDG-PET is a marker of neuronal metabolic activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.label: Prefrontal hypometabolism in FDG PET
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001265.definition: Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the prefrontal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.label: Thalamic hypometabolism in FDG PET
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.definition: Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the thalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.label: Hypothalamic hypometabolism in FDG PET
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.definition: Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the hypothalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.label: Parietal hypometabolism in FDG PET
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.definition: Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the parietal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.label: Mildly reduced left ventricular ejection fraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.definition: A small reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at least 50 percent, and a mild reduction is defined as 40-49 percent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.label: Reduced left ventricular ejection fraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.definition: A diminution of the volumetric fraction of blood pumped out of the ventricle with each cardiac cycle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.label: Moderately reduced left ventricular ejection fraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.definition: A medium reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle, defined as a left ventricular ejection fraction of 30-39 percent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.label: Severely reduced left ventricular ejection fraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.definition: A large reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at over 50 percent, and a severe reduction is defined as less than 30 percent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.label: Regional left ventricular wall motion abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.definition: An abnormal motion of a segment of the left ventricle during the cardiac cycle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.label: Carotid sinus syncope
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001266.definition: An exaggerated response to carotid sinus baroreceptor stimulation resulting in syncope from transient diminished cerebral perfusion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.label: Orthostatic syncope
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.definition: Syncope following a quick change in position from lying down to standing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.label: Abulia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.definition: Abulia is a severe form of apathy, characterized by difficulty in initiating and sustaining spontaneous movements, as well as reductions in emotional responsiveness, spontaneous speech, and social interaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.label: Akinetic mutism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.definition: Akinetic mutism is essentially characterized by a total absence of spontaneous behavior and speech occurring in the presence of preserved visual tracking.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.label: Aplasia of the upper vagina
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.definition: A failure to develop of the upper vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.label: Aplasia of the lower vagina
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.definition: A failure to develop of the lower part of the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.label: Iron accumulation in brain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.definition: An abnormal build up of iron (Fe) in brain tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.label: Copper accumulation in brain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.definition: An anomalous build up of copper (Cu) in the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.label: obsolete Iron accumulation in globus pallidus
Iron accumulation in substantia nigra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.definition: An anomalous build up of iron (Fe) in the substantia nigra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.label: Widened interpedicular distance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001267.definition: An increase in the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Abnormality of the pineal gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: An anomaly of the pineal gland,a small endocrine gland in the brain that produces melatonin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Abnormal pineal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: A structural abnormality of the pineal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Pineal gland calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: Accumulation of calcium salts in the pineal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Pineal cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: A glial uniloculated or multiloculated fluid-filled sac that either reside within or completely replace the pineal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Abnormal pineal volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: An abnormal increase or decrease in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Decreased pineal volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: An abnormal reduction in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Increased pineal volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: An abnormal elevation in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Agenesis of pineal gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: Failure to develop of the pineal gland, defined clinically as the absence of the pineal gland with no indication of the pineal gland even having been present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Abnormality of pineal physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: A functional abnormality of the pineal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.label: Abnormal pineal melatonin secretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001268.definition: An anomaly in the amount or timing of melatonin secretion by the pineal gland. Note that melatonin is also synthesized by multiple tissues outside of the pineal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: T2 hypointense thalamus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting the entire thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: Focal T2 hypointense thalamic lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: Focal T2 hyperintense thalamic lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: Abnormal thalamic size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: Deviation from the normal range of size of the thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: Enlarged thalamic volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: An increase in the quantity of space occupied by the thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: Decreased thalamic volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: A reduction in the quantity of space occupied by the thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: Abnormal thalamic MRI signal intensity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: Small basal ganglia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: Decreased size of the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: Cerebellar gliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.label: Anomaly of lower limb diaphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001269.definition: A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Abnormal large intestine physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: A functional anomaly of the large intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Bowel urgency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: A sudden, irresistible need to have a bowel movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Tenesmus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: A repeated, painful urge to defecate without excreting stool.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Abnormal subarachnoid space morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: Abnormality in the space in the meninges beneath the arachnoid membrane and above the pia mater that contains the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Widened subarachnoid space
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Abnormal metabolic brain imaging by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: An anomaly of metabolism in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Elevated brain choline level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: An increase in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Elevated brain lactate level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: An increase in the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Reduced brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: A decrease in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.label: Abnormal brain choline/creatine ratio by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001270.definition: A deviation from normal in the ratio of choline to creatine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Ingrown nail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: Excessive growth of a nail laterally into the nail fold.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Delayed ossification of vertebral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Mild hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: The presence of a mild form of hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Moderate hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: The presence of a moderate form of hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Severe hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: A severe form of hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Profound hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: A profound (essentially complete) form of hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Moderate conductive hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: The presence of a moderate form of conductive hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Severe conductive hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: A severe form of conductive hearing impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Abnormal gastrointestinal tract morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: Abnormal structure of the gastrointestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.label: Functional abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001271.definition: Abnormal functionality of the gastrointestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Neoplasm of the nose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: Tumor (An abnormal mass of tissue resulting from abnormally dividing cells) of the nasal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Venous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: A vascular malformation resulting from a developmental error of venous tissue composed of dysmorphic channels lined by flattened endothelium and exhibiting slow turnover. A venous malformation may present as a blue patch on the skin ranging to a soft blue mass. Venous malformations are easily compressible and usually swell in thewhen venous pressure increases (e.g., when held in a dependent position or when a child cries). They may be relatively localized or quite extensive within an anatomic region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Heart block
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: Impaired conduction of cardiac impulse occurring anywhere along the conduction pathway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Sinoatrial block
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: Disturbance in the atrial activation that is caused by transient failure of impulse conduction from the sinoatrial node to the cardiac atria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Upper eyelid edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: Edema in the region of the upper eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Cutaneous syndactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal or metatarsophalangeal joint of the adjacent digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Episodic hypokalemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood occurring periodically with a return to normal between the episodes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Thoracic aortic aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the thoracic aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Fusiform descending thoracic aortic aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: A concentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta that involves the full circumference of the vessel wall

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.label: Saccular descending thoracic aortic aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001272.definition: An eccentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta that involves only a portion of the circumference of the vessel wall

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.label: Aglossia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.definition: Absence of the tongue owing to a developmental abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.label: Ectopic anterior pituitary gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.definition: Abnormal anatomic location of the anterior pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.label: Anorectal anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.definition: An abnormality of the anus or rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.label: Macule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.definition: A flat, distinct, discolored area of skin less than 1 cm wide that does not involve any change in the thickness or texture of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.label: Ketotic hypoglycemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.definition: Low blood glucose is accompanied by elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.label: Cough
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.definition: A sudden, audible expulsion of air from the lungs through a partially closed glottis, preceded by inhalation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.label: Profound global developmental delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.definition: A profound delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.label: Small intestinal polyp
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.definition: A discrete abnormal tissue mass that protrudes into the lumen of the small intestine and is attached to the intestinal wall either by a stalk, pedunculus, or a broad base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.label: Agenesis of the small intestine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001273.definition: Failure to develop of the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Papilloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: A tumor of the skin or mucous membrane with finger-like projections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Unilateral cryptorchidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: Absence of a testis from the scrotum on one side owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Thin fingernail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: Fingernail that appears thin when viewed on end.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Abdominal obesity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: Excessive fat around the stomach and abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Femoral aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: Failure of the femur to develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Short palpebral fissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: Distance between the medial and lateral canthi is more than 2 SD below the mean for age (objective); or, apparently reduced length of the palpebral fissures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Thin toenail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: Toenail that appears thin when viewed on end.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Abnormal brainstem MRI signal intensity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Focal T2 hyperintense brainstem lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.label: Focal T2 hypointense brainstem lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001274.definition: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: T2 hypointense brainstem
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting the entire brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: Abnormal basal ganglia MRI signal intensity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: Focal T2 hypointense basal ganglia lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: T2 hypointense basal ganglia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting all of the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: CNS hypermyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: Increased amount of myelin in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: Enlarged brainstem
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: Abnormal increase in size of the brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: CSF polymorphonuclear pleocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: An increased polymorphonuclear cell count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: Abnormal neuron morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: A structural anomaly of a neuron. Neurons are electrically excitable cells that transmit signals throughout the body. Neurons employ both electrical and chemical components in the transmission of information. Neurons are connected to other neurons at synapses and connected to effector organs or cells at neuroeffector junctions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: Neurodevelopmental delay
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: Neurodevelopmental delay (NDD) refers to delays in the maturation of the brain and central nervous system; infants and young children with NDD may experience delays in the development of one or more skills including gross motor abilities, fine-motor coordination, language abilities and ability to solve increasingly complex problems.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.label: Neurodevelopmental abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001275.definition: A deviation from normal of the neurological development of a child, which may include any or all of the aspects of the development of personal, social, gross or fine motor, and cognitive abilities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.label: Reduced social reciprocity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.definition: A reduced ability to participate in the back-and-forth flow of social interaction appropriate to culture and developmental level, which is normally characterized by an influence of the behavior of one person on the behavior of another person.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.label: Absent mastoid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.definition: A developmental anomaly in which the mastoid process fails to form and is thus found to be congenitally absent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.label: Cerebral white matter atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.definition: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebral white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.label: Paroxysmal dyspnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.definition: A sudden attack of dyspnea that occurs while the affected person is at rest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.label: Orthopnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.definition: A sensation of breathlessness in the recumbent position, relieved by sitting or standing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.label: Widened cerebellar subarachnoid space
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.definition: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.label: Widened cerebral subarachnoid space
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.definition: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.label: Abnormal placental size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.definition: A deviation from normal size of the placenta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.label: Abnormal arm span
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001276.definition: A deviation from normal of the length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle)

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Reduced arm span
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: Decreased length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Increased arm span
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: Increased length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Abnormal upper to lower segment ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: A deviation from normal of the relation between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Reduced upper to lower segment ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: Decreased ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis. Consider the term Disproportionate tall stature (HP:0001519) if tall stature is also present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Increased upper to lower segment ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: Elevated ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Stellate iris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: A lacy pattern or iris pigmentation that resembles the spokes of a bicycle wheel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Abnormal ciliary body morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: A structural anomaly of the ciliary body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Retinal neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Retinal astrocytic hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: A glial tumor of the retinal nerve fiber layer arising from a retinal astrocyte.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.label: Transient hearing impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001277.definition: Hearing loss that occurs acutely and resolves completely.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.label: Neoplasm of the ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.label: Mid-frequency hearing loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.definition: A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the middle frequencies of sound (1000 Hz to 3000 Hz).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.label: Perilobar nephrogenic rest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.definition: A type of nephrogenic rest associated with multiple lesions in the periphery of the renal lobe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.label: Intralobar nephrogenic rest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.definition: A type of nephrogenic rest usually representing single lesions within the renal lobe, renal sinus, or calyceal walls.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.label: Perinephritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.definition: Inflammation of the connective and adipose tissues surrounding the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.label: Flexion contracture of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in a finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.label: Recurrent cystitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.definition: Repeated infections of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.label: Reticulate pigmentation of oral mucosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001278.definition: A net-like pattern of increased pigmentation of the oral cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Abnormal intramembranous ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: An anomaly in the process of intramembranous ossification by which flat bones (cranial bones of the skull, i.e., the frontal, parietal, occipital, and temporal bones, and the clavicles) are formed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Abnormal humeral ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: An anomaly of the process of formation of bone in the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Absent ossification of thoracic vertebral bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: A lack of bone mineralization of one or more body of thoracic vertebra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Kinked brainstem
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: A kinked appearance of the brainstem, i.e., an exaggerated flexure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Periventricular white matter hypodensities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: Multiple areas of darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the cerebral ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Abnormal optic disc morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: A morphological abnormality of the optic disc, i.e., of the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Increased cup-to-disc ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: An elevation in the ratio of the diameter of the cup of the optic disc to the total diameter of the disc. The optic disc has an orange-pink rim with a pale centre (the cup) that does not contain neuroretinal tissue. An increase in this ratio therefore may indicate a decrease in the quantity of healthy neuroretinal cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Lymphatic vessel neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from the lymphatic vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Pulmonary lymphangiomyomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: Infiltration of smooth muscle-like cells in lymph vessels as well as the lung (pleura, alveolar septa, bronchi, pulmonary vessels and lymphatics as well as lymph nodes, especially in posterior mediastinum and retroperitoneum). Focal emphysema can develop because of airway narrowing, and the thoracic duct may be obliterated. Pulmonary lymphangiomyomatosis may lead to multiple small cysts with a hamartomatous proliferation of smooth muscle in their walls.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.label: Unilateral facial palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001279.definition: One-sided weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: Accessory cranial suture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: A cranial suture that is in addition to canonical membrane-covered openings in the incompletely ossified skull of the fetus or newborn infant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: Narrow jaw
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparently decreased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: Broad jaw
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 SD above the mean (objective); or an apparently increased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: Anisometropia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: Inequality of refractive power of the two eyes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: Corneal ulceration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: Disruption of the epithelial layer of the cornea with involvement of the underlying stroma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: Iris transillumination defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: Transmission of light through the iris as visualized upon slit lamp examination or infrared iris transillumination videography. The light passes through defects in the pigmentation of the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: Proboscis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: A fleshy, tube-like structure usually located in the midline of the face or just to one side of the midline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: High insertion of columella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: Insertion of the posterior columella superior to the nasal base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: Abnormal nasal base norphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: An anomaly of the nasal base, which can be conceived of as an imaginary line between the most lateral points of the external inferior attachments of the alae nasi to the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.label: Narrow nasal base
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001280.definition: Decreased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.label: Wide nasal base
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.definition: Increased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.label: Wide nasal ridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.definition: Increased width of the nasal ridge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.label: Fullness of paranasal tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.definition: Increased bulk of tissue alongside the nose. The fullness can be caused by both bony and soft tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.label: Unilateral breast hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.definition: Underdevelopment of the breast on one side only.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.label: Bilateral breast hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.definition: Underdevelopment of the breast on both sides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.label: Hypoplastic female external genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.definition: Underdevelopment of part or all of the female external reproductive organs (which include the mons pubis, labia majora, labia minora, Bartholin glands, and clitoris).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.label: Right ventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.definition: A predominantly right ventricular variant of isolated noncompaction cardiomyopathy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.label: Noncompaction cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.definition: A type of cardiomyopathy characterized anatomically by deep trabeculations in the ventricular wall, which define recesses communicating with the main ventricular chamber.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.label: Biventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001281.definition: Noncompaction cardiomyopathy that affects both ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Bilateral vocal cord paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on both sides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Unilateral vocal cord paresis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: Decreased strength of the vocal fold on one side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Bilateral vocal cord paresis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: Decreased strength of the vocal fold on both sides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Clinical modifier
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Severity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: The intensity or degree of a manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Mild
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: Having a relatively minor degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between two and three standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Moderate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: Having a medium degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between three and four standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Borderline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: Having a minor degree of severity that is considered to be on the boundary between the normal and the abnormal ranges. For quantitative traits, a deviation of that is less than two standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Severe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: Having a high degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between four and five standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.label: Profound
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001282.definition: Having an extremely high degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of more than five standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Position
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: The anatomical localization of the specified phenotypic abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Laterality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: The localization with respect to the side of the body of the specified phenotypic abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Bilateral
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: Being present on both sides of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Unilateral
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: Being present on only the left or only the right side of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Right
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: Being located on the right side of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Left
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: Being located on the left side of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Spatial pattern
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: The pattern by which a phenotype affects one or more regions of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Generalized
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: Affecting all regions without specificity of distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Localized
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: Being confined or restricted to a particular location.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.label: Distal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001283.definition: Localized away from the central point of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.label: Proximal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.definition: Localized close to the central point of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.label: Retinal vascular tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal blood vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.label: Skin appendage neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the hair follicles, sebaceous glands, or sweat glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.label: Hair follicle neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.definition: An uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation originating in a hair follicle, which is an epidermal adnexal structures responsible for hair growth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.label: Trichilemmoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.definition: A benign tumor originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.label: Single trichilemmoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.definition: Presence of a unitary trichilemmoma, a benign tumor originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.label: Multiple trichilemmomata
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.definition: Presence of multiple trichilemmomata, a benign tumor originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.label: Epilepsia partialis continua
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.definition: Epilepsia partialis continua (also called Kojevnikov's or Kozhevnikov's epilepsia) is a type of focal motor status epilepticus characterized by repeated stereotyped simple motor manifestations such as jerks, typically of a limb or the face, recurring every few seconds or minutes for extended periods (days or years).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.label: Small intestinal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001284.definition: The narrowing or partial blockage of a portion of the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Small intestinal dysmotility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: Abnormal small intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Colonic stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: A narrowing of a segment of colon whereby bowel continuity is maintained.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Hepatic bridging fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: Hepatic fibrosis that reaches from a portal area to another portal area.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Scrotal hypospadias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Midshaft hypospadias
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the middle of the inferior shaft of the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Scrotal hyperpigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: Increased pigmentation (skin color) of the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Abnormal scrotal rugation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: Anomaly of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Increased scrotal rugation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: Increased number or density of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Decreased scrotal rugation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: Decreased number or density of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.label: Esophageal leukoplakia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001285.definition: A white patch or plaque occurring on the surface of the esophageal mucous membranes that cannot be rubbed off and cannot be characterized clinically as any other disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.label: Testicular fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.definition: Formation of excess connective tissue in the testicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.label: Ovotestis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.definition: A gonad that contains both ovarian follicles and testicular tubular elements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.label: Abnormal germ cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.definition: Any structural anomaly of a reproductive cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.label: Abnormal male germ cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.definition: A structural anomaly of a male reproductive cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.label: Abnormal sperm head morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.definition: A structural abnormality of the sperm head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.label: Abnormal sperm neck morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.definition: A structural abnormality of the sperm neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.label: Abnormal sperm mid-piece morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.definition: A structural abnormality of the sperm mid-piece.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.label: Abnormal sperm tail morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.definition: A structural abnormality of the sperm tail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.label: Acephalic spermatozoa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001286.definition: Spermatozoa with very small cranial ends devoid of any nuclear material, that is, lacking a typical sperm head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.label: Vanishing testis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.definition: A condition which is considered to be due to the subsequent atrophy and disappearance in fetal life of an initially normal testis. In the presence of spermatic cord structures is evidence of the presence of the testis in early intrauterine life. When associated with a blind-ending spermatic cord, this entity is named as his absence of a testis in an otherwise normal 46XY male is usually unilateral and is assumed to be a consequence of intrauterine or perinatal torsion or infarction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.label: Varicocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.definition: A varicocele is a widening of the veins along the spermatic cord, leading to enlarged, twisted veins in the scrotum, and manifested clinically by a painless testicle lump, scrotal swelling, or bulge in the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.label: Abnormal vas deferens morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.definition: A structural anomaly of the secretory duct of the testicle that carries spermatozoa from the epididymis to the prostatic urethra where it terminates to form ejaculatory duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.label: Absent vas deferens
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.definition: Aplasia (congenital absence) of the vas deferens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.label: Abnormal male reproductive system physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.definition: An abnormal functionality of the male genital system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.label: Abnormal ejaculation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.definition: Abnormality in the process of ejection of semen (usually carrying sperm) from the male reproductive tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.label: Premature ejaculation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.definition: The emission of semen and seminal fluid during the act of preparation for sexual intercourse, i.e. before there is penetration, or shortly after penetration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.label: Retrograde ejaculation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.definition: The emission of semen and seminal fluid into the bladder instead of through the penis during orgasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.label: Retarded ejaculation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001287.definition: Difficulty of a male in achieving orgasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.label: Abnormal labia minora morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.definition: An anomaly of the labia minora, the folds of skin between the outer labia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.label: Abnormal labia majora morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.definition: An anomaly of the outer labia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.label: Fallopian tube cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.definition: A fluid filled sac located in the Fallopian tube.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.label: Fallopian tube torsion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.definition: A twisting of the Fallopian tube. Sudden onset with sharp, colicky pelvic pain associated with nausea, vomiting, bowel, and bladder symptoms is the usual presentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.label: Fallopian tube duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.definition: The presence of a supernumerary Fallopian tube.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.label: Hemorrhagic ovarian cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.definition: An abdominal mass formed by bleeding into a follicular ovarian cyst or corpus luteum cyst.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.label: Ovarian serous cystadenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.definition: A cystic tumor of the ovary, containing thin, clear, yellow serous fluid and varying amounts of solid tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.label: Abnormal uterine cervix morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.definition: An anomaly of the neck of the uterus (lower part of the uterus), called the uterine cervix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.label: Cervical endometriosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001288.definition: Abnormal growth of endometrial cells (which are normally limited to the uterus) within the cervix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.label: High posterior hairline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.definition: Hair on the neck extends less inferiorly than usual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.label: Facial muscle hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.definition: Hypertrophy of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.label: Neck muscle hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.definition: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the muscles of the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.label: Paraspinal muscle hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.definition: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the paraspinal muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.label: Scapular muscle hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.definition: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the scapular muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.label: Abnormal motor evoked potentials
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.definition: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs). MEPs are measured following single-pulse or repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation and can be used for the assessment of the excitability of the motor cortex and the integrity of conduction along the central and peripheral motor pathways.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.label: Abnormal upper-limb motor evoked potentials
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.definition: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs) in the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.label: Abnormal lower-limb motor evoked potentials
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.definition: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs) in the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.label: Handgrip myotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001289.definition: Difficulty releasing one's grip associated with prolonged first handgrip relaxation times.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.label: Myotonia of the face
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.definition: Slowed relaxation of muscles in the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.label: Myotonia of the jaw
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.definition: Slowed relaxation of muscles in the jaw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.label: Myotonia of the lower limb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.definition: Slowed relaxation of muscles in the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.label: Myotonia of the upper limb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.definition: Slowed relaxation of muscles in the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.label: Cold-sensitive myotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.definition: An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation that is induced by exposure to cold.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.label: Euryblepharon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_001290.definition: Euryblepharon is a congenital eyelid anomaly characterized by horizontal enlargement of the palpebral fissure. The eyelid is shortened vertically compared with the horizontal dimension, with associated lateral canthal malpositioning and lateral ectropion abnormally wide lid opening.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002000.label: Ciliary body coloboma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002000.definition: A coloboma of the ciliary body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.label: Diffuse
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.definition: A spatial pattern that is spread out, i.e., not localized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.label: Lower limb dysmetria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.definition: A lack of coordination of leg movement manifested by undershoot or overshoot of the intended position of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.label: Upper limb dysmetria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.definition: A lack of coordination of arm movement manifested by undershoot or overshoot of the intended position of the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.label: Astasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.definition: A postural abnormality characterized by the inability to stand without external support despite having sufficient muscle strength.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.label: Vertebrobasilar dolichoectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002003.definition: Elongation, dilatation, and/or tortuosity of the vertebrobasilar segment. The definition of VBD includes: (i) diameter of basilar or vertebral artery over 4.5 mm; or (ii) deviation of any portion more than 10 mm from the shortest expected course; and (iii) length of basilar artery over 29.5 mm or length of intracranial vertebral artery over 23.5 mm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.label: Double elevator palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.definition: A type of incomitant strabismus in which both elevator muscles (i.e., the inferior oblique and superior rectus muscles) of the same eye are weak leading to restricted elevation and hypotropia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.label: Double depressor palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.definition: An ocular movement abnormality characterised by simultaneous weakness of the inferior rectus muscle and superior oblique muscle of the same eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.label: Vertical incomitant strabismus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.definition: A type of incomitant strabismus in which the angle of deviation varies as the patient's gaze shifts upwards and/or downwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.label: Esodeviation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.definition: A manifest or latent ocular deviation in which one or both eyes tends to deviate nasally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.label: Accommodative esotropia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.definition: A form of esotropia (convergent deviation of the eyes) associated with activation of the accommodative reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.label: Abnormal myeloid cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.definition: Any structural anomaly of a cell of the monocyte, granulocyte, mast cell, megakaryocyte, or erythroid lineage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.label: Reduced bone-marrow pro-B cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.definition: A reduction in the numbers of pro-B cells (defined by coexpression of CD34 and CD19). Earlier B-cell precursors are defined by expressing surface CD34 and cytoplasmic TdT in the absence of CD19.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.label: Exodeviation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002004.definition: A manifest or latent ocular deviation in which one or both eyes tends to deviate temporally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002005.label: Anti-granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002005.definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002005.label: Abnormal erythrocyte physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002005.definition: Any functional abnormality of erythrocytes (red-blood cells).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002005.label: Abnormal red blood cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002005.definition: Any deviation from the normal number of red blood cells per volume in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002005.label: Increased red blood cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002005.definition: An abnormal elevation above the normal number of red blood cells per volume in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.label: Decreased red blood cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.definition: An abnormal reduction below the normal number of red blood cells per volume in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.label: Abnormal hemoglobin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of hemoglobin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.label: Decreased hemoglobin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.definition: An abnormal reduction below normal hemoglobin concentration in the circulation.
