http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.label: Increased hemoglobin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.definition: An abnormal elevation above normal hemoglobin concentration in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.label: Abnormal eosinophil count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002006.definition: Any deviation from the normal number of eosinophils per volume in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.label: Viremia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.definition: The presence of virus in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.label: Persistent EBV viremia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.definition: Persistent presence of Epstein-Barr virus in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.label: Hypopigmented macule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.definition: A white or lighter patch of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by decreased skin pigmentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.label: Crystalluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.definition: The presence of crystals in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.label: Leucine crystalluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.definition: The presence of leucine crystals in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.label: Wrist ganglion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.definition: A benign soft tissue tumor of the wrist usually found in the dorsal aspect of the wrist and communicate with the joint via a pedicle. This pedicle usually originates not only at the scapholunate ligament, but also may arise from a number of other sites over the dorsal aspect of the wrist capsule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.label: Carnitinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.definition: An elevated level of carnitine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.label: Alaninuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.definition: An increased level of alanine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.label: Beta-alaninuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002007.definition: An increased level of beta-alanine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: Erythrocyte inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of substances in red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: Pappenheimer bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: A type of erythrocyte inclusion characterized by basophilic stippling of erythrocytes, that is, by numerous very small coarse or fine blue granules within the cytoplasm with the additional stipulation that the stippled particles are due to iron granules (demonstrable by the Prussian blue stain).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: Heinz bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: A type of erythrocyte inclusion composed of denatured hemoglobin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: Furuncle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: An infection of a hair follicle that extends subcutaneously, forming an abscess.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: Carbuncle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: A pustular lesion of the skin emerging from group of infected hair follicles, characterized by a deep location and dissecting through tissue planes. A carbuncle is larger and deeper than a furuncle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: Infection following live vaccination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: An infection resulting from live attenuated vaccines (LAV), that is, a vaccine prepared from living viruses or bacteria that have been weakened under laboratory conditions. LAV vaccines will replicate in a vaccinated individual and produce an immune response but usually cause mild or no disease. are derived from disease-causing pathogens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: BCGitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: Local or regional infection with Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: BCGosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: Distant, or disseminated infection with Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination associated with failure to contain thebacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination leading to spread of BCG to many sites in the body. The tuberculosis vaccine BCG contains live attenuated Mycobacterium bovis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: Post-vaccination measles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: Infection with the measles virus of the live-attenuated vaccine. This is an extremely rare event and may indicate immunocompromise in some cases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.label: Post-vaccination rubella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002008.definition: Infection with the rubella virus of the live-attenuated vaccine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.label: Post-vaccination polio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.definition: Infection with live attenuated polio vaccine following vaccination. This is an extreemely rare event that may indicate immunocompromise.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.label: Post-vaccination rotavirus infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.definition: Infection with live attenuated rotavirus vaccine following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.label: Recurrent deep organ abscess formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.definition: Repeated episodes of the formation of abscesses in organs. An abscess is a circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the parenchyma or an organ.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.label: Prolonged need of intravenous antibiotic therapy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.definition: Clinical assessment of a requirement to treat with intravenous antibiotics over an unusually prolonged period of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.label: Recurrent streptococcal infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.definition: Increased susceptibility to streptococcal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of streptococcal infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.label: Infection due to encapsulated bacteria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.definition: An infection by an encapsulated bacterial agent. Isolates which cause invasive disease are usually surrounded by a polysaccharide capsule, which is a major virulence factor and the key antigen in protective protein-polysaccharide conjugate vaccines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.label: Severe norovirus infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002009.definition: An unusually severe course of infection with Human norovirus, previously known as Norwalk virus. Norovirus, an RNA virus of the family Caliciviridae, is a human enteric pathogen. Norovirus infection-associated illness may also be more prolonged and severe in immunocompromised individuals and may be associated with remarkably persistent viral excretion in some of these individuals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.label: Unusual fungal infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.definition: An unusual fungal infection that is regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection by a fungal agent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.label: Invasive fungal infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.definition: Fungal infection characterized by invasion of host tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.label: Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.definition: An opportunistic disease caused by invasion of unicellular fungus Pneumocystis jirovecii. Transmission of P. jirovecii cysts takes place through the airborne route, and usually, its presence in lungs is asymptomatic. However, people with impaired immunity, especially those with CD4+ T cell count below 200/microliter, are still at risk of the development of Pneumocystis pneumonia due to P. jirovecii invasion. Symptoms induced by this disease are not specific: progressive dyspnoea, non-productive cough, low-grade fever, arterial partial pressure of oxygen below 65 mmHg, and chest radiographs demonstrating bilateral, interstitial shadowing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.label: Invasive pulmonary aspergillosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.definition: Infection of the lungs with aspergillus. In the respiratory mucosa, the spores may germinate into hyphae, which in turn can invade the mucosa leading to invasive pulmonary aspergillosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.label: Unusual protozoan infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.definition: An unusual protozoan infection that is regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection by a protozoal agent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.label: Severe toxoplasmosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.definition: Toxoplasmosis is a widespread parasitic infection that is frequently asymptomatic in immunocompetent patients. However, this obligate intracellular protozoan parasite can evade the immune system and persist for the life of its host in cyst form, predominantly in the brain, retina, and muscles. Reactivation of latent cysts may occur when the immune system fails to maintain cytokine pressure, which mainly relies on gamma interferon (IFN-gamma). Toxoplasmosis is a life-threatening infection in immunocompromised patients (ICPs).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.label: Severe giardiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.definition: An unusually severe infection due to Giardia lamblia, also called Giardia duodenalis or Giardia intestinalis, which is a protozoan parasite of the small intestine that causes extensive morbidity worldwide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.label: Unusual helminthic infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.definition: An unusual helminthic infection that is regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection by a worm (helminth).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.label: Unusual parasitic infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002010.definition: An unusual parasitic infection that is regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection by a parasite.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.label: Bone fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.definition: A partial or complete breakage of the continuity of a bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.label: Abnormal CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cell proportion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.definition: A deviation from the normal proportion of CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cells in circulation, relative to another population of cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.label: Increased proportion of CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.definition: An abnormally increased proportion of CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cells in circulation, relative to another population of cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.label: Decreased proportion of CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.definition: An abnormally decreased proportion of CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cells in circulation, relative to another population of cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.label: Persistent human papillomavirus infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.definition: Human papillomaviruses (HPVs) are small oncogenic viruses. HPV has been shown to cause a variety of lesions and malignancies, which predominantly affect the anogenital region. Low-risk, non-oncogenic HPV types are associated with anogenital warts and recurrent respiratory papillomatosis while high-risk, oncogenic types are associated with cervical, penile, anal, vaginal, vulvar, and oropharyngeal cancers. Infection with anogenital HPV is usually asymptomatic and resolves spontaneously without consequences in the immunocompetent host. When disease does occur, the most common manifestation is genital warts, which may be small papules, or flat, smooth or pedunculated lesions. This resolution of HPV lesions is not generally seen in the immunosuppressed, resulting in severe, persistent and extensive manifestations of HPV disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.label: Hypoplastic dermoepidermal hemidesmosomes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.definition: Underdeveloped hemidesmosomes at the dermoepidermal junction. Hemidesmosomes are the specialized junctional complexes, that contribute to the attachment of epithelial cells to the underlying basement membrane in stratified and other complex epithelia, such as the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.label: Radial artery aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.definition: Congenital absence of the radial artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.label: Abnormal retinal nerve fiber layer morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002011.definition: A structural abnormality of the retinal nerve fiber layer

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.label: Retinal nerve fiber edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.definition: Swelling (edema) of the retinal nerve fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.label: Conception by assisted reproductive technology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.definition: A history of conception by an assisted reproductive technology such as in vitro fertilization (IVF), intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI), and cryopreservation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.label: Bite cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.definition: Red blood cells that appear to have parts of them bitten away.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.label: Tympanosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.definition: A stiffening of the tympanic membrane due to calcification, typically presents as white plaque-like lesions, involving discrete regions of the tympanic membrane and/or middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.label: Spontaneous conjunctival filtering bleb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.definition: Avascular cystic elevations of the superior conjunctiva not related to ocular surgery or trauma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.label: Prostate mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.definition: A lump detected in the prostate. In this context, mass is a general term for a lump or growth that may be caused by the abnormal growth of cells, a cyst, hormonal changes, or an immune reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.label: Periarticular soft-tissue mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.definition: A lump detected in the region that surrounds a joint. In this context, mass is a general term for a lump or growth that may be caused by the abnormal growth of cells, a cyst, hormonal changes, or an immune reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.label: Aplasia of the olfactory tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.definition: Aplasia (congenital absence) of the olfactory tract, which causes anosmia, a complete loss of the sense of smell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.label: Abnormal urine protein level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002012.definition: Any deviation of the concentration of one or more proteins in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: Increased urinary neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: An increased concentration of neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin in the urine (there is no generally accepted threshold, but some studies choose a threshold of above 150 nanogram per milliliter).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: Abnormal tubular basement membrane morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: Abnormal structure of the basement membrane of the renal tubulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: Thickening of the tubular basement membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: Increase in thickness of the basement membrane of the tubulus of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: Podocyte hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: Increased visceral epithelial cell size, with or without cytoplasmic protein droplets.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: Increased urine neutrophil count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: Abnormally increased count of neutrophils in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: Myofibromatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: A mesenchymal neoplasm characterized by solitary or multiple nodules involving the skin, striated muscles, bones and, sometimes, viscera. It usually appears as a subcutaneous nodule, but can also appear as an ulcer, pedunculated lesion, or similar to a hemangioma. Histology shows well-circumscribed tapered cell lobes, resembling smooth muscle cells. At its center, perivascular round cells (hemangiopericitoides) are usually observed, giving a biphasic appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: Anticardiolipin IgG antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: The presence of circulating IgG autoantibodies to cardiolipin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: Anticardiolipin IgM antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: The presence of circulating IgM autoantibodies to cardiolipin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: History of recent animal bite
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: Medical history of a recent bite injury due to an animal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.label: History of recent insect bite
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002013.definition: Medical history of a recent bite injury due to an insect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: History of recent tick bite
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: Medical history of a recent bite injury due to a tick.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: Blood pressure substantially higher in legs than arms
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: An abnormal blood pressure discrepancy between the upper and lower extremities with the blood pressure measured in the legs being much higher than the blood pressure measure in the arms. In healthy individuals, ankle systolic blood pressures are only slightly higher than the systolic blood pressure measured in the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: Blood pressure substantially higher in arms than legs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: An abnormal blood pressure discrepancy between the upper and lower extremities with the blood pressure measured in the arms being much higher than the blood pressure measure in the legs. In healthy individuals, ankle systolic blood pressures are only slightly higher than the systolic blood pressure measured in the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: Tracheal duplication cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: A cyst in the trachea, whose wall is made up by tissue similar to the bronchial tree, including cartilage and smooth muscle, and is lined by secretory respiratory epithelium composed of cuboid or columnar ciliated epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: Calcium phosphate crystalluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: The presence of calcium phosphate crystals in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: Calcium oxalate crystalluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: The presence of calcium oxalate crystals in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: Calcium carbonate crystalluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: The presence of calcium carbonate crystals in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: 2-Methylbutyryl glycinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: Increased concentration of 2-methylbutyryl glycine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: Increased circulating mead acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: An abnormally elevated concentration od mead acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.label: Elevated circulating succinate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002014.definition: An increase concentration of succinate in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Elevated urinary uromodulin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: The concentration of uromodulin (also known as Tamm Horsfall protein) in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Anti-dsDNA antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against double-stranded DNA.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Distal joint laxity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: Lack of stability of a distal joint (e.g., finger).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Positive blood 1,3 beta glucan test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: Beta-1,3-glucan is a major constituent of all of the characterized fungal cell walls, making up between 30-80 percent of the mass of the wall. It is a biomarker of fungal infections such as invasive pulmonary aspergillosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Nevus comedonicus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: A type of epidermal nevus characterized by closely arranged, dilated follicular openings with keratinous plugs resembling classical comedones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Abnormal oocyte morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: An abnormal structure of the female germ cell (egg cell).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Abnormal zona pellucida morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: Abnormal structure of the oocyte extracellular matrix region known as teh zona pellucida.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Thin zona pellucida
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: Reduced thickness of the zona pellucida.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Increased circulating adrenic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: An increased concentration of adrenic acid (also known as cis-7,10,13,16-Docosatetraenoic acid) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.label: Reduced response to gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002015.definition: Failure of the gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) stimulation test to induce an appropriate increased in luteinizing hormone (LH), follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) levels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.label: Branch retinal artery occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.definition: Blockage of a branch of the retinal artery. This can cause loss of a section of visual field.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.label: Cilioretinal artery occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.definition: Blockage of the cilioretinal artery. The central retinal artery supplies the inner retina and the surface of the optic nerve. In some individuals, the cilioretinal artery, a branch of the ciliary circulation, may supply a portion of the retina including the macula. In cilioretinal artery occlusion, vision loss results from cell death in the inner retinal layers (mainly ganglion cells) despite relative sparing of the outer layers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.label: Ophthalmic artery occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.definition: A partial or complete obstruction of the ophthalmic artery (branch of the internal carotid artery) that may lead to severe ischemia of the affected globe and associated ocular tissues. It can present with a similar picture to central retinal artery occlusion; however, profound choroidal ischaemia also occurs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.label: Branch retinal vein occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.definition: Blockage of a branch of the retinal vein. It may present with sudden-onset of painless vision loss or visual field defect correlating to the area of perfusion of the obstructed vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.label: Central retinal vein occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.definition: Central retinal vein occlusion is an occlusion of the main retinal vein posterior to the lamina cribrosa of the optic nerve and is typically caused by thrombosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.label: Hemiretinal vein occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.definition: A variant of central retinal vein occlusions that involves the superior or inferior half of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.label: Abnormal drug response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002016.definition: An anomalous response to a medication related to individual variation in metabolic or immune response to drugs varying from potentially from potentially life-threatening adverse drug reactions to alteration of therapeutic efficacy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Increased blood drug concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: High plasma concentration of a drug as compared to previously measured thresholds given the expected concentration for the applied dosage regime.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Decreased blood drug concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: Low plasma concentration of a drug as compared to previously measured thresholds given the expected concentration for the applied dosage regime.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Adverse drug response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: An unpleasant or harmful reaction resulting from treatment with a drug.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Reduced drug efficacy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: Decreased response to a drug intervention in comparison to the expected response.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Refractory drug response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: Absent or significantly reduced efficacy of drug intervention characterized by lack of measurable benefit or deterioration of disease course.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Reduced cholinesterase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: A decreased amount of cholinesterase in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Cholesterol crystalluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: The presence of cholesterol crystals in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta TEMRA T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: An abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta effector memory RA TEMRA T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CD45RA-positive, CD45RO-negative, and CCR7-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Abnormal dendritic cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: A deviation from the normal count of dendritic cells in the peripheral blood circulation. Dendritic cells are of hematopoietic origin, typically resident in particular tissues, specialized in the uptake, processing, and transport of antigens to lymph nodes for the purpose of stimulating an immune response via T cell activation. These cells are lineage negative (CD3-negative, CD19-negative, CD34-negative, and CD56-negative).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.label: Abnormal circulating haptoglobin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002017.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of haptoglobin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Elevated haptoglobin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: An abnormally high concentration of haptoglobin in the blood circulation. Haptoglobin is an acute-phase reactant whose levels can become elevated in the presence of infection and inflammation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Reduced haptoglobin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: An abnormally low concentration of haptoglobin in the blood circulation. Decreased haptoglobin in conjunction with increased reticulocyte count and anemia may indicate hemolysis. Decreased haptoglobin levels can also occur in the absence of hemolysis, due to cirrhosis of the liver, disseminated ovarian carcinomatosis, pulmonary sarcoidosis, and elevated estrogen state.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Abnormal circulating A-type atrial natriuretic peptide concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: A measurable change in circulating levels of Atrial natriuretic peptide hormone, a protein which plays an important role in the regulation of body fluid volume and blood pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Increased circulating A-type natriuretic peptide concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: A measurable elevation in circulating levels of Atrial natriuretic peptide hormone, a protein which plays an important role in the regulation of body fluid volume and blood pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Decreased circulating A-type natriuretic peptide concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: A measurable reduction in circulating levels of Atrial natriuretic peptide hormone, a protein which plays an important role in the regulation of body fluid volume and blood pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Superior cerebellar dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: Abnormal morphological development of the superior part of the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Multilobulated spleen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: The fetal spleen is lobulated, and these lobules normally disappear before the birth. Lobulation of the spleen may persist into adult life and be typically seen along the medial part of the spleen. A persisting lobule results in a variation in shape of the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Thick pachygyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: Pachygyria with a very thick cerebral cortex measuring 10-20 mm. Note that cortical thickness cannot be measured reliably on scans done between 3 and 24 months of age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Anterior predominant pachygyria with 5-10 mm cortical thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: Pachygyria with cortical thickness between 5 and 10 mm with and a posterior predominant severety gradient. The severety gradient is determined based on the gyral width, with gyri typically over 5mm over the more severely affected regions. Posterior predominant gradient indicates pachygyria more severe other the occipital lobes but also includes a rare perisylvian-predominant pachygyria and a temporal predominant pachygyria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.label: Posterior predominant thick cortex pachygyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002018.definition: Pachygyria with cortical thickness above 10 mm with and a posterior predominant severety gradient. The severety gradient is determined based on the gyral width, with gyri typically wider than 5mm over the more severely affected regions. Posterior predominant gradient indicates pachygyria more severe other the occipital lobes but also includes a rare perisylvian-predominant pachygyria and a temporal predominant pachygyria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: Perisylvian predominant thick cortex pachygyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: Pachygyria with cortical thickness greater than 10 mm and a perisylvian predominant severity gradient. The severity gradient is determined based on the gyral width, with gyri typically wider than 5mm over the more severely affected regions. Perisylvian predominant gradient indicates pachygyria more severe other the occipital lobes but also includes a rare perisylvian-predominant pachygyria and a temporal predominant pachygyria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: Anterior predominant thick cortex pachygyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: Pachygyria with cortical thickness greater than 10 mm and an anterior predominant severity gradient. The severety gradient is determined based on the gyral width, with gyri typically wider than 5mm over the more severely affected regions. Anterior predominant gradient indicates pachygyria more severe over the frontal and temporal lobes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: Pachygyria with 5-10 mm cortical thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: Pachygyria with a mildly thickend cerebral cortex measuring 5-10 mm. Note that cortical thickness cannot be measured reliably on scans done between 3 and 24 months of age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: Prolonged reptilase time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: An abnormally increased duration of the reptilase time. Reptilase time is a functional plasma clotting assay, which is based on the enzymatic activity of batroxobin. By specifically cleaving fibrinogen A from fibrinogen, batroxobin leads to the formation of a stable fibrin clot. The time, starting from the addition of batroxobin to the plasma sample, until clot formation is the reptilase time and is given in seconds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: IgA heavy chain paraproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: An abnormal IgA heavy chain in the circulation and typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: IgG heavy chain paraproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: An abnormal IgG heavy chain in the circulation and typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: IgM heavy chain paraproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: An abnormal IgM heavy chain in the circulation and typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: Increased circulating arachidonic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: An increased circulation of arachidonic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: Abnormal circulating 18-hydroxycorticosterone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of 18-Hydroxycorticosterone level in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.label: Decreased circulating 18-hydroxycortisone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002019.definition: A subnormal concentration of 18-Hydroxycorticosterone level in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.label: Increased circulating 18-hydroxycortisone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.definition: An abnormally elevated concentration of 18-Hydroxycorticosterone level in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.label: Abnormal sarcomere morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.definition: Any structural anomaly of the sarcomere, which is unit of a myofibril in a muscle cell, composed of an array of overlapping thick and thin filaments between two adjacent Z discs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.label: Abnormal Z disc morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.definition: Any structural anomaly of the Z disc, which is the platelike region of a muscle sarcomere to which the plus ends of actin filaments are attached.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.label: Z-band streaming
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.definition: Streaming or smearing of the Z band, which is then no longer confined to a narrow zone which bisects the I band. The Z disc may extend across the I band or the entire sarcomere in a zigzag manner. Focal thickening, smudging, and blurring of the Z band takes place concurrently. Myofibrillar disorganization is a frequent but not invariable accompanying change.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.label: Tubulointerstitial bacterial infiltration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.definition: Tubulointerstitial infiltration of bacteria identified on routine and/or special (Brown-Hopps) stains.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.label: Tubulointerstitial fungal infiltration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.definition: Tubulointerstitial infiltration of yeast or hyphal-microrganisms identified on routine and/or special (PAS, silver) stains.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.label: Simple ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.definition: The pinna has fewer folds and grooves than usual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.label: Eating-induced seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.definition: A seizure precipitated by aspects of anticipating food, eating itself, or the post-prandial period.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.label: Hot water-induced seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002020.definition: A seizure precipitated by pouring cupfuls of very hot water (40 to 50 degrees Celsius) in rapid succession over the head. Bathing in this manner is the most common trigger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.label: Praxis-induced seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.definition: A seizure precipitated by complex, cognition-guided tasks often involving visuomotor coordination and decision-making.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.label: Proprioceptive-induced seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.definition: A seizure precipitated by movement or a change in posture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.label: Somatosensory-induced seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.definition: A somatosensory reflex seizure is a seizure precipitated by somatic stimulation of a specific part of the body in the absence of startle or surprise.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.label: Startle-induced seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.definition: Startle-induced seizures are triggered by multiple and non-specific stimuli (auditory, somatosensory, and rarely visual) and are characterized by their sudden unexpected nature. Sudden noise rather than pure sound is the most effective acoustic stimulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.label: Thinking-induced seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.definition: Seizures induced by thinking and decision-making. comment:

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.label: Visually-induced seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.definition: Seizures evoked by visual stimuli. This includes clinical seizures induced by strobe lighting, television and other screens, flickering environmental lighting and self-induction by causing a strobe effect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.label: Focal aware motor seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.definition: A type of focal motor seizure in which awareness is retained throughout the seizure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.label: Focal aware atonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.definition: A type of focal atonic seizure during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.label: Motor seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002021.definition: A motor seizure is a type of seizure that is characterized at onset by involvement of the skeletal musculature. The motor event could consist of an increase (positive) or decrease (negative) in muscle contraction to produce a movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.label: Focal atonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.definition: A focal seizure characterized at onset by sudden loss or diminution of muscle tone without apparent preceding myoclonic or tonic activity, typically lasting more than 500 ms but less than 2 seconds. It may involve the head, trunk, jaw or limb musculature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.label: Clonic seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.definition: A clonic seizure is a type of motor seizure characterized by sustained rhythmic jerking, that is regularly repetitive.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.label: Hypohomocysteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.definition: A decreased concentration of homocystine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.label: Dermal sinus tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.definition: A dermal sinus tract is an abnormality present at birth over the dorsal midline where an abnormal epithelialized connection from the skin tracks inwards towards the spine, most commonly seen in the lumbosacral region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.label: Mammary duct ectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.definition: A non-proliferative inflammatory disorder of the large duct (milk duct) of the breast; as such, it affects nipple and areola complex. The condition is characterized by focal dilatation of the lactiferous duct system is due to endoluminal changes, as well as the loss of duct wall elastin, leading to abnormally dilated and tortuous lactiferous ducts with associated periductal inflammation and fibrosis. Mammary duct ectasia may present with nipple discharge or palpable mass.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.label: Breast abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.definition: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the breast.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.label: Nipple tenderness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.definition: Pain or discomfort produced by touching the nipple.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.label: Floating gallbladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002022.definition: An abnormal configuration in which the gallbladder is pedunculated, hanging free of the liver, and attached only by the cystic mesentery,

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.label: Hallux rigidus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.definition: Osteoarthritis of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the first toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.label: Thickening of glomerular capillary wall
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.definition: Widening of the wall of capillary blood vessels in the glomerulus. This feature may be produced by deposits and other changes affecting either subepithelial and subendothelial regions or the glomerular basement membrane itself.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.label: Abnormal glomerular capillary morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.definition: A structural anomaly of the capillary blood vessels in the renal glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.label: Ectopic fovea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.definition: An abnormal anatomic position of the fovea, the small, central pit composed of closely packed cones that is located in the macula of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.label: Tracheal tug on inspiration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.definition: Downward movement of the trachea during inspiration due to downward traction on the tracheobronchial tree.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.label: Forward slanting upper incisors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002500.definition: The upper incisors deviate from the normal angle of being roughly parallel to the surface of the face and instead slant outwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.label: Foveal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.definition: Partial or complete loss of foveal tissue that was once present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.label: Pyriform aperture stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.definition: Narrowing of the anterior nasal aperture (piriform or pyriform aperture), which is a pear-shaped opening in the skull that forms the bony inlet of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.label: Status cribrosum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.definition: Diffusely widened perivascular spaces in the basal ganglia, affecting especially the corpus striatum. Status cribrosum is usually symmetrical, with the perivascular spaces showing CSF signal and without diffusion restriction. The word cribriform means sievelike, with multiple perforations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.label: Decerebrate rigidity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.definition: A type of rigidity that is manifested by an exaggerated extensor posture of all extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.label: Subcutaneous spheroids
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.definition: Small, hard cyst-like nodules, freely moveable in the subcutis over the bony prominences of the legs and arms, which have an outer calcified layer with a translucent core on x-ray.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.label: Abnormal capillary morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.definition: A structural anomaly of the tiny blood vessels that connect arterioles with venules and whose walls act as semipermeable membranes that mediate the diffusion of fluids and gases between the blood circulation and body tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.label: Capillary fragility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.definition: Reduced resistance to rupture of capillary blood vessels. Capillary fragility may manifest as a bleeding diathesis with spontaneous ecchymoses (bruises).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.label: Abnormal capillary physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.definition: A functional anomaly of the tiny blood vessels that connect arterioles with venules and whose walls act as semipermeable membranes that mediate the diffusion of fluids and gases between the blood circulation and body tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.label: Arterial rupture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002501.definition: Sudden breakage of an artery leading to leakage of blood from the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.label: Elevated prostate-specific antigen level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.definition: An increased concentration of prostate specific antigen (PSA) in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.label: Abnormal erythrocyte sedimentation rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.definition: A deviation from normal range of the erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR), a test that measures the distance that erythrocytes have fallen after one hour in a vertical column of anticoagulated blood under the influence of gravity. The ESR is a nonspecific finding. An elevation may indicate inflammation or may be caused by any condition that elevates fibrinogen. A decreased ESR may be seen in polycythemia or in certain blood diseases in which red blood cells have an irregular or smaller shape that causes slower settling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.label: Decreased erythrocyte sedimentation rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.definition: A reduced erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR). The ESR is a test that measures the distance that erythrocytes have fallen after one hour in a vertical column of anticoagulated blood under the influence of gravity. The ESR is a nonspecific finding. A decreased ESR may be seen in polycythemia or in certain blood diseases in which red blood cells have an irregular or smaller shape that causes slower settling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.label: Rectal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.definition: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the rectum. That is, there is an abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.label: Megarectum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.definition: An abnormal dilation of the rectum. There is a large filled rectum as a result of underlying innervation or muscular abnormalities, which remains after disimpaction of the rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.label: Rectovestibular fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.definition: A congenital malformation characterized by an abnormal connection (fistula) between the rectum and the vulval vestibule, at the lower aspect of the vaginal opening.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.label: H-type rectovestibular fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.definition: Rectovestibular fistula with a normal anus is known as H-type fistula or double termination of the alimentary tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.label: Osteoma cutis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.definition: The term osteoma refers to the anomalous presence of ossification (bone formation) in the interior of the dermis or epidermis. The dermal or subcutaneous bone formation presents as stony hard nodules. The osteomata appear as irregular, hardened small nodules that are well circumscribed and generally of the same color as the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.label: Abnormal enteric nervous system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002502.definition: A structural anomaly of nerves of the enteric nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.label: Enteric neuronal degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.definition: Deterioration of enteric neurons with impairment of enteric neuronal structure. Typical neuropathological findings include qualitative (e.g., neuronal swelling, intranuclear inclusions, axonal degeneration) and quantitative (e.g., reduction in the number of neurons) abnormalities of the enteric neurons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.label: Abnormality of digestive system physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.definition: A functional anomaly of the digestive system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.label: Abnormal digestive system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.definition: A structural anomaly of the digestive system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.label: Abnormal morphology of erythroid progenitor cell
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.definition: Abnormal form of the progenitor cells committed to the erythroid lineage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.label: Abnormal proerythroblast morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.definition: Anomalous form of the proerythroblast, i.e., the immature, nucleated erythrocyte occupying the stage of erythropoeisis that follows formation of erythroid progenitor cells. This cell is CD71-positive, has both a nucleus and a nucleolus, and lacks hematopoeitic lineage markers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.label: Hypothalamic gliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.definition: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the hypothalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.label: Intratesticular abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.definition: A collection of pus within a testicle. Ultrasonographic features include shaggy, irregular walls, intratesticular location, low-level internal echoes, and occasionally, hypervascular margins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.label: Basal ganglia edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002503.definition: Swelling within the basal ganglia due to the accumulation of fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.label: Thalamic edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.definition: Swelling within the thalamus due to the accumulation of fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.label: Abnormality of mesenteric lymph nodes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.definition: A morphological anomaly of lymph nodes in the mesenteric root or throughout the mesentery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.label: Enlarged mesenteric lymph node
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.definition: Increase in size of one or more mesenteric lymph nodes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.label: Lung abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.definition: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in lung parenchyma, which leads to a cavity, and after formation of bronchopulmonary fistula, can manifest as an air-fluid level inside the cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.label: Abnormal brain lactate level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.definition: A deviation from normal of the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.label: Reduced brain lactate level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.definition: A decrease in the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.label: Abnormal brain choline level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.definition: A deviation from normal in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.label: Reduced brain choline level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.definition: An decrease in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002504.label: Abnormal brain creatine level by MRS

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.label: Elevated brain creatine level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.definition: An increase in the level of creatine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.label: Reduced brain creatine level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.definition: A decrease in the level of creatine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.label: Abnormal brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.definition: A deviation from normal in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.label: Elevated brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.definition: An increase in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.label: Abnormal olfactory lobe morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.definition: A structural anomaly of the olfactory lobe, the structure within the brain that receives neural input from the nasal cavity and thereby processes the sense of smell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.label: Hypothalamic atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of hypothalamus tissue that was once present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.label: Splenic abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002505.definition: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the parenchyma of the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.label: Multifocal splenic abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.definition: Multiple abscess lesions in the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.label: Geophagia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.definition: The practice of eating earth or soil-like substrates such as clay or chalk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.label: Scaphoid abdomen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.definition: The anterior abdominal wall is sunken and presents a concave rather than a convex contour.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.label: Abnormal mean corpuscular volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.definition: A deviation from normal of the mean corpuscular volume, or mean cell volume (MCV) of red blood cells, usually taken to be 80 to 100 femtoliters.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.label: Decreased mean corpuscular volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.definition: A reduction from normal of the mean corpuscular volume, or mean cell volume (MCV) of red blood cells (usually defined as an MCV below 80 femtoliters).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.label: Incomitant strabismus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.definition: Strabismus in which the angle of deviation differs depending upon the direction of gaze or according to which eye is fixing, associated with: (i) defective movement of the eye, (ii) asymmetrical accommodative effort.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.label: Concomitant strabismus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002506.definition: Strabismus in which the angle of deviation of the squiting eye remains the same in relation to the other eye, in all directions of gaze, and whichever eye is fixing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: Abnormal U wave
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: An anomaly of the U wave of the electrocardiogram (EKG). The U wave is a small (0.5 mm) deflection immediately following the T wave, usually in the same direction as the T wave. It is best seen in leads V2 and V3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: U wave inversion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: Direction of the U wave opposite to the T wave (i.e., below baseline) in leads with upright T waves.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: Prominent U wave
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: Increased amplitude of the U wave, defined as an amplitude grerater than 1-2mm or 25 percent of the height of the T wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: Exercise-induced U wave inversion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: U wave inversion that is induced by exercise stress testing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: Abnormal QRS complex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: An anomaly of the complex formed by the Q, R, and S waves, which occur in rapid succession on the electrocardiogram.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: Increased QRS voltage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: Elevation of the voltage (height) of the QRS complex. There are several criteria in use, but the most common is the Sokolov-Lyon criterion (S wave depth in V1 + tallest R wave height in V5-V6 greater than 35 mm).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: Abnormal QRS voltage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: Abnormal amplitude of the QRS complex of the electrocardiogram (EKG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: Decreased QRS voltage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: Reduced amplitude (height) of the QRS complex of the electrocardiogram (EKG), defined as amplitudes of all the QRS complexes in the limb leads are less than 5 mm or amplitudes of all the QRS complexes in the precordial leads less than 10 mm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: Electrical alternans
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: The QRS complexes of the electrocardiogram alternate in height.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.label: Pancreatic abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002507.definition: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the parenchyma of the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Orthokeratotic hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: A form of hyperkeratosis characterized by thickening of the cornified layer without retained nuclei.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Darier's sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: A skin change elicited by briskly rubbing the skin lesion in urticaria pigmentosa (UP), whereby the area begins to itch and becomes raised and surrounded by erythema. Unlike other forms of dermatographism, Darier's sign refers to urtication that is limited to the UP involved areas and, as in this case, spares the skin unaffected by UP.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Abnormal cutaneous elastic fiber morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: Any structural anomaly of the elastic fibers of the skin. Elastic fibers are the essential extracellular matrix macromolecules comprising an elastin core surrounded by a mantle of fibrillin-rich microfibrils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Elevated dermal desmosine content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: An increased amount of desmosine measure in the skin. Desmosine is a cross-linking amino acid formed from lysyl residues in elastin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Folliculitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: Inflammatory cells within the wall and ostia of the hair follicle, creating a follicular-based pustule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Bloody diarrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: Passage of many stools containing blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Bloody mucoid diarrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: Passage of many stools containing blood and mucus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Delayed recoil upon stretching of skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: Area of skin requiring an increased amount of time to return to its original shape after being stretched.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Onychomadesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: Complete shedding (separation) of the nail from the proximal matrix. Onychomadesis is the proximal separation of the nail plate from the nail matrix due to a temporary cessation of nail growth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.label: Feculent vomiting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002508.definition: Vomiting of material that is of fecal origin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.label: Abnormal large intestinal mucosa morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.definition: A structural anomaly of the mucous lining of the large intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.label: Epidermal acanthosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.definition: Diffuse hypertrophy or thickening of the stratum spinosum of the epidermis (prickle cell layer of the skin).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.label: Peripapillary exudate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.definition: A retinal exudate in the area surrounding the optic nerve head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.label: Disciform macular scar
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.definition: A subretinal scar with a disc-like shape in the region of the macula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.label: Sneeze
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.definition: A sudden violent, spasmodic, audible expiration of breath through the nose and mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.label: Eyelid myoclonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.definition: Marked, involuntary jerking of the eyelids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.label: Dysgenesis of the hypothalamus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.definition: Structural abnormality of the hypothalamus related to defective development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.label: Dysgenesis of the thalamus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002509.definition: Structural abnormality of the thalamus related to defective development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Abnormal hippocampus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: Any structural anomaly of the hippocampus,

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Dysgenesis of the hippocampus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: Structural abnormality of the hippocampus related to defective development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Dysgenesis of the basal ganglia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: Structural abnormality of the basal ganglia related to defective development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Umbilicated nodule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: A type of skin nodule that has a small depression that resembles a navel (i.e., is umbilicated).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Capillary malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: A capillary malformation is a flat, sharply defined vascular stain of the skin. It may cover a large surface area or it may be scattered and appear as little islands of color. In a capillary maformation, the predominant vessels are small, slow-flow vessels (i.e., arterioles and postcapillary venules).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Nevus anemicus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: A congenital skin lesion characterized by irregular hypopigmented macules that coalesce to form plaques and occur particularly on the chest. It is generally present at birth or develops in the first days of life. It is more common in females. Diagnosis is confirmed by applying gentle friction to the lesion and the surrounding skin and checking that the erythema produced in the healthy skin does not appear in the hypopigmented lesion. This pale macule becomes more conspicuous when the lesion and its surroundings are rubbed. The margin of the naevus is ill-defined and consists of an archipelago of small anaemic spots.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Nevus roseus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: A variant of port-wine stain characterized by a pale red or even pink tone, in contrast to the darker hue of the port-wine stain. By analogy with the term port-wine stain, this variant rose-wine stain, or nevus roseus. Nevus roseus, however, cannot be definitely diagnosed until adulthood as port-wine stains are sometimes pink in children. While the natural history of port-wine stains includes hypertrophy, darkening, and nodularity, nevus roseus remains unchanged for life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Cutis marmorata telangiectatica congenita
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: A congenital vascular malformation that presents as localized or generalized erythematous-telangiectatic lesions with a reticular pattern; the lesions are almost always present at birth or develop in the first days of life. Cutis marmorata telangiectatica congenita (CMTC) appears as marble-like pattern (mottling) on the surface of the skin. In contrast to cutis marmorata, the marbling is more severe and always visible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Angioma serpentinum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: Angioma serpiginosum consists of punctate, tightly packed telangiectatic lesions. Characteristic histopathological features are dilated and tortuous capillaries involving the uppermost part of the dermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.label: Reduced red cell pyruvate kinase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002510.definition: Decrease in the level of pyruvate kinase (PK) within erythrocytes. PK catalyzes the reaction: ATP + pyruvate = ADP + phosphoenolpyruvate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.label: Placoid macular lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.definition: Yellow/white, sharply delineated lesion, typically of inflammatory nature, involving the macula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.label: Misophonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.definition: An adverse response (dislike) to sound no matter what volume the sound is, characterized by a strong negative reaction to soft sounds that can sometimes be further triggered by seeing the source of the offending sound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.label: Hypergranulosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.definition: Hypergranulosis is an increased thickness of the stratum granulosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.label: Civatte bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.definition: Eosinophilic hyaline ovoid bodies which are often found in the subepidermal papillary regions or sometimes in the epidermis. Civatte bodies (CBs) are seen as rounded, homogenous, eosinophilic masses on routine H and E staining lying in the deeper parts of epidermis/epithelium and more frequently in dermis/connective tissue. They are known as CBs (in epithelium/epidermis), colloid bodies, or hyaline bodies (in connective tissue). They are 10-25 micrometers in diameter and situated mostly within or above the inflammatory cell infiltrate. In lichen planus, the number of necrotic keratinocytes may be so large that they are seen lying in clusters in the uppermost dermis. These bodies show a positive periodic acid Schiff reaction and are diastase resistant

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.label: Fetal distress
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.definition: An intrauterine state characterized by suboptimal values in the fetal heart rate, oxygenation of fetal blood, or other parameters indicative of compromise of the fetus. Signs of fetal distress include repetitive variable decelerations, fetal tachycardia or bradycardia, late decelerations, or low biophysical profile.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.label: Rete ridge flattening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.definition: Rete pegs (or ridges) are the epithelial extensions that project into the underlying connective tissue in both skin and mucous membranes. Rete ridge flattening refers to the loss of these projections so that the skin epithelium acquires a relatively flat appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.label: Lip discoloration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.definition: Lightening or darkening of the lips from their usual coloring.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.label: Violet lip discoloration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002511.definition: An alteration of the color of the lip to take on a violet color. This term does not include cyanosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.label: Sawtooth acanthosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.definition: A type of epidermal acanthosis characterized by a jagged (sawtooth) appearance of the rete ridges of the epidermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.label: White streaks/specks on enamel.
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.definition: Areas of white discoloration visible on the surface of the teeth (enamel) in the form of streaks or specks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.label: Fragile teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.definition: A tendency of teeth to fracture as manifested by a history of repeated fracture of the dental enamel without adequate trauma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.label: White lesion of the oral mucosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.definition: White lesions of the oral mucosa are generally caused by a condition that increases the thickness of the epithelium. This increases the distance to the vascular bed and thereby tends to change the usual reddish color of the oral mucosa to white. Common causes include hyperkeratosis (thickening of the keratin layer), acanthosis (thickening of the spinous cell layer), increased edema in the epithelium (leukoedema), and reduced vascularity of the underlying lamina propria. Additionally, fibrin caps or surface ulcerations and collapsed bullae can appear white.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.label: Oral hairy leukoplakia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.definition: A corrugated white lesion of the oral mucosa that usually occurs on the lateral or ventral surfaces of the tongue and may have a shaggy or frayed appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.label: Actinic keratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.definition: A scaly, crusty lesion caused by damage from the ultraviolet radiation of the sun, with typical location on sun-exposed areas of the skin. Actinic keratosis lesions are often elevated, rough, and wartlike, and may be red, or occasionally tan, pink, or flesh-toned in color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.label: Reduced intraabdominal adipose tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.definition: An abnormally reduced amount of adipose tissue in the abdominal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.label: Abnormal small intestinal mucosa morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002512.definition: A structural anomaly of the mucous lining of the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Decreased small intestinal mucosa lactase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: Lactase is produced in the small intestine in humans, Lactase is a member of the beta-galactosidase family of enzymes, and hydrolyzes D-lactose to form D-galactose and D-glucose, which can be absorbed by the small intestine. There are many ways of assessing lactase activity. In one test, an endoscopic biopsy from the postbulbar duodenum is incubated with lactose on a test plate, and a color reaction develops within 20 min as a result of hydrolyzed lactose (a positive result) in patients with normolactasia, whereas no reaction (a negative result) develops in patients with severe hypolactasia. Other, less direct, tests include the hydrogen breath test, and blood tests following lactose challenges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Finger swelling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: Enlargement of the soft tissues of one or more fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Abnormal circulating estrogen level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: A deviation from normal concentration of the hormone estrogen in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Abnormal serum estradiol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: A deviation from normal concentrations of estradiol in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Increased serum estradiol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: An elevation above normal limits of the concentration of estradiol in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Abnormal serum estriol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: A deviation from normal concentration of estriol in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Increased serum estriol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: An elevation above normal limits of estriol concentration in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Decreased serum estriol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: A reduction below normal limits of estriol in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Abnormal serum estrone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of circulating estrone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.label: Increased serum estrone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002513.definition: An elevation above normal limits of the concentration of estrone in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Decreased serum estrone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: A reduction below normal limits of the concentration of estrone in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Gingival calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: Ectopic deposition of calcium salts found in the gingiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Constitutional symptom
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: A symptom or manifestation indicating a systemic or general effect of a disease and that may affect the general well-being or status of an individual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Chills
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: A sudden sensation of feeling cold.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Shivering
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: Involuntary contraction or twitching of the muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Rigors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: Severe chills with violent shivering. A rigor is an episode of shaking or exaggerated shivering which can occur with a high fever.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Foveal degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: Deterioration of the tissue of the fovea, i.e.,the region of sharpest vision within the macula of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Beaten bronze macular sheen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: A shiny appearance of the macula, which is often called a beaten bronze appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Dark choroid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: A fluorescein angiographic finding of absence of the normal background fluorescence (a dark choroid).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.label: Atrophic muscularis propria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002514.definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of muscularois propria tissue that was once present. The atrophy may involve a marked vacuolar degeneration of myocytes, loss of muscle fibers and some cases a highly characteristic honeycomb fibrosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002515.label: Ganglioneuromatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002515.definition: Hyperplastic submucosal and myenteric plexus containing an increased number of ganglion cells, glial cells and nerve fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002515.label: Poor visual behavior for age
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002515.definition: Lack of visual responsiveness or decrease in visual capabilities suggesting a lack of visual responsiveness or decrease in visual capabilities in an infant or young child in which visual behavior fails to meet normal developmental milestones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002515.label: Transient
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_002515.definition: Short-lived and not permanent. This term applies to a phenotypic abnormality that is temporary and of short duration.
