http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.label: Glomerular basement membrane lamellation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.definition: Presence of abnormal additional layers of the basement membrane of the glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.label: Struvite nephrolithiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.definition: Presence of struvite (magnesium ammonium phosphate) containing calculi (kidney stones).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.label: Isothenuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.definition: Inability of the kidneys to produce either concentrated or dilute urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.label: Enchondroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.definition: A solitary, benign, intramedullary cartilage tumor that is often found in the short tubular bones of the hands and feet, distal femur, and proximal humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.label: Fused thoracic vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003003.definition: A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more thoracic vertebral bodies with one another.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.label: Fused lumbar vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.definition: A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more lumbar vertebral bodies with one another.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.label: Schmorl's node
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.definition: A Schmorl's node is the herniation of nucleus pulposus through the cartilaginous and bony end plate into the body of the adjacent vertebra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.label: Incomplete ossification of pubis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.definition: Failure to complete ossification (maturation and calcification) of the pubic bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.label: Hip subluxation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.definition: A partial dislocation of the hip joint, whereby the head of the femur is partially displaced from the socket.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.label: Flexion contracture of digit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.definition: A bent (flexed) finger or toe joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement of joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.label: Hypoglycosylation of alpha-dystroglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.definition: A reduction in the degree of glycosylation of alpha-dystroglycan in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.label: Abnormal lateral ventricle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.definition: A morphological anomaly of the lateral ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.label: Colpocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.definition: Colpocephaly is an anatomic finding in the brain manifested by occipital horns that are disproportionately enlarged in comparison with other parts of the lateral ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.label: Brain abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003004.definition: A collection of pus, immune cells, and other material in the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.label: Narcolepsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.definition: An abnormal phenomenon characterized by a classic tetrad of excessive daytime sleepiness with irresistible sleep attacks, cataplexy (sudden bilateral loss of muscle tone), hypnagogic hallucinations, and sleep paralysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.label: Tip-toe gait
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.definition: An abnormal gait pattern characterized by the failure of the heel to contact the floor at the onset of stance during gait.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.label: Inguinal freckling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.definition: The presence in the inguinal region (groin) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.label: Perifollicular fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.definition: Presence of excess fibrous connective tissue surrounding hair follicules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.label: Hyperconvex toenail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.definition: When viewed on end (with the tip of the toe pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the toenail forms a tighter curve of convexity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.label: Uncombable hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.definition: Hair that is disorderly, stands out from the scalp, and cannot be combed flat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.label: Autoimmune antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.definition: The presence of an antibody in the blood circulation that is directed against the organism's own cells or tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.label: Sickled erythrocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.definition: An irreversible distortion of the morphology of an erythrocyte such that the cells are elongated and curved, resembling the blade of a sickle (the hand-held agricultural tool traditionally used to harvest grains).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.label: Mitochondrial depletion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003005.definition: An abnormal reduction in mitochondrial DNA content of cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Nervous tissue neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A neoplasm derived from nervous tissue (not necessarily a neoplasm located in the nervous system).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Neuroectodermal neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A neoplasm arising in the neuroectoderm, the portion of the ectoderm of the early embryo that gives rise to the central and peripheral nervous systems, including some glial cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Craniopharyngioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A benign pituitary-region neoplasm that originates from Rathke's pouch. Craniopharyngiomas are benign slow growing tumors that are located within the sellar and para sellar region of the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Neuroepithelial neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A neoplasm composed of neural epithelium, not necessarily a neoplasm located in the neural epithelium or neuroepithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Neurocytoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A benign brain tumor composed of neural elements which most often arise from the septum pellucidum and the walls of the lateral ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Primitive neuroectodermal tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A tumor that originates in cells from the primitive neural crest. This group of tumors is characteirzed by the presence of primitive cells with elements of neuronal and/or glial differentiation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Ependymoblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A highly malignant embryonal tumor of infancy and young childhood characterized by neuroectodermal elements organized in distinctive multilayered rosettes. Ependymoblastomas are large lesions that occur in the supratentorial compartment, typically displaying a physical connection to the ventricular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Peripheral primitive neuroectodermal neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A primitive neuroectodermal neoplasm that occurs extracranially in soft tissue and bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Olfactory esthesioneuroblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A malignant olfactory neuroblastoma arising from the olfactory epithelium of the superior nasal cavity and cribriform plate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.label: Primary central nervous system lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003006.definition: A form of extranodal, high-grade non-Hodgkin B-cell neoplasm, usually large cell or immunoblastic type that originates in the brain, leptomeninges, spinal cord, or eyes and typically remains confined to the CNS.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.label: Central primitive neuroectodermal tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.definition: A primitive neuroectodermal neoplasm that occurs in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.label: Medulloepithelioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.definition: A primitive neuroectodermal tumor that originates from the cells of the embryonic medullary canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.label: Paranasal sinus neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.definition: A tumor that originates in the paranasal sinus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.label: Chemodectoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.definition: A usually benign neoplasm originating in the chemoreceptor tissue of the carotid body, glomus jugulare, glomus tympanicum, aortic bodies, or the female genital tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.label: Ductal carcinoma in situ
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.definition: Presence of abnormal cells inside a milk duct, that is, non-invasive breast cancer. Ductal carcinoma in situ is considered to be a precursor lesion to invasive breast cancer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.label: Bronchial neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.definition: A tumor originating in a bronchus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.label: Cervix cancer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003007.definition: A tumor of the uterine cervix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Burkitt lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: A form of undifferentiated malignant lymphoma commonly manifested as a large osteolytic lesion in the jaw or as an abdominal mass.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Punctate periventricular T2 hyperintense foci
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: Multiple pointlike areas of high T2 signal observed upon magnetic resonance imaging of the periventricular cerebral white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Abnormal drinking behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: Abnormal consumption of fluids with excessive or insufficient consumption of fluid or any other abnormal pattern of fluid consumption.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Salt craving
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: Hypersalivation, also known as salt craving, refers to an excessive desire to consume salt (sodium chloride) or salty foods.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Clinodactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: An angulation of a digit at an interphalangeal joint in the plane of the palm (finger) or sole (toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Abnormal CSF lactate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: Abnormal concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Reduced CSF lactate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: Decreased concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Abnormal circulating testosterone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: An anomalous concentration of testosterone in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Increased serum testosterone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: An elevated circulating testosterone level in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.label: Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003008.definition: An anomalous amount of protein present in or on the surface of muscle fibers. This feature may be appreciate upon immunohistochemical investigation of muscle biopsy tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Abnormal muscle fiber merosin expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: An anomalous amount of merosin in muscle fibers. Merosin is a basement membrane-associated protein found in placenta, striated muscle, and peripheral nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Absent muscle fiber merosin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: Lack of merosin protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Reduced muscle fiber merosin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: A reduced amount of merosin in muscle fibers. This feature is usually assessed by immunohistochemical examination of muscle biopsy tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Abnormal muscle fiber laminin beta 1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: A deviation from normal of the amount of laminin beta 1 in muscle fiber tissue. Laminin 2 is a major component of the basal lamina of skeletal muscle cells. It is a heterotrimer composed of 3 chains: merosin (laminin alpha 2 chain), beta 1, and gamma 1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Reduced muscle fiber laminin beta 1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: A reduced amount of laminin beta 1 in muscle fiber tissue. Laminin 2 is a major component of the basal lamina of skeletal muscle cells. It is a heterotrimer composed of 3 chains: merosin (laminin alpha 2 chain), beta 1, and gamma 1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Reduced muscle collagen VI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: A decreased amount of collagen VI in muscle tissue. Collagen VI is a primarily associated with the extracellular matrix of skeletal muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Abnormal muscle fiber dystrophin expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: A deviation from normal in the amount of dystrophin in muscle fiber tissue. Dystrophin is located at the muscle sarcolemma in a membrane-spanning protein complex that connects the cytoskeleton to the basal lamina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Absent muscle dystrophin expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: Lack of dystrophin in muscle tissue. Immunohistochemistry reveals absent dystrophin protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Reduced muscle dystrophin expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: A decreased amount of dystrophin in muscle fiber tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.label: Reduced muscle fiber alpha dystroglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003009.definition: Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced alpha dystroglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. Alpha-dystroglycan is a heavily glycosylated peripheral-membrane component of the dystrophin-associated glycoprotein complex (DAPC), which, in addition to laminin alpha2, binds perlecan and agrin in the extracellular matrix, whereas beta-dystroglycan, derived from the same gene, is a transmembrane protein that links to dystrophin intracellularly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Abnormal muscle fiber alpha sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: Deviation from normal in the amount of alpha sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Absent muscle fiber alpha sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: Lack of alpha sarcoglycan in muscle. Immunohistochemistry reveals absent alpha sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Reduced muscle fiber alpha sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: A decreased amount of alpha sarcoglycan in muscle. Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced alpha sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Abnormal muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: Deviation from normal in the amount of beta sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Abnormal muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: Deviation from normal in the amount of gamma sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Abnormal muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: Deviation from normal in the amount of delta sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Absent muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of beta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Reduced muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced beta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Reduced muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced gamma sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.label: Absent muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003010.definition: Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of gamma sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Absent muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of delta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Reduced muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: Abnormally reduced amount of delta sarcoglycan in muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Abnormal muscle fiber alpha dystroglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: A deviation from normal of muscle alpha-dystroglcan expression. Alpha-dystroglycan is a heavily glycosylated peripheral-membrane component of the dystrophin-associated glycoprotein complex (DAPC), which, in addition to laminin alpha2, binds perlecan and agrin in the extracellular matrix, whereas beta-dystroglycan, derived from the same gene, is a transmembrane protein that links to dystrophin intracellularly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Abnormal muscle fiber dysferlin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: A deviation from normal in the expression of dysferlin in muscle tissue. Dysferlin is an ubiquitous 230-kDa transmembrane protein involved in calcium-mediated sarcolemma resealing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Absent muscle fiber dysferlin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of dysferlin protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Reduced muscle fiber dysferlin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced dysferlin protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Abnormal muscle fiber emerin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: A deviation from normal of the amount of the inner nuclear membrane protein emerin in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Absent muscle fiber emerin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of emerin protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Reduced muscle fiber emerin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced emerin protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.label: Abnormal muscle fiber calpain-3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003011.definition: A deviation from normal in the amount of calpain-3 in muscle tissue. Calpains are intracellular nonlysosomal cysteine proteases modulated by calcium ions. A typical calpain is a heterodimer composed of two distinct subunits, one large (over 80 kDa) and the other small (30 kDa). While only one gene encoding the small subunit has been demonstrated, there are many genes for the large one. CAPN3 is similar to ubiquitous Calpain 1 and 2 (m-calpain and micro-calpain), but contains specific insertion sequences (NS, IS1 and IS2). Calpains cleave target proteins to modify their properties, rather than breaking down the substrates.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.label: Absent muscle fiber calpain-3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.definition: Western blot shows complete lack of calpain-3 protein in the muscle biopsy tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.label: Reduced muscle fiber calpain-3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.definition: Western blot reveals reduced calpain-3 protein in the muscle biopsy tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.label: Reduced muscle fiber perlecan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.definition: Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced perlecan protein in the muscle biopsy. Perlecan is a basement membrane-specific heparan sulfate proteoglycan core protein (HSPG) also known as heparan sulfate proteoglycan 2 (HSPG2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.label: Abnormal muscle fiber lamin A/C
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.definition: A deviation from the normal amount of lamin A/C in muscle tissue. The LMNA gene gives rise to at least three splicing isoforms including the two main isoforms, lamin A and lamin C. These are constitutive components of the fibrous nuclear lamina and have different roles, ranging from mechanical nuclear membrane maintenance to gene regulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.label: Reduced muscle fiber lamin A/C
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.definition: A decreased amount of lamin A/C in muscle tissue. This feature can be shown by immunohistochemistry or Western blotting of muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.label: Sacralization of the fifth lumbar vertebra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.definition: A congenital anomaly, in which the transverse process of the last lumbar vertebra (L5) fuses to the sacrum on one side or both, or to ilium, or both.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.label: Abnormal endometrium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.definition: An anomaly of the inner mucous membrane of the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.label: Endometriosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.definition: The growth of endometrial tissue outside the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.label: Impaired ristocetin cofactor assay activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003012.definition: Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin to platelet-poor plasma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Impaired von Willebrand factor collagen binding activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: Reduced ability of von Willebrand factor (vWF) to bind collagen. Abnormal response to collagen as manifested by reduced or lacking ability of plasma von WIllebrand Factor to bind collagen. An ELISA-based assay is typically used; the test is sensitive to loss of von Willebrand Factor high molecular weight multimers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Abnormal von Willebrand factor multimer distribution
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: Deviation from the normal von Willebrand factor multimer pattern.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Absence of large von Willebrand factor multimers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: Absence of large von Willebrand Factor multimers on gel electrophoresis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Abnormal presence of ultra-large von Willebrand factor multimers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: Detection of abnormal ultra-large von Willebrand factor multimers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Total absence von Willebrand factor multimers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: Complete absence of all von Willebrand factor multimers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Absence of intermediate von Willebrand factor multimers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: Lack of intermediate von Willebrand Factor multimers on gel electrophoresis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Enhanced ristocetin cofactor assay activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by increased aggregation of platelets upon addition of low-dose ristocetin to platelet-rich plasma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Prolonged bleeding following circumcision
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: Bleeding that persists for a longer than usual time following circumcision.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Excessive bleeding from superficial cuts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: An abnormally increased degree of bleeding following a superfical injury to the surface of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.label: Excessive bleeding after a venipuncture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003013.definition: An abnormal high amount of bleeding following the procedure of taking a blood sample.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Oral cavity bleeding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: Recurrent or excessive bleeding from the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Abnormality of the posterior hairline
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: An anomaly in the placement or shape of the hairline (trichion) on the back of the head (neck), that is, the border between skin on the back of the head that has head hair.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Abnormal bowel sounds
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: An anomaly of the amount or nature of abdominal sounds. Abdominal sounds (bowel sounds) are made by the movement of the intestines as they promote passage of abdominal contents by peristalsis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Hyperactive bowel sounds
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: Abnormally increased gurgling/rumbling sounds made by the movement of fluid and gas in the intestines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Hypoactive bowel sounds
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: An decreased amount of bowel sounds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Lack of bowel sounds
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: Complete lack of abdominal sounds as assayed by examination of the abdomen with a stethoscope.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Abnormal liver parenchyma morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: A structural anomaly of the liver located predominantly in the hepatocytes as opposed to stromal cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Truncal titubation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: Tremor of the trunk in an anterior-posterior plane at 3-4 Hz.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Heart murmur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: An extra or unusual sound heard during a heartbeat caused vibrations resulting from the flow of blood through the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.label: Cardiogenic shock
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003014.definition: Severely decreased cardiac output with evidence of inadequate end-organ perfusion (i.e., tissue hypoxia) in the presence of adequate intravascular volume.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.label: Plasmacytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.definition: An abnormally increased number of plasma cells in tissues, exudates, or blood

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.label: Cholangitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.definition: Inflammation of the biliary ductal system, affecting the intrahepatic or extrahepatic portions, or both.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.label: Cholangiocarcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.definition: Cholangiocarcinoma is a primary cancer originating in the biliary epithelium i.e., the cholangiocytes, of the extrahepatic and intrahepatic biliary ducts. It is extremely invasive, develops rapidly, often metastasizes, and has a very poor prognosis. They are slow growing tumors which spread longitudinally along the bile ducts with neural, perineural and subepithelial extension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.label: Gallbladder perforation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.definition: Rupture of the wall of the gallbladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.label: Scrotal pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.label: Bence Jones Proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.definition: The presence of free monoclonal immunoglobulin light chains in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.label: Flank pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the flank.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.label: Cervical ectropion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.definition: Cervical ectropion occurs when eversion of the endocervix exposes columnar epithelium to the vaginal milieu

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.label: Cervical polyp
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003015.definition: Abnormal growth of tissue projecting from a mucous membrane of the endocervix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.label: Vaginal pruritus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.definition: A sensation of itching in the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.label: Jaw claudication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.definition: Pain in the jaw or ear induced by chewing or otherwise moving the jaw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.label: Temporal artery tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the temporal artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.label: Night sweats
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.definition: Occurrence of excessive sweating during sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.label: Antimitochondrial antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against mitochondria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.label: Dilated superficial abdominal veins
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.definition: Increase in diameter of the veins located underneath the skin of the abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.label: Gastric varix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003016.definition: Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.label: Cystic artery pseudoaneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.definition: Presence of a pseudoaneurysm in the artery that supplies the gallbladder and cystic duct with blood. A pseudoaneurysm, also known as a false aneurysm, forms when blood leaks through a breach of the arterial wall but is contained by the adventitia or surrounding perivascular soft tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.label: Perirenal hematoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.definition: A collection of clotted blood surrounding the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.label: Peripheral amyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.definition: Congenital absence of the myelin sheath on a nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.label: Increased peripheral myelin thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.definition: Elevated thickness of the myelin sheath of peripheral nerves, in a regular and concentric fashion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.label: Myelin tomacula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.definition: The presence of multiple sausage-shaped swellings of the myelin sheath (The Latin tomaculum means sausage).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.label: Asymmetric peripheral demyelination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.definition: Loss of myelin from peripheral nerves in a pattern that differs between right and left.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.label: Abnormality of peripheral nervous system electrophysiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.definition: An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which peripheral nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.label: Abnormality of central nervous system electrophysiology
Abnormal peripheral action potential amplitude
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003017.definition: An anomaly in the magnitude of the action potential along a peripheral nerve, that is, of the rapid rise and fall of the electrical membrane potential of the nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.label: Oppenheim reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.definition: Dorsiflexion of the big toe, sometimes accompanied by fanning of the other toes, elicited by stroking along the medial side of the tibia (the normal response would be no movement of the big toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.label: Gordon reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.definition: Dorsal extension of the big toe, sometimes accompanied by fanning of the other toes, elicited by compressing the calf muscles (a normal response is no movement of the big toe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.label: Tetraplegia/tetraparesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.definition: Loss of strength in all four limbs. Tetraplegia refers to a complete loss of strength, whereas Tetraparesis refers to an incomplete loss of strength.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.label: Impaired visually enhanced vestibulo-ocular reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.definition: The vestibulo-ocular reflex is responsible for the stabilization of the retinal image during movement. The visual vestibular ocular reflex (VVOR) or visual enhanced VOR, maintains ocular stability during head motion by generating compensatory eye movement opposite to head movement, and is a major component of visual vestibular interaction. This feature is an impairment of this reflex, manifested as the combined impairment of the three compensatory eye movement reflexes, namely the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR), smooth pursuit (SP) and optokinetic reflex (OKR).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.label: Isometric tremor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.definition: An isometric tremor occurs with muscle contraction against a rigid stationary object (e.g., when making a fist).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.label: Kinetic tremor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.definition: Tremor that occurs during any voluntary movement. It may include visually or non-visually guided movements. Tremor during target directed movement is called intention tremor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.label: Titubation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.definition: Nodding movement of the head or body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.label: Tremor by anatomical site
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003018.definition: Tremor classified by the affected body part.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Oral motor hypotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: Reduced muscle tone of oral musculature. In infants, this feature may be associated with difficulties in breast feeding, and may affect the latch, jaw motions, tongue placement, lip seal, suck/swallow/breathe pattern and overall feeding behavior.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Abnormal peripheral nervous system synaptic transmission
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: An anomaly in the communication from a neuron to a target across a synapse in the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Fatigable weakness of bulbar muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: A type of weakness of the bulbar muscles (muscles of the mouth and throat responsible for speech and swallowing) that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Fatigable weakness of chewing muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: A type of weakness of the muscles involved in chewing that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Fatigable weakness of speech muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: A type of weakness of the muscles involved in speech that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Fatigable weakness of swallowing muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: A type of weakness of the muscles involved in swallowing that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Fatigable weakness of respiratory muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: A type of weakness of the muscles involved in breathing (respiration) that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Fatigable weakness of skeletal muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: A type of weakness of skeletal muscle that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Fatigable weakness of distal limb muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle of distal part of a limb that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.label: Fatigable weakness of neck muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003019.definition: A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle in the neck that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.label: Fatiguable weakness of proximal limb muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.definition: A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle of proximal part of a limb that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.label: Response to drugs acting on neuromuscular transmission
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.definition: Specific drugs interfere selectively with the different cellular mechanisms involved in neuromuscular transmission (synthesis, storage, release, action and inactivation of transmitter). The response of a patient to a specific drug can therefore be useful information for the differential diagnosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.label: Favorable response of weakness to acetylcholine esterase inhibitors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.definition: Improvement of muscle strength in response to administration of an acetylcholine esterase inhibitor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.label: Unfavorable response of muscle weakness to acetylcholine esterase inhibitors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.definition: Lack of improvement of muscle strength in response to administration of an acetylcholine esterase inhibitor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.label: Increased jitter at single fiber EMG
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.definition: The variation in the time interval between the two action potentials of the same motor unit is called jitter. This term therefore applies to increased variability in the interval between successive action potentials of the same motor unit, which is measured by electromyography (EMG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.label: EMG: incremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.definition: A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to an abnormal increase in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.label: Paradoxical respiration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.definition: Breathing movements in which the chest wall moves in on inspiration and out on expiration, in reverse of the normal movements. It may be seen in children with respiratory distress of any cause, which leads to indrawing of the intercostal spaces during inspiration. Patients with chronic airways obstruction also show indrawing of the lower ribs during inspiration, due to the distorted action of a depressed and flattened diaphragm. Crush injuries of the chest, with fractured ribs and sternum, can lead to a severe degree of paradoxical breathing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.label: Anti-acetylcholine receptor antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ganglioside-monosialic acid (GM1), which is a type of glycosphingolipid with one sialic acid. GM1 is located on the outer layer of the plasma membrane, and plays a vital role in neurogenesis, nerve development, differentiation and repair after injury.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.label: Calcium channel antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003020.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against voltage-gated calcium channels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Anti-muscle-specific tyrosine kinase antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against muscle specific kinase (anti-MuSK Ab).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Slow pupillary light response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: Reduced velocity and acceleration in the pupillary light response.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Collectionism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: Excessive or pathological tendency to save and collect possessions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Emotional blunting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: Inability to feel positive or negative emotions, feelings of detachment, or reduced emotional responsiveness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Hypersexuality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: Pathological persistent sexual disinhibiting behavior, directed towards oneself or others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Inappropriate crying
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: Uncontrolled episodes of crying occur without any apparent motivating stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Inertia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: Reduction of goal-directed behaviors linked to the impairment in frontal executive functions (planning of an action for example).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Limb apraxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: Difficulty in performing the correct execution of limbs movements in absence of motor impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Punding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: Punding is a stereotypical motor behavior characterized by an intense fascination with repetitive, excessive and non-goal oriented handling, and examining of objects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.label: Semantic dementia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003021.definition: A progressive loss of the ability to remember the meaning of words, faces and objects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Socially inappropriate behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: Behavior that is not in line with social norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Sweet craving
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: Excessive desire to eat sweet foods.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Visual agnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: The condition is known as visual agnosia, which refers to the inability to recognize objects that are visually presented, even though the individual may have normal visual field, acuity, color vision, brightness discrimination, language, and memory.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Perseverative thought
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: Manifestations of perseverative thoughts are behaviors that do not meet the demands of the situation, are not the product of deliberation, and may unfold despite counter intention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Abnormal muscle fiber desmin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: A deviation from normal in the expression of desmin in muscle tissue. Desmin is an 53-kDa protein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Accumulation of muscle fiber desmin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation of desmin protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Abnormal muscle fiber myotilin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: A deviation from normal in the expression of myotilin in muscle tissue. Myotilin is a 57kDa cytoskeletal protein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Accumulation of muscle fiber myotilin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation of myotilin protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Abnormal muscle fiber valosin-containing protein
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: A deviation from normal in the expression of valosin-containing protein in muscle tissue. Valosin-containing protein is an ubiquitously expressed multifunctional 100-kD protein that is a member of the AAA+ (ATPase associated with various activities) protein family.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.label: Accumulation of muscle fiber valosin-containing protein
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003022.definition: Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation of valosin-containing protein in the muscle biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.label: Central core regions in muscle fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.definition: The presence of disorganized areas called cores in the center of muscle fibers. There is a typical appearance of the biopsy on light microscopy, where the muscle cells have cores that are devoid of mitochondria and specific enzymes. Cores are typically well demarcated and centrally located, but may occasionally be multiple and of eccentric.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.label: Glycogen accumulation in muscle fiber lysosomes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.definition: An increased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue found specifically in lysosomes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.label: Increased sarcoplasmic glycogen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.definition: Elevated glycogen content in the sarcoplasm (cytoplasm) of muscle fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.label: Bethlem sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.definition: Limitation of wrist and finger extension on asking patient to form a prayer sign. This is a result of progressive wrist and finger flexion contractures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.label: Highly elevated creatine kinase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.definition: An increased CPK level between 4X and 50X above the upper normal level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.label: Extremely elevated creatine kinase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.definition: An increased creatine kinase level more than 50X above the upper normal level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.label: Abnormality of muscle size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.definition: Abnormalities of the overall muscle bulk based on clinical observation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.label: Hand muscle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.definition: Reduced strength of the musculature of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.label: Hypoplasia of the upper arm musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003023.definition: Underdevelopment of the musculature of the upper arm, which may include the deltoid, the triceps, the biceps, and the brachioradialis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.label: Portal vein thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.definition: Thrombosis of the portal vein and/or its tributaries, which include the splenic vein and the superior and inferior mesenteric veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.label: Hepatic vein thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.definition: An obstruction in the veins of the liver caused by a blood clot (thrombosis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.label: Maternal fever in pregnancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.definition: The occurence of an elevated body temperature of the mother during pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.label: Intrapartum fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.definition: The occurence of maternal fever during labor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.label: Maternal first trimester fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.definition: The occurence of fever in a mother during the first trimester of pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.label: Splanchnic vein thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.definition: The term splanchnic vein thrombosis encompasses Budd-Chiari syndrome (hepatic vein thrombosis), extrahepatic portal vein obstruction (EHPVO), and mesenteric vein thrombosis; the word splanchnic is used to refer to the visceral organs (of the abdominal cavity).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.label: Mesenteric venous thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.definition: A clot that obstructs blood flow in a mesenteric vein (the superior and the inferior mesenteric vein drain blood from the small and large intestine).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.label: Enanthema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003024.definition: A sudden eruption (rash) of the surface of a mucous membrane of the mouth or pharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Pulmonary granulomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: The presence of multiple granulomata (small nodular inflammatory lesions containing grouped mononuclear phagocytes) in the lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Absence of memory B cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: Complete lack of memory B cells, that is, of mature B cell type that is long-lived, readily activated upon re-encounter of its antigenic determinant, and has been selected for expression of higher affinity immunoglobulin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Absent circulating B cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: Complete lack of mature B cells, that is, of B cells that have left the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Defective T cell proliferation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: A reduced ability of a T cell population to expand by cell division following T cell activation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Nail bed hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: Small areas of bleeding (hemorrhage) under the fingernail or toenail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Large intestinal polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: The presence of multiple polyps in the large intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Small intestinal polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: The presence of multiple polyps in the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Freckled genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: One or more brown punctate macules on the skin of the genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Hyperpigmented genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: Localized or generalized increased genital pigmentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.label: Hypopigmented genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003025.definition: Localized or generalized decreased genital pigmentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.label: Microphallus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.definition: Length of penis more than 2 SD below the mean for age accompanied by hypospadias.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.label: Narrow penis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.definition: Penile width more than 2 standard deviations (SD) below the mean for age. Alternatively circumference of the flaccid penis more than 2 SD below the mean for age. Alternatively, apparently decreased penile width for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.label: Torsion of the penis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.definition: Rotated position of the glans, with or without the penile shaft, of 30 degrees or more.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.label: Webbed penis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.definition: Ventral skinfold extending from penis to scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.label: Wide penis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.definition: Distance between left and right side of the flaccid penis at the attachment to the skin above the pubic symphysis more than 2 standard deviations above the mean for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.label: obsolete Abnormality of the sacroiliac notch
Calcification of the interosseus membrane of the forearm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.definition: Deposition of calcium salts in the fibrous sheet that connects the radius and the ulna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.label: Hyperplastic callus formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.definition: Increased growth of callus, the bony and cartilaginous material that forms a connecting bridge across a bone fracture during fracture healing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.label: Increased circulating insulin-like growth factor 1 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003026.definition: An elevated level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.label: Elevated red cell adenosine deaminase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.definition: Increase in the level of adenosine deaminase (ADA), an enzyme involved in purine metabolism, within erythrocytes. ADA is involved in the catabolism of adenosine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.label: Reduced erythrocyte 2,3-diphosphoglycerate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.definition: This term refers to an inappropriate low 2,3-DPG concentration in erythrocytes. 2,3-diphosphoglycerate (2,3-DPG) controls the movement of oxygen from red blood cells to tissues. Anemia is usually accompanied by an increased level of 2,3-DPG in order to promote tissue oxygenation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.label: Abnormal erythrocyte enzyme level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.definition: An altered level of any enzyme to act as catalysts within erythrocytes. This term includes changes due to altered activity of an enzyme.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.label: Reduced red cell adenosine deaminase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.definition: Decrease in the level of adenosine deaminase (ADA), an enzyme involved in purine metabolism, within erythrocytes. ADA is involved in the catabolism of adenosine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.label: Accessory scrotum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.definition: Additional scrotum, or part of a scrotum in an abnormal location.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.label: Ectopic scrotum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.definition: Scrotum in a position other than the usual position inferior to the base of the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.label: Abnormal vertebral pedicle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.definition: Abnormal morphology of a vertebral pedical.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.label: Hypoplastic L5 vertebral pedicle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003027.definition: Underdeveloped pedicle of the fifth lumbar vertebra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.label: Rib gap
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.definition: Radiolucent focal defect of a rib shaft.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.label: Cervical C3/C4 vertebral fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.definition: Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C3 and C4, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.label: Posterior rib gap
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.definition: Radiolucent focal defect of the posterior portion of a rib shaft. The 'gaps' may lead to flail chest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.label: Partial absence of the septum pellucidum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.definition: Only part of the septum pellucidum (a thin, triangular, vertical membrane separating the lateral ventricles of the brain) is present. This feature can be appreciated on magnetic resonance tomography or computed tomography of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.label: Triangular tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.definition: A form of macrogloassia (increased size of the tongue) characterized by a broad based root of the tongue but a small tongue tip, giving the appearance of a triangle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.label: Splayed superior cerebellar peduncle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.definition: Abnormal splayed configuration (spreading out) of the superior cerebellar peduncle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.label: Atrophic superior cerebellar peduncle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.definition: Atrophy of the superior cerebellar peduncle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.label: Flattened femoral epiphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003028.definition: An abnormal flattening of an epiphysis of femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.label: Unossified sacrum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.definition: Lack of ossification of the sacrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.label: Lower-limb metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of one or more metaphyses of a bone of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.label: Tibial metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of a metaphysis of a tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.label: Fibular metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of a metaphysis of a fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.label: Distal femoral metaphyseal abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003029.definition: An anomaly of the metaphysis of the distal femur (close to the knee).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.label: 10 pairs of ribs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.definition: Presence of only 10 (instead of the usual 12) pairs of ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.label: Abnormality of the anterior commissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.definition: An anomaly of the anterior commissure, a bundle of nerve fibers that connect the two cerebral hemispheres across the midline. The anterior commissure plays a role in pain sensation and contains decussating fibers from the olfactory tracts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.label: Abnormal number of vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.definition: A deviation from the normal number of vertebrae in the spinal column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.label: 11 thoracic vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.definition: The presence of 11 instead of the normal 12 thoracic vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.label: Flared lower limb metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.definition: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.label: Flared distal tibial metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.definition: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of the distal tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.label: Flared distal fibular metaphysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003030.definition: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of the distal fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.label: Upper extremity joint dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.definition: Displacement or malalignment of one or more joints in the upper extremity (arm).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.label: Lower extremity joint dislocation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.definition: Displacement or malalignment of one or more joints in the lower extremity (leg).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.label: Obliteration of the calvarial diploe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.definition: Absence of the spongy bone structure (or tissue) of the internal part of the skull cap (i.e., of the calvarial diploe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.label: Abnormal periosteum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.definition: An anomalous structure of the periosteum, i.e., of the membrane that covers the outer surface of bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.label: Angular cheilitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.definition: A type of inflammation of the lips involving one or both of the corners of the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.label: Weakness of facial musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003031.definition: Reduced strength of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.label: Increased intervertebral space
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.definition: An increase in the vertical distance between adjacent vertebral bodies, observed as an increase in the intervertebral disc space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.label: Abnormal vertebral artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.definition: An anomaly of the vertebral artery, the major artery of the neck that originates from the subclavian artery and merges to form the single midline basilar artery in a complex called the vertebrobasilar system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.label: Unilateral vertebral artery hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.definition: Underdevelopment of the vertebral artery on one side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.label: Bilateral vertebral artery hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.definition: Underdevelopment of the vertebral artery on both sides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.label: Cervicomedullary schisis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.definition: Fissure within the spinal cord of the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.label: Abnormal macrophage count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.definition: An anomaly in the number of macrophages.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.label: Abnormal osteoclast count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.definition: An anomaly in the number of osteoclasts in bone tissue, bone-resorbing cells that develop from macrophages. This finding can be observed by histological examination of bone tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.label: Decreased osteoclast count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.definition: Decreased number of osteoclasts in bone tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.label: Retinal thinning
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003032.definition: Reduced anteroposterior thickness of the retina. This phenotype can be appreciated by retinal optical coherence tomography (OCT).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.label: Multinucleated giant chondrocytes in epiphyseal cartilage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.definition: The presence of cartilage cells (chondrocytes) that are substantially increased in size and contain more than one nucleus and are located within the resting zone of the epiphyseal cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.label: Impaired stimulus-induced skin wrinkling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.definition: A reduced ability of the skin of the fingertips to wrinkle when exposed to stimuli such as soaking in water or application of EMLA cream (the fingertip remains smooth).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.label: Abnormal alpha-beta T cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.definition: A structuraly anomaly of T cells that express an alpha-beta T cell receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.label: Abnormal CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.definition: A structural anomaly of a CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta T cell. These cells are regulatory T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.label: Abnormal CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.definition: A deviation from the normal count of CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.label: Absence of CD4-positive, CD25-positive regulatory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.definition: Lack of CD4+CD25+ T regulatory cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.label: Elevated CD4-positive, CD25-positive regulatory T cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.definition: An increased number of CD4-positive, CD25-positive regulatory T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.label: Abnormal circulating gonadotropin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.definition: An anomaly of the circulating level of a gonadotropin, that is, of a protein hormone secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary of vertebrates. The primary gonadotropins are luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.label: Decreased circulating gonadotropin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003033.definition: A reduction of the circulating level of a gonadotropin, that is, of a protein hormone secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary of vertebrates. The primary gonadotropins are luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.label: Decreased circulating follicle stimulating hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.definition: A reduction of the circulating level of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.label: Decreased circulating luteinizing hormone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.definition: A reduction in the circulating level of luteinizing hormone (LH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.label: Abnormal circulating luteinizing hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.definition: An anomaly of the circulating level of luteinizing hormone (LH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.label: Abnormal circulating follicle-stimulating hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.definition: An anomaly of the circulating level of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.label: Abnormal circulating androgen level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.definition: An anomaly in the blood concentration of an androgen, that is, of a steroid hormone that controls development and maintenance of masculine characteristics. The androgens include testosterone and Dehydroepiandrosterone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.label: Increased circulating androgen concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.definition: An elevation of the blood concentration of an androgen, that is, of a steroid hormone that controls development and maintenance of masculine characteristics. The androgens include testosterone and Dehydroepiandrosterone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.label: Decreased circulating androgen concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003034.definition: A reduction in the blood concentration of an androgen, that is, of a steroid hormone that controls development and maintenance of masculine characteristics. The androgens include testosterone and Dehydroepiandrosterone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.label: Erythematous papule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.definition: A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid that is reddish (erythematous) in color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.label: Urticarial plaque
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.definition: A well-circumscribed, intensely pruritic, raised wheal (edema of the superficial skin) typically 1 to 2 cm in diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.label: Abnormal serum insulin-like growth factor 1 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.definition: An anomalous level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.label: Decreased serum insulin-like growth factor 1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.definition: A reduced level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.label: Abnormal circulating interferon concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.definition: Abnormal levels of interferon in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.label: Abnormal circulating interferon-gamma concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.definition: Abnormal levels of interferon gamma measured in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.label: Increased circulating interferon-gamma concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.definition: An elevation in the concentration of interferon gamma measured in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.label: Small cell lung carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.definition: Small cell lung cancer (SCLC) is a type of highly malignant lung cancer that is composed of small ovoid cells. In the past, SCLC was called oat cell carcinoma because the microscopic appearance of the cells was felt to resemble oats. SLCLC usually originates near the bronchi and in many cases may grow and metastasize quickly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.label: Squamous cell lung carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003035.definition: A type of non-small cell lung carcinoma that is derived from stratified squamous epithelial cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Large cell lung carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: A type of non-small cell lung carcinoma that is derived from undifferentiated malignant neoplasms originating from transformed epithelial cells in the lung, and which is differentiate from small-cell lung carcinoma by the larger size of the anaplastic cells, a higher cytoplasmic-to-nuclear size ratio, and a lack of salt-and-pepper appearance of the chromatin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Abnormal circulating eicosanoid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of an icosanoid (also known as eicosanoids). These are signaling molecules derived from oxidation of 20-carbon fatty acids. Most are produced from arachidonic acid, a 20-carbon polyunsaturated fatty acid (5,8,11,14-eicosatetraenoic acid).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Reduced muscle carnitine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: A reduction in the level of carnitine in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Primary Caesarian section
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: Delivery by Caesarian section representing the first time the mother has delivered by Caesarian section.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Secondary Caesarian section
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: Delivery by Caesarian section representing where the mother has already had a previous Cesarean delivery, and this is a repeat Cesarean birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Vaginal birth after Caesarian
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: Vaginal birth after Caesarian (VBAC) refers to the situation where the mother has had a previous Cesarean delivery but has now delivered vaginally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Delivery by Odon device
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: The Odon device is an instrument for assisted vaginal deliveries that is applied on the head of the baby and used to apply traction to assist the birth process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Finger hyperphalangy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: Hyperphalangy is a digit morphology in which increased numbers of phalanges are arranged linearly within a digit. That is, there is an accessory phalanx that is arranged linearly with the other phalanges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Hyperphalangy of the 2nd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: An accessory phalanx of the index (second) finger that is arranged linearly with the other phalanges. Hyperphalangy of the index finger results from an accessory ossification center at the metacarpophalangeal joint, resulting in radial deviation of the index finger. Note that this term refers only to this type of hyperphalangy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.label: Induced vaginal delivery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003036.definition: Vaginal delivery following induction of labor, a procedure used to stimulate uterine contractions during pregnancy before labor begins on its own.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003037.label: Abnormal proportion of naive B cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003037.definition: A deviation in the normal proportion of naive B cells (CD19+/CD27-/IgD+/IgM+) relative to the total number of B cells. Naive B cells represent one of the subtypes of B cells in the peripheral blood, and are B cells that have not been exposed to antigen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003037.label: Increased proportion of naive B cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003037.definition: An elevation above the normal proportion of naive B cells (CD19+/CD27-/IgD+/IgM+) relative to total number of B cells. Naive B cells represent one of the subtypes of B cells in the peripheral blood, and are B cells that have not been exposed to antigen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003037.label: Decreased proportion of naive B cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003037.definition: A reduction below normal proportion of naive B cells (CD19+/CD27-/IgD+/IgM+) relative to total number of B cells. Naive B cells represent one of the subtypes of B cells in the peripheral blood, and are B cells that have not been exposed to antigen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003037.label: Abnormal proportion of memory B cells
