http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.definition: Lower eyelid partly covered by skin when eyes are open.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.label: Hooded upper eyelid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.definition: Upper eyelid partly covered by skin when eyes are open.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.label: Scleral thickening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.definition: Increased dimension of the sclera in the anterior-posterior axis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.label: Mizuo phenomenon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.definition: Change in the color of the fundus from red in the dark-adapted state to golden immediately or shortly after the onset of the light. The color of the fundus reflex in the light adapted state has also been described as golden-yellow, gray-white, and yellow-white. This reflex can appear either homogeneous or in streaks in the fundus. The retinal vessels appear to be protruding in contrast to the radiant background. Dark adaptation leads to disappearance of the unusual fundus coloration [Digital Journal of Ophthalmology 2008; Volume 14, Number 14].

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.label: Absent foveal reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.definition: Lack of the foveal reflex, which normally occurs as a result of the reflection of light from the ophthalmoscope in the foveal pit upon examination. The foveal reflex is a bright pinpoint of light that is observed to move sideways or up and down in response to movement of the opthalmoscope.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.label: Eyelid fasciculation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.definition: Tiny, repetitive muscle contractions in the eyelids, causing the appearance of twitching.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.label: Wheezing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.definition: A high-pitched whistling sound associated with labored breathing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.label: Abnormal breath sound
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003082.definition: An anomalous (adventitious) sound produced by the breathing process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Crackles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: Crackles are discontinuous, explosive, and nonmusical adventitious lung sounds normally heard in inspiration and sometimes during expiration. Crackles are usually classified as fine and coarse crackles based on their duration, loudness, pitch, timing in the respiratory cycle, and relationship to coughing and changing body position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Rhonchi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: Abnormal breath sounds characterized by low-pitched, snoring or rattle-like sounds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Vitreous strands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: Fiber- or rope-like opacities located within the vitreous humor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Neck pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Shoulder pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the shoulder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Elbow pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the elbow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Wrist pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the wrist.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Finger pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Hip pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the hip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.label: Knee pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003083.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the knee.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.label: Ankle pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the ankle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.label: Toe pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.label: Choking episodes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.definition: Incidents in which a piece of food or other objects get stuck in the upper airway and provoke coughing, gagging, inability to talk, and difficulty breathing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.label: Cardiac amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.definition: Extracellular deposition in cardiac tissue of a proteinaceous material that, when stained with Congo red, demonstrates apple-green birefringence under polarized light and that has a distinct color when stained with sulfated Alcian blue. Viewed with electron microscopy, the amyloid deposits are seen to be composed of a beta-sheet fibrillar material. These nonbranching fibrils have a diameter of 7.5 to 10 nm and are the result of protein misfolding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.label: Undetectable pattern electroretinogram
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.definition: Absent response to a pattern electroretinogram (PERG).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.label: Heliotrope rash of eyelid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.definition: Heliotrope rash is a violaceous discoloration of the eyelids associated with periorbital edema.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.label: Abnormal jugular venous pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.definition: An anomaly of the jugular venous pressure. The internal jugular veins, being continuous with the superior vena cava, provide a visible measure of the degree to which the systemic venous reservoir is filled. The vertical height above the right atrium to which they are distended and above which they are in a collapsed state provides an imperfect reflection of the right atrial pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.label: Hepatojugular reflux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003084.definition: The examiner applies firm but persistent pressure over the liver for 10 seconds while observing the mean jugular venous pressure. Normally there is either no rise or only a transient (i.e., 2 to 3 sec) rise in mean jugular venous pressure. A sustained increase in the mean venous pressure until abdominal compression is released is abnormal and indicates impaired right heart function. This abnormal response is called hepatojugular reflux.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: Abnormal pulse pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: An anomaly of the pulse pressure, which is defined as the systolic pressured minus the diastolic pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: Low pulse pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: Reduced amplitude of the pulse pressure (systolic blood pressure minus diastolic blood pressure).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: High pulse pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: Increased amplitude of the pulse pressure (systolic blood pressure minus diastolic blood pressure).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: Heterotaxy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: An abnormality in which the internal thoraco-abdominal organs demonstrate abnormal arrangement across the left-right axis of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: Scleral staphyloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: A staphyloma is a localized defect in the eye wall with protrusion of uveal tissue due to alterations in scleral thickness and structure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: Anterior staphyloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: A localized defect in the anterior eye wall with protrusion of uveal tissue due to alterations in scleral thickness and structure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: Posterior staphyloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: A localized defect in the posterior eye wall with protrusion of uveal tissue due to alterations in scleral thickness and structure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: Eye movement-induced pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the eye that is worse in certain directions of gaze and during prolonged gaze holding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: Addictive behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: When an activity, substance, object, or behavior becomes a major focus of a person's life, excluding other activities, or has begun to harm the individual or others physically, mentally, or socially, it can be considered addictive behavior. A person can become addicted or compulsively engaged with anything.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.label: Anti-topoisomerase I antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003085.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against topoisomerase I.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Abnormal CSF amyloid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: Abnormal concentration of amyloid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Decreased CSF amyloid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: Reduced concentration of amyloid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Elevated CSF amyloid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: Increased concentration of amyloid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Nasal flaring
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: Widening of the nostrils upon inhalation as a manifestation of respiratory distress.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Intercostal retractions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: A pulling inward of the soft tissues between the ribs upon inhalation. This is a sign of increased use of the chest muscles for breathing and is a manifestation of respiratory distress.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Large elbow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: Abnormal increased size of the elbow joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Large knee
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: Abnormally increased size of the knee joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Vertical orbital dystopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: The orbits do not lie on the same horizontal plane, that is, one eye is lower than the other.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Monorchism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: Having only one testis in the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.label: Anorchism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003086.definition: An abnormality of XY sexual development characterized by the absence of both testes at birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.label: Abnormality of spinal facet joint
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.definition: An anomaly of the small joints located between and behind adjacent vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.label: Facet joint arthrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.definition: Osteoarthritis of facet joints in the spine. Degeneration of cartilage in the facet joints results in bone rubbing on bone and reactive new bone formation visible on X-ray.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.label: Abnormal cardiac ventricular function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.definition: An abnormality of the cardiac ventricular function.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.label: Anti-centromere antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against the centromeres or centromere components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.label: Oxygen desaturation on exertion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.definition: Oxygen saturation less than 95% on exertion or arterial partial pressure of oxygen falling by more than 1kPa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.label: Abnormality of pulmonary circulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.definition: A functional anomaly of that portion of the cardiosvascular system that carries deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs and returns oxygenated blood back to the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.label: Reduced FEV1/FVC ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.definition: Abnormally low FEV1/FVC (FEV1 - forced expiratory volume in 1 second; FVC forced vital capacity).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.label: Abnormality on pulmonary function testing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.definition: Any anomaly measure by pulmonary function testing, which includes spirometry, measures of diffusing capacity, and plethysmography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.label: Interlobular septal thickening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003087.definition: Presence of thickening of the interlobular septa of the lungs as seen on a CT scan.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.label: Shoulder impingement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.definition: Trapping and compression of the rotator cuff tendons during shoulder movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.label: Coronary artery aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.definition: Enlargement of the diameter (cross-section) of a coronary artery as defined by a focal dilation of a segment at least 1.5 times larger than the reference vessel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.label: Femoroacetabular impingement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.definition: Femoroacetabular impingement (FAI) results from one or more bony abnormalities that lead to abnormal contact between the acetabulum and the femoral head or neck. The femoral abnormality is proposed to cause compression and shear stresses in the region between the labrum and cartilage, anterosuperiorly. These stresses cause a separation between the labrum and cartilage as the labrum is pushed outwards and the cartilage is pushed centrally. This eventually leads to articular degeneration and eventually global hip osteoarthritis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.label: Gastrojejunal tube feeding in infancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.definition: Feeding problem necessitating gastrojejunal tube feeding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.label: Recurrent parasitic infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.definition: Increased susceptibility to parasitic infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of parasitic infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.label: Abnormal lymphocyte apoptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.definition: A anomaly in the rate of programmed cell death (apoptosis) in lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.label: Increased lymphocyte apoptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.definition: A elevation in the rate of apoptosis in lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.label: C3 nephritic factor positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against C3 convertase (C3bBb).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.label: Congenital shortened small intestine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003088.definition: Substantially shortened length of the small intestine as a result of a developmental defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: A brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Periventricular white matter hyperintensities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: Areas of brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the cerebral ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Deep cerebral white matter hyperintensities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: Areas of brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from locations distant from the ventricular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Abnormal response to short acting pulmonary vasodilator
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: Pulmonary vasodilator testing is performed during right-heart catheterization and involves a short-acting vasoactive agent such as adenosine, epoprostenol, or inhaled nitric oxide. The current definition of a normal (positive) response is a drop in mean pulmonary artery pressure of at least 10 mm Hg (or 20 percent) to below 40 mm Hg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Insufficient response to short acting pulmonary vasodilator
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: No fall in mean pulmonary arterial pressure (mPAP) falls by at least 10 mmHg to an absolute value less than 40 mmHg without a degradation in cardiac output (CO) in response to a short-acting vasoactive agent such as adenosine, epoprostenol, or inhaled nitric oxide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Abnormal gastrointestinal motility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: An anomaly of the muscular contractions that propel food though the gastrointestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Abnormal gastrointestinal transit time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: A deviation from the normal amount of time required for food to pass through the intestines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Decreased intestinal transit time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: A reduction in the length of time required for food to pass through the intestines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Pruritis on abdomen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.label: Pruritis on hand
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003089.definition: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Pruritus on foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Pruritis on breast
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the breast.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Palmomental reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: A type of primitive reflex characterized by an involuntary contraction of the mentalis muscle of the chin caused by stimulation of the thenar eminence of the palm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Grasp reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: A type of primitive reflex that can be elicated when the hand of the examiner is gently inserted into the palm of the patient's hand. The palmar surface is stroked or simply touched. The flexor surfaces of the fingers may be stimulated also by the examiner's fingers. The stimulus should be in a distal direction. With a positive response, the patient grasps the examiner's hand with variable strength and continues to grasp as the examiner's hand is moved. Ability to release the grip voluntarily depends on the activity of the reflex; some patients can do so readily, while others can even be lifted off the bed, since the grasp has such power [NCBI Books:NBK395].

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Glabellar reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by repetitive tapping on the forehead. Normal subjects usually blink in response to the first several taps, but if blinking persists, the response is abnormal and considered to be a sign of frontal release. Persistent blinking is also known as Myerson's sign.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Snout reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by tapping the upper lip lightly. The contraction of the muscles causes the mouth to resemble a snout.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Suck reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by lightly touching or tapping on the lips with an object such as a tongue blade, reflex hammer, or the examiner's finger. At times the reflex is obtained merely by approaching the lips with an object. A positive suck reflex consists of sucking movements by the lips when they are stroked or touched.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Thunderclap headache
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: Severe head pain with sudden onset, reaching its maximum intensity in less than one minute and lasting from one hour to ten days.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Liver kidney microsome type 1 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against P450 2D6, a cytochrome P450 mono-oxygenase. Anti-LKM-1 antibodies are considered to be a diagnostic marker of autoimmune hepatitis type 2 (AIH2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.label: Anti-liver cytosolic antigen type 1 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003090.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against a 60-kd peptide contained in the liver cytosolic fraction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003091.label: Bifid clitoris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003091.definition: Two clitorides located side by side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003091.label: Exaggerated rugosity of the labia majora
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003091.definition: Marked rugae formation of the skin of the labia majora.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003091.label: Abnormal peristalsis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003091.definition: An anomaly of the wave-like muscle contractions of the digestive tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003091.label: Cerebellar edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003091.definition: Swelling from fluid accumulation (serous fluid infiltration into the interstitial space) in the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.label: Oral erythroplakia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.definition: A velvety red but not ulcerated lesion of the oral mucosa. The texture may be roughened or normal, and the lesion is neither raised nor depressed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.label: Abnormal intestinal smooth muscle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.definition: A structural anomaly of the nonstriated, involuntary muscle tissue of the intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.label: Abnormal layering of muscularis propria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.definition: Abnormal layering of the intestinal muscularis propria into three layers; (1) inner circular; (2) additional oblique; and (3) outer longitudinal layer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.label: Fibrotic muscularis propria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.definition: The presence of excessive fibrous connective tissue in the muscularis propria of the intestine. Fibrosis is a reparative or reactive process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.label: Enteric intraneuronal nuclear inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.definition: Aggregates of stainable substances (proteins) in the nuclei of enteric neurons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.label: Palpebral thickening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003093.definition: An increased thickness of the eyelid not related to acute inflammation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003094.label: Conjunctival papillae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003094.definition: Raised tissue masses located on the palpebral conjunctiva with a central vessel. Papillae are created by a focal infiltration of inflammatory cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003094.label: Conjunctival follicles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003094.definition: Small, dome-shaped nodules without a prominent central vessel located on the conjunctiva. The lymphoid follicles are located in the subendothelial region of the conjunctiva. They consist of a germinal center that contains immature, proliferating lymphocytes, as well as a corona that contains mature lymphocytes and plasma cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003094.label: Elevated gamma-glutamyltransferase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003094.definition: Increased level of the enzyme gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT). GGT is mainly present in kidney, liver, and pancreatic cells, but small amounts are present in other tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003094.label: Glomerular deposits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003094.definition: An abnormal accumulation of protein in the glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.label: Pulmonary venous hypertension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.definition: An abnormal increase in pressure in the pulmonary veins, usually as a result of left atrial hypertension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.label: Skeletal muscle fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.definition: Excessive formation of fibrous bands of scar tissue in between muscle fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.label: Birdshot retinochoroidopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.definition: Multiple cream-yellow colored hypopigmented lesions typically located at the level of the choroid or retinal pigment epithelium; ovoid, cream-colored with indistinct borders. They are between 50 and 1,500 micrometers in size with a characteristic nasal, radial distribution in the postequatorial fundus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.label: Conjunctival hyperemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.definition: Dilatation of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva leading to a red appearance of the sclera.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.label: Addictive alcohol use
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.definition: An addictive behavior is defined as drinking excessive amounts of alcohol over a prolonged period of time, having difficulty in reducing the amount of alcohol consumed, strongly desiring alcohol, and experiencing withdrawal symptoms when not drinking alcohol.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.label: Abnormality of cardiovascular system electrophysiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.definition: An anomaly of the electrical conduction physiology of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.label: Ventricular septal aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.definition: A bowing (bulging to one side) of the interventricular septum of more than 15 mm on either side in adults and 5 mm in children during normal cardiac motion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.label: Membranous ventricular septal aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.definition: Bowing (bulging out) of the membranous part of the interventricular septum of more than 10-15 mm into the cavity of an adjacent ventricle (usually into the right ventricle).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.label: Muscular ventricular septal aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003095.definition: Bowing (bulging out) of the muscular part of the interventricular septum of more than 10-15 mm into the cavity of an adjacent ventricle (usually into the right ventricle).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.label: Microspherophakia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.definition: Lens of the eye is smaller than normal and spherically shaped.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.label: Abnormal morphology of the great vessels
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.definition: A structural anomaly affecting a blood vessel involved in the circulation of the heart, i.e., the superior or inferior vena cava, the pulmonary arteries, the pulmonary veins, and the aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.label: Aortic stiffness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.definition: The elastic properties of the aorta allow the aorta to store half of the cardiac ejected blood volume per beat, whereby aortic recoil during diastole pushes the remaining stored volume forward into the peripheral circulation, a phenomenon known as the Windkessel function. Aortic stiffness occurs as the elastic fibers within the arterial wall become disrupted due to mechanical stress (with age or due to other factors). Aortic stiffness refers to a reduction in the elasticity of the aorta, which is associated with an elevated pulse pressure, increased wave reflection, and often hypertension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.label: Abnormal pulmonary artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.definition: An abnormality of the structure of the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.label: Abnormal pulmonary artery physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.definition: An abnormality of the function of the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.label: Abnormal pulmonary vein morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.definition: An abnormality of the structure of the pulmonary veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.label: Abnormal pulmonary vein physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003096.definition: An abnormality of the function of the pulmonary veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.label: Abnormal vena cava physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.definition: An abnormality of the function of the veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body into the heart, i.e., the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.label: Abnormal systemic blood pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.definition: A chronic deviation from normal pressure in the systemic arterial system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.label: Postexertional symptom exacerbation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.definition: Post-exertional symptom exacerbation (PESE), also referred to as post-exertional malaise (PEM), is defined as the worsening of symptoms that can follow minimal cognitive, physical, emotional, or social activity, or activity that could previously be tolerated. Symptoms typically worsen 12 to 72 hours after activity and can last for days or even weeks, sometimes leading to a relapse.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.label: Cryptozoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.definition: A type of oligozoospermia in which spermatozoa can be detected in an ejaculate only after centrifugation and inspection of the pellet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.label: Pontine tegmental cap
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.definition: An abnormal curved or vaulted (capped) structure covering the middle third of the dorsal pontine tegmentum and projecting into the fourth ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.label: Abnormal factor VIII activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.definition: A deviation from the normal activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.label: Increased factor VIII activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.definition: Increased activity of the coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.label: Decreased CSF/serum albumin ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.definition: A reduction below normal limits of the ratio of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) albumin concentration to serum albumin concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.label: Dilatation of large choroidal vessels
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003097.definition: Enlargement of the large blood vessels in the choroid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.label: Reduced brain glutamine level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.definition: An decrease in the level of glutamine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.label: Abnormal CSF/serum albumin ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.definition: A deviation from the normal range of the ratio of the albumin concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) to the concentration in serum (which may be defined as 3.2-9.0). This is an index of blood-brain barrier (BBB) integrity, adjusted for the serum albumin concentration, and an increased ratio is taken as a sign of a loss of integrity of the BBB with leakage of albumin into the CSF.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.label: Ovarian thecoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.definition: A sex cord-stromal tumor of the ovary. Thecomas range from small tumors to large solid or solid-cystic masses of up to 15 cm. They are unilateral in over 90 percent of cases and are rarely malignant. Thecomas are stromal tumors made up of cells that resemble theca cells, lutein cells and fibroblasts. They are traditionally classified within the sex cord-stromal tumor category of ovarian tumor types.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.label: Abnormal serum bile acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of serum bile acid concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.label: Decreased serum bile acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.definition: A reduction in the concentration of bile acid in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.label: Biliary epithelial hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.definition: Hyperplasia of lining epithelia of the septal and large bile ducts manifesting as micropapillary projections or as a stratification of the epithelium with or without dilatation of the duct lumen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.label: Suppurative cholangitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.definition: Cholangitis characterized by the presence of numerous polymorphonuclear cells around and within the wall as well as within the lumen of the ducts. This may involve ducts of any size and is occasionally associated with abscess formation (cholangitic abscess).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.label: Granulomatous cholangitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.definition: Cholangitis characterized by the accumulation of granulomas. Granulomas are aggregates of modified macrophages (epithelioid cells) and other inflammatory cells that accumulate after chronic exposure to antigens. The underlying trigger may be exposure to noxious agents that cannot be biochemically degraded or to immune dysfunction. The ultimate result is a release of a variety cytokines that stimulate mononuclear cells that fuse to form multinucleated giant cells with a surrounding rim of lymphocytes and fibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.label: Lymphoid cholangitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003098.definition: Cholangitis characterized by a close association between duct branches, usually interlobular bile ducts, and lymphocytic aggregates, which may show a follicular arrangement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Pleomorphic cholangitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: Cholangitis associated with mixed inflammatory infiltrates and the presence of fibrosis or sclerosis of the biliary tree.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Sclerosing cholangitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: Cholangitis associated with evident ductal fibrosis that develops as a consequence of long-standing bile duct inflammatory, obstruction, or ischemic injury; it can be obliterative or nonobliterative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Abnormal pancreatic duct morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: Any structural anomaly of the pancreatic duct, which is the tubular structure that collects exocrine pancreatic secretions and transports them to the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Duplication of pancreatic duct
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: A congenital anomaly characterized by the presence of two separate pancreatic ducts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Pancreas divisum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: A congenital anomaly of the pancreas that results from failed fusion of the dorsal and ventral ducts during embyological development. Three variants have been described: type 1 or classical divisum in which there is total failure of fusion; type 2 in which dorsal drainage is dominant in the absence of the duct of Wirsung; and type 3 or incomplete divisum where a small communicating branch is present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Peritoneal effusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: An increase in the amount of fluid present in the peritoneal cavity (between the layers of the peritoneum that lines the abdomen).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Megaduodenum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: Dilation and elongation of the duodenum with hypertrophy of all layers of the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Atretic vas deferens
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: Abnormal closure or blockage of the vas deferens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Cerebrospinal fluid rhinorrhoea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: Drainage of cerebrospinal fluid through the nose. This can occur when there is a fistula between the dura and the skull base and discharge of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.label: Abnormal vestibular saccule morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003099.definition: Any structural anomaly of the saccule of the vestibule. The saccule is the otolith organ that senses motions in the sagittal plane (i.e., up-down movement).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.label: Vestibular saccular degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.definition: Deterioration or loss of the tissues of the saccule of the vestibule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.label: Minifascicle formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.definition: A nerve fascicle or fasciculus is a small bundle of axons, enclosed by the perineurium. A minifascule refers to a group of thinly myelinated and unmyelinated axons surrounded by a delicate perineurium, and with a smaller diameter than a normal nerve fascicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.label: Hemiareflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.definition: Areflexia that is limited to one side of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.label: Acroparesthesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.definition: A type of paresthesia (tingling, pins-and-needles, burning or numbness or stiffness) that occurs in the hands and feet and particularly in the fingers and toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.label: Orofacial action-specific dystonia induced by speech
Lingual dystonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.definition: Involuntary protrusions, movements, spams and contortions of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.label: Ainhum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003100.definition: Development of a fibrotic constriction ring involving the base of one or more toes, conditioning eversion and absorption of distal structures, possibly progressing to spontaneous amputation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Hyperphalangy of the 3rd finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: An accessory phalanx of the third (middle) finger that is arranged linearly with the other phalanges. Hyperphalangy results from an accessory ossification center at the metacarpophalangeal joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Fatty streak
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: Yellow-colored streaks, patches, or spots on the intimal surface of arteries. Fatty streaks stain red with Sudan III or Sudan IV.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Thin-cap fibroatheroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: Thin-cap fibroatheroma is characterized by a relatively large necrotic core with an overlying thin fibrous cap measuring less than 65 micrometers and typically containing numerous macrophages, and is considered to be the precursor lesion of plaque rupture which is the most common cause of coronary thrombosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Ankylosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: A reduction of joint mobility resulting from changes involving the articular surfaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Arteria lusoria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: Usually, three large arteries arise from the arch of the aorta: the brachiocephalic trunk (divided into the right common carotid artery and the right subclavian artery), the left common carotid artery, and the left subclavian artery. However, when aberrant right subclavian artery variant is present, the brachiocephalic trunk is absent and four large arteries arise from the arch of the aorta: the right common carotid artery, the left common carotid artery, the left subclavian artery, and the final one with the most distal left sided origin, the right subclavian artery, also called the arteria lusoria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Intrahepatic portal vein sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: Sclerosis of the intrahepatic portal veins of the liver and generally accompanied by non-cirrhotic portal hypertension, features of which may include splenomegaly and varices.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Alternating radiolucent and radiodense metaphyseal lines
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: Areas of radio-opaque sclerotic bands alternating with those of normal lucency give rise to stripes akin to a zebra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Swiss cheese atrial septal defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: Multiple defects in the atrial septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Eccrine syringofibroadenoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: Eccrine syringofibroadenoma (ESFA) is a benign adnexal tumor arising most often on the extremities of elderly individuals characterized by anastomosing cords of cuboidal epithelial cells surrounded by a fibrovascular stroma containing plasma cells and ductal structures. ESFA stains positively with epithelial membrane antigen (EMA) and carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.label: Pyknotic bone marrow neutrophils
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003101.definition: Nuclear lobes of neutrophils in the bone marrow are thickened and condensed, and individual lobes are connected by unusually long chromatin filaments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Bone marrow hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: A larger than normal amount or percentage of hematopoietic cells relative to marrow fat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Squamous Papilloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm characterized by a papillary growth pattern and a proliferation of neoplastic squamous cells without morphologic evidence of malignancy [NCI thesaurus].

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Oropharyngeal squamous papilloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: A benign exophytic neoplasm that arises from the oropharynx. It is characterized by the presence of a connective tissue core covered by stratified squamous epithelium [NCI thesaurus].

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Multiple mucosal neuromas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: Multiple painful, dome-shaped, translucent pink to skin-colored papules on oral mucosa. Histologically, the lesions may demonstrate dermal proliferation of well-demarcated nerve bundles associated with abundant mucin and surrounded by a distinct perineural sheath.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Cylindroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: A benign skin adnexal tumor of eccrine differentiation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Gastric leiomyosarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: A malignant neoplasm of the stomach that grows submucosally in the gastric wall. Necrosis and hemorrhage may be visible radiologically. Histologically, spindle cells with abnormal mitotic activity may be visible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Snail-like ilia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: The ilia is round and hypoplastic with a very flat acetabular roof and a very unusual medial projection of bone that is said to resemble the head of a snail. Figure 4 of PMID:3799723 illustrates this feature.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Internal notch of the femoral head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: A small V-shaped indentation on the internal aspect of the femoral head. This feature is well illustrated in Figure 5 of PMID:11694546.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Lactescent serum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: Serum sample with a grossly white (milk-like, i.e., lactescent) appearance. This feature is indicative of an extremely elevated serum triglyceride level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.label: Elevated carcinoembryonic antigen level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003102.definition: An increased blood concentration of the carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA). CEA is a member of the immunoglobulin supergene family. The human CEA gene family is clustered on chromosome 19q and comprises 29 genes. CEA is highly expressed in embryonic tissue and in some cancers, and is a widely used tumor marker.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Elevated carcinoma antigen 125 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: An increased blood concentration of carcinoma antigen 125 (CA-125). CA-125, also known as mucin 16, can exhibit increased blood levels in certain types of cancer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Abnormal retinol-binding protein level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: A deviation from normal blood concentration of retinol-binding protein (RBP). The most commonly used indicator of vitamin A status is the serum retinol concentration (retinol is one of the several compounds known as vitamin A). The serum RBP concentration is used as a surrogate measure for serum retinol.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Decreased retinol-binding protein level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: A reduced blood concentration of retinol-binding protein. This finding predicts vitamin A deficiency with high sensitivity and specificity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Impaired urinary acidification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: The kidney contributes towards acid-base homeostasis by excreting H+ ions and retaining bicarbonate. This process is known as acidification of the urine. The pH of urine ranges normally from 4.5 to 8. The inability to reduce the pH of the urine in a situation where it would be otherwise expected is known as an acidification defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Abnormal insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: A deviation from the normal blood concentration of the insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit (IGFALS; Entrez Gene ID 3483). The acid-labile subunit (IGFALS) acts in the insulin-like growth (IGF) system by binding circulating IGF1 in a ternary complex with binding protein (IGFBP)-3 to prevent IGF1 from crossing the endothelial barrier.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Chronic infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: Presence of a protracted or persistent infection by a pathogen potentially related to an underlying abnormality of the immune system that is not able to clear the infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Reduced growth-hormone binding protein level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: A decreased blood concentration of growth hormone binding protein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Reduced insulin-like factor 3 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: Blood concentration of insulin-like factor 3 (ILF3) is below normal limits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Spermatogenesis maturation arrest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: Maturation arrest (MA) is defined as germ cells that fail to complete maturation. Uniform MA is characterized by spermatogenic arrest at the same stage of spermatogenesis throughout the seminiferous tubules. MA is subcategorized into early MA, in which only spermatogonia or spermatocytes are found, and late MA, in which spermatids are detected without spermatozoa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.label: Spermatocyte maturation arrest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003103.definition: A type of spermatogenesis maturation arrest in which the block of developmental occurs in the spermatocyte stage. Testicular histology shows seminiferous tubules with Sertoli cells, spermatogonial cells and spermatocytes but no further differentiated cells like round spermatids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Round spermatid arrest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: A failure of spermatogenesis to progress beyond the round spermatid stage. The round spermatid is the first haploid cells produced during spermatogenesis and normally further develop into mature spermatozoa. This abnormality can be visualized with testicular biopsy and is characterized seminiferous tubules with increased numbers of round spermatids with few or no mature spermatozoa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Obstruction of the superior vena cava
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: Blockage of blood flow through the superior vena cava (SVC). Because the venous drainage from the upper extremities, upper thorax and head is obstructed, SVC obstruction presents with symptoms related to engorgement of these areas. Both the degree of SVC compromise and the extent of collateral veins determine the varied clinical presentation, which can be as mild as slight facial and upper extremity edema or as dire as intracranial swelling, seizures, hemodynamic instability and tracheal obstruction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Strawberry tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: Inflammed tongue with hyperplastic (enlarged) fungiform papillae that is said to resemble a strawberry or raspberry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Type A4 brachydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: A type of brachydactyly characterized by brachymesophalangy affecting mainly the 2nd and 5th digits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Type A5 brachydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: A type of brachydactyly characterized by absent middle phalanges of digits 2 to 5.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Acral blistering
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: Bullae (defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls) of the skin with an acral distribution (affecting peripheral regions such as hands and feet).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Absent soft palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: A developmental defect characterized by lack of a soft palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Paraproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: An abnormal immunoglobulin or part of an Ig (light chain) in the circulation. Paraproteins are typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Light-chain paraproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: An abnormal immunoglobulin light chain in the circulation and typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.label: Heavy-chain paraproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003104.definition: An abnormal immunoglobulin heavy chain in the circulation and typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Whole-immunoglobulin paraproteinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: An abnormal immunoglobulin (heavy and light chain) in the circulation and typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Tarsal sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more tarsal bones of the foot. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Elevated vascular endothelial growth factor level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: Increased blood concentration of vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Coarctation in the transverse aortic arch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized to the region of the transverse aortic arch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Long segment coarctation of the aorta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a long segment of the arch of the aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Abnormal branching pattern of left aortic arch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: A deviance from the norm of the origin or course of the right brachiocephalic artery, the left common carotid artery, the left subclavian artery or the proximal vertebral arteries, whereby the aortic arch descends on the left as normal (as opposed to right aortic arch).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Fusiform cerebral aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: A localized circumferential (i.e., bulges on all sides) dilatation or ballooning of a cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Skin fissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: A clearly-defined and roughly linear cleavage in the skin that usually extends to the dermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Impairment of activities of daily living
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: Difficulty in performing one or more activities normally performed every day, such as eating, bathing, dressing, grooming, work, homemaking, and leisure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.label: Impaired ability to bathe oneself
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003105.definition: This term applies to an individual who requires help to bathe more than one part of the body, get in or out of the tub or shower, or who requires total bathing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.label: Impaired ability to dress oneself
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.definition: This applies to an individual who needs help with dressing or needs to be completely dressed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.label: Impaired toileting ability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.definition: This term applies to an individual who requires help transferring to the toilet, cleaning self or who uses bedpan or commode.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.label: Impaired transferring ability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.definition: Applies to an individual who needs help in moving from bed to chair or requires a complete transfer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.label: Impaired feeding ability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.definition: Applies to an individual who needs partial or total help with feeding or requires parenteral feeding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.label: Impaired continence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.definition: Partial or total incontinence of bowel or bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.label: Empty ovarian follicle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.definition: A failure to collect oocytes after an apparently normal controlled ovarian hyperstimulation cycle for in vitro fertilization.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.label: Abnormal femoral torsion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003106.definition: Femoral torsion, also known as femoral rotation or femoral version, refers to the twist between the proximal and distal parts of the femur on the transverse plane. Femoral anteversion averages between 30-40 degress at birth, and between 8-14 degrees in adults. This term applies if the amount of femoral torsion deviates from this range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.label: Abnormal endocrine morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.definition: Any anomaly of the structure of an organ ofthe endocrine system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.label: Abnormal endocrine physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.definition: Any anomaly of the function of the endocrine system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.label: Abnormal response to endocrine stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.definition: An anomalous response to a test that is designed to probe the function of the endocrine system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.label: Abnormal response to ACTH stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.definition: An anomolous response to stimulation by adminstration of the adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH). ACTH stimulation normally stimulates the adrenal glands to release cortisol and adrenaline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.label: Abnormal response to insulin tolerance test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.definition: An anomalous response to the insulin tolerance test (ITT), in which insulin is administered intravenously and blood glucose and potentially other compounds are measured at intervals. Insulin administration is intended to induce extreme hypoglycemia (bloodgluoce below 40 mg/dl), which in turn induces release of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone (GH). ACTH induces the adrenal gland to release cortisol, which together with GH opposes the action of insulin on the blood glucose level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.label: Impaired cortisol response to insulin stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.definition: Failure of cortisol levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the insulin tolerance test (ITT).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.label: Abnormal response to corticotropin releasing hormone stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.definition: An anomalous response to the corticotropin releasing hormone (CRH) stimulation test. Normally,CRH is released by the hypothalamus to induce adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) release by the anterior pituitary. In the stimulation test, CRH is administered intravenously and ACTH and cortisol are measured at intervals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.label: Impaired cortisol response to corticotropin releasing hormone stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.definition: Failure of cortisol levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the corticotropin releasing hormone stimulation test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.label: Impaired growth-hormone response to insulin stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003107.definition: Failure of growth hormone levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the insulin tolerance test (ITT).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.label: Abnormal response to glucagon stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.definition: An anomalous response to the glucagon stimulation test, which like the insulin tolerance test (ITT) stimulates the release of both adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone (GH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.label: Impaired cortisol response to glucagon stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.definition: Failure of cortisol levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the glucagon stimulation test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.label: Impaired growth-hormone response to glucagon stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.definition: Failure of growth hormone levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the glucagon stimulation test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.label: Abnormal response to human chorionic gonadotrophin stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.definition: An anomalous response to intravenous stimulation by human chorionic gonadotrophin. Stimulation with hCG stimulates testicular Leydig cells to secrete androgens via the Leydig hormone receptors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.label: Excessive insulin response to glucagon test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.definition: An abnormally high increase in insulin levels following a glucagon stimulation test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.label: Decreased prealbumin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.definition: A reduced concentration of prealbumin in the blood. Prealbumin, also known as transthyretin, has a half-life in plasma of about 2 days, much shorter than that of albumin. Prealbumin is therefore more sensitive to changes in protein-energy status than albumin, and its concentration closely reflects recent dietary intake rather than overall nutritional status.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.label: Ectopic ovary
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.definition: Undescended or ectopic ovaries are characterized by the attachment of the upper pole of the ovary to an area above the level of the common iliac vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.label: Absent pubertal growth spurt
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.definition: The abrupt and transient increase in the annual growth rate normally observed in adolescent individuals does not occur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.label: Palatal edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003108.definition: Swelling related to fluid accumulation within the palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Finger dactylitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: Fingers appear swollen and plump owing to inflammation of the complete finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Toe dactylitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: Toes appear swollen and plump owing to inflammation of the complete toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Spindle-shaped finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: Swelling of the hand at the knuckles, that gives the fingers a spindle shape (i.e., a round stick with tapered end and a broader base).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Abnormal breast morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: Any anomaly of the structure of the breast.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Abnormal breast physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: Any anomaly of the function of the breast.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Abnormal humerus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: Any anomaly of the structure of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Delayed vertebral ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: A decrease in the amount of mineralized bone in one or more vertebrae compared with that expected for a given developmental age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Abnormal thyroid-stimulating hormone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: Any deviation from the normal amount of the thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH), which is produced by the anterior pituitary gland and stimulates the function of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Decreased thyroid-stimulating hormone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: Reduced amount of the thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH), which is produced by the anterior pituitary gland and stimulates the function of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.label: Abnormal circulating inhibin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003109.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of inhibins, which are heterodimeric protein hormones secreted by granulosa cells of the ovary in females and Sertoli cells of the testis in males. Inhibins suppress the secretion of pituitary follicle-stimulating hormone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: Decreased inhibin B level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: A reduced concentration of inhibin B in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: Abnormal circulating antimullerian hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the antimullerian hormone, a peptide produced by the granulosa cells of follicles. Anti-Mullerian hormone (AMH), also known as Mullerian inhibiting substance, is produced by the granulosa cells of small antral follicles of the ovary. AMH has an inhibiting role in the ovary, contributing to follicular arrest. AMH levels in women are low until the age of 8, rise rapidly until puberty and decline steadily from the age of 25 until menopause, when AMH production ceases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: Increased circulating antimullerian hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: An elevation above the normal range of the antimullerian hormone in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: Decreased cirrculating antimullerian hormone circulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: A reduction below the normal range of the antimullerian hormone in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: Insulin receptor antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against the insulin receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: Abnormal uterus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: Any anomaly of the structure of the uterus

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: T-shaped uterus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: An abnormality of the uterus characterized by a normal uterine outline but with an abnormal T-shaped uterine cavity with narrowing cavity due to thickened lateral walls with a correlation 2/3 uterine corpus and 1/3 cervix. The abnormlaity is said to resemble the letter T in hysterosalpingographic imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: Decreased fibular diameter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: Reduced width of the cross sectional diameter of the fibula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: Triceps weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: A lack of strength in the triceps muscle, which normally is responsible for extending (straightening) the elbow and mediating certain shoulder movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.label: Agalactia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003110.definition: Failure of secretion of milk following childbirth associated with an inability to breastfeed an infant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.label: Twin-to-twin transfusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.definition: As a result of sharing a single placenta, the blood supplies of monochorionic twin fetuses can become connected, so that they share blood circulation: although each fetus uses its own portion of the placenta, the connecting blood vessels within the placenta allow blood to pass from one twin to the other.Depending on the number, type and direction of the interconnecting blood vessels (anastomoses), blood can be transferred disproportionately from one twin (the donor) to the other (the recipient). This state of transfusion causes the donor twin to have decreased blood volume, retarding the donor's development and growth. The blood volume of the recipient twin is increased, which can strain the fetus's heart and eventually lead to heart failure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.label: Cutaneous hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.definition: A hamartoma (tissue malformation consisting of an abnormal mixture of constitutive components) originating in the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.label: Purely bicuspid aortic valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.definition: A type of bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) characterized by two equal-sized cusps, with no raphe and only two commissures. There is a lateral arrangement of the free edge of the cusps. Note that this differs from some other forms of BAV in which there are three commissures and two of the three cusps are joined by a raphe forming two functional leaflets. This type of BAV often is associated with aortic stenosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.label: Single raphe bicuspid aortic valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.definition: A type of bicuspid aortic valvue (BAV) characterized by the presence of a single raphe that extends from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps, resulting in two leaflets of unequal size.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.label: Bicuspid aortic valve with right-left cusp fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003111.definition: A type of bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) characterized by a single raphe between the right and left cusps (RL fusion pattern). This results in two leaflefts with an anterior-posterior leaflet orientation (also called the typical pattern). There is thus one completely developed noncoronary cusp, two completely developed commissures, and one raphe between the underdeveloped left and right coronary cusps extending to the corresponding malformed commissure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Bicuspid aortic valve with right-noncoronary cusp fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: A type of bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) characterized by a single raphe between the right and noncoronary cusps (RN fusion pattern). This results in two leaflets with right-left leaflet orientation (also called the atypical pattern). There is thus one completely developed left cusp, two completely developed commissures, and one raphe between the underdeveloped right and noncoronary coronary cusps extending to the corresponding malformed commissure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Bicuspid aortic valve with left-noncoronary cusp fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: A type of bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) characterized by a single raphe between the left and noncoronary cusps (LN fusion pattern). There is thus one completely developed right cusp, two completely developed commissures, and one raphe between the underdeveloped left and noncoronary coronary cusps extending to the corresponding malformed commissure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Two-raphe bicuspid aortic valve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: A type of bicuspid aortic valvue (BAV) characterized by the presence of two raphes that each extend from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps. This type of BAV has developmental anlagen of three cusps, commissures, and sinuses, but two commissures are more or less malformed and obliterated, giving rise to a raphe, a fibrous ridge, which extends from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps. This type of BAV is typically associated with a high degree of aortic stenosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Recurrent gastroenteritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: Increased susceptibility to gastroenteritis, an infectious inflammationof the stomach and small intestines manifested by signs and symptoms such as diarheas and abdominal pain, as manifested by recurrent episodes of gastroenteritis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Decreased platelet thromboxane A2 receptor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of thromboxane A2 receptor that is stimulated by thromboxane A2 (TBXA2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Decreased platelet alpha-2A-adrenergic receptor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of alpha-2A adrenergic receptor that is stimulated by epinephrine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Impaired clot retraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: Platelets contain contractile proteins (actin and myosin) that induce clot retraction. As the platelets contract, they pull on the surrounding fibrin strands, squeezing serum form the mass, compacting the clot and drawing the ruptured edges of the blood vessel more closely together. Clot retraction is directly proportional to the platelet count and inversely proportional to the fibrinogen concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Impaired convulxin-induced platelet aggregation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: Abnormal response to convulxin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of convulxin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Impaired collagen-related peptide-induced platelet aggregation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: Abnormal response to collagen-related peptide (CRP) as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of CRP.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.label: Impaired phorbol myristate acetate-induced platelet aggregation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003112.definition: Abnormal response to phorbol myristate acetate (PMA) as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of PMA.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Impaired calcium ionophore-induced platelet aggregation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: Abnormal response to calcium Ionophore (such as A23187) as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of the ionophore.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Abnormal platelet phosphatidylserine exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: An abnormality of phosphatidylserine (PS) on activated platelets. PS is normally located on the cytoplasmic face of the resting platelet membrane but appears on the plasma-oriented surface of discrete membrane vesicles that derive from activated platelets. Thrombin, the central molecule of coagulation, is produced from prothrombin by a complex (prothrombinase) between factor Xa and its protein cofactor (factor V(a)) that forms on platelet-derived membranes. This complex enhances the rate of activation of prothrombin to thrombin by roughly 150,000 fold relative to factor X(a) in solution. The negatively charged surface of PS-containing platelet-derived membranes is at least partly responsible for this rate enhancement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Impaired annexin V binding to platelet phosphatidylserine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: Reduced binding of annexin V to platelet membrane, which is mediated by exposed phosphatidylserine. This can be measured by flow cytometry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Increased annexin V binding to platelet phosphatidylserine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: Elevated binding of annexin V to platelet membrane, which is mediated by exposed phosphatidylserine. This can be measured by flow cytometry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Cor triatrium sinister
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: A developmental anomaly of the heart characterized by the presence of three atria because the left atrium is divided by an abnormal septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Triggered by physical trauma
