http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to a trauma (injury to tissue).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Decreased acrosin in sperm head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: A reduced amount of the enzyme acrosin in the sperm head acrosome. The acrosome is an organelle in the anterior half of the head of spermatozoa, and acrosin is a protease that contributes to the digestation of the zona pellucida in the fertilization process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Storage in hepatocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: Hepatocytes (liver parenchymal cells) exhibit a bloated appearance because of expansion of the cytoplasm by accumulated material.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Abnormal B-type natriuretic peptide concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.label: Frog-leg posture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003113.definition: A type of rest posture in an infant that indicated a generalized reduction in muscle tone. The hips are flexed and the legs are abducted to an extent that causes the lateral thigh to rest upon the supporting surface. This posture is said to resemble the legs of a frog.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.label: Abnormal liver sonography
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.definition: An abnormal appearance of the liver or any of its components on sonography (ultrasound).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.label: Increased hepatic echogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.definition: Increased echogenicity of liver tissue on sonography, manifested as an increased amount of white on the screen of the sonography device.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.label: Abnormal hepatic echogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.definition: Any deviation from the normal degree of echogenicity of the liver on sonography. Echogenicity refers to the ability of a tissue to reflect or transmit ultrasound waves in the context of surrounding tissues. Whenever there is an interface of structures with different echogenicities, a visible difference in contrast will be apparent on the screen. Based on echogenicity, a structure can be characterized as hyperechoic (white on the screen), hypoechoic (gray on the screen) and anechoic (black on the screen).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.label: Decreased hepatic echogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.definition: Reduced echogenicity of liver tissue on sonography, manifested as an increased amount of black on the screen of the sonography device.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.label: Coarsened hepatic echotexture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.definition: The appearance of the liver in sonographic images is normally uniform. This term applies when there is an irregular or non-uniform appearance of the liver parenchyma in liver sonography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.label: Starry sky appearance on hepatic sonography
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.definition: An abnormal echotexture visible in liver ultrasound manifesting as a diffuse hyperechoic liver echotexture with multiple, small hypoechoic lesions. The appearance is said to resemble a starry sky (multiple white spots on a dark background).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.label: Impaired oral bolus formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003114.definition: An abnormality of swallowing characterized by reduced tongue coordination to form bolus after chewing. Food material spreads over the oral cavity instead of being concentrated into a bolus that is easily swallowed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Vitreomacular adhesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: Perifoveal vitreous separation with remaining vitreomacular attachment and unperturbed foveal morphologic features. It is an OCT finding that is almost always the result of normal vitreous aging, which may lead to pathologic conditions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Vitreomacular traction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: Vitreomacular traction is characterized by anomalous posterior vitreous detachment accompanied by anatomic distortion of the fovea, which may include pseudocysts, macular schisis, cystoid macular edema, and subretinal fluid. Vitreomacular traction can be subclassified by the diameter of vitreous attachment to the macular surface as measured by OCT, with attachment of 1500 micrometers or less defined as focal and attachment of more than 1500 micrometers as broad.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Full-thickness macular hole
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: Full-thickness macular hole (FTMH) is defined as a foveal lesion with interruption of all retinal layers from the internal limiting membrane to the retinal pigment epithelium. Full-thickness macular hole is primary if caused by vitreous traction or secondary if directly the result of pathologic characteristics other than vitreomacular traction. Full-thickness macular hole is subclassified by size of the hole as determined by OCT and the presence or absence of vitreomacular traction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Membranous vitreous appearance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: Vitreous humor of the eye displaying consisting of a vestigial gel in the retrolental space bounded by a convoluted membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Beaded vitreous appearance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: Vitreous humor of the eye displaying beaded bundles of irregular diameters.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Increased Arden ratio of electrooculogram
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: An abnormal increase in the Arden ratio, which is the ratio between the light peak and the dark trough of the smoothed (physiologic) EOG record.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Decreased platelet glycoprotein Ib
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: Decreased platelet cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein Ib.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Carotid cavernous fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: An abnormal connection between a carotid artery and the cavernous sinus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Widened atrophic scar
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: An atrophic scar (fibrous connective tissue resulting from incomplete healing of a wound) that has stretched (gotten wider), a manifestation of tissue fragility.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.label: Thinning of Descemet membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003115.definition: A reduction in the thickness of Descemet's membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.label: Myelokathexis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.definition: Impaired egress of mature neutrophils from bone marrow causing neutropenia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.label: Reduced brain glutamate level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.definition: An decrease in the level of glutamate (Glu) in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.label: Impaired oropharyngeal swallow response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.definition: Delay or absence of the swallow response, reflexes triggered by the contact the food bolus makes with the anterior faucial pillars.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.label: Low femoral bone density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.definition: Reduced bone mineral density of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.label: Growth arrest lines
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.definition: Growth arrest lines are alternating transverse rings of sclerosis at the metaphysis of a long bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.label: Multifocal seizures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.definition: Seizures that start from several different areas of the brain (i.e., with multiple ictal onset locations).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.label: Eyelid myokymia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.definition: Involuntary, fine, continuous, undulating contractions of the eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.label: Triggered by ingestion of potassium-rich food
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating or drinking foods rich in potassium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.label: Postterm pregnancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003116.definition: A pregnancy that extends to 42 weeks of gestation or beyond.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Female fetal virilization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: Fetal masculinization of female external genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Femoral spur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: A bony projection (spur, osteophyte) originating from the femur, often in the medial femoral neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Sectoral retinitis pigmentosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: A variant of retinitis pigmentosa in which there is a regional distribution of the retinal degeneration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Tibial spur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: A bony projection (spur, osteophyte) originating from the tibia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Double-layered patella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: An anomaly of the patella characterized by two layers visible on lateral knee X-ray such that one layer is in front of the other in the sagittal orientation (See Figure 2A and 3B of PMID:12966518). This finding persists into adulthood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Absent cervical vertebra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: A developmental defect characterized by agenesis of one or more vertebral bodies of the cervical spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Absent thoracic vertebra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: A developmental defect characterized by agenesis of one or more vertebral bodies of the thoracic spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Finger flexor weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: Reduced ability to flex (bend) the fingers. This can manifest as incomplete closure of the hand due to weakness in finger flexion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Fixed head retroflexion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: Head is bent in the posterior direction in a permanent fashion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.label: Nuchal rigidity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003117.definition: Resistance of the extensor muscles of the neck to being bent forwards (i.e., impaired neck flexion) as a result of muscle spasm of the extensor muscles of the neck. Nuchal rigidity is not a fixed rigidity. Nuchal rigidity has been used as a bedside test for meningism, although its sensitivity for this purpose has been debated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.label: Erythema migrans
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.definition: An expanding erythematous (red) skin lesion, usually round or oval, by definition at least 5 cm in size (in largest diameter).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.label: Necrolytic migratory erythema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.definition: Acral or periorificial lesions that evolve in recurrent crops, with an annular and migratory distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.label: Increased circulating NT-proBNP concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.definition: An elevated level of circulating N-terminal part of the prohormone of B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.label: Abnormal circulating deoxycorticosterone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.definition: An abnormality of the concentration of deoxycorticosterone in the blood. Deoxycorticosterone comprises 11-deoxycorticosterone and 21-deoxycorticosterone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.label: Abnormal circulating pregnenolone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.definition: An abnormality of the concentration of pregnenolone in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.label: Genital edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.definition: A buildup of fluid that causes swelling in the soft tissues of the genital area.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.label: Wrist drop
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003118.definition: A condition in which the affected individual cannot extend the wrist, which hangs flaccidly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Superficial dermal perivascular inflammatory infiltrate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: Numerous lymphocytes surrounding blood vessels in the superfical part of the dermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Deep dermal perivascular inflammatory infiltrate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: Numerous lymphocytes surrounding blood vessels in the deep part of the dermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Abnormal morphology of left ventricular trabeculae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: Any structural anomaly of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the left ventricle of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Abnormal morphology of right ventricular trabeculae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: Any structural anomaly of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the right ventricle of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Increased density of left ventricular trabeculae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: An increased density (number and tightness) of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the left ventricles of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Apical hypertrabeculation of the left ventricle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: An increased number and density of the trabeculae in the apex (tip) of the left ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Thin myocardium compact layer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: Reduced thickness of the outer, dense layer of the myocardium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Cellular urinary casts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: A type of urinary cast composed of cells incorporated in a protein matrix. The cells can be those found in the urinary sediment (erythrocytes, leuklocytes, renal tubular epithelial cells).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Renal tubular epithelial cell casts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: A type of cellular urinary cast composed of renal tubular epithelial cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.label: Acellular urinary casts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003119.definition: A type of urinary cast composed of a proteinaceous matrix without a substantial number of cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Hyaline casts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: A type of acellular urinary cast that are composed only of Tamm-Horsfall glycoprotein, a fact which explains their low refractive index. Hyaline casts may display a spectrum of morphologies, which includes fluffy, compact, convoluted or wrinkled casts. Hyaline casts have a smooth texture and usually have parallel sides with clear margins and blunted ends.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Granular casts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: A type of acelluar casts that have a surface composed of granules, which can vary in size. The granules can be rather heterogeneous, ranging from fine (finely granular cast) up to coarse (coarsely granular cast), dark, clear, and pigmented.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Waxy casts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: A type of acellular urinary casts that display a melted wax (waxy) appearance, which gives them a high refractive index. They are frequently dark, with blunt extremities, indented and cracked edges and a large size, which is often several times that of other types of casts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Fatty casts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: A type of acellular urinary casts that contain lipid droplets, oval fat bodies or cholesterol crystals, and are often associated with the free forms of these elements. Their identification may require the use of polarised light microscopy, under which fatty particles embedded into the cast matrix appear as Maltese crosses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Bacterial cell casts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: A type of urinary cast that contain bacteria. Bacterial casts can be difficult to identify and can be distinguished from other types of casts using phase contrast microscopy. Bacterial casts are diagnostic of acute pyelonephritis or intrinsic renal infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Reduced lysosomal acid lipase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: Reduction in the activity of lysosomal acid lipase (LAL) in the blood. Lysosomal lipase activity is measured. LAL hydrolyzes cholesteryl esters derived from cell internalization of plasma lipoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Striatal T2 hyperintensity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: Abnormally bright T2 signal from the striatum on brain magnetic resonance imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Hepatic hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: A congenital vascular malformation in the liver composed of masses of blood vessels that are atypical or irregular in arrangement and size.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Increased pituitary glycoprotein hormone alpha subunit level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: An increased concentration of circulating alpha polypeptide of glycoprotein hormones (NCBI Gene 1081). This alpha subunit is common to luteinizing hormone (LH) , follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) , thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) and human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), which are glycoprotein hormones composed of an identical alpha subunit together with a beta subunit that confers biological specificity. The alpha subunit is used as a marker for tumors that produce these hormones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.label: Decreased circulating lipoprotein lipase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003120.definition: Reduction in the level of lipoprotein lipase in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.label: Abnormal circulating hyaluronic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of hyaluronic acid in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.label: Elevated cholesterol ester level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.definition: An elevated concentration of circulating cholesterol esters, which are fatty acid esters of cholesterol and make up about two-thirds of total plasma cholesterol.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.label: Elevated circulating 17-hydroxyprogesterone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.definition: An increased level of 17-hydroxyprogesterone in the blood. 17-hydroxyprogesterone is an intermediate steroid in the adrenal biosynthetic pathway from cholesterol to cortisol and is the substrate for steroid 21-hydroxylase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.label: Decreased circulating dehydroepiandrosterone-sulfate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.definition: A reduced concentration of dehydroepiandrosterone-sulfate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.label: Increased circulating progesterone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.definition: An elevated concentration of progesterone in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.label: Hot flashes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.definition: Sudden feelings of warmth that are generally most pronounced over the face, neck and chest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.label: Inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.definition: A state of increased circulating antidiuretic hormone despite hyponatremia and hypo-osmolality with normal or increased plasma volume.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.label: Reduced radioactive iodine uptake
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003121.definition: A decreased amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours after administration of the radioactive marker.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Increased radioactive iodine uptake
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: An elevated amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours after administration of the radioactive marker.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Abnormal radioactive iodine uptake test result
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: Any deviation from normal in the amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours after administration of the radioactive marker.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Increased circulating thyroxine-binding globulin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: An elevated concentration of thyroxine-binding globulin (TBG) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Focal pancreatic islet hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans that affects only certain regions of the pancreas and not others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Diffuse pancreatic islet hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans with a generalized distribution.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Intrapulmonary shunt
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: Blood flow through a region of the lung in which little or no ventilation takes place, resulting in reduced oxygenation of the blood leaving the lungs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Perinephric fluid collection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: An accumulation of fluid in one or more of the perinephric spaces, which consist of the subcapsular, perirenal, anterior and posterior pararenal spaces. This abnormality can be demonstrated by cross-sectional imaging, particularly computed tomography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Nasopharyngeal teratoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: A teratoma arising in the nasopharyngeal region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Abnormal incisura morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: An abnormal shape of the incisura, defined as the narrowed downward continuation of the conchal space bounded anteriorly by the borders of the tragus, posteriorly by the antitragus, and along its lower lateral margins and inferior boundary by the connection between the first two. The upper boundary is a somewhat arbitrary line crossing from the apices of the antitragus and the tragus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.label: Increased incisura length
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003122.definition: The length of the incisura from the upper to lower border is greater than that observed in the average population.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Decreased incisura length
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: The length of the incisura from the upper to lower border is less than that observed in the average population.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Narrow incisura width
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: Width of the incisura from the anterior to posterior border less than that observed in the average population.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Increased incisura width
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: Breadth of the incisura from the anterior to posterior border greater than that observed in the average population.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Horizontal inferior border of scapula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: A morphological abnormality of the scapula in which there is a flat (horizontal) inferior edge of the scapula. The entire scapula is said to resemble a square, leading to the designation sqaring of the scapula (in Figure 1 of PMID:24706940 the scapulae have a roughly rectangular shape).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Neutrophilic infiltration of the skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: A predominantly neutrophilic infiltrate of the dermis and or epidermis (i.e., a large number of neutrophils inferred to have migrated into the skin).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Predominantly epidermal neutrophilic infiltrate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: Collection of neutrophils in the epidermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Predominantly dermal neutrophilic infiltrate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: Collection of neutrophils in the dermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Internally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: An abnormally increased proportion of nuclei of sarcomeres with an internal localization. Individual muscle fibers are syncytia, formed by embryonic fusion of many myoblasts or later, myosatellite cells. Each muscle fiber contains many nuclei, peripherally positioned immediately adjacent to the sarcolemmal membrane. In healthy muscle only 3-5% of fibers contain nuclei that are located internally, within the cell, but many disease processes lead to internal nuclei.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Necklace skeletal muscle fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: A histological alteration of muscle fibers that resembles a necklace (necklace fibers). A substantial proportion of fibers (4-20% in PMID:19084976) show internalized nuclei aligned in a basophilic ring (necklace) at 3 micrometers beneath the sarcolemma. Ultrastructurally, such necklaces consist of myofibrils of smaller diameter, in oblique orientation, surrounded by mitochondria, sarcoplasmic reticulum and glycogen granules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.label: Extrafoveal choroidal neovascularization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003123.definition: A type of choroidal neovascularization in which the nearest edge of the area of neovascularization is located 200 to 1500 micrometers from the center of the fovea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Juxtafoveal choroidal neovascularization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: A type of choroidal neovascularization in which the nearest edge of the area of neovascularization is located 1 to 199 micrometers from the center of the fovea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Subfoveal choroidal neovascularization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: A type of choroidal neovascularization in which the area of neovascularization overlaps with the center of the fovea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Decreased circulating chylomicron concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: Reduced plasma concentrations of chylomicrons, the large lipid droplet (up to 100 mm in diameter) of reprocessed lipid synthesized in epithelial cells of the small intestine and containing triacylglycerols, cholesterol esters, and several apolipoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Decreased VLDL cholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: A reduction in the amount of very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Swollen lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: Enlargement of the lip typically due to fluid buildup or inflammation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Productive cough
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: A cough that produces phlegm or mucus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Nonproductive cough
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: A cough that does not produce phlegm or mucus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Whooping cough
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: A type of cough characterized by a burst of numerous and rapid coughs followed by a long inhaling effort that is accompanied by a high-pitched whooping sound produced by the inhalation of air.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Palmar pruritus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the palm(s) of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.label: Parageusia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003124.definition: A distortion of the sense of taste, often characterized by the sensation of a metallic taste.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Lip fissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: A severe crack in a lip. A lip fissure may be painful, may bleed and often is a recurring manifestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Abnormal subclavian artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: Any anomaly of a subclavian artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Dilated left subclavian artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: Abnormally increased caliber of the left subclavian artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Anomalous origin of left subclavian artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: Origin of the left subclavian artery from an anomalous anatomical location.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Thalamic arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Hypothalamic arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the hypothalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Optic nerve arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the optic nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Arteriovenous malformation of the maxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the maxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Delirium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: A state of sudden and severe confusion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.label: Oophoritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003125.definition: An inflammation of the ovary or ovaries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.label: Triangular tibia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.definition: A short, dysplastic tibia with a triangular shape. Instead of the normal shaft configuration of the tibia, the tibia forms a triangle with the longest side corresponding to the proximal-distal dimension, and the apex of the triangle directed laterally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.label: Bladder polyp
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.definition: An abnormal growth that projects from the mucous membrane of the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.label: Abnormal renal corpuscle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.definition: Any anomolous structure of the renal corpuscle, which is the initial component of the nephron that filters blood. The renal corpuscle consists of a knot of capillaries (glomerulus) that is surrounded by a double-walled capsule (Bowman capsule) that opens into a renal tubule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.label: Abnormal Bowman capsule morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.definition: A structural anomaly of the double-walled capsule (Bowman capsule) that opens into a renal tubule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.label: Abnormal glomerular visceral epithelial cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.definition: Any structural anomaly of the podocyte, which is a highly specialized cell of the Bowman capsule and which forms multiple interdigitating foot processes. Podocytes are interconnected by slit diaphragms and cover the exterior basement membrane surface of the glomerular capillary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.label: Podocyte foot process effacement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.definition: An anomaly of podocyte morphology characterized by the loss of the interdigitating foot process pattern (generally called foot process effacement; FPE). The term FPE designates the loss of the usual interdigitating pattern of foot processes of neighboring podocytes, leading to relatively broad expanses of podocyte processes covering the glomerular basement membrane (GBM). It is widely viewed as a pathological derangement that is associated with leakage of macromolecules such as albumin through the glomerular filtration barrier.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.label: Abnormal CD69 upregulation upon TCR activation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.definition: Any abnormality in the upregulation of CD69 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR). Upregulation of CD69 is one of the earliest and most sensitive measures of antigen recognition in the periphery, and transient expression of CD69 is associated with positive selection in the thymus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.label: Decreased CD69 upregulation upon TCR activation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.definition: Reduced or impaired upregulation of CD69 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.label: Abnormal CD25 upregulation upon TCR activation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003126.definition: Any abnormality in the upregulation of CD25 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR). CD25 is the alpha chain of the IL2 receptor. Ligation of the T cell antigen receptor leads to the induction of CD25 expression.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.label: Decreased CD25 upregulation upon TCR activation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.definition: Decreased or impaired upregulation of CD25 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.label: Absent ankle pulse
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.definition: The pulsation of the posterior tibial artery behind the internal malleolus, or of the dorsalis pedis artery, cannot be detected on physical examination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.label: Pulmonary arterial atherosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.definition: Accumulation of lipids and inflammatory cells along the inner walls of the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.label: Shock
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.definition: The state in which profound and widespread reduction of effective tissue perfusion leads first to reversible, and then if prolonged, to irreversible cellular injury.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.label: Hypovolemic shock
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.definition: A state of shock characterized by decreased circulating blood volume in relation to total vascular capacity. This type of shock is characterized by a reduction of diastolic filling pressures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.label: Distributive shock
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.definition: A hyperdynamic process resulting from excessive vasodilatation. Impaired blood flow causes inadequate tissue perfusion, which can lead to end-organ damage

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.label: Obstructive shock
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.definition: A type of shock characterized by inadequate cardiac preload due to obstructed venous return (e.g. pericardial tamponade, tension pneumothorax, abdominal compartment) or obstruction of arterial blood flow (e.g. pulmonary embolism).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.label: Abnormal thoracic duct morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.definition: Any structural anomaly of the thoracic duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.label: Abnormal response to gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003127.definition: An abnormal response to the gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) stimulation test. This test typically involves intravenous administration of GnRH followed by repeated blood sampling at various time points to measure the levels of luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.label: Increased LH response to gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.definition: An abnormally high amount of luteinizing hormone (LH) is released upon gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.label: Malalignment of the great toenail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.definition: A lateral deviation of the nail plate of the great toe along the longitudinal axis due to the lateral rotation of the nail matrix. The nail plate grows out in ridges.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.label: Tufted hairs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.definition: The presence of tufts of 8-15 hairs that appear to emerge from a single follicular orifice.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.label: Flushing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.definition: Recurrent episodes of redness of the skin together with a sensation of warmth or burning of the affected areas of skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.label: Abnormal perifollicular morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.definition: Any structural anomaly in the areas surrounding the hair follicles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.label: Seborrheic keratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.definition: A raised growth on the skin of older individuals. The lesion usually is initially light tan and may darken to dark brown or nearly black. The consistent feature of seborrheic keratoses is their waxy, pasted-on or stuck-on look.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.label: Cobblestone-like hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003128.definition: The presence of verrucous, cobblestone-like papules and nodules in a region of skin that is said to have an appearance like that of cobblestones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.label: Tuberous xanthoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.definition: A type of xanthoma characterized by a nodular form. Tuberous xanthomas are firm subcutaneous nodules,whereby the overlying skin can have red or red-yellow color changes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.label: Ichthyosis follicularis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.definition: Ichthyosis follicularis is characterized by widespread non inflammatory thorn-like follicular projections. Dyskeratotic papules are most pronounced over the extensor extremities and scalp and are symmetrically distributed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.label: Cutaneous abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.definition: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.label: Digital pitting scar
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.definition: Pinhole-sized concave depressions with hyperkeratosis in the skin of a finger or toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.label: Left atrial enlargement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.definition: Increase in size of the left atrium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.label: Atrial septal hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.definition: An abnormal increase in the thickness of the atrial septum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.label: Unroofed coronary sinus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.definition: Unroofed coronary sinus (CS) is a rare congenital cardiac anomaly in which there is partial (either focal or fenestrated) or complete absence of the roof of the CS, which results in a communication between the CS and the LA. Unroofed CS is the rarest type of atrial septal defect. It is often associated with persistent left superior vena cava (LSVC) and other forms of complex congenital heart disease, usually heterotaxia syndromes. The morphological types have been classified into 4 groups: Type I, completely unroofed with persistent LSVC; type II, completely unroofed without persistent LSVC; type III, partially unroofed mid portion; and type IV, partially unroofed terminal portion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.label: Coronary sinus enlargement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.definition: Abnormal increase in size of the coronary sinus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.label: Elevated left atrial pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003129.definition: An abnormal increase in magnitude of the pressure in the left atrium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Abnormal circulating properdin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of properdin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Peripheral arterial calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Lower extremity peripheral arterial calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Femoral arterial calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the femoral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Iliac arterial calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the iliac artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Tibial arterial calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the tibial artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Intracranial arterial calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in an artery that is located within the skull (intracranial).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Internal carotid artery calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the internal carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Vertebral artery calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the vertebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.label: Cerebral artery calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003130.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.label: Basilar artery calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the basilar artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.label: Middle cerebral artery calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the middle cerebral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.label: Abdominal aortic calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in abdominal aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.label: Carotid artery calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.label: External carotid artery calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the external carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.label: Abnormal ventricular myocardium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.definition: A structural anomaly of the muscle layer of the heart wall of a cardiac ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.label: Fatty replacement of ventricular myocardial tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.definition: Presence of an increased amount of fat tissue within a cardiac ventricle with corresponding reduction of muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.label: Myofiber disarray
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.definition: A nonparallel arrangement of cardiac myocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.label: Cardiomyocyte hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003131.definition: An increase in cell size, enhanced protein synthesis, and heightened organization of the sarcomere within cardiac myocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Cardiomyocyte mitochondrial proliferation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: An abnormal increase in the number of mitochondria per cardiac myocyte.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Myocardial immune cell infiltration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: An increase in the number of immune cells in myocardial tissue (which can be assumed to have migrated into the myocardium).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Myocardial lymphocytic infiltration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: An increase in the number of lymphocytes in myocardial tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Myocardial eosinophilic infiltration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: An increase in the number of eosinophils in myocardial tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Myocardial multinucleated giant cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: The presence of extremely large cells with multiple nuclei. The so-called giant cells are thought to be of macrophage origin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Myocardial granulomatous infiltrates
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: The presence of multiple granulomata (small nodular inflammatory lesions containing grouped mononuclear phagocytes) in the myocardium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Monoclonal light chain cardiac amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: A type of cardiac amyloidosis related to deposition of an immunoglobulin light chain. The current gold standard of amyloid typing is to determine the precursor protein using laser microdissection mass spectrometry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: A type of cardiac amyloidosis related to deposition of transthyretin (TTR), which is identified by immunohistochemical staining.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Perivascular cardiac fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: A type of myocardial fibrosis characterized by excessive diffuse collagen accumulation concentrated in perivascular spaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.label: Interstitial cardiac fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003132.definition: A type of myocardial fibrosis characterized by excessive diffuse collagen accumulation concentrated in interstitial spaces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Perivascular myocardial immune cell infiltration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: An increase in the number of immune cells in myocardial tissue concentrated in the spaces surrounding blood vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Abnormal cardiomyocyte morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: Any structural anomaly of cardiomyocytes, which are terminally differentiated muscle cells in the heart that are interconnected end to end by gap junctions, which allows coordinated contraction of heart tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Cardiomyocyte degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: Deterioration of cardiomyocyte characterized by abnormal features such as loss of myofilaments, occurrence of cellular sequestration, decreased mitochondrial sizes and cellular debris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Myocardial sarcomeric disarray
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: A disruption of the structure of the sarcomeres of cardiomyocytes. The sarcomere is the repeating unit between two Z lines comprised largely of myosin and actin that mediates contractility, and normally sarcomeres are aligned with the long axis of cells, with the Z bands being in register throughout the length of the cardiac myocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Cardiomyocyte inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of stainable substances within cardiomyocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Abnormal cardiomyocyte mitochondrial morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: An anomaly of the structure of mitochondria within cardiomyocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Intranuclear cardiomyocyte mitochondria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: Abnormal localization of mitochondria within the nuclei of cardiomyocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Abnormal cardiomyocyte connexin43 staining
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: Anomalous staining of Connexin43 in cardiomyocytes. Connexin43 (Cx43) is the primary gap junction protein in the working myocardium. Cx43 exhibits increased localization at the lateral membranes of cardiomyocytes in a variety of heart diseases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Abnormal cardiomyocyte plakoglobin staining
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: Anomalous staining of plakoglobin in cardiomyocytes. Plakoglobin is a component of desmosomes in cardiomyocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.label: Abnormal cardiomyocyte dystrophin staining
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003133.definition: Anomalous staining of dystrophin in cardiomyocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Abnormal lysosomal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: A structural anomaly of lysosomes, membrane-enclosed organelles that contain an array of enzymes capable of catabolizing proteins, nucleic acids, carbohydrates, and lipids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Gastric arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Duodenal arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Jejunal arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the jejunum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Pelvic arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Colonic arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the colon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Rectal arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Uterine arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Dextrotransposition of the great arteries
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: A type of transposition of the great arteries (TGA) in which aorta is in front of and primarily to the right of the pulmonary artery. This is the most common kind of TGA.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.label: Levotransposition of the great arteries
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003134.definition: A type of transposition of the great arteries (TGA) in which aorta is in front of and primarily to the left of the pulmonary artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Cardiac sarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: A malignant soft tissue neoplasm that arises from the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Calcified amorphous tumor of the heart
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: A non-neoplastic cardiac tumor characterized by calcification and eosinophilic amorphous material in the background of dense collagenous fibrous tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Chest tightness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: An unpleasant sensation of tightness or pressure in the chest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Otitis media with effusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: Otitis media characterized by thick or sticky fluid behind the tympanic membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Sleep onset insomnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: Difficulty initiating sleep, that is, increased sleep onset latency, refers to the condition where it takes 30 minutes or more to fall asleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Maintenance insomnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: Individuals affected by abnormal difficulty in staying asleep tend to wake up at night and struggle to return to sleep. This condition typically involves spending more than 30 minutes awake during the night.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Terminal insomnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: A type of insomnia characterized by waking up too early in the morning is known as early morning awakening. The termination of sleep must occur at least 30 minutes before the desired time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Glomeruloid hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: A histologically distinctive, cutaneous, benign vascular tumor that is characterized by a solitary or multiple blue-red papules and histologically resembles renal glomeruli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Vegetative state
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: The absence of wakefulness and consciousness, but in contrast to a coma, there is involuntary opening of the eyes and movements such as teeth grinding, yawning, or thrashing of the extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.label: Cutaneous sclerotic plaque
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003135.definition: A solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter that is characterized by hardening (sclerosis) of the affected skin area (related to collagen thickening).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.label: Yellow skin plaque
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.definition: A solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter and that has a yellow color.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.label: Zebra bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.definition: Intralysosomal, osmiophilic, lamellated and sometimes concentric cytoplasmic inclusions comprised of broad transversely-stacked myelinoid membranes and said to resemble a zebra in electron microscopic images.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.label: Palpable purpura
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.definition: A type of purpura in which the lesions are raised (and can therefore be appreciated upon palpation).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.label: Ecchymosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.definition: A purpuric lesion that is larger than 1 cm in diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.label: Macular purpura
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.definition: Purpura that is flat (non-palpable, not raised).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.label: Palate neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.definition: A neoplasm that affects the hard palate, soft palate, or uvula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.label: Metaphyseal striations
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.definition: Longitudinal densities on radiographs located in a metaphysis (the narrow region of a long bone between the epiphysis and the diaphysis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.label: Intestinal perforation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.definition: A hole (perforation) in the wall of the intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.label: Colon perforation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003136.definition: A hole (perforation) in the wall of the colon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.label: Small intestinal perforation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.definition: A hole (perforation) in the wall of the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.label: Rectal perforation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.definition: A hole (perforation) in the wall of the rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.label: Cold paresis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.definition: Increased muscle weakness upon exposure to cold temperatures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.label: Stiff tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.definition: Increased rigidity and reduced mobility of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.label: Ankle weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.definition: Reduced strength of the muscles that lift or otherwise move the foot at the ankle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.label: Refractory
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is difficult to treat or cure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.label: Abnormal cell proliferation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.definition: Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of cells, which may result in the expansion of a cell population.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.label: Abnormal lymphocyte proliferation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.definition: Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of lymphocytes, which results in the expansion of a cell population.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.label: Abnormal T cell proliferation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003137.definition: Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of T cells, which results in the expansion of a cell population.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Abnormal B cell proliferation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of B cells, which results in the expansion of a cell population.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Decreased lymphocyte proliferation in response to mitogen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: A decreased proliferative response of lymphocytes in vitro or in vivo, when stimulated with mitogens, such as phytohemagglutinin (PHA).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Decreased lymphocyte proliferation in response to anti-CD3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: A decreased proliferative response of lymphocytes in vitro or in vivo, when stimulated with an anti-CD3 antibody against the T-cell co-receptor, CD3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Abnormal lymphocyte surface marker expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: Abnormal amount of a protein that is normally present on the cell surface of lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Reduced T cell CD40 expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: A deficiency in the expression of the CD40 ligand on the surface of activated T-lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Megakaryocyte nucleus hypolobulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: The presence of megakaryocytes in the bone marrow whose nuclei are less lobulated than expected for the size of the nucleus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Increased micromegakaryocyte count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: The presence of abnormally high numbers of micromegakaryocytes in the bone marrow. Micromegakaryocytes are mononuclear diploid cells, with a nucleus similar in size to that of a myeloblast or promyelocyte with the cell being less than 30 micrometers in diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Increased multinucleated megakaryocyte count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: The presence of abnormally high numbers of multinucleated megakaryocytes in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Megakaryocyte nucleus hyperlobulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: The presence of megakaryocytes in the bone marrow whose nuclei are more lobulated than expected for the size of the nucleus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.label: Abnormal MHC II surface expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003138.definition: A deviation from the normal level of major histocompatibility complex class II molecules expressed at the cell surface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.label: Reduced MHC II surface expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.definition: A reduction from the normal level of major histocompatibility complex class II molecules expressed at the cell surface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.label: Elevated MHC II surface expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.definition: An increase above the normal level of major histocompatibility complex class II molecules expressed at the cell surface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.label: Abnormal proportion of CD4-positive T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of CD4-positive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.label: Abnormal proportion of CD8-positive T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.label: Abnormal CD4:CD8 ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.definition: Any abnormality in the relative amount of CD4+ and CD8+ T lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.label: Abnormal proportion of naive T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of naive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.label: Decreased proportion of naive T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.definition: An abnormally decreased proportion of naive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.label: Increased proportion of naive T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.definition: An abnormally increased proportion of naive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.label: Abnormal proportion of double-negative alpha-beta regulatory T cell
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003139.definition: An abnormal proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative (double negative or DN) alpha-beta regulatory T cells (Tregs) as compared to total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.label: Reduced proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative, alpha-beta regulatory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.definition: An abnormally decreased proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative (double negative or DN) alpha-beta regulatory T cells (Tregs) as compared to total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.label: Reduced antigen-specific T cell proliferation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.definition: Impaired proliferation and expansion of a T cell population following activation by an antigenic stimulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.label: Impaired pathogen-specific CD8 cytoxicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.definition: Impaired response of CD8 T cells to pathogens. CD8 T cells direct the killing of a target cell through the release of granules containing cytotoxic mediators or through the engagement of death receptors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.label: Impaired antigen-specific response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.definition: An impaired immune response mediated by cells expressing specific receptors for antigen produced through a somatic diversification process, and allowing for an enhanced secondary response to subsequent exposures to the same antigen (immunological memory).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.label: Poroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.definition: A benign, well circumscribed sweat gland neoplasm with eccrine or apocrine differentiation. It usually presents as a solitary, dome-shaped papule, nodule, or plaque on acral sites. It is characterized by a proliferation of uniform basaloid cells in the dermis and it is associated with the presence of focal ductal and cystic structures [NCIT:C27273].

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.label: Abnormal cytokine signaling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.definition: Any abnormality in the series of molecular signals initiated by the binding of a cytokine to a receptor on the surface of a cell, and ending with regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.label: Impaired cytokine signaling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.definition: A defect or impairment in the series of molecular signals initiated by the binding of a cytokine to a receptor on the surface of a cell, and ending with regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.label: Increased proportion of CD25+ mast cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003140.definition: An increased proportion of mast cells are positive for the cell surface marker CD25 (also called interleukin-2 receptor alpha chain).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.label: Abnormal distribution of CD56 bright/dim natural killer cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.definition: An abnormal distribution in the number of CD56 bright NK cells, as measured by flow cytometry. CD56, an adhesion molecule mediating homotypic adhesion, is used as a functional marker for NK cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.label: Abnormal chromosome morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.definition: Any structural anomaly of a chromosome, which is a thread like molecule consisting of DNA and proteins (chromatin) that contains DNA sequences for genes and other genetic elements in linear order.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.label: Short telomere length
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.definition: An abnormal reduction in telomere length. Telomeres are non-coding, repetitive sequences of DNA at the ends of the chromosomes of eukaryotic cells which become shorter as cells divide, and when telomere attrition reaches its limit, cell proliferation arrest, senescence, and apoptosis can occur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.label: High serum calcifediol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.definition: An increased concentration of calcifediol in the blood. Calcifediol is also known as 25-hydroxycholecalciferol or 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.label: High serum calcitriol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.definition: An increased concentration of calcitriol in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.label: Abnormal nasal mucus secretion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.definition: Any deviation from the normal quantity of secretion of nasal mucus, a thick viscous liquid produced by the mucous membranes of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.label: Rhinorrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.definition: Increased discharge of mucus from the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.label: Increased body mass index
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.definition: Abnormally increased weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of overweight compared to averages.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.label: Reduced sex -hormone binding protein level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003141.definition: A decreased concentration of sex-hormone binding protein in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Small yellow foveal lesion with surrounding gray zone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: A lesion that is observed following light damage to the macula. Damage to the retinal by exposure to intense visible light, usually the sun. Intense light exposure such as staring at the sun causes fine structural anomalies in the outer segments of the photoreceptors and the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells of the macula. Symptoms usually develop within 1 to 4 h after exposure and include decreased vision, metamorphopsia, micropsia, and central or paracentral scotomas. Fundus examination typically shows a small yellow spot with a surrounding gray zone in the foveolar or parafoveolar area. Spontaneous evolution leads to the improvement of visual acuity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Small superior frontal cortex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: Reduced size of the superior frontal portion of the cerebral cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Abnormal cerebellar cortex morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: Any structural anomaly of the cortex of the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Small cerebellar cortex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: Reduced size of the cerebellar cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Abnormal circulating beta-C-terminal telopeptide concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of beta-C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen in the blood circulation, a marker of the rate of bone turnover.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Increased circulating beta-C-terminal telopeptide concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: A abnormal elevation above the normal concentration of beta-C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Decreased circulating beta-C-terminal telopeptide concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: A reduction from the normal concentration of beta-C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Abnormal circulating osteocalcin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of osteocalcin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Increased circulating osteocalcin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: An elevated level of osteocalcin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.label: Decreased circulating osteocalcin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003142.definition: A reduced level of osteocalcin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Oligoclonal T cell expansion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.definition: The presence of a population of T cells with a restricted T cell receptor (TCR) repertoire derived from a limited number of TCR clones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Persistent repetition of sounds
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.definition: Repetition of sounds with no meaning.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Restricted or repetitive behaviors or interests
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.definition: A broad range of compulsive behaviors are repeated, including simple motor stereotypies and tics, as well as more complex repetitive movements or compulsions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Alexithymia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.definition: A deficit in emotional awareness is characterized by difficulties in recognizing and expressing feelings and emotions. This deficit manifests as a limited ability to respond to facial cues or other signs of emotions in others, often accompanied by detached connections to others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Abnormal prosody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.definition: Abnormalities in the patterns of rhythm, stress, or intonation of speech or vocalization.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Monotonic speech
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.definition: A speech pattern characterized by an abnormal lack of tone in the voice.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Singsong Intonation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.definition: A speech pattern characterized by abnormal fluctuations in the pitch of the voice.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Pregnancy exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.definition: Exposure of pregnant women to toxins from any source, such as environmental toxins or chemicals, that may potentially cause problems such as miscarriage, preterm delivery, low birth weight, and, in some cases, developmental delays in infants.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Abnormal sex hormone-binding globulin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration in the circulation of sex hormone-binding globulin, a circulating glycoprotein that transports testosterone and other steroids in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003143.label: Abnormal angiostatin level
