http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003224.label: Persistent CMV viremia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003224.definition: Lasting (uncontrolled) presence of cytomegalovirus in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003224.label: Persistent viremia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003224.definition: Persistence of virus in the blood circulation longer than would be normal in an immunocompentent host.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003224.label: Coccidioidomycosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003224.definition: Infection by a Coccidioides species fungus. These are dimorphic, soil-dwelling, fungi known to cause a broad spectrum of disease, ranging from a mild febrile illness to severe pulmonary manifestations or disseminated disease. The genus Coccidioides is comprised of two genetically distinct species: Coccidioides immitis and C. posadasii.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.label: Acinetobacter infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.definition: An infection by Acinetobacter baumannii, a Gram-negative bacillus that is aerobic, pleomorphic and non-motile. An opportunistic pathogen, A. baumannii has a high incidence among immunocompromised individuals, particularly those who have experienced a prolonged (over 90 d) hospital stay.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.label: Granuloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.definition: A compact, organized collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes, which may be but is not necessarily accompanied by accessory features such as necrosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.label: Eosinophilic granuloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.definition: A type of granuloma characterized morphologically by the predominance of Langerhans cells with characteristic grooved, folded, indented nuclei in the appropriate milieu that includes variable numbers of eosinophils and histiocytes including multinucleated forms, often appearing similar to osteoclasts or touton like giant cells, neutrophils and small lymphocytes. The concentration of the eosinophilic infiltrate varies from scattered mature cells to sheet-like masses of cells. Occasionally, areas of bone necrosis may interrupt the cellular infiltrate. The foamy cells may also be amassed in clumps, which are of no clinical significance because these clumps represent phagocytosis of lipid debris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.label: Increased circulating copper concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.definition: An abnormally elevated concentration of copper in the blood circulation. This term refers to the total copper concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.label: Opportunistic fungal infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.definition: An infection that is caused by a fungus that would generally not be able to cause an infection in a host with a normal immune system. Such fungi take advantage of the opportunity, so to speak, that is provided by a weakened immune system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.label: Histoplasmosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.definition: Histoplasmosis is caused by the fungus Histoplasma capsulatum and is consider to be an opportunistic infection in immunosuppressed persons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.label: Disseminated histoplasmosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.definition: Histoplasmosis infection involving multiple sites of the body. Disseminated histoplasmosis can involve various organs, including reticuloendothelial organs, gastrointestinal tract, adrenal glands, central nervous system, endovascular structures, kidney, and skin. It typically presents with systemic symptoms like fever, generalized fatigue, night sweats, weight loss, and the symptoms related to the specific organ involved. Severe disseminated disease can manifest as septic shock, multi organ failure, and ARDS.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.label: Pulmonary histoplasmosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.definition: Infection of the lungs with Histoplasma capsulatum. Symptoms may include fever, headache, weakness, chest pain and dry cough. When imaging is done, chest radiographs may show patchy pneumonia involving one or more lobes with adenopathy of the mediastinum or hilum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.label: Chronic tinea infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003225.definition: The term tinea means fungal infection, whereas dermatophyte refers to the fungal organisms that cause tinea. This term refers to a tinea infection that is chronic or recalcitrant to treatment and may be reflective of an immune defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: Opportunistic bacterial infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: An infection that is caused by a bacterium that would generally not be able to cause an infection in a host with a normal immune system. Such bacteria take advantage of the opportunity, so to speak, that is provided by a weakened immune system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: Nontuberculous mycobacterial pulmonary infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: An infection of the lung caused by environmental mycobacteria. Such infections can occur in individuals with predisposing lung disease or immune disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: Pulmonary tuberculosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: A lung infection by Mycobacterium tuberculosis a slightly curved non-motile, aerobic, non-capsulated and non-spore forming strains of mycobacteria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: Increased blood pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: Abnormal increase in blood pressure. An individual measurement of increased blood pressure does not necessarily imply hypertension. In practical terms, multiple measurements are recommended to diagnose the presence of hypertension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: Anti-NMDA receptor antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against the NMDA (N-methyl-D-aspartate)-type glutamate receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: CSF autoimmune antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: The presence of an antibody in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) that is directed against the organism's own cells or tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: CSF anti-NMDA receptor antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) that react against the NMDA (N-methyl-D-aspartate)-type glutamate receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: Empty delta sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: This sign is created by a nonenhancing thrombus in the dural sinus surrounded by triangular enhancing dura as seen on cross-section. The sign, seen on contrast-enhanced CT scan images, suggests dural sinovenous thrombosis. It is best seen on wider window settings. It is a reliable sign of sinus thrombosis but is seen only in 25-30% of these cases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: Dural tail sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: This sign represents thickening and enhancement of the dura mater in continuity with a mass, which on MR images, gives the appearance of a tail arising from the mass. The dural tail is thought to represent reactive change; however, it may also be due to tumor invasion. Three criteria need to be met for a positive dural tail sign: the tail should be seen on two successive images through the tumor, it should taper away from the tumor, and it must enhance more than the tumor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.label: Lemon sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003226.definition: The lemon sign refers to the shape of the fetal skull at ultrasonography (US) when the frontal bones lose their normal convex contour and appear flattened or inwardly scalloped. This gives the skull a shape that is said to resemble a lemon.. The sign is seen on transverse sonograms of the fetal cranium obtained at the level of the ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.label: Optic nerve tram-track sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.definition: A tram-track sign is composed of two enhancing areas of tumor separated from each other by the negative defect of the optic nerve. It is seen on contrast-enhanced CT scan and MRI images, in optic nerve sheath meningioma. The sign helps distinguish between optic nerve sheath meningioma and optic glioma. Optic glioma arises from glial cells within the optic nerve and there is no clear separation between the nerve and the tumor; hence the tram-track sign is not seen in optic gliomas. Calcification may be seen in optic nerve sheath meningiomas in 20-50% of cases and hence the tram-track sign may be seen on nonenhanced CT scan images as a linear calcification around the nerve, but this is less common.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.label: Extrapulmonary tuberculosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.definition: A type of tubercular infection located outside of the lung, which is the most common location of tuberculosis. There are two types of clinical manifestation of tuberculosis (TB) are pulmonary TB (PTB) and extrapulmonary TB (EPTB). The former is most common. EPTB refers to TB involving organs other than the lungs (e.g., pleura, lymph nodes, abdomen, genitourinary tract, skin, joints and bones, or meninges). A patient with both pulmonary and EPTB is classified as a case of PTB.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.label: Elevated urinary N-acetylaspartic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.definition: Elevated N-acetylaspartic acid (NAA) in urine. This feature can be measured using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.label: Increased circulating N-acetylaspartic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.definition: Concentration of N-acetylaspartic acid in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.label: Increased CSF N-acetylaspartic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.definition: An abnormally increased concentration of N-acetylaspartic acid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.label: Recurrent shingles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.definition: Repeated episodes of a localized, painful cutaneous eruption related to reactivation of varicella zoster virus (VZV) and characterized by a characteristic rash in one or two adjacent dermatomes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.label: Prominent subcalcaneal fat pad
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.definition: Abnormally increased prominence of the fat pad underneath the heal. This feature can be appreciated in figure 1 of PMID:26769062.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.label: 2-hydroxyglutarate aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003227.definition: The concentration of 2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.label: Abnormal base excess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.definition: Deviation from the normal quantity of base excess, defined as the amount of strong acid (in millimoles per liter) that needs to be added in vitro to 1 liter of fully oxygenated whole blood to return a blood sample to standard conditions (pH of 7.40, Pco2 of 40 mm Hg, and temperature of 37 degrees C).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.label: Contact dermatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.definition: An inflammatory process in skin caused by an exogenous agent that directly or indirectly injure the skin. If the offending agent is identified and removed, the eruption will resolve. An unusual or patterned eruption may be a clue to the presence of a contact dermatitis. Patch testing may be helpful in the differential diagnosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.label: Disseminated nontuberculous mycobacterial infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.definition: An infection with nontuberculous mycobacteria that affects multiple body sites. Such infections can occur in individuals with immune disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.label: Ultra-low vision with retained motion projection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.definition: Ultra-low vision but with retained ability to identify a moving object (typically hand motion at distance of 30 cm).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.label: Ultra-low vision with retained light projection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.definition: Ultra-low vision but with retained ability to perceive the difference between light and dark. Also when light is projected in each of the four quadrants of the visual field, the individual is able to correctly identify the origin of the light stimulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.label: Ultra-low vision with retained light perception
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.definition: Ultra-low vision but with retained ability to perceive the difference between light and dark.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.label: Ultra-low vision with no light perception
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.definition: Ultra-low vision with complete lack of light and form perception.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.label: Polyclonal elevation of circulating IgG
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.definition: An increase in polyclonal immunoglobulins resulting from many different plasma cells. On serum electrophoresis, a polyclonal gammopathy is characterized by a broad diffuse band with one or more heavy chains and kappa and lambda light chains.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.label: Oligoclonal elevation of circulating IgG
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003228.definition: An increase in circulating immunoglobulins characterized by two or more bands in serum electrophoresis but not the broad diffuse band that characterizes a polyclonal increase in circulating immunoglobulins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Monoclonal elevation of IgG
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: An increase in circulating immunoglobulins characterized by a single band in serum electrophoresis but not the broad diffuse band that characterizes a polyclonal increase in circulating immunoglobulins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Monoclonal elevation of intact IgG
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: A type of monoclonal elevation of IgG in which the involved immunoglobulin has a normal structure with a light and heavy chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Monoclonal elevation of IgG light chain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: A type of monoclonal elevation of IgG in which the involved immunoglobulin has an abnormal structure with a light chain but not a heavy chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Monoclonal elevation of IgG heavy chain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: A type of monoclonal elevation of IgG in which the involved immunoglobulin has an abnormal structure with a heavy chain but not a light chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Monoclonal elevation of IgG kappa chain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: A type of monoclonal elevation of IgG in which the involved immunoglobulin has an abnormal structure with a kappa light chain but not a heavy chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Monoclonal elevation of IgG lambda chain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: A type of monoclonal elevation of IgG in which the involved immunoglobulin has an abnormal structure with a lambda light chain but not a heavy chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Increased circulating IgG subclass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: An elevation of circulating IgG level predominantly related to an elevation of one of the four IgG subclasses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Increased circulating IgG3 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: An abnormally increased concentration of the IgG3 subtype in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Increased circulating IgG1 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: An abnormally increased concentration of the IgG1 subtype in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.label: Increased circulating IgG2 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003229.definition: An abnormally increased concentration of the IgG2 subtype in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.label: Increased circulating IgG4 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.definition: An abnormally increased concentration of the IgG4 subtype in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.label: Genital warts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.definition: Warts affecting the skin in the genital area (peniile shaft, scrotum, vagina, or labia majora). Warts can be small, beginning as a pinhead-size swelling that may become larger and take on a pdenuculated appearance. Warts can spread and coalesce into large masses in the genital or anal area. Their color is variable but tends to be skin colored or darker, and they may occasionally bleed. Warts may cause itching, redness, or discomfort. An outbreak of genital warts may also cause psychological distress.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.label: Kappa Bence Jones proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.definition: The presence of free monoclonal kappa immunoglobulin light chains in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.label: Lambda Bence Jones proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.definition: The presence of free monoclonal lambda immunoglobulin light chains in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.label: Abnormal circulating mannose-binding protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of mannose-binding protein in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.label: Decreased circulating mannose-binding protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.definition: Concentration of mannose-binding protein in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.label: Increased circulating mannose-binding protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.definition: Concentration of mannose-binding protein in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.label: Increased circulating procalcitonin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.definition: An elevated concentration of procalcitonin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.label: Abnormal granulocyte count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003230.definition: Any deviation from the normal cell count per volume of granulocytes in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Granulocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: An increased count of granulocytes in the peripheral blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Increased circulating globulin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: An abnormally elevated concentration of globulins in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Decreased circulating globulin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: An abnormally reduced concentration of globulins in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Frontotemporal hypertrichosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the region of the forehead and temple.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Abnormal areolar morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: An abnormal appearance or structure of the ring of pigmented skin that surrounds the nipple.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Areolar fullness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: The areola (ring of pigmented skin surrounding the nipple) is filled out so as to produce a rounded shape.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Family history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: Information about close relatives of an individual who is the proband of a study or who is being investigated with the goal of identifying a medical diagnosis. Usually, the family history includes information from three generations of relatives, including children, brothers and sisters, parents, aunts and uncles, nieces and nephews, grandparents, and cousins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Family history of cancer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: A close blood relative had cancer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Family history of heart disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: A close blood relative had heart disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.label: Health status
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003231.definition: Health status of a family member with respect to the disease being investigated in a proband.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Affected
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: This term applies to a family member who is diagnosed with the same condition as the individual who is the primary focus of investigation (the proband).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Unaffected
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: This term applies to a family member in whom the diagnosis that is the primary focus of investigation is excluded.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Healthy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: No history of any serious disease, including the disease being investigated in the proband.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Periodic fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: Episodic fever that recurs at regular intervals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Non-periodic recurrent fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: Episodic fever that recurs at irregular intervals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Lacunar stroke
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: A stroke related to a small infarct (2-20 mm in diameter) in the deep cerebral white matter, basal ganglia, or pons, that is presumed to result from the occlusion of a single small perforating artery supplying the subcortical areas of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: Infection with staphylococcus aureus resistant to the antibiotic methicillin (MRSA). MRSA can infect any individual but is more common among hospitalized patients, and can also occur as an opportunistic infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Interhemispheric cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: Cystic collection (sac-like, fluid containing pocket of membranous tissue) located in the interhemispheric fissure, with or without communication with the ventricular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Temporomandibular joint adhesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: Formation of one or more fibrous bands within the temporomandibular joint (TMJ) with resulting limitation of movement of the TMJ. Adhesions may be seen in degenerative processes that involve the TMJ.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.label: Increased urinary 11-deoxycortisol level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003232.definition: An abnormally elevated concentration of 11-deoxycortisol in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.label: Increased urinary 11-deoxycorticosterone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.definition: An abnormally elevated concentration or amount of 11-deoxycorticosterone in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.label: Increased urinary 11-deoxytetrahydrocorticosterone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.definition: An abnormally elevated concentration or amount of 11-deoxytetrahydrocorticosterone the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.label: Oligoclonal elevation of circulating IgM
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.definition: An increase in circulating IgM characterized by two or more bands in serum electrophoresis but not the broad diffuse band that characterizes a polyclonal increase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.label: Polyclonal elevation of circulating IgA
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.definition: A heterogeneous increase in IgA mmunoglobulins characterized by a diffuse band on serum electrophoresis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.label: Oligoclonal elevation of circulating IgA
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.definition: An increase in circulating IgA characterized by two or more bands in serum electrophoresis but not the broad diffuse band that characterizes a polyclonal increase in circulating immunoglobulins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.label: Monoclonal elevation of circulating IgA
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.definition: An increase in circulating IgA characterized by one predominant band in serum electrophoresis but not the broad diffuse band that characterizes a polyclonal increase in circulating immunoglobulins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.label: Monoclonal elevation of circulating IgE
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.definition: An increase in circulating IgE characterized by one predominant band in serum electrophoresis but not the broad diffuse band that characterizes a polyclonal increase in circulating immunoglobulins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.label: Oligoclonal elevation of circulating IgE
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.definition: An increase in circulating IgE characterized by two or more bands in serum electrophoresis but not the broad diffuse band that characterizes a polyclonal increase in circulating immunoglobulins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.label: Polyclonal elevation of circulating IgE
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003233.definition: A heterogeneous increase in IgE mmunoglobulins characterized by a diffuse band on serum electrophoresis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.label: Reduced forced vital capacity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can expel following maximal inspiration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.label: Reduced forced expiratory volume in one second
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can forcefully expel in one second.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.label: Elevated cancer Ag 19-9 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.definition: An abnormal increased in the amount of the carbohydrate antigen 19-9, a recognizable sialo-ganglioside in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.label: Cutaneous lichen amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.definition: Lichen amyloidosis presents with multiple localized or rarely generalized, hyperpigmented grouped papules with a predilection for the shins, calves, ankles, and dorsa of the feet and thighs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.label: Cutaneous macular amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.definition: A type of cutaneous amyloidosis that is characterized by hyperpigmented patches with indefinite margins composed of grayish brown macules, often with a reticulated or rippled appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.label: Cutaneous nodular amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.definition: A type of cutaneous amyloidosis that is characterized clinically by waxy, purpuric plaques and nodules and histologically by amyloid deposits in the dermis and subcutaneous tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.label: Serinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003234.definition: A increased concentration of serine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.label: Sulfocysteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.definition: A increased concentration of sulfocysteine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.label: Phenylalaninuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.definition: Increased level of phenylalanine in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.label: Methioninuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.definition: Level of methionine in urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.label: Leucinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.definition: Increased level of leucine in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.label: Decreased peak expiratory flow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.definition: A reduction in the maximum expiratory flow per minute, which can be used to measure how fast a subject can exhale as well as to judge the strength of the expiratory muscles and the condition of the large airways.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.label: Decreased pre-bronchodilator forced vital capacity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can expel following maximal insipiration, with the test being performed before the administration of a bronchodilating medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.label: Decreased post-bronchodilator forced vital capacity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can expel following maximal insipiration, with the test being performed after the administration of a bronchodilating medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.label: Decreased post-bronchodilator forced expiratory volume in one second
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can forcefully expel in one second, with the test being performed after the administration of a bronchodilating medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.label: Decreased forced expiratory flow 25-75%
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003235.definition: A reduction compared to the predicted value of the forced expiratory flow over the middle one-half of the FVC; the average flow from the point at which 25% of the FVC has been exhaled to the point at which 75% of the FVC has been exhaled.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.label: Decreased pre-bronchodilator forced expiratory flow 25-75%
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.definition: A reduction compared to the predicted value of the forced expiratory flow over the middle one-half of the FVC; the average flow from the point at which 25% of the FVC has been exhaled to the point at which 75% of the FVC has been exhaled. Here, the test is performed before the administration of a bronchodilating medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.label: Decreased post-bronchodilator forced expiratory flow 25-75%
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.definition: A reduction compared to the predicted value of the forced expiratory flow over the middle one-half of the FVC; the average flow from the point at which 25% of the FVC has been exhaled to the point at which 75% of the FVC has been exhaled. Here, the test is performed after the administration of a bronchodilating medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.label: Increased circulating corticosterone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.definition: An abnormally elevated concentration of corticosterone in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.label: Decreased circulating corticosterone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.definition: An abnormally reduced concentration of corticosterone in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.label: obsolete Abnormal CSF amino acid level
Exacerbated by aspirin exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by ingestion of aspirin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.label: Positive direct antiglobulin test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.definition: A positive result of the direct antiglobulin test (DAT), a method of demonstrating the presence of antibody or complement bound to red blood cell (RBC) membranes by the use of anti-human globulin to form a visible agglutination reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.label: Abnormal growth hormone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.definition: Any deviation from the normal level of growth hormone (GH) in the blood circulation. GH or somatotropin is a peptide hormone that stimulates growth, cell reproduction, and cell regeneration. Its secretion from the pituitary is regulated by the neurosecretory nuclei of the hypothalamus, which can release Growth hormone-releasing hormone (GHRH or somatocrinin) and Growth hormone-inhibiting hormone (GHIH or somatostatin) into the hypophyseal portal venous blood surrounding the pituitary. GH is secreted in a pulsatile manner, which is one of the reasons why an isolated measurement of its blood concentration is not meaningful.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.label: Acidemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.definition: An abnormally low blood pH (usually defined as less than 7.35).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.label: Alkalemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003236.definition: An abnormally high blood pH (usually defined as 7.41 or above).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Blood group A
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: ABO phenotype A, corresponding to the genotype AO or AA.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Isoleucinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: An increased concentration of isoleucine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Increased peripheral blast count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: An increased count in the peripheral blood of cells that are precursors to mature circulating blood cells such as neutrophiles, monocytes, lymphocutes, and erythrocytes. Blasts are not usually found in significant numbers in the peripheral blood circulation, but can be observed in hematopoietic neoplasms such as leukemia, severe infections, and as a result of certain medications.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Duffy blood group
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: The Duffy blood group system is based on the presence of a glycoprotein termed Fy that is on the surface of erythrocytes and some other cells. There are two Duffy antigens named Fya and Fyb, and thus there are four Duffy phenotypes: a+b+, a+b-, a-b+,a-b-.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Duffy Fya positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: Presence of the Duffy Fya antigen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Duffy Fyb positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: Presence of the Duffy Fyb antigen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Anti-beta 2 glycoprotein I antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: Presence of antibodies against beta 2 glycoprotein I in the circulation. Beta-2 glycoprotein I (beta2GPI) is the principal target of autoantibodies in the antiphospholipid syndrome (APS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Increased urinary orosomucoid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: An increased concentration in the urine of alpha-1-acid glycoprotein (AGP), also known as orosomucoid (ORM). AGP is a 41-43-kDa glycoprotein with a pI of 2.8-3.8. AGP is an acute-phase protein that has many activities including, but not limited to, acting as an acute-phase reactant and disease marker, modulating immunity, binding and carrying drugs, maintaining the barrier function of capillary, and mediating the sphingolipid metabolism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Immediate-type hypersensitivity drug reaction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: Hypersensitivity that is observed within 1 hr of exposures. A variety of adverse reactions can occur within minutes to hours of exposure to a drug. Some can be related to the pharmacological action of the drug (WHO Adverse Reaction Terminology type A for augmented) and usually have a low mortality. Others are not readily predictable based on the structure and pharmacological action of the drug and have a relatively high mortality risk (Type B for bizarre). The most serious form of immediate onset drug hypersensitivity reaction, anaphylaxis. Other reactions including itching, dizziness/light-headedness, nausea, chest discomfort but without any objective skin features, physical signs or physiological compromise. Skin only reactions include generalized erythema, urticaria or angioedema without any sentinel features (see below) of other organ involvement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.label: Polymorphous light eruption
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003237.definition: The cardinal symptom is severely pruritic skin lesions. Macular, papular, papulovesicular, urticarial, multiforme- and plaque-like variants are differentiated morphologically, hence the name polymorphous. Usually one morphology dominates in a single individual (monomorphous). The skin lesions develop a few hours to several days after sun exposure. Initially, patchy erythema develops, accompanied by pruritus. Distinct lesions then develop. The upper chest, upper arms, backs of the hands, thighs, and the sides of the face are the primary localizations. The skin lesions resolve spontaneously within several days of ceasing sun exposure and do not leave behind any traces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.label: Hydroa vacciniforme
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.definition: In response to the spring sun distinct inflamed reddened skin develops on the ears, nose, cheeks, fingers, backs of the hands, and the lower arms, on which blisters with serous or hemorrhagic content develop. These dry out with the formation of a blackish scab. After shedding of the scab, depressed, varioliform, often hypopigmented scars remain. In addition, hyper- and hypopigmentation are present together, resulting in a polymorphous skin presentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.label: Uniparental disomy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.definition: Inheritance of both homologues of a chromosome pair from the same parent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.label: Uniparental heterodisomy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.definition: A type of uniparental disomy in which the two different chromosomes (or chromosome segments) of the same parent are transmitted.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.label: Uniparental isodisomy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.definition: A type of uniparental disomy in which the two identical chromosomes (or chromosome segments) of the same parent are transmitted.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.label: Abnormal circulating transferrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of transferrin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.label: Elevated circulating transferrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.definition: An abnormally increased concentration of transferrin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.label: Reduced circulating transferrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of transferrin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.label: Periventricular nodular heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.definition: Nodules of heterotopia along the ventricular walls. There can be a single nodule or a large number of nodules, they can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, they can be small or large, single or multiple.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.label: Periventricular laminar heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003238.definition: A large mass of heterotopia in a laminar configuration along the ventricular walls. Usually bilateral.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Periventricular ribbonlike heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: Heterotopia that forms a continuous wavy line along the ventricular wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Subcortical heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: A form of heterotopia were the mislocalized gray matter is located deep within the white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Nodular subcortical heterotopia in peritrigonal regions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: Solid nodular heterotopia situated in the region of the peritrigonal optic pathway posterior to the deep gray nuclei.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Diffuse ribbon-like subcortical heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: Subcortical heterotopia consisting of a bilateral and symmetric single continuous, undulating ribbon-like layer of gray matter located in the frontal, parietal and occipital lobes. It has no visible connection to the overlying cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Mesial parasagittal subcortical heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: Subcortical heterotopia extending along the mesial aspect of the lateral ventricles, with direct connection to mesial polymicrogyria-like cortex at the anterior and posterior limits of the heterotopia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Curvilinear subcortical heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: Large subcortical heterotopia of variable morphology wiht streaks and swirls. These always connect to the overlying cortex in at least one, but usually in multiple, locations. Spaces with the signal intensity of CSF are usually seen within the heterotopia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Transmantle columnar heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: Linear heterotopia spanning from the cerebral mantle from the pia to the ependyma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Citrullinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: An increased concentration of citrulline in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Dysgyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: An abnormal gyral pattern characterized by abnormalities of sulcal depth or orientation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.label: Dysgyria with normal cortical thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003239.definition: An abnormal gyral pattern characterized by abnormalities of sulcal depth or orientation but with a normal thickness of the cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.label: Dysgyria with thickened cortex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.definition: An abnormal gyral pattern characterized by abnormalities of sulcal depth or orientation and a thickened cortex intermediate between pachygyria and polymicrogyria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.label: Aspartic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.definition: A increased concentration of aspartic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.label: Asparaginuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.definition: An increased concentration of asparagine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.label: Testicular mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.definition: An abnormal bulge or lump in a testis. A testicular mass has a long differential diagnosis including testicular torsion, epididymitis, acute orchitis, strangulated hernia and testicular cancer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.label: Increased urinary phosphoserine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.definition: An increased level of phosphoserine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.label: Unilateral perisylvian polymicrogyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.definition: A type of perisylvian polymicrogyria that largely affects one side of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.label: Bilateral perisylvian polymicrogyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.definition: A type of perisylvian polymicrogyria that affects both sides of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.label: Breast mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.definition: A breast lump is any discrete mass in a breast noticed by the patient, significant other, or physician.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.label: Subcortical band heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003240.definition: A form of subcortical heterotopia with mislocalized gray matter within the white matter.It is defined as longitudinal bands of gray matter located deep to the cerebral cortex and separated from it by a thin layer of normal appearing white matter. It is part of the lissencephaly spectrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Bilateral generalized polymicrogyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: Symmetric generalized polymicrogyria with no obvious gradient or region of maximal severity; may have abnormal high signal in white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Posterior predominant subcortical band heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: Longitudinal bands of gray matter located deep to the cerebral cortex and separated from it by a thin layer of normal appearing white matter visible along the occipital cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Anterior predominant subcortical band heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: Longitudinal bands of gray matter located deep to the cerebral cortex and separated from it by a thin layer of normal appearing white matter visible in the frontal and temporal lobes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Diffuse subcortical band heterotopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: Longitudinal bands of gray matter located deep to the cerebral cortex and separated from it by a thin layer of normal appearing white matter visible along the whole brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Hydroxylysinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: The presence of an elevated amount of 5-hydroxylysine in the urine. This compound is a hydroxylated derivative of the amino acid lysine that is present in certain collagens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Parasagittal parieto-occipital polymicrogyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: Polymicrogyria in parasagittal and mesial aspects of parieto-occipital cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Retinal microaneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: A localized dilation of microvasculature formed due to disruption of the internal elastic lamina of a retinal capillary blood vessel. The lesions present as small circular, red dots having distinct margins and are no larger than a blood vessel width at the disk margin. This expansion disturbs the normal flow pattern, changing shear force and pressure along the vessel. Shear force plays a key role in promoting the differentiation and proliferation of endothelial cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Periglomerular fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: Circumferential fibrosis in the interstitium surrounding Bowman's capsule

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Abnormal HDL subfraction concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: An abnormal concentration of an HDL subfraction, which can be determined by methods such as electrophoresis followed by densitometric determination of the areas under the peaks. Large HDL subfractions are defined as HDL1 (greater than 12 nm), HDL2b (9.7-12 nm), and HDL2a (8.8-9.69 nm). Small HDL subfractions are defined as HDL3a (8.2-8.79 nm), HDL3b (7.8-8.19 nm), and HDL3c (7.20-7.79 nm).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.label: Abnormal HDL2a concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003241.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of the HDL2a subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL2a particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 8.80-9.69 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Increased HDL2a concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: An elevation above the normal concentration of the HDL2a subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL2a particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 8.80-9.69 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Decreased HDL2a concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: A reduction below the normal concentration of the HDL2a subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL2a particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 8.80-9.69 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Abnormal HDL2b concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of the HDL2b subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL2b particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 9.7-12 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Decreased HDL2b concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: A reduction below the normal concentration of the HDL2b subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL2b particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 9.7-12 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Increased HDL2b concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: An elevation above the normal concentration of the HDL2b subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL2b particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 9.7-12 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Abnormal HDL3a concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of the HDL3a subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3a particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 8.2-8.79 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Abnormal HDL3b concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of the HDL3b subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3b particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 7.8-8.19 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Abnormal HDL3c concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of the HDL3c subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3c particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 7.20-7.79 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Increased HDL3a concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: An elevation above the normal concentration of the HDL3a subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3a particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 8.2-8.79 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.label: Decreased HDL3a concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003242.definition: A reduction below the normal concentration of the HDL3a subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3a particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 8.2-8.79 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Increased HDL3b concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: An elevation above the normal concentration of the HDL3b subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3b particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 7.8-8.19 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Decreased HDL3b concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: A reduction below the normal concentration of the HDL3b subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3b particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 7.8-8.19 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Increased HDL3c concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: An elevation above the normal concentration of the HDL3c subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3c particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 7.20-7.79 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Decreased HDL3c concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: A reduction below the normal concentration of the HDL3c subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3c particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 7.20-7.79 nm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Delayed umbilical cord separation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: Separation of the umbilical cord occurs at an abnormally late timepoint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Neonatal omphalitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: An infection of the umbilicus and/or surrounding tissues occurring in the neonatal period.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Abnormal circulating C-reactive protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of C-reactive protein in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Reduced circulating C-reactive protein concecntration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: An abnormal decrease of the C-reactive protein level in serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Platelet anisocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: Abnormally increased variability in the size of platelets.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.label: Airborn particle hypersensitivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003243.definition: An abnormally increased sensitivity to airborn particles. This can be diagnosed on the basis of the medical history, taking into account seasonality or a relationship to the concentration of airborn particles in the environment of the affected individual. Aerosol challenge is a gold standard of establishment of the symptom. There exist particle hypersensitivity (diesel exhaust, metals, inorganic material) vs. allergen (including pollen dander, etc) hypersensitivity. The responses are usually different and testing for allergen hypersensitivity is done in concert with serum IgE and or skin testing to the suspected allergen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Blood group B
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: ABO phenotype B, corresponding to the genotype BO or BB.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Blood group AB
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: ABO phenotype AB, corresponding to the genotype AB.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Blood group O
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: ABO phenotype O, corresponding to the genotype OO.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Past medical history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: In a medical encounter, the physician generally will interview the patient about his or her current problem, and may perform additional testing. The past medical history (PMH) in contrast records information about the patient's medical, personal and family history that might be relevant to the presenting illness or to provide optimal clinical management. The PMH generally includes (if relevant) other major illnesses, hospitalizations, surgeries, injuries, allergies, gynecologic and obstetric history, family history, personal history including occupational history, alcohol and drug use, etc.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Status post organ transplantation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: The affected individual has received an organ transplant previous to the current medical encounter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Pulmonary cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: A round circumscribed space within a lung that is surrounded by an epithelial or fibrous wall of variable thickness. A cyst usually has a thin and regular wall (less than 2 mm) and contains air, although some may contain fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Pulmonary bulla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: Pulmonary bullae are rounded focal regions of emphysema with a thin wall which measure more than 1 cm in diameter. They are often subpleural in location and are typically larger in the apices. In some cases, bullae can be very large and result in compression of adjacent lung tissue. A giant bulla is arbitrarily defined as one that occupies at least one third of the volume of a hemithorax. When large, bullae can simulate pneumothorax. The most common cause is paraseptal emphysema but bullae may also be seen in association with centrilobular emphysema.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Pulmonary bleb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: A bleb is a small gas-containing space within the visceral pleura or in the subpleural lung, not larger than 1 cm in diameter. CT findings show a bleb as a thin-walled cystic air space contiguous with the pleura.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Achlorhydria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: A condition in which production of hydrochloric acid in the stomach is absent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.label: Abnormal dermoepidermal hemidesmosome morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003244.definition: An abnormal structure or appearance of hemidesmosomes, multiprotein complexes that facilitate the stable adhesion of basal epithelial cells to the underlying basement membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: Positive blood arsenic test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: Detection of arsenic in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: Oral melanotic macule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: Flat, distinct, discolored area of oral mucosal membrane less than 1 cm wide not associated with a change in the thickness or texture of the affected mucosal membrane. The lesions are small, solitary, well-circumscribed and often uniformly pigmented.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: Oral melanoacanthoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: Oral melanoacanthoma usually presents as an asymptomatic, ill-defined, rapidly enlarging, macular pigmentation. Although most lesions are heavily pigmented, the coloration may or may not be uniform. Any mucosal site may be affected, but buccal mucosal involvement is most common. Although typically solitary, rare patients may present with multifocal lesions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: Abnormal lip pigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: Abnormal coloring of the lip, whereby the lip discolored, blotchy, or darker or lighter than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: Labial melanotic macule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: Flat, distinct, discolored area on the lip less than 1 cm wide not associated with a change in the thickness or texture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: Reduced granulocyte CD18 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: Reduced level of CD18 on the granulocyte surface. This feature can be assessed by flow cytometry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: Unlayered lissencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: A type of lissencephaly whereby upon neuropathological examination the cortical plate is severely disorganized with a festooned-like pattern and with neither lamination nor clear demarcation between white and grey matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: 2-3-layered lissencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: Pachygyria-agyria spectrum whereby at neuropathological examination the cortical plate consists of a two-three layered organization made up of a molecular layer, a relatively thin wavy layer with a higher cellular density and a third layer with lower cellularity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: Narrowing of medullary canal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: A reduction in diameter and volume of the central cavity of bone where red or yellow bone marrow is located.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.label: Abnormal phosphoribosylpyrophosphate synthetase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003245.definition: Any deviation from the normal level of the enzyme phosphoribosyl pyrophosphatesynthetase, which catalyzes the synthesis of PP-ribose-P from ATP and ribose-5-phosphate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.label: Decreased phosphoribosylpyrophosphate synthetase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.definition: Abnormally reduced level of the enzyme phosphoribosyl pyrophosphatesynthetase, which catalyzes the synthesis of PP-ribose-P from ATP and ribose-5-phosphate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.label: Increased circulating palmitate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.definition: An elevation beyond the normal concentration of palmitate (palmitic acid) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.label: Reduced circulating fibronectin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.definition: A reduction below the normal concentration of fibronectin the the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.label: Bladder trabeculation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.definition: Muscular projections that protrude into the lumen of the bladder, criss-crossing the walls of the bladder on its inner surface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.label: Aplasia of the olfactory bulb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.definition: Lack of formation (congenital absence) of the olfactory bulb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.label: Past obstetric history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.definition: Information about past pregnancies including gravidity (number of times a woman has been pregnant, regardless of the outcome), parity (total number of births), gestational age of births, and medical conditions related to past pregnancies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.label: History of stillbirth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.definition: One or more previous pregnancies resulted in stillbirth, defined as death of a fetus in the later stages of pregnancy (definitions in the literature vary, with cut-offs ranging from 20 to 28 weeks gestation).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.label: Anti-asialoglycoprotein receptor antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003246.definition: Presence of autoantibodies against the asialoglycoprotein receptor (ASGPR) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.label: Monilethrix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.definition: The hair shaft has a beaded appearance due to the presence of elliptical nodes that have the diameter of normal hair and are medullated, regularly separated by internodes that are narrow, devoid of medulla and are the site of fracture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.label: Focal polymicrogyria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.definition: Polymicrogyria affecting one or multiple small areas of the cerebral cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.label: Abnormal urine urobilinogen level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.definition: An abnormal concentration of urobilinogen in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.label: Decreased urine urobilinogen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.definition: An abnormally reduced concentration of urobilinogen in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.label: Abnormal circulating vitamin B6 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.definition: An abnormal concentration of vitamin B6 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.label: Elevated circulating vitamin B6 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.definition: An abnormally increased concentration of vitamin B6 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.label: Lateral spinal meningocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.definition: Protrusion of the arachnoid and dura through spinal foramina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.label: Preimplantation lethality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003247.definition: It is estimated that about 40-70 percent of human embryos produced in vitro fertilization (IVF) and intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) are viable embryos, whereas others arrest at different early stages of development. The phenotype of preimplantation lethality is inferred if IVF and ICSI cycles fail because all of an individual's embryos are arrested at early stages of development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.label: Beta-aminoisobutyric aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.definition: An increased amount of beta-aminoisobutyric acid in the urine. Beta-aminoisobutyric acid is a non-protein amino acid originating from the catabolism of thymine and valine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.label: Abnormal pituitary glycoprotein hormone alpha subunit level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of circulating alpha polypeptide of glycoprotein hormones (NCBI Gene 1081).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.label: Decreased pituitary glycoprotein hormone alpha subunit level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.definition: An reduced concentration of circulating alpha polypeptide of glycoprotein hormones (NCBI Gene 1081).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.label: Elevated fecal sodium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.definition: An elevated concentration of sodium in feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.label: Abnormal fecal osmolality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.definition: Abnormal concentration of feces as assessed by the total number of solute particles per kilogram.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.label: Elevated fecal osmolality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.definition: Abnormally high concentration of feces as assessed by the total number of solute particles per kilogram.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.label: Reduced fecal osmolality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.definition: Abnormally low concentration of feces as assessed by the total number of solute particles per kilogram.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.label: Abnormal fecal pH
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.definition: Any deviation from the normal pH of feces. The pH reflects the acidity or alkalinity of a solution on a logarithmic scale on which 7 is neutral, whereby lower values are more acid and higher values more alkaline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.label: Elevated fecal pH
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003248.definition: Abnormally high fecal pH, i.e., abnormal alkalinity of feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.label: Decreased fecal pH
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.definition: Abnormally low fecal pH, i.e., abnormal acidity of feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.label: Increased circulating argininosuccinic acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.definition: An increased level of the non-proteinogenic amino acid argininosuccinic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.label: Anti-myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.definition: Presence of antibodies in the serum that react against myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.label: Increased circulating trypsinogen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.definition: An abnormally high concentration of trypsinogen in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.label: Abnormal terminal:vellus ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.definition: A deviation from the normal proportion of terminal to vellus hairs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.label: Elevated terminal:vellus ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.definition: An increased proportion of terminal hairs compared to vellus hairs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.label: Reduced terminal:vellus ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.definition: A terminal:vellus ratio under 4:1 is characteristic of androgenetic alopecia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.label: Giant neutrophil granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003249.definition: The presence of abnormally large granules in neutrophils. This finding can be appreciated on a peripheral blood smear. The finding is characteristic of Chediak Higashi syndrome. The giant granules are derived from azurophil granules, whereas peroxidase-negative granules are not involved in their formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Exacerbated by tobacco use
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by smoking tobacco products.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Exacerbated by contraceptive medication exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by taking contraceptive medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Exacerbated by barbiturate exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by taking barbituates.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Ameliorated by ethanol ingestion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by drinking alcohol (ethanol).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Lhermitte's sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: An electric shock-like sensation that occurs on flexion of the neck. This sensation radiates down the spine, often into the legs, arms, and sometimes to the trunk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Hydrophobia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: Pharyngeal spasms that are provoked by an attempt to drink.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Alien limb phenomenon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: Alien limb phenomenon refers to involuntary motor activity of a limb in conjunction with the feeling of estrangement from that limb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Labiomental fasciculations
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: Fasciculations affecting the tongue muscle and the musculature of the chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Polyembolokoilamania
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: Habitual insertion of foreign bodies into bodily orifices.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.label: Onychotillomania
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003250.definition: Onychotillomania is characterized by the compulsive or irresistible urge in patients to pick at, pull off, or harmfully bite or chew their nails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.label: Tendon pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to a tendon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.label: Superiorly positioned umbilicus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.definition: The position of the umbilicus (belly button) is abnormally high (superior).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.label: Four-vessel umbilical cord
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.definition: Four-vessel umbilical cord containing two arteries and two veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.label: Duplicated lacrimal punctum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.definition: A congenital developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two (instead of the normal one) lacrimal punctum on one or both sides of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.label: Deep dermatophytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.definition: A type of invasive dermatophyte infection of the deep dermis characterized by extensive dermal infiltration by fungal elements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.label: Invasive dermatophyte infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.definition: Infection that extends deeply into the dermis by dermatophytes, fungi that typically cause different types of superficial infection (tinea) or skin, hair, or nails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.label: Majocchi's granuloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.definition: Majocchi's granuloma (MG) is an inflammatory and granulomatous, dermatophytic infection characterized by a granulomatous inflammation around the hair follicle. Histopathologically, MG demonstrates a nodular perifollicular granulomatous infiltrate of lymphoid cells, macrophages, epithelioid cells, multinucleated giant cells, and neutrophils. Unlike superficial dermatophytoses, fungal hyphae and spores can be detected not only on the surface of the epidermis but also within or around the hair follicles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.label: Disseminated dermatophytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.definition: A type of invasive dermatophyte infection characterized by vascular involvement and dissemination to other organs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.label: Increased Burr cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003251.definition: Burr cells, also known as echinocytes, have a speculated border over the entire cell surface. Burr cells are commonly found in both end-stage renal disease and liver disease. Small numbers of Burr cells are commonly found in healthy individuals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: Masseter muscular weakness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.definition: Reduced strength of the masseter muscle, whose primary function is to elevate the mandible and thereby raise the mandible towards the maxilla, closing the jaw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: Self hugging
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.definition: Involuntary, tic-like movements consisted of crossing both arms across the chest and tensing the body or clasping the hands and squeezing the arms to the sides. The movements last a few seconds and may occur in series or flurries, generally accompanied by facial grimacing and occasional grunting.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: Ameliorated by immunosuppresion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with immunosuppresive medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: Tendon thickening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.definition: An abnormal increase in the thickness (diameter) of a tendon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: Long thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.definition: Length of the thumb is greater than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: Exacerbated by acetylcholinesterase inhibitor exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by treatment with an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor such as tensilon (edrophonium) or pyridostigmine (Mestinon).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: Ameliorated by acetylcholinesterase inhibitor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor such as mestinon or tensilon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: Inferiorly positioned umbilicus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.definition: The position of the umbilicus (belly button) is abnormally low (inferior).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: Elevated urinary 4-hydroxybutyric acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.definition: An increased amount of 4-hydroxybutyric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003252.label: obsolete Elevated circulating gamma-aminobutyric acid concentration

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.label: Decreased succinic semialdehyde dehydrogenase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.definition: Reduced level of succinic semialdehyde dehydrogenase (SSADH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.label: Elevated CSF 4-hydroxybutyric acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.definition: Abnormally increased level of 4-hydroxybutyric acid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.label: Elevated circulating acetone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.definition: An increased level of acetone in the blood circulation. Acetone is one of the predominant ketone bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.label: Exacerbated by methylxanthine ingestion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by ingestion of food containing a methylxanthine compound (for instance, coffee, caffeine, chocolate).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.label: Cervical (neck)
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.definition: Applies to an abnormality that is situated in the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.label: Increased number of lymph nodes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.definition: An abnormally elevated number of lymph nodes in an anatomical region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.label: Delayed fracture healing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.definition: A delay in healing of a fracture past the expected duration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.label: Pretibial dimple
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003253.definition: A groove or crease on the shins (pretibial, i.e., over the shin bone). Pretibial creases may be obvious at birth and may range from 3 cm to over 15 cm in length and lenghten as the limb grows.
