http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.label: Abnormal factor IX activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.definition: Abnormal activity of coagulation factor IX. Factor IX, which itself is activated by factor Xa or factor VIIa to form factor IXa, activates factor X into factor Xa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.label: Shortened sleep phase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.definition: A tendency to sleep fewer hours than usual while feeling well-rested.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.label: Renal interstitial globotriaosylceramide inclusions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.definition: Accumulation of globotriaosylceramide (GL-3) in kidney tissues, which can be quantified as the number of globotriaosylceramide (GL-3) inclusions/kidney interstitial capillary (KIC).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.label: Mild albuminuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.definition: The presence of mildly increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as an albumin-creatinine ratio (ACR) less than 30 mg/gm (less than 3.4 mg/mmol).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.label: Severe albuminuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.definition: The presence of severely increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as an albumin-creatinine ratio greater than 300 mg/gm (greater than 34 mg/mmol).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.label: Medication crystalluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.definition: A variety of drugs may occasionally cause transient crystalluria, in isolation or in conjunction with other urinary abnormalities. Overdose, dehydration, or hypoalbuminaemia, which increases the unbound drug which is ultrafiltrated by the glomerulus, are the factors usally favoring the precipitation of crystals within the tubular lumina. In some cases, medication-induced crystalluria has a distinct phenotypic appearance. For instance, Sulphadiazine crystals appear as strongly birefringent 'shocks of wheat' or 'shells' with an amber colour. Acyclovir crystals are birefringent and needle-shaped, and when present in abundance give to urine a silky and opalescent macroscopic appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.label: Renal interstitial IgG4+ plasma cell infiltration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003306.definition: An increased number of IgG4+ plasma cells in the interstitial space of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Impaired self monitoring
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: Impaired ability to track awareness of the effect that one's behavior has on others and how it compares with standards or expectations for behavior.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Impaired task monitoring
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: Impaired ability to keep track of one's problem-solving success or failure, and to identify and correct mistakes during performance of a goal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Abnormal macroscopic urine appearance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: Anomalous physical appearance (color, cloudiness, clarity) or odor of urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Urate tophus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: Intradermal urate crystal deposits appeared as small, superficial, pustule-like, whitish lesions. The lesions may be the focus of inflammatory episodes with increasing pain, swelling, and erythema of the intradermal tophi.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Steroid-responsive anemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: Amelioration of anemia upon treatment with a steroid medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Inappropriately normal thyroid-stimulating hormone level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: A normal or elevated serum thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) level in the face of an elevation in circulating FT4 and/or FT3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Abnormal circulating free T4 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of free thyroxine (T4) in the blood circulation. Circulating T4 is almost entirely bound to specific transport proteins such as thyroxine-binding globulin (TBG) but it is the unbound (free) fraction that is able to enter tissues and exert effects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Increased circulating free T4 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: An elevated concentration of free thyroxine (fT4) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Decreased circulating free T4 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: A reduced concentration of free thyroxine (fT4) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the thyroid gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003307.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Abnormal TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: Thyrotrophin-releasing hormone (TRH) is a hypothalamic tripeptide synthesised by, stored within and released from the hypothalamus. It stimulates the synthesis and release of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) from the anterior pituitary gland. Following administration of exogenous TRH, a transient increase in serum TSH is expected. This term refers to an abnormal reponse in the TRH stimulation test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Absent TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: Failure to increase serum TSH levels in response to a TRH stimulation test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Reduced TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: A lower than normal TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Increased circulating farnesol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: An elevated level of farnesol in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Abnormal antral follicle count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: Any deviation from a count of antral follicles that is normal for age. Antral follicles appear as small fluid-filled sacs that contain an immature egg. Antral follicle count can be measured (usually on day 2-5 of the menstrual cycle) by transvaginal ultrasound. The number of antral follicles may reflect ovarian reserve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Reduced antral follicle count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: A count of antral follicles that is lower than normal for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Increased antral follicle count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: A count of antral follicles that is higher than normal for age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Quotidian fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: Fever that occurs at daily intervals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Valinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: Urine valine level above the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.label: Branched-chain aminoaciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003308.definition: An increased level of a branched chain family amino acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Increased aromatic amino acid level in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: An elevated level of an aromatic amino acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Tyrosinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: An abnormally increased level of tyrosine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Increased urine succinate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: The concentration of succinate in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Increased glutamine family amino acid level in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: An elevated level of an glutamine family amino acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Increased urine glutamate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: An increased concentration of glutamate in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Increased sulfur amino acid level in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: An elevated level of a sulfur-containing amino acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Increased aspartate family amino acid level in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: An elevated level of an aspartate family amino acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Increased urine proteinogenic amino acid derivative level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: An elevated urine level of a compound that is derived from an amino acid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Increased urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: An increased level in the urine of an alpha-amino acid which is not a member of the group of 23 proteinogenic amino acids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.label: Increased serine family amino acid in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003309.definition: An increased level of a serine family amino acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Increased proteinogenic amino acid level in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: An elevated level of a proteinogenic amino acid in the urine. These are the 23 alpha-amino acids that are precursors to proteins, and are incorporated into proteins during translation. The group includes the 20 amino acids encoded by the nuclear genes of eukaryotes together with selenocysteine, pyrrolysine, and N-formylmethionine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Elevated urine aconitic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: An abnormally increased level of aconitic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Monkey wrench femoral neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: The femoral neck region shows medial metaphyseal beaking and a significant enlargement of the lesser trochanter (with some enlargement also of the greater trochanter), producing a monkey wrench (Swedish key) configuration of the proximal femur. A monkey wrench refers to a type of adjustable wrench with one fixed and one adjustable jaw at right angles to a straight handle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Elevated circulating CHI3L1 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: Increased concentration of chitinase 3-like 1 (CHI3L1) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Inappropriate absence of fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: Failure to develop fever in the presence of an infection that normally would be expected to elicit a febrile response.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Interhypothalamic adhesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: An abnormal parenchymal band connecting the medial margins of the left and right hypothalami across the third ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Elevated circulating D-dimer concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: An increased concentration of D-dimers, a marker of fibrin degradation, in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Abnormal circulating proteinogenic amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: An elevated level of a proteinogenic amino acid in the blood circulation. These are the 23 alpha-amino acids that are precursors to proteins, and are incorporated into proteins during translation. The group includes the 20 amino acids encoded by the nuclear genes of eukaryotes together with selenocysteine, pyrrolysine, and N-formylmethionine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Abnormal circulating proteinogenic amino acid derivative concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of a compound that is derived from an amino acid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.label: Abnormal circulating non-proteinogenic amino acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003310.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of an alpha-amino acid which is not a member of the group of 23 proteinogenic amino acids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: Elevated circulating alpha-aminobutyric acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: An abnormally increased level of alpa-aminobutyric acid in the blood circulation. Alpha-aminobutyric acid alpha-amino acid that is butyric acid bearing a single amino substituent located at position 2.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: 3-hydroxyisovaleric aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: Concentration of 3-hydroxyisovaleric acid in the urine above the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: Elevated circulating apolipoprotein C-III concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: An increased concentration in blood of apolipoprotein C-III, a protein component of triglyceride (TG)-rich lipoproteins (TRLs) including very low density lipoproteins (VLDL), high density lipoproteins (HDL) and chylomicrons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: Gallop rhythm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: In the normal heart cycle, two heart sounds can be heard by auscultation per cycle: S1 and S2. A gallop rhythm refers to the presence of three or four heart sounds per cardiac cycle, which is said to resemble the gallop of a horse.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: Quadruple gallop rhythm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: A type of gallop rhytm in which both the third and the fourth sounds are present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: Elevated circulating tenascin-C level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: Abnormally increased concentration of tenascin-C in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: Duodenal gastric metaplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: Foci of gastric-type mucus-secreting cells interspersed between duodenal enterocytes. These foci of gastric epithelial cells contain Periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive neutral mucin and lack a brush border.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: Duodenitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: Inflammation of the lining of the upper small intestine (duodenum).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: Abnormal right ventricular function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: Anomalous physiology (function) of the right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.label: Elevated right ventricular systolic pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003311.definition: Elevation of right ventricular systolic pressure (RVSP) above normal limits. In adults, RVSP is normally 20-30 mmHg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Nummular eczema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: A type of eczema characterized by pruritic coin-shaped patches on the skin. Nummular eczema most commonly occurs on the extremities, particularly the legs, but may occur anywhere on the trunk, hands, or feet

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Barking cough
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: A cough with a characteristic sound that has been compared to a seal's bark.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Absent P wave
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: The P wave that normally precedes each QRS complex by a fixed PR interval of 120 to 200 milliseconds is not present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Elevated circulating osteopontin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: Abnormally increased level of osteopontin in the blood circulation

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Increased serum sorbitol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: An increased level of sorbitol in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Follicular lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: An indolent B cell lymphoproliferative disorder of transformed follicular center B cells. Follicular lymphoma is characterized by diffuse lymphadenopathy, bone marrow involvement, splenomegaly and less commonly other extranodal sites of involvement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Cutaneous necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: Skin and subcutaneous tissue necrosis (tissue death). Clinically, cutaneous necrosis may present as a painful and extremely tender black eschar (dead tissue found in a full-thickness wound) surrounded by dusky grey-red coloured skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Abnormality of the musculoskeletal system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: An anomaly of the musculoskeletal system, which consists of the bones of the skeleton, muscles, cartilage, tendons, ligaments, joints, and other connective tissue. The musculoskeletal system supports the weight of the body, maintains body position and produces movements of the body or of parts of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Delayed ability to crawl
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: A failure to achieve the ability to crawl at an appropriate developmental stage. Normal infant motor development is marked by a series of postural milestones including learning to crawl on hands and knees between the ages of 6 and 10 months.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.label: Abnormal shoulder physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003312.definition: Anopmalous function of the shoulder. The shoulder is a ball-and-socket joint that is made up of humerus, scapula and clavicle, which are connected by the sternoclavicular joint (SC), the acromioclavicular joint (AC), the glenohumeral joint (GH), and the scapulothoracic joint (ST). The GH, AC and SC joints link the upper extremity to the axial skeleton at the thorax and enable movement at the shoulder joint: flexion, extension, and rotation of the arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.label: Abnormal renal echogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.definition: Anomalous echogenicity of the kidney on ultrasound examination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.label: Renal medullary hyperechogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.definition: Increased echogenecity of the medullary region of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.label: Renal cortical hyperechogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.definition: Increased echogenecity of the kidney cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.label: Abdominal adhesions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.definition: Fibrous bands (i.e., bands of scar-like tissue) that span two or more intra-abdominal organs and/or the inner abdominal wall (i.e. peritoneal membrane).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.label: Hepatic infarction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.definition: Hepatic infarction is defined as areas of coagulative necrosis from hepatocyte cell death caused by local ischemia. Liver infarctions appear as hypoechoic nonvascular regions on conventional and Doppler sonography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.label: Lymph node abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.definition: An inflammed lymph node that is filled with pus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.label: Abnormal pulmonary alveolar system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.definition: A structural abnormality of the pulmonary acinus, alveolar parenchyma, or alveoli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.label: Right atrial thrombus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.definition: A thrombus (i.e., a blood clot formed in situ within the vascular system) located in the right atrium of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.label: Elevated circulating uracil concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003313.definition: Concentration of uracil in the blood circulation is above the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Blake's pouch cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: The presence of an upwardly displaced normal cerebellar vermis, normal appearance of the fastigium, tentorium and size of the cisterna magna.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Severe SARS-CoV-2 infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: Unusually severe clinical course of SARS-CoV-2 infection, manifested clinically by features such as dyspnea and hypoxia with diffuse bilateral ground-glass opacities of the lungs on computed tomographic scan with progressive respiratory insufficiency necessitating oxygen supplementation or mechanical ventilation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Long nasal bridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: Increased superior-inferior length of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Jejunitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: Inflammation of the lining of the middle section of the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Abnormal circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: Any deviation of the concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood from the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Increased circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: Elevated concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Elevated circulating methylsuccinic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: Increased concentration of methylsuccinic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Abnormal circulating short-chain fatty-acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a short-chain fatty acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Increased circulating isovaleric acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: Increased concentration of isovaleric acid, a C5, branched-chain saturated fatty acid, in the blood concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.label: Intrahepatic bile duct dilatation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003314.definition: Increased diameter (caliber) of intrahepatic bile ducts (bile ducts that transport bile between the Canals of Hering and the interlobar bile ducts).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Anorectal abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: An abscess located at the junction of the anal canal and the rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Abnormal pharynx morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: A structural anomaly of the pharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Abnormal pharynx physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: A functional anomaly of the pharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Elevated circulating dodecenoylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: An abnormally increased circulation of dodecenoylcarnitine, C12:1, in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Elevated circulating deoxypyridinoline concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: An increased concentration of lysyl-pyridinoline (deoxypyridinoline) cross-links in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Elevated circulating L-alloisoleucine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: Abnormally increased concentration of L-alloisoleucine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Elevated urine L-alloisoleucine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: Abnormally increased level of L-alloisoleucine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Elevated circulating 3-methylhistidine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: Abnormal increase of the concentration of 3-methylhistidine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Reduced respiratory ciliary beating frequency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: An abnormal reduction in the number of beats per unit time of the respiratory cilia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.label: Reduced urinary inosine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003315.definition: Decreased level of inosine in urine. Inosine is a purine nucleoside in which hypoxanthine is attached to ribofuranose via a beta-N(9)-glycosidic bond.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Decreased urinary guanosine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: Decreased level of guanosine in urine. Guanosine is a purine nucleoside in which guanine is attached to ribofuranose via a beta-N(9)-glycosidic bond.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Abnormal urinary purine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: Any deviation from the normal amount of a purine compound in the urine. Purines are aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring. Two of the four deoxyribonucleotides (deoxyadenosine and deoxyguanosine) and two of the four ribonucleotides (adenosine, or AMP, and guanosine, or GMP) are purines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Abnormal urinary pyrimidine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: Any deviation from the normal amount of a pyrimidine compound in the urine. Pyrimidines and pyrimidine derivatives are compounds containing a pyrimidne ring, which is a six-member aromatic heterocycle which consists of two nitrogen atoms (at positions 1 and 3) and four carbon atoms. The nucleotides cytosine, thymine and uracil are pyrimidines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Small intestinal bacterial overgrowth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: An increased number and/or abnormal type of bacteria in the small bowel. Small intestinal bacterial overgrowth has been defined as the presence of greater than one hundred thousand bacteria (i.e. colony-forming units, CFU) per mL of proximal jejunal aspiration. The normal value is ten thousand or few CFU/ml.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Focal active colitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: Focal active colitis (FAC) is characterized by focal crypt damage caused by neutrophils. FAC is characterized by an inflammatory infiltrate consisting of intraepithelial neutrophils and/or neutrophils invading the lumen of the criptae, with no other microscopic alteration of the colonic mucosa and, in particular, without the presence of signs of chronic inflammation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Necrotizing enterocolitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: Inflammation of the intestine leading to bacterial invasion causing cellular damage and death which causes necrosis of the colon and intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Recurrent viral upper respiratory tract infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: An increased susceptibility to viral upper respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent viral upper respiratory tract infections (otitis, sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Neutrophilic urticarial dermatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: A neutrophilic interstitial, perivascular and/or perieccrine infiltrate with leukocytoclasia. Notably, leukocytoclastic vasculitis is not present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Reduced mevalonate kinase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: Abnormally reduced activity of mevalonate kinase, which is a key enzyme in the mevalonate biosynthetic pathway that leads to the synthesis of both cholesterol and nonsterol isoprenoids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.label: Reduced total lung capacity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003316.definition: Abnormally reduced volume of air in the lungs upon the maximum effort of inspiration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Abnormal skinfold thickness measurement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: Any deviation from the normal range of a skinfold thickness, which quantifies the amount of subcutaneous fat when the skin is pinched by specialized calipers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Abnormal triceps skinfold thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the thickness of the tricpes skinfold, which quantifies the amount of subcutaneous fat when the skin is pinched by specialized calipers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Increased triceps skinfold thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: Increased thickness of the triceps skinfold, which is measured halfway down the back of the upper arm is increased.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Milky appearance of bronchoalveolar lavage fluid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: Return of lavage fluid with a milky apperance due to the accumulation of a mixture of pulmonary surfactant, which is a lipoprotein complex, in the alveolar space.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Bloody bronchoalveolar lavage fluid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: Return of lavage fluid characteristically has a bloody apperance in pulmonary alveolar hemorrhage. This is due to admixture of blood, which typically increases with each consecutive lavage portion. Microscopically erythrocytes can be seen. After 24 to 48 h macrophages contain phagocytosed erythrocytes, indicating previous bleeding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Elevated circulating 5-oxoproline concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: Concentration of L-pyroglutamic acid in the blood is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Submandibular lymph node enlargement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: Increased size of the lymph nodes that are located beneath the mandible (lower jaw).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Elevated circulating suberic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: An increased concentration of suberic acid in the blood circulation. Suberic acid is an alpha,omega-dicarboxylic acid that is the 1,6-dicarboxy derivative of hexane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Increased circulating interleukin 8 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: An increased concentration of interleukin-8 in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.label: Elevated circulating aconitic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003317.definition: Concentration of aconitic acid in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.label: Torsion of appendix of testis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.definition: The appendix testis or hydatid of Morgagni, is a vestigial remnant of the Müllerian duct located on the superior pole of the testicle between the testis and epididymis. Although this appendage has no vital function, it is present in 50% of males. Torsion of twisting of this vestigial remnant can be incredibly painful, but usually requires no medical intervention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.label: Spinal epidural abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.definition: Spinal epidural abscess (SEA) is caused by a suppurative infection in the epidural space. The mass effect of the abscess can compress and reduce blood flow to the spinal cord, conus medullaris, or cauda equina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.label: Increased circulating cathepsin D level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.definition: An increase in concentration of cathepsin D in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.label: Bilobed right lung
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.definition: A developmental defect of pulmonary lobation characterized by the presence of only two lobes of the right lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.label: Triggered by EBV infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by infection by the Epstein-Barr virus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.label: Misalignment of the pulmonary veins
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.definition: The term is commonly used to describe a putative abnormal location of pulmonary vein branches adjacent to pulmonary arteries within the same adventitial sheath. However, evidence has been provided that the vessels in question are not pulmonary veins, however represent dilated bronchial veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.label: Hyperimidodipeptiduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.definition: Elevated levels of proline-containing dipeptides in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.label: Cystic acne
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.definition: A severe type of acne characterized by the formation of cysts enclosing a mixture of keratin and sebum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.label: Radiculomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003318.definition: Tooth root length more than 2 SD above mean, or subjectively apparently increased tooth root length.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Hypertrichotic hyperpigmented patch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: A large nonpalpable spot of the skin over 1 cm in dimension with increased pigmentation and increased hair growth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Increased circulating selenium concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: An increased concentration of selenium in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Decreased circulating selenium concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: An abnormally reduced concentration of selenium in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Ballooning hepatocyte degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: Swelling of the hepatocyte, rounding of its contour, and alteration of the cytoplasm, which takes on a reticulated, rarified, or flocculant quality. The cytoplasm of the ballooned hepatocytes often contains clumps of eosinophilic ropey material known as Mallory-Denk bodies (MDBs) or Mallory hyaline, which is composed of hyperphosphorylated misfolded intermediate filaments, ubiquitin, and ubiquitin-binding protein P62.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Perioral erythema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: Erythema (Redness of the skin caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin) localized to the region surrounding the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Perianal erythema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: Erythema (Redness of the skin caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin) localized to the region surrounding the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Portal inflammation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: Infiltration of portal fields by inflammatory cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Hepatic lobular inflammation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: Infiltration of inflammatory cells in lobules of the liver. A focus of lobular inflammation can be defined as two or more inflammatory cells (neutrophils, lymphocytes and other mononuclear cells, eosinophils and microgranulomas) within the lobule present within the sinusoids or surrounding injured hepatocytes (ballooned or apoptotic hepatocytes).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Triggered by viral infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by infection by a virus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.label: Increased circulating interleukin 10 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003319.definition: An elevation of the concentration of interleukin 10 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Triceps hyporeflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: Reduced intensity of the triceps tendon reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Biceps hyporeflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: Reduced intensity of the biceps tendon reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Brachioradialis hyporeflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: Reduced intensity of the brachioradialis tendon reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Brachioradialis hyperreflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: Increased intensity of the brachioradialis reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Triceps hyperreflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: Increased intensity of the triceps reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Biceps hyperreflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: Increased intensity of the biceps reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Hyperactive Achilles reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: Increased intensity of the Achilles reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Increased proportion autoreactive unresponsive CD21-/low B cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: Increased proportion relative to B-lymphocytes of a subset of B lymphocytes characterized by dim/low levels of CD21, i.e., CD21-/low, in flow cytometry, and additionally enriched in autoreactive clones as determined for instance by clonse showing rheumatoid factor (anti-IgG) reactivity and antibodies recognizing cytoplasmic and to a lesser extent nuclear structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Alveolar capillary dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: A developmental defect of the alveolar airspace during cananicular lung development characterized by a decreased number of pulmonary capillaries located away from the alveolar epithelium, thickened alveolar septae, media hypertrophy of small pulmonary arteries and muscularization of distal arterioles, and in some cases lymphangiectasis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.label: Acinar dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003320.definition: Arrest of lung development in the pseudoglandular stage (weeks 8 to 16 of human gestation) resulting in small sized lungs, predominantly composed of bronchial and bronchiolar structures embedded in abundant loose mesenchyme that is poorly vascularized. Acinar structures are essentially absent, with no significant formation of saccules and no alveoli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.label: Congenital alveolar dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.definition: Arrest of lung development in the cananicular stage (weeks 18 to 26 of human gestation) resulting in simplified acinar spaces, frequently with abundant intervening mesenchyme and no alveoli. In later arrest growth stages early saccular formations may be seen. May resemble the lobular maldevelopment often seen in alveolar capillary dysplasia/misaligment of the pulmonary veins without vein misalignment or marked hypertensive changes of the pulmonary arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.label: Decreased total iron binding capacity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.definition: A reduction in the total-iron binding capacity, which measures how much serum iron is bound if an excess of radioactive iron is added. The latent (or free) iron binding capacity is the difference between the TIBC and the measured serum iron, corresponding to the transferrin not bound to iron, i.e., free iron binding capacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.label: Abnormal total iron binding capacity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.definition: Any deviation from the normal total-iron binding capacity, which measures how much serum iron is bound if an excess of radioactive iron is added.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.label: Elevated urine suberic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.definition: The concentration of suberic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.label: Recurrent viral pneumonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.definition: Increased susceptibility to viral pneumonia, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral pneumonias.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.label: Obliterative abnormality of the renal glomerulus
Glomerular hyalinosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus. Distribution can include vascular pole, perihilar, tip or neither tip, perihilar or vascular.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.label: Perihilar glomerular hyalinosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus at the vascular pole/perihilum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.label: Glomerular hyalinosis at the tubular pole
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus at the tip/tubular pole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.label: Glomerular hyalinosis away from the vascular and tubular poles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003321.definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus at neither tip nor perihilar/vascular poles. Both the vascular and the tubular pole are present in the glomerular cross section.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: 2-ethylhydracylic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: An increased concentration of 2-ethylhydracylic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: Increased CD4:CD8 ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: An abnormal elevation of the relative proportion of CD4+ to CD8+ T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: Decreased CD4:CD8 ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: An abnormal reduction of the relative proportion of CD4+ to CD8+ T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: Abnormal glomerular parietal epithelial cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: Any structural abnormality of the parietal epithelial cells that line the inside of Bowman's capsule and form an inconspicuous sheet of flat epithelial cells in continuity with the proximal tubular epithelial cells at the urinary pole and with the podocytes at the vascular pole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: Glomerular parietal epithelial cell hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: Increased number of parietal epithelial cells lining Bowman's capsule. Hyperplasia leads to the cells being present in 2 or more layers, often with crowding and multilayering.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: Glomerular parietal epithelial cell hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: An abnormality of the glomerular parietal epithelial cells characterized by (1) Increased parietal epithelial cell size, with or without cytoplasmic protein droplets; or (2) enlarged nuclei with prominent nucleoli. Both features can be present

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: Bowman capsular hyaline drops
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: An insudative accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material protruding from Bowman's capsule into the urinary space. Although not always evident by light microscopy, this material is located between Bowman's capsule and the parietal epithelial cells, in some cases associated with newly formed matrix material.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: Glomerular synechial adhesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: An area of basement membrane continuity between the glomerular tuft and Bowman's capsule, without intervening crescent and not adjacent to an area of segmental sclerosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: Triceps areflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: Inability to elicit triceps tendon reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.label: Brachioradialis areflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003322.definition: Inability to elicit brachioradialis tendon reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.label: Biceps areflexia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.definition: Inability to elicit biceps tendon reflex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.label: Abnormal glomerular mesangial cellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.definition: Abnormal number of its constituent cells of the mesangium of the glomerulus of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.label: Abnormal glomerular mesangial matrix morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.definition: Any structural anomaly of the glomerular matrix. Mesangial cells generate and embed in their own extracellular matrix. The mesangial matrix is different in composition from the glomerular basement membrane. Its constituents are type IV collagen (but only the alpha1 and alpha2 chains); type V collagen; laminin A, B1, and B2; and considerable amounts of fibronectin, heparan sulfate and chondroitin sulfate proteoglycans, entactin, and nidogen. Furthermore, small amounts of the proteoglycans decorin and biglycan are found in the mesangial matrix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.label: Paramesangial deposits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.definition: Mesangial immune deposit located adjacent to the paramesangial glomerular basement membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.label: Mesangial hyaline deposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.definition: Extracellular mesangial accumulation of moderately electron-dense, generally homogenous, amorphous-appearing extracellular material.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.label: Cognitive fatigue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.definition: A failure to sustain attention that requires self-motivation to optimize performance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.label: Visceral epithelial cell detachment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.definition: Detachment of visceral epithelial cells (podocytes) from underlying glomerular basement membrane with intervening new loose basement membrane material (pale on Hematoxylin and eosin, periodic acid-Shiff, trichrome, or silver stain) forming a so-called 'halo'.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.label: Podocyte microvillous transformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.definition: Cytoplasmic projections into the urinary space from the luminal side of the podocyte.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.label: Visceral epithelial cell capping
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003323.definition: Layer of hypertrophied visceral epithelial cells overlying a sclerosed segment of the tuft of the glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Elevated RV/TLC ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: An increase in the ratio of residual volume (RV) to total lung capacity (TLC) on pulmonary function testing. RV is the amount of air remaining aftermaximal expiration and TLC is the total amount of air in theungs at full inspiration. These volumes cannot be determined by spirometry, but can be measured by inert gas dilution, nitrogen washout, and (3) body plethysmography. An elevated RV/TLC can be interpreted as a sign of air trapping and hyperinflation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Polyalveolar lobe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: An elevation of the total count of alveoli as determined by microscopic point-counting of randomly taken lung sections, not secondary to abnormalities in number, size and structure of the airways. In polyaveolar lobe, the number of alveoli is generally increased three to fivefold.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Horseshoe lung
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: A horseshoe lung is an uncommon congenital abnormality caused by the partial fusion of the bases of both lungs behind the pericardial sac.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Pulmonary necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: Cellular death affecting one or more parts of the lung. Necrosis is caused by diverse external and internal factors which result in the unregulated digestion of cell components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Glycogen accumulation in pulmonary interstitial cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: Accumulation of immature interstitial cells containing abundant cytoplasmic glycogen defined by periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) positive cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Abnormal alveolar type II pneumocyte morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: Any structural abnormality of alveolar type 2 (ATII) cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Type II pneumocyte hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: Increase in size of type II pneumocytes, characterized by qualitative morphologic alterations, including cuboidal shapes, increased nucleocytoplasmic ratio, enlarged nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and various alterations in their nuclear chromatin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Pulmonary amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: Extracellular deposition in lung tissue of a proteinaceous material that, when stained with Congo red, demonstrates apple-green birefringence under polarized light and that has a distinct color when stained with sulfated Alcian blue. Viewed with electron microscopy, the amyloid deposits are seen to be composed of a beta-sheet fibrillar material. These nonbranching fibrils have a diameter of 7.5 to 10 nm and are the result of protein misfolding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Multiple pulmonary interstitial hyalinized nodules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: Fibrosing nodules, consisting of either unilateral or bilateral central whorled deposits of lamellar collagen hyalin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.label: Focal substantia nigra T2 hyperintensity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003324.definition: Hyperintense lesion in the substantia nigra on magnetic resonance T2 imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.label: Nailfold capillary tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.definition: An increased number of turns of the blood vessels of the nailfold with a charactereistic winded or twisted appearance of the blood vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.label: Elevated residual volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.definition: Increase in the amount of air remaining in a person's lungs after full exhalation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.label: Palmar hyperlinearity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.definition: Exaggerated skin markings (dermatoglyphics) on the palms of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.label: Reduced circulating interferon gamma concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.definition: A reduction in the concentration of interferon gamma measured in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.label: Anorectal stricture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.definition: Narrowing of the anorectum associated with inflammation or scar tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.label: Congenital lobar overinflation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.definition: A congenital malformation characterized by an overdistended segment of lung, affecting an party of a lobe or the entire one. It results in progressive overinflation of one or more lobes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.label: Delayed ability to walk with support
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.definition: A failure to achieve the ability to walk with support (cruise) at an appropriate developmental stage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.label: Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.definition: Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy (SUDEP) is a sudden, unexpected, witnessed or unwitnessed, non-traumatic and non-drowning death, occurring in benign circumstances, in an individual with epilepsy, with or without evidence for a seizure and excluding documented status epilepticus, in which postmortem examination has not revealed a cause of death.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.label: Non-motor seizure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003325.definition: A seizure with clinical manifestation but without motor signs (other than possible behavior arrest) as its initial clinical manifestation. The electrographic onset may be generalized, focal, or unknown.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Livedo racemosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: Livedo racemosa describes a reddish-blue mottling of the skin in an irregular, reticular pattern. It differs from the more common livedo reticularis by its shape. Livedo racemosa consists of broken circular segments resulting in a seemingly larger pattern, as opposed to the fine, regular, complete network of livedo reticularis. Livedo racemosa results from permanent impairment of peripheral blood flow and, unlike livedo reticularis, it persists on warming.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Renal artery aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: Increase in diameter of a segment of the renal artery that can be defined as a focal, isolated dilatation of all three layers of the arterial wall over 1.5 times the diameter of the disease-free proximal adjacent arterial segment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Transphyseal fracture of the distal humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: A fracture through the distal humeral physis that separates the entire distal humeral epiphysis from the metaphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Absent platelet dense granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: Lack of platelet dense granules, a type of platelet organelles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Enlarged platelet dense granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: Increased size of platelet dense granules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Podocyte myelin figures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: Lamellated intracytoplasmic lipid inclusions within podocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Glomerular pseudocrescent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: Visceral epithelial cell hyperplasia with resulting cellular crowding of the the urinary space. In contrast with true crescents, these proliferations lack inflammatory cells and fibrin. The cells are typically plump (not spindle-shaped) and often vacuolated, and Bowman's capsule is usually intact.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Abnormal glomerular capillary lumen morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space of the capillary of the renal glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Deflation of the glomerular tuft
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: Wrinkling and folding of the capillaries without epithelial cell (podocyte) hyperplasia (formerly called ischemic type of collapse) involving o 80% of the glomerular tuft. The wrinkling is generally made by small regular folds of the glomerular basement membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.label: Glomerular capillary collapse
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003326.definition: Collapse is generally accompanied by other descriptors such as hypertrophy and hyperplasia of overlying glomerular epithelial cells, halo, protein droplets in podocytes and glomerular parietal epithelial cells (PECs).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.label: Glomerular capillary congestion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.definition: Global distention of glomerular capillaries with intraluminal intact red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.label: Glomerular capillary microaneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.definition: Glomerular capillary dilatation due to loosening/detachment of the glomerular basement membrane (GBM) from its anchoring points, usually in the context of mesangiolysis or nodular glomerulosclerosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.label: Abnormal glomerular endothelial cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.definition: An abnormal structure of the glomerular endothelial cells, which are highly specialized cells with fenestrae and a charged luminal glycocalyx layer that contribute to the filtration barrier.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.label: Loss of glomerular endothelial cell fenestration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.definition: Loss of round to oval discontinuities normally present in the glomerular capillary endothelial cell cytoplasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.label: Glomerular endotheliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.definition: Enlargement of glomerular endothelial cells by cytoplasmic swelling with resulting partial or complete occlusion of the lumen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.label: Glomerular endothelial tubuloreticular inclusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.definition: Inter-anastomosing tubular structures located within cisternae of endoplasmic reticulum, most often within endothelial cells and associated with exposure to interferon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.label: Glomerular fibrinoid necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.definition: Fibrin associated with glomerular basement membrane disruption and/or lysis of the mesangial matrix; this lesion does not require the presence of karyorrhexis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.label: Reduced CD95-induced lymphocyte apoptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.definition: Reduced amount of programmed cell death in peripheral blood lymphocytes following exposure to CD95 (APO-1/Fas), which is a member of the death receptor family, a subfamily of the TNF-R superfamily. Crosslinking of CD95 with its natural ligand CD95L (CD178) or with agonistic antibodies such as anti-APO-1 induces apoptosis in sensitive cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.label: Enterocutaneous fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003327.definition: An abnormal connection (fistula) between the intra-abdominal intestinal tract and the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.label: Paratracheal lymphadenopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.definition: Enlargement of lymph nodes surrounding the trachea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.label: Circulating nucleated red blood cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.definition: The presence of nucleated red blood cells in the peripheral blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.label: Abnormal glomerular basement membrane morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.definition: Any abnormal sttructure of the glomerular basement membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.label: Segmentally thickened glomerular basement membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.definition: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM) reflecting a segmental and increase in thickness (subjective estimate) with no evidence of electron dense deposits by EM. Thickening is measured from endothelial to visceral epithelial plasma membrane and mainly attributable to an increase in thickness of the lamina densa, generally to an overall thickness more than 2 standard deviations greater than that of the normal mean GBM thickness for health age- and sex matched individuals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.label: Diffusely thickened glomerular basement membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.definition: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM) reflecting an diffuse and relativly uniform increase in thickness (subjective estimate) with no evidence of electron dense deposits by EM. Thickening is measured from endothelial to visceral epithelial plasma membrane and mainly attributable to an increase in thickness of the lamina densa, generally to an overall thickness more than 2 standard deviations greater than that of the normal mean GBM thickness for health age- and sex matched individuals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.label: Thickened glomerular basement membranes with no electron dense deposits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.definition: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM) reflecting an increase in thickness (subjective estimate) with no evidence of electron dense deposits by electron microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.label: Thickened glomerular basement membranes with electron dense deposits
Glomerular basement membrane lucencies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.definition: Lucent zones within the glomerular basement membranes. May reflect remote/resolved deposits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.label: Glomerular basement membrane wrinkling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003328.definition: Irregular folding of the glomerular basement membrane with an intact lamina densa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Glomerular subendothelial widening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: Expansion of the space between the glomerular endothelium and lamina densa by electron-lucent material.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Glomerular karyhorrhectic debris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: Apoptotic, pyknotic, and fragmented nuclei within the glomerulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Glomerular fibrin thrombus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: An aggregate of coagulated blood containing fibrin, with or without entrapped cellular elements, within a glomerular capillary lumen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Glomerular hyaline pseudothrombus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: Intracapillary amorphous, eosinophilic material consisting of immune deposits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Glomerular lipoprotein thrombus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: Intracapillary silver-positive material that is finely vacuolated and laminated, and stains with oil red O on frozen sections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Mesangial Immune complex deposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: Extracellular meangial accumulation of finely granular material corresponding to immunoglobulin and/or complement by immunofluorescence/immunohistochemistry; most typically electron-dense although this may decrease with resorption of the deposit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Binucleated visceral epithelial cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: Visceral epithelial cells with 2 nuclei. Can be observed on light or ultrastructral microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Multinucleated visceral epithelial cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: Visceral epithelial cells with more than two nuclei. Can be observed on light or ultrastructral microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Abnormal circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration in blood of factor H-related protein 1 (FHR-1)

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.label: Reduced circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003329.definition: Decreased level of circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.label: Increased circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.definition: Elevated level of circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.label: Elevated circulating 1-methylhistidine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.definition: An abnormally increased level of 1-methylhistidine in the blood circulation. 1-methylhistidine is a derivative of L-histidine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.label: Elevated circulating 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.definition: The concentration of 4-Hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the blood circulation is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.label: Elevated urinary monocarboxylic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.definition: Abnormally increased amount of a monocarboxylic acid in the urine. Monocarboxylic acids are molecules with one COOH functional group.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.label: Abnormal circulating fetuin A concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of fetuin A in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.label: Decreased circulating fetuin A concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.definition: A reduction below normal of fetuin A in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.label: Increased circulating fetuin A concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.definition: An elevation above normal of fetuin A in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.label: Ileoileal intussusception
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003330.definition: A type of intussusception of the small intestine in which one part of the ileum invaginates (telescopes) into another part of the ileum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Osmotic diarrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: Osmotic diarrhea results from the presence of osmotically active, poorly absorbed solutes in the bowel lumen that inhibit normal water and electrolyte absorption.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Abdominal aortic dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: A tear in the intimal layer of the abdominal aorta causing a separation between the intima and the medial layers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Abnormal Bowman space morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: Structural anomaly located in Bowman's space, which represents the beginning of the urinary space and is contiguous with the proximal convoluted tubule of the nephron.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Urinary space collagenization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: Acellular collagenous matrix within Bowman's space, not associated with extracapillary hypercellularity or necrosis, associated with sclerosis or deflation of the tuft.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Visceral epithelial cell hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: Increased number of visceral epithelial cells (2 or more layers), often with crowding and multilayering, but without continuity with the parietal epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Visceral epithelial hyaline droplets
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: Round to ovoid, Periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, fuchsinophilic cytoplasmic inclusions within visceral epithelial cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Glomerular crescent formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: Glomerular crescent refers hyperplastic lesions involving 10% or more of the circumference of Bowman's capsule. Crescents can be composed of a variable mixture of epithelial/leukocyte hypercellularity, fibrous matrix, and fibrin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Cellular crescent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: A type of glomerular crescent characterized by extracapillary hypercellularity of greater than two cell layers and involving more than 10% of the capsular circumference, composed of greater than 75% cells with or without fibrin, and less than 25% fibrous matrix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Fibrocellular crescent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: A type of glomerular crescent characterized by extracapillary hypercellularity of more than 2 cell layers and involving over 10% of the capsular circumference, composed of 25% to 75% cells with or without fibrin, and the remainder fibrous matrix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.label: Fibrous crescent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003331.definition: A type of glomerular crescent characterized by extracapillary fibrosis composed of greater than 75% matrix and of less than 25% cells with or without fibrin, usually associated with disruption of Bowman's capsule and involving over 10% of the capsular circumference.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Mesangial cell loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: Loss of mesangial cells segmentally or globally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Glomerular obsolescence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: Globally sclerotic glomeruli are that are small and without hyalinosis and may appear with collapse of the tuft with collagenization of the urinary space. Bowman's capsule is completely or partially absent and there is no periglomerular fibrosis and glomerular size is decreased by more than 50% compared to all other glomeruli in the same biopsy. Obsolescent glomeruli may appear to be receding into the interstitium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Glomerular capillary wall duplication without cellular interposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: Double contouring of the original glomerular basement membrane (GBM)/additional layer(s) of overlying basement membrane matrix, with or without endocapillary hypercellularity and no evidence of interposed migrated cells (mesangial, endothelial, monocytes) between the layers of original GBM and de novo GBM.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Glomerular capillary wall duplication with cellular interposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: Double contouring of the original glomerular basement membrane (GBM)/additional layer(s) of overlying basement membrane matrix with interposed migrated cells (mesangial, endothelial, monocytes) between the layers of original GBM and de novo GBM.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Elevated circulating homovanillic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: The concentration of homovanillic acid in the blood circulation is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Elevated circulating sebacic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: Increased concentration of sebacic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Elevated circulating hydroxyphenlyllactic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: An increased concentration of 4-hydroxyphenlyllactic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Nail psoriasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: Psoriatic nail abnormality characterized by the presence of neutrophils in the nail bed epithelium, hyperkeratosis with parakeratosis, presence of exudates on the corneal epithelium, focal hypogranulosis and psoriasiform hyperplasia of the nail bed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Type II pneumocyte hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: Increase in the number of type II pneumocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.label: Abnormal postural reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003332.definition: Anomaly of the physiological response to maintain the body's posture when movement and position is altered.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.label: Impaired neck-righting reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.definition: Abnormal neck-righting response, which is said to be a physiological response when a child is placed flat on his or her back and the head is turned 90 degrees to the right or the left. With a normal neck-righting response, there follows a reflected torsion of the vertebral column in the same direction as the induced rotation of the neck. That is, the whole body follows the direction in which the head was turned. The response is present from birth to the age of five years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.label: Acute phase response
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.definition: Presence of one or more manifestations of the acute phase response. Acute phase proteins (APP) are blood proteins primarily synthesized by hepatocytes as part of the acute phase response (APR). The APR is part of the early-defense or innate immune system, which is triggered by different stimuli including trauma, infection, stress, neoplasia, and inflammation. The APR results in a complex systemic reaction with the goal of reestablishing homeostasis and promoting healing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.label: Elevated circulating amyloid A
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.definition: An increased concentration of serum amyloid A in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.label: Jaw contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.definition: Limitation of motion of the jaw due to structural changes in a muscle such as the massseter responsible for jaw movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.label: Abnormal embryonic development
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.definition: An anomaly in the development of the embryo, that is, of the early developmental stage of development that follows the fertilization of an egg by sperm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.label: Abnormal preimplantation embryonic development
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.definition: An anomaly in the development of the embryo in a stage prior to implantation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.label: Zygotic cleavage failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.definition: Failure of a fertilized oocyte to undergo the first round of cell division.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.label: Abnormal gametogenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.definition: An anomaly in the process by a a haploid cell is formed from a diploid cells through meiosis. In males, diploid spermatogonia produce two haploid cells (secondary spermatocytes) in meiosis I and four haploid spermatids in meiosis II. In females, primordial germ cells under meiosis II before birth to form primary oocytes. Once puberty cell begins, these cells form secondary oocytes through meiosis II.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.label: Increased circulating inosine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003333.definition: An increased concentration of inosine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.label: Increased circulating guanosine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.definition: Increased concentration of guanosine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.label: Elevated circulating sitosterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.definition: An increased concentration of beta-sitosterol in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.label: Anti-aquaporin 4 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against aquaporin-4.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.label: Mucoid diarrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.definition: Passage of an increased number of stools containing mucus, a thick fluid substance secreted by mucous membranes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.label: Pleural cobblestoning
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.definition: A pleural cobblestone appearance characterized by irregular bumps surrounded by depressed lines in open lung biopsy. Caused by underlying scarring causing retraction of the interlobular septa where they insert on the pleura.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.label: Neuralgia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.definition: Pain (An unpleasant sensory and emotional experience) along the course of a nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003334.label: Psychic epileptic aura
