http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Medullary peritubular capillary intraluminal thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the peritubular capillaries located in the medulla of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Medullary peritubular capillary lumen organized thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the peritubular capillaries of the medulla of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Cortical peritubular capillary lumen cholesterol emboli
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of peritubular capillaries located in the cortex of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Cortical peritubular capillary intraluminal thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the peritubular capillaries located in the cortex of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Cortical peritubular capillary lumen organized thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the peritubular capillaries of the cortex of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Abnormal arcuate vein lumen morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space (lumen) of the arcuate vein of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Arcuate vein lumen cholesterol emboli
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of arcuate veins of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Arcuate vein intraluminal thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Arcuate vein lumen organized thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.label: Abnormal arcuate vein intima/media morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003387.definition: Any structural anomaly located in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Arcuate vein intimal mucoid edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in the inner layer (intima) of arcuate veins of the kidney. The material resembles mucus and appears pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Arcuate vein intimal/medial myxomatous degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Accumulation of myxoid material (mucus-like material) within the inner or middle layer of the arcuate vein of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Arcuate vein intima/medial amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney. Amyloidosis stains Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Abnormal cortical radial artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Any structural anomaly of the radial arteries that branch off at right angles from the arcuate artery and carry blood toward the cortex of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Abnormal cortical radial artery lumen morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space of the cortical radial arteries of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Cortical radial artery lumen cholesterol emboli
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of cortical radial arteries (interlobular arteries) of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Abnormal arcuate artery intima/media morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Anomalous structure of the inner or middle layer of the arc-shaped arteries located at the border of the renal cortex and renal medulla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Cortical radial artery intimal/medial amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the glomerular, interstitial or vascular compartments of the interlobular arteries of the kidney. Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Abnormal cortical radial artery intima/media morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Any structural anomaly of the inner or middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.label: Abnormal renal arteriole morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003388.definition: Any structural anomaly of the glomerular arterioles. The interlobar arteries of the kidney branch into arcuate arteries, cortical radiate arteries, and then into afferent arterioles. After passing through the renal corpuscle, the capillaries form the efferent arteriole. The afferent and efferent arterioles are difficult to distinguish histologically and are thus both included in this term and its descendents.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Abnormal renal arteriole lumen morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space (lumen) of renal arterioles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Renal arteriolar lumen cholesterol emboli
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of arterioles of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Abnormal renal arteriole intima/media morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Any structural anomaly located in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Renal arteriolar lumen organized thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Renal arteriolar intraluminal thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Abnormal renal arteriole endothelium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Any structural anomaly of the lining (endothelium) of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Abnormal arcuate artery lumen morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space (lumen) of the arcuate artery of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Arcuate artery lumen cholesterol emboli
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of arcuate arteries of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Arcuate artery intraluminal thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.label: Arcuate artery lumen organized thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003389.definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Renal arteriole intima/media amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the inner or middle layer of renal arterioles. Amyloidosis stains Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Abnormal arcuate artery endothelium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Any structural anomaly of the lining (endothelium) of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Arcuate artery endotheliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Enlargement of endothelial cells of the arcuate arteries of the kidney because of cytoplasmic swelling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Arcuate artery endoarterial hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Proliferation of endothelial cells (increased number of cells) of the lining (endothelium) of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Renal arteriole intima/media hyalinosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material (hyalinosis) in the inner or middle layer of the renal arterioles. This feature may be accompanied by hypertrophy of the media and intima fibrosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Arcuate artery intima/media arteriosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Thickening of the intima of the arcuate arteries of the kidney with fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Renal intimal/medial arteriolitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Inflammation of an arteriole of the kidney, which may involve only the intma or can be transmural.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Renal arteriole intima/media arteriolosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Thickening of the intima of renal arterioles with fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Renal arteriole medial atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of of the middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.label: Arcuate vein medial hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003390.definition: Increased thickness of middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Arcuate vein medial atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of the middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Cortical radial artery medial hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Increased thickness of the middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Cortical radial artery medial atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of the middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Cortical radial artery medial/intimal arteriitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Inflammation of a the intima or the entire wall of cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Arcuate artery intima/media amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate arteries of the kidney. Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Arcuate artery intimal mucoid edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in intima resembling mucus. This feature appears pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Medial/intimal arcuate venosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Thickening of the intima with fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina in arcuate veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Arcuate intimal/medial venulitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Inflammation of arcuate veins of the kidney, which may involve only the intima or can be transmural.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Renal arteriole medial hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Increased thickness of middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.label: Medial/intimal arcuate venulitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003391.definition: Inflammation of the inner or middle layer of arcuate venules. This feature may involve only the intima or it can be transmural.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Renal arteriole intima/media storage material accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: Deposition of storage material other than amyloid (glycogen, glycosphingolipid in Fabry's disease, sphingomyelin in Nieman Pick disease, glucosylceramide in Gaucher's disease, gangliosides, mucopolysaccahrides, phytanic acid in Refsum disease) in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Renal arteriole endoarterial hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: Abnormal and excessive number of cells (hypercellularity) in the lining (endothelium) of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: A type of renal arteriole endoarterial hypercellularity due to increased number of white blood cells (leukocytes).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Renal arteriole foam cell endoarterial hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: A type of renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity due to the presence of lipid-filled cells, often a macrophage, with a vacuolated appearance in arteriolar lumen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Renal arteriole neutrophil endoarterial hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: A type of renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity due to the presence of increased numbers of neutrophils within the arteriolar lumen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Renal arteriole lymphocyte endoarterial hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: A type of renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity due to the presence of increased number of lymphocytes in the arteriolar lumen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Renal arteriole intimal/medial multilamellation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: Myointimal hyperplasia arranged in multiple concentric layers in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Arcuate artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: Arcuate artery endoarterial hypercellularity due to increased numbers of white blood cells (leukocytes).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Arcuate artery endoarterial foam cell hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: A type of arcuate artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of lipid-filled cells, often a macrophage, with a vacuolated appearance in arteriolar lumen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.label: Arcuate artery endoarterial neutrophil hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003392.definition: A type of arcuate artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of increased numbers of neutrophils withinin the lumen of arcuate artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Arcuate artery endoarterial lymphocyte hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: A type of arcuate artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of increased number of lymphocytes in the lumen of arcuate artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Arcuate artery intima/media necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: Death of tissue in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate artery of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Arcuate artery intima/media coagulative necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: A type of arcuate artery intima/media necrosis in which the necrotic tissue retains the outlines of the dead (necrotic) structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Arcuate artery intima/media liquefactive necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: A type of arcuate artery intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Arcuate vein intimal/medial storage material accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: Accumulation of material other than amyloid (glycogen, glycosphingolipid in Fabry's disease, sphingomyelin in Nieman Pick disease, glucosylceramide in Gaucher's disease, gangliosides, mucopolysaccahrides, phytanic acid in Refsum disease) in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Cortical radial artery intima/media necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: Cell death (necrosis) in the inner or middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Cortical radial artery intima/media liquefactive necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: A type of cortical radial artery intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Cortical radial artery intima/media coagulative necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: A type of cortical radial artery intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue retains the outlines of the dead structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Renal arteriole intima/media necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: Cell death (necrosis) in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.label: Renal arteriole intima/media liquefactive necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003393.definition: A type of renal arteriole intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Renal arteriole intima/media coagulative necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: A type of renal arteriole intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue retains the outlines of the dead structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Granulomatous arteriolitis of the arteriolar intima/media
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: A type of renal intimal/medial arteriolitis characteriezed by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Arcuate vein medial/intimal necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: Cell death (necrosis) of the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Arcuate vein medial/intimal coagulative necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: A type of arcuate vein medial/intimal necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue retains the outlines of the dead structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Arcuate vein medial/intimal liquefactive necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: A type of arcuate vein medial/intimal necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Arcuate intimal/medial granulomatous venulitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: A type of arcuate intimal/medial venulitis characterized by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Arcuate vein intima/media crystal accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: Deposition of crystals such as uric acid, oxalate, or cystine in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Renal arteriole intima/media crystal accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: Deposition of crystals such as uric acid, oxalate, or cystine in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Arcuate artery intima/media arteriitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: Inflammation of the inner or middle layer of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.label: Arcuate artery intima/media granulomatous arteriitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003394.definition: A type of arcuate artery intima/media granulomatous arteriitis characterized by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Cortical radial artery intraluminal thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding vascular lumen within the interior space of cortical radial arteries (interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Cortical radial artery intraluminal organized thrombi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: Thrombi containing fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels within the interior space of cortical radial arteries (interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Abnormal cortical radial artery endothelium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the lining (endothelium) of the cortical radial arteries (also known as interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Cortical radial artery endotheliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: Enlargement of endothelial cells of the cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney because of cytoplasmic swelling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Cortical radial artery hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: Proliferation of endothelial cells (increased number of cells) of the lining (endothelium) of the cortical radial arteries (also known as interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Cortical radial artery leukocyte hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: A type of cortical radial artery endoarterial hypercellularity due to increased numbers of white blood cells (leukocytes).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Cortical radial artery lymphocyte hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: A type of cortical radial artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of increased number of lymphocytes in the lumen of cortical radial arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Cortical radial artery neutrophil hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: A type of cortical radial artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of increased numbers of neutrophils in the lumen of cortical radial arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Cortical radial artery foam cell hypercellularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: A type of cortical radial artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of lipid-filled cells, often macrophages, with a vacuolated appearance in the lumen of cortical radial artery (also known as the interlobular artery) of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.label: Cortical radial artery intima/media arteriosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003395.definition: Thickening of the intima of the cortical radial artery (also known as the interlobular artery) of the kidney characterized by fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Cortical radial artery intimal mucoid edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in the intima of the cortical radial artery (also known as the interlobular artery) of the kidney. This material resembles mucus and stains pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Cortical radial artery intima/media multilamellation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: Myointimal hyperplasia of the inner and middle layer of the cortical radial artery (also known as the interlobular artery) of the kidney, arranged in multiple concentric layers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Cortical radial artery medial/intimal granulomatous arteriitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: A type of cortical radial artery medial/intimal arteriitis that is characterized by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Abnormal interlobular vein intima/media morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: Any structural anomaly of the inner or middle layer of the interlobular veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Interlobular intima/media venosclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: Thickening of the intima with fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina in interlobular veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Interlobular vein intimal mucoid edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in the intima of the interlobular vein of the kidney. This material resembles mucus and stains pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Interlobular vein intima/media amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the glomerular, interstitial or vascular compartments of the interlobular veins of the kidney. Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Interlobular vein intima/media venulitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: Inflammation of the interlobular veins of the kidney which may affect only the intima or may be transmural.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Interlobular vein intima/media granulomatous venulitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: A type of interlobular vein intima/media venulitis that is characterized by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed veins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.label: Interlobular vein intima/media necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003396.definition: Cell death (necrosis) in the inner or middle layer of the interlobular vein of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Interlobular vein intima/media liquefactive necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: A type of interlobular vein intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Interlobular vein intima/media coagulative necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: A type of interlobular vein intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue retains the outlines of the dead structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Interlobular vein medial atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of the medial layer pf the interlobular veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Interlobular vein medial hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: Increased thickness of middle layer of the interlobular veins of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Interlobular vein intima/media multilamellation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: Myointimal hyperplasia of the inner and middle layer of the interlobular veins of the kidney, arranged in multiple concentric layers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Absent second fingernail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: Absence of the fingernail of the index (second) finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Volar fingernail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: The presence of an extra nail on the palmar (volar, ventral) surface of the finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Talar aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: Absent talus owing to a congenital defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Reduced beta-hexosaminidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: Diminished activity of the enzyme beta-hexosaminidase in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.label: Excessive dynamic airway collapse
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003397.definition: Excessive anterior displacement of the tracheal and/or bronchial membranous wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Paroxysmal tonic upgaze
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: Recurrent episodes of sustained upward deviation of the eyes and incomplete downward saccades, and normal horizontal eye movements without impairment of consciousness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Vertebral artery tortuosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the vertebral arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Celiac artery dissection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the celiac artery wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein C-II concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: Reduced concentration of apolipoprotein C-II in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Increased urinary 8-oxo-7,8-dihydroguanosine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: An elevated amount of 8-oxo-7,8-dihydroguanosine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Elongated femoral neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: Increased length of the neck of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Tortuous lymphatic vessels
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of lymphatic vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Phosphaturic mesenchymal tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: A rare, endocrine active tumor that causes severe renal phosphate wasting, which in turn can lead to critical osteomalacia. Phosphaturic mesenchymal tumors (PMTs) are typically small and mostly benign tumors producing fibroblast growth factor 23 (FGF-23). FGF-23 lowers the expression of sodium/phosphate cotransporters, which are the primary transport proteins responsible for phosphate reabsorption in the kidneys. The paraneoplastic overproduction of FGF-23 lowers reabsorption of phosphate and causes severe paraneoplastic renal phosphate wasting and hypophosphatemia. FGF-23 also affects vitamin D levels by lowering 25-hydroxyvitamin D 1-alpha-hydroxylase in the proximal renal tubules and by increasing the expression of vitamin D 24-hydroxylase, a mitochondrial enzyme responsible for inactivating vitamin D metabolites.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Amygdala microinfarct
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: An infarct located in the almond-shaped body of basal nuclei anterior to the inferior horn of the lateral ventricle of the brain, within the temporal lobe that can only be observed microscopically.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.label: Hippocampal microinfarct
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003398.definition: An infarct located in the structure of the cerebrum involved with memory storage and spatial navigation that can only be observed microscopically.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Cartilaginous tracheobronchomalacia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: Softening of the tracheal and/or bronchial cartilage resulting in segmental tracheal and/or bronchial weakness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Vasa previa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: Vasa previa occurs when the membranes that contain the umbilical cord traverse the membranes overlying the internal os of the cervix. There is a high risk of fetal mortality if not identified perinatally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Chronotropic incompetence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: Inability of the heart to increase its rate commensurate with increased activity or demand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Viral encephalitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: An inflammation of brain parenchyma due to infection with a virus. Viral encephalitis can occur as a rare complication of common infections (eg, herpes virus infections) or can occur as a characteristic presentation of rare viruses (eg, rabies virus infection). Encephalitis may be the only neurologic manifestation of infection, or may occur in association with meningitis, myelitis, radiculitis, or neuritis. Viral encephalitis is associated with neurological dysfunction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Dependency on parenteral nutrition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: Inability to ingest sufficient quantities of nutrition by mouth or by tube-feeding with the corresponding requirement for intravenous administration of nutrition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Microvillus inclusions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: The presence of vacuoles bearing centripetal microvilli in small gut villus enterocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Microvillar PAS-positive secretory granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: The presenceaccumulationof periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) granules in the subapical region of small intenstinal microvilli, appearing as different kinds of vesicular/tubular structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Perinuclear cardiomyocyte vacuolization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: Formation of vacuoles, i.e., membrane-bound organelles, in the portion of the cytoplasm near the nucleus within myocytes of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Single-lobed right lung
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: A developmental defect of pulmonary lobation characterized by the presence of only one lobe of the right lung, which normally has three lobes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.label: Bronchial hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003399.definition: Bronchial hemorrhage is a focal bleeding located in the bronchial system. It can be diagnosed by tracheobronchoscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.label: Tracheal hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.definition: Tracheal hemorrhage is a focal bleeding within the trachea. It be diagnosed by tracheobronchoscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.label: Anti-Complement factor H antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against complement factor H.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.label: Anti-phospholipase A2 receptor antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against the phospholipase A2 receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.label: Broad medial eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.definition: Regional increase in the width (height) of the middle portion of the eyebrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.label: Parosmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.definition: Misperception of existing odor, that is, distorted or altered olfactory perception in the presence of known stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.label: Decreased dendritic spine number
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of spines on a given dendrite.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.label: Decreased urinary lysyl-pyridinoline-hydroxylysyl-pyridinoline ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.definition: A decreased amount of the urinary cross-links lysyl-pyridinoline (LP, or deoxypyridinoline DPD) as compared to hydroxylysyl-pyridinoline (HP, or pyridinoline PYD). Both are established biochemical markers of osteoclastic bone resorption and collagen degradation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.label: Posterior atrophy of corpus callosum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.definition: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the posterior portion of the corpus callosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.label: Pelvic lipomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003400.definition: Overgrowth of fat in the perivesical and perirectal area.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Increased megakaryocyte colony forming unit count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: Increased numbers of megakryocyte precursors (megakaryocyte colony forming units) in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Reduced progressive sperm motility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: A reduced proportion of sperm that move in a straight line or large circles; alternatively, an increaed proportion of sperm that move in tight circles or in some other non-linear fashion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Palmoplantar hypohidrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: Decreased sweating on the palms and soles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Curvilinear pericallosal lipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: A type of pericallosal lipoma that is thin and curves around the posterior end of the splenium of the corpus callosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Tubulonodular pericallosal lipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: A type of pericallosal lipoma with a rounded or lobular appearance and a diameter that is usually above 2 cm. They are anteriorly situated and are associated with extensive callosal and often fronto-facial anomalies. A tubulonodular pericallosal lipoma can extend into the choroid plexus or lateral ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Cavitating pulmonary nodule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: Thick-walled abnormal gas-filled interstitial nodule within a lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Anti-HLA antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen (HLA).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Anti-class I HLA antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a class I human leukocyte antigen (HLA). Class I HLA corresponds to MHC class I (A, B, and C).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Anti-class II HLA antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a class II human leukocyte antigen (HLA). Class I HLA corresponds to MHC class II (DP, DM, DO, DQ, and DR).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.label: Anti-HLA-A antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003401.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-A (HLA-A).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Anti-HLA-A IgG1 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: The presence of IgG1 autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-A (HLA-A).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Anti-HLA-A IgG3 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: The presence of IgG3 autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-A (HLA-A).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Anti-HLA-B antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-B (HLA-B).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Anti-HLA-B IgG1 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: The presence of IgG1 autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-B (HLA-B).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Anti-HLA-B IgG3 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: The presence of IgG3 autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-B (HLA-B).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Abnormal circulating GABA concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Elevated circulating sacchoropine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: An increased concentration of saccharopine in the blood circulation. L-saccharopine is the N(6)-(1,3-dicarboxypropan-1-yl) derivative of L-lysine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Abnormal urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: Any deviation from the normal amount in the urine of an alpha-amino acid which is not a member of the group of 23 proteinogenic amino acids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Saccharopinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: Presence of saccharopine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.label: Hepatic foam cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003402.definition: The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, in the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.label: Facial cyanosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.definition: Bluish discoloration of one or more regions of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.label: Central cyanosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.definition: Generalized bluish discoloration of the body and the visible mucous membranes, which occurs due to inadequate oxygenation secondary to conditions that lead to an increase in deoxygenated hemoglobin or presence of abnormal hemoglobin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.label: Peripheral cyanosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.definition: Bluish discoloration of the distal extremities (hands, fingertips, toes), and can sometimes involve circumoral and periorbital areas. Mucous membranes are generally not involved.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.label: Differential cyanosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.definition: Differential degree of bluish discoloration between the upper and lower extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.label: Pharyngeal exudate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.definition: Fluid exuded from the posterior wall of the pharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.label: Pseudo-chilblains on toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.definition: Inflammatory chilblain-like nodules on the feet and/or toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.label: Pseudo-chilblains on fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.definition: Inflammatory chilblain-like nodules on the hands and/or fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.label: Silent hypoxemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.definition: Abnormally low blood oxygen level without the presence of dyspnea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.label: Ventricular couplet
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003403.definition: Two consecutive premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) with no intervening normal beats.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Bidirectional ventricular tachycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: Bidirectional ventricular tachycardia (BDVT) is a regular ventricular tachyarrhythmia (VT) with two different QRS morphologies alternating at a rate typically between 140 and 180 bpm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Ventricular ectopy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: Ventricular ectopics, also known as ventricular extrasystoles, premature ventricular contractions or complexes (PVC) and ventricular premature depolarisations (VPD) are beats arising from within the ventricles. When they occur in groupings such as bigeminy, trigeminy, couplets and triplets they are referred to as ventricular ectopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Dorsal hirsutism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: Abnormally increased hair growth in the lskin of the back.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Increased fecal bile acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: Elevated amount of bile acids in the feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Trident pelvis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: Spurs at the medial and lateral acetabular margin and in the center of the acetabulum gives rise to shape resembling a three-pronged spear known as trident.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Angulated muscle fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: Normal muscle fibers are polygonal-shaped in cross section, are multinucleated, and have minimal amounts of endomysial connective tissue. In contrast, angulated (also known as angular) muscle fibers have long and narrow vertices (corners) with sharp edges and a pointed tip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Mandibular osteolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: Osteolysis (destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium) localized to the mandible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Rib osteolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: Osteolysis (destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium) localized to a rib.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Decreased circulating chenodeoxycholic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: A reduced concentration of chenodeoxycholic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.label: Elevated urinary prostaglandin E2 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003404.definition: An increased amount of prostaglandin E2 in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.label: Elevated urinary prostaglandin E2 metabolite level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.definition: An increased amount of prostaglandin E2 metabolite (PGE-M) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.label: Hypoplastic anterior limbs of the internal capsule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.definition: Underdevelopment of the frontal part (anterior crus or anterior limb) of the internal capsule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.label: Impaired toe-walking ability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.definition: Difficulty or reduced ability to walk on toes. Toe-walking can be tested as a part of the neurological examination. Foot plantar flexion weakness leads to difficulties in walking on toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.label: Probst bundles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.definition: Probst bundles (also known as longitudinal callosal fascicles) are neuroanatomical homologues to the corpus callosum and can occur in association with callosal agenesis. Probst bundles are white matter fibers that normally cross the corpus callosum but (because of the agenesis of the corpus callosum) fail to cross the midline, such that when they reach the corticoseptal boundary, they turn and run parallel to the interhemispheric fissure within the septal leaves, indenting the medial walls of the lateral ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.label: Anti-side-chain cleavage enzyme antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against cytochrome P450 cholesterol side-chain cleavage enzyme (P450scc), which is encoded by CYP11A1 cytochrome P450 family 11 subfamily A member 1 (Gene ID:1583).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.label: Increased fecal calprotectin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.definition: An increased amount of calprotectin in the feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.label: Fetal anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.definition: Structural or functional abnormalities of the fetus. Note that this section comprises terms that describe abnormalities that are specific to the fetus or differ from the corresponding general terms. A term from anywhere in the Human Phenotype Ontology can be applied to a fetus if appropriate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.label: Abnormal fetal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.definition: Any structural anomaly of the fetus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.label: Abnormal fetal physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003405.definition: Any functional anomaly of the fetus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Triggered by fava bean ingestion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating fava beans.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Anti-steroid 17alpha-hydroxylase antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against steroid 17alpha-hydroxylase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Anti-insulin antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against insulin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Anti-islet antigen-2 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against tyrosine phosphatase IA-2.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Anti-salivary protein antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against salivary protein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Anti-Zinc transporter 8 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against zinc transporter 8.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Anti-carbonic anhydrase VI antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against carbonic anhydrase VI.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Tonofilament clumping
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: Formation of lumps of tonofilaments, which are bundles of keratin filaments. In some but not all epithelia, keratin filaments are conspicuously bundled as tonofilaments. Inside the cell they braid the nucleus, span through the cytoplasm and are attached to the cytoplasmic plaques of the typical epithelial cell-cell junctions, the desmosomes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Anti-plasminogen binding peptide antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against plasminogen binding peptide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.label: Anti-parotid secretory protein antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003406.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against parotid secretory protein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Anti-enterocyte antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against enterocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Anti-21-hydroxylase antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against 21-hydroxylase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Abnormal fetal long-bone echogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: Any deviation from the normal appearing echogenicity of the fetal bone. Echogenicity refers to the ability of tissue to reflect ultrasound waves back toward the transducer and produce an echo. Whenever there is an interface of structures with different echogenicities, a visible difference in contrast will be apparent on the screen. The higher the echogenicity of tissues, the brighter they appear on ultrasound imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Reduced fetal long bone echogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: An abnormally decreased echogenicity of fetal long bones in a prenatal sonographic investigation. Ths finding is due to hypomineralization and can be seen in some disorders such as hypophosphatasia, osteogenesis imperfecta, and achondrogenesis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Increased fetal long bone echogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: An abnormally elevated echogenicity of fetal long bones in a prenatal sonographic investigation. This finding is due to hypermineralization.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein B concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: Reduced circulating level of apolipoprotein B, which is the main apolipoprotein of chylomicrons and low density lipoproteins. It occurs in plasma as two main isoforms, apoB-48 and apoB-100.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Anti-ribosome Po antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ribosome Po.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Anti-complement component C1q antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against C1q.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Anti-centromere protein A antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against CENP-A.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.label: Anti-centromere protein B antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003407.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against CENP-B.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.label: Anti-U3 RNP antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against U3 RNP.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.label: Anti-Th/To antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Th/To.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.label: Anti-bicaudal D2 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against bicaudal D2.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.label: Anti-nucleolus-organizing region antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Nor90.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.label: Anti-phosphatidyl ethanolamine antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003408.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against phosphatidyl ethanolamine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ki.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.label: Anti-sp100 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against sp100. Autoantibodies causing the MND pattern are directed against sp100, sp140, promyelocytic leukemia nuclear body proteins (PML) or ubiquitin-like modifier (SUMO) proteins, while in the punctate nuclear envelope pattern, the target antigens are gp210, nucleoporin-62 or laminin B receptor proteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.label: Anti-beta-2-Glycoprotein I IgG antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.definition: Presence of IgG antibodies against beta 2 glycoprotein I in the circulation. Beta-2 glycoprotein I (beta2GPI) is the principal target of autoantibodies in the antiphospholipid syndrome.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.label: Anti-beta-2-Glycoprotein I IgM antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.definition: Presence of IgM antibodies against beta 2 glycoprotein I in the circulation. Beta-2 glycoprotein I (beta2GPI) is the principal target of autoantibodies in the antiphospholipid syndrome.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.label: Anti-tyrosine phosphatase region of islet antigen-2 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against the tyrosine phossphatase region of islet antigen 2A (this region is a specific part of IA-2). Usually IA-2A are measured using the intracellular portion of IA-2 (IA-2ic) made up of the protein tyrosine phosphatase (PTP) and juxtamembrane (JM) regions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.label: Paget disease of bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003415.definition: A localized disorder of bone remodeling. Increased numbers of larger than normal osteoclasts initiate the process at affected skeletal sites, and the increase in bone resorption is followed by an increase in new bone formation, altering bone architecture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003416.label: Reduced circulating interleukin 9 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003416.definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of interleukin 9 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003417.label: Vertebral artery aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003417.definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the vertebral artery .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Fusion of the caudate and putamen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: Abnormal joined appearance of the caudate and putamen with an absence of the anterior limb of the internal capsule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the liver
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Segmental hypoplasia of liver
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: Anatomically the liver is divided into right and left lobes based on the attachment of its peritoneal ligaments. This term refers to a developmental anomaly characterzied by the underdevelopment of one of the lobes of the liver. This is a rare and usually asymptomatic anomaly that can be detected incidentally on cross sectional imaging with computed tomography or magnetic resonance imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Spastic triplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: Spastic weakness found in both lower extremities and one upper extremity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Increased insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: An abnormally elevated concentration of insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Median pseudocleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: A type of mild median cleft lip in which the central tubercle of the upper lip is replaced by a mucosal cleft in the midline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Patella alta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: Patella alta is a patella that rides abnormally high in relation to the femur, the femoral trochlea, or the tibia, with decreased bony stability requiring increased knee flexion angles to engage the trochlea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Clavicular pseudarthrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: A developmental defect in a the clavicule leading to bending and pathologic fracture, with inability to form a normal bony callus with subsequent fibrous nonunion, leading to the pseudarthrosis (or false joint).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Midline liver
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: Position of the liver across the middle of the body instead of being in its normal position to the right of the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.label: Anti-thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003418.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against thyroid-stimulating hormone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Abnormal fetal cardiovascular physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: Abnormal functionality of the fetal cardiovascular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Elevated fetal middle cerebral artery peak systolic velocity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: Increased peak systolic velocity of the fetal middle cerebral artery (MCA) as evaluated by Doppler ultrasound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Pulmonary thromboembolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: Pulmonary embolism is caused by emboli, which have originated from venous thrombi, travelling to and occluding the arteries of the lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Stratum basale cleavage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: Cleavage within the epidermal keratinocytes, which is the innermost layer of the epidermis and consists of proliferating cells that give rise to the outer layers of the epidermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Suprabasal cleavage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: Cleavage within the suprabasal cell layer of the epidermis, which lies directly above the basal layer and is composed of five to ten layers of cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Triggered by muscle relaxant
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to a muscle relaxant such as suxamethonium and mivacurium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Ductus venosus agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: A developmental defect characterized by lack of formation of the ductus venosus (a shunt that allows oxygenated blood in the umbilical vein to bypass the liver in the fetal circulation).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Third trimester onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: This term refers to a phenotypic feature that was first observed prior to birth during the third trimester, which is defined as 28 weeks and zero days (28+0) of gestation and beyond.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Second trimester onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: This term refers to a phenotypic feature that was first observed prior to birth during the second trimester, which comprises the range of gestational ages from 14 0/7 weeks to 27 6/7 (inclusive).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.label: Late first trimester onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003419.definition: This term refers to a phenotypic feature that was first observed prior to birth in the first trimester during the early fetal period, which is defined as 11 0/7 to 13 6/7 weeks of gestation (inclusive).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.label: Abnormal CSF homovanillic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.label: Increased CSF homovanillic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.definition: Elevated concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.label: Decreased iduronate sulfatase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.definition: An decreased level of iduronate-2-sulfatase activity in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.label: Decreased circulating C1-esterase inhibitor concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.definition: Decreased concentration of C1-esterase inhibitor (C1INH) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.label: Iniencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.definition: Iniencephaly is a rare neural tube defect involving dysmorphic spine and abnormal fusion of the portion of the occipital skull with the back. It results in extreme fixed head retroflexion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.label: Abnormal fetal central nervous system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.definition: An anomalous structural finding of the fetal central nervous system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.label: Abnormal fetal gastrointestinal system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.definition: An anomalous structural finding of the fetal gastrointestinal system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.label: Fetal intracranial hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.definition: Abnormal bleeding inside the skull (cranium) of a fetus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.label: Fetal subependymal hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003420.definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage located in the subependymal germinal matrix below the frontal horns of the lateral ventricles in the caudothalamic notch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage with bleeding into the ventricular system of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Fetal cerebral parenchymal hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage with bleeding into the parenchyma (tissue) of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Fetal extra-axial hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage with bleeding that occurs within the skull but outside of the brain tissue itself (into the epidural, subdural, or arachnoid space).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Fetal posterior fossa hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage that occurs in the posterior cranial fossa, which is the part of the cranial cavity that is located between the foramen magnum and tentorium cerebelli and contains the brainstem and cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage without ventriculomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: A type of fetal intraventricular hemorrhage characterized by clear hemorrhage spillover to the ventricles filling less than 50% of the lateral ventricle and without ventriculomegaly of greater than 15 mm in the transverse diameter of the lateral ventricular atrium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Fetal cerebellar hemisphere hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage that occurs in the hemisphere of the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Fetal cerebellar vermis hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage that occurs in the vermis of the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Sonographic non-visualized fetal bladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: Inability to visualize the fetal bladder on targeted prenatal sonography examination. The fetal bladder can be visualized with sonography as a midline, fluid-filled structure in the pelvis as early as 10-12 weeks of gestation. The normal fetus voids at least once an hour but never completely empties the urinary bladder. The fetal bladdder should be consistently imaged after 13 weeks of gestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage with ventriculomegaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: A type of fetal intraventricular hemorrhage (IVH) characterized by spillover to ventricles with flooding of 50% or more of one or both lateral ventricles accrued accompanying ventriculomegaly, but with no apparent brain parenchymal injury. This type of IVH may be defined as a diameter exceeding 15 mm in the transverse diameter of the lateral ventricular atrium as visualiuzed by prenatal sonography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.label: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage with periventricular hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003421.definition: A type of fetal intraventricular hemorrhage that additionally includes hemorrhage in a large part of the periventricular parenchyma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Temporal lobe megalencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: Expansion of the temporal lobes of the brain along all axes, including rostrocaudal, superoinferior, and mediolateral, resulting in a globular appearance of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Abnormal temporal lobe morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: An abnormal strcutural of the zone (lobe) of the cerebral cortex that is located inferior to the lateral fissure on other cerebral hemispheres.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Temporal lobe dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: A developmental defect of the temporal lobe of the cerebral cortex that is characterized by prominent sulcations and radially directed gyrations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Elevated umbilical artery pulsatility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: Human umbilical artery (UA) blood flow pulsatility measured by Doppler ultrasound is a widely used biomarker for the detection of elevated placental vascular resistance. Elevated UA pulsatility, which in the most extreme cases manifests as absent or even reversed end-diastolic velocity, is associated with intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) and still-birth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Absent end-diastolic umbilical artery flow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: An anomaly that is visualized by umbilical artery Doppler velocimetry. Flow in the umbilical artery should be in the forward direction in normal circumstances. This anomaly is characterized by an absence of flow in the umbilical artery at the end of diastole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Reversed end-diastolic umbilical artery flow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: An anomaly that is visualized by umbilical artery Doppler velocimetry. Flow in the umbilical artery should be in the forward direction in normal circumstances. This anomaly is characterized by an reversal of flow in the umbilical artery at the end of diastole (i.e., backwards flow).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Champagne cork sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: Characteristic appearance of the chest and abdomen in the sagittal view on prenatal ultrasound when the chest is small and the abdomen protruding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Aortic isthmus hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: A type of aortic arch hypoplasia whereby the isthmus (arch between the left subclavian and insertion of the patent ductus arteriosus/ligamentum arteriosum) has a diameter of less than 40% of the diameter of the ascending aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Proximal aortic arch hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: A type of aortic arch hypoplasia whereby the proximal aortic arch (arch proximal to the origin of the left subclavian artery) has a diameter of less than 60% of the diameter of the ascending aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.label: Distal aortic arch hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003422.definition: A type of aortic arch hypoplasia whereby the distal aortic arch (arch distal to the ductus arteriosus) has a diameter of less than 60% of the diameter of the ascending aorta.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: Inferior crossed fused renal ectopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia characterized by fusion between the upper pole of the cross-fused ectopic kidney (located more inferiorly relative to the other kidney) and the lower pole of the other orthotopic kidney (located in a more superior position).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: Sigmoid kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia where the normal side kidney is present superiorly and the direction of pelvic is medial, the kidney which crosses positioned inferiorly with direction of pelvic toward the lateral side. As kidneys fuse after complete rotation on the vertical axis, both renal pelves lie in correct orientation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: Unilateral lump kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia where fusion occurs over a wide margin, both renal pelves anteriorly directed and placed more inferiorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: Disc kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia in which kidneys fuse along their medial borders.
