http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: L-shaped kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia in which the crossed kidney lies inferiorly and transversely, fused with the lower pole of the normal kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: Superior crossed-fused renal ectopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia in which the ectopic kidney lies superiorly and its lower pole fuses with the upper pole of the normal kidney. The renal pelvis of both kidneys lies anteriorly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: Apnea of prematurity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: Recurrent episodes of apnea occurring in infants born less than 37 weeks of gestation, defined specifically as a pause of breathing for more than 15-20 s, or accompanied by oxygen desaturation (SpO2 not more than 80% for at least 4 s) and bradycardia (heart rate less than 2/3 of baseline for at least 4 s), in infants born less than 37 weeks of gestation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: Open neural tube defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: A type of neural tube defect that is not covered by skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: Closed neural tube defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: A type of neural tube defect that is covered by skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.label: Renal vein thrombosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003423.definition: The presence of a thrombus (blood clot) in the major renal veins or its tributaries, generally leading to passive congestion that develops causes the affected kidney to swell and become engorged, leading to degeneration of nephrons and causing symptoms of flank pain, hematuria, and decreased urine output.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.label: Fetal neck mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.definition: An abnormal growth (lump) of tissue in the neck region of a fetus. Masses may be simple cystic,, cystic with a few simple septations (fewer than three septations and less than 3-mm thick), cystic with multiple or thick septations (greater than three septations or septations 3-mm-thick or more), a mass that is than is less than 50% solid, and a mass that is 50% solid or more.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.label: Prenatal death
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.definition: Death of a fetus in the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.label: Abnormal fetal genitourinary system morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.definition: An anomalous structural finding of the fetal genitourinary system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.label: Abnormal fetal pulmonary morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.definition: An anomalous structural finding of the fetal lungs. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.label: Gastric pseudomass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.definition: At US examination from the second trimester onward, the fetal stomach appears as a uniformly anechoic, sharply circumscribed round structure in the left upper quadrant. However, debris is commonly visualized in the stomach, forming a pseudomass.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.label: Fetal scalp mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.definition: An abnormal growth (lump) of tissue that projects from the fetal scalp.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.label: Fetal lower urinary tract obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.definition: An obstruction in the ureter leading to bladder outlet obstruction. Special criteria are used for lower urinary tract obstruction (LUTO) in the fetus. Prenatal LUTO has classically been suspected on the basis of three ultrasonographic findings: megacystis, dilated posterior urethra (known as the keyhole sign) and hydronephrosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.label: Increased fetal lens echogenicity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.definition: Increased echogenicity (increased brightness in the gray-scale sonography image) of the lens of a fetus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.label: Severe influenza infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003424.definition: An unusually severe infection by an influenza virus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: Fetal nuchal edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: Nuchal edema is considered present in a fetus at gestational week 14 or more if in the midsagittal plane of the neck, there is subcutaneous edema that produces a characteristic tremor on ballotment of the fetal head. This constitutes the severe end of the spectrum of increased nuchal fold thickness, which is defined as soft-tissue thickening of 6 mm or more, seen in the suboccipitobregmatic view of the fetal head. Nuchal edema may be confined to the neck or it may be generalized, as part of hydrops fetalis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: Abnormal corneal reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: An anomaly of the corneal reflex that normally induces involuntary blinking of the eyelids following contact of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: Absent corneal reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: Absence of the corneal blinking reflex, which normally induces involuntary blinking of the eyelids following contact of the cornea. The corneal blink reflex is caused by a loop between the trigeminal sensory nerves and the facial motor (VII) nerve innervation of the orbicularis oculi muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: Eosinophil nuclear hypersegmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: An excessive division of the lobes of the nucleus of eosinophils. Eosinophils with more than two nuclear lobes are commonly regarded as hypersegmented, because seventy to ninety percent of peripheral blood eosinophils have two nuclear lobes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: Face of the giant panda sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: The face of the giant panda sign on T2-weighted MRI is characterized by preservation of normal signal intensity in the red nuclei and lateral portion of the pars reticulata of the substantia nigra, high signal in the tegmentum, and hypointensity of the superior colliculus. The findings are said to resemble the face of a giant panda.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: Colovesical fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: An aberrant, pathological communication between the colon and the bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: Absent dermoepidermal hemidesmosomes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: Lack of demonstrable hemidesmosomes at the dermoepidermal junction. Hemidesmosomes are the specialized junctional complexes, that contribute to the attachment of epithelial cells to the underlying basement membrane in stratified and other complex epithelia, such as the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: C4 nephritic factor positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that recognize C4b2a, the C3 convertase of the classical pathway of complement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the midbrain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the midbrain (mesencephalon).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.label: Hypoplasia of the midbrain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003425.definition: A developmental defect characterized by underdevelopment of the mesencephalon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.label: Aplastic zygomatic arch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.definition: Developmental defect characterized by the absence of the zygomatic arch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of facial bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.definition: A developmental defect characterized by absence or underdevelopment of one or more facial bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.label: Absent lanugo
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.definition: Lack of development of lanugo, the fine, soft, unpigmented hair on the body of a fetus or newborn baby.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.label: Abnormal vaginal bleeding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.definition: Abnormal vaginal bleeding occurs between menstrual periods, after sex, or after menopause. Menstrual periods that are heavier or last longer than usual or last more than seven days also are considered abnormal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.label: Postcoital vaginal bleeding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.definition: Postcoital bleeding (PCB) consists of spotting or bleeding after sexual intercourse that is not related to a person's menstrual cycle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.label: Pelvic pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.definition: Pain perceived in the area of the pelvis, the lower part of the abdomen located between the hip bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.label: Abnormal vaginal discharge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003426.definition: Anomalous amount, odor, or consistency of the fluid or mucus that comes from the vagina

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: Serrated incisors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: Incisor teeth with irregular edges said to resemble a saw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: Copper beaten skull
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: Diffuse prominent gyral impressions on the inner table of skull vault said to resemble beaten copper.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: Perifoveal hypoautofluorescence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: Decreased amount of autofluorescence (emission of fluorescent light from ocular structures in the absence of sodium fluorescein) in the retina in the region surrounding the fovea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: Premature sagging cheeks
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: Drooping or sinking of tissues of the cheeks more than would be expected at a given age. Sagging can occur due to a relative excess of skin and/or lack of elastic recoil as well as fat accumulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: Gastrointestinal ulcer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: A deep defect in the esophageal, gastric, duodenal or intestinal wall involving the entire mucosal thickness and penetrating through the muscularis mucosae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: Verrucous epidermal nevus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: A type of epidermal nevus (which represent Blaschkoid hamartomas of the skin that result from mosaic post-zygotic mutations) that appears as skin-colored-to-brown, sharply demarcated, papillomatous papules that coalesce into plaques. The majority of these nevi are either present at birth or occur within the first year of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: Elevated circulating thymidine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: Concentration of thymidine in the blood circulation above the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: Elevated circulating deoxyuridine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: Concentration of 2-deoxyuridine in the blood circulation is above the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: Multinucleated erythroblast
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: Erythroblasts with multiple nuclei. Erythroblasts are nucleated precrusor cells of erythrocytes that are localized to the bone marrow. Normally, erythroblasts have a single nucleus. The abnormal finding of erythrocytes with two or more nuclei may be related to defects in cytokinesis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.label: 2,8-dihydroxyadenine crystalluria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003427.definition: The presence of 2,8-dihydroxyadenine crystals in the urine. The crystals appear as round, yellow-brown crystals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Target cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: Target cells (codocytes) have a centrally located disk of hemoglobin surrounded by an area of pallor with an outer rim of hemoglobin adjacent to the cell membrane giving the cell the appearance of a target.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Phalangeal cone-shaped epiphyses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the phalanges of the hands or feet. Cone-shaped epiphyses (also known as coned epiphyses) are epiphyses that invaginate into cupped metaphyses. That is, the epiphysis has a cone-shaped distal extension resulting from increased growth of the central portion of the epiphysis relative to its periphery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Subcutaneous ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: Formation of abnormal, extraskeletal bony tissue in the soft tissue beneath the skin. Subcutaneous ossifications may be observed by radiography or by palpation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Increased fecal protoporphyrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: Abnormally high concentration of protoporphyrin (derivative of porphyrin with propionic acid groups) in feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Recurrent gingivitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: Repeated occurrences of inflammatory condition of the gums (gingival tissue), most commonly caused by bacterial infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Enteroviral encephalitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: Inflamation of the brain related to infection by an enterovirus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia is an opportunistic infection that occurs in immunosuppressed populations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Afibrinogenemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: Lack of detectable fibrinogen in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Elevated circulating reverse T3 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: Abnormally increased concentration of reverse T3 (3,3',5'-triiodothyronine or rT3) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.label: Elevated circulating rT3/T3 ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003428.definition: An abnormally increased ratio of the concentrations of reverse T3 to T3 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.label: Elevated circulating tiglylglycine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.definition: Concentration of tiglylglycine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.label: Elevated circulating creatine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.definition: An elevation above the normal range of creatine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.label: Reduced circulating creatine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.definition: An reduction below the normal range of creatine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.label: Temporal lobe calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.definition: The presence of calcium deposition within the temporal lobe of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.label: Ductal bile plugs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.definition: Bile thrombi that form an obstruction (plug) in a dilated bile duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.label: Reduced cerebral white matter volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.definition: An abnormally low volume of the white matter of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.label: Elevated circulating tetracosanoic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.definition: Elevated concentration of tetracosanoic acid (a C24 straight-chain saturated fatty acid) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.label: Elevated circulating hexacosanoic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.definition: Elevated concentration of hexacosanoic acid (a C26 straight-chain saturated fatty acid) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.label: Sertoli cell-only phenotype
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003429.definition: A histological phenotype observed on testicular biopsy in which only Sertoli cells line the seminiferous tubules of the testis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: Decreased acid sphingomyelinase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: Reduced activity of the enzyme acid sphingomyelinase activity in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: Congenital pouch colon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: A malformation of the colon in which a pouch-like dilatation of a varying degree of shortened colon is associated with an anorectal malformation. The pouch usually terminates in a fistulous communication with the genitourinary tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: Megalopapilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: A congenitally anomalous enlarged optic disk (surface area greater than 2.50 square millimeters). It is considered to be a normal variant without physiological defects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: Notched T wave
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: A bifid T-wave with a notch duration between the 2 peaks at leasy 0.04 sec and an amplitude at least 0.05 mV.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: Epsilon wave
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: An electric signal of depolarization observed between the end of the QRS complex and the beginning of the T wave.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: 2:1 atrioventricular block
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: A type of second-degree atrioventricular block in which every other P wave is not conducted through the AV node such that only every other P wave is followed by a QRS complex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: Ventricular bigeminy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of a normal QRS followed by a premature ventricular contraction; a rhythmic pairing of normal and atypical beats originating in the ventricles in a 1-1 ratio such that an ectopic ventricular beat follows each regular heartbeat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: Elevated left ventricular end-diastolic diameter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: The LV end-diastolic internal diameter was measured from two-dimensional (2D) images in the parasternal long-axis view, timed with mitral valve closure at the level of the mitral valve chordae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: Prolonged P wave
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: Abnormal increased in the duration of the P wave, which is a marker of delayed inter-atrial conduction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.label: Multiflagellar spermatozoa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003430.definition: Spermatozoa with multiple flagella attached to the sperm head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.label: Post-vaccination yellow fever
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.definition: Infection with the yellow fever virus of the live-attenuated vaccine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.label: Hypoplastic optic chiasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.definition: Developmental defect characterized by undergrowth of the optic chiasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.label: Nocturnal hypoxemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.definition: Abnormally reduced oxyhemoglobin saturation during sleep (nocturnal). Different thresholds are used in the literature, including more than 10 percent of total sleep time below a SpO2 of 90 percent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.label: Hyperdynamic left ventricular ejection fraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.definition: An abnoramlly increased ejection fraction of the left ventricle, usually defined as a left ventricular ejection fraction greater than 70 percent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.label: Abnormal left ventricular ejection fraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.definition: Any abnormality of the left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF), which is the fraction of chamber volume ejected in systole (stroke volume) in relation to the volume of the blood in the ventricle at the end of diastole (end-diastolic volume). Stroke volume (SV) is calculated as the difference between end-diastolic volume (EDV) and end-systolic volume (ESV). LVEF is calculated as [SV/EDV] in percent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.label: Chronic cough
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.definition: A persistent cough, defined as a cough lasting longer than eight weeks in adults or longer than four weeks in children.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.label: Thinning of the substantia nigra pars compacta
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.definition: Reduced volume of pars compacta of the substantia nigra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.label: Unusual virus reactivation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.definition: Reactivation is the mechanism whereby a latent virus that has infected a host cell switches to a lytic stage, undergoing productive viral replication and allowing the virus to spread. This term refers to reactivation regarded as unusual because of frequency, intensity, location, or nature of the virus, in the sense that the reactivation would not be observed in an immunocompetent host.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.label: CNS vasculitis with reactivation of varicella-zoster virus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003431.definition: A vasculopathy in the central nervous system (CNS) following reactivation of varicella-zoster virus due to a productive viral infection of both large and small cerebral arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.label: Muscle fiber intracytoplasmic reducing inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.definition: Intracytoplasmic inclusions in myofibers that reduce nitro-blue tetrazolium (NBT) and thus stain strongly with the menadione-NBT stain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.label: Elevated circulating guanidinoacetic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.definition: Concentration of guanidinoacetic acid in the blood circulation is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.label: Reduced circulating growth hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.definition: Concentration of growth hormone in the blood circulation below normal limits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.label: Brachiocephalic artery aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.definition: An abnormal widening (dilatation) of the brachiocephalic artery

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.label: Common carotid artery aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.definition: An abnormal widening (dilatation) of the common carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.label: Adenomyosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.definition: Inappropriate (ectopic) endometrial tissue proliferation within the uterine myometrium, often presenting clinically with painful menses and heavy menstrual bleeding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.label: Posterior corneal stroma punctiform multicolored opacities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.definition: Thin, punctiform elements of various colors in the posterior stroma of the cornea, immediately anterior to Descemet membrane. The elements are visible to direct and indirect illumination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.label: Fibro-obliterative bile-duct lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.definition: A condition in which the lumen of a bile duct has been filled by fibrous scar material, in effect replacing the bile duct with a fibrous scar.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.label: Dysplastic megalencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003432.definition: A congenital brain malformation characterized by marked overgrowth and dysplasia affecting one or both cerebral hemispheres, and, in some cases, subcortical brain regions as well. The presence of dysplasia in dysplastic megalencephaly distinguishes it from other forms of generalized megalencephaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.label: Regional right ventricular hypokinesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.definition: Decreased range of right ventricular motion in a portion of the right ventricle of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.label: McConnell sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.definition: Severe hypokinesia of the mid-free wall of the right ventricle of the heart with a normal contraction of the apical segment of the right ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.label: Cognitive regression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.definition: Loss of cognitive developmental skills, as manifested by loss of developmental cognitive milestones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.label: Increased circulating hypoxanthine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.definition: Elevated concentration of hypoxanthine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.label: Inheritance qualifier
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.definition: The terms in this hierarchy can be used to specificy the context in which inheritance of a disease is typically observed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.label: Splenic infarction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.definition: Ischemia and necrosis of part or all of the spleen resulting from compromise of blood supply resulting from arterial or venous occlusion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.label: Claw hand deformity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.definition: An abnormality of the hand characterized by metacarpophalangeal (MCP) hyperextension and proximal interphalangeal (PIP) and distal interphalangeal (DIP) flexion. The position of the affected hand is said to resemble a claw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.label: Imprinted
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.definition: Requires that the abnormal allele be paternal or maternal in origin, depending on the disease-gene relationship. Imprinting refers to a normal developmental process in which either the paternal or maternal allele is inactivated, depending on the specific locus, thus leading to expression from only one copy of the gene. Disease typically manifests when a deleterious variant is inherited from a parent whose copy of the gene would normally be expressed, but not when a deleterious variant is inherited from a parent whose copy of the gene would normally be inactivated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.label: Pseudoautosomal inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003433.definition: A pattern of inheritance observed for alleles in the X-Y identical regions is referred to as pseudoautosomal inheritance, because it resembles the pattern seen for alleles located on autosomes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Pseudoautosomal dominant inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: A type of pseudoautosomal inheritance that is dominant and in which heterozygous males and females both manifest a disease phenotype.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Pseudoautosomal recessive inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: A type of pseudoautosomal inheritance that is recessive and in which biallelic males and females both manifest a disease phenotype.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Trapezius muscle aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: A developmental defect characterized by lack of formation of the trapezius muscle, which is broad superficial muscle that extends from the posterior neck to the posterior part of the trunk (thorax).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Requires heterozygosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: A rarely encountered phenomenon in which condition is most severe in the heterozygous state. Such disorders are rare and currently all are X-linked. Most X-linked recessive conditions manifest if hemizygous in males, or biallelic in females, though may have a mild phenotype in the heterozygous state in females.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Female-limited expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: Used to refer to a monogenic trait linked to an autosomal locus in which the phenotypic effects of allelic differences are expressed only in the female sex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Mendelian inheritance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: A mode of inheritance of diseases whose pathophysiology can be traced back to deleterious variants in a single gene. The inheritance patterns of these single-gene (monogenic) diseases are often referred to as Mendelian in honor of Gregor Mendel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Nesidioblastosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: An abnormality of pancreatic beta cells characterized by a proliferation of abnormal beta cells throughout the entire pancreas, with enlarged islet size and number (hypertrophic islets), increased periductular islets, enlarged beta-cell nuclei and abundant clear cytoplasm. Occasionally beta cells with pleomorphic nuclei, ductuloinsular complexes, and neoformation of islets from ducts are observed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Greater auricular nerve thickening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: Increase in thickness of the great auricular nerve, a cutaneous nerve of the head. It originates from the cervical plexus, with branches of spinal nerves C2 and C3. Thickening may lead to the nerve being palpable or even visible in this region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Subpulmonary stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: A cardiovascular malformation associated with narrowing of the outflow tract of the right ventricle immediately below the pulmonary valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.label: Supravalvar pulmonary stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003434.definition: A cardiovascular malformation associated with narrowing at the level of the pulmonary sinotubular junction above the pulmonic valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: Valvular pulmonary stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: A cardiovascular malformation associated with narrowing of the outflow tract of the right ventricle immediately at the level of the pulmonary valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: Neuromyotonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: Peripheral nerve hyperexcitability manifesting as spontaneous discharges originating from motor axons or their terminals, lead to overactivity of muscles, typically manifesting as twitches, cramps and stiffness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: Bile duct polyp
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: An elevated growth from the the mucosa of the bile duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: Appendicular spasticity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: A type of spasticity that affects one or more limbs (arms or legs).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: Trichoschisis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: Transverse fractures through the hair shafts (trichoschisis). Trichoschisis is characterized by a sharp transverse fracture of the hair shaft.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: White cerebellum sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: On computed tomography of the brain,the white (or dense) cerebellum sign is seen when the cerebellum appears dense with respect to the cerebral parenchyma. The increase in attenuation of cerebellum is in fact a relative hyperdensity caused by decreased attenutation of the brain. It represents anoxic-ischemic cerebral injury, and has a very poor prognosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: Impaired renal tubular reabsorption of low molecular weight protein
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: Increased loss of low-molecular weight proteins by the kidneys, measured in terms of the fractional excretion (FE). The FE of low-molecular-weight proteins such as beta2-microglobulin can be measured in terms of plasma and urine concentrations, since urinary low-molecular-weight protein concentrations can vary with water reabsorption.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: Impaired renal tubular reabsorption of glucose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: Increased fractional excretion (FE) of glucose in the urine. The FE of glucose is the percentage of the glucose filtered by the kidney which is excreted in the urine. It is measured in terms of plasma and urine glucose, rather than by the interpretation of urinary glucose concentration alone, as urinary glucose concentrations can vary with water reabsorption.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: Impaired renal tubular reabsorption of sodium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: Increased fractional excretion (FE) of sodium in the urine. The FE of sodium is the percentage of the sodium filtered by the kidney which is excreted in the urine. It is measured in terms of plasma and urine sodium, rather than by the interpretation of urinary glucose concentration alone, as urinary glucose concentrations can vary with water reabsorption.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.label: Impaired renal tubular reabsorption of phosphate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003435.definition: Increased fractional excretion (FE) of glucose in the phosphate. The FE of glucose is the percentage of the phosphate filtered by the kidney which is excreted in the urine. It is measured in terms of plasma and urine phosphate, rather than by the interpretation of urinary phosphate concentration alone, as urinary glucose concentrations can vary with water reabsorption.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Action myoclonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: A type of myoclonus (arrhythmic muscular jerking) that is induced by voluntary movement. It is made worse by attempts at precise or coordinated movement (intention myoclonus) and may also be provoked by certain sensory stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Redundant umbilical skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: Greater than normal amount of skin surrounding the umbilicus (belly button) with protrusion of the umbilicus above the plane of the abdomen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Dull foveal reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: Reduced brigthness of the foveal reflex, which normally is a bright pinpoint of light that is observed to move sideways or up and down in response to movement of the opthalmoscope.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Corneal pterygium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: Corneal pterygium is an ocular surface disease characterized mainly by a wing-shaped growth of limbal and conjunctival tissue over the adjacent cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Fibrofatty replacement of right ventricular myocardium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: Replacement of the myocardium of the right ventricular free wall by fat and fibrous tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Elevated circulating alpha-aminoadipic semialdehyde concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: Increased concentration of alpha-aminoadipic semialdehyde in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Fracture blister
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: Fracture blister is a type of blister that forms following acute bone fractures, typically near the ankle, wrist elbow or foot, where skin adheres tightly to bone with little subcutaneous fat cushioning. The blister that results resembles that of a second degree burn.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Decreased circulating beta-mannosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: Activity of the enzyme beta-mannosidase below the lower limit of normal. Beta-mannosidase is a lysosomal enzyme that catabolizes oligosaccharides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Urolithiasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: Renal stones are formed within the kidneys, and this is called nephrolithiasis. Urolithiasis is a condition that occurs when these stones exit the renal pelvis and move into the remainder of the urinary collecting system, which includes the ureters, bladder, and urethra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.label: Decreased level of coenzyme Q10 in skeletal muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003436.definition: Reduced amount of coenzyme Q10,a naturally occurring quinone, in skeletal muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.label: Reduced circulating prekallikrein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.definition: Reduced concentration of prekallikrein (PK; also known as Fletcher factor) in the blood circulation. PK is the precursor of plasma kallikrein, a serine protease that activates kinins. PK is cleaved to produce kallikrein by activated Factor XII.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.label: External tibial torsion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.definition: External twisting of the tibia resulting in the toes of each foot pointing outward (outtoeing) .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.label: Trident acetabulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.definition: Abnormal appearance of the acetabulum characterized by spurs at the medial and lateral acetabular margin and in the center of the acetabulum, giving rise to shape resembling a three-pronged spear sadi to resemble a trident.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.label: Spherophakia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.definition: Spherophakia is a rare congenital condition that presents with weak zonules around a smaller and more spherical crystalline lens with an increased anteroposterior thickness of the lens, and highly myopic eye. The lens zonules are developmentally hypoplastic and abnormally weak and due to non-attachment of the posterior zonules to the equatorial zone of the lens, the lens changes its normal shape to spherical.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.label: Atrioventricular valve regurgitation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.definition: Regurgitation of a heart valve that controls blood flow from a an atrium to a ventricle, including mitral, tricuspid, or, rarely, single atrioventicular valve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.label: Single atrioventricular valve regurgitation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.definition: Regurgitation of the single atrioventricular valve regurgitation (AVVR) in the context of a congenital heart defect with a single ventricle. Roughly three quarters of patients following Fontan procedure display AVVR.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.label: Urethrovesical occlusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.definition: Blockage of the flow of urine from the bladder into the urethra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.label: obsolete Vascular granular osmiophilic material deposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003437.definition: Accumulation of granular osmiophilic material in blood vessel walls. Osmiophilic material becomes black upon staining with osmium tetroxide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.label: Juvenile type testicular granulosa cell tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.definition: Juvenile granulosa cell tumor of the testis of neonates and infants is an uncommon lesion frequently associated with abnormal sex chromosome and ambiguous genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.label: Central nervous system axonal spheroid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.definition: Axonal spheroids are bubble-like biological features that form on most degenerating axons. During neurodegeneration, bubble-like swellings form along the length of the axon, a primary and early effect of dynamic axonal deformation. These varicosities, spheroids, or swellings have been described as beads on a string and branches bearing fruit, and they frequently appear on degenerating axons. The focal swellings on degenerating axons, axonal spheroids, are often filled with cellular debris such as organelles, pathological proteins, and disorganized cytoskeletal elements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.label: Disease remission
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.definition: A decrease in or disappearance of signs and symptoms typically associated with a disease course.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.label: Elevated circulating biliverdin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.definition: Increased concentration of biliverdin, a green tetrapyrrolic bile pigment, in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.label: Elevated circulating insulin:C-peptide ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.definition: Increased ratio of insulin to C-peptide in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.label: Abnormal left ventricular endsystolic diameter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.definition: A deviation from the normal range of the left ventricular endsystolic diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.label: Reduced left ventricular endsystolic diameter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.definition: A lower than normal left ventricular endsystolic diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.label: Hilar lymph node enlargement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.definition: Hilar lymphadenopathy is swelling or enlargement of lymph nodes localised in hila, wedge-shaped anatomical structures containing pulmonary vessels, major bronchi, nerves and lymph nodes. Hilar lymph nodes are not visible on chest X-ray if they are not enlarged. Hilar lymph node enlargement can be caused by benign and malignant conditions and can be symmetrical (bilateral) or asymmetrical (unilateral).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.label: Pulmonary vein varix
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003438.definition: Pulmonary vein varix (PVV), refers to a localised dilatation of a pulmonary vein. PVV is a rare condition and can be congenital or acquired. PVV typically occur at the confluence of the veins adjacent to the left atrium. PVVs are sometimes classified into three morphological types: saccular, tortuous and confluent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Decreased CSF glycine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: Abnormally decreased levels of glycine in cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Elbow contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: A limitation in the passive range of motion of the elbow resulting from loss of elasticity in the periarticular tissues owing to structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules or skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: A limitation in the passive range of motion of the elbow resulting from loss of elasticity in the periarticular tissues owing to structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules or skin. A contracture prevents movement of the associated body part.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Elbow extension contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: An elbow contracture that limits the ability of the elbow joint to flex (flexion of the the elbow joint refers to bending the elbow joint to bring the hand closer to the shoulder), meaning that the elbow is fixed in an extended (straight) position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Forearm supination contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: A contracture that limits the ability of the forearm to stabilize the hand in pronation (pronation refers to a rotation of the forearm that causes the palm and forearm to face downwards), meaning that the palm is fixed in a upward orientation. Restriction of supination/pronation can occur at the elbow (radial-humeral joint), at the wrist (radial-ulnar joint), and anywhere in between.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Forearm pronation contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: A contracture that limits the ability of the forearm to stabilize the hand in supiation (supination refers to a rotation of the forearm that causes the palm and forearm to face upwards), meaning that the palm is fixed in a downward orientation. Restriction of supination/pronation can occur at the elbow (radial-humeral joint), at the wrist (radial-ulnar joint), and anywhere in between.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Hippocampal malrotation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: Hippocampal malrotation, also termed incomplete inversion of the hippocampus or hippocampal malformation, is an increasingly recognized neuroimaging finding of undetermined clinical significance. It is characterized by features including (i) Round or pyramidal shape instead of ovoid shape; (ii) Medial position of the hippocampus on the hippocampal sulcus; (iii) The collateral sulcus is excessively deep or verticalized; (iv) Fimbria located medial to the hippocampus; (v) Small or displaced fornix; (vi) Enlarged temporal horn and empty choroid fissure; (vii) Thickened subiculum; (viii) Reduced upper horizontal portion of the parahippocampal gyrus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Claw toe deformity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: Claw toes are characterized by hyperextension at the metatarsal-phalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Toe deformity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: Abnormal positioning of toe phalanges. Deformities of the lesser toes often occur gradually, though they can be brought on by trauma. The main adult sagittal plane deformities consist of claw toes, hammer toes and mallet toes. Axial plane deformities include crossover toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.label: Prolonged central motor conduction time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003439.definition: Increased duration of the central motor conduction time (CMCT). The CMCT estimates the conduction time of corticospinal fibers between motor cortex and spinal (or bulbar) motoneurons. It includes the times for excitation of cortical cells, conduction via the corticobulbar-corticospinal tract and excitation of the motoneuron sufficient to reach its firing threshold. CMCT is calculated by subtracting the peripheral conduction time from the MEP latency recorded after cortical stimulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.label: Circumferential skin creases on extremities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.definition: Ringed creases of the skin of the extremities related to folding of excess skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.label: Atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.definition: An aggressive malignant embryonal neoplasm arising from the central nervous system. It is composed of cells with a large eccentric nucleus, prominent nucleolus, and abundant cytoplasm. Mutations of the SMARCB1 gene or very rarely SMARCA4 (BRG1) gene are present. The vast majority of cases occur in childhood. Symptoms include lethargy, vomiting, cranial nerve palsy, headache, and hemiplegia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.label: Rhabdoid tumor of the kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.definition: A highly aggressive, extremely rare neoplasm of the kidney that is usually seen in children. The term rhabdoid is used because the tumor cells resemble rhabdomyoblasts but lack myogenic markers, and pathologic diagnosis requires familiarity with these microscopic features plus awareness that adult onset is possible. It can be associated with abnormalities of chromosome 22. It is characterized by the presence of cells with a large eccentric nucleus, prominent nucleolus, and abundant cytoplasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.label: Subcutaneous panniculitis-like T-cell lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.definition: A form of T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma in which cytotoxic CD8+ T cells infiltrate adipose tissue forming subcutaneous nodules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.label: Fungal hyphae in sputum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.definition: Presence of hyphae (long, branching, filamentous structures produced by fungi) in sputum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.label: Enlarged tectum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.definition: Increasaed size of the tectum, which is the region of the midbrain posterior to the cerebral aqueduct of Sylvius. The midbrain is the most superior portion of the brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.label: Reduced circulating 3-ketoacyl-CoA thiolase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.definition: Decreased concentration of 3-ketoacyl-CoA thiolase in th blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.label: Solitary angiokeratoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.definition: A dark, keratotic papule about 2-10 mm in diameter, usually occuring on the lower extremeities. Usually the lesions begin as bright, soft, and nonkeratotic paules which grow larger and change to a firm, blue to black and keratotic stage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.label: Fordyce angiokeratoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003440.definition: A type of angiokeratoma that most commonly occurs on the scrotum of patients who are 40 years old or older. The typical single lesion is a dark red to blue dome-shaped papule 2-4 mm in diameter with a very discrete keratotic surface. Typically, they are multiple and arranged in a line parallel to the raphe mediana of the scrotum. They also occur on the vulva and less commnly on the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Angiokeratoma circumscriptum naeviforme
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: A type of angiokeratoma that typically presents in childhood as a large, mostly linear and unilateral hyperkeratotic plaque which is composed of confluent keratotic papules. The size ranges from a few centimeters up to a major part of the body surface. Initially the lesions present asa multile reddish macules, clinically similar to a nevus flammeus. Within several years they develop into acanthokeratotic papules that agrregate into plaques which may have a hyperkeratotic surface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Angiokeratoma of Mibelli
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: A type of angiokeratoma that typically presents in women on the dorsa of fingers and toes and multiple dark red papules with a slightly verrucous surface, each measuring about 3-5 mm in diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Laryngeal mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: A lump in the region of the larynx. A mass is any lump in the body that can be caused by the abnormal growth of cells, a cyst, hormonal changes or an immune reaction. Typically a mass is an initial finding that will lead to additional workup. Laryngeal masses can be visualized by multiple methods include computed tomography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Palate mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: A lump in the region of the palate. A mass is any lump in the body that can be caused by the abnormal growth of cells, a cyst, hormonal changes or an immune reaction. Typically a mass is an initial finding that will lead to additional workup.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Thick oral frenulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: Increased thickness of an oral frenulum, flaps of mucous membrane that extend from the midline gingiva to the upper or lower lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Tooth avulsion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: A type of dental trauma characterized by total dislocation of the tooth from its socket.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Torn oral frenulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: Laceration or tear of an oral frenulum, flaps of mucous membrane that extend from the midline gingiva to the upper or lower lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Intraoral laceration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: A wound of the mucosa within the oral cavity covering lips, tongue, palate, gingiva, pharynx, or retropharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Erythematous oral mucosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: An erythematous lesion of the oral mucosa may result from a variety of tissue alterations, including inflammation, erythrocyte extravasation, and atrophy or reduced keratinization of the surface epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.label: Mitral chordae tendinae rupture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003441.definition: Breakage of the chordae tendinae of the mitral valve. This can lead to loss of tension of one of the mitral valve leaflets and mitral regurgitation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.label: History of cardiovascular procedure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.definition: Indicates that a cardiovascular procedure such as stenting, bypass, catherization was performed on a patient.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.label: Ejection click
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.definition: A high-pitched sound that occurs at the moment of maximal opening of the aortic or pulmonary valves. They are heard just after the first heart sound. The sounds occur in the presence of a dilated aorta or pulmonary artery or in the presence of a bicuspid or flexible stenotic aortic or pulmonary valve. Ejection clicks may also be called ejection sounds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.label: Cryofibrinogenemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.definition: Cryofibrinogen is an abnormal protein that forms precipitate only in plasma. consisting of fibrinogen, fibronectin, alpha1-antitrypsin and alpha2-macroglobulin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.label: triggered by allergens
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to allergens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.label: Clicking tinnitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.definition: A type of tinnitus that presents as clicks, resembling the noise made by the snapping together of 2 fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.label: Reduced hair sulfur content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.definition: Abnormally low amount of sulfur in hair.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.label: Purulent eye discharge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.definition: Secretion of pus-like (purulent) material from the eye, which may caused the eyelids to be matted together.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.label: Bacteria in cerebrospinal fluid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003442.definition: Presence of bacteria in the cerebrospinal fluid, as manifested by visual inspection or bacterial culture results.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.label: Joint crepitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.definition: A popping, clicking or crackling sound that accompaniees movement of a joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.label: Intertriginous distribution
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.definition: Applies to the localization of a skin lesion involving any area of the body where two opposing skin surfaces can touch and rub or chaff.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.label: Distributed along skin tension lines
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.definition: Applies to the localization of a skin lesion that correspond to skin tension lines, which are linear clefts in the skin that indicate the direction of orientation of the underlying collagen fibers. Skin tension lines are also known as Langer's lines or lines of cleavage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.label: Abnormal communication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.definition: Presence of any form of communication (e.g., verbal or non-verbal) that does not align with cultural expectations or developmental level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.label: Abnormal eye contact
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.definition: Any abnormality of eye contact behavior. We define eye contact as a form of nonverbal communication between two individuals who are facing each other in which an individual directs the eyes towards the eyes or face of the other individual. Eye contact occurs frequently and voluntarily during face-to-face verbal communication. The duration and frequency of eye contact that is interpreted to be appropriate may follow social and situational norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.label: Gaze avoidance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.definition: A deliberate avoidance of eye contact.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.label: Excessive eye contact
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.definition: Tendency to maintain sustained eye contact for an inappropriately long period of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.label: Instep location
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003443.definition: Applies to an abnormality that is situated in the arched middle portion of the foot in front of the ankle joint (i.e., instep).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Ameliorated by ultraviolet light exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: Applies to a skin lesion that is improved or made more bearable by exposure to ultraviolet light (sunshine or phototherapy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Decreased circulating aspartic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: An reduced concentration of aspartic acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Abnormal circulating erythropoietin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of erythropoietin in the blood circulation. Erythropoietin is a glycoprotein hormone produced by the peritubular cells of the kidney that stimulates red blood cell production.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Reduced circulating erythropoietin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: Decreased concentration of erythropoietin in the blood circulation. Erythropoietin is a glycoprotein hormone produced by the peritubular cells of the kidney that stimulates red blood cell production.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Abnormal gamma-glutamyltransferase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: Any deviation from the normal level of the enzyme gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT). GGT is mainly present in kidney, liver, and pancreatic cells, but small amounts are present in other tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Reduced gamma-glutamyltransferase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: Decreased level of the enzyme gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT). GGT is mainly present in kidney, liver, and pancreatic cells, but small amounts are present in other tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Elevated circulating histamine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: Increased concentration of histamine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Increased circulating interleukin 18 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: An increased concentration of interleukin-18 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Abnormal phytanic acid:pristanic acid ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: Any deviation from the normal ratio of blood phytanic acid concentration to pristanic acid concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.label: Increased phytanic acid:pristanic acid ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003444.definition: An elevation above the normal ratio of blood phytanic acid concentration to pristanic acid concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.label: Decreased phytanic acid:pristanic acid ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.definition: A reduction below the normal ratio of blood phytanic acid concentration to pristanic acid concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.label: Rectovesical fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.definition: An aberrant, pathological communication between the rectum and the bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.label: Rectoureteral fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.definition: An abnormal connection (fistula) between the rectum and the ureter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.label: Arachnoid granulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.definition: Arachnoid granulations (AGs) are tufts of arachnoid membrane invaginated into the dural sinuses through which cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) enters the venous system. The lesions are primarily located in the parasagittal region along the superior sagittal sinus, which is occasionally seen at the transverse sinus. Normally dural venous sinus AGs typically range from 2 to 8 mm in size, but may grow enough to expand the dural sinuses, and even the inner table, diploic space and outer table of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.label: Increased CSF taurine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.definition: Increased concentration of taurine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.label: Elevated circulating glutathione concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.definition: An abnormally increased level of glutathione in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.label: Hawkinsinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.definition: The concentration of hawkinsin in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.label: Elevated urinary phenylpyruvic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.definition: An abnormally increased amount of phenylpyruvic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.label: Ameliorated by lumbar puncture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003445.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by lumbar puncture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: Increased CSF uracil concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: An increased level of uracil in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: Elevated urine kynurenine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: An abnormally increased amount of kynurenine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: Increased CSF L-alloisoleucine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: An abnormally increased concentration of L-alloisoleucine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: Hydroxylysinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: An increased concentration of hydroxylysine in the blood circulation. Hydroxylysine arises from a post-translational hydroxy modification of lysine and is unique to collagen and proteins containing collagen-like sequences. Elevated concentrations of hydroxylysine may indicate increased bone turnover.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: Homocitrullinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: An increased amount of L-homocitrulline in the urine. L-homocitrulline is an L-lysine derivative that is L-lysine having a carbamoyl group at the N(6)-position. It is found in individuals with urea cycle disorders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: 2-hydroxyadipic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: An increase in the level of 2-hydroxyadipic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: Homoargininuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: An increased amount of homoarginine in the urine. Homoarginine is a nonproteinogenic alpha amino acid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: Increased urinary cysteine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: An increased concentration of cysteine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: Gastric xanthoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: Gastric xanthomas (also known as xanthelasmas) are are plaque-like red lesions defined by the presence of histiocytic containing lipids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.label: Decreased stool elastase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003446.definition: Reduced amount of pancreatic elastase in the stool. This feature may be observed with pancreatic insufficiency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Elevated stool chloride content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Elevated amount of chloride in the stool.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Increased fecal coproporphyrin III:coproporphyrin I ratio
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Abnormal relative increase in the amount of fecal coproporphyrin III as compared to coproporphyrin I in the feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Increased fecal harderoporphyrin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Abnormally high concentration of harderoporphyrin in feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Increased fecal heptacarboxylporphyrin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Abnormally high concentration of heptacarboxylporphyrin in feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Increased fecal pentacarboxylporphyrin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Abnormally high concentration of pentacarboxylporphyrin in feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Increased fecal isocoproporphyrin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Abnormally high concentration of isocoproporphyrin in feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Positive fecal Clostridium botulinum test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Identification of Clostridium botulinum toxin in the feces.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Perihepatic adhesions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Abnormal union of the membranous surfaces of the liver capsule and the parietal peritoneum due to inflammation or injury. Adhesions may be visualized by laparoscopy and may have a violin string appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Dilated vas deferens
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Abnormal increase in diameter (expansion) of the vas deferens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.label: Enlarged epididymis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003447.definition: Abnormal increase in the size of the epididymis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.label: Atypical gestures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.definition: Spontaneous production of communicative gestures that are perceived as odd or mechanical, or are poorly integrated with other means of communication. This may include inaccurate mimicry of typical gestures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.label: Bone marrow vacuolated lymphocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.definition: The presence of lymphocytes with multilple vacuoles (a membrane-bound cell organelle) in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.label: Spinal cord calcifications
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.definition: The presence of calcium deposition in the spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.label: Neuroepithelial cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.definition: A benign epithelial-lined cystic lesion that can occur anywhere in the neuraxis. Neuroepithelial cysts are ependymal or epithelial lined fluid collections of unknown etiology within the central nervous system parenchyma with no obvious ventricular or subarachnoid connection. Most cysts are asymptomatic, however, some present with seizures, mass effect, or rarely with movement disorders. On imaging, they present as CSF-like parenchymal cysts with smooth, rounded borders and minimal or no surrounding signal intensity abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.label: Reduced circulating interleukin 7 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.definition: A diminished concentration of interleukin-7 in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.label: Increased circulating interleukin 12 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.definition: An increased concentration of interleukin-12 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.label: Increased circulating interleukin 13 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.definition: An increased concentration of interleukin-13 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.label: Increased circulating interleukin 2 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003448.definition: An increased concentration of interleukin-2 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Increased circulating interleukin 4 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: An increased concentration of interleukin-4 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Increased circulating interleukin 5 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: An increased concentration of interleukin-5 in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Salpingitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: An inflammation of the fallopian tube.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Tubo-ovarian abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: A tubo-ovarian abscess (TOA) is a complex infectious mass of the adnexa that forms as a sequela of pelvic inflammatory disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Opacified paranasal sinuses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: White appearance (radio-opaqueness) of a paranasal sinus on radiography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Elevated brain glutamine level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: An increased in the level of glutamine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Abnormal brain glutamine level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: A deviation from normal in the level of glutamine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Increased urinary hexanoic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: The concentration of hexanoic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Hepatic focal nodular hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: Hepatic focal nodular hyperplasia (FNH) is a benign hepatic tumor. FNH develops within hepatic parenchymal tissue that is otherwise histologically normal. Macroscopically, the tumor is characterized by the presence of depressed, grayish-white scar, which is generally (but not always) located at the center of the lesion, with fibrous septa radiating outward, toward the periphery of the tumor. This stellate scar is found in only 50% of all FNH nodules, but its presence is regarded as pathognomonic. The lesion itself is usually lighter in color than the tissue that surrounds it, and it sometimes has a yellowish hue. FNH nodules are generally not capsulated; their margins are well defined, and they are sometimes lobulated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.label: Increased bone marrow iron
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003449.definition: An increased amount of iron in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Glenoid fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: A fracture of the glenoid fossa, a relatively shallow dish is located on the lateral scapula and is the socket portion of the shoulder joint that meets to articulate the humeral head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Widened mediastinum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: Abnormal increase in the width of the mediastinum, often defined as being greater than 6 to 8 cm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Narrow mediastinum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: Abnormal decrease in the width of the mediastinum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Ovarian torsion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: Ovarian torsion is a twisting of the ligaments that support the adnexa, cutting off the blood flow to the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Septate gallbladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: Septate gallbladder is characterized by the presence of a septum that divides the gallbladder in two chambers. When the septum dividing the gallbladder lies longitudinally it is called bilobed gallbladder and when there is a transverse septum separating the fundus from the rest of the gallbladder it is called an hour-glass gallbladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Gallbladder wall thickening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: Abnormal increased in the thickness of the wall of the gallbladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Gallbladder enlargement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: Abnormal increased in the thickness of the size of the gallbladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Gallbladder mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: An abnormal lesion or swelling seen on gallbladder imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Fingerprint bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: Fingerprint bodies are inclusion bodies located at the periphery of the muscle fibers underneath the sarcolemma (subsarcolemmal), consisting of non-membrane-bound packed lamellae arranged in concentric patterns resembling fingerprints.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.label: Spheroid bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003450.definition: An accumulation of myofilamentous material within individual muscle fibers, forming usually round but occasionally elongated bodies ranging from 2 to 15 pm in size. The so-called spheroid bodies stain green with the modified trichrome preparation and are mainly present in the periphery of type 1 muscle fibers, where they may occupy large sectors sharply demarcated from the remainder of the cross-sectioned muscle fiber.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.label: Abnormal muscle tissue enzyme activity or level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.definition: Any deviation from the normal activity or histological staining of an enzyme in muscle tissue, usually measured in a muscle biopsy specimen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.label: Reduced muscle aconitase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.definition: Diminished activity of the enzyne aconitase in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.label: Transitional-cell carcinoma of the ureter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.definition: A cancer of the ureter that most often arises in the distal third of the ureter and is often diagnosed during the sixth and seventh decades of life. The most common presentation is gross hematuria or flank pain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.label: Increased circulating Interferon-alpha concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.definition: An elevation in the concentration of interferon alpha measured in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.label: Liver hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.definition: A benign (noncancerous) tumorlike malformation made up of an abnormal mixture of cells and tissues that originates in the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.label: Ameloblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.definition: Ameloblastoma is a benign odontogenic tumor generally present in the jaw bone. The tumor originates from the residual epithelium of the tooth germ, epithelium of odontogenic cysts stratified squamous epithelium and epithelium of the enamel organ.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.label: Ameliorated by ketogenic diet
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by following a ketogenic diet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.label: Pretibial hyperpigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.definition: Darkening of the area of skin that overlies the shin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.label: Muscle fiber fuchsinophilic inclusion bodies
