http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003451.definition: The presence of inclusion bodies within the cytoplasm of muscle cells that react positively with acid fuchsin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Esophageal myenteric plexus degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: Deterioration of the cells of the myenteric plexus (also known as the Auerbach plexus) located between the layers of the muscular propria of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Periorificial hyperkeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: Scaling and overgrowth of horny tissue of the skin surrounding body orifices (including peri-auricular, peri-oral, peri-anal areas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Eosinophilic lymph node infiltration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: Presence of an elevated number of eosinophils in a lymph node (usually as demonstrated by lymph node biopsy).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Blood parasite
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: Detection of a parasitic organism in the blood stream. Blood parasites include malaria plasmodia, microfilaria species, trypanosomes (the causative agents of African sleeping sickness and South American Changas disease) and the causative agents of schistosomiasis of the bladder and the intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Bloodstream trypomastigotes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: Presence of trypomastigote parasites in the blood stream. This finding can be demonstrated by the identification of trypomastigote parasites on peripheral blood smear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Adamantinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: A primary low-grade, malignant bone tumor that is predominantly located in the mid-portion of the tibia. Histologically, classic adamantinoma is a biphasic tumor characterized by epithelial and osteofibrous components that may be intermingled with each other in various proportions and differentiating patterns.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Abnormal enzyme activity in muscle tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: Deviation from the normal activity of an enzyme in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Reduced muscle phosphoglycerate kinase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: Reduced activity of phosphoglycerate kinase (PGK) in muscle tissue. PGK is a glycolytic enzyme that catalyses one of the two ATP-producing reactions in the glycolytic pathway, through the conversion of 1,3-bisphosphoglycerate to 3-phosphoglycerate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Reduced fibroblast type III procollagen synthesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: Diminished production of type III procollagen by cultured skin fibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.label: Reduced muscle myoadenylate deaminase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003452.definition: Diminished activity of the enzyme myoadenylate deaminase. Myoadenylate deaminase is the muscle isoform of adenosine monophosphate (AMP) deaminase and catalyzes the deamination of AMP to inosine monophosphate and ammonia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Bent long bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: A developmental defect of a long bone, such as the femur or the humerus, characterized by a sharply curve deviation located in the metaphysis (shaft) of the bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Tracheal rupture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: A break or tear in the trachea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Increased myocardial glycogen content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: Elevated amount of glycogen in the myocardium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Triggered by monoamine oxidase inhibitor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to a monoamine oxidase inhibitor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Triggered by serotonin reuptake inhibitor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to a serotonin reuptake inhibitor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Ameliorated by acetazolamide
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with acetazolamide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Ameliorated by exposure to medication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with a medication. Terms in this subhierarchy are intended to be used for cases in which the fact that a manifestation of a disease responds to a specific treatment can be used in the differential diagnosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Ameliorated by vitamin B12
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with vitamin B12.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Ameliorated by thiamine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with thiamine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.label: Ameliorated by dantrolene
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003453.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with dantrolene.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Ameliorated by biotin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with biotin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Reduced bone-marrow megakaryocyte size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: Decreased in average size (diameter) of megakaryocytes in the bone marrow. Megakaryocyte diameter can be assessed as using automated cellular imaging systems.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Hairshafts with longitudinal grooves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: Long narrow depressions running lengthwise in hairshafts. This feature can be appreciated by scanning electron microsopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Mycobacterium bacteremia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: Presence of viable mycobacteria in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Decreased delta-aminolevulinate dehydratase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: Reduced activity of the enzyme delta-aminolevulinate dehydratase. The enzyme is active in erythrocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Elevated circulating pancreatic secretory trypsin inhibitor activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: Increased activity of the enzyme pancreatic secretory trypsin inhibitor in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Presence of uterus in 46,XY individual
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: A developmental anomaly in which an individual with an X chromosome and a Y chromosome (usually 46,XY) has a uterus. The uterus and Fallopian tubes are derived from the Müllerian duct and thus this phenotype is generally also associated with the presence of Fallopian tubes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Intraluminal meconium calcification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: Deposition of calcium in meconium present in the internal cavity of the fetal bowel. This manifestation may be the result of any distal intestinal obstruction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Portal vein hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: A developmental defect characterized by underdevelopment of hte portal vein.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.label: Adrenal leiomyoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003454.definition: Adrenal leiomyoma is a rare, benign solid tumor that develops from the smooth muscle of the adrenal vein and its tributaries

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Small intestinal lymphoplasmacytic infiltrate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: Infiltration of the wall of the small intestine by lymphocytes and mature plasma cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Triggered by neuroleptic medication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to neuroleptic (also known as antipsychotic) medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Abnormal peroxisomal morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: Structural anomaly of peroxisomes, which are small, membrane-enclosed metabolic organelles with roles in the metabolism of complex lipids and reactive ionic species.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Absence of peroxisomes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: Lack of observable peroxisomes. This feature can be observed by immunohistochemical staining of cultured cells (such as fibroblasts) or by electronmicroscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Paucity of peroxisomes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: Reduced number of observable peroxisomes per cell. This feature can be observed by immunohistochemical staining of cultured cells (such as fibroblasts) or by electronmicroscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Reduced sulfide:quinone oxidoreductase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: Reduced activity of the enzyme sulfide:quinone oxidoreductase, which typically is measured in a biopsy specimen from liver or muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Deficit at segmental level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: Refers to distribution of neurological deficits that corresponds to a deficit of a specific spinal segment and all segments below it.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Rhabdoid tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: Rhabdoid tumors are rare aggressive malignancies in infants and young children with a poor prognosis. The most common anatomic localizations are the central nervous system, the kidneys, and other soft tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Rhabdoid tumor of the ovary
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: A highly aggressive, extremely rare neoplasm of the ovary that is usually seen in children. The term rhabdoid is used because the tumor cells resemble rhabdomyoblasts but lack myogenic markers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.label: Cardiac rhabdoid tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003455.definition: A rare and aggressive neoplasms developing mainly in the kidney but also in cerebral and extra-cerebral tissues and rarely in the heart. Histologically, rhabdoid renal and extrarenal tumors share common characteristics. The cells are polygonal, with eccentric, vesicular nuclei and prominent nucleoli, eosinophilic cytoplasmic inclusions. The tumors have an infiltrative growth pattern, necrosis, and high proliferative index. The immunohistochemistry tools of investigation facilitate differential diagnosis by showing loss of INI-1 expression, usually accompanied by germline mutations of the SMARCB1 gene. When INI-1 is still expressed in the affected tissues, a rhabdoid tumor with SMARCA4 mutations should be considered.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Malignant rhabdoid tumor of the bladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: A rhabdoid tumor (a rare aggressive malignancies in infants and young children with a poor prognosis) originating in the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Malignant rhabdoid tumor of liver
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: A malginant rhabdoid tumor (MRT) originating in the liver. MRT are best characterized by the presence of round or polygonal cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm, typical eosinophilic perinuclear inclusions, vesicular nuclei and prominent nucleoli. Immunohistochemical expression of vimentin and epithelial markers and lack of staining for S-100, myoglobin and desmin are commonly found, but are non-specific.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Malignant rhabdoid tumor of muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: A malginant rhabdoid tumor (MRT) originating in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Neck teratoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: A teratoma located in the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Kidney teratoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: A teratoma located in a kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Elevated urinary 5-amino-4-imidazolecarboxamide-riboside level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: Increased amount of 5-amino-4-imidazolecarboxamide(AICA)-riboside in the urine. AICA-riboside is the dephosphorylated counterpart of AICAR, an intermediate of de novo purine biosynthesis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Aplasia of posterior communicating artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: A developmental anomnaly characterized by the lack of development of the posterior communicating artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Optic pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: A developmental anomaloy characterized by congenital excavation of the optic nerve head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Ameliorated by naloxone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with naloxone, an opioid antagonist.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.label: Ameliorated by pyridoxal phosphate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003456.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by ingestion of pyridoxal phosphate (activated vitamin B6).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.label: Thickened intrahepatic portal venules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.definition: Increased width of the vascular wall of portal venules within the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.label: Ovarian fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.definition: Excessive proliferation of fibroblasts and deposition of extracellular matrix within the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.label: Pigment incontinence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.definition: A process in which melanosomes (melanin granules) are deposited in the dermis. The dermal melanosomes are observed to be mainly in macrophages. This phenomenon of pigmentary incontinence usually follows an inflammatory process with the basic feature of basal cell damage, such as in lichen planus, lupus erythematosus, Riehl's melanosis, incontinentia pigmenti (Bloch-Sulzberger), and fixed drug eruption. Incontinence of pigment, or dropping off of epidermal melanin into the dermis, frequently produces a clinically recognizable and characteristic slate-gray pigmentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.label: Reduced epidermal keratin 10 protein expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.definition: Amount of keratin 10 in the epidermis below the lower limit of normal. The findiong is typically ascertained by immunofluorescent microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.label: Reduced epidermal collagen IV protein expression
Reduced epidermal bullous pemphigoid antigen 1 protein expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.definition: Lower than normal amount of bullous pemphigoid antigen 1 (BP230) in the epidermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003457.label: Reduced epidermal collagen VII protein expression
Reduced epidermal collagen XVII protein expression
Reduced epidermal integrin alpha6beta4 protein expression

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.label: Bloodstream Trypanosoma cruzi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.definition: Presence of Trypanosoma cruzi in the blood stream. Trypanosoma cruzii is the etiological agent of Chagas disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.label: Abnormal lymph node cell composition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.definition: A deviation from the normal distribution of cell types or their relative proprotions in a lymph node.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.label: Lipid-laden lymph node macrophages
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.definition: Lymph node with increased numbers of macrophages heavily laden with lipids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.label: Cochlear nerve hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.definition: A developmental defect characterized by underdevelopment of the cochlear nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.label: Glutathionuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.definition: Level of glutathione in the urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.label: Nevus psiloliparus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.definition: Nevus psiloliparus is a rare fatty tissue nevus that is a marker for encephalocraniocutaneous lipomatosis, a neurocutaneous syndrome with ocular and central nervous system anomalies. Clinically, nevus psiloliparus is often described as a congenital alopecia and appears as an irregularly shaped, circumscribed area of alopecia on the scalp. Histopathology demonstrates a near-complete absence of mature hair follicles with preservation of arrector pili muscles and mature adipocytes within the dermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.label: Crypt hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.definition: Crypt hyperplasia denotes elongation of the length of the crypts of Lieberkuhn, a process that initially precedes villous atrophy. Elongation may be caused by expansion of the lamina propria as a result of the proliferation of stromal cells, an influx of inflammatory cells and tissue remodelling.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.label: Increased circulating dehydroepiandrosterone-sulfate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003458.definition: Concentration of dehydroepiandrosterone-sulfate in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Abnormal circulating thyroxine-binding globulin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of thyroxine-binding globulin (TBG) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Decreased circulating thyroxine-binding globulin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: A reduction from the normal concentration of thyroxine-binding globulin (TBG) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Elevated circulating beta-aminoisobutyric acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: An increased concentration of beta-aminoisobutyric acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Elevated circulating dihydrouracil concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: An increased concentration of dihydrouracil in the blood circulation. Dihydrouracil is an intermediate in the catabolism of uracil that is also known as 5,6-dihydrouracil.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Elevated circulating dihydrothymine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: An increased concentration of dihydrothymine in the blood circulation. Dihydrouracil is an intermediate in the catabolism of thymine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Elevated circulating N-carbamyl-beta-alanine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: An increased concentrationof N-carbamyl-beta-alanine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Elevated ciculating 5-hydroxymethyluracil concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: An increased concentration of 5-hydroxymethyluracil in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Decreased CSF creatinine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: Concentration of creatinine in the cerebrrospinal fluid below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Elevated urinary creatine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: An increased amount of creatine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.label: Decreased circulating biotin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003459.definition: Concentration of biotin in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Elevated circulating thrombopoietin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Concentration of thrombopoietin in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. Thrombopoietin is a glycoprotein hormone produced by the liver and kidney that stimulates the production and differentiation of megakaryocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Decreased circulating C1q concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Concentration or activity of the C1q protein in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal. C1q is the first component of the classical pathway and is composed of the C1qA chain, C1qB chain, and C1qC chain, which are encoded by C1qA, C1qB, and C1qC genes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein A-II concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Concentration of apolipoprotein A-II below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Elevated circulating CA19-9 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Concentration of CA19-9 above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Elevated circulating DOPA concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Concentration of DOPA (3,4-dihydroxyphenylalanine) in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Elevated CSF DOPA concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Concentration of DOPA (3,4-dihydroxyphenylalanine) in the cerebrospinal fluid above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Elevated circulating porphyrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Concentration of porphyrins or of a specific porphryin above the upper limit of normal. The most commonly tested circulating porphyrins are coproporphyrin, protoporphyrin, and uroporphyrin. Normally protoporphyrin is present in the highest concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Decreased circulating 17-hydroxyprogesterone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Concentration of 17-hydroxyprogesterone in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Decreased circulating transcobalamin II concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Concentration of transcobalamin II in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.label: Polychromasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003460.definition: Increased variation in the color of the erythrocytes (red blood cells), including pale red, normal or dark colors, indicating a highly variable hemoglobin concentration. Typically this indicates the release of immature erythrocytes in states of anemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Decreased circulating myo-inositol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Concentration of myo-inositol in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Elevated circulating arabitol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Concentration of arabitol in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Elevated urine arabitol level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Amount of arabitol in the urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Elevated urine erythritol level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Amount of erythritol in the urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Elevated circulating erythritol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Concentration of erythritol in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Reduced circulating matrix metalloproteinase 2 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Concentration of matrix metalloproteinase 2 in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Abnormal circulating coenzyme concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Concentration of a coenzyme (an organic molecule that binds to the active sites of an enzyme to promote the catalysis of a reaction) is above or below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Elevated circulating S-adenosyl methionine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Concentration of S-adenosyl methionine (SAM) in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. SAM is a cosubstrate involved in methyl group transfers, transsulfuration, and aminopropylation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Abnormal circulating membrane cofactor protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Concentration of membrane cofactor protein in the blood circulation outside the limits of normal. Membrane cofactor protein (MCP, CD46) is a cell surface complement regulatory protein which acts as a cofactor for the factor I-mediated cleavage of the activated complement components C3b/C4b.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.label: Decreased circulating membrane cofactor protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003461.definition: Concentration of membrane cofactor protein in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Elevated circulating membrane cofactor protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Concentration of membrane cofactor protein in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Hepatic xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Lipid deposits localized within the liver. Xanthomas are benign but are often an important visible sign of systemic conditions such as familial hypercholesterolemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Adrenal xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Lipid deposits localized within the adrenal gland. Xanthomas are benign but are often an important visible sign of systemic conditions such as familial hypercholesterolemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Splenic xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Lipid deposits localized within the spleen. Xanthomas are benign but are often an important visible sign of systemic conditions such as familial hypercholesterolemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Spinal cord xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Lipid deposits localized within the spinal cord. Xanthomas are benign but are often an important visible sign of systemic conditions such as familial hypercholesterolemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Brain xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Lipid deposits localized within the brain. Xanthomas are benign but are often an important visible sign of systemic conditions such as familial hypercholesterolemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Pulmonary xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Lipid deposits localized within the lung. Xanthomas are benign but are often an important visible sign of systemic conditions such as familial hypercholesterolemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Bone marrow xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Lipid deposits localized within the bone marrow. Xanthomas are benign but are often an important visible sign of systemic conditions such as familial hypercholesterolemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Lymph node xanthomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Lipid deposits localized within one or more lymph nodes. Xanthomas are benign but are often an important visible sign of systemic conditions such as familial hypercholesterolemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.label: Xanthoma of bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003462.definition: Xanthoma of bone is an exceedingly rare benign primary bone tumor histologically characterized by mononuclear macrophage-like cells, abundant foam cells, and multinucleated giant cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Ameliorated by folinic acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with folinic acid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Triggered by succinylcholine anesthetic
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to a succinylcholine anesthetic such as suxamethonium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Exogenous androgen exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: History of having been treated with an exogenous androgen medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Reduced muscle enolase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: Diminished activity of the enzyme enolase in muscle tissue. The enzyme enolase catalyzes the interconversion of 2-phosphoglycerate and phosphoenolpyruvate. In adult human muscle, over 90% of enolase activity is accounted for by the beta-enolase subunit, the protein product of the ENO3 gene.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Dopamine antagonist exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: History of having been treated with a dopamine antagonist including metaclopramide, phenothiazine; haloperidol, chlorpromazine, promethazine, prochlorperazine, ziprasidone, and quetiapine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Muscle fiber granulofilamentous inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: The presence of inclusion bodies within the cytoplasm of muscle cells that contain a mxiture of granules and filaments.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Bone marrow myeloid vacuolization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: Formation of vacuoles (a space within a cell that is empty of cytoplasm, lined with a membrane, and filled with fluid) in the cytoplasm of myeloid precursors in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Pulmonary cylindroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: A cylindroma located in the lung. Cylindromas are well-circumscribed, smooth, pale pink nodular tumors, often with arborizing vessels visible. The tumors are slow growing and vary in size from a few millimeters to over 5 mm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Colonic fibrinopurulent exudate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: Fluid visible on the colonic surface containing fibrin, inflammatory cells, and cellular debris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.label: Bloodstream microfilaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003463.definition: Presence of filaria in the blood stream. Filariasis is a common cause of elephantiasis in Coastal Districts of India. The initial manifestations are repeated episodes of fever with chills and rigor, lymphadenopathy which gradually progress to elephantiasis. In India filarial infestation is commonly caused by W. bancrofti and Brugia malayi, the former responsible for almost 98 percent of all cases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Skin infectious agent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: The presence of an infectious agent in the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Dermal microfilaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: Presence of filariae in the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Dermal papillary IgA deposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: Accumulation of immunoglobulin A (IgA) surrounding dermal papillae, which are specialized cells that support the hair follicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Dermal immune complex deposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: Accumulation of antigen-bound antibody in the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Abnormal liver metabolite concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: The concentration of a metabolite in the liver is above or below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Hepatic polyglucosan accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: Intracellular accumulation of polyglucosan bodies-containing amylopectinlike polysaccharide-in the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Urinary bladder neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) located in the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Synovial granuloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: An aggregation of macrophages (forming in response to chronic inflammation) localized in the lining of a joint (synovium).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Elevated urine fumaric acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: The concentration of fumaric acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.label: Elevated urine N-acetylaspartic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003464.definition: Amoutn of N-acetylaspartate high in the urine above upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Elevated urine suberylglycine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: Level of suberylglycine in urine above upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Elevated urine phenylpropionylglycine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: Level of phenylpropionylglycine in urine above upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Elevated urine octenedioic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: The concentration of octenedioic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Monocarboxylic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: Level of a monocarboxylic acid in the urine above the upper limit of normal. A monocarboxylic acid is an oxoacid containing one carboxy group.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Elevated urine octanoic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: Amount of octanoic acid in the urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Elevated urine glutaconic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: The concentration of glutaconic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Elevated urine 3-hydroxyglutaric level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: The concentration of 3-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Elevated urine malonic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: The concentration of malonic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Elevated urine propionylglycine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: Amount of propionylglycine in the urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.label: Elevated urine tiglylglycine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003465.definition: Amount of tiglylglycine in the urine above upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Elevated urine 2-methylacetoacetic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: Amount of 2-methylacetoacetic acid in the urine above upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Elevated urine 3-hydroxypropionic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: Amount of 3-hydroxypropionic acid in the urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Elevated urine 2-methylcitric acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: Amount of 2-methylcitric acid in the urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Elevated urine 4-hydroxyisovaleric acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: Amount of 4-hydroxyisovaleric acid in urine above upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Elevated urine 2-hydroxy-3-methylvaleric acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: Amount of 2-hydroxy-3-methylvaleric acid in the urine above the upper limit of normal. 2-Hydroxy-3-methylpentanoic acid or 2-hydroxy-3-methylvaleric acid (HMVA) is an organic acid generated by L-isoleucine metabolism.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Shoulder contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the shoulder joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Shoulder extension contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: Lack of the full expected passive range of flexion of the shoulder joint (Shoulder flexion puts the arms from a resting position at one's sides to straight above the head; thus, with shoulder extension contracture it is not possible to raise the arms above the head fully).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Thumb extension contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: Movement in the sagittal plane that increases the angle of the thumb joint (straightens the joint); motion involving posterior bending of the vertebral column or returning to the upright position from a flexed position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Tongue myxoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: A myxoma (benign soft tissue neoplasm characterized by the presence of spindle and stellate cells, lobulated growth pattern, and myxoid stroma formation) localized in the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.label: Abnormal knee morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003466.definition: A structural abnormality of the knee joint or surrounding structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.label: Abnormal knee physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.definition: A functional anomaly of the knee joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.label: Knee contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.definition: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the knee joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.label: Knee extension contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.definition: A type of knee joint contracture in which the knee lacks full expected flexion, such that the upper and lower leg cannot be brought together.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.label: Abnormal ankle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.definition: A structural anomaly of the ankle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.label: Abnormal ankle physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.definition: A functional anomaly of the ankle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.label: Toe joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.definition: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of a toe joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.label: Extension contracture of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003467.definition: A type of toe joint contracture in which the joint lacks full expected flexion, so that the two bony segments on either side of their connecting joint cannot be brought together.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.label: Finger joint contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.definition: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of a finger joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.label: Extension contracture of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.definition: A type of finger joint contracture in which the joint lacks full expected flexion, so that the two bony segments on either side of their connecting joint cannot be brought together.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.label: Reduced muscle telethonin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.definition: Amount of telethonin protein expression in muscle tissue below lower limit of normal. Telethonin is a 19-kDa sarcomeric protein, localized to the Z-disc of skeletal and cardiac muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.label: Abnormal enzyme concentration or activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.definition: Concentration or activity of an enzyme is above or below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.label: Abnormal liver enzyme activity or concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.definition: Concentration or activity of an enzyme is above or below the limits of normal in liver tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.label: Reduced hepatic urocanase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.definition: Activity of urocanase in the liver below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.label: Impaired cerebroside sulfate hydrolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.definition: Reduced hydrolysis (splitting of a bond and the addition of the hydrogen anion of water) of the sulfuric ester linkage in the molecule of cerebroside sulfate, possibly leading to accumuation of cerebroside sulfate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.label: Reduced peroxisomal glutaryl-CoA oxidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.definition: Diminished enzyme activity of peroxisomal glutaryl-CoA oxidase, an enzyme that metabolizes glutaryl-CoA (a metabolite of L-lysine, L-hydroxy-lysine and L-tryptophan) by dehydrogenation to glutaconyl-CoA directly followed by decarboxylation of this to crotonyl-CoA.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.label: Reduced sterol 27-hydroxylase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003468.definition: Diminished activity of the enzyme sterol 27-hydroxylase, which participates in the degradation of cholesterol to bile acid. Sterol 27-hydroxylase catalyzes the first step in the normal oxidation of the steroid side chain, converting cholesterol, as well as different 7a-hydroxylated cholesterol metabolites, to 27-oxygenated steroids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.label: Reduced short-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.definition: Diminished activbity of the enzyme Short-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase (SCAD), a key enzyme of fatty acid beta-oxidation that catalyses the first step in mitochondrial beta-oxidation of fatty acids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.label: Reduced 3-phosphoglycerate dehydrogenase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.definition: Diminished activity of the enzyme 3-phosphoglycerate dehydrogenase (PGDH), which catalyzes the first step in the pathway by converting D-3-phosphoglycerate (PGA), an intermediate in glycolysis, to phosphohydroxypyruvate concomitant with the reduction of NAD+.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.label: Reduced hepatic methionine adenosyltransferase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.definition: Activity of methionine adenosyltransferase in the liver below the lower limit of normal. Note that there are multiple methionine adenosyltransferase isoezymes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.label: Substantia nigra dopaminergic neuron loss
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.definition: Degeneration and loss of neruons in the substantia nigra of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.label: Intramuscular lipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.definition: A lipoma that is located within a muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.label: Cutaneous telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.definition: Dilated blood vessels on the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.label: Abnormal aromatase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.definition: Aromatase activity outside of the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.label: Elevated aromatase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003469.definition: Enzyme activity of aromatase above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Reduced aromatase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: Enzyme activity of aromatase below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Corneal amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: A form of amyloidosis that is located in the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Abnormal keratinocyte morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: Any structural anomaly of the keratinocyte. The keratinocyte is the major cell type of the epidermis and is responsible for generating the protective barrier.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Keratinocyte vacuolization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: Increased number of vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles that areempty of cytoplasm, lined with a membrane, and filled with fluid) in keratinocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Parotid gland adenocarcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the parotid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Pulmonary vasculitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: Cellular inflammation, vessel destruction, and tissue necrosis of the blood vessels of the lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Reduced hepatic D-glycerate kinase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: Activity of D-glycerate kinase in the liver below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Lymph-node hemophagocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: Phagocytosis of erythrocytes, lymphocytes or other hematopoietic precursors by histiocytes or macrophages in a lymph node.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Superior pubic ramus hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: Underdevelopment of the upper branch of the pubis bone (inferior pubic ramus).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.label: Uterine adenofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003470.definition: A rare benign mullerian mixed tumor of the uterus composed of benign epithelial and mesenchymal components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Pulmonary hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: A benign malformation of the lung that includes an abnormal mixture of tissue components such as cartilage, epithelium, fat, or muscle which are common to the lung but without preservation of the organ architecture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Peripheral axonal distension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: An abnormal histological finding characterized by an increase in the cross-section area of peripheral nerve axons (up to 20-25 micrometers in diameter).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Decreased circulating alpha-mannosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: Concentration or activity of alpha mannosidase below the lower limit of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Abnormal hepatocyte morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: A structural anomaly of the hepatocyte, which is the main cell type that makes up the liver perncyhma. Hepatocytes are usually binucleated and appear as sheets in the liver tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Hepatic melanin-like lysosomal pigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: Accumulation of dark, coarsely granular pigment localized in lysosomes of centrilobular hepatocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Reduced uroporphyrinogen decarboxylase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: Activity of the enzyme uroporphyrinogen decarboxylase (UROD; EC 4.1.1.37) below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Reduced heme oxygenase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: Activity of the enzyme heme oxygenase below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Swollen achromatic neurons in the cerebral cortex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: The presence of enlarged and swollen neurons that lack Nissl bodies (the rough endoplasmic reticulum-achromasia refers to neurons that lack Nissl bodies) in the cortex of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Vacuolated hepatocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: Presence of vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles that areempty of cytoplasm, lined with a membrane, and filled with fluid) in hepatocytes, which normally rarely contain vacuoles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.label: Lack of oocyte pronucleus formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003471.definition: An abnormality of oocyte maturation characterized by the inability of oocytes to form pronuclei after in vitro fertilization procedures. Oocytes normally show two pronuclei 17 to 20 hours after in vitro insemination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.label: Self-healing squamous epithelioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.definition: A type of skin tumor that initially presents as a reddish macule and subsequently becomes papular, enlarged, ulcerated and ultimately heals leaving pitted scars.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.label: Elevated circulating pristanic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.definition: Concentration of pristanic acid in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.label: Sarcoplasmic bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.definition: Rounded or oval structures that appeared brown on hematoxylin and eosin and red on the modified Gomori trichrome stain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.label: Reduced CSF cystine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.definition: Concentration of cystine in the cerebrospinal fluid below the lower limit of normal. Cystine is sulfur-containing amino acid obtained by the oxidation of two cysteine molecules which are then linked via a disulfide bond.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.label: Abnormal circulating beta-mannosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.definition: Activity of the enzyme beta-mannosidase outside normal limits. Beta-mannosidase is a lysosomal enzyme that catabolizes oligosaccharides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.label: Elevated circulating beta-mannosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.definition: Activity of the enzyme beta-mannosidase above the upper limit of normal. Beta-mannosidase is a lysosomal enzyme that catabolizes oligosaccharides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.label: Reduced circulating alpha-L-fucosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.definition: Activity of the enzyme alpha-L-fucosidase below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.label: Abnormal circulating alpha-L-fucosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.definition: Activity of the enzyme alpha-L-fucosidase in the blood circulation outside the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.label: Elevated circulating alpha-L-fucosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003472.definition: Activity of the enzyme alpha-L-fucosidase above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Elevated circulating S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: Increased concentration of S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Elevated circulating S-adenosyl-L-methionine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: Concentration S-adenosyl-L-methionine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Exercise-triggered malignant hyperthermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: Malignant hyperthermia that is characterized by exercise-induced life-threatening hyperthermia with a body temperature over 40 degrees C and signs of encephalopathy ranging from confusion to convulsions or coma. Incidence increases with rising ambient temperature and relative humidity. Manifestations may include rhabdomyolysis (presenting with myalgia, muscle weakness, and myoglobinuria), tachycardia, and in severe cases multiorgan failure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Anesthesic-triggered malignant hyperthermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: Malignant hyperthermia that is characterized by a rapid increase in temperature to 39-42 degrees C in response to inhalational anesthetics such as halothane or to muscle relaxants such as succinylcholine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Elevated CSF argininosuccinic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: Concentration of argininosuccinic acid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Elevated CSF aspartylglucosamine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: Concentration of aspartylglucosamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Elevated circulating alpha-oxoadipic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: Concentration of alpha-oxoadipic acid in the blood above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Abnormal erythrocyte metabolite concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: A deviation from the normal range of a metabolite in red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Reduced erythrocyte glutathione concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: Concentration of glutathione in red blood cells below the lower limit of normal. Glutathione (GSH) is an important redox active biomolecule critical in the maintenance and regulation of cellular and organismal health.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.label: Elevated CSF sarcosine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003473.definition: Concentration of sarcosine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: Reduced CSF methionine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: Concentration of methionine in the cerebrospinal fluid below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: Elevated circulating homoarginine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: Concentration of homoarginine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: Elevated urinary formiminoglutamic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: The concentration of formiminoglutamic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: Elevated CSF proline concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: Concentration of proline in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: Elevated urinary S-sulfocysteine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: Level of S-sulfocysteine high in urine above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: Elevated circulating S-sulfocysteine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: Concentration of S-sulfocysteine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: Sertoli cell hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: Abnormal increase in the number of Sertoli cells in the testis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: CSF infectious agent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: The presence of an infectious agent in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: CSF mycobacteria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: Mycobacterium present in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). This feature can be ascertained by CSF microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.label: Fungal bloodstream infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003474.definition: Detection of a fungal organism (such as candida or coccidioides) in the blood stream.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Supraclavicular lymphadenopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: Enlarged lymph node located just above the clavicle (collarbone).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Inguinal lymphadenopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: Enlarged lymph node located in the inguinal region (groin).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Axillary lymphadenopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: Enlarged lymph node located in the axillary region (armpit).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Positive Murphy sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: Murphy's sign is elicited in patients with acute cholecystitis by asking the patient to take in and hold a deep breath while palpating the subcostal region. In practice, Murphy's sign is performed by palpating the subcostal region during inspiration. If pain is elicited and the patient suddenly stops their inspiratory effort, a positive Murphy's sign has been elicited.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Bilious emesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: Vomiting whereby the vomit has the color of bile, yellowish-green.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Ameliorated by NSAID
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Fetal exposure history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to a medication or other substance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Fetal barbiturate exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to barbiturate medications such as phenobarbital. Barbiturates are used medically as anxiolytics, hypnotics, and anticonvulsants.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Fetal narcotic exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to narcotic medications such as morphine or codeine. Narcotics are used medically to treat moderate or severe pain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.label: Ameliorated by ethosuximide
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003475.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by administration of ethosuximide. Ethosuximide is most often used to treat absence seizures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Reduced epidermal extracellular matrix protein 1 protein expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: Lower than normal amount of extracellular matrix protein 1 (ECM1) in the epidermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Neurofibroma by anatomical location
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: Neurofibroma categorized according to the anatomical site of origin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Tongue neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) localized in the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Cardiac neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) localized in the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Gastric neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) localized in the stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Renal neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) localized in the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Muscle fiber polyglucosan inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: Accumulation of a poorly branched and poorly spherical amylopectin-like glycogen (polyglucosan) in muscle fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Abnormal rete ridge morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: Abnormal structure of the rete ridges (also known as rete pegs), which are downward projections of epithelium surrounding the connective tissue papillae in between the dermal papillae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Rete ridge elongation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: Increased length of the rete rdiges of the epidermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.label: Pulmonary Langerhans cell histiocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003476.definition: Accumulation of monoclonal CD1a-positive Langerhans cells in the bronchioles and alveolar interstitium that can cause damage to the lungs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.label: Lumbar hypolordosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.definition: Flattening of a curve in the spine in the lumbar (lower back) region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.label: Battle sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.definition: Battle sign is bruising over the mastoid process that is typically the result of head trauma. It is retroauricular or mastoid ecchymosis that is typically the result of head trauma. Battle sign typically requires significant head trauma and may indicate significant internal injury to the brain and not just the posterior cranial vault or mastoid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.label: Decreased skull base length
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.definition: Reduced anterioposterior dimension of the skull base.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.label: Oscillopsia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.definition: A visual disturbance in which objects in the visual field appear to oscillate (jump, jiggle, vibrate).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.label: Decreased blink rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.definition: The frequency with which the eye is blinked is below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.label: Abnormal blink rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.definition: A deviation from the normal frequency of blinking the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.label: Elevated blink rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.definition: The frequecy with which the eye is blinked is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.label: Maternal hyperthyroidism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.definition: The mother of a fetus or index patient has a history of hyperthyroidism during the corresponding pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.label: Perineal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003477.definition: Applies to an abnormality that affects the perineum (the region of skin between the genitals and the anus).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.label: Gadolinium exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.definition: History of exposure to gadolinium, a contrast medium often used for magnetic resonance imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.label: Purulent parotid gland drainage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.definition: Excretion of pus (purulent discharge) from the opening of the parotid duct.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.label: Obstipation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.definition: Obstipation is the inability to pass either stool or flatus (gas).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.label: Vasculitis by anatomical site
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.definition: Vasculitis categorized according to the anatomical site where the finding is localized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.label: Vasculitis by histology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.definition: Vasculitis categorized according to type of histological abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.label: Leukocytoclastic vasculitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.definition: A type of vasculitis characterized by the presence of debris of neutrophils within the blood vessel walls.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.label: Accumulation of lipid droplets in small-bowel enterocytes
Pericardial friction rub
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003478.definition: A pericardial friction rub is a grating, to-and-fro sound that occurs in phase with the heart sounds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.label: Abnormal muscle succinate dehydrogenase staining
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.definition: Any deviation from the normal amount of staining of succinate dehydrogenase in skeletal muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.label: Small intestinal hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.definition: A benign (noncancerous) tumorlike malformation made up of an abnormal mixture of cells and tissues that originates in the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.label: Pyriform sperm head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.definition: Pyriform spermatozoa consist of a normally shaped acrosomal structure which can be normal in size or enlarged, while the post-acrosomal region shows severe elongation and an acute narrowing to the posterior end, ending in about the same thickness as the connecting mid-piece.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.label: Excess residual spermatozoal cytoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.definition: Excess residual cytoplasm is associated with abnormal spermatozoa produced from a defective spermiation process. This abnormal excess cytoplasm should not be confused with more physiological cytoplasmic residues that can be observed in direct microscopy of the ejaculate but not in dried, fixed and stained morphology smears.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.label: Cardiomyocyte hyaline bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.definition: Subsarcolemmal, eosinophilic glass-like regions within the cytoplasm of cardiomyocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.label: Hepatic hemophagocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.definition: Phagocytosis of erythrocytes, lymphocytes or other hematopoietic precursors by histiocytes or macrophages observed in the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.label: CSF hemophagocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.definition: Phagocytosis of erythrocytes, lymphocytes or other hematopoietic precursors by histiocytes or macrophages observed in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.label: Splenic hemophagocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003479.definition: Phagocytosis of erythrocytes, lymphocytes or other hematopoietic precursors by histiocytes or macrophages observed in the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Urinary bladder granulomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: The presence of multiple granulomas in the urinary bladder as based on pathological examination. Granulomas are small 0.5 to 2 mm collections of modified macrophages called epithelioid cells usually surrounded by lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Epidermal necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: Death of keratinocytes in the epidermis layer of the skin, which generally manifests as extensive exfoliation (separation of the epidermis from the underlying dermis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Exacerbated by flexion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is aggravated by (or made more painful by) bending of a limb or joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Hemolacria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: The presence of blood in tears.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Corneal foreign body sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: A perception that an object is in contact with the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Buttock pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the buttock (round fleshy area at the lower rear area of a human trunk).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Vaginal foreign body sensation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: A perception that an object located in the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: Attacks of breathlessness that occur at night and may awaken the sleeping patient.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Eyelid pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.label: Abnormal sperm physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003480.definition: Abnormality of a sperm function including protection of paternal DNA, traversing the female reproductive tract, oocyte localisation, penetration of the zona pellucida, oocyte activation and centriole deposition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Small acrosomal area
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: Reduction in size of the acrosome below the lower limit of normal. The acrosome is a unique membranous organelle located over the anterior part of the sperm nucleus. According to the World Health Organization criteria, the acrosome must be clearly visible, comprising approximately 40-70 percent of the sperm head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Bent sperm flagella
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: The proportion of sperm cells whose flagella is sharply curved or has a sharp angle is above normal limits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Spermiation failure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: Spermiation failure is indicated by apparently normal spermiogenesis, but the presence of retained Sd2 spermatids in stages III-V of human spermatogenesis, whereas maturation arrest is indicated by a lack of late Sd1 and Sd2 spermatids in the epithelium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Hypospermatogenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: A morphological abnormality visible upon biopsy of the germinal epithelium of the testis in which the cellularity of the germinal epithelium is reduced in general, so that all stages of germ cells (spermatogonia, spermatocytes, and spermatids) are present but reduced in number. This term applies to biopsies with some tubules showing diminished amounts of qualitatively complete spermatogenesis in combination with a vast majority of tubules that lack germ cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Conjunctival membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: Formation of a sheet of tissue by coagulum of exudate over the conjunctiva of the eye that if removed leaves behind a denuded bleeding surface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Extreme oligozoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: A type of oligozoospermia characterized by a total number of more than zero but less than 2 million sperm in the ejaculate or a concentration of more than zero but less than one million sperm per milliliter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Mild oligozoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: A type of oligozoospermia characterized by a total number of more than 30 but less than 39 million sperm in the ejaculate or a concentration of more than 10 but less than 15 million sperm per milliliter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Moderate oligozoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: A type of oligozoospermia characterized by a total number of more than 10 but less than 29 million sperm in the ejaculate or a concentration of more than 5 but less than 10 million sperm per milliliter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Severe oligozoospermia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: A type of oligozoospermia characterized by a total number of more than 2 but less than 10 million sperm in the ejaculate or a concentration of more than 1 but less than 5 million sperm per milliliter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.label: Iris nodule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003481.definition: The presence of a nodule (small rounded lump of tissue) in the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.label: Koeppe nodules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.definition: A type of iris nodule consisting of inflammatory cell precipitates which lie at the pupillary margin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.label: Bussaca nodules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.definition: A type of iris nodule consisting of inflammatory cell precipitates which lie on the iris surface.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.label: Decreased CSF copper concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.definition: Concentration of copper in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.label: Diffuse pulmonary lymphoid hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.definition: Diffuse lymphoid hyperplasia (DLH) describes the pathological entity that lies between follicular bronchiolitis and lymphocytic interstitial pneumonia (LIP). It is pathologically characterized by a diffuse peribronchiolar proliferation of hyperplastic lymphoid follicles (BALT), extended along the lymphatics to involve the interlobular septa and pleura. Unlike LIP, DHL does not show uniform involvement of the alveolar septa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.label: Ameliorated by steroid medication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by treatment with a steroid medication such as prednisone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.label: Triggered by medication exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by administration of a medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.label: Triggered by levothyroxin exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by administration of levothyroxin (thyroid hormone).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.label: Reduced muscle laminin alpha-2 chain staining
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.definition: A decreased amount of laminin alpha-2 chain in muscle tissue. This feature can be shown by immunohistochemistry or Western blotting of muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.label: Adrenal cortical sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003482.definition: Abnormal thickening of of the outer layer (cortex) of the adrenal gland due to fibrosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Reduced hepatic fructose-1,6-phosphate aldolase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: Concentration or activity of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in liver tissue below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Pancreatic hamartoma
