http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: A benign (noncancerous) tumorlike malformation made up of an abnormal mixture of cells and tissues that originates in the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Liver angiomyolipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: A benign liver neoplasm composed of fat, vascular, and smooth muscle elements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Cardiac lipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: A lipoma that is located within a the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Peripheral nerve polyglucosan inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: Accumulation of a poorly branched and poorly spherical amylopectin-like glycogen (polyglucosan) in peripheral nerve fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Cardiac polyglucosan accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: Accumulation of a poorly branched and poorly spherical amylopectin-like glycogen (polyglucosan) in myocardial tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Cystic nephroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: A benign cystic neoplasm of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Absent dermal elastic fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: Elastic fibers not demonstrable in skin biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Cleavage at junction of stratum corneum and stratum granulosum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: Splitting of the skin (cell-cell adhesion of keratinocytes) localized to the interface betweem the stratum corneum and stratum granulosum layers of the epidermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.label: Lymphoid hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003483.definition: An abnormal bone marrow finding characterized by many poorly circumscribed and occasionally confluent lymphoid nodules. The nodules contain small and uniform lymphocytes with rounded nuclei, clumped chromatin, and without prominent nucleoli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Absence of epidermal lamellar bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: Lack of lamellar bodies (LBs) inthe epidermis. LBs are specialized organelles that contain pro-barrier lipids imparting a fully lamellar internal structure, but also other cargoes such as enzymes (lipid metabolizing and proteolytic), enzyme inhibitors, and antimicrobial peptides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Gastrointestinal granulomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: The presence of multiple granulomas in the gastrointestinal tract (Pylorus, esophagus, jejunum, ileum, cecum, rectum, perirectal area, esophagus) as based on pathological examination. Granulomas are small 0.5 to 2 mm collections of modified macrophages called epithelioid cells usually surrounded by lymphocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Enlarged sperm head vacuole
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: Increased size of sperm vacuoles, which are surface concavities typically located at the the tip or middle area of sperm heads. According to the WHO Laboratory Manual for the Examination and Processing of Human Semen, sperm head vacuoles are considered abnormal when exceeding 20% of the cross-sectional area of the head. Vacuoles are found in almost all samples with normal sperm morphology; this term applies if the proportion of sperm with abnormally large vacuoles is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Ureteral hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: A benign (noncancerous) tumorlike malformation made up of an abnormal mixture of cells and tissues that originates in the ureter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Fetal methimazole exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to methimazole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Fetal procarbazine exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to procarbazine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Fetal fluorouracil exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to fluorouracil.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Fetal cytarabine exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to cytarabine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Fetal tetracycline exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to tetracycline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.label: Fetal quinine exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003484.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to quinine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Fetal cyclophosphamide exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to cyclophosphamide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Fetal metronidazole exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to metronidazole.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Fetal phenobarbital exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to phenobarbital.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Fetal phenytoin exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to phenytoin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Periumbilical
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance are located at or near the umbilicus (belly button).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Maternal obesity during pregnancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: A history of obesity, which can be defined as a body mass index of 30 or greater, in the mother of a fetus or index patient.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Maternal amniocentesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: A history of amniocentesis having been performed in the mother of a fetus or index patient.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Typified by highly variable age of onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: Description of conditions in which age of onset is highly variable even in family members who share the same disease-associated variant or variants.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Abnormal leukocyte enzyme concentration or activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: Concentration or activity of an enzyme as measured in leukocytes is above or below the limits of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.label: Reduced leukocyte beta-glucuronidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003485.definition: Concentration or activity of an beta-glucuronidase as measured in leukocytes is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Reduced leukocyte alpha-L-fucosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Concentration or activity of an alpha-L-fucosidase as measured in leukocytes is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Reduced leukocyte arylsulfatase B activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Concentration or activity of an arylsulfatase B as measured in leukocytes is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Reduced leukocyte steroid sulfatase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Concentration or activity of an arylsulfatase C as measured in leukocytes is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Reduced leukocyte arylsulfatase A activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Concentration or activity of the lysosomal enzyme arylsulfatase A (EC 3.1.6.8) as measured in leukocytes is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Decreased alpha-galactosidase A activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Activity of the enzyme alpha-galactosidase outsidebelow the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Positive fecal parasite test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Demonstration of parasite in stool specimen, e.g., Parasites present on wet mount of stool.e

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Positive stool infectious agent test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Any kind of test for an infectious agent in stool positive.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Positive stool giardia antigen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Test for giardia antigen in stool such as immune assay or DFA positive.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Entamoeba histolytica antibody positive in stool
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Demonstration of antibody directed against Entamoeba histolytica in stool.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.label: Reduced erythrocyte free porphyrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003486.definition: Concentration of porphyrin in erythrocytes below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Reduced circulating urocanic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: The concentration of urocanic acid in the blood circulation is below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Decreased urinary epinephrine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: The concentration of epinephrine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Decreased CSF epinephrine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: Concentration of epinephrine in the cerebrospinal fluid below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Decreased circulating epinephrine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: Concentration of epinephrin in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Decreased circulating norepinephrine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: Concentration of norepinephrin in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Decreased urinary norepinephrine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: The concentration of norepinephrine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Decreased urinary metaepinephrine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: The concentration of metanephrine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Decreased CSF metanephrine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: Concentration of metanephrine in the cerebrospinal fluid below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Decreased circulating metanephrine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: Concentration of metanephrin in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.label: Ovarian mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003487.definition: A swelling or enlargment localized to the ovary. The word mass is usually used at an early stage of the diagnostic workup before the precise nature of the swelling has been determined.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Adrenal mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: A swelling or enlargment localized to the adrenal gland. The word mass is usually used at an early stage of the diagnostic workup before the precise nature of the swelling has been determined.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Uterine mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: A swelling or enlargment localized to the uterus. The word mass is usually used at an early stage of the diagnostic workup before the precise nature of the swelling has been determined.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Prostatic calculus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: Calcium deposits in the prostate gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Decreased portal vein velocity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: A reduction in the velocity of portal venous flow, generally measured by Doppler ultrasound. Portal venous flow is normally towards the liver with peak systolic velocities in the range of 20-40 cm/s.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Uterine cervix mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: A swelling or enlargment localized to the cervis of the uterus. The word mass is usually used at an early stage of the diagnostic workup before the precise nature of the swelling has been determined.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Abnormal urinary uromodulin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: The concentration of uromodulin (also known as Tamm Horsfall protein) in the urine, normalized for usine concentration, is outside the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Decreased urinary uromodulin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: The concentration of uromodulin (also known as Tamm Horsfall protein) in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Increased urine phenylacetylglutamine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: The concentration of phenylacetylglutamine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Decreased urine guanidinoacetic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: The concentration of guanidinoacetic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.label: Positive urine infectious agent nucleid acid test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003488.definition: Detection of DNA and RNA originating from an infectious agent (bacteria, viruses, parasites and fungi) in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: Positive CMV urine nucleic acid test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: Detection of Cytomegalovirus (CMV) nucleic acid in the urine by a method such as polymerase chain reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: Positive Neisseria gonorrhoeae urine nucleic acid test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: Detection of Neisseria gonorrhoeae nucleic acid in the urine by a method such as polymerase chain reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: Positive enterovirus urine nucleic acid test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: Detection of enterovirus nucleic acid in the urine by a method such as polymerase chain reaction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: Elevated brain glycine level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: An increase in the level of glycine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: Elevated brain polyol compounds by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: An increase in the level of polyol compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: Elevated brain gamma-aminobutyric acid by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: An increase in the level of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: History of recent anticoagulant ingestion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: Medical history of ingestion of anticoagulants prior to presentation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: Decreased circulating antidiuretic hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: Concentration of antidiuretic hormone, also known as vasopressin, is below the lower limit of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: Elevated circulating growth hormone-releasing hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: Concentration of growth hormone-releasing hormone above the upper limit of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.label: Abnormal amniotic fluid protein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003489.definition: Any deviation of the concentration of a protein in the amniotic fluid from normal limits

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Decreased amniotic fluid alpha-fetoprotein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of alpha-fetoprotein in the amniotic fluid below lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Increased circulating vitamin E concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of vitamin E in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Abnormal circulating calcitonin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of calcitonin, a 32-amino acid polypeptide hormone that is produced primarily by the parafollicular cells of the thyroid, in the blood circulation outside of normal limits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Decreased circulating calcitonin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of calcitonin, a 32-amino acid polypeptide hormone that is produced primarily by the parafollicular cells of the thyroid, in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Decreased circulating thyrotropin releasing hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of thyrotropin releasing hormone below the lower limit of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Elevated circulating uroporphyrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of uroporphyrin in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Increased urine pentacarboxylporphyrin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of pentacarboxylporphyrin in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Increased urine hexacarboxylporphyrin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of hexacarboxylporphyrin in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Increased circulating dehydroepiandrosterone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of dehydroepiandrosterone in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.label: Increased erythrocyte coproporphyrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003490.definition: Concentration of coproporphyrin in erythrocytes above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Increased erythrocyte uroproporphyrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: Concentration of uroproporphyrin in erythrocytes above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein E concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: Concentration of apolipoprotein E below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Elevated circulating apolipoprotein E concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: Concentration of apolipoprotein E above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Acrosomal hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: Reduction in the size of the acrosome of the head of spermatozoa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Oocyte maturation arrest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: Oocyte maturation arrest (OMA) can manifest as failed in vitro fetilization/intracytoplasmic sperm injection (IVF/ICSI) attempts using affected oocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Abnormal anus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: A structural anomaly of the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Abnormal anus physiology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: A functional anomaly of the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Weak anal sphincter tone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: Reduced muscle tone of the sphincter of the anus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Reduced muscle 2,4-dienoyl-CoA reductase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: Diminished activity of the enzyme 2,4-dienoyl-CoA reductase in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.label: Reduced liver 2,4-dienoyl-CoA reductase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003491.definition: Diminished activity of the enzyme 2,4-dienoyl-CoA reductase in liver tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Nasal mucosa vasculitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: Inflammation of blood vessels in the mucosa of the nasal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Pituitary blastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: Pituitary blastoma is a distinctive anterior hypophyseal tumor of infants

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Peripheral axon spheroid formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: Axonal spheroids are bubble-like biological features that form on most degenerating axons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Reduced liver carboxylesterase 1 activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: Activity of the enzyme carboxylesterase 1 in liver tissue below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Abnormal dermis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: A structural anomaly of the dermis, the layer of skin that lies beneath the epidermis and above the subcutaneous layer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Perivascular dermis hyaline deposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: Deposition of a largely amorphous hyaline (transparent and homogeneous) substance around blood vessels in the dermis layer of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Perivascular small intestinal hyaline deposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: Deposition of a largely amorphous hyaline (transparent and homogeneous) substance around blood vessels in the wall of the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Large keratohyaline granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: Abnormally large keratohyalin granules (KHG). KHG are typically present in the stratum granulosum of the epidermal layer of the skin (and epithelium of the mucosae). KHG are protein structures found in the keratinocytes of the stratum granulosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Decreased muscle lipoic acid content
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: Reduced amount of lipoic acid in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.label: Reduced hepatic cystathionine gamma-lyase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003492.definition: Activity of cystathionine gamma-lyase in the liver below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Digestive system neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the digestive system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Lumbar spondylosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: Arthrosis, i.e., of degenerative joint disease, affecting the lumbar vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Decreased circulating acid maltase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: Activity of the enzyme acid maltase (also known as alpha-1,4-glucosidase) below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Increased circulating ribitol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: The concentration of ribitol in the blood circulation is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Abnormal circulating 7-dehydrocholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: Concentration of 7-dehydrocholesterol in the blood circulation outside the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Decreased circulating 7-dehydrocholesterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: Concentration of 7-dehydrocholesterol in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Elevated circulating lathosterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: Concentration of lathosterol in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Elevated circulating desmosterol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: Concentration of desmosterol in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Decreased circulating sialic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: Concentration of sialic acid in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.label: Purulent synovial fluid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003493.definition: The synovial fluid (also known as synovia, i.e., the fluid found in the cavities of synovial joints) contains increased quantities of white blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Muscle fiber calsequestrin 1-containing inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: The presence of inclusion bodies within the cytoplasm of muscle cells that demonstrate immunoreactivity for calsequestrin 1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Palatine myxoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: A myxoma (A benign tumor composed of myxomatous tissue composed of loosely-arranged spindle, polygonal, and stellate cells) localized to the palate. Clinically, such tumors may present as a sessile nodule on the hard palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Vaginal myxoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: A myxoma (tumor of primitive connective tissue) localized in the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Decreased dermal collagen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: Abnormally reduced amount of collagen fibers in the dermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Irregularly shaped keratohyaline granules
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: Abnormal shape of keratohyaline granules in dermal keratinocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Tubular shadows
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: Tubular shadows are characterised by a complete absence of cells in the testicular tubules, meaning that germ cells as well as somatic Sertoli cells are absent. The cells have been replaced by hyalinization.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Multiple eyelid margin cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: Presence of many apocrine hidrocystoma (cysts) on the margins of the eyelids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Altered location of the longitudinal column in the fibrous sheath
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: The fibrous sheath is a structure in the midpiece of the sperm flagellum surrounding the outer dense fibers. It comprises two longitudinal columns and tranverse ribs. In case of altered location of the longitudinal column in the fibrous sheath the symmetrical structure is lost, most commonly with the columns not being opposite to each other, which can be visualised by electron microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Uterine myxoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: A myxoma (tumor of primitive connective tissue) localized to the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.label: Uterine cervix myxoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003494.definition: A myxoma (tumor of primitive connective tissue) localized to the the cervix of the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.label: Typified by complete penetrance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.definition: Penetrance describes the proportion of genotype positive individuals that develop disease given a lifespan of 80 years. For example, penetrance of Neurofibromatosis type 1 is close to 100%.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.label: Osteochondromyxoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.definition: A rare benign chondroid and osteoid matrix-producing neoplasm of bone characterized by extensive myxoid changes. OMX originate from bony cortices and have been observed in the nasal region, as well as the tibia and radius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.label: Gangliocytoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.definition: A low-grade central nervous system tumor composed of dysplastic ganglion cells, usually presenting in children or young adults and located in the cerebral hemispheres.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.label: Duodenal gastrinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.definition: A gastrinoma, a neuroendocrine tumors characterized by the secretion of gastrin with resultant excessive gastric acid production, that is localized to the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.label: Bone marrow eosinophilia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.definition: Count of eosinophils in the bone marrow above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.label: Exacerbated by lithium exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by treatment with lithium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.label: Reduced hepatic glycogen debrancher enzyme activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.definition: Activity of glycogen debrancher enzyme (also known as amylo-1,6-glucosydase, 4-alpha-glucantransferase) in liver tissue below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.label: Asymmetrical insertion of the midpiece into the head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.definition: Insertion of the neck and midpiece into the head of a spermatozoon on an axis that diverges from the midline axis of the spermatozoon head. This term applies if the proportion of spermatozoa with this defect is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.label: Bent sperm neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003495.definition: Sharply angled insertion of the neck and midpiece into the head of a spermatozoon. This term applies if the proportion of spermatozoa with this feature is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Elevated urine 3,6-epoxydicarboxylic acid level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: The concentration of 3,6-epoxydicarboxylic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Gallbladder biliary sludging
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: Presence of biliary sludge (a mixture of particulate solids that have precipitated from bile) in the gallbladder. Such sediment consists of cholesterol crystals, calcium bilirubinate pigment, and other calcium salts. Sludge is usually detected on transabdominal ultrasonography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Exacerbated by amiodarone exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by treatment with amiodarone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Ureteral mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: A swelling or enlargment localized to the ureter. The word mass is usually used at an early stage of the diagnostic workup before the precise nature of the swelling has been determined.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Wide cavum septum pellucidum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: Width of the cavum septum pellucidum above the upper limit of normal, which is defined as a separation of greater than one cm of the leaves of the cavum septum pellucidum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Hypoplastic trochlear nerve
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: Underdevelopment of the trochlear nerve, which is the fourth cranial nerve and one of the ocular motor nerves that controls eye movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Thymic cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: A closed sac of tissue (cyst) located in the thymus. Thymic cysts are a rare, benign anomaly, are usually asymptomatic, and mostly occur in the anterior mediastinum .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Uterine cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: A closed sack of tissue (cyst) located in the uterus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Urinary bladder mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: A swelling or enlargment localized to the urinary bladder. The word mass is usually used at an early stage of the diagnostic workup before the precise nature of the swelling has been determined.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.label: Endosteal scalloping
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003496.definition: A series of indentations or erosions on a normally smooth margin of the inner layer of the cortex (i.e. the endosteum) of bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Urinary bladder hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: A benign (noncancerous) tumorlike malformation made up of an abnormal mixture of cells and tissues that originates in the urinary bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Peritoneal mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: A swelling or enlargment localized to the peritoneal cavity. The word mass is usually used at an early stage of the diagnostic workup before the precise nature of the swelling has been determined.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Fallopian tube mass
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: A swelling or enlargment localized to the Fallopian tube. The word mass is usually used at an early stage of the diagnostic workup before the precise nature of the swelling has been determined.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Aplasia of the pyramids of the medulla oblongata
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: Congenital absence of the pyramids, that is, of the paired structures located at the medial aspect of the ventral medulla that flank the anterior median fissure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Bathrocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: A deformity of the posterior skull with bulging of the midportion of the occipital bone that is often associated with a benign variant of the mendosal suture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Occipital horn
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: Downward pointing exostoses of the occipital bone situated in the tendinous insertions of the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Absent pituitary stalk
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: A developmental defect characterized by failure to develop of the pituitary stalk. The pituitary stalk, also known as the infundibulum or infundibular stalk, is the connection between the hypothalamus and the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Abnormal pituitary stalk morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: A structural anomaly of the pituitary stalk, also known as the infundibulum or infundibular stalk, is the connection between the hypothalamus and the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Interrupted pituitary stalk
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: A developmental defect characterized by a discontinuity of the pituitary stalk. The pituitary stalk, also known as the infundibulum or infundibular stalk, is the connection between the hypothalamus and the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.label: Facial synkinesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003497.definition: Unintentional movement in one area of the face produced during intentional movement of another area of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.label: Synkinesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.definition: Unintentional movement in one area of the body produced during intentional movement of another area of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.label: Perianal anethesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.definition: Loss of sensation to the area of buttocks, perianal space and thighs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.label: Phenylephrine does not induce blanching of eye redness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.definition: Instillation of 2.5% phenylephrine drops into the eye does not induce blanching of eye redness. Failure to blanch suggests redness caused by scleral vessel engorgement (e.g., scleritis) or extravascular cause (e.g., hemorrhage), not episcleritis or conjunctivitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.label: Fetal alcohol exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.definition: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to ethanol (alcohol).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.label: Reduced cellular cobalamin uptake
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.definition: Diminished ability of cells to transport cobalamine from the extracellular space to the cytoplasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.label: Focal necrotic brainstem lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.definition: A localized area of cell death, often accompanied by infiltration of inflammatory cells, in the brainstem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.label: Focal necrotic optic nerve lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.definition: A localized area of cell death, often accompanied by infiltration of inflammatory cells, in the optic nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.label: Focal necrotic thalamus lesion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.definition: A localized area of cell death, often accompanied by infiltration of inflammatory cells, in the thalamus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.label: Interstitial dermal edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003498.definition: Accumulation of fluid in the interstitial spaces of the skin. This finding can be appreciated my microscopic examination of a skin biopsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.label: Shoulder external rotation contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.definition: A type of shoulder contracture characterized by decreased internal rotation of shoulder, that is, by a chronic reduction in active and passive ability to internally rotate the humerus at the shoulder joint (if the arm is flexed at the elbow, Internal rotation of the shoulder rotates the forearm towards the center of the body).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.label: Thumb adduction contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.definition: A type of thumb contracture characterized by a chronic reduction in active and passive ability of the metacarpal-phalangeal and/or interphalangeal joints of the thumb to bring from medial side to neutral position, where the neutral position for the thumb is when the distal and proximal segments of the thumb joint are in linear alignment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.label: Reduced hepatic fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.definition: Activity of fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase (EC 3.1.3.11) in the liver below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.label: Reduced hepatic carbamoylphosphate synthetase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.definition: Activity of carbamoylphosphate synthetase in the liver below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.label: Reduced intraepidermal small nerve fiber density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.definition: Reduced number of small nerve fibers in the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.label: Femoral artery duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.definition: A developmental defect characterized by the presence of a supernumerary femoral artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.label: Intracellular accumulation of collagen VII
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003499.definition: Collagen VII is the major molecular constituent of anchoring fibrils in the skin. Collagen VII is synthesized as three identical pro-alpha1(VII) polypeptide chains, which are hydroxylated and glycosylated in a coordinated manner and then fold into triple-helical procollagen VII in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). Mature collagen VII undergoes a multistep fibril polymerization process to form the anchoring fibrils. Mutant pro-alpha1(VII) polypeptide chains or procollagen VII molecules do not pass the ER quality control and are retained in the ER or designated for ubiquitin-proteasome degradation resulting in reduced amounts of collagen VII in the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Reduced reticular lamina anchoring fibril density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: Diminished amount of the anchoring fibrils in the basement membrane zone that normally attach the epithelium to the basement membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Reduced lamina lucida anchoring filament density
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: Diminished amount of the anchoring filaments that normally bridge the lamina lucida and insert into the lamina densa in the cutaneous basement membrane zone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Reduced epidermal keratin 5 protein expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: Amount of keratin 5 in the epidermis below the lower limit of normal. The findiong is typically ascertained by immunofluorescent microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Reduced epidermal keratin 14 protein expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: Amount of keratin 14 in the epidermis below the lower limit of normal. The findiong is typically ascertained by immunofluorescent microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Reduced epidermal keratin protein expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: Amount of one or more keratins in the epidermis below the lower limit of normal. The findiong is typically ascertained by immunofluorescent microscopy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Reduced hepatic alanine-glyoxylate aminotransferase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: Activity of alanine-glyoxylate aminotransferase in the liver below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Hepatic sinusoidal dilatation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: Presence of an increased amount of blood in the hepatic capillaries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Thin spermatozoon midpiece
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: The cross-sectional size (diameter) of the midpiece of the spermatozoon is below the lower limit of normal. This term applies if the proportion of spermatozoa with this defect is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Thick spermatozoon midpiece insertion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: Increased width of the midpiece of the spermatozoon. The midpiece is the structure that is located between the head and the flagella (tail) of the spermatozoon. This term applies if the width of the midpiece increases progressively from the flagella to the head and if the proportion of individual spermatozoa with this anomaly is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.label: Shoulder adduction contracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003500.definition: A type of shoulder contracture characterized by a chronic reduction in the active and passive ability to abduct the shoulder. This results in the shoulders being closer to midline. The affected individual is not able to position the shoulders away from the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.label: Occupational exposure history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.definition: Exposure to a substance that results from the performance of an employee's duties.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.label: Occupational silver exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.definition: A history of exposure to silver that has occured in relation to performance of job duties.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.label: Abnormal femoral artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.definition: Any structural abnormality of the femoral artey, a large blood vessel that provides oxygenated blood to lower extremity structures and in part to the lower anterior abdominal wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.label: Extrahepatic bile duct fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.definition: Accumulation of fibrous connective tissue (collagen) in the extrahepatic bile ducts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.label: Elevated circulating short-chain acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.definition: Concentration of short-chain acylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. Acylcarnitines are classified according to the number of carbon atoms in the acyl-chain. Short chain acylcarnitines have between two and five carbon atoms in the acyl-chain (C2-C5),

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.label: Elevated circulating C4 acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.definition: Concentration of C4 acylcarnitines in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. C4 acylcarnitines have a four-carbon acyl chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.label: Elevated circulating medium-chain acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.definition: Concentration of medium-chain acylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. Acylcarnitines are classified according to the number of carbon atoms in the acyl-chain. Medium-chain acylcarnitines have between six and twelve carbon atoms in the acyl-chain (C6-C12),

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.label: Elevated circulating long-chain acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.definition: Concentration of long-chain acylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. Acylcarnitines are classified according to the number of carbon atoms in the acyl-chain. Long-chain acylcarnitines have between thirteen and twenty carbon atoms in the acyl-chain (C13-C20),

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.label: Elevated circulating C5 acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003501.definition: Concentration of C5 acylcarnitines in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. C5 acylcarnitines have a five-carbon acyl chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating C18 acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of C18 acylcarnitines in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. C18 acylcarnitines have a eighteen-carbon acyl chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating C16 acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of C16 acylcarnitines in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. C16 acylcarnitines have a sixteen-carbon acyl chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating very long-chain acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of very long-chain acylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. Acylcarnitines are classified according to the number of carbon atoms in the acyl-chain. Very long-chain acylcarnitines have twentyone or more carbon atoms in the acyl-chain (C21 and higher),

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating acetylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of acetylcarnitine (C2 acylcarnitine) in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. Acetylcarnitine has a two-carbon acyl chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating methylmalonylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of methylmalonylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating 3-hydroxyhexadecanoylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of 3-hydroxyhexadecanoylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating C6 acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of C6 acylcarnitines in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. C6 acylcarnitines have a six-carbon acyl chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating methylglutarylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of methylglutarylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating 3-hydroxyisovalerylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of 3-hydroxyisovalerylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.label: Elevated circulating 3-hydroxyhexanoylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003502.definition: Concentration of 3-hydroxyhexanoylcarnitine (C6-OH) in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003503.label: Elevated circulating carnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003503.definition: Concentration of carnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003503.label: Elevated circulating tiglylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003503.definition: Concentration of tiglylcarnitine (C5:1) in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003503.label: Reduced circulating acetylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003503.definition: Concentration of acetylcarnitine (C2 acylcarnitine) in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal. Acetylcarnitine has a two-carbon acyl chain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003503.label: Reduced circulating octadecenoylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_003503.definition: Concentration of octadecenoylcarnitine (C18:1 acylcarnitine) in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004000.label: Absent pigmentation of chest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004000.definition: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the chest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004000.label: Hyperparakeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004000.definition: Abnormal keratinization of the epidermal stratum coreum (horny layer) with increased keratin formation, preservation of the nuclei in the superficial cells, and absence of the stratum granulosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004001.label: Chromosome breakage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004001.definition: Elevated rate of chromosomal breakage or interchanges occurring either spontaneously or following exposure to various DNA-damaging agents. This feature may be assayed by treatment of cultured lymphocytes with agents such as chemical mutagens, irradiation, and alkylating agents.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004001.label: Increased activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004002.label: obsolete Radial deviation of the thumb

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004003.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fifth metatarsal bone
Abnormality of the second metatarsal bone
Abnormality of the fourth metatarsal bone

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004004.label: Toenail onycholysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004004.definition: Painless and spontaneous separation of a toenail from the nail bed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004004.label: Aplasia of the eccrine sweat glands
Hypoplasia of the eccrine sweat glands
obsolete Aplasia of the left hemidiaphragm
Macular edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004004.definition: Thickening of the retina that takes place due to accumulation of fluid in the macula as a nonspecific response to blood-retinal barrier breakdown. Macular edema is a common pathological response to a wide variety of ocular insults, most commonly after intraocular (e.g. cataract) surgery or in association with retinal vascular (e.g. diabetic eye disease, retinal vein occlusion) or inflammatory (e.g. uveitis) disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004006.label: obsolete Abnormal morphology of bones of the upper limbs
obsolete Abnormal morphology of bones of the lower limbs

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004007.label: Abnormal morphology of ulna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004007.definition: Any structural anomaly of the ulna, a bone of the forearm the extends from the elbow to the little finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004007.label: obsolete Abnormal concentration of calcium in blood

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.label: Abnormal circulating creatine kinase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.definition: Any deviation from the normal circulating creatine kinase concentration.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.label: Happy demeanor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.definition: A conspicuously happy disposition, characterized by frequent smiling and laughing, which may be contextually inappropriate or unrelated to the situation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.label: obsolete Toe walking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.definition: Toe walking is a pattern of walking in which a person walks on balls of his or her feet, with no contact between the heels and ground. Toe-walking is common in children who are learning to walk, but most children outgrow it around the age of two years. This term refers to the persistance of toe-walking beyond the usual age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.label: Abnormal circulating renin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of renin in the blood, a central hormone in the control of blood pressure and various other physiological functions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.label: Abnormal blood folate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of folate in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.label: Abnormal lymphocyte count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.definition: Any abnormality in the total number of lymphocytes in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.label: Abnormal natural killer cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004008.definition: Any deviation from the normal overall count of natural killer (NK) cells in the circulation or a deviation from the normal distribution of NK cell subtypes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004009.label: Abnormality of the tympanic membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004009.definition: An abnormality of the tympanic membrane

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004009.label: Asymmetry of the size of ears
Asymmetry of the shape of the ears
Asymmetry of the position of the ears
Neoplasm of the outer ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004009.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the outer ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004009.label: Neoplasm of the inner ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004009.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the inner ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004009.label: Neoplasm of the ceruminal gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004009.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ceruminal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004010.label: Cutaneous atresia of the external auditory canal
Osseous atresia of the external auditory canal
Cutaneous stenosis of the external auditory canal
Osseous stenosis of the external auditory canal

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004011.label: Absence of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle
Abnormal Eustachian tube morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004011.definition: A structural anomaly of the Eustachian tube (ET). The ET is a biomechanical valve between the nasopharynx and the middle ear. Physiologically, it controls the passive adaptation of the middle ear air pressure to the ambient air pressure primarily via direct muscular actions of the soft palate. In the closed state it protects the middle ear. Inadequate function of the ET causes middle ear ventilation disorders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004012.label: Abnormality of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle
Abnormality of the acoustic reflex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004012.definition: An abnormality in the reflexive contraction of the middle-ear muscles in response to sound stimulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004012.label: Impairment of the the acoustic reflex
Impairment of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle
Abnormal vitamin B12 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004012.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of cobalamin (vitamin B12) in the blood. Vitamin B12 is one of the eight B vitamins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004012.label: Abnormal sweat homeostasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004012.definition: An abnormality of the composition of sweat or the levels of its components.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.label: Abnormal circulating ferritin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.definition: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of ferritin. Ferritin concentration can be measured in serum or plasma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.label: Abnormal transferrin saturation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.definition: Any abnormality in the serum transferrin saturation, which is calculated by dividing the serum iron level by total iron-binding capacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.label: Comedonal acne
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.definition: A type of acne in which open and closed comedones comprise the majority of the lesions, with substantially fewer papules and pustules.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.label: Mucinous histiocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.definition: Multiple subcutaneous non-fragile and skin-coloured papules characterized by interstitial infiltrate of spindle and epithelioid histiocytes, and mucin. There are well circumscribed aggregates of epithelioid histiocytes and mucin in the upper and middle dermis,with the histiocytes arranged between collagen bundles and separated from the epidermis by a Grenz zone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.label: Lipogranulomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004013.definition: Yellow nodules of lipoid material are deposited in the skin and mucosae. This gives rise to granulomatous reactions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.label: Reduced 5-oxoprolinase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.definition: Decreased level of the reaction 5-oxo-L-proline + ATP + 2 H(2)O = L-glutamate + ADP + 2 H(+) + phosphate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.label: Dystopic os odontoideum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.definition: Os odontoideum is classified into two anatomic types (orthotopic and dystopic). Os odontoideum is defined as an ossicle that consists of smooth and separate caudal portions of the odontoid process. With orthotopic os odontoideum, the ossicle moves with the anterior arch of the atlas, while the dystopic type consists of an ossicle near the basion, or one that is fused with the clivus

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.label: L-2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.definition: An increase in the level of L-2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.label: Cortical myoclonus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.definition: Cortical myoclonus mainly affects the distal upper limbs and face, which reflects the largest cortical representations of these body areas. It is often focal, but may be multifocal, bilateral or generalized, as a consequence of intracortical and transcallosal spreading of abnormal activity. It typically occurs on voluntary action and may affect speech and gait. Cortical myoclonic jerks are stimulus sensitive, typically to touch, but sensitivity to visual stimuli is also described. Most patients with cortical myoclonus have both positive myoclonus and NM, occurring either independently or together as a complex of the two kinds of myoclonus. If cortical myoclonus is prolonged and lasts for hours, days or weeks, it is called epilepsia partials continua and is considered to be a rare form of focal epileptic status. Focal cortical myoclonus almost always points to an underlining lesion of the sensori-motor cortex, which produces hyperexcitability (e.g. vascular, inflammatory or neoplastic).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.label: Woolly scalp hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004014.definition: The presence of woolly hair on the scalp. The term woolly hair refers to an abnormal variant of hair that is fine, with tightly coiled curls, and often hypopigmented. Optical microscopy may reveal the presence of tight spirals and a clear diameter reduction as compared with normal hair. Electron microscopy may show flat, oval hair shafts with reduced transversal diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004015.label: Acne inversa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004015.definition: A chronic skin condition involving the inflammation of the apocrine sweat glands, forming pimple-like bumps known as abscesses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004015.label: Elevated urinary 3-hydroxybutyric acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004015.definition: An increased amount of 3-hydroxybutyric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004015.label: Elevated urinary carboxylic acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004015.definition: An increased amount of carboxylic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004016.label: Orthokeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004016.definition: Formation of an anuclear keratin layer

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004017.label: Abnormality of extrinsic muscle of tongue
Platelet-activating factor acetylhydrolase deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004017.definition: Reduced level of platelet-activating factor acetylhydrolase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004017.label: Abnormal circulating phospholipid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004017.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a phospholipid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.label: Chapped lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.definition: Cracking, fissuring, and peeling of the skin of the lips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.label: Inappropriate sinus tachycardia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.definition: Inappropriate sinus tachycardia is a nonparoxysmal tachyarrhythmia characterized by an increased resting heart rate (HR) and/or an exaggerated HR response to minimal exertion or a change in body posture. HR is constantly above the physiological range with no appropriate relation to metabolic or physiological demands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.label: Maculopapular exanthema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.definition: A skin rash that is characterized by diffuse cutaneous erythema with areas of skin elevation. It may evolve to vesicles or papules as part of a more severe clinical entity. Different degrees of angioedema with involvement of subcutaneous tissue may also appear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.label: Neonatal sepsis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.definition: Systemic inflammatory response to infection in newborn babies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.label: Osteochondrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.definition: Abnormal growth ossification centers in children. Initially a degeneration/ necrosis followed by regeneration or recalcification.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.label: Scaling skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004018.definition: Refers to the loss of the outer layer of the epidermis in large, scale-like flakes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.label: APUdoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.definition: An endocrine tumor arising from an APUD cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.label: Increased head circumference
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.definition: An abnormally increased head circumference in a growing child. Head circumference is measured with a nonelastic tape and comprises the distance from above the eyebrows and ears and around the back of the head. The measured HC is then plotted on an appropriate growth chart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.label: Decreased head circumference
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.definition: An abnormally reduced head circumference in a growing child. Head circumference is measured with a nonelastic tape and comprises the distance from above the eyebrows and ears and around the back of the head. The measured HC is then plotted on an appropriate growth chart. Microcephaly is defined as a head circumference (HC) that is great than two standard deviations below the mean of age- and gender-matched population based samples. Severe microcephaly is defined with an HC that is three standard deviations below the mean.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.label: Mild microcephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.definition: Decreased occipito-frontal (head) circumference (OFC). For the microcephaly OFC must be between -3 SD and -2 SD compared to appropriate, age matched, normal standards (i.e. -3 SD <= OFC < -2 SD).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.label: Encephalomalacia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004019.definition: Encephalomalacia is the softening or loss of brain tissue after cerebral infarction, cerebral ischemia, infection, craniocerebral trauma, or other injury.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Motor impersistence
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: The inability to maintain postures or positions (such as keeping eyes closed, protruding the tongue, maintaining conjugate gaze steadily in a fixed direction, or making a prolonged 'ah' sound) without repeated prompts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Simultanapraxia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: A subset of motor impersistence, defined as the inability to perform more than two of the simple voluntary acts simultaneously, such as closing the eyes and protruding the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Abnormal consumption behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: Recurrent abnormal consumption of food, liquids, or objects that could have negative consequences for the individual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Abnormal CSF neopterin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: Abnormal concentration of neopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Elevated CSF neopterin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: Increased concentration of neopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Decreased CSF neopterin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: Decreased concentration of neopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Abnormal circulating neopterin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of neopterin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Abnormal CSF biopterin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: Abnormal concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Elevated CSF biopterin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: Concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.label: Decreased CSF biopterin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004020.definition: Concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.label: Abnormal circulating biopterin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of biopterin in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.label: Abnormal skin morphology of the palm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.definition: An abnormality of the skin of the palm, that is, the skin of the front of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.label: Risus sardonicus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.definition: Fixed sarcastic grimace and anxious expression. Caused by spasms of the masseter and other facial muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.label: Hypopnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.definition: Hypopnea is referring to breathing that is abnormally shallow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.label: Abnormal circulating insulin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.definition: An abnormal concentration of insulin in the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.label: Hypoinsulinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.definition: A decreased concentration of insulin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.label: Elevated hemoglobin A1c
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.definition: An increased concentration of hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c), which is the product of nonenzymatic attachment of a hexose molecule to the N-terminal amino acid of the hemoglobin molecule. This reaction is dependent on blood glucose concentration, and therefore reflects the mean glucose concentration over the previous 8 to 12 weeks. The HbA1c level provides a better indication of long-term glycemic control than one-time blood or urinary glucose measurements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.label: Reduced natural killer cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.definition: Less than normal number of natural killer cells, a type of lymphocyte in the innate immune system with an ability to mediate cytotoxicity and produce cytokines after the ligation of a germline-encoded activation receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.label: Absent natural killer cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004021.definition: Lack of natural killer cells, a type of lymphocyte in the innate immune system that contains cytoplasmic granzymes, i.e., small granules with perforin and proteases that allow natural killer cells to form pores in the cell membrane of the target cell through which the granzymes and associated molecules can enter, inducing apoptosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.label: Abnormal size of the dental root
Maternal thrombophilia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.definition: An increased tendency towards thrombosis in the mother during a pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.label: Pulmonary hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.definition: Pulmonary hemorrhage is a bleeding within the lungs. Older children and adults may spit blood or bloody sputum. Neonates, infants and young children usually do not spit up blood. Anemia, pulmonary infiltrates, increasingling bloody return on BAL and the presence of hemosiderin-laden macrophages in broncho-alveolar lavage (BAL) fluid or lung biopsy can diagnose lung bleeding. Alveolar macrophages contain phagocytosed red blood cells and stain positive for hemosiderin, a product of hemoglobin degradation, after about 48-72 hours following pulmonary hemorraghe. Previous or recurrent bleeding can thus be distinguished from fresh events. A differentiation into local or diffuse is of importance. Also differentiate if pulmonary hemorrhage is due to a primary lung disorder or a manifestation of a systemic disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.label: Abnormality of fibrinolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.definition: Clincial phenotype characterized by delayed bleeding accelerated break down of blood clot (fibrinolysis)

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.label: Decrease in high molecular weight von Willebrand factor Multimers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.definition: A decrease in high molecular weight von Willebrand factor multimers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.label: Decreased level of heparin co-factor II
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.definition: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of heparin co-factor II

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.label: Decreased level of histidine-rich glycoprotein
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.definition: Decrease of these levels result in increased inhibition of fibrinolysis and reduced inhibition of coagulation

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.label: Decreased level of thrombomodulin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004022.definition: Thrombomodulin is a cofactor in the thrombin induced activation of Protein C. In the case of deficiency there will be less Protein C and tendency to clot

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.label: Decreased level of tissue plasminogen activator
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.definition: The tPA protein catalyzes the conversion of plasiminogen to plasmin, and thus break down of clots. When there is a deficiency there will be an increase of thrombosis

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.label: Delayed onset bleeding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.definition: Abnormal bleeding related to a procedure or trauma which does not start at the time of the initial insult, but after delay by at least 24 hours.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.label: Factor XIII subunit A deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.definition: Deficiency of factor XIII subunit A, leading to a reduced factor XIII activity. Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.label: Factor XIII subunit B deficiency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.definition: Deficiency of factor XIII subunit B, leading to a reduced factor XIII activity. Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.label: Leukocyte inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.definition: The presence of intraceullar inclusion bodies (aggregates of stainable substances, usually proteins) in leukocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.label: Hyperfibrinolysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.definition: Increased degradation of fibrin, associated with clot instability and bleeding

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.label: Impaired binding of factor VIII to VWF
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.definition: Impaired binding of factor VIII to von Willebrand Factor. This is determined using a modified ELISA assay.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.label: Impaired neutrophil chemotaxis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.definition: An impairment of the migration of neutrophils towards chemoattractants as part of the innate immune response

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.label: Increased plasma vitamin K epoxide after vitamin K supplementation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004023.definition: Increased plasma vitamin K epoxide after vitamin K supplementation is present in VKCFD (vitamin K-dependent clotting factor deficiency) type 2, but not in VKCFD type 1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.label: Increased ratio of VWF propeptide to VWF antigen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.definition: An increased VWF propeptide to VWF antigen indicates that deficiency of VWF is not due to impaired synthesis but due to rapid clearance. The VWF propeptide is measured by ELISA.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.label: Increased RIPA
