http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.definition: Increased platelet agglutination in response to low-dose ristocetin

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.label: Prolonged euglobulin clot lysis time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.definition: Abnormally increased length of time required for an in vitro clot to dissolve in the absence of the normal plasmin inhibitors. This test is a clinical assay used to measure fibrinolysis. The euglobulin fraction of plasma is precipitated and used to form clot by addition of thrombin; after clot forms the rate of clot breakdown (fibrinolysis) can be monitored.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.label: Prolonged Russell's viper venom time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.definition: Increased time to coagulation in the Russell's viper venom assay

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.label: Reduced alpha-2-antiplasmin activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.definition: Reduced activity of alpha-2-antiplasmin. This protein inactivates the protease plasmin that drives fibrinolysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.label: Reduced antithrombin antigen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.definition: Reduced antithrombin antigen. A reduced level of antithrombin may lead to an increased risk of thrombus formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.label: Reduced euglobulin clot lysis time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.definition: Abnormally decreased length of time required for an in vitro clot to dissolve in the absence of the normal plasmin inhibitors. This test is a clinical assay used to measure fibrinolysis. The euglobulin fraction of plasma is precipitated and used to form clot by addition of thrombin; after clot forms the rate of clot breakdown (fibrinolysis) can be monitored.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.label: Reduced plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.definition: Reduced activity of plasminogen activator inhibitor 1. This protein down-regulates fibrinolysis in the circulation by inhibiting the two major plasminogen activators: tissue-plasminogen activator and urokinase-plasminogen activator.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.label: Reduced plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 antigen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004024.definition: Reduced level of plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 antigen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.label: Reduced prothrombin antigen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.definition: Reduced prothrombin antigen as measured by ELISA assay. Prothrombin is a vitamin K-dependent coagulation factor that is proteolytically cleaved to form thrombin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.label: Hand dimple
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.definition: A cutaneous indentation resulting from tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.label: Aplastic/Hypoplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the nasopharyngeal adenoids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.label: Abnormal size of nasopharyngeal adenoids
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.definition: A deviation in the size of nasopharyngeal adenoids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.label: Aplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004025.definition: Absence of the nasopharyngeal adenoids as a developmental defect.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.label: Decreased size of nasopharyngeal adenoids
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.definition: An abnormal decrease in the size of nasopharyngeal adenoids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.label: Increased size of nasopharyngeal adenoids
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.definition: An abnormal increase in the size of nasopharyngeal adenoids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.label: Glue ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.definition: Middle ear is filled with glue-like fluid instead of air.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.label: Jaw pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the jaw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.label: Upper limb muscle hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.definition: Abnormal increase in muscle size and mass of one or both arms not due to training.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.label: Recurrent infections of the middle ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004026.definition: Increased susceptibility to middle ear infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of middle ear infections

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.label: Impaired glucose tolerance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.definition: An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral or intravenous administration of glucose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.label: Hyperintensity of MRI T2 signal of the spinal cord
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.definition: A region of high intensity (brightness) observed upon magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans of the spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.label: Adenocarcinoma of the intestines
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.definition: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the intestines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.label: Adenocarcinoma of the small intestine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.definition: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.label: Adenocarcinoma of the large intestine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.definition: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the large intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.label: Prolactinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.definition: A benign tumor (adenoma) of the pituitary gland

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.label: Frequency
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004027.definition: Class to represent frequency of phenotypic abnormalities within a patient cohort.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.label: Obligate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.definition: Always present, i.e. in 100% of the cases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.label: Very frequent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.definition: Present in 80% to 99% of the cases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.label: Frequent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.definition: Present in 30% to 79% of the cases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.label: Occasional
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.definition: Present in 5% to 29% of the cases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.label: Very rare
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.definition: Present in 1% to 4% of the cases.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.label: Abnormal axial muscle morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.definition: A structural anomaly of the muscles of the trunk and head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.label: Nasogastric tube feeding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.definition: The condition of inability to eat normally treated by placement of a thin tube through the nose into the stomach that is then used to carry food.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.label: Cyclic neutropenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004028.definition: Recurrent episodes of abnormally low levels of neutrophils in the body (neutropenia).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004029.label: Abnormal location of the eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004029.definition: Anomalous anatomical placement of the eyebrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004029.label: Preauricular cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004029.definition: Preauricular sinus is an occasional finding and most frequently appears as a small pit close to the anterior margin of the ascending portion of the helix. The opening has also been reported along the postero superior margin of the helix, the tragus or the lobule. Preauricular sinus may lead to the formation of a subcutaneous cyst that is intimately related to the tragal cartilage and the anterior crus of the helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004029.label: Decreased circulating free fatty acid level

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.label: Abnormal circulating free fatty acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a free fatty acid in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.label: Increased urinary glycerol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.definition: An increased concentration of glycerol in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.label: Hyperglycerolemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.definition: Increased concentration of glycerol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.label: Increased male libido
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.definition: Increased desire for sexual activity on the part of a male.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.label: Decreased male libido
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.definition: Reduced desire for sexual activity on the part of a male.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.label: Male sexual dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.definition: A problem occurring during any phase of the male sexual response cycle that prevents the individual from experiencing satisfaction from the sexual activity

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.label: Male anorgasmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004030.definition: Inability of a male to reach orgasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.label: Sterile arthritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.definition: An inflammatory arthritis characterized by purulent synovial fluid with neutrophil accumulation, but with negative cultures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.label: Symmetric polyarthritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.definition: Polyarthritis refers to a joint disease that involves at least five joints. One or more signs of inflammation, including pain, movement restriction, swelling, warmth, and redness, are seen in the joints involved. Polyarthritis is defined as symmetric if at least half of the joints involved are affected in a symmetric (i.e., both right and the left) fashion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.label: Oligoarthritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.definition: A type of arthritis that affects up to four joints in the first six months of disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.label: Blind vagina
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.definition: The vagina ends in a blind pouch or sac rather than being connected to the internal genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.label: Tongue edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.label: Blue urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.definition: An abnormal blue color of the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.label: Red urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.definition: An abnormal red color of the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.label: Dark urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004031.definition: An abnormal dark color of the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.label: Red-brown urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.definition: An abnormal red-brown color of the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.label: Dark yellow urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.definition: An abnormal dark-yellow color of the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.label: Purple urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.definition: An abnormal purple color of the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.label: Eyelid erythema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.definition: Redness of the skin of the eyelids, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.label: Heliotrope rash
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.definition: In a heliotrope rash, the color of the skin turns to violet, which is the color of the heliotrope flower.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.label: Bull's eye rash
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.definition: A cutaneous eruption that consists of multiple (at least two) concentric erythematous rings.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.label: Abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.definition: An abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb (bulbus olfactorius), which is involved in olfaction, i.e. the sense of smell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.label: Focal hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.definition: An abnormal area of increased brightness (hyperintensity) that is limited to one particular area.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.label: Multifocal hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004032.definition: An abnormal area of increased brightness (hyperintensity) that occurs in several distinct areas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004033.label: Confluent hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004033.definition: Areas of brighter than expected MRI signal in the white matter of the brain whereby individual patches run together.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004033.label: Focal hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
Multifocal hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
Confluent hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
Purulent rhinitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004033.definition: Chronic rhinitis accompanied by pus formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.label: Absent neutrophil lactoferrin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.definition: The absence of lactoferrin in neutrophil granules, which could be caused by either an isolated failure of synthesis of this protein (or the production of an antigenically unrecognizable form of lactoferrin) or a complete deficiency of specific granule production.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.label: Neutrophil nuclear clefts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.definition: An abnormality of the nucleus of neutrophils, which presents as either a type I nuclear cleft, where the nuclear cleft may show a transition into a round/oval shape. The second type nuclear cleft, which runs perpendicular to the nuclear surface, and this type of cleft might be related to nuclear lobe formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.label: Low neutrophil alkaline phosphatase
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.definition: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase in neutrophils, which could be due to absence of enzyme or the production of defective enzyme.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.label: Increased neutrophil mitochondria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.definition: An increased number of mitochondria detected in neutrophils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.label: Increased neutrophil ribosomes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.definition: An increased number of ribosomes detected in neutrophils.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.label: Bladder outlet obstruction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.definition: A compression or resistance upon the bladder outflow channel at any location from the bladder neck to urethral meatus, which usually causes lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.label: Decreased expression of GPI-anchored proteins on the cell surface
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004104.definition: A decrease in the protein expression of GPI-anchor proteins, such as CD55 and CD59, at the cell surface, which suggests a defect in GPI-anchor biosynthesis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.label: Renal tubular cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.definition: Tubular lumnal dilatation/prominence lined by simple layer of cuboidal-to-flat tublar epihelial cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.label: Ageusia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.definition: A rare condition that is characterized by a complete loss of taste function of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.label: Agenesis of putamen
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.definition: A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the putamen owing to its failure to develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.label: obsolete Fractured thoracic segment of trunk
Fractured humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.definition: A partial or complete breakage of the humerus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.label: Hot cross bun sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.definition: A cruciform-shaped hyperintensity within the pons found on T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.label: Transient decreased circulating IgG4
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.definition: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.label: Chronic decreased circulating IgG4
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.definition: A lasting decrease of immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.label: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG4
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004105.definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) in the blood, whereby at most trace quantities of IgG4 can be measured.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG4
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A lasting limited decrease of immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Fractured calcaneus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A partial or complete breakage of the calcaneus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Transient decreased circulating IgG2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin G2 (IgG2) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Chronic decreased cirulating IgG2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A lasting decrease of immunoglobulin G2 (IgG2) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Fractured knee
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A partial or complete breakage of the knee.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin G2 (IgG2) in the blood, whereby at most trace quantities of IgG2 can be measured.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A lasting limited decrease of immunoglobulin G2 (IgG2) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Transient decreased circulating IgG1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin G1 (IgG1) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Chronic decreased circulating IgG1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A lasting decrease of immunoglobulin G1 (IgG1) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.label: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004106.definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin G1 (IgG1) in the blood, whereby at most trace quantities of IgG1 can be measured.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: A lasting limited decrease of immunoglobulin G1 (IgG1) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Transient decreased circulating IgG3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin G3 (IgG3) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Chronic decreased circulating IgG3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: A lasting decrease of immunoglobulin G3 (IgG3) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Fractured thoracic vertebra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: A partial or complete breakage of the thoracic vertebra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin G3 (IgG3) in the blood, whereby at most trace quantities of IgG3 can be measured.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: A lasting limited decrease of immunoglobulin G3 (IgG3) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Abnormal immunoglobulin level in body fluid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of immunoglobulins in body fluids, such as mucous.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Increased immunoglobulin level in body fluid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: An elevation from normal levels of immunoglobulins in body fluids, such as mucous.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Decreased immunoglobulin level in body fluid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: An reduction from normal levels of immunoglobulins in body fluids, such as mucous.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.label: Decreased body fat percentage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004107.definition: The percentage of fat as a part of total body weight below the norm, usually defined as less than 14% for females and less than 8% for males.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Abnormal proportion of exhausted T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.definition: A deviation from the normal proportion of exhausted T cell relative to T cell in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Fractured lower leg
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.definition: Bone fracture anywhere in the tibia, fibula, or ankle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Fractured skull
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.definition: A partial or complete breakage of the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Fractured phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.definition: A partial or complete breakage of the phalanx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Compression-fractured thoracic vertebra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.definition: A fracture of the thoracic vertebra that is caused by a loss of bone mass (osteoporosis) that occurs as part of aging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Compression-fractured vertebra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.definition: A fracture of the vertebra that is caused by a loss of bone mass (osteoporosis) that occurs as part of aging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Compression-fractured cervical vertebra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.definition: A fracture of the cervical vertebra that is caused by a loss of bone mass (osteoporosis) that occurs as part of aging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Compression-fractured lumbar vertebra

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Avulsion fractured humerus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.definition: A fractured in which a fragment of the humerus tears away from the main mass of bone as a result of physical trauma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.label: Avulsion fractured tibia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004108.definition: A fractured in which a fragment of the tibia tears away from the main mass of bone as a result of physical trauma.

Avulsion fractured epiphysis of femur
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004109.definition: A fractured in which the fragment of the epiphysis of femur bone tears away from the main mass of bone as a result of physical trauma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004109.label: Emotional hypersensitivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004109.definition: Heightened emotional reactivity to environmental stimuli, including the emotions of others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004109.label: Beau's lines
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004109.definition: A nail dystrophy that is preseents as grooved lines that run from side to side on the fingernail or the toenail that may look like indentations or ridges on the nail plate. They are caused by temporary disruption in the growth of proximal nail matrix. Trauma is usually the initiating factor such as infections, severe medical illnesses, major surgery/anesthesia, medication side effects, and autoimmune disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004109.label: Complete tracheal ring
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004109.definition: Continuous or nearly continuous configuration of the cartilaginous tracheal ring.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004109.label: Decreased middle cerebral artery pulsatility index
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004109.definition: Abnormally reduced blood flow pulsatility in in the middle cerebral artery (MCA). The pulsatility index (PI) is calculated using the following equation PI = (peak systolic velocity-end-diastolic velocity)/mean velocity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004500.label: Abnormal ossification of the trapezoid bone
Neural tube defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004500.definition: A neural tube defect arises when the neural tube, the embryonic precursor of the brain and spinal cord, fails to close during neurulation. The cranial region (anencephaly) or the low spine (open spina bifida; myelomeningocele) are most commonly affected although, in the severe NTD craniorachischisis, almost the entire neural tube remains open, from midbrain to low spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004500.label: Abnormal substantia nigra morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004500.definition: A structural anomaly of the substantia nigra, which is a midbrain dopaminergic nucleus which has a critical role in modulating motor movement and reward functions as part of the basal ganglia circuitry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004502.definition: Reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004502.label: Abnormal mediastinum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004502.definition: Any structural anomaly of the central compartment of the thoracic cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004502.label: Microlissencephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004502.definition: Severe microcephaly and lissencephaly with granular surfaces with immature cortical plate, reduced in thickness, with focal polymicrogyria and immature small neurons with rare processes, intermingled with a considerable number of glial elements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004502.label: Eosinophilic fasciitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004502.definition: Inflammation and thickening (localized fibrosis) of the fascia, the tissue under the skin and over the muscle, typically associated with a build up of eosinophils in the muscles and tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004503.label: Elevated urinary aminoisobutyric acid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004503.definition: An increased amount of 3-aminoisobutyric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004503.label: Osteolysis involving bones of the upper limbs

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: A deviation from the normal serum concentration/activity of lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), which catalyzes the reduction of pyruvate to form lactate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.label: Reduced lactate dehydrogenase B level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: A decreased or reduced level of the enzyme lactate dehydrogenase in serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.label: Decreased circulating complement C4 concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: Concentration of the complement component C4 in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.label: Decreased circulating complement C4a concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: Concentration of the complement component C4a in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.label: Decreased circulating complement C4b concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: Concentration of the complement component C4b in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.label: Elevated circulating acylcarnitine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: Concentration of acylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.label: Reduced insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.label: HbS hemoglobin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: Presence of an abnormal type of hemoglobin characterized by the subsitution of a glutamic acid residue at position 7 following the initial methionine residue by a valine (the mutation causative of sickle cell disease). The mutation promotes the polymerization of the HbS under conditions of low oxygen concentration. HbS can be identified by multiple methodologies including hemoglobin electrophoresis and high-performance liquid chromatography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.label: Increased HbA2 hemoglobin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: An elevated concentration in the blood of hemoglobin A2 (HbA2), which is a normal variant of hemoglobin A that consists of two alpha and two delta chains and is normally present at low levels in adults but may be increased in beta thalassemia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.label: Abnormal DLCO
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004504.definition: An abnormal amount of oxygen passes into the blood from the lungs and/or an abnormal amount of carbon dioxide passes from the blood into the lungs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.label: Increased DLCO
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.definition: Increased ability of the lungs to transfer gas from inspired air to the bloodstream as measured by the diffusing capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide (DLCO) test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.label: Decreased DLCO
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.definition: Reduced ability of the lungs to transfer gas from inspired air to the bloodstream as measured by the diffusing capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide (DLCO) test.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.label: Abnormality of the brachial nerve plexus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.definition: Any abnormality of the brachial nerve plexus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.label: Abnormality of the lumbosacral nerve plexus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.definition: Any abnormality of the lumbosacral nerve plexus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.label: Tiger tail banding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.definition: An abnormal appearance of hair under polarizing microscopy (using crossed polarizers), whereby hair shafts show striking alternating bright and dark bands, often referred to as tiger tail banding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.label: Abnormal circulating alpha-fetoprotein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.definition: Concentration of alpha-fetoprotein in the blood circulation outside normal limits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.label: Decreased circulating alpha-fetoprotein concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.definition: Concentration of alpha-fetoprotein in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.label: Abnormality of the testis size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.definition: An anomaly of the size of the testicle (the male gonad).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.label: Hyperkeratotic papule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004505.definition: A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point that is composed of localized hyperkeratosis (the latter may be demonstrated histopathologically).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004506.label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the extremities
Increased PIVKA-II
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004506.definition: Des-gamma carboxyprothrombin (DCP) or pro-thrombin induced by vitamin K absence-II (PIVKA-II) is an abnormal prothrombin protein that is increased in the serum of patients with HCC. Generation of DCP is thought to be a result of an acquired defect in the post- translational carboxylation of the prothrombin precursor in malignant cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004507.label: Distal femoral metaphyseal irregularity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004507.definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the distal metaphysis of the femur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.label: Decreased proportion of CD3-positive T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of CD3-positive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.label: Abnormality of body mass index
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.definition: Anomaly in the weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of obesity and underweight compared to averages.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.label: Decreased body mass index
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.definition: Abnormally decreased weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of underweight compared to averages.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.label: Knee joint hypermobility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.definition: The ability of the knee to move past its normal range of motion, (knee hyperextension is greater than 10 degrees).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.label: Clinical relevance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.definition: Subontology for annotating phenotypic features as distinctive or minor findings in patients. The subontology is intended to be used to annotate subjective clinical impressions of whether a certain finding is important for the differential diagnosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.label: Distinctive finding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004508.definition: In clinical parlance, findings are occasionally interpreted as being distinctive or minor, reflecting a subjective clinical impression of the importance of a feature for the differential diagnosis. A minor finding is taken to be one that is likely to have high utility in distinguishing the correct diagnosis from other candidates in the differential.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004509.label: Minor finding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004509.definition: In clinical parlance, findings are occasionally interpreted as being distinctive or minor, reflecting a subjective clinical impression of the importance of a feature for the differential diagnosis. A minor finding is taken to be one that is unlikely to help distinguish the correct diagnosis from other candidates in the differential.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004650.label: Anorgasmia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004650.definition: Inability of individual to reach orgasm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004650.label: Hand pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004650.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort localized to the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004650.label: Pain in head and neck region
Bradypnea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004650.definition: Bradypnea is referring to breathing that is abnormally slow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004650.label: Abnormal cervical spine morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_004650.definition: Any morphological abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.label: Early onset of sexual maturation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.definition: An early onset of puberty, in this case early does not refer to precocious.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.label: Malignant mesothelioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.definition: Malignant mesothelioma is a form of cancer that originates from the cells of the mesothelium, a thin tissue layer surrounding the body's internal organs. Malignant mesothelioma is almost exclusively caused by asbestos exposure, pleural mesothelioma beeing the most common form, affecting the lining of the lungs called the pleura. Other forms such as perioneal-, percardial- or testicular- mesothelioma are much rarer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.label: Pleural mesothelioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.definition: A malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the pleura (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the lungs). Pleural mesothelioma is the most common form of mesothelioma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.label: Peritoneal mesothelioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.definition: A Malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the peritoneum (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the abdomen). Peritoneal mesothelioma is the second most common form of mesothelioma after pleural mesothelioma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.label: Pericardial mesothelioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.definition: A Malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the pericardium (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the heart).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.label: Testicular mesothelioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.definition: A Malignant mesothelioma of the testis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.label: Neoplasm of the central nervous system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.definition: A neoplasm of the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.label: Neoplasm of the peripheral nervous system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor) of the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.label: Schwannoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010000.definition: A benign nerve sheath tumor composed of Schwann cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.label: Neoplasm of the eye
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.label: Neoplasm of the breast
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the breast.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.label: Epiretinal membrane
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.definition: An epiretinal membrane is a thin sheet of fibrous tissue that can develop on the surface of the macular area of the retina and cause a disturbance in vision. An epiretinal membrane area can develop on the thin macular area of the retin. An epiretinal membrane is also sometimes called a macular pucker, premacular fibrosis, surface wrinkling retinopathy or cellophane maculopathy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.label: Stahl ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.definition: The presence of a supernumerary, i.e. third, crus of the helix in the helix, arising at or above the normal bifurcation of the antihelix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.label: Abnormal mesentery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.definition: Folds of membranous tissue (peritoneum, mesothelium) attached to the wall of the abdomen and enclosing viscera. Examples include the mesentery for the small intestine; the transverse mesocolon, which attaches the transverse portion of the colon to the back wall of the abdomen; and the mesosigmoid, which enfolds the sigmoid portion of the colon. Cells of the same embryologic origin also surround the other organs of the body such as the lungs (pleura) or the heart (pericardium).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.label: Capsular cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.definition: A cataract that affects the capsule of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.label: Nuclear cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.definition: A nuclear cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the lens nucleus. That is, a nuclear cataract is one that is located in the center of the lens. The nucleus tends to darken changing from clear to yellow and sometimes brown.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.label: Cortical cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010001.definition: A cataract which affects the layer of the lens surrounding the nucleus, i.e., the lens cortex. It is identified by its unique wedge or spoke appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.label: Posterior capsular cataract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.definition: A cataract which is found in the back outer layer of the lens. This type often develops more rapidly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.label: Cerebral palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.definition: Cerebral palsy describes a group of permanent disorders of the development of movement and posture, causing activity limitation, that are attributed to nonprogressive disturbances that occurred in the developing fetal or infant brain. The motor disorders of cerebral palsy are often accompanied by disturbances of sensation, perception, cognition, communication, and behaviour, by epilepsy, and by secondary musculoskeletal problems.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.label: Abnormality of movement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.definition: An abnormality of movement with a neurological basis characterized by changes in coordination and speed of voluntary movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.label: Recurrent hand flapping
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.definition: A type of repetitive behavior in which the affected individual repeatedly waves the hands and/or arms rhythmically.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.label: Conspicuously happy disposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.definition: An unusually happy demeanor over time, which can also be observed during inappropriate situations that should, for example, cause distress, fear, or anger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.label: Overfriendliness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.definition: A form of hypersociability that presents as mostly inappropriate people-orientation and friendliness towards others on an inadequate level which might go as far as being dangerous considering for example young children following strangers without restriction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.label: Arteriovenous malformation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.label: Lingual thyroid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010002.definition: An aberrant thyroid gland or Ectopic thyroid located at the base of the tongue, just posterior to the foramen cecum as a result of a failure of the thyroid to descend.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.label: Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.definition: Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue arising from remnants of the thyroglossal duct anywhere along the path of the thyroglossal duct tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.label: Neoplasm of the thyroid gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the thyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.label: Tics
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.definition: Repeated, individually recognizable, intermittent movements or movement fragments that are almost always briefly suppressible and are usually associated with awareness of an urge to perform the movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.label: Motor tics
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.definition: Movement-based tics affecting discrete muscle groups.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.label: Phonic tics
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.definition: Involuntary sounds produced by moving air through the nose, mouth, or throat. The vocal cords are not involved in all tics that produce sound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.label: Pseudo-fractures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.definition: A band of bone material of decreased density forming alongside the surface of the cortical bone with thickening of the periosteum. Callus formation in the affected area is common and gives the appearance of a false fracture.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.label: Abnormality of the scalp hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.definition: An abnormality of the hair of head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.label: Slow-growing scalp hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.definition: Scalp hair whose growth is slower than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.label: Thickened cortex of bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010003.definition: An Abnormality of cortical bone leading to an abnormal thickness of the cortex of affected bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010004.label: Broad 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010004.definition: A broad appearance of the second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010004.label: Broad 3rd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010004.definition: A broad appearance of the third toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010004.label: Broad 4th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010004.definition: A broad appearance of the fourth toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010004.label: Broad 5th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010004.definition: A broad appearance of the fifth toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010004.label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 2nd toe

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010005.label: Ivory epiphyses of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010005.definition: Epiphyses of the 2nd toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010005.label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010005.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 2nd toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010005.label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 3rd toe

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010006.label: Ivory epiphyses of the 3rd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010006.definition: Epiphyses of the 3rd toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010006.label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 3rd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010006.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 3rd toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010007.label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 4th toe
Ivory epiphyses of the 4th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010007.definition: Epiphyses of the 4th toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010007.label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 4th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010007.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 4th toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010008.label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 5th toe
Ivory epiphyses of the 5th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010008.definition: Epiphyses of the 5th toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010008.label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 5th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010008.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 5th toe.

Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe

Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe

Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010010.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010011.label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Absent epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Bracket epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Cone-shaped epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Enlarged epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Irregular epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Ivory epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Pseudoepiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010011.definition: A pseudoepiphysis (an accessory epiphysis that does not significantly contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone) located in the middle phalanx of the second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010011.label: Small epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010012.label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010012.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010012.label: Triangular epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010012.definition: A pseudoepiphysis (an accessory epiphysis that does not significantly contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone) located in the proximal phalanx of the second toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010013.label: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010013.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010013.label: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Abnormality of the pubic hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010013.definition: Abnormality of the growth of the pubic hair. Pubic hair is part of the secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010013.label: Abnormality of the axillary hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010013.definition: Abnormality of the growth of the axillary hair. Axillary hair is part of the secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010013.label: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010014.label: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010014.definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010014.label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe

Synostosis involving bones of the toes
Synostosis involving bones of the upper limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010023.definition: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the upper limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Synostosis of joints
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: The abnormal fusion of neighboring bones across a joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Ectopic respiratory mucosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: Ectopic respiratory epithelium presenting as a superficial lesion in the skin usually localised unilateral in the skin of the forearm and associated with ipsilateral hand malformations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Sarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: A connective tissue neoplasm formed by proliferation of mesodermal cells. Bone and soft tissue sarcomas are the main types of sarcoma. Sarcoma is usually highly malignant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Leiomyosarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: A smooth muscle connective tissue tumor, which is rare type of cancer that is a malignant neoplasm of smooth muscle. When such a neoplasm is benign, it is called a leiomyoma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Fibrosarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: A fibroblastic sarcoma is a malignant tumor derived from fibrous connective tissue and characterized by immature proliferating fibroblasts or undifferentiated anaplastic spindle cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Desmoid tumors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: Benign, slow-growing tumors without any metastatic potential. Despite their benign nature, they can damage nearby structures causing organ dysfunction. Histologically they resemble low-grade fibrosarcomas, but they are very locally aggressive and tend to recur even after complete resection. There is a tendency for recurrence in the setting of prior surgery and the most common localisation of these tumors is intraabdominal from smooth muscle cells of the instestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Osteoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: Osteomas are bony growths found most commonly on the skull and mandible; however, they may occur in any bone of the body. Osteomas do not usually cause clinical problems and do not become malignant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Recurrent singultus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: A contraction of the diaphragm that repeats several times per minute. In humans, the abrupt rush of air into the lungs causes the epiglottis to close, creating a hic sound. Also known as synchronous diaphragmatic flutter (SDF), or singultus, from the Latin singult, the act of catching one's breath while sobbing. The hiccup is an involuntary action involving a reflex arc.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Hemiballismus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: Hemiballismus is a rare movement disorder that is caused primarily by damage to various areas in the basal ganglia. Hemiballismus is usually characterized by involuntary flinging motions of the extremities. The movements are often violent and have wide amplitudes of motion. They are continuous and random and can involve proximal and/or distal muscles on one side of the body, while some cases even include the facial muscles. The more a patient is active, the more the movements increase. With relaxation comes a decrease in movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.label: Calcification of muscles
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010024.definition: Deposition of calcium salts in muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.label: Multiple central nervous system lipomas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.definition: The presence of multiple lipomas located in the central nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.label: Abnormality of the medullary cavity of the long bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.definition: An abnormality of the medullary cavity (medulla, innermost part), which is the central cavity of bone shafts where red bone marrow and/or yellow bone marrow (adipose tissue) is stored.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.label: Stenosis of the medullary cavity of the long bones
Metaphyseal dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.definition: The presence of dysplastic regions in metaphyseal regions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.label: Senile plaques
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.definition: Senile plaques are extracellular deposits of amyloid in the gray matter of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.label: Ectrodactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.definition: A condition in which middle parts of the hands and/or feet (digits and meta-carpals and -tarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe/fingers over absent 2nd or 3rd toes/fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands and/or feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.label: Preaxial polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.definition: A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the thumb or great toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.label: Postaxial polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010025.definition: A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the fifth finger or fifth toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.label: Mesoaxial polydactyly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.definition: The presence of a supernumerary finger or toe (not a thumb or hallux) involving the third or fourth metacarpal/tarsal with associated osseous syndactyly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.label: Abnormal tendon morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.definition: An abnormality of the structure or form of the tendons, also often called sinews.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.label: Synostosis of carpals/tarsals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.definition: The carpus consists of the scaphoid, lunate, triquetal, pisiform, captitate, hamate, trapezoid, and trapezium bones. The tarsus consists of the talus, calcaneus, cuboid, cuneiform, and navicular bones. This term applies if there is any fusion among the bones of the carpus or tarsus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.label: Lip pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.definition: A depression located on a lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.label: Upper lip pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.definition: Depression located on the vermilion of the upper lip, usually paramedian.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.label: Paramedian lip pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010026.definition: Depression located paramedially on the vermilion of a lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.label: Abnormality of dorsoventral patterning of the limbs
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.definition: An abnormality resulting from a defect or disruption of dorsoventral patterning that normally happens during early development of the limbs. A disruption of the normal development of the dorsoventral axis may lead to a variable spectrum of different phenotypic abnormalities that may affect the nails and or palmar and dorsal side of the hands and/or feet, ultimately changing the normal dorsoventral appearance of the affected limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.label: Hyponasal speech
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.definition: Hyponasal speech is when there is an abnormally reduced nasal airflow during speech often in a setting of nasal obstruction or congestion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.label: Branchial sinus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.definition: A congenital branchial sinus is a remnant of the embryonic branchial arches and their intervening clefts and pouches that has failed to regress completely. Sinuses typically have their external orifice inferior to the ramus of the mandible. They may traverse the parotid gland, and run in close vicinity to the facial nerve in the external auditory canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.label: Gustatory lacrimation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.definition: Gustatory lacrimation results from an aberrant innervation of fibres from the seventh cranial nerve to the pterygopalatine ganglion which are destined originally for the submandibular ganglion. This aberrant innervation leads to uncontrollable tearing while eating or in anticipation of a meal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.label: Diffuse cerebellar atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.definition: Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.label: Skin pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.definition: A small, skin-lined tract that leads from the surface to deep within the tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.label: Periauricular skin pits
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.definition: Benign congenital lesions of the periauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.label: Ulcerative colitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010027.definition: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that includes characteristic ulcers, or open sores, in the colon. The main symptom of active disease is usually constant diarrhea mixed with blood, of gradual onset and intermittent periods of exacerbated symptoms contrasting with periods that are relatively symptom-free. In contrast to Crohn's disease this special form of colitis begins in the distal parts of the rectum, spreads continually upwards and affects only mucose and submucose tissue of the colon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.label: Crohn's disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.definition: A chronic granulomatous inflammatory disease of the intestines that may affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus, causing a wide variety of symptoms. It primarily causes abdominal pain, diarrhea which may be bloody, vomiting, or weight loss, but may also cause complications outside of the gastrointestinal tract such as skin rashes, arthritis, inflammation of the eye, tiredness, and lack of concentration. Crohn's disease is thought to be an autoimmune disease, in which the body's immune system attacks the gastrointestinal tract, causing inflammation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.label: Chronic colitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.definition: A chronic inflammatory disease of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.label: Acute colitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.definition: An acute and self-limited inflammatory disease of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.label: EMG: continuous motor unit activity at rest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.definition: Continuous electromyographic activity of motor units at rest, i.e., without voluntary movement of the muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.label: EMG: myotonic discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.definition: High frequency discharges in electromyography (EMG) that vary in amplitude and frequency, waxing and waning continuously with firing frequencies ranging from 150/second down to 20/second and producing a sound that has been referred to as a dive bomber sound.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.label: EMG: impaired neuromuscular transmission
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.definition: An electromyographic finding associated with erratic or absent neuromuscular transmission with erratic, moment-to-moment changes in the shape of the motor unit potential (MUP).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.label: EMG: slow motor conduction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.definition: The presence of reduced conduction velocity of motor nerves on electromyography.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.label: EMG: myokymic discharges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.definition: The presence of spontaneous bursts of rapidly firing potentials that recur at regular intervals of 2-10 per second and are unaffected by voluntary effort. This is an electromyographic (EMG) finding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010028.label: Abnormality of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010029.label: Abnormality of peripheral somatosensory evoked potentials
Abnormality of central somatosensory evoked potentials
Amyloidosis of peripheral nerves
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010029.definition: The presence of amyloid deposition in the nerves of the peripheral nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010029.label: Hypertrophied muscle fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010029.definition: The presence of an increased amount of muscle fibers with an increased diameter. This feature can be ascertained by microscopic examination of a muscle biopsy sample. Together with fiber size variation and atrophied muscle fibers, and hypertrophied muscle fibers are commonly found in myopathies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010029.label: Increased endomysial connective tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010029.definition: An increased volume of the endomysium, which is a connective tissue sheath that surrounds each muscule fiber. Together, bundles of muscle fibers form a fasciculus, surrounded by another layer of connective tissue called the perimysium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.label: Muscle fiber tubular inclusions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.definition: Unusual regions of densely packed membranous tubules known as tubular aggregates which present as membranous inclusions, derived from membranes of sarcoplasmic reticulum and mitochondria, containing miscellaneous proteins with a variety of enzymatic activities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.label: Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.definition: The presence of inclusion bodies within the cytoplasm of muscle cells. Inclusion bodies are aggregates (deposits) or stainable material, usually misfolded proteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.label: Muscle fiber intranuclear inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.definition: The presence of inclusion bodies within the nucleus of muscle cells. Inclusion bodies are aggregates (deposits) or stainable material, usually misfolded proteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.label: Ring fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.definition: Ring fibers are formed by a bundle of peripheral myofibrils which are circumferentially oriented such that they encircle the internal portion of the sarcoplasm which is normal in structure and orientation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.label: Muscle fiber hyaline bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.definition: Subsarcolemmal, eosinophilic glass-like regions in the cytoplasm of muscle fibers. Hyaline bodies show significant reactivity to myofibrillar ATPase after acid pre-incubation and with immunohistochemistry, show intense reactivity with only slow myosin heavy chain. Electron microscopy of the affected areas show a lack of myofibrils and a uniform, finely granular matrix, sometimes suggesting a filamentous nature, containing few scattered nuclei and mitochondria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.label: Cerebral cortical hemiatrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.definition: Atrophy of one side of the brain, characterized by findings including thinning of the cerebral cortex, reduced volume of the cerebral white matter with abnormal myelination, and enlargement of the ispilateral fourth ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.label: Subdural hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010030.definition: Hemorrhage occurring between the dura mater and the arachnoid mater.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.label: Epidural hemorrhage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.definition: Hemorrhage occurring between the dura mater and the skull.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.label: Cerebral ventricular adhesions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.definition: Bands of scar-like tisssue that hve formed within a cerebral ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.label: Cerebral germinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.definition: The presence of a germ cell tumor of the cerebrum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.label: Cerebral granulomatosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.definition: Cerebral inflammation involving a granulomatous response, i.e., a non-specific inflammatory response involving granulomas, defined as a compact organized collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes including epithelioid and giant cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.label: Cerebral inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.definition: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of stainable substances within cells of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.label: Hirano bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.definition: Intracellular aggregates of actin and actin-associated proteins within nerve cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.label: Argyrophilic inclusion bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.definition: Presence of abundant argyrophilic grains and coiled bodies on microscopic examination of brain tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.label: Lafora bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.definition: An intraneuronal inclusion body composed of acid mucopolysaccharides.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.label: Cerebral hyaline bodies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010031.definition: Cerebral eosinophilic, discrete, intracytoplasmatic inclusions of unknown significance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010032.label: Rosenthal fibers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010032.definition: Thick, elongated, worm-like or corkscrew eosinophilic bundle that are found on H&E staining of the brain in the presence of long standing gliosis, occasional tumors, and some metabolic disorders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010032.label: Abnormal dentate nucleus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010032.definition: An abnormality of the dentate nucleus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010032.label: Juvenile aseptic necrosis

Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 5th toe
Synostosis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux with the 1st metatarsal
Proximal/middle symphalangism of 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010048.definition: Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 2nd toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010049.label: Camptodactyly of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010049.definition: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010049.label: obsolete Joint contractures involving the joints of the feet
Hypoammonemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010049.definition: A decreased concentration of ammonia in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010049.label: Abnormal mast cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010049.definition: Any structural anomaly of mast cells, which are found in almost all tissues and contain numerous basophilic granules and are capable of releasing large amounts of histamine and heparin upon activation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010049.label: Mastocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010049.definition: The presence of an increased number of mast cells and CD34+ mast cell precursors in the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010049.label: Abnormality of the vitamin B3 metabolism

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.label: Recurrent bronchiolitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.definition: An increased susceptibility to bronchiolitis as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchiolitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.label: Low levels of vitamin B1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin B1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.label: Low levels of vitamin B2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin B2.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.label: Low levels of vitamin B5
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin B5.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.label: Low levels of vitamin B8
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin B8.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.label: Reduced blood folate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.definition: A reduced circulating concentration of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.label: Abnormality of vitamin metabolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010050.definition: An anomaly in the metabolism of a vitamin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.label: Low levels of vitamin C
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.definition: A reduced concentration of Vitamin C.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.label: Low levels of vitamin D
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.definition: A reduced concentration of Vitamin D.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.label: Decreased circulating vitamin E concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin E in the blood circulation. Vitamin E is a lipophilic vitamin that is also known as alpha-tocopherol.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.label: Abnormal circulating vitamin E concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.definition: Concentration of vitamin E in the blood circulation outside of normal limits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.label: Neoplasm of the ureter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the ureter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.label: Neoplasm of the urethra
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the urethra.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.label: Anuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010051.definition: Absence of urine, clinically classified as below 50ml/day.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.label: Oliguria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.definition: Low output of urine, clinically classified as an output below 300-500ml/day.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.label: Neoplasm of the thymus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the thymus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.label: Thymoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.definition: A tumor originating from the epithelial cells of the thymus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.label: Liver abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.definition: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.label: Limb duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.definition: Congenital duplication of all or part of a limb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.label: Urachus fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.definition: Persistence of the urachal canal with drainage of urine from the bladder through the persistent allantois canal to the umbilicus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.label: Pleuropulmonary blastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.definition: A rare cancer originating in the lung or pleural cavity that occurs most often in infants and young children but also has been reported in adults. Pleuropulmonary blastoma is regarded as malignant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.label: Abnormal blood phosphate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010052.definition: An abnormality of phosphate homeostasis or concentration in the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.label: Abnormal circulating calcium-phosphate regulating hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of a hormone that is involved in the regulation of phosphate and calcium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.label: Wind-swept deformity of the knees
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.definition: The appearance of abnormal valgus deformity in one knee in association with varus deformity in the other.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.label: Inflammatory abnormality of the eye
