http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.definition: Inflammation of the eye, parts of the eye or the periorbital region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.label: Episcleritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.definition: Inflammation of the episclera, a thin layer of tissue covering the white part (sclera) of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.label: Fasciitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.definition: Inflammation of fascia, the tissue under the skin and over the muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.label: Abnormality of the supraorbital ridges
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.definition: An anomaly of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.label: Periorbital edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010053.definition: Edema affecting the region situated around the orbit of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.label: Palpebral edema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.definition: Edema in the region of the eyelids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.label: Femoral hernia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.definition: A hernia which occurs just below the inguinal ligament, where abdominal contents pass through a naturally occurring weakness called the femoral canal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.label: Abnormal localization of kidney
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.definition: An abnormal site of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.label: Cognitive impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.definition: Abnormal cognition is characterized by deficits in thinking, reasoning, or remembering.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.label: Neoplasm of the heart
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.label: Arterial stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.definition: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of an artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.label: Abnormal forebrain morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.definition: An abnormality of the forebrain, which has as its parts the telencephalon, diencephalon, lateral ventricles and third ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.label: Exstrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010054.definition: Eversion of a hollow organ and exposure, inside out, and protruded through the abdominal wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.label: Asymmetric growth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.definition: A growth pattern that displays an abnormal difference between the left and the right side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.label: Hemiatrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.definition: Undergrowth of the limbs that affects only one side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.label: Hemiatrophy of lower limb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.definition: Unilateral atrophy (reduction in size) of a leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.label: Hemiatrophy of upper limb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.definition: Unilateral atrophy (reduction in size) of an arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.label: Lower limb asymmetry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010055.definition: A difference in length or diameter between the left and right leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.label: Upper limb asymmetry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.definition: Difference in length or size between the right and left arm.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.label: Diastomatomyelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.definition: Coexistence of two hemicords, at variable levels, causing splaying of the posterior vertebral elements. Results in neurological deficits in lower limb or perineum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.label: Triplomyelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.definition: Triplication of the spinal cord - extremely rare.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.label: Hydromyelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.definition: Dilation of central canal from incomplete fusion of the posterior columns or persistence of the primitive large canal of the embryo.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.label: Amyelia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.definition: Congenital absence of the spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.label: Neoplasm of the endocrine system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the endocrine system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.label: Abnormally ossified vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010056.definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of one or more vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.label: Carcinoid tumor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.definition: A tumor formed from the endocrine (argentaffin) cells of the mucosal lining of a variety of organs including the stomach and intestine. These cells are from neuroectodermal origin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.label: Cardiac diverticulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.definition: A cardiac diverticulum is a rare congenital malformation which is either fibrous or muscular.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.label: Fibrous cardiac diverticulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.definition: A fibrous cardiac diverticulum refers to an aneurysm and usually appears as an isolated congenital anomaly.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.label: Biliary tract neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the biliary system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.label: Neoplasm of the gallbladder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the gallbladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.label: Amaurosis fugax
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.definition: A transient visual disturbance that is typically caused by a circulatory, ocular or neurological underlying condition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.label: Mucosal telangiectasiae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010057.definition: Telangiectasia of the mucosa, the mucous membranes which are involved in absorption and secretion that line cavities that are exposed to the external environment and internal organs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Barrett esophagus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: An abnormal change (metaplasia) in the cells of the inferior portion of the esophagus. The normal squamous epithelium lining of the esophagus is replaced by metaplastic columnar epithelium. Columnar epithelium refers to a cell type that is typically found in more distal parts of the gastrointestinal system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Dilatation of renal calices
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: An abnormal enlargement of the renal calices, the system of ducts of the kidney that collect urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Nasal polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: Polypoidal masses arising mainly from the mucous membranes of the nose and paranasal sinuses. They are freely movable and nontender overgrowths of the mucosa that frequently accompany allergic rhinitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Corneal perforation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: A rupture of the cornea through which a portion of the iris protrudes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Endocarditis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: An inflammation of the endocardium, the inner layer of the heart, which usually involves the heart valves.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Telangiectasia of the skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: Presence of small, permanently dilated blood vessels near the surface of the skin, visible as small focal red lesions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Sterile pyuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: Patients who routinely have greater than 20 leukocytes per microliter, but have abacterial urine, are said to have sterile pyuria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Abnormal preputium morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: An abnormality of the retractable fold of skin that covers the tip of the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Paraphimosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: The foreskin becomes trapped behind the glans penis, and cannot be pulled back to its normal flaccid position covering the glans penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.label: Urogenital fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010058.definition: The presence of a fistula affecting the genitourinary system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.label: Rectal fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.definition: The presence of a fistula affecting the rectum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.label: Peritoneal abscess
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.definition: The presence of an abscess of the peritoneum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.label: Calcification of cartilage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.definition: The presence of calcium deposition in cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.label: Esophageal web
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.definition: Thin (2-3mm) membranes of normal esophageal tissue consisting of mucosa and submucosa that can be congenital or acquired. Congenital webs commonly appear in the middle and inferior third of the esophagus, and they are more likely to be circumferential with a central or eccentric orifice. Acquired webs are much more common than congenital webs and typically appear in the cervical area (postcricoid). Clinical symptoms of this condition are selective (solid more than liquids) dysphagia, thoracic pain, nasopharyngeal reflux, aspiration, perforation and food impaction (the last two are very rare).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.label: Camptocormia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.definition: An abnormal forward-flexed posture e.g. forward flexion of the spine, which is noticeable when standing or walking but disappears when lying down. It is becoming an increasingly recognized feature of Parkinson's disease and dystonic disorders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.label: Absent nares
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.definition: The nostrils (the paired channels of the nose) are not present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.label: Bifid penis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010059.definition: Two penile structures, separated from the tip to the base of the shaft.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.label: Penoscrotal transposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.definition: A partial or complete positional exchange between the penis and the scrotum, with positioning of the scrotum superior to the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.label: Eclampsia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.definition: An acute and life-threatening complication of pregnancy, which is characterized by the appearance of tonic-clonic seizures, usually in a patient who had developed pre-eclampsia. Eclampsia includes seizures and coma that happen during pregnancy but are not due to preexisting or organic brain disorders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.label: Preeclampsia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.definition: Pregnancy-induced hypertension in association with significant amounts of protein in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.label: Toxemia of pregnancy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.definition: Pregnancy-induced toxic reactions of the mother that can be as harmless as slight Maternal hypertension or as life threatening as Eclampsia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.label: Neoplasm of the lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.label: Neoplasm of the respiratory system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the respiratory system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.label: Dysmenorrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010060.definition: Pain during menstruation that interferes with daily activities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Maternal hyperphenylalaninemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: A medical history of exposure during the fetal period to hyperphenylalaninemia because the mother had phenylketonuria with inadequate control during pregnancy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Multiple glomerular cysts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: The presence of many cysts in the glomerulus of the kidney related to dilatation of the Bowman's capsule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Odontogenic neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: Neoplasm involving odontogenic cells, an odontogenic tumor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Death in early adulthood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: Death between the age of 16 and 40 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Myositis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: A general term for inflammation of the muscles without respect to the underlying cause.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Ovarian neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Testicular teratoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: The presence of a teratoma of the testis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Testicular seminoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: The presence of a seminoma, an undifferentiated germ cell tumor of the testis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Leydig cell neoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the testis with origin in a Leydig cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.label: Sertoli cell neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010061.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the testis with origin in a Sertoli cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.label: Germinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.definition: A type of undifferentiated germ cell tumor that may be benign or malignant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.label: Dysgerminoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.definition: The presence of a dysgerminoma, i.e., an undifferentiated germ cell tumor of the ovary.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.label: Abnormal corpus cavernosum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.definition: A structural anomaly of the corpus cavernosum, the erectile tissue of the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.label: Displacement of the urethral meatus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.definition: A displacement of the external urethral orifice from its normal position (in males normally placed at the tip of glans penis, in females normally placed about 2.5 cm behind the glans clitoridis and immediately in front of that of the vagina).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.label: Esophageal diverticulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.definition: The presence of a diverticulum of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.label: Midline facial cleft
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010062.definition: A congenital malformation with a cleft (gap or opening) in the midline of the face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.label: Neoplasm of the adrenal gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the adrenal gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.label: Pulmonary sequestration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.definition: The presence of a piece lung tissue which is not attached to the pulmonary blood supply and does not communicate with the other lung tissue (not connected to the standard bronchial airways and not performing a function in respiration).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.label: Neuroendocrine neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.definition: A tumor that originates from a neuroendocrine cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.label: Carotid paraganglioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.definition: A paraganglioma (a neuroendocrine neoplasm) originating in a carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.label: Pulmonary paraglioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.definition: A rare paranglioma of the lung, tumors that arise from extra-adrenal chromaffin cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.label: Neoplasm of the pharynx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.definition: A neoplasm originating in the pharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.label: Erectile dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010063.definition: A multidimensional but common male sexual dysfunction that involves an alteration in any of the components of the erectile response, including organic, relational and psychological.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.label: Laryngeal cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.definition: Presence of a cyst (sac-like structure) located in the larynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.label: Neoplasm of the adrenal cortex
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.label: Neoplasm of the adrenal medulla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal medulla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.label: Abnormality of nail color
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.definition: An anomaly of the color of the nail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.label: Melanonychia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.definition: Brown or black discoloration of the nails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.label: Cystocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.definition: Anterior vaginal wall prolapse with bulging of the bladder into the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.label: Graves disease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.definition: An autoimmune disease where the thyroid is overactive, producing an excessive amount of thyroid hormones (a serious metabolic imbalance known as hyperthyroidism and thyrotoxicosis). This is caused by autoantibodies to the TSH-receptor (TSHR-Ab) that activate that TSH-receptor (TSHR), thereby stimulating thyroid hormone synthesis and secretion, and thyroid growth (causing a diffusely enlarged goiter). The resulting state of hyperthyroidism can cause a dramatic constellation of neuropsychological and physical signs and symptoms, which can severely compromise the patients.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.label: Neoplasm of the tongue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the tongue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.label: Neoplasm of the oral cavity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010064.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the oral cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.label: Vaginal neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.label: Type I diabetes mellitus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.definition: A chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin. Type I diabetes mellitus is manifested by the sudden onset of severe hyperglycemia with rapid progression to diabetic ketoacidosis unless treated with insulin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.label: Retrobulbar optic neuritis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.definition: Optic neuritis that occurs in the section of the optic nerve located behind the eyeball.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.label: Thoracoabdominal wall defect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.definition: Failure to close of the chest and abdominal wall likely caused by the failure of the ventral wall to close during week 4 of development.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.label: Thoracoabdominal eventration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.definition: Congenital protrusion of the abdominal or thoracic viscera, usually with a defect of the sternum and ribs as well as of the abdominal walls.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.label: Cellulitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.definition: A bacterial infection and inflammation of the skin und subcutaneous tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.label: Abnormal cerebral vascular morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010065.definition: An anomaly of the cerebral blood vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.label: Dyskinesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.definition: A movement disorder which consists of effects including diminished voluntary movements and the presence of involuntary movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.label: Trigeminal neuralgia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.definition: A neuropathic disorder characterized by episodes of intense pain in the face, originating from the trigeminal nerve. One, two, or all three branches of the nerve may be affected.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.label: Synotia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.definition: A congenital malformation characterized by the union or approximation of the ears in front of the neck, often accompanied by the absence or defective development of the lower jaw.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.label: Angioedema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.definition: Rapid swelling (edema) of the dermis, subcutaneous tissue, mucosa and submucosal tissues of the skin of the face, normally around the mouth, and the mucosa of the mouth and/or throat, as well as the tongue during a period of minutes to several hours. The swelling can also occur elsewhere, typically in the hands. Angioedema is similar to urticaria, but the swelling is subcutaneous rather than on the epidermis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.label: Intestinal duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.definition: A developmental disorder in which there is a duplication the entire intestine or of a portion of the intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.label: Abnormal pigmentation of the oral mucosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010066.definition: An abnormality of the pigmentation of the mucosa of the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.label: Coarse metaphyseal trabecularization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.definition: Coarse appearance of the components of the network of osseous tissue that makes up the cancellous structure of a bone, i.e., thickening of the (usually fine) white lines that are produced by trabeculae in radiograms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.label: Abnormal trabecular bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.definition: Abnormal structure or form of trabecular bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.label: Vaginal hernia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.definition: The presence of a hernia of the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.label: Vaginal hydrocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.definition: A type of hydrocele testis in which the processus vaginalis remains patent only around the testes, and, as fluid accumulates, it renders the testes impalpable.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.label: Vulval varicose vein
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.definition: Varicosity of veins in the vulval region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.label: Premature skin wrinkling
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010067.definition: The presence of an increased degree of wrinkling (irregular folds and indentations) of the skin as compared with age-related norms.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.label: Esophageal duplication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.definition: A developmental disorder in which there is a duplication of a portion of the muscle and submucosa of the esophagus without epithelial duplication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.label: Tracheal atresia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.definition: A congenital absence or considerable underdevelopment of the trachea such that communication between the larynx proximally and the alveoli of the lungs distally is lacking.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.label: Salivary gland neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of a salivary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.label: Abnormal Sharpey fiber morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.definition: An abnormality of Sharpey's fibers (bone fibers, or perforating fibers), which are a matrix of connective tissue consisting of bundles of strong collagenous fibres connecting periosteum to bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.label: Polyotia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.definition: The presence of an extra auricle on one or both sides of the head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.label: Decreased corneal thickness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010068.definition: A decreased anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.label: Abnormality of the curvature of the cornea
Increased corneal curvature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.definition: An increase in the degree of curvature of the cornea compared to normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.label: Iridodonesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.definition: Tremulousness of the iris on movement of the eye, occurring in subluxation of the lens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.label: Tibial torsion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.definition: Twisted position of the tibia (shin bone) associated with pathological rotation of the leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.label: Lipedema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.definition: Excess deposit and expansion of adipose tissue in an unusual pattern which cannot be lost through diet and exercise .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.label: Neurofibrosarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.definition: A form of malignant cancer of the connective tissue surrounding nerves. Given its origin and behavior, it is classified as a sarcoma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.label: Subcutaneous neurofibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.definition: A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) localized in the subcutis (subcutaneous region).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.label: Scarring
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010069.definition: A scar refers to a lesion in which wound, burn, or sore has not healed completely and fibrous connective tissue has developed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.label: Abnormal arachnoid mater morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.definition: An abnormality of the Arachnoid mater.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.label: Abnormal pia mater
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.definition: An abnormality of the pia mater.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.label: Arachnoid cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.definition: An extra-parenchymal and intra-arachnoidal collection of fluid with a composition similar to that of cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.label: Tongue thrusting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.definition: Pressing forward of the tongue in the mouth, a retained motoric habit from infantile swallowing patterns

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.label: Cerebral visual impairment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.definition: A form of loss of vision caused by damage to the visual cortex rather than a defect in the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.label: Abnormal glial cell morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.definition: An abnormality of the glia cell.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.label: Abnormal oligodendroglia morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.definition: One of the three types of glia cells that, with the nerve cells, compose the central nervous system and are characterized by sheetlike processes that wrap around individual axons to form the myelin sheath of nerve fibers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.label: Abnormal microglia morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010070.definition: An abnormality of the microglial cells. They are also known as brain-resident macrophages or Hortega cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.label: Impulsivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.definition: Acting on the spur of the moment in response to immediate stimuli; acting on a momentary basis without a plan or consideration of outcomes; having difficulty establishing or following plans; experiencing a sense of urgency and engaging in self-harming behavior when under emotional distress.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.label: Abnormal thoracic spine morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.definition: An abnormality of the thoracic vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.label: Abnormal lumbar spine morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.definition: Any structural abnormality of the lumbar vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.label: Abnormal cementum morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.definition: Any structural anomaly of the cementum, which is the mineralized connective tissue covering the dental root. The cementum allows anchoring of the fibers of the periodontal ligament. Cementum is secreted by cementoblasts, which may be, later on, embedded in the cementum. Cementum can be acellular (along the two third coronal portion of the root) and cellular (in the apical and interradicular part of the root).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.label: Lens coloboma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010071.definition: A sectoral indentation of the crystalline lens, usually due to zonular weakness or absence.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.label: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.definition: Swelling of lymph nodes within the mediastinum, the central compartment of the thoracic cavities that contains the heart and the great vessels, the esophagus, and trachea and other structures including lymph nodes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.label: Hypercoagulability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.definition: An abnormality of coagulation associated with an increased risk of thrombosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.label: Lichenification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.definition: Thickening and hardening of the epidermis seen with exaggeration of normal skin lines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.label: Kaposi's sarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.definition: A systemic disease which can present with cutaneous lesions with or without internal involvement. Tumors are caused by Human herpesvirus 8 (HHV8), also known as Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus (KSHV).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.label: Histiocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010072.definition: An excessive number of histiocytes (tissue macrophages).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.label: Bronchogenic cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.definition: A rare congenital cystic lesion of the lungs in the mediastinum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.label: Transverse facial cleft
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.definition: A horizontal cleft of the face, varying from slight widening of the mouth, to a cleft extending to the ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.label: Neoplasm of the parathyroid gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the parathyroid gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.label: Abnormal vertebral epiphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.definition: An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of one or more vertebrae.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.label: Abnormal soft palate morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.definition: An abnormality of the soft palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.label: Abnormal eating behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.definition: Abnormal eating habits involve excessive or insufficient consumption of food, or any other abnormal pattern of food consumption.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.label: Bulimia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010073.definition: A form of anomalous eating behavior characterized by binge eating is followed by self-induced vomiting or other compensatory behavior intended to prevent weight gain (purging, fasting or exercising or a combination of these).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.label: Vascular neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor) originating in the vascular system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.label: Abnormality of the humeroulnar joint
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.definition: An anomaly of the joint between the trochlear notch of ulna and the trochlea of humerus, which is part of the elbow joint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.label: Macrodactyly of finger
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.definition: A type of Macrodactyly affecting one or several fingers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.label: Macrodactyly of toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.definition: A type of Macrodactyly affecting one or several toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.label: Chest pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010074.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the chest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.label: Atelectasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.definition: Collapse of part of a lung associated with absence of inflation (air) of that part.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.label: Esophageal neoplasm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.label: Abnormal liver lobulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.definition: Formation of abnormal lobules (small masses of tissue) in the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.label: Schizophrenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.definition: A mental disorder characterized by a disintegration of thought processes and emotional responsiveness. It most commonly manifests as auditory hallucinations, paranoid or bizarre delusions, or disorganized speech and thinking. It is accompanied by significant social or occupational dysfunction. The onset of symptoms typically occurs in young adulthood, with a global lifetime prevalence of about 1%. This term is not a helpful parent term to describe abnormal experiences.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.label: Mania
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.definition: A state of abnormally elevated or irritable mood, arousal, and/or energy levels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.label: Pancreatoblastoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.definition: A rare pediatric carcinoma of the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.label: Gangrene
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.definition: A serious and potentially life-threatening condition that arises when a considerable mass of body tissue dies (necrosis).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.label: Clubbing of fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010075.definition: Terminal broadening of the fingers (distal phalanges of the fingers).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.label: Clubbing of toes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.definition: Terminal broadening of the toes (distal phalanges of the toes).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.label: Abnormality of the lymphatic system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.definition: An anomaly of the lymphatic system, a network of lymphatic vessels that carry a clear fluid called lymph unidirectionally towards either the right lymphatic duct or the thoracic duct, which in turn drain into the right and left subclavian veins respectively.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.label: Lymphangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.definition: Lymphangiomas are rare congenital malformations consisting of focal proliferations of well-differentiated lymphatic tissue in multi cystic or sponge like structures. Lymphangioma is usually asymptomatic due to its soft consistency but compression of adjacent structures can be seen due to the mass effect of a large tumor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.label: Abnormal lymphatic vessel morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.definition: A structural anomaly of the vessel that contains or conveys lymph fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.label: Abnormal placenta morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.definition: An abnormality of the placenta, the organ that connects the developing fetus to the uterine wall to enable nutrient uptake, waste elimination, and gas exchange.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.label: Choriocarcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010076.definition: A malignant, trophoblastic and aggressive cancer, usually of the placenta. It is characterized by early hematogenous spread to the lungs and belongs to the far end of the spectrum of gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD), a subset of germ cell tumors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.label: Hyperperistalsis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.definition: Excessively active peristalsis (wave of contraction of the tubular organs of the gastrointestinal tract) marked by excessive rapidity of the passage of food through the stomach and intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.label: Hypoperistalsis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.definition: Reduced or inadequate peristalsis, with resultant slow passage of contents through the digestive tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.label: Hyperostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.definition: Excessive growth or abnormal thickening of bone tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.label: Dural ectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.definition: A widening or ballooning of the dural sac surrounding the spinal cord usually at the lumbosacral level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.label: Recurrent pharyngitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.definition: An increased susceptibility to pharyngitis as manifested by a history of recurrent pharyngitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.label: Exostoses
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.definition: An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.label: Cryoglobulinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.definition: Increased level of cryoglobulins in the blood. Cryoglobulins are abnormal immunoglobulins, especially IGG or IGM, that precipitate spontaneously when serum is cooled below 37 degrees Celsius.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.label: Urogenital sinus anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010077.definition: A rare birth defect in women where the urethra and vagina both open into a common channel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.label: Conjunctival hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.definition: A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) of the conjunctiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.label: Abnormal sacroiliac joint morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.definition: An anomaly of the sacroiliac joint, which connects the base of the spine (sacrum) to the ilium (a hip bone).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.label: Breast aplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.definition: Failure to develop and congenital absence of the breast.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.label: Insomnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.definition: Persistent difficulty initiating or maintaining sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.label: Hypersomnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.definition: Excessive sleepiness or feeling of sleepiness, or difficulty staying awake despite having had adequate sleep, which persists over several days.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.label: Fused lips
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.definition: Lack of separation of the upper and lower lips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.label: Torus palatinus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010078.definition: A bony protrusion present on the midline of the hard palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.label: Acantholysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.definition: The loss of intercellular connections, such as desmosomes, resulting in loss of cohesion between keratinocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.label: Abnormally straight spine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.definition: The absence of the normal curvature of the vertebral column.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.label: Toenail dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.definition: An abnormality of the development of the toenails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.label: Fingernail dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.definition: An abnormality of the development of the fingernails.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.label: Neoplasm of the middle ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010079.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the middle ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pancreas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.definition: A congenital underdevelopment (aplasia or hypoplasia) of the pancreas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.label: Malposition of the stomach
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.definition: Abnormal anatomical location of the stomach. This feature may be due to intestinal malrotation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.label: Abnormality of the periungual region
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.definition: An abnormality of the region around the nails of the fingers or toes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.label: Ungual fibroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.definition: Flesh-colored papule in or around the nail bed. Ungual fibromas may be periungual (arising under the proximal nail fold) or subungual (originating under the nail plate).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.label: Long fingers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.definition: The middle finger is more than 2 SD above the mean for newborns 27 to 41 weeks EGA or above the 97th centile for children from birth to 16 years of age AND the five digits retain their normal length proportions relative to each other (i.e., it is not the case that the middle finger is the only lengthened digit), or, Fingers that appear disproportionately long compared to the palm of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.label: Gastric diverticulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.definition: An outpouching of the gastric wall.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.label: Scalp tenderness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010080.definition: Pain or discomfort of the scalp elicited by palpation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the colon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.definition: Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the colon.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.label: Halitosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.definition: Noticeably unpleasant odors exhaled in breathing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.label: Testicular torsion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.definition: Testicular torsion is when the spermatic cord to a testicle twists, cutting off the blood supply. The most common symptom is acute testicular pain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.label: Renovascular hypertension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.definition: The presence of hypertension related to stenosis of the renal artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.label: Long thorax
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.definition: Increased inferior to superior extent of the thorax.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.label: Intestinal fistula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010081.definition: An abnormal connection between the gut and another hollow organ, such as the bladder, urethra, vagina, or other regions of the gastrointestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.label: Glomerulopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.definition: Inflammatory or noninflammatory diseases affecting the glomeruli of the nephron.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.label: Urethrocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.definition: The prolapse of the female urethra into the vagina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.label: Rectocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.definition: A Rectocele results from a tear in the rectovaginal septum (which is normally a tough, fibrous, sheet-like divider between the rectum and vagina). Rectal tissue bulges through this tear and into the vagina as a hernia. There are two main causes of this tear: childbirth, and hysterectomy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.label: Neoplasm of the nail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the nail.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.label: Lymphocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.definition: Increase in the number or proportion of lymphocytes in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.label: Increased T cell count
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.definition: An abnormal increase in the total number of T cells detected in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.label: Galactorrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010082.definition: Spontaneous flow of milk from the breast, unassociated with childbirth or nursing.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.label: Abnormality of vitamin K metabolism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.definition: Vitamin K is a fat-soluble vitamin with a role in promoting the coagulation cascade.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.label: Vitreous floaters
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.definition: Deposits of various size, shape, consistency, refractive index, and motility within the eye's vitreous humour, which is normally transparent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.label: Neoplasm of the small intestine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the small intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.label: Neoplasm of the large intestine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the large intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.label: Benign neoplasm of the central nervous system
Malignant neoplasm of the central nervous system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.definition: A tumor that originates in the pineal gland, has moderate cellularity and tends to form rosette patterns.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.label: Atrophodermia vermiculata
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.definition: Symmetrical vermiform facial atrophy that affects mainly the forehead, the chin, the ear lobes and helices. Atrophodermia vermiculata is characterized by erythema and follicular plugs on the cheeks, developing into painless reticular impressions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.label: Recurrent cutaneous abscess formation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.definition: An increased susceptibility to cutaneous abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent cutaneous abscesses.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.label: Hepatic agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010083.definition: Absence of the liver owing to a failure of the liver to develop.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the eyebrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the eyebrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.label: Microgastria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.definition: A developmental anomaly wtih a small tubular or saccular midline stomach.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.label: Septo-optic dysplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.definition: Underdevelopment of the optic nerve and absence of the septum pellucidum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.label: Anaphylactic shock
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.definition: An acute hypersensitivity reaction due to exposure to a previously encountered antigen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.label: Palmoplantar pustulosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.definition: A chronic, relapsing, pustular eruption that is localized to the palms and soles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.label: Neoplasm of the male external genitalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the male external genitalia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.label: Neoplasm of the scrotum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010084.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the scrotum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.label: Neoplasm of the penis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the penis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.label: Abnormal emotion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.definition: Abnormalities in the intensity, frequency, or duration of emotional experiences.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.label: Abnormal fear-induced behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.definition: An abnormal fear-induced behavior includes observable actions. This behavior is characterized by abnormal responses to fear or abnormal fear levels. Examples of such behavior include avoiding fear-inducing situations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.label: Hypoplastic areola
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.definition: Underdevelopment of the areola, the circular area of pigmented skin surrounding the nipple.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.label: Poorly ossified vertebrae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.definition: Decreased ossification of the vertebral bodies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.label: Dilatation of celiac artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the celiac artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.label: Dilatation of superior mesenteric artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010085.definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the superior mesenteric artery .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.label: Dilatation of Inferior mesenteric artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the inferior mesenteric artery .

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.label: Sclerotic vertebral body
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.definition: Increase in bone density of the vertebral body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.label: Short femoral neck
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.definition: An abnormally short femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.label: Broad ischia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.definition: Increased width of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.label: Duodenal stenosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.definition: The narrowing or partial blockage of a portion of the duodenum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.label: Palmar telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010086.definition: The presence of telangiectases on the skin of palm of hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.label: Plantar telangiectasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located on the skin of sole of foot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.label: Abnormal palm morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.definition: An abnormality of the palm, that is, of the front of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.label: Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.definition: An abnormality of the plantar part of foot, that is of the soles of the feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.label: Thick hair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.definition: Increased density of hairs, i.e., and elevated number of hairs per unit area.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.label: Hemimacroglossia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.definition: Increased length and width of one half of the tounge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.label: Infra-orbital crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.definition: Skin crease extending from below the inner canthus laterally along the malar process of the maxilla and zygoma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.label: Renal diverticulum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010087.definition: Cystic, urine-containing intrarenal cavities lined with transitional cell epithelium that communicate through a narrow channel with the collecting system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.label: Nephrogenic rest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.definition: Abnormally persistent clusters of embryonal cells, representing microscopic malformations (dysplasias) of the developing kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.label: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.definition: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma is a type of kidney tumor that is usually found before birth by ultrasound or within the first 3 months of life. It contains fibroblastic cells (connective tissue cells), and may spread to the other kidney or to nearby tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.label: Fibrous hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.definition: A rare, benign soft tissue tumor that typically occurs within the first two years of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.label: Chorangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.definition: Hamartoma-like growth in the placenta consisting of blood vessels.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.label: Compensatory scoliosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.definition: A scoliosis which is the results of a difference in leg length (which might be due to hemihypertrophy or hemihypotrophy of a leg) and the resulting tilting of the pelvis. If untreated this will lead to the development of scoliosis over time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.label: Lateral venous anomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.definition: Persistence of the embryonic dorsal or sciatic vein system that normally should have involuted around the tenth to twelfth week of intrauterine life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.label: Abnormality of globe location
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.definition: An abnormality in the placement of the ocular globe (eyeball).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.label: Abnormality of globe size
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.definition: An abnormality in the size of the ocular globe (eyeball).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.label: Abnormal ductus choledochus morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010088.definition: An abnormality of the Common bile duct, a tube-like anatomic structure in the human gastrointestinal tract, formed by the union of the Common hepatic duct and the Cystic duct from the gall bladder.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.label: Bifid xiphoid process
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.definition: A cleft of the xiphoid process of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.label: Abnormality of the xiphoid process
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.definition: An abnormality of the xiphoid process of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.label: Prominent xiphoid process
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.definition: Increased prominence of the xiphoid process of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.label: Broad xiphoid process
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.definition: Increased side-to-side width of the xiphoid process of the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.label: Rectal polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.definition: The presence of multiple rectal hyperplastic/adenomatous polyps.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.label: Connective tissue nevi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.definition: Connective tissue nevi are hamartomas in which one or several components of the dermis is altered.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.label: Sclerosis of finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010089.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010090.label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.definition: An elevation of bone density in the distal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.definition: An elevation of bone density in the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.label: Sclerosis of distal finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more distal phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.label: Sclerosis of middle finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more middle phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.label: Sclerosis of proximal finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more proximal phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.label: Sclerosis of 2nd finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the second finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.label: Sclerosis of 3rd finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010091.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the third finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.label: Sclerosis of 4th finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fourth finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.label: Sclerosis of 5th finger phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fifth finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.label: Clavicular sclerosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.definition: An increase in bone density within the clavicle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.label: Sclerosis of toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.label: Sclerosis of foot bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more foot bones. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.label: Sclerosis of 2nd toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the second toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.label: Sclerosis of 3rd toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the third toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.label: Sclerosis of 4th toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fourth toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.label: Sclerosis of 5th toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010092.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fifth toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010093.label: Sclerosis of hallux phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010093.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the big toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010093.label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010093.definition: An elevation in bone density in the proximal phalanx of the second toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010093.label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010093.definition: An elevation in bone density in the proximal phalanx of the third toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010093.label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010093.definition: An elevation in bone density in the middle phalanx of the third toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010093.label: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010094.label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010094.definition: An elevation in bone density in the distal phalanx of the third toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010094.label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
Sclerosis of proximal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010094.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more proximal phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010094.label: Sclerosis of middle toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010094.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more middle phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010094.label: Sclerosis of distal toe phalanx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010094.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more distal phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010095.label: Enlarged sylvian cistern
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010095.definition: An increase in size of the subarachnoid space associated with the lateral cerebral sulcus (Sylvian fissure).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010095.label: Abnormal renal medulla morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010095.definition: Any structural abnormality of the medulla of the kidney.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010095.label: Narrow foramen obturatorium
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010095.definition: Decreased width of the foramen obturatorium. The foramen obturatorium (also known as the obturator foramen) is a hole located between the ischium and pubis bones of the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010095.label: Dense metaphyseal bands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010095.definition: Dense radiopaque bands of bone which are thicker than the adjacent diaphyseal cortex and may form at the metaphysis of growing bones. They appear on radiographs as bone that is more radiopaque that the adjacent diaphyseal cortex.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010096.label: Lateral ventricular asymmetry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010096.definition: Abnormal difference in size between the left and right lateral cerebral ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010096.label: Enlarged hippocampus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010096.definition: Increase in size of the hippocampus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010096.label: Hyperesthesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_010096.definition: Increased sensitivity to stimulation, excluding the special senses, which may refer to various modes of cutaneous sensibility including touch and thermal sensation without pain, as well as to pain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.label: Dysharmonic bone age
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.definition: Different levels of maturation of different bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.label: Dysharmonic accelerated bone age
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.definition: A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is an acceleration in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.label: Abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.definition: The presence of an abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.label: Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.definition: An abnormal size of the palpebral fissures for example unusually long or short palpebral fissures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.label: Intestinal polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020000.definition: The presence of multiple polyps in the intestine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020001.label: Neoplasm of fatty tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020001.definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of adipose tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020001.label: Acrokeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020001.definition: Overgrowth of the stratum corneum characterized by flesh-coloured or slightly pigmented smooth or warty papules on the upper surface of hands and feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020001.label: Cerebral white matter agenesis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020001.definition: Congenital defect with failure of the development of the cerebral white matter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020001.label: Protanomaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020001.definition: A type of anomalous trichromacy associated with defective long-wavelength-sensitive (L) cones, causing the sensitivity spectrum to be shifted toward medium wavelengths. This leads to difficulties especially in distinguishing red and green.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.label: Corneal erosion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.definition: An erosion or abrasion of the cornea's outermost layer of epithelial cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.label: Choroid plexus papilloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.definition: Choroid plexus papilloma is a histologically benign neoplasm located in the ventricular system of the choroid plexus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.label: Priapism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.definition: A painful and harmful medical condition in which the erect penis doesn't return to its flaccid state, despite the absence of both physical and psychological stimulation, within four hours.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.label: Premature chromatid separation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.definition: The presence of premature sister chromatid segregation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.label: Mandibular pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the mandible.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.label: Ocular pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.label: Pretibial myxedema
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.definition: A diffuse, non-pitting edema and thickening of the skin usually on the anterior aspect of the lower legs spreading to the dorsum of the feet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.label: Vasculitis in the skin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020002.definition: A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) that affects skeletal muscle tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.label: Kayser-Fleischer ring
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.definition: Grey-green or brownish-pigmented ring in the deep epithelial layers at the outer border of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.label: Papule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.definition: A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.label: Skin plaque
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.definition: A plaque is a solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.label: Skin nodule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.definition: Morphologically similar to a papule, but greater than either 10mm in both width and depth, and most frequently centered in the dermis or subcutaneous fat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.label: Skin vesicle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.definition: A circumscribed, fluid-containing, epidermal elevation generally considered less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.label: Pustule
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020003.definition: A small elevation of the skin containing cloudy or purulent material usually consisting of necrotic inflammatory cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.label: Epidermoid cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.definition: Nontender, round and firm, but slightly compressible, intradermal or subcutaneous cyst measuring 0.5-5 cm in diameter. Epidermal cysts are intradermal or subcutaneous tumors, grow slowly and occur on the face, neck, back and scrotum. They usually appear at or around puberty, and as a rule an affected individual has one solitary or a few cysts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.label: Skin erosion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.definition: A discontinuity of the skin exhibiting incomplete loss of the epidermis, a lesion that is moist, circumscribed, and usually depressed.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.label: Skin ulcer
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.definition: A discontinuity of the skin exhibiting complete loss of the epidermis and often portions of the dermis and even subcutaneous fat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.label: Verrucae
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.definition: Warts, benign growths on the skin or mucous membranes that cause cosmetic problems as well as pain and discomfort. Warts most often occur on the hands, feet, and genital areas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.label: Porokeratosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.definition: A clonal disorder of keratinization with one or multiple atrophic patches surrounded by a clinically and histologically distinctive hyperkeratotic ridgelike border called the cornoid lamella.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.label: Cat cry
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.definition: The presence of a characteristic high-pitched cry that sounds similar to the meowing of a kitten.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.label: Chondritis of pinna
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.definition: Inflammation of the cartilage of the external ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.label: Upper limb hypertonia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020004.definition: Increased muscle tone observed in the arms of the affected person.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020005.label: Hemihypotrophy of lower limb
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020005.definition: Shortening of a leg affecting only one side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020005.label: Marcus Gunn pupil
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020005.definition: An aberrant pupillary response characterized by (i) Constriction of pupils of both eyes when the light stimulus is applied to the normal eye, and (ii) Dilatation of pupils of both eyes when the light stimulus is rapidly transferred from the normal eye (after brief light exposure to the normal eye) to the affected eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020006.label: Colorectal polyposis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020006.definition: Multiple abnormal growths that arise from the lining of the large intestine (colon or rectum) and protrude into the intestinal lumen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020006.label: Asymmetry of iris pigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020006.definition: Asymmetry between the two irides or asymmetry between different parts of one iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020006.label: Recurrent spontaneous abortion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020006.definition: Repeated episodes of abortion (Expulsion of the product of fertilization before completing the term of gestation) without deliberate interference.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020007.label: Peripheral vitreoretinal degeneration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020007.definition: A type of vitreoretinal degeneration with manifestations that are concentrated at the periphery of the retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020007.label: Episodic quadriplegia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020007.definition: Intermittent episodes of paralysis of all four limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020007.label: Respiratory insufficiency due to defective ciliary clearance

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020008.label: Giant cell hepatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020008.definition: Chronic hepatitis characterized by parenchymal inflammation with formation of large multinucleated hepatocytes in response to a variety of insults to the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020009.label: Triangular-shaped open mouth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020009.definition: A facial appearance characterized by a permanently or nearly permanently opened mouth, in which the upper lip is tented in a way that the opened mouth has the appearance of a triangle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020010.label: Absent fifth fingernail
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020010.definition: Absence of nail of little finger.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020011.label: Metabolic alkalosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020011.definition: Metabolic alkalosis is defined as a disease state where the pH is elevated to greater than 7.45 secondary to some metabolic process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020011.label: Recurrent upper and lower respiratory tract infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020011.definition: Increased susceptibility to upper and lower respiratory tract infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of upper and lower respiratory tract infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020011.label: Acute hepatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020011.definition: Acute hepatic injury resulting from inflammation typically accompanied by increased serum alanine transaminase activity. Etiologies include viral hepatitis, drugs, toxins, and autoimmune disorders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.label: Chronic active hepatitis
