http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.definition: Chronic hepatitis associated with recurrent clinical exacerbations, extrahepatic manifestations, and progression to cirrhosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.label: Chronic hepatitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.definition: Hepatitis that lasts for more than six months.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.label: Chronic hepatitis due to cryptosporidium infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.definition: Chronic hepatitis associated with infection by cryptosporidia, as demonstrated (for example) by immunohistochemistry of liver tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.label: Atrial cardiomyopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.definition: Any complex of structural, architectural, contractile or electrophysiological changes affecting the atria with the potential to produce clinically relevant manifestations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.label: Biventricular hypertrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020012.definition: Thickening of the heart walls in both ventricles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020013.label: Epileptic encephalopathy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020013.definition: A condition in which epileptiform abnormalities are believed to contribute to the progressive disturbance in cerebral function. Epileptic encephalaopathy is characterized by (1) electrographic EEG paroxysmal activity that is often aggressive, (2) seizures that are usually multiform and intractable, (3) cognitive, behavioral and neurological deficits that may be relentless, and (4) sometimes early death.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020014.label: Mucoid extracellular matrix accumulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020014.definition: An increase of medial mucoid extracellular matrix creating translamellar and/or intralamellar expansions including extracellular pools as noted on an H&E stain and/or a stain to highlight extracellular matrix material (Movat's pentachrome, Alcian blue, etc.).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020014.label: Neuronal loss in basal ganglia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020014.definition: A reduction in the number of nerve cells in the basal ganglia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020014.label: Abnormal liver function tests during pregnancy
CSF lymphocytic pleiocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020014.definition: An increased lymphocyte count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020015.label: Increased serum bile acid concentration during pregnancy
Cutaneous mastocytosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020015.definition: Multifocal dense infiltrates of mast cells in cutaneous tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_020015.label: Agenesis of permanent mandibular lateral incisor
Agenesis of primary mandibular lateral incisor

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.label: Tall chin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.definition: Increased vertical distance from the vermillion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.label: Chin with vertical crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.definition: Vertical crease fold situated below the vermilion border of the lower lip and above the fatty pad of the chin with the face at rest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.label: Extra concha fold
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.definition: Folds or ridges within the concha that are distinct from the crus helix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.label: Focal absence of the external ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.definition: Absence of a localized portion of the ear that cannot be described by a more precise term (e.g., absent ear lobe).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.label: Long ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.definition: Median longitudinal ear length greater than two SD above the mean determined by the maximal distance from the superior aspect to the inferior aspect of the external ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.label: Short ear
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.definition: Median longitudinal ear length less than two SD above the mean determined by the maximal distance from the superior aspect to the inferior aspect of the external ear.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.label: Polymenorrhea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.definition: Frequent menses; menstrual cycles lasting less than 21 days.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.label: Menometrorrhagia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_040000.definition: Prolonged/excessive menses and bleeding at irregular intervals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041000.label: Abnormality of ophthalmic artery
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041000.definition: Abnormality of the first branch of the internal carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041000.label: Abnormality of the peripheral nervous system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041000.definition: Any abnormality of the part of the nervous system that consists of the nerves and ganglia outside of the brain and spinal cord.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041000.label: Abnormality of the somatic nervous system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041000.definition: Any abnormality of the part of the peripheral nervous system associated with sensation and skeletal muscle voluntary control of body movements.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Abnormality of somatic nerve plexus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: Any abnormality of the somatic nerve plexus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Abnormality of masticatory muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: Any abnormality of the masticatory muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Abnormal mouth floor morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: Any abnormality of the mouth floor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Abnormality of the submandibular region
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: Any abnormality of the submandibular region, the region between the mandible and the hyoid bone contains the submandibular and sublingual glands, suprahyoid muscles, submandibular ganglion, and lingual artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Abnormal ganglion morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: An abnormality of nerve cell cluster or a group of nerve cell bodies located in the autonomic nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Abnormal peripheral nervous system ganglion morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: An abnormality of nerve cell cluster or a group of nerve cell bodies located in the peripheral autonomic nervous system.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Abnormal cranial ganglion morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: An abnormality of nerve cell cluster or a group of nerve cell bodies located in the autonomic nervous system of the cranium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Otitis externa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: Inflammation or infection of the external auditory canal (EAC), the auricle, or both.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Recurrent ear infections
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: Increased susceptibility to ear infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of ear infections.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.label: Epigastric pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041001.definition: Pain that is localized to the region of the upper abdomen immediately below the ribs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.label: Fish odor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.definition: Body odor characterized by an offensive body odor and the smell of rotting fish due to the excessive excretion of trimethylamine (TMA) in the urine, sweat, and breath of affected individuals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.label: Vaginal fish odor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.definition: A fish odor in the vaginal area, that is characteristic of bacterial vaginosis (BV), and is due to trimethylamine (TMA).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.label: Abnormal distribution of cell junction proteins in buccal mucosal cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.definition: An anomalous amount or location of cell junction proteins such as plakoglobin or Cx43.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.label: Alveolar bone loss around teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.definition: A decrease in the amount of alveolar bone around the root of a tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.label: Recurrent oral herpes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041002.definition: Recurrent episodes of oral herpes, typically characterized by blisters or ulcers on the gums, lips and/or tongue caused by herpes virus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.label: Cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.definition: A gap in the lip or lips.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.label: Submucous cleft of soft and hard palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.definition: Soft and hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the soft and hard palate that are covered by the lining (ie mucous membrane) of the roof of the mouth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.label: Unilateral alveolar cleft of maxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.definition: One sided alveolar cleft of the maxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.label: Bilateral alveolar cleft of maxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.definition: Nonmidline alveolar cleft of the maxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.label: Abnormal T cell activation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041003.definition: Any abnormality in the activation of T cells, i.e. the change in morphology and behavior of a mature or immature T cell resulting from exposure to a mitogen, cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or an antigen for which it is specific.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041004.label: Abnormal liver morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041004.definition: Any structural anomaly of the bile-secreting organ that is important for detoxification, for fat, carbohydrate, and protein metabolism, and for glycogen storage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041004.label: Abnormal neural tube morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041004.definition: Any structural anomaly of the hollow epithelial tube found on the dorsal side of the vertebrate embryo that develops into the central nervous system (i.e. brain and spinal cord).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Decreased level of 1,5 anhydroglucitol in serum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: A decrease in the level of 1,5 anhydroglucitol in the serum. 1,5-Anhydrosorbitol is a validated marker of short-term glycemic control. This substance is derived mainly from food, is well absorbed in the intestine, and is distributed to all organs and tissues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Increased level of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaric acid in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: The concentration of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaric acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Increased level of allantoin in serum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: An increase in the level of allantoin in the serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Elevated circulating gamma-aminobutyric acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: An increase in the level of Gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Decreased circulating GABA concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: A decrease in the level of GABA in the serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Decreased level of erythritol in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: A decrease in the level of erythritol in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Decreased CSF erythritol concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: Concentration of erythritol in the cerebrospinal fluid below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Increased level of D-threitol in plasma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: An increase in the level of D-threitol in the plasma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Increased level of D-threitol in CSF
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: An increase in the level of D-threitol in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.label: Increased level of D-threitol in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041005.definition: An increase in the level of D-threitol in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.label: Decreased level of D-mannose in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.definition: A decrease in the level of D-mannose in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.label: Increased level of galactitol in plasma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.definition: An increase in the level of galactitol in the plasma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.label: Increased level of galactitol in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.definition: An increase in the level of galactitol in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.label: Increased level of galactonate in red blood cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.definition: An increase in the level of galactonate in the red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.label: Increased level of galactitol in red blood cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.definition: An increase in the level of galactitol in the red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.label: Increased level of hippuric acid in blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.definition: An increase in the level of hippuric acid in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.label: Increased level of hippuric acid in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.definition: An increase in the level of hippuric acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.label: Increased level of L-fucose in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.definition: An increase in the level of L-fucose in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.label: obsolete Increased level of L-glutamic acid in blood
Increased level of propylene glycol in blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041006.definition: An increase in the level of propylene glycol in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.label: Increased level of ribitol in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.definition: An increase in the level of ribitol in the urine. Ribotol is a crystalline pentose alcohol (C5H12O5) and is a metabolic end product formed by the reduction of ribose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.label: Increased level of ribitol in CSF
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.definition: An increase in the level of ribitol in the cerebral spinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.label: Increased level of ribose in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.definition: An increase in the level of ribose in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.label: Increased level of ribose in CSF
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.definition: An increase in the level of ribose in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.label: Increased level of xylitol in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.definition: An increase in the level of xylitol in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.label: Increased level of xylitol in CSF
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041007.definition: An increase in the level of xylitol in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.label: Increased level of L-pyroglutamic acid in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.definition: An increase in the level of L-pyroglutamic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.label: Chronic idiopathic urticaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.definition: Urticaria characterized by spontaneously recurring hives for 6 weeks or longer.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.label: Physical urticaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.definition: Urticaria caused by physical agents, such as heat, cold, light, friction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.label: Cold urticaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.definition: Urticaria may be caused by cold temperatures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.label: Aquagenic urticaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.definition: A form of physical urticaria, in which contact with water, regardless of its temperature and source, evokes pruritic follicular wheals on the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.label: Solar urticaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.definition: Urticaria in response to exposure to ultraviolet-A (UVA), ultraviolet-B (UVB), visible and rarely infrared light.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.label: Vibratory urticaria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041013.definition: Urticaria in response to dermal vibration, with coincident degranulation of mast cells and increased histamine levels in serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.label: Abnormal circulating biotinidase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.definition: An abnormality in the biotinidase level, an enzyme that releases biotin from biocytin, the product of biotin-dependent carboxylases degradation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.label: Decreased circulating biotinidase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.definition: Concentration of biotinidase in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal. Biotidinase is an enzyme that releases biotin from biocytin, the product of biotin-dependent carboxylases degradation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.label: Elevated circulating biotinidase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.definition: Concentration of biotinidase in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. Biotidinase is an enzyme that releases biotin from biocytin, the product of biotin-dependent carboxylases degradation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.label: Eosinophilic infiltration in the stomach mucosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.definition: Infiltration of eosinophils in the stomach mucosa, that is diagnosed by an upper endoscopy and microscopy that shows more than 20 eosinophils per high-power field in association with peripheral eosinophilia and the absence of secondary cause of eosinophilia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.label: Idiopathic anaphylaxis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.definition: A rare form of anaphylaxis for which triggers cannot be identified despite a detailed history and careful diagnostic assessment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.label: Drug-induced anaphylaxis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041014.definition: A form of anaphylaxis that is triggered by intake of drugs or medications.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.label: Eosinophilic infiltration of the esophagus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.definition: Infiltration of numerous eosinophils (usually greater than 15 per high power field) into the squamous epithelium of the esophagus, and layering of eosinophils on the surface layer of the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.label: Eosinophilic microabscess formation in the esophagus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.definition: The formation of small localized collection of eosinophiles (an eosinophilic microabscess) in the esophagus. Usually clusters of greater than or equal to 4 eosinophils are seen, that appear as exudates or white spots or white plaques.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.label: Increased level of methylsuccinic acid in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.definition: The concentration of methylsuccinic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.label: Increased level of myristic acid in serum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.definition: An increase in the level of myristic acid in the serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.label: Increased level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.definition: An increase in the level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.label: Increased level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041015.definition: An increase in the level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in cultured fibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041016.label: Defective interstrand cross-link repair
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041016.definition: A defect in the of the process of interstrand cross-link repair: removal of a DNA interstrand crosslink (a covalent attachment of DNA bases on opposite strands of the DNA) and restoration of the DNA. DNA interstrand crosslinks occur when both strands of duplex DNA are covalently tethered together (e.g. by an exogenous or endogenous agent), thus preventing the strand unwinding necessary for essential DNA functions such as transcription and replication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041016.label: Abnormal morphology of the chest musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041016.definition: Any abnormality of the chest muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041016.label: Abnormality of the back musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041016.definition: Any abnormality of the back muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041016.label: Abnormal morphology of the shoulder musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041016.definition: Any abnormality of the shoulder muscles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Hippocampal atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of hippocampus tissue that was once present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Increased cotinine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: Increased concentration of cotinine in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Blood xenobiotic
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: The presence of a xenobiotic in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Increased circulating troponin I concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: An increased concentration of tropnin I in the blood, which is a cardiac regulatory protein that controls the calcium mediated interaction between actin and myosin. Raised cardiac troponin concentrations are now accepted as the standard biochemical marker for the diagnosis of myocardial infarction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Increased circulating troponin T concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: An increased concentration of tropnin T in the blood, which is a cardiac regulatory protein that controls the calcium mediated interaction between actin and myosin. Raised cardiac troponin concentrations are now accepted as the standard biochemical marker for the diagnosis of myocardial infarction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Hyperketonemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: An increase in the level of ketone bodies (acetoacetic acid, beta-hydroxybutyric acid, and acetone) in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Abnormal circulating glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041017.definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in a dried blood spot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in a dried blood spot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in a dried blood spot.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in leukocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in leukocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in tissue
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in tissue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041018.definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in red blood cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in leukocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in leukocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in leukocytes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in leukocytes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: An abnormality in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level, an enzyme that catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in plasma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: An abnormality in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in plasma. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Increased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in plasma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: An increase in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in plasma. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Decreased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in plasma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: A decrease in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in plasma. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: An abnormality in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Increased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: An increase in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Decreased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: A decrease in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.label: Increased CSF urate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041019.definition: Increased concentration of urate in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Positive meconium barbiturate test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in meconium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Positive hair barbiturate test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in the hair.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Positive stool barbiturate test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in the stool.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Positive gastric fluid barbiturate test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in the gastric fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Increased intestinal transit time
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: An increase in the length of time required for food to pass through the intestines.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Abnormal circulating nicotinurate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of nicotinurate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Increased circulating nicotinurate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: An increased amount of nicotinurate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Positive methadone plasma/serum test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: Detection of methadone or its metabolite 2-ethylidene-1,5-dimethyl-3,3- diphenylpyrrolidine (EDDP) in plasma or serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Positive plasma/serum cotinine test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: Detection of cotinine, an alkaloid found in tobacco and the predominant metabolite of nicotine, in plasma or serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.label: Folate deficiency in CSF
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041020.definition: A reduced concentration of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9 in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.label: Abnormal cord blood measurement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.definition: An abnormality in any umbilical cord measurement performed after birth, such as the blood gas level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.label: Abnormal blood gas level in cord blood
Hyperoxemia in cord blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.definition: An abnormally high level of blood oxygen in the cord blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.label: Hypoxemia in cord blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.definition: An abnormally low level of blood oxygen in the cord blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.label: Hypercapnia in cord blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.definition: Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level in the cord blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.label: Hypocapnia in cord blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.definition: Abnormally decreased blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level in the cord blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.label: Abnormal blood 5-methyltetrahydrofolate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.definition: An abnormal concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.label: Reduced blood 5-methyltetrahydrofolate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.definition: A decreased concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.label: Hypoplasia of maxilla relative to mandible
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.definition: Abnormally small dimension of the maxilla (upper jaw) relative to the mandible (lower jaw).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.label: Hypoplasia of mandible relative to maxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041021.definition: Abnormally small dimension of the mandible (lower jaw) relative to the maxilla (upper jaw).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-dairy protein IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against dairy proteins, including casein, alpha-lactalbumin, beta-lactoglobulin or bovine serum albumin contained in cow, sheep or goat milk and milk products.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-animal protein IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against animal proteins, such as albumins that are present in animal hair, dander, shed skin, saliva and urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-seafood IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against seafood, including fish, shrimp, lobster, crab, squid and abalone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-dust mite IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against dust mites, such as house dust mites.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-bacteria IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against bacteria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-drug IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against a drug or class of drugs, such as antibiotics.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-feather IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against feathers, which could be indicative of an allergy against feathers themselves, or mite allergens present in feathers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-food allergen IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against proteins found in foods, such as milk, egg, soy, wheat, peanut, treenut, fish, and shellfish.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-plant based food allergen IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against a plant based food allergen, including vegetables and fruits.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.label: Increased anti-gluten IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041022.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.label: Increased anti-nut food product IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against nut food products such as peanuts or tree nuts, such as hazelnuts, walnuts, cashews, and almonds.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.label: Increased anti-egg IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against eggs, including egg whites, egg yolks, and egg proteins such as ovoalbumin and ovomucoid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.label: Increased anti-fungi IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against fungus, such as molds like zygomycota, ascomycota and deuteromycota.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.label: Increased anti-meat allergen IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against meat, such as mammalian meat, including beef or pork, or poultry, like duck or chicken.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.label: Increased anti-parasite IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against parasites, such as helminths (parasitic worms, such as Ascaris lumbricoides, Trichuris trichiura, Ancylostoma duodenalis, Necator americanus, Strongyloides stercoralis) or parasites such as Toxoplasma gondii.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.label: Increased anti-insect IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against antigens from insects such as moths, mosquitos, or cockroaches.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.label: Increased anti-venom IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against venom from insects such as bees, wasps, hornets, yellowjackets.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.label: Increased anti-plant product IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against antigens from plants and products derived from plants, such as wood or pollen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.label: Positive urine norcotinine test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041023.definition: Detection of norcotinine, a metabolite of nicotine, in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Abnormal circulating IgA level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgA immunoglobulin in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Abnormal circulating IgE level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgE immunoglobulin in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Abnormal circulating IgG level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgG immunoglobulin in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Abnormal circulating IgM level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgM immunoglobulin in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Abnormal circulating IgD level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgD immunoglobulin in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Decreased circulating IgD
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin D (IgD) in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Increased circulating IgD level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin D in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Increased anti-animal dander IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against animal dander, tiny scales shed from animal skin or hair, such as from pet dogs or cats.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Increased anti-house dust mite IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against house dust mites, a common allergen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.label: Increased anti-alpha-gal IgE antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041024.definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against galactose-alpha-1, 3 galactose (alpha-gal), a carbohydrate found in mammalian meat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.label: Abnormal L-selectin shedding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.definition: An abnormality in the cleavage of L-selectin during the process of guiding neutrophils to the site of infection. Proteolytic cleavage of L-selectin results in rapid shedding from the cell surface, which has a role in neutrophil rolling and accumulation at the site of infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.label: Chronic neutropenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.definition: Neutropenia with an absolute neutrophil count (ANC) less than 1,500,000,000/L lasting for more than 3 months.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.label: Myeloid maturation arrest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.definition: Chornic neutropenia arising from an impaired proliferation and maturation of myeloid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.label: Cyclic neutropenia in myeloid maturation arrest in bone marrow
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.definition: Cyclic neutropenia arising from an impaired proliferation and maturation of myeloid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.label: Transient neutropenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.definition: A transient reduction in the number of neutrophils in the peripheral blood. Transient neutropenia is most commonly associated with viral infections, but other causes include drugs and autoimmunity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.label: Infection associated neutropenia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.definition: Transient neutropenia caused by an infection, such as with a virus, bacteria or protozoan.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.label: Neutrophilia in presence of infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.definition: An increased number of neutrophils circulating in the blood during an infection, such as with a bacteria, virus or fungus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.label: Neutrophilia in absence of infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.definition: An increased number of neutrophils circulating in the blood in the absence of an infection. Factors contributing to neutrophilia could include inflammation or congenital disorders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.label: Hepatopulmonary fusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041025.definition: Fusion of the liver with the lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Asymmetrical gluteal crease
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: The presence of an asymmetrical gluteal crease, the horizontal crease formed by the inferior aspect of the buttocks and the posterior upper leg.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Wide space between 4th and 5th toe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: A widely spaced gap between the fourth toe and the fifth (pinky) toe.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Lower cranial nerve dysfunction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: A functional abnormality affecting the lower cranial nerves, which include the paired 9th (glossopharyngeal), 10th (vagal), 11th (accessory) and 12th (hypoglossal) cranial nerves.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Brain imaging abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: An anomaly of metabolism or structure of the brain identified by imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Subglottic hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the airway, typically below the vocal chords, that can cause severe obstruction of the airway.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Supraglottic hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the upper part of the larynx (voice box) including the epiglottis; the area above the vocal cords.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Visceral hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: A hemangioma arising from within visceral structures, the internal organs of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Intestinal hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the intestines, which includes the bowel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Spleen hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.label: Labial hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041026.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the upper lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Esophageal hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Laryngeal hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the glottic or supraglottic regions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Vulvar hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the vulva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Retropharyngeal hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the retropharyngeal space, the portion of the peripharyngeal space that is located posterior to the pharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Paraspinal hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the paraspinal muscular region, the muscles next to the spine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Lumbosacral hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: A spinal cord hemangioma located in the lumbosacral spine region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Supraumbilical raphe
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: An abnormality of the sternum that presents at birth as a ventral sternal non-union defect, due to an abnormality of the fusion of the layers of the skin. It presents as a scar-like line that extends upward from the umbilicus (belly button).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Sternal pit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: A sternal pit is a small indentation or dimple in the skin overlying the sternum of the chest. In some cases, the skin defect can be linear, extending several inches over the sternum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Pituitary gland cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: A fluid-filled sacs that develop on or near the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.label: Atrophic pituitary gland
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041027.definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of the pituitary gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Pediatric onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: Onset of disease manifestations before adulthood, defined here as before the age of 16 years, but excluding neonatal or congenital onset.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Dyspepsia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: A heterogeneous group of symptoms that are localized in the epigastric region. Typical dyspeptic symptoms include postprandial fullness, early satiation, epigastric pain and epigastric burning, but other upper gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, belching or abdominal bloating often occur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Abnormal circulating amylase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Positive blood acetaminophen test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: Detection of acetaminophen in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Positive norpropoxyphene blood test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: Detection of norpropoxyphene in the blood, a major metabolite of the opioid analgesic drug dextropropoxyphene.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Positive meconium methadone test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: Detection of methadone or its metabolite 2-ethylidene-1,5-dimethyl-3,3- diphenylpyrrolidine (EDDP) in meconium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Positive blood molindone test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: Detection of molindone in the blood, an antipyschotic used for treatment of schizophrenia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Intrathoracic hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the intrathoracic or chest region.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Hyperamylasemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: Increased level of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.label: Hypoamylasemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041028.definition: Decreased level of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.label: Negativism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.definition: Opposing or not responding to instructions or external stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.label: Abnormal isohemagglutinin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.definition: An abnormal level of isohemagglutinin in the blood. An isohemagglutinin refers to the naturally occurring antibodies in the ABO blood group system (i.e., anti-A in a group B person, anti-B in a group A person, and anti-A, anti-B, and anti-A,B in a group O person).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.label: Absent isohemagglutinin level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.definition: Absent or undetectable level of isohemagglutinin. An isohemagglutinin refers to the naturally occurring antibodies in the ABO blood group system (i.e., anti-A in a group B person, anti-B in a group A person, and anti-A, anti-B, and anti-A,B in a group O person).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.label: Decreased specific antibody response to protein vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against proteins in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a tetanus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to hepatitis B vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a hepatisis B antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a tetanus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to hepatitis B vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a hepatitis B antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.label: Decreased specific antibody response to polysaccharide vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041029.definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to unconjugated pneumococcus vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a pneumococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to unconjugated pneumococcus vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a pneumococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Decreased specific antibody response to protein-conjugated polysaccharide vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against protein-conjugated polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to meningococcus vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a meningococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to meningococcus vaccine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a meningococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Positive stool methadone test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: Detection of methadone and its metabolites in the stool.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Decreased specific antibody response to infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: A reduced ability to synthesize antibodies against antigens from an infectious agent or pathogen (such as bacteria, viruses, parasites, etc.), as measured by antibody titer determination following infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.label: Alpha-aminoadipic aciduria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041030.definition: The concentration of alpha-aminoadipic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Abnormality of neutrophil morphology in CSF
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: An abnormal form or size of neutrophils in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Hyposegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in CSF
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: Hyposegmented (hypolobulated) or bilobed neutrophil nuclei in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Hypersegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in CSF
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: An excessive division of the lobes of the nucleus of a neutrophil in the cerebrospinal fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Abnormal urinary 1-methylhistidine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: Abnormal concentration of 1-methylhistidine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Decreased urinary 1-methylhistidine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: Decreased concentration of 1-methylhistidine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Increased urinary 1-methylhistidine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: Increased concentration of 1-methylhistidine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Abnormal urinary 3-methylhistidine level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: Abnormal amount of 3-methylhistidine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Increased urinary 3-methylhistidine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: Increased concentration of 3-methylhistidine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Decreased urinary 3-methylhistidine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: Decreased concentration of 3-methylhistidine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.label: Alpha-gal allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041031.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against alpha-gal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.label: Animal protein allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against animal proteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.label: Animal dander allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against animal dander.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.label: Bacteria allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against bacteria.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.label: Drug allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against drugs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.label: Dust mite allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against dust mites.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.label: Feather allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against feathers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.label: Dairy allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against dairy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.label: Egg allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against eggs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.label: Gluten allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041032.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against gluten.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Meat allergen allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against allergens contained in meat products.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Nut food product allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against nut food products.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Plant based food allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against plant based food allergens.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Seafood allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against seafood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Fungi allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against fungus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Insect allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against insects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Venom allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against insect venom.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Parasite allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against parasites.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Plant product allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against plant products.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.label: Insect bite allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041033.definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against insect bites.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Focal epithelial hyperplasia of oral mucosa
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: The occurrence of multiple or unique whitish or normal in color small papules or nodules in oral cavity, especially on labial and buccal mucosa, lower lip and tongue, and less often on the upper lip, gingiva and palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Abnormal circulating heparan sulfate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: An abnormal level of heparan sulfate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Increased circulating heparan sulfate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of heparan sulfate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Decreased circulating heparan sulfate level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of heparan sulfate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Shortened O-fucosylated glycan on properdin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: Decreased length of O-fucosylated glycans present on properdin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Increased urinary polyhexose
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of polyhexose in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Increased urinary galactosylated oligosaccharide
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of galactosylated oligosaccharides in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Increased urinary high-mannose-type oligosaccharide
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of high-mannose-type oligosaccharides in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Increased urinary multiantennary sialylated oligosaccharide
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of multiantennary sialylated oligosaccharides in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.label: Decreased glycosyltransferase O-Fucosylpeptide 3-Beta-N-Acetylglucosaminyltransferase level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041034.definition: An abnormal decrease in glycosyltransferase O-fucosylpeptide 3-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase enzymatic level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Increased urinary fucosylated oligosaccharide
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentrationl of small fucosylated oligosaccharides in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Abnormal complex N-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Increased complex N-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Decreased complex N-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Increased sialylated N-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of sialylated N-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Decreased sialylated N-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of sialylated N-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Abnormal high-mannose N-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal concentration of high-mannose N-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Increased high-mannose N-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of high-mannose N-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Decreased high-mannose N-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of high-mannose N-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.label: Abnormal core 1 O-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041035.definition: An abnormal in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Increased core 1 O-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Decreased core 1 O-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Decreased O-mannosyl glycans on alpha-dystroglycan
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: Hypoglycosylation of alpha-dystroglycan with O-mannosyl glycans. Alpha-dystroglycan is a functional target of O-mannosyl glycosylation and functional glycosylation of alpha-DG is essential in its interaction with the extracellular matrix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Increased monosialylated core 1 O-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of monosialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Decreased monosialylated core 1 O-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of monosialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Increased disialylated core 1 O-glycan level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of disialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Increased globoside Gb4 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of globoside Gb4.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Increased hepatitis A virus antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis A virus in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Increased globoside Gb3 level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of glycolipid globoside Gb3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.label: Increased hepatitis B virus antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041036.definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis B virus in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.label: Increased hepatitis C virus antibody level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis C virus in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.label: Increased Tn-antigen level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of Tn antigen on glycoproteins.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.label: Abnormal proportion of naive CD4 T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of naive CD4 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.label: Abnormal proportion of naive CD8 T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.label: Increased proportion of naive CD4 T cells
Increased proportion of naive CD8 T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.definition: An abnormally increased proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.label: Decreased proportion of naive CD8 T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.definition: An abnormally reduced proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.label: Decreased proportion of naive CD4 T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.definition: An abnormally reduced proportion of naive CD4 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.label: Abnormal proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041037.definition: An abnormal proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.label: Abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.definition: An abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. A CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell with memory phenotype is CD45RO and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.label: Abnormal proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.definition: An abnormal proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.label: obsolete Abnormal proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Abnormal proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.definition: An abnormal proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.label: Abnormal proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.definition: An abnormal proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.label: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.definition: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. A CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell with memory phenotype is CD45RO and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.label: Decreased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.definition: Decresaed proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.label: obsolete Decreased proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Decreased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.definition: A reduced proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.label: Decreased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041038.definition: A reduced proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta central memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.label: Decreased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.definition: A reduced proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta effector memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.label: Increased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.label: Increased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CD45RO and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.label: Increased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.label: Increased proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.label: Increased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.definition: An increased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.label: Increased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
