http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.definition: An increased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.label: Bronchiolectasis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.definition: Saccular dilatation of the terminal bronchioles.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.label: Positive blood lead test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041039.definition: Detection of lead in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041040.label: Absent sebaceous glands
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041040.definition: Absence of the sebaceous gland, the holocrine gland that secretes sebum into the hair follicles, or in hairless areas into ducts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041040.label: Worse in evening
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_041040.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is exacerbated in the evening as compared to the day.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.label: Abnormal frontal bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.definition: An abnormality of the frontal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.label: Abnormal lacrimal bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.definition: An abnormality of the lacrimal bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.label: Abnormal palatine bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.definition: An abnormality of the palatine bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.label: Abnormal ethmoid bone morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.definition: An abnormality of the ethmoid bone

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.label: Ectopic cilia of eyelid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.definition: An eyelash that emerges from the underside (conjunctiva) of the upper or lower eyelid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.label: Symblepharon
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.definition: A partial or complete adhesion of the palpebral conjunctiva of the eyelid to the bulbar conjunctiva of the eyeball.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.label: Accessory eyelid
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043000.definition: The presence of more than the normal number of eyelids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Microblepharia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: Abnormal shortness of the vertical dimensions of the eyelids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Defect of palpebral conjunctiva
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: An abnormality of the palpebral conjunctiva.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Incomplete ossification of palatine bone
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: Failure to complete ossification (maturation and calcification) of the palatine bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Absent palatine bone ossification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: Lack of formation of the palatine bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Abnormality of musculature of soft palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: An abnormality of one or more of the five muscles of the soft palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Abnormal morphology of musculature of pharynx
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: An abnormality of any of the muscles of the pharynx.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Abnormality of tensor veli palatini muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: An abnormality of the tensor veli palatini muscle

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Abnormality of uvular muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: An abnormality of the uvular muscle

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Abnormality of nasal musculature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: An abnormality of the muscles of the structure of the nose.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.label: Abnormality of muscle of facial expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043001.definition: An abnormality of any of the muscles of facial expression, which are innervated by the seventh (VII) cranial nerve and control facial expression.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.label: Abnormality of levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.definition: An abnormality of the levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.label: Abnormal common carotid artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.definition: An abnormality of the common carotid arteries, which provide the arterial supply to the head and neck and give rise to the internal carotid artery and the external carotid artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.label: Abnormality of the sphenoid sinus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.definition: An abnormality of the sphenoid sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The sphenoid sinus is located within the sphenoid bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.label: Abnormality of the maxillary sinus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.definition: An abnormality of the maxillary sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The maxillary sinus is located within the skeleton of the midface, lateral to the nasal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.label: Abnormality of external jugular vein
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.definition: An abnormality of an external jugular vein of the neck.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.label: Bilateral facial palsy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.definition: Two-sided or bilateral weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.label: obsolete Abnormality of the shape of the midface
Hyperplasia of the maxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.definition: Abnormally increased dimension of the maxilla, especially relative to the mandible, resulting in a malocclusion or malalignment between the upper and lower teeth or in anterior positioning of the nasal base, increased convexity of the face, increased nasolabial angle, or increased width (transverse dimension of the maxilla.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.label: Hyperplasia of the premaxilla
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_043002.definition: An abnormality of the premaxilla (the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla) causing it to appear relatively large in size compared to the other parts of the maxilla or other facial structures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.label: Body odor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.definition: A perceived unpleasant smell given off by the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.label: Anal pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.definition: Pain in and around the anus or rectum (perianal region).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.label: Iris flocculi
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.definition: Multiple cysts along the pupillary margin that appear as spherical or tear-drop-shaped pigmented lesions or wrinkled masses emerging from the pupillary border of the iris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.label: Cornea verticillata
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.definition: Golden brown or gray deposits with a clockwise, whorl-like distribution in the inferior interpalpebal portion of the cornea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.label: Dysplastic gangliocytoma of the cerebellum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050000.definition: It is a rare, slowly growing tumor of the cerebellum, a gangliocytoma sometimes considered to be a hamartoma, characterized by diffuse hypertrophy of the granular layer of the cerebellum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.label: Moon facies
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.definition: A rounded, puffy face with fat deposits in the temporal fossa and cheeks, a double chin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.label: Abnormal gonadotropin-releasing hormone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.definition: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of the normal gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH). Intermittent GnRH secretion from the hypothalamus acts upon its receptor in the anterior pituitary to regulate the production and release of the gonadotropins, follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.label: Lack of gonadotropin-releasing hormone pulsatility
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.definition: Secretion of gonadotropin-releasing hormone that does not occur in a pulsatile fashion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.label: Abnormal cardiac test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.definition: Abnormal test result of cardiovascular physiology.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.label: Abnormal cardiac MRI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.definition: Abnormal results of a MRI for the heart.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.label: Abnormal cardiac catheterization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.definition: Abnormal results from the diagnostic tests resulting from cardiac catheterization.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.label: Abnormal cardiac exercise stress test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.definition: Abnormal results of exercise on heart function.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.label: Abnormal resting energy expenditure from metabolic cart test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050001.definition: Resting energy expenditure (REE) can be measured with indirect calorimetry using a metabolic cart, which is used to measure the oxygen consumption (VO2) and carbon dioxide production (VCO2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.label: Abnormal cardiac biomarker test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.definition: Abnormal blood test results measuring creatine kinase (CK), CK-MB, troponin (TROPI), myoglobin, and/or cardiac enzymes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.label: Reduced brain gamma-aminobutyric acid level by MRS
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.definition: An decreased level of gamma-aminobutyric acid in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.label: Abnormal circulating dehydroepiandrosterone concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of dehydroepiandrosterone in the circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.label: Aplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.definition: Absence of the musculature of the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.label: Hypoplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.definition: Underdevelopment of the musculature of the pelvis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.label: Cotton wool plaques
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050002.definition: Deposition of large, diffuse cotton wool amyloid plaques (CWPs) lacking a dense core and associated neuritic changes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.label: Abnormal hepatic glycogen storage
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.definition: Change in normal glycogen storage content.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.label: Sclerosis of the carpal bones
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more carpal bones of the hand.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.label: Abnormal neuron branching
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.definition: Abnormality of the structure and branching of the dendrites of a neuron.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.label: Abnormal natural killer subset distribution
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.definition: Any abnormality in the proportion natural killer subsets relative to the total number of natural killer cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.label: Nasolacrimal sac granuloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.definition: A mass of granulation tissue in response to chronic dacryocystitis as polypoid formations or they follow accidental injury, from probing and as a reaction to retained foreign bodies in the sac.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.label: Nasolacrimal sac papilloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.definition: Benign tumor of the nasolacrimal sac.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.label: Nasolacrimal sac epithelial papillary carcinoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.definition: The malignant epithelial neoplasm with papillary growths in the nasolacrimal sac.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.label: Conjunctival cicatrization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050003.definition: An abnormality of the conjuctiva and ocular surface caused by conjunctival inflammation and associated with scarring.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Dermolipoma of the conjunctiva
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: A benign tumor composed of adipose tissue and dense connective tissue usually located near the temporal fornix.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Myopic astigmatism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: A condition where one or both of the two principal meridians focus in the front of the retina when the eye is at rest.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Latent hypermetropia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: A term to describe when farsightedness is masked when the accommodative muscles are used to increase the focusing power of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Eyelid retraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: With the eyes in primary position, the sclera is visible above the superior corneal limbus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Upper eyelid retraction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: An elevation of the eyelid above the normal level in the primary position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Collier's sign
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: A unilateral or bilateral eyelid retraction due to midbrain lesions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Seborrhoeic blepharitis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: Inflammation of the eyelid due to overactivity of the sebaceous gland.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Nasolacrimal sac lymphoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: A type of lymphoma that involves the nasolacrimal sac.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Delayed canalization of nasolacrimal duct
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: A very common condition in which the extreme end of the nasolacrimal duct underneath the inferior turbinate fails to complete its canalization in the newborn period.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.label: Retinopathy of prematurity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050004.definition: An avascular or abnormally vascularized retina that occurs in premature infants and can lead to blindness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: The retinal vessels stop and then a linear flat white line is present that usually runs the circumference of the vascular retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: The accumulating neovascularization thickens and manifests as a linear bump. The neovascularization remains along the surface of the retina and does not extend off the retina into the cortical vitreous.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 3
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: The neovascularization accumulates at the edge of the vascularized retina and extends into the vitreous (also called extra retinal fibrosis proliferation). In cases of Zone 2 and Zone 3, this may be sausage shaped. In more posterior Zone 1 disease, the stage 3 can appear as a direct extension of the normal retinal vessels but extending tangentially over the avascular retina.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 4
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: Scar tissue that forms a continuous sheet coming up from the edge of the vascularized retina. This scar tissue can grow toward the vitreous base/posterior lens capsule resulting in traction, distortion, and even detachment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 4a
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: A detachment that involves the peripheral retina that does not extend into the macula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 4b
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: A detachment that involves the peripheral retina that involves the macula itself. The detachment usually starts in the temporal periphery although can also involve the nasal retina as well.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: Funnel detachment from the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5a
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: An open funnel detachment of the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5b
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: A closed funnel detachment of the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.label: Retinopathy of prematurity zone I
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050005.definition: Retinopathy which extends from the center of the optic disc to twice the distance from the center of the optic disc to the center of the macula.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.label: Retinopathy of prematurity zone II
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.definition: Retinopathy which extends centrifugally from the edge of zone I to the nasal ora serrata.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.label: Retinopathy of prematurity zone III
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.definition: Retinopathy which is a residual crescent of retina anterior to zone II.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.label: Retinopathy of prematurity plus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.definition: Venous dilatation and arteriolar tortuosity of the posterior retinal vessels and may later increase in severity to include iris vascular engorgement, poor pupillary dilatation (rigid pupil), and vitreous haze. This definition has been further refined in the later clinical trials in which the diagnosis of plus disease could be made if sufficient vascular dilatation and tortuosity are present in at least 2 quadrants of the eye.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.label: Retinopathy of prematurity pre-plus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.definition: As vascular abnormalities of the posterior pole that are insufficient for the diagnosis of plus disease but that demonstrate more arterial tortuosity and more venous dilatation than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.label: Retinopathy of prematurity threshold
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.definition: A retinopathy with a 50% likelihood of progressing to retinal detachment. Threshold disease is considered to be present when stage 3 retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) is present in either zone I or zone II, with at least 5 continuous or 8 total clock hours of disease, and the presence of plus disease.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.label: Retinopathy of prematurity prethreshold
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.definition: High risk patients who were in Zone 1 (no Plus or stage 3) or Zone 2 with Plus or stage 3 but not both.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.label: Latent myopia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.definition: The difference between total and manifest myopia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.label: Paralytic ectropion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050006.definition: A type of ectropion associated with orbicularis muscle weakness caused by cranial nerve VII palsy.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.label: Conjunctival dermolipoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.definition: A conjuctival lesion composed of adipose tissue and dense connective tissue. Such choristomas of dermal elements are normally found at the outer canthus, and have a gelatinous appearance. Classically, there is an indistinct posterior border (with the lesion frequently extending into the orbit) and a well-demarcated anterior border several millimetres posterior to the limbus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.label: Absolute eccentric fixation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.definition: Eccentric fixation in which the angle of eccentricity equals the objective angle of deviation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.label: Abnormal ocular alignment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.definition: Any deviation from the normal ocular alignment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.label: Dissociated vertical deviation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.definition: An incomitant tendency for an occluded eye to elevate and extort which resolves on uncovering.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.label: Dissociated horizontal deviation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.definition: A change in horizontal ocular alignment, unrelated to accommodation, that is brought about solely by a change in the balance of visual input from the two eyes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.label: Alternating hypertropia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.definition: A type of vertical tropia in which, when one eye is fixing, the other eye is deviated upwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.label: Alternating hyperphoria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.definition: A type of vertical phoria in which, in dissociation, the occluded eye deviates upwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.label: Alternating hypotropia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.definition: A type of vertical tropia in which, when one eye is fixing, the other eye is deviated downwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.label: Alternating hypophoria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050007.definition: A type of vertical phoria in which, in dissociation, the occluded eye deviates downwards.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.label: Pseudophakia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.definition: The term pseudophakia refers to having an artificial lens implanted after the natural eye lens has been removed. During cataract surgery the natural cloudy lens is replaced by an pseudophakia intraocular lens (IOL).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.label: Optic nerve gray crescent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.definition: Having a characteristic appearance of a slate gray area of pigmentation within the disc margins that commonly appears along the inferotemporal or temporal neuroretinal rim areas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.label: Peripapillary atrophy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.definition: Thinning in the layers of the retina and retinal pigment epithelium around the optic nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.label: Foveal depigmentation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.definition: Loss of pigment in the fovea centralis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.label: Optic nerve sheath meningioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050008.definition: A benign tumor of meningothelial cells of the meninges that usually occurs in middle age. It is typically unilateral and there is an association with neurofibromatosis type 2.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.label: Periocular capillary hemangioma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.definition: A capillary hemangioma surrounding the eyeball but within the orbit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.label: Lymphangioma of the orbit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.definition: A hamartoma of lymph vessels that usually presents in childhood. It tends to increase in size with head-down posture and with the Valsalva manoeuvre. Superficial lesions are visible as transilluminable cystic spaces of the lid or conjunctiva that may also contain blood. Deep lesions may cause gradual proptosis or present acutely with orbital pain and reduced vision due to haemorrhage.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.label: Orbital rhabdomyosarcoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.definition: A mesenchymal tumor that is considered to be the commonest primary orbital malignancy in children. Histologically, it may be differentiated into embryonal, alveolar, and pleomorphic types. It is usually intraconal or within the superior orbit.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.label: Food allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.definition: Primary food allergies primarily occur as a result (most likely) of gastrointestinal sensitization to predominantly stable food allergens (glycoproteins). A secondary food allergy develops after primary sensitization to airborne allergens (e. g., pollen allergens) with subsequent reactions (due to cross-reactivity) to structurally related often labile allergens in (plant) foods.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.label: Latex allergy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.definition: Latex allergy is an IgE-mediated immediate hypersensitivity response to natural rubber latex (NRL) protein with a variety of clinical signs ranging from contact urticaria, angioedema, asthma, and anaphylaxis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.label: Food-induced anaphylaxis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.definition: Food-induced anaphylaxis is a severe, potentially fatal, systemic allergic reaction that occurs suddenly after contact with an allergy-causing food.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.label: Venom-induced anaphylaxis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.definition: A form of anaphylaxis that is triggered by exposure to venom.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.label: Meconium xenobiotic
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050009.definition: Presence of a xenobiotic in meconium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.label: Plasma/serum xenobiotic
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.definition: Presence of a xenobiotic in plasma and/or serum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.label: Gastric fluid xenobiotic
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.definition: Presence of a xenobiotic in gastric fluid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.label: Decreased diastolic blood pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.definition: Abnormal decrease in diastolic blood pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.label: Decreased systolic blood pressure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.definition: Abnormal decrease in systolic blood pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.label: Isolated systolic hypertension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.definition: Elevated systolic blood pressure without an elevated blood pressure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.label: Isolated diastolic hypotension
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.definition: A decrease in diastolic blood pressure (<60 mmHg) without a decrease in systolic blood pressure (> or = to 100 mmHg).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.label: Positive urine cocaine test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.definition: Detection of cocaine or its major metabolite, benzoylecgonine, in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.label: Positive urine barbiturate test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050010.definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as Phenobarbital in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.label: Positive urine cannabinoid test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.definition: Detection of delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) or other cannabinoid metabolites in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.label: Positive urine benzodiazepines test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.definition: Detection of benzodiazepine metabolites, primarily nordiazepam, oxazepam, and temazepam, in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.label: Positive urine amphetamine test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.definition: Detection of amphetamine or its metabolites in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.label: Positive urine opioid test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.definition: Detection of opioids or opioid metabolites in urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.label: Abnormal stool urobilinogen concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.definition: Abnormal concentration of urobilinogen present in the stool.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.label: Increased stool urobilinogen concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.definition: An increased amount of urobilinogen present in the stool.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.label: Positive blood barbiturate test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as Phenobarbital in blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.label: Abnormal CSF urate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050011.definition: Abnormal concentration of urate in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.label: Hypovalinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.definition: A decreased amount of valine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.label: Hypotyrosinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.definition: An decreased concentration of tyrosine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.label: Hypertryptophanemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.definition: An increased amount of tryptophan in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.label: Hypotryptophanemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.definition: A decreased amount of tryptophan in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.label: Hypothreoninemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.definition: A decreased amount of threonine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.label: Hyperserinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.definition: An increased amount of serine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050013.definition: A decreased amount of proline in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.definition: A decreased amount of hydroxyproline in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.definition: A decreased amount of phenylalanine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.definition: A decreased amount of lysine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.definition: A decreased amount of histidine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.label: Hypoglutaminemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.definition: Decreased amount of glutamine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.label: Abnormal circulating glutamate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glutamate in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.label: Hyperglutamatemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050014.definition: Concentration of glutamate in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.label: Hypoglutamatemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.definition: A decreased amount of glutamate in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.label: Hypercystinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.definition: An increased amount of cystine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.label: Hypocystinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.definition: A decreased amount of cystine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.label: Hyperargininemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.definition: An increased amount of arginine levels in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.definition: A decreased amount of alanine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.label: Abnormal circulating asparagine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of asparagine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.label: Hyperasparaginemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.definition: An increased amount of asparagine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.definition: A decreased amount of asparagine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.label: Abnormal circulating aspartic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of aspartate in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050015.label: Increased circulating aspartic acid concentration

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of carnosine in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.label: Increased level of carnosine in blood
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.definition: An increased amount of carnosine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.definition: A decreased amount of carnosine in bood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.label: Hypoornithinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.definition: An abnormal decrease in ornithine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.label: Abnormal blood carbon dioxide level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.definition: An abnormality of carbon dioxide (CO2) in the arterial blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.label: Abnormal blood oxygen level
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.definition: An abnormality of the partial pressure of oxygen in the arterial blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.label: Abnormal circulating gastrin concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.definition: An abnormal concentration of gastrin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.label: Hypergastrinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050016.definition: An elevated amount of gastrin in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050017.label: Abnormal concentration of acylcarnitine in the urine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050017.definition: An abnormal amount of acylcarnitine in the urine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050017.label: Reflex asystolic syncope
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050017.definition: A loss of consciousness followed by stiffening and brief clonic movements affecting some or all limbs, often misinterpreted as an epileptic seizure.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050018.label: Abnormal circulating amino sulfonic acid concentration
Hypertaurinemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_050018.definition: An increased amount of taurine in the blood.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_055000.definition: Symmetrical thickening, tightening and induration of the skin of the fingers and the skin proximal to the metacarpophalangeal or metatarsophalangeal joints. These changes can involve the entire limb, face, neck and trunk.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_055000.label: Bilateral basilar pulmonary fibrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_055000.definition: It is a bilateral reticular pattern of linear or lineonodular densities that are most pronounced in basilar portions of the lungs on standard chest x-ray. It is the third minor criterion for scleroderma diagnosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300005.definition: A structural anomaly of the hypopharyx, which is the most inferior portion of the pharynx. The hypopharynx continues from the oropharynx at the pharyngoepiglottic fold superiorly and extends inferiorly to the level of the inferior aspect of the cricoid cartilage, which marks the beginning of the cervical esophagus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300006.definition: An abnormality of a lateral rectus extra-ocular muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormality of levator anguli oris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: An abnormality of a levator anguli oris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormality of levator labii superioris
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: An abnormality of a levator labii superioris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormal levator palpebrae superioris morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: An abnormality of a levator palpebrae superioris.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormality of levator veli palatini muscle
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: An abnormality of a levator veli palatini.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormal lingual artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: Any structural abnormality of a lingual artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormal lingual nerve morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: Any structural anomaly of a lingual nerve.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormality of lingual tonsil
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: An abnormality of a lingual tonsil.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormal mandible condylar process morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: An abnormality of a mandible condylar process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormal mandible coronoid process morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: An abnormality of a mandible coronoid process.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.label: Abnormal mandibular symphysis morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_300007.definition: A structural abnormality of a mandibular symphysis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.label: Abnormal cardiac magnetic resonance imaging finding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.definition: Abnormal finding by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), which uses non-ionizing radiation via a strong magnetic field and radio frequency energy to generate three dimensional images. This term comprises findings that are specific to MRI. Findings such as ventricular spetum defect that can be detected by multiple modalities should be coded separately.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.label: Elevated myocardial native T2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.definition: Increased duration of myocardial T2 time without gadolinium contrast. Elevated T2, which can detect myocardial edema.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.label: Myocardial late gadolinium enhancement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.definition: Areas of high signal intensity in magnetic resonance imaging of the heart appearing 10 to 15 minutes after injection of the intercellular contrast agent gadolinium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.label: Pericardial late gadolinium enhancement
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.definition: Areas of high signal intensity in magnetic resonance imaging of the pericardium appearing around 10 minutes after injection of the intercellular contrast agent gadolinium.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.label: Elevated myocardial native T1
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.definition: Increased duration of myocardial T1 time without gadolinium contrast. T1 mapping consists of quantifying the T1 relaxation time of a tissue by using analytical expressions of image-based signal intensities. A fundamental principle of MR imaging is that the signal intensity of pixels is based on the relaxation of hydrogen nuclei protons in a static magnetic field. The T1 relaxation times between two tissues vary substantially. Edema, fat infiltration, and fibrosis also cause differences in T1 relaxivity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.label: Bronchoconstriction
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.definition: Tightening of smooth muscle surrounding the bronchi and bronchioles with consequent wheezing and shortness of breath.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.label: Formation of multiple pronuclei during fertilization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.definition: Pronuclei formation is a critical process during fertilisation. Normally, there are two pronuclei (2PN), including the paternal pronucleus and the maternal pronucleus, in the zygote after fertilisation. It is generally accepted that multiple pronuclei (MPN) formation is due to the abnormal extrusion of the second polar body or to abnormal fertilisation with multiple sperm. The MPN therefore can cause infertility and recurrent failure of IVF/ICSI.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.label: Kinesiophobia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400000.definition: An excessive, irrational, and debilitating fear of carrying out a physical movement due to a feeling of vulnerability to painful injury or reinjury.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.label: Impaired renal tubular reabsorption of bicarbonate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.definition: Decreased renal tubular reabsorption of bicarbonate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.label: History of congenital HPV infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.definition: A congenital human papillomavirus (HPV) infection of the newborn. Congential HPV infection can manifest as condyloma cuminata in the newborn.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.label: Anti-desmoglein-1 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against desmoglein-1, a dermal cell adhesion molecule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.label: Anti-desmoglein-3 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against desmoglein-3, a dermal cell adhesion molecule.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.label: Anti-envoplakin antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against envoplakin, a cytoskeletal linker protein that links intermediate filaments to cellular junctions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.label: Anti-periplakin antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against periplakin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.label: Anti-desmoplakin I antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against desmoplakin-1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.label: Anti-desmoplakin II antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against desmoplakin-II.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.label: Anti-BP230 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against BP230.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: Anti-BP180 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against BP180.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: Anti-laminin 332 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against laminin-332.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: Anti-laminin 6 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against laminin-6.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: Anti-laminin gamma1 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against laminin gamma-1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: Anti-laminin antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against a laminin. Laminins are major components of the basement membrane.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: Anti-integrin antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against an integrin. Integrins are a family of cell adhesion molecules with 24 known integrin heterodimers. Integrins transduce mechanical and biochemical signals from fibrotic extracellular matrix into the cell, activate latent TGFbeta, and subsequently modulate fibroblast adhesion, migration, and growth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: Anti-transglutaminase 6 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against transglutaminase 6.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: anti-LAD-1 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against LAD-1, which is the soluble 120 kDa ectodomain of BP180.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: Anti-LABD97 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against LABD97, which is structurally identical to a portion of the extracellular domain of BPAg2. BPAg2, a 180 kDa bullous pemphigoid antigen, is a transmembrane protein important for basement membrane cohesion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.label: Antigliadin antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against gliadin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.label: Anti-reticulin antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against reticulin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.label: Anti-type VII collagen antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against collagen type VII.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.label: False perception of self-motion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.definition: A perception that one's body is moving or swaying despite lack of motion of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.label: Non-spinning vertigo
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.definition: A perception of unsteadiness of dizziness that is not characterized bythe spinning sensation of classic vertigo, but rather by an oscillatory perception (rocking, bobbing, or swaying despite the fact that the subject is not moving).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.label: Primary obstructive megaureter
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.definition: Megaurater associated with obstruction or an adynamic ureteral segment in the ureterovesical junction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.label: Encysted hydrocele of the cord
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.definition: A type of hydrocele testis in which both the proximal and distal portions of processus vaginalis get obliterated while the central portion remains patent and fluid accumulates within it.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.label: Congenital hydrocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.definition: Congenital hydrocele occurs when processus vaginalis is patent and communicates with the peritoneal cavity. This communication allows the movement of peritoneal fluid but is too small to allow the intra-abdominal contents to herniate through.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.label: Infantile hydrocele
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.definition: Infantile Hydrocele is a type pf hydrocele in which the processus vaginalis gets obliterated at the level of the deep inguinal ring. However, the portion distal to it remains patent and allows fluid accumulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.label: Reduced proportion of mucosal-associated invariant T cells
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400003.definition: A decreased proportion of circulating mucosal-associated invariant T (MAIT) cells relative to total T cell count.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: Puerpural onset
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: Onset of a phenotypic abnormality or a disease during childbirth or in the period immediately following.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: AA amyloidosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: Extracellular tissue deposition of fibrils that are composed of fragments of and/or intact serum amyloid A protein, a hepatic acute phase reactant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: Fracture type
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: Category of fracture. Terms from this subontology can be used together with terms in the subontology that descends from Bone fracture (HP:0020110).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: Greenstick fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: A type of fracture in which the broken bone is not completely separated.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: Transverse fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: A type of fracture in which the break is in a straight line across the bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: Spiral fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: A type of fracture in which the break spirals around the bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: Oblique fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: A type of fracture in which there is a diagonal break across the bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: Compression fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: A type of fracture in which the bone is crushed, causing the broken bone to be wider or flatter in appearance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: Comminuted fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: A type of fracture in which the break is in three or more pieces and fragments are present at the fracture site.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.label: Segmental fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400004.definition: A type of fracture in which the same bone is fractured in two places, so there is a floating segment of bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.label: Open fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.definition: A type of fracture in which there is an open wound or break in the skin near the site of the broken bone.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.label: Closed fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.definition: A type of fracture in which the broken bone that does not penetrate the skin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.label: Avulsion fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.definition: A type of fracture that is localied near to a a tendon or ligament and a small fragment of bone is separated from the main mass of bone as a result of physical trauma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.label: Displaced fracture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.definition: A type of fracture in which the ends of the fractured bone are no longer aligned.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.label: Intestinal inflammation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.definition: A reaction characterizeds by capillary dilatation, leukocytic infiltration, redness, heat, pain, swelling localized to the in the intestinal tract.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.label: Abnormal apoptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.definition: Any abnormality of programmed cell death (apoptosis), which is defined as the orchestrated collapse of a cell characterised by membrane blebbing, cell shrinkage, condensation of chromatin, and fragmentation of DNA followed by rapid engulfment of the corpse by neighbouring cells. Apoptosis is distinguished from death by necrosis by the absence of an associated inflammatory response.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.label: Decreased FasL-mediated apoptosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.definition: A reduced amount of programmed cell death upon stimulation of the FAS receptor, which normally induces caspase-8 dependent apoptosis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.label: Glomerular proteinuria
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.definition: A type of proteinuria characterized by increased permeability of the glomerular capillary wall to macromolecules (particularly albumin), whereby protein excretion can reach 20 g/24 h and consists mainly of albumin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.label: Abnormal lung development
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400005.definition: A structural defect associated with abnormal development of the lung.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.label: Pancreatic alpha-cell hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.definition: A diffuse and specific increase in the number of alpha-cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.label: 3-4 metacarpal synostosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.definition: A congenital hand malformation characterized by the coalescence of the coalescence of third and fourth metacarpals (i.e., those corresponding to the middle and ring fingers).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.label: Abnormal iliac artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.definition: Any structural anomaly of the iliac artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.label: Iliac artery aneurysm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the iliac artery.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.label: Abnormal interest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.definition: Any deviation from normal intensity or subject of a person's interests, which can be defined as a state of giving selective attention to something.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.label: Persistent preoccupation with parts of objects
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400006.definition: A type of abnormal interest characterized by a persistent and intense focus on parts of a toy/object. For example, affected individuals may spin the wheels on a toy car rather than drive the toy car.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.label: Fixated interests
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.definition: Highly restricted, fixated interests that are abnormal in intensity or focus (e.g., strong attachment to or preoccupation with unusual objects, excessively circumscribed or perseverative interests).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.label: Abnormal language feature
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.definition: The presence of any atypical form of expressive language.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.label: Pronoun reversal
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.definition: Atypical language features characterized by first vs. second or third person pronoun errors such as using 'you' or 'he/she' in place of 'I'.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.label: Idiosyncratic language
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.definition: Consistent use of an unusual way of referring to something that is idiosyncratic to the individual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.label: Reduced frequency of facial expressions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.definition: The number of times facial expressions are produced in a given period is lower than expected given the social and cultural context.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.label: Use of another person's body to communicate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.definition: Moving another person's hand, body part, or body to communicate a desire, e.g. pushing or pulling someone toward a desired object or placing someone's hand on something.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.label: Fixated interest with abnormal focus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.definition: A fixated interest in a specific topic that is atypical for the social context of the individual, such as topics of a non-social nature like fossils or vacuum cleaners.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.label: Fixated interest with abnormal intensity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.definition: An abnormally intense interest in a topic or object that is not atypical for the social context of the affected person.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.label: Sensory seeking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400007.definition: Unusual interest in sensory aspects of the environment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.label: Reduced production of gestures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.definition: Diminished use of typical non-verbal conversational gestures such as shaking the head to indicate no or nodding the head to indicate yes.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.label: Reduced collaborative play
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.definition: Impairment in a child's ability to be able to play in a way that involves peer collaboration. Collaborative play involves things such as verbal and non-verbal communication (e.g., self-initiated interactions), turn-taking, sharing, reciprocity, and collaborative problem-solving. It is often contrasted to parallel play, which involves a form of social play in which two children do similar activities near each other and often mimic each other. Typically developing children develop collaborative play between the ages of 4 and 5.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.label: Ignores peers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.definition: Lack of interest in peers of comparable age and social groups is evident when an individual, such as a child, shows more interest in socializing with adults rather than children their own age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.label: Reduced sharing of interests
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.definition: Decreased sharing of interests with others appropriate to culture and developmental level.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.label: Reduced object sharing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.definition: An absence or reduction in object sharing. Object sharing is an early emerging social skill in which a child will share objects with parents or peers during object play. Object sharing typically develops within the first two years of life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.label: Abnormal communicative facial expressions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.definition: Abnormal expressions (movements or position of muscles of the face that convey the emotional state of an individual to observers during social interactions) comprising abnormalities of quantity, range, context-appropriateness, and quality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.label: Facial expressions that do not match the context
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.definition: Production of facial expressions that are misaligned with the social context.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.label: Abnormal quality of facial expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400008.definition: Spontaneous production of communicative facial expressions that have poor quality or are exaggerated or muted.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.label: Abnormal gesture use
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.definition: Abnormality in the use of gestures defined as hand, shoulder, and head movements that convey a shared meaning within a culture that replace or supplement verbal communication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.label: Poor conversational reciprocity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.definition: Reduced ability to conduct a reciprocal (back and forth) conversation, as expected for language level. May be characterized by deficits in the ability to make comments about discussion topics of others, failure to ask questions, and not building a conversation on comments of others. Affected persons may not know what to say next in a conversation, may not notice if others are bored with a given topic, may conduct a one-sided conversation (talking but not listening), or may veer off topic more than is socially acceptable.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.label: Ectopic tooth eruption
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.definition: A condition in which the permanent teeth, because of deficiency of growth in the jaw or segment of jaw, assume a path of eruption that intercepts a primary tooth, causes its premature loss and produces a consequent malposition of the permanent tooth.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.label: Corpus cavernosum hypoplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by undergrowth of the corpus cavernosum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.label: Elevated circulating thymine concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400009.definition: Concentration of the nucleobase thymine in the blood circulation above the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Positive lactose hydrogen breath test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: Elevated hydrogen gas level in exhaled breath following oral administration of lactose. In individuals with lactose intolerance, undigested lactose in the colon will be metabolized by colonic bacteria, releasing hydrogen gas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Triggered by exposure to medication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to a medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Triggered by allopurinol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to allopurinol.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Ameliorated by oral zinc supplementation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by oral zinc supplementation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Curved dental root
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: A root of a tooth that is more rounded than normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Abnormal four chamber view of the fetal heart
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: The four-chamber (4Ch) view of the fetal heart is the most widely used screening examination for the detection of structural cardiac abnormalities during routine fetal ultrasonography. In the healthy normal fetus, the apical 4Ch view demonstrates four well-developed chambers, a concordant atrioventricular (AV) connection, unobstructed AV valves (mitral and tricuspid valves), the foramen ovale flap opening into left atrium (LA), and an intact interventricular septum. Additionally, the pulmonary venous opening can be visualized at the LA wall. Any structural deviations from normal anatomy may lead to congenital heart disease that can be determined by the 4Ch view of the fetal heart's ultrasound imaging.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Spleen hamartoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: A hamartomatous lesion (benign focal lesions composed of disorganized tissue elements) localized in the spleen.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Positive lupus band test
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: Deposits of immunoglobulins and complement components along the dermoepidermal junction.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Bone marrow erythroid vacuolization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: Formation of vacuoles (a space within a cell that is empty of cytoplasm, lined with a membrane, and filled with fluid) in the cytoplasm of erythroid precursors in the bone marrow.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.label: Triggered by electromagnetic field
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400010.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to an electromagnetic field.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.label: Exposure history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.definition: Information about current and past exposure to metals, dust, fibers, fumes, chemicals, biologic hazards, radiation, noise, and/or vibration at work or home.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.label: Asbestos exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.definition: History of exposure to asbestos, a fibrous mineral with physical and chemical properties that make it resistant to heat and degradation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.label: Medication history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.definition: Information about current or past medications taken by an individual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.label: Aminoglycoside exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.definition: History of having taken aminoglycoside antibiotics.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.label: Statin exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.definition: History of having taken statins, also known as HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.label: Potassium-sparing diuretic exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.definition: History of having taken a potassium-sparing diuretic exposure such as amiloride, eplerenone, spironolactone, and triamterene.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.label: Valproate exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.definition: History of having taken valproate (valproic acid).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.label: Calcium channel blocker exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400011.definition: History of having taken a calcium channel blocker such as amlodipine, nicardipine, nifedipine, verapamil, or diltiazem.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.label: Triggered by poison ivy, poson oak, or sumac
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure (cutaneous contact) to poison ivy, poison oak, and poison sumac. These three plants each contain urushiol. Contact with these plants is the most common causes of clinically diagnosed allergic contact dermatitis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.label: History of exclusive breast feeding
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.definition: A past medical history of having been fed exclusively by breast feeding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.label: Nutrition history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.definition: A part of the past medical history consisting of information about the typical food intake of an individual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.label: High dietary oxalate intake
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.definition: A history of ingestion of a relatively high amount of foods containing high levels of oxalate, such as green-leaf vegetables, tea, nuts, chocolate and rhubarb.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.label: Recent honey ingestion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.definition: A history of ingestion of honey in recent weeks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.label: Raw egg-white ingestion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.definition: A history of eating raw egg whites.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.label: Exacerbated by sodium channel blocking agent exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by administration of sodium channel blocking agents such as phenytoin, carbamazepine, oxcarbazepine, lamotrigine, topiramate, and zonisamide.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.label: Addictive nitrous oxide use
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.definition: Addiction to inhaled nitrous oxide gas (N2O) is a growing concern.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.label: Recent blood transfusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400012.definition: A past medical history of a recent blood transfusion.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: Ameliorated by colchicine
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by administration of colchizine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: Ameliorated by vitamin D
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by administration of vitamin D.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: Exacerbated by phenytoin exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by administration of phenytoin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: Triggered by angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to anngiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor such as benazepril, captopril, enalapril, fosinopril, and lisinopril.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: Prostaglandin E1 exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: History of having been treateed with prostaglandin E1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: 5-fluorouracil exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: History of having been treated with 5-fluorouracil.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: 6-mercaptopurine exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: History of having been treateed with 6-mercaptopurine.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: Isoniazid exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: History of having been treateed with isoniazid.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: Absent cavum septum pellucidum
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: The cavum septum pellucidum (CSP) is an important fetal midline forebrain landmark that is normally visible by prenatal sonography. This term refers to the lack of visiblity of the CSP on prenatal sonography. The CSP normally can be visualized between 18 and 37 weeks of gestation. Lack of visualization of the CSP in this time period generally requires follow up and may indicate the presence of underlying malformations such as malformations of the corpus callosum. The lack of CSP before 18 weeks or after 37 weeks of gestation (or postnatally) is considered a normal finding.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.label: Fetal abdominal cyst
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400013.definition: Fetal abdominal cysts are usually detected during the second trimester anomaly scan or discovered incidentally at later gestations. However, a definitive diagnosis is often not made until postnatal life. The most common etiologies of fetal abdominal cysts are: ovarian, gastrointestinal cystic duplication, liver and choledochal, meconium pseudocysts, mesenteric and adrenal. Following identification of a cyst, careful morphological assessment allows the prediction of their natural history and importantly, the likelihood of surgical intervention being required postnatally.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: Fetal bowel dilatation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: Fetal bowel dilatation is characterized by fluid-filled intestinal loops which measure at least fifteen millimeters long or seven millimeters in diameter. Ultrasonographic image of dilated fetal bowel is a sign of intestinal mechanical or functional obstruction and its prevalence will depend on the underlying condition: bowel atresia or stenosis, malrotation with volvulus, meconium ileus, total colonic aganglionosis, and meconium plug syndrome. The etiology of fetal bowel dilatation is a difficult prenatal diagnosis since ultrasound has limited accuracy for bowel evaluation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: Left ventricular dilatation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: Enlargement of the chamber of the left heart ventricle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: Fetal trigonocephaly
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: A fetal ultrasound finding defined by flattening of the occiput with pointing of the frontal bones and brachycephaly with an increased cephalic index. It is characterized by keel shaped deformity of forehead with midline ridge, bilateral fronto temporal constriction with compensatory biparietal expansion, supra orbital and lateral orbital retrusion and hypotelorism. This finding is said to resemble a strawberry.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: Abnormal fetal heart outflow tract
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: A prenatal anomaly of the outflow tract. Fetal ultrasound may not always be able to easily and accurately describe the outflow anomaly, but can detect abnormal anatomy. Often, follow up with a fetal echo is recommended, but fetal ultrasound is limited.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: Recent past medical history
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: History of events that precede the current presenting condition and are thought to be of potential relevance, having occured in the hours, days, or weeks before the current condition.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: History of recent viral illness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: Medical history of a viral illness in recent weeks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: History of recent dental procedure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: Medical history of a dental procedure in recent weeks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: Abnormal hepatic artery morphology
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: Any structural anomaly of the hepatic artery or its branches.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: Hepatic artery hyperplasia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: Abnormal increase in size of the hepatic arteries.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.label: Lymph node necrosis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400014.definition: Areas of necrotic tissue within a lymph node.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.label: Multinucleated neuron
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.definition: Neurons that contain more than one nucleus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.label: History of recent contralateral injury
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.definition: A history of an injury that occurred several hours, days, or weeks before the current presenting complaint and is located on the other side of the body relative to the current presenting complaint.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.label: Alternating laterality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.definition: Occuring on the left and right in succession. This term can refer to alternating sides of the body (e.g., Alternating hemiplegia) or alternative sides of the visual field (e.g., some migraine auras).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.label: Cervical squamous cell papilloma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.definition: A benign tumor arising from the epithelial surface of the cervix and usually caused by Human Papillomavirus infection.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.label: Liver leiomyoma
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.definition: A benign smooth muscle neoplasm that arises in the liver.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.label: Typified by high penetrance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.definition: Description of conditions in which only an incomplete but relatively high proportion of individuals with a given genotype exhibit the disease regardless of age assuming a full lifespan of 80 years. There is no commonly accepted definition for incomplete, but high penetrance, but we suggest that this term be applied if at least 80 percent but less than 100 percent of individuals with the given genotype would manifest the disease with a full lifespan.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.label: Typified by moderate penetrance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400015.definition: Description of conditions in which only a moderate proportion of individuals with a given genotype exhibit the disease regardless of age assuming a full lifespan of 80 years. There is no commonly accepted definition for moderate penetrance, but we suggest that this term be applied if at least 20 percent but less than 80 percent of individuals with the given genotype would manifest the disease with a full lifespan.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.label: Typified by low penetrance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.definition: Description of conditions in which only a low proportion of individuals with a given genotype exhibit the disease regardless of age assuming a full lifespan of 80 years. There is no commonly accepted definition for low penetrance, but we suggest that this term be applied if at least some but less than 20 percent of carriers would manifest the disease with a full lifespan.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.label: Decreased Succinyl-CoA 3-ketoacid CoA transferase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.definition: Decreased activity of the enzyme succinyl-CoA 3-ketoacid CoA transferase.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.label: Decreased phytanoyl-CoA hydroxylase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.definition: Reduced activity of the enzyme phytanoyl-CoA hydroxylase, which plays a role in the catabolism of phytanic acid, a branched-chain fatty acid that is a normal constituent of the human diet.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.label: Reduced bifunctional protein activity
