http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.definition: Diminished activity of hydroxysteroid 17-beta dehydrogenase 4 (HSD17B4), also known as D-bifunctional protein (DBP), a peroxisomal enzyme that catalyzes multiple steps of beta-oxidation of very long chain fatty acids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.label: Decreased circulating plasmalogen concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.definition: Reduced plasmalogen concentration in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.label: Post-vaccination varicella zoster virus infection
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.definition: Infection with live, attenuated varicella-zoster virus following vaccination. This is an extreemely rare event that may indicate immunocompromise.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.label: Recent steroid exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.definition: History of having been treated with corticosteroid medications in recent weeks.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.label: Shark teeth
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.definition: Eruption of permanent teeth behind deciduous (baby) teeth before they have fallen out, resulting in a double row of teeth. This phenomen is typically observed between the ages of 5 to 7 years.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.label: Pontine T2 hypointensity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400016.definition: A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the pons.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: Anti-platelet antigen antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against antigens present on the surface of thrombocytes such as the glycoproteins GPIIb/IIIa, GPIb/IX, and GPIa/IIa.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: Anti-voltage-gated potassium channel antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against a voltage-gated potassium channel.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: Vegan diet
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: A history of following a vegan diet characterized by avoidance of food sourced from animals including meet, fish, and dairy products.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: History of previous pregnancy with hydrops fetalis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: One or more previous pregnancies in which the fetus developed hydrops fetalis.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: Ameliorated by potassium supplements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by ingesting a potassium supplement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: Ameliorated by niacin
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by ingesting niacin (vitamin B3).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: Aggravated by exposure to medication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by treatment with a medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: Bleeding ameliorated by vitamin K
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: Applies to bleeding that is significantly reduced by treatment with vitamin K.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: Anti-retroviral therapy exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: History of having been treated with an antiretroviral agent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.label: Potassium-wasting diuretic exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400017.definition: History of having been treated with a potassium-wasting diuretic such as thiazide (chlorothiazide, chlorthalidone, hydrochlorothiazide, indapamide, metolazone) and loop (bumetanide, ethacrynic acid, furosemide, torsemide) diuretics.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.label: Tricyclic antidepressant exposure
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.definition: History of having been treated with a tricyclic antidepressant medication.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.label: Excessive dental attrition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.definition: A higher than expected amount of attrition of teeth, as menifested by loss of tooth characteristics including rounding or sharpening of incisal edges, loss of cusps, and fracturing of teeth, to an extent that is deemed more than would be expected at a given age.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.label: Positionally dependent pain
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.definition: Pain improves or worsens with changes in body position.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.label: Abnormal erythrocyte adenosine triphosphate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.definition: Concentration of adenosine triphosphate (ATP) in red blood cells (erythrocytes) outside of the normal range.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.label: Reduced erythrocyte adenosine triphosphate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.definition: Concentration of adenosine triphosphate (ATP) in red blood cells (erythrocytes) below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.label: Elevated erythrocyte adenosine triphosphate concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.definition: Concentration of adenosine triphosphate (ATP) in red blood cells (erythrocytes) above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.label: Spermatogonial maturation arrest
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.definition: A type of spermatogenesis maturation arrest in which the block of developmental occurs in the spermatogonial stage. Testicular histology shows seminiferous tubules with Sertoli cells and spermatogonial cells but no further differentiated cells like spermatocytes or round spermatids.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.label: Elevated circulating neuron-specific enolase concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400018.definition: Concentration of neuron-specific enolase above the upper limit of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Reduced leukocyte alpha-mannosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Concentration or activity of an alpha-mannosidase as measured in leukocytes is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Increased circulating alpha-mannosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Concentration or activity of alpha mannosidase above the upper limit of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Reduced leukocyte cathepsin D activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Concentration or activity of cathepsin D as measured in leukocytes is below the limits of normal. The reduction in cathepsin D activity can also be measured in fibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Reduced leukocyte N-sulfoglucosamine sulfohydrolase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Concentration or activity of N-sulfoglucosamine sulfohydrolase as measured in leukocytes is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Pseudohyperkalemia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Pseudohyperkalemia describes a falsely elevated potassium level upon measurement of the serum electrolyte concentration due to disruption of cells during the collection or processing of the sample.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Abnormal enzyme activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Concentration or activity of an enzyme is above or below the limits of normal in cultured fibroblasts. Fibroblasts are easy to grow in culture and are the main cell type involved in producing extracellular matrix. They are used as a convenient model system for measuring enzyme activity for enzymes that are not expressed in blood cells. Usually, the test is done in fibroblasts for convenience rather than for the investigation of a pathophysiology specific to fibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Reduced heparan-alpha-glucosaminide N-acetyltransferase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Concentration or activity of N-sulfoglucosamine sulfohydrolase as measured in cultured fibroblasts is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Reduced N-acetylgalactosamine-6-sulfate sulfatase in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Concentration or activity of N-acetylgalactosamine-6-sulfate sulfatase as measured in cultured fibroblasts is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Reduced acetylglucosamine-6-sulfate sulfatase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Concentration or activity of N-acetylglucosamine-6-sulfatase (EC 3.1.6.14) as measured in cultured fibroblasts is below the limits of normal. N-acetylglucosamine-6-sulfatase hydrolyzes heparan sulfate and keratan sulfate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.label: Reduced erythrocyte porphobilinogen deaminase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400019.definition: Activity or concentration of in the level of porphobilinogen deaminase (EC 4.3.1.8) in erythrocytes below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Reduced holocarboxylase synthetase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Concentration or activity of holocarboxylase synthetase (EC 6.3.4.10) as measured in cultured fibroblasts is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Abnormal circulating alpha mannosidase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Concentration or activity of alpha mannosidase outside of the limits of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Reduced alpha-N-acetylgalactosaminidase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Concentration or activity of alpha-N-acetylgalactosaminidase (EC 3.2.1.49) as measured in cultured fibroblasts is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Reduced erythrocyte arginase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Activity or concentration of arginase (EC 3.5.3.1) in red blood cells below the lower limit of normal. Arginase catalyzes the last step of the urea cycle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Reduced mitochondrial acetyl-CoA acetyltransferase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Concentration or activity of mitochondrial acetyl-CoA acetyltransferase (EC 2.3.1.9) as measured in cultured fibroblasts is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Reduced beta-mannosidase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Concentration or activity of beta-mannosidase (EC 3.2.1.25) as measured in cultured fibroblasts is below the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Reduced 3-methylcrotonyl CoA carboxylase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Acitivity of 3-methylcrotonyl-CoA carboxylase (EC 6.4.1.4) below the lower limit of normal in cultured fibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Reduced branched-chain alpha-keto acid dehydrogenase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Acitivity of branched-chain alpha-keto acid dehydrogenase complex (EC 1.2.4.4) below the lower limit of normal in cultured fibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Reduced erythrocyte galactose-1-phosphate uridylyltransferase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Activity or concentration of in the level of galactose-1-phosphate uridylyltransferase (GALT; EC 2.7.7.12) in erythrocytes below the lower limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.label: Abnormal erythrocyte adenosine deaminase activity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400020.definition: Activity of adenosine deaminase in red blood cells outside the limits of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400021.label: Reduced isovaleryl CoA dehydrogenase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400021.definition: Acitivity of isovaleryl-CoA dehydrogenase (EC 1.3.99.10) below the lower limit of normal in cultured fibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400021.label: Reduced glycerol kinase activity in cultured fibroblasts
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400021.definition: Acitivity of glycerol kinase (EC 2.7.1.30) below the lower limit of normal in cultured fibroblasts.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400021.label: Increased circulating vitamin A concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400021.definition: Concentration of vitamin A above the upper limit of normal in the blood circulation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400021.label: Elevated circulating hyaluronic acid concentration
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_400021.definition: Concentration of hyaluronic acid in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-AK5 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against anti-adenylate kinase 5 (AK5).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-AMPAR antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against anti-alpha-amino-3-hydroxy-5-methyl-4-isoxazolepropionic acid receptor (AMPAR).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-Amphiphysin antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Amphiphysin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-ARHGAP26 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Rho GTPase-activating protein 26 (ARHGAP26).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-CARP VIII antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Carbonic anhydrase-related protein VIII (CARPVIII).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-CASPR2
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against contactin-associated protein-like 2 (CASPR2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-CV2/CRMP5 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against CV2/CRMP5. Anti-CV2/CRMP5 autoantibody is the most commonly detected anti-neuronal autoantibody. Patients with typical paraneoplastic chorea show fully developed chorea in the course of weeks to months with acute inflammation in the striatum.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-DPPX antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against dipeptidyl-peptidase-like protein 6 (DPPX).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-FGFR3 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against FGFR3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.label: Anti-GABA(A)R antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500000.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against gamma-aminobutyric acid A receptor, i.e., GABA(A)R.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-GABA(B)R antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against gamma-aminobutyric acid B receptor, i.e., GABA(B)R.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-GAD65 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against glutamic acid decarboxylase 65 (GAD65).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-Gephyrin antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Gephyrin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-GFAP antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against glial fibrillary acidic protein (GFAP).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-GlyR antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Glycine receptor (GlyR).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-Homer-3 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Homer-3.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-Hu antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Hu.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-Iglon5 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against immunoglobulin-like cell adhesion molecule 5 (IgLON5).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-ITPR1 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate receptor 1 (ITPR1).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.label: Anti-Kelch like protein 11 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500001.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against kelch-like protein 11 (KLHL11).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-LGI1 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against leucine-rich glioma-inactivated 1 (LGI1).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-Ma antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-Ma2 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ma2.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-Ma1 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ma1.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-mGluR1 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against metabotropic glutamate receptor 1 (mGluR1).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-mGluR5 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against metabotropic glutamate receptor 5 (mGluR5).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-neurexin-3alpha antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against neurexin-3alpha.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-P/Q-type VGCC antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against P/Q-type voltage-gated calcium channels (VGCCs).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-MAP1B antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against microtubule-associated protein 1B (MAP1B).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.label: Anti-PKCgamma antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500002.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against protein kinase Cgamma.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-Ri antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ri, an antineuronal antibody.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-Septin-5 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Septin-5.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-SEZ6L2 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against seizure-related 6 homolog like 2 (SEZ6L2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-SOX1 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against SOX1. Anti-SOX1 antibodies, also known as antiglial nuclear antibody (AGNA), are specifically found in paraneoplastic neurological disorders. Since SOX1 is expressed in neuronal precursor cells in the developing central nervous system, it has been used as an early marker of neural stem cells.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-Tr/DNER antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Tr/DNER. Anti-Tr antibodies are directed against cerebellar Purkinje cells (termed anti-Tr or PCA-Tr). Anti-Tr autoantibodies are frequently associated with Hodgkin lymphoma (HL). Anti-Tr antibodies are defined by a specific staining pattern in cerebellar tissue that is characterized by punctate immunoreactivity in both the dendritic tree and soma of Purkinje cells but not in their axons. This characteristic pattern is indicative of the presence of anti-Tr antibodies. The Delta/Notch-like epidermal growth factor-related receptor (DNER) was identified as the target antigen of anti-Tr.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-TRIM46 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against the axon initial segment protein tripartite motif 46 (TRIM46).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-TRIM9/TRIM67 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against TRIM9/TRIM67.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-Yo antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Yo.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-titin antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against titin.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.label: Anti-Zic4 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500003.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Zic family member 4 (ZIC4).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.label: Anti-Sj/ITPR1 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Sj/inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.label: Anti-D2 R antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against dopamine-2 receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.label: Anti-GluK2 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against glutamate kainate receptor subunit 2 (GluK2).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.label: Anti-Lrp4 antibody positivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against low-density lipoprotein receptor (Lrp4).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.label: Anti-ryanodine receptor antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ryanodine receptor.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.label: Anti-Kv1.4 antibody
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_500004.definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against the voltage-gated potassium channel Kv1.4.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.label: Selective mutism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.definition: Voluntary failure to use spoken language (at whatever level attained) in selective social contexts over a period of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.label: Limited repertoire of facial expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.definition: An abnormally limited range of facial expressions demonstrated by a lack of nuance of facial expression to match specific social situations or an inability to demonstrate a normal range of emotions with one's face.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.label: Excessive interest in others
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.definition: An unusually strong interest in others in general or tendency to develop a strong interest in certain individuals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.label: Reduced response to another's attempt to get direct attention
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.definition: There is a diminished interest in all individuals, including both peers and non-peers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.label: Abnormal pitch
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.definition: Abnormally high or low-pitched vocalization or speech.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.label: Loose association
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.definition: Speech characterized by weak (e.g. tangential/circumstantial) or absent (e.g. word salad) connections between ideas.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.label: Neologism
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.definition: Consistent use of an invented word that is unique to an individual.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.label: Overly formal/pedantic language
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.definition: Use of language that is overly formal, precise, detailed, or pedantic for the social context.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.label: Midline hand movements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520000.definition: Hand stereotypies within the medial plane of the body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Abnormal Intonation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: Abnormal rise and fall of the voice in speech and vocalization.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Abnormal speech rate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: Speech that is abnormally fast or slow

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Abnormal speech rhythm
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: Speech with abnormal rhythm or pattern

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Ambiguous facial expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: Spontaneous production of communicative facial expressions that have poor quality or are perceived as odd or mechanical. This may include inaccurate mimicry of typical facial expressions. These expressions may be difficult to interpret for someone who is not familiar with the individual making the expression.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Exaggerated facial expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: A tendency to make facial expressions that are exaggerated and a failure to make subtle facial expressions in a social context when a subtle expression is more appropriate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Muted facial expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: A tendency to produce facial expressions with decreased intensity or expressivity which appear muted or flat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Abnormal peer relationships
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: The state of having abnormal relationships with others. This does not describe specific aspects of one's social aptitudes but rather a state which may come about from these aptitudes, such as lacking peer relationships or lacking close friends.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Abnormal movements of face and head
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: Abnormal movements of face and head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Abnormal movements of the upper extremities
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: Abnormal movements of the upper extremities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.label: Abnormal movements of the whole body
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520001.definition: Abnormal movements of the whole body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.label: Abnormal interest in others
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.definition: A social interest in others that is abnormal given the social context. This can include an increased interest with another person or an abnormal lack of interest in other people.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.label: Reduced social insight
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.definition: A lack of awareness of social rules in multiple social settings, which are simple or intuitive to others in the same social setting.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.label: Reduced awareness of convention
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.definition: Reduced awareness of expected conventions, which are normal and expected for particular social settings or interactions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.label: Abnormal relationship
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.definition: The state of having abnormal relationships with others. This does not describe specific aspects of one's social aptitudes but rather a state which may come about from these aptitudes, such as lacking peer relationships, lacking close friends, or having a relational network that is abnormal given one's cultural context.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.label: Abnormal social imitation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.definition: A reduced ability to imitate a task or the movements of others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.label: Reduced attempt to get or direct another's attention
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.definition: An abnormality in one's tendency to initiate social interactions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.label: Reduced response to social cues
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520002.definition: Abnormality in the way one responds to social cues such as a verbal cue (which should cause one to shift attention) or someone sharing their emotions (which should elicit a sympathetic response).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.label: Diminished integration of verbal and non-verbal communicative behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.definition: A communicative abnormality where one's nonverbal and verbal communication are poorly integrated. This may occur when verbal and nonverbal communication are intact alone but are abnormal when used together, or an abnormality in the use of typically integrated communication such as the use of beat gestures during speech.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.label: obsolete Reduced immediate imitation of others
Reduced collaborative imaginative play
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.definition: Failure of a child to integrate with peers in imaginative play.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.label: Lack of response to verbal cues
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.definition: A consistent failure to respond to any verbal cues.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.label: Reduced sympathetic expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.definition: A reduction in showing sympathy to others, such as providing comfort when someone is sad or crying.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.label: Excessively loud speech
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520003.definition: Speech which is abnormally loud that is not due to a structural or muscular abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.label: Excessively quiet voice
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.definition: Speech which is abnormally quiet or inappropriate whispering that is not due to a structural or muscular abnormality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.label: Abnormal speech volume
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.definition: Speech that is abnormally loud or quiet for the social context in which it is spoken.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.label: Reduced attention regulation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.definition: An abnormality in one's ability to control their attention towards a specific subject or task can include difficulties in changing or maintaining attention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.label: Reduced impulse control
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.definition: Reduced ability to control, or a failure to resist a temptation, urge, or impulse.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.label: Sensory behavioral abnormality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.definition: Abnormal sensory behavior, including avoiding or seeking sensory input or difficulty modulating sensory stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.label: Idiosyncratic gesture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.definition: When one uses gestures that are unique to them and have no apparent meaning to others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.label: Atypical sorting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520004.definition: Atypical focus on arranging, balancing, or positioning objects; may be atypical in focus or intensity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Excessive checking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: Checking behavior that is excessive for the situational context.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Excessive hand washing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: Hand washing behavior that is excessive for the situational context.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Resistance to trivial environmental changes
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: Distress in response to minor changes in one's environmental expectations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Lack of nonverbal response to verbal cues
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: A consistent failure to nonverbally respond to verbal cues such as a failure to shift attention or look at the source of the cue.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Lack of verbal response to verbal cues
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: A consistent failure to verbally respond to verbal cues which are intended to elicit a verbal response.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Reduced co-speech gestures
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: Reduced use of speech-integrated gestures such as the use of beat gestures.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Limited head nodding or shaking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: Absence or reduction in the use of head nodding to indicate "yes" or head shaking to indicate "no".

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Limited pointing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: Absence or reduction in the use of pointing to request or direct another's attention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Sensory hypersensitivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: A decreased tolerance to sensory stimuli that triggers emotional and/or physical distress.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.label: Sensory hyposensitivity unexplained by sensory deficit
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520005.definition: Increased tolerance to sensory stimuli due to diminished sensory ability.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Auditory hypersensitivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: Hyperresponsive to sound that is abnormal in intensity and/or frequency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Tactile hypersensitivity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: A decreased tolerance to physical touch.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Auditory sensory seeking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: Pursuit of specific sounds or noises that is abnormal in intensity and/or frequency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Gustatory sensory seeking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: Pursuit of a particular taste that is abnormal in intensity and/or frequency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Olfactory sensory seeking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: Pursuit of specific scents, smells, or fragrances that is abnormal in intensity and/or frequency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Tactile sensory seeking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: Pursuit of a specific texture that is abnormal in intensity and/or frequency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Vestibular sensory seeking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: Pursuit of vestibular stimulation that is abnormal in intensity and/or frequency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Visual sensory seeking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: Pursuit visual stimulation by looking at specific sights, images, and/or colors that is abnormal in intensity and/or frequency.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Socially inappropriate questioning
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: A tendency to ask questions that are overly personal or otherwise inappropriate in the social situation in which they are asked.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.label: Spinning
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520006.definition: An excessive frequency of spinning one's body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520007.label: Delayed Echolalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520007.definition: Repetition of borrowed words or phrases outside of the context in which they were originally heard. E.g., scripting from TV shows or movies.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520007.label: Immediate Echolalia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520007.definition: Immediate repetition of another person's speech.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520007.label: Excessive cleaning
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520007.definition: Excessive cleaning of surfaces, living space, or environment that is excessive for the situational context.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520010.label: Facial expressions not directed to others
Abnormal play
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520010.definition: An abnormality in a child's ability play.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520010.label: Reduced imaginative play skills
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520010.definition: Reduced or lack of pretending in play (does not assign abstract properties to objects, use invisible objects, or use objects in nonliteral ways other than their intended purpose in play).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520010.label: Nonfunctional or atypical use of objects in play
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520010.definition: Use of objects in atypical, unimaginitive ways other than for which they are intended (banging, throwing, shaking, sorting, lining up, spinning).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520011.label: Avoids emotional intimacy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520011.definition: Tendency to avoid interpersonal exchanges characterizing by sharing of personal feelings, expressions of understanding, affirmation, and demonstrations of caring.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520011.label: Difficulty understanding nonliteral meaning of conversation

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520012.label: Aggression towards others
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520012.definition: Aggression that is directed towards other individuals, as opposed to oneself.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520012.label: Aggression towards caregivers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520012.definition: Aggression that is directed towards caregivers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520012.label: Aggression toward non-caregivers
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520012.definition: Aggression that is directed towards non-caregivers.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520012.label: Deficit applying language skills across context
Abnormal rituals
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520012.definition: Insistence on rituals which are self-imposed on a person's environment including directing the behavior of those around them.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520013.label: Reduced use of language for social purposes
Jumping
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520013.definition: An excessive frequency of jumping in place.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520013.label: Delay in the acquisition of play skills
Reduced attempt to get or direct attention of peers

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.label: Olfactory hallucination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.definition: Perception of smell without olfactory stimulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.label: Gustatory hallucination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.definition: Perception of taste without gustatory stimulus.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.label: Abnormal interpretation of external stimuli
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.definition: Abnormal perception of reality is characterized by an abnormal or inaccurate experience of external stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.label: Proprioceptive hallucination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.definition: A type of hallucination that involves the perception of distorted or abnormal sensations related to one's body position or movement.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.label: Disturbed perception with a stimulus
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.definition: A perceptual experience in which an individual's perception of sensory stimuli is altered or disrupted in some way, resulting in abnormal or distorted sensory perceptions despite the presence of actual external stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.label: Illusions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.definition: Perceptual experiences that involve misinterpretations or distortions of sensory stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.label: Inattentiveness illusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.definition: Instances in which individuals fail to perceive or notice salient or significant stimuli in their visual field due to a lack of attention.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.label: Illusions due to affect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.definition: Perceptual distortions or misinterpretations of sensory information arise as a result of the individual's emotional or affective state.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.label: Pareidolia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520020.definition: Apophenia is a psychological phenomenon in which individuals perceive familiar patterns or meaningful images in random or ambiguous stimuli, such as clouds, shadows, or inanimate objects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.label: Autoscopy
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.definition: A phenomenon in which an individual perceives themselves from an external perspective, as if they are observing their own body or self from a location outside of their physical body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.label: Subjective eidetic images
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.definition: A mental phenomenon is when an individual can vividly visualize or recall visual information from memory with exceptional detail and accuracy. These images are experienced subjectively by the individual, meaning they are not physically present or visible to others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.label: Increased social interactions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.definition: An increase in the frequency, intensity, or extent of social or personal exchanges between individuals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.label: Decreased emotional vulnerability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.definition: Decreased emotional expression during interactions may include a lack of personal emotion sharing or empathy toward others.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.label: Somatic hallucination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.definition: A type of hallucination that involves the perception of sensory experiences related to the body or its internal organs, systems, or processes. It is a hallucinatory experience that primarily affects bodily sensations rather than external sensory perceptions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.label: Visceral hallucination
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.definition: A type of hallucination that involves the perception of internal bodily sensations or processes that do not actually exist.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.label: Abnormal perceptual state
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.definition: Temporary alteration of the awareness of reality or self-perception.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.label: Depersonalization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.definition: A psychological experience or symptom characterized by a sense of detachment or estrangement from oneself or one's surroundings.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.label: Derealization
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520021.definition: Depersonalization is a subjective experience in which an individual feels a sense of detachment or estrangement from their surroundings, leading to a distorted perception of the external world. It is characterized by a feeling of unreality or unfamiliarity with one's environment, as if things are dreamlike, artificial, or lacking in significance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520022.label: Decreased facial expression reciprocity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520022.definition: Decreased mirroring or reflection of facial expressions in another person during social interactions, compared to the person's normal behavior.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520022.label: Decreased comfort with casual physical contact
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520022.definition: An abnormal reduction in the interest or frequency of physical contact with others as compared with the usual behavior of an individual. For instance, an individual may choose to stand farther apart from others in conversations or decline physical contact when offered during social interactions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520022.label: Thought blocking
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520022.definition: The interruption of speech causes an abnormal period of silence, followed by a sudden switch to an unrelated topic. Some may describe the experience as an abrupt emptying of the mind or the belief that an external force removed their thoughts from their head.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.label: Maladaptive fear-related cognitions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.definition: Threat-based cognitive biases result in a skewed perception, experience, or processing of internal or external stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.label: Hypervigilance
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.definition: A heightened alertness is characterized by a broad awareness and/or excessive scanning of environmental stimuli.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.label: Phobia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.definition: Extreme, irrational, and persistent fears of certain objects, situations, activities, or persons can impede functioning in day-to-day life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.label: Anticipatory anxiety
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.definition: A state characterized by future-oriented worry, accompanied by negative affect and autonomic arousal.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.label: Flight of ideas
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.definition: Successive thoughts and speech are easily diverted by external stimuli or internal superficial associations.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.label: Thought disorder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520023.definition: An abnormal or disorganized way of communicating that appears to be the result of disorganized thought.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520024.label: Recurrent maladaptive behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520024.definition: A repeating behavior that is either immediately unproductive or has negative long-term consequences. This includes harmful coping mechanisms such as addictive behavior and failure to control impulses and compulsions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520024.label: Cognitive distortion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520024.definition: A cognitive distortion is a maladaptive, exaggerated, or irrational thought pattern.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.label: Abnormal affect
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.definition: Abnormalities in the intensity, frequency, or duration of observable and expressed emotions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.label: Abnormally increased motivation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.definition: An excessive increase in goal-directed behavior, that is, motivation, is the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action. It also includes an excessive increase in non goal-directed movement or activity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.label: Pressured speech
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.definition: There has been an increase in the amount of spontaneous speech, which is generally continuous, rapid, loud, and difficult to interrupt. It may sometimes be incoherent and continue even when no one is listening.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.label: Laeden paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.definition: The sensation of having heavy arms and legs, or feeling a heaviness in the limbs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.label: Abnormal thought pattern
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520026.definition: Abnormal thought pattern refers to thoughts or patterns of thinking that are intrusive, obsessive, or challenging to control.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.label: Grandiosity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.definition: Exaggerated feelings of self-importance, superiority, uniqueness, or invulnerability.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.label: Hopelessness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.definition: Excessive feelings of despair; an intense state of despair; an overwhelming lack of hope.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.label: Sadness
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.definition: Intense or excessive feelings of unhappiness are often characterized by feeling down, low, unhappy, or sorrowful.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.label: Abnormal motivation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.definition: Behavioral patterns and/or energy/activity levels that are statistically uncommon within a particular culture, maladaptive, and result in personal distress and impairment in the individual's functioning.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.label: Decreased need for sleep
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520027.definition: There has been a noticeable decrease in the need for sleep, where individuals feel refreshed even with minimal or no sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.label: Sleep-related breathing disorders
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.definition: Conditions of abnormal and difficult respiration during sleep, including chronic snoring and sleep apnea.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.label: Bruxism during sleep
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.definition: Bruxism is a condition in which you grind, gnash, or clench your teeth while asleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.label: Nightmares
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.definition: Frightening dreams, typically occurring during REM sleep, are normal and common in children under 10. However, they can also impact teenagers and adults.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.label: Sleep-related eating disorder
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.definition: Eating while asleep can be problematic, as it may involve potentially harmful behaviors like overeating or consuming raw meat.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.label: Microsleep
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520028.definition: Sudden onset of extreme drowsiness or falling asleep during the day for a short period of time.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.label: Exploding head syndrome
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.definition: Sleep disorder in which one hears a loud noise or explosive crashing sound in their head. The sound is not real or heard by anyone else. The episode typically happens suddenly, either when beginning to fall asleep or when waking up during the night.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.label: Sleep enactment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.definition: A sleep disorder in which one physically acts out one's dreams without awareness of the physical actions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.label: Non restorative sleep
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.definition: Perception of feeling unrefreshed after sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.label: Disturbance during transitions between sleep and wake states
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.definition: A group of parasomnias that occur during the transition from wakefulness to sleep or from one sleep stage to another. Rhythmic Movement Disorder, Sleep Starts, Sleep Talking, and Nocturnal Leg Cramps - these four disorders belong to Sleep-Wake Transition Disorders in the International Classification of Sleep Disorders.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.label: Sexsomnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.definition: Unintentional sexual behavior during sleep, such as masturbation, initiation of sex, or making sexual noises, is known as sexsomnia. Sexsomnia predominantly occurs during NREM sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.label: Periodic limb movements
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.definition: Repetitive limb movements during sleep can affect the quality of your sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.label: Abnormal hypnagogia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.definition: Abnormal transition of consciousness from wakefulness to sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.label: Abnormal hypnopompia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.definition: Abnormal transition of consciousness from sleeping to wakefulness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.label: Abnormal sleep architecture
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520029.definition: Interruptions during the various stages of sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.label: Abnormal movement during sleep
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.definition: Periodic Limb Movement Disorder, also known as Sleep-Related Myoclonus Syndrome or Nocturnal Myoclonus Syndrome, refers to the periodic and stereotypic movements of the legs or upper limbs during sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.label: Short N1 sleep
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.definition: Disruptions in the first stage of NREM sleep can occur.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.label: Paradoxical insomnia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.definition: Paradoxical insomnia is a condition in which individuals with a normal or near-normal sleep macrostructure tend to severely underestimate the quantity and quality of their sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.label: Short N2 sleep
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.definition: Disruptions in the second stage of NREM sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.label: Short N3 sleep
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520030.definition: Disruptions in the third stage of NREM sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520031.label: Decreased social interactions
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520031.definition: A decrease in the frequency, intensity, or extent of social or personal exchanges between individuals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520031.label: Increased interpersonal communication
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520031.definition: An intensified exchange of information between individuals.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520031.label: Increased seeking of relationships
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520031.definition: Increased frequency or duration in social outings and interactions as part of relationship-seeking or maintenance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.label: Decreased seeking of relationships
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.definition: A decrease in frequency or duration related to seeking or maintaining relationships may involve avoiding social outings or social interactions.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.label: Increased sexual behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.definition: Engaging in riskier sexual practices, experiencing a significant increase in frequency, having multiple sexual partners, or spending excessive time on sexual activities can become disproportionate to other aspects of a person's life.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.label: Increased emotional expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.definition: Heightened emotional behaviors like crying, laughter, and smiling compared to the individual's baseline.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.label: Increased emotional vulnerability
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.definition: Increased emotional expression during interactions, involving personal emotion sharing or reciprocation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.label: Increased comfort with casual physical contact
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.definition: An individual exhibits more physical contact with others than their usual behavior, seen as increased touch in platonic interactions or greater contact in romantic relationships.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.label: Decreased sexual behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.definition: Absence of sexual attraction, behaviors, and interest that are different from the person's normal state.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.label: Decreased emotional expression
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.definition: Reduced frequency or subdued emotional behaviors like crying, laughter, and smiling, making the individual appear apathetic or disinterested.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.label: Problematic alcohol consumption
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520032.definition: Excessive or problematic drug seeking and continued use despite harmful consequences.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.label: Addictive sedative use
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.definition: Misuse and/or abuse of sedative drugs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.label: Addictive non-substance behaviors
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.definition: Uncontrolled use or problematic behaviors of dependency without the use of drugs or substances can be detrimental.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.label: Addictive spending behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.definition: An uncontrollable urge to shop and spend money can lead to distress or impairment.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.label: Addictive gambling behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.definition: The act of taking chances or engaging in behaviors without restraint, typically involving the wagering of something valuable, in pursuit of acquiring something of higher value.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.label: Addictive sex behavior
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.definition: Inability to control or manage sexual urges, fantasies, or behaviors that impair one's ability to function.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.label: Addictive video game use
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.definition: The inability to regulate persistent gaming behavior is characterized by a heightened prioritization of gaming activities over regular daily tasks and responsibilities.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.label: Compulsive stealing
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.definition: Irresistible impulses to take easily affordable items.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.label: Excessive fire setting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.definition: The inability to control urges of deliberately setting fires for pleasure and gratification, without any criminal intent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.label: Self-cutting
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520033.definition: Deliberate harm to one's body, in the form of cutting that results in tissue damage, without a conscious intent to die.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520034.label: Addictive cannabis use
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520034.definition: A persistent and compulsive need to use cannabis, despite negative consequences.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520034.label: Autophagia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520034.definition: The habitual action of inflicting pain upon oneself by biting and/or devouring portions of one's body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520035.label: Hypnagogic sleep paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520035.definition: Sleep paralysis that occurs when falling asleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520035.label: Hypnopompic sleep paralysis
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520035.definition: Sleep paralysis that occurs when waking up from sleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520035.label: Sleep onset rapid eye movement period
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520035.definition: Entering REM sleep immediately upon falling asleep.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.label: Abnormal judgment
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.definition: Beliefs that deviate from what is considered rational or within the range of normal human judgment and belief formation.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.label: Overvalued idea
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.definition: A solitary belief that can be considered justified in the context of a person's life history and personality, but which goes on to determine an individual's actions to a morbid degree. The disturbance in functioning and the subjective suffering caused to the patient or others give this type of idea the qualifier of being overvalued.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.label: Time agnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.definition: The inability to perceive the passage of time is usually due to a disorder involving the temporal area of the brain.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.label: Olfactory agnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.definition: The inability to recognize certain smells or types of odors that you previously recognized.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.label: Tactile agnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.definition: The inability to recognize objects by touch is called tactile agnosia.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.label: Topographical agnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.definition: The inability to rely on visual cues to guide one's direction is due to the inability to recognize objects.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.label: Delusional memory
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520040.definition: A delusional interpretation of a normal memory.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.label: Auditory agnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.definition: The condition is characterized by the inability to recognize spoken languages and/or nonverbal environmental sounds and music, despite having adequate hearing. However, spontaneous speech, reading, and writing abilities remain intact.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.label: Gustatory agnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.definition: People cannot identify tastes, even though they can experience them.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.label: Allesthesia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.definition: Referral of a sensory stimulus from one side of the body to the other.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.label: Autotopagnosia
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.definition: The loss of the ability to localize, recognize, or identify specific parts of one's body.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.label: Delusion of persecution
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.definition: False beliefs or perceptions in which a person believes that they are being treated with malicious intent, hostility, or harassment - despite significant evidence to suggest otherwise.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.label: Delusion of infidelity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.definition: A false belief that a person is the victim of his or her partner's unfaithfulness.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.label: Grandiose delusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.definition: False beliefs relating to origin (aristocratic lineage, royal birth, being raised as a foster child), possessions (owning vast estates, castles, etc., which are withheld through intrigue), abilities (being great inventors, discoverers, artists, possessors of special wisdom, gifted with inspiration), and status (adviser to prominent diplomats, the true director of political destinies).

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.label: Folie à deux
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.definition: Delusional beliefs are transmitted from one individual to another.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.label: Delusion of control
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520041.definition: A false belief that another person, group of people, or external force controls one's general thoughts, feelings, impulses, or behaviors.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Delusion of love
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: A delusion is when someone believes they are loved by another person, even though there is no evidence of this, and the person in question denies it.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Nihilistic delusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: A false belief associated with the nonexistence of the "self," specific body parts, or the world.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Cotard delusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: A false belief that you or your body parts are dead, dying, or do not exist.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Abnormal experience of reality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: Subjective phenomena or perceptions that deviate from what is considered correct or are outside the range of normal human experiences.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Delusional perception
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: A true perception, to which a patient attributes a false meaning, ranges from experiencing some vague meaning to clear, delusional observations, and expresses delusions of reference.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Hypochondriac delusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: Bodily preoccupation, disease phobia, and a false fixed conviction of the presence of disease with no response to reassurance.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Delusions of infestation
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: A persistent belief that a person is infested with living or non-living pathogens, such as parasites, insects, or bugs, when no such infestation is present.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Delusional atmosphere
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: Experience everything around them as sinister, portentous, uncanny, and peculiar in an indefinable way. They know that they are personally involved but cannot tell how. They have a feeling of anticipation, sometimes even excitement, that soon all the separate parts of their experience will fit together to reveal something immensely significant.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Delusional misidentification
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: A group of complex, monothematic delusional phenomena in which subjects hold a belief that the identity of a familiar person, object, location, or self has been altered or replaced.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.label: Religious delusion
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520042.definition: Delusions are characterized by increased conviction and pervasiveness, permeating the individual's entire experience to a greater extent.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520043.label: Abnormal psychotic pattern
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520043.definition: Any abnormal pattern of psychotic experiences, where an individual has significant disturbances in their thoughts, perceptions, emotions, and behavior, resulting in a loss of touch with reality.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Incomplete unilateral cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Unilateral cleft lip cleft that starts from the bottom of the upper lip but does not reach the nasal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Complete unilateral cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Unilateral cleft lip cleft that starts from the bottom of the upper lip and reaches the nasal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Microform unilateral cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Notch, groove, or scar of the upper lip without noticeable rupture of the lip. Microforms are sometimes associated with disruption of the continuity of the orbicularis oris muscle.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Complete cleft hard palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Cleft hard palate in which the cleft goes through the entire length of the hard palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Incomplete cleft hard palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Cleft hard palate in which the cleft doe not goes through the entire length of the hard palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Complete cleft soft palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Cleft soft palate in which the cleft goes through the entire length of the soft palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Incomplete cleft soft palate
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Cleft soft palate in which the cleft doe not goes through the entire length of the soft palate.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Incomplete cleft maxillary alveolar ridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Cleft maxillary alveolar ridge in which the cleft does not go through the entire length of the maxillary alveolar ridge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Complete cleft maxillary alveolar ridge
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Cleft maxillary alveolar ridge in which the cleft goes through the entire length of the maxillary alveolar ridge.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.label: Complete cleft of the upper lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520100.definition: Cleft of the upper lip that starts from the bottom of the upper lip and reaches the nasal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.label: Microform cleft of the upper lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.definition: Notch, groove, or scar of the upper lip without noticeable rupture of the lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.label: Complete bilateral cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.definition: Bilateral cleft lip in which the cleft lip on both sides is complete, i.e. start from the bottom of the upper lip and reach the nasal cavity.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.label: Incomplete bilateral cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.definition: Bilateral cleft lip in which the cleft lip on both sides are incomplete (i.e. start from the bottom of the upper lip but do not reach the nasal cavity), or the cleft lip on one is incomplete and a microform on the other side.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.label: Microform bilateral cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.definition: Bilateral cleft lip in which the cleft lip on both sides are microform, i.e. a notch, groove, or scar without noticeable rupture of the lip.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.label: Asymmetric bilateral cleft lip
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/HP_520101.definition: Bilateral cleft lip in which the cleft lip on one side is complete (i.e. starts from the bottom of the upper lip and reaches the nasal cavity), and the one on the other side is incomplete (i.e. starts from the bottom of the upper lip but does not reach the nasal cavity) or microform (i.e. a notch, groove, or scar without noticeable rupture of the lip).
